Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Gedcarlin
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay in San Francisco and stayed at the Parc 55. This wasn't our initial hotel, our initial hotel was under going renovations, so we were offered this hotel instead. Checked out some reviews on here before we went and there were a bit negative, which didn't instill me with confidence. However, the hotel was fine. The staff were great, the hotel was clean and the rooms were just as good. The hotel is located about a five minute walk from Union Square and there is a cable car stop just round the corner from it, and I mean just round the corner, about a minutes walk. This stop is the end of the line so you get to see them turn the cable cars around ready to set off in the opposite direction. As a result you have a better chance of getting a standing space on the front of the car, as these go straight away so if your getting on at a later stop all of the standing spaces will be gone. We never ate in the hotel as there are so many places around to go to, however the bar is good. The staff bring your drinks to the table for you so you don't even have to go to the bar, RESULT!!!!!!!! San Francisco is a great place, if you go I would definately go to Alcatraz, the trip is fantastic. I would book before you go to make sure you get tickets as it's extremely popular. I would recommend buying a "CityPass" as well. This gives you entry to 6 attractions and lets you ride on the cable cars and trams for a period of 7 days. It costs about £40, but when you think a single ride on the cable cars costs 6 dollars each, which equates to about £3.70ish, it's well worth it. Not sure why anyone would write a negative comment about the Parc 55 as I thought it was fine. The hotel is also used by a number of airlines which must say something about the standards they set. If I ever go back to San Francisco I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: donna g
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay here. When we checked in, they asked us if it was a special occasion. When we said we were celebrating a birthday and anniversary, they upgraded our room. We were moved up to the 28th floor and we had free continental breakfasts every day. The street noise was faint and did not bother us. It was perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “My trip to San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Kwan L
Reviews.Content: Good value for the money I paid. The room was big with two double beds compared to the other Union Sq hotels. Setting was very good and clean. My wife and I were very happy for the 6-night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: cwood001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Christmas and had such a wonderful time! The staff was so attentive and helpful that we really enjoyed ourselves. It was a family trip with ages 16 to 70 and everyone loved the hotel. The breakfast in the concierge lounge was a definite plus! The staff remembered our names and treated us like family throughout the week.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Yes; Quiet, NO.”
Reviews.Author: Jettdi
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed on property because it was close to AT&T park for the Giants game I attended. The hotel had a very modern design and feel to it in the lounging areas and room design itself. The check in was easy and we went right to our room. Very large room with wonderful city-scapes and beautiful night time lights. In addition, we had a treadmill in our room?!?!?! Not sure if that was standard, but it was an interesting addition. The only peaceful area of that floor was the bathroom in the shower with the water running. Other than that, there were many city sounds and people sounds to keep any light sleeper awake. Since our stay was just one night, it was not horrific, but I'm not sure I would stay there again. The price of convenience should not be the sacrifice of a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location but Everything Not so Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: TMS08
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler, I was not sure what to expect from this Wyndham as they tend to be hit or miss in my experience. As others have mentioned, this property is in a perfect location. Only one block away from Union Square, shopping along Market Street, and walking distance to all of San Fran's public transportation options. Parking at the hotel is pricey ($48/day) but there is a public garage 2-3 blocks away which charges $25/day. The entrance and lobby have clearly been renovated but the rooms have not. While clean the rooms/bathroom were clearly a bit dated. While not the best it was not the worst room I have ever seen. I also agree with other reviewers....the NOISE is striking. I have never stayed in a hotel where so much outside noise comes into your room. Even while staying on the 26th floor you can hear voices, sirens, and just about anything else at all hours of the day. We were able to secure this hotel through bidding on priceline at $120/night which was a great deal. If we paid anything more I would have been a bit more disappointed in the stay. If location is your priority this may be the place to stay; if absolute luxury is your goal definitely look into other options.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff & location”
Reviews.Author: MrsBarrie
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 has great staff, very friendly and helpful. The maids, doormen, reception desk and security all smiled and paid attention to us. The hotel is very clean and well taken care of. The only flaw is that the beds are uncomfortable, way too firm for my liking, my husband and I both woke up with backaches. The location is very central - only a block from the Bart station, trolley, mall and only a few blocks from union square.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: ajie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Parc 55 Wyndham overnight and loved it. The location can't be beat! It is a block from Market street and approximately 4 blocks from Union Square. China Town is about a 15 min walk and the ferry building is about 20-25mins away. Great shopping , from high end to discount stores are at your doorstep.The rooms are your standard hotel rooms, a little outdated and can be a bit noisy at night. I kept hearing sirens during the night. Ear plugs are provided. What makes this hotel great other than the location is the employees. Every single employee I came in contact with was friendly and eager to help. I felt like they really appreciated my business and they were so welcoming. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “About the street noise”
Reviews.Author: KidsToLondon
Reviews.Content: I wondered why, given that this is a fairly modern building....a close look at the windows tells the story. The hotel's rooms nearly all have 3 panel bay-type windows that jut out from the facade of the building.  Provides great views, but the windows seem to be single pane, sealed units, not the double (sometimes triple) pane glass used in many downtown hotels.  So,yes, street noise comes right into your room, even at high floors.  Too bad, because this is an ok hotel otherwise with some good deals on rooms at times.  Service is fine, Very central location, convenient to BART....just darn noisy!  BTW, we did not experience much interior noise. Doors to rooms closed fairly gently, not the prison block slams you find in some hotels.  Wall and ceiling noise was average. The earplugs supplied along with the shampoo are not just for decoration though

Reviews.Title: “Location is the key!”
Reviews.Author: damcoutinho
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located, really close to a BART station (Powell St) and almost in front of the cable car station. Walking just a few blocks, you´ll be at the Union Square. We booked a pack that included breakfast at the Club Lounge and got a 29th floor room. The room was really nice and clean, and so was the bathroom. However, there was no refrigerator in the room and you have to pay U$ 15 dollar daily for Wi-Fi access! You can hear some noise from the street (specially sirens) even in such a high level floor, but it was not enough to disturb our sleep time. As mentioned by others, the Club Lounge is a nice, but small place. The breakfast was ok. There´s some variety of fruits, cheeses, ham and pastries (but personally I was frustrated when i found no chocolat muffin and no scrambled eggs in the mix). Overall, it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & convenient to City”
Reviews.Author: SCBadone
Reviews.Content: Looking at other reviews I was amazed they were complaining about noise! This is the big city, folks, and this hotel is located at a very central location. The sirens come with living in the City anyway! We visit SF frequently and have even lived here. This hotel is so centrally located to the commercial "happening" area of SF so all transportation is easily accessible as well as the shopping hub for all us shoppers. Nordstrom is located across the street, Bloomingdale's is right down the street along with a variety of drug stores and there are several fine restaurants including the Parc55 restaurant where I had a very delicious steak. Amenities were great in my opinion. If you want more product so you don't have to share with your bunk mate, simply ask and they will be provided. This is pretty standard throughout the hotel industry I might add. Bed was very comfortable which is my #1 thing so we slept well throughout the night. I happened to leave some clothes hanging in the closet when we left and didn't notice till the next day on our trip, I was happy to find out that housekeeping had secured the items, labeled them and was very helpful in sending them home to me with helpful and friendly assistance. Believe me, this is a primary indication of a well run hotel in my opinion as I have had bad experiences in the past! Although the Club room really wasn't all that in terms of food content, the comfort of chairs, TV and the view is outstanding. We would definitely return and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravell2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed here August 2011 and had a great time. Managed to book the room on AAA rates and was able to upgrade for an insignificant amount to have access to Club level, which included a daily breakfast. Great location, great view, wonderful sunset. The only downside was the wait staff in the bar on the lobby level and the bell man at the front door. They were rude and in fact offensive. It's a good thing the very pleasant concierge made up in spaces for those 2 incidents. Loved Pier 32 restaurant - which may or may not be there anymore as it's location is part of the waterfront upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the whooping dollars...”
Reviews.Author: Aanchal_M
Reviews.Content: I was at Parc55 for a business trip. My room was on the 13th floor, the view from the window was mind blowing with icecream cone and other skyscrapers visible from such a close proximity. Right at the Union Square, Parc55 has just the right location. Speaking about the service. The staff was very polite and helpful. The amenities provided in the room somehow left me disappointed. For a twin sharing room, there was only a single set of toiletries and other basic stuff. Now this one will shock you. On the day of conference which was happening in Mason Hall in the hotel, during lunch hours, 3 Macbook Air Laptops were flicked by someone and the hotel security was clueless about it. All in all it was a nice experience staying at the Wyndham, but not really worth the whooping Dollar that we paid for the stay and food.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & great rooms not so sure about club lounge......”
Reviews.Author: UncleDom
Reviews.Content: Booked Parc 55 as part of Travelzoo offer for $165 plus taxes for club room & club lounge access for 3 nights. Really great location right by Powell St BART , so easy to get to from the airport, just come out of the subway look for the BofA and it is the tall brownish building on the other side of the road, you cannot get lost !! Checkin was prompt & efficient and allocated room on 27th floor with amazing views over the city. Quite a large sized room with sofa and great big comfortable bed which was very sleepable. Good sized bathroom with big tub & lots of soaps & gels & earplugs (not needed). Noise was not an issue except for police & fire sirens in the night sometimes from street level. Overall a good room and spacious. However club lounge was a bit disappointing as it was quite small and not a whole lot of table & chairs.The breakfast options were limited to cereals & pastries with some ham & cheeses, juices & coffee. When it was busy in the morning it was hard to get a seat & you had to wait for someone to vacate. The cocktail hour canapés were just cheese & crackers with a small hot snack, the soft drinks & juices were free but the wines/beers were payable. For the extra $25 that it cost I did expect a little more & was disappointed as I have been in better hotel lounges where all drinks (soft & hard) were free & you had a better experience. Apart from that the hotel was fab, Lobby was massive, 3 free computers by the lobby lifts (6 lifts) to check email & print boarding passes. The location is spot on for tourists & first time visitors to the city, all the BART, buses & tram go along Market St past the hotel & there are stops moments away from the hotel as well as the Powell Street cable car turnaround. The 3 day MUNI travel pass available form the sales desk by BofA is fantastic value @ $21 for 3 days & includes unlimited travel on the cable card, trams & buses. Also check out the tourist information office in Powell St BART subway for free wifi & free local calls from the phones on the walls !!The Cheesecake Factory is just around the corner on Union Sq in the top floor of Macys and stays open very late and has a nice open air terrace overlooking Union Sq. If in town again would probably try elsewhere but in same neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Should Have Listened!”
Reviews.Author: Bbmskuwait
Reviews.Content: So many reviewers told me that this hotel had a lot of street noise. It certainly does. It does amaze me how I am on the 27th floor and can actually hear people on the street below. The amentities include earplugs, when have you ever had ear plugs in the room? How does that happen! The club lounge does NOT offer free drinks with the evening happy hour, strange. The breakfast is ok but not special. I am sitting here wishing I did not pay the extra for the club floor, I would suggest you think about it first. Now the good news, the tolietries are fabulous and I love them so much I am taking them every morning and hiding them so the maid will replenish. The room is nice and comfortable and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The wifi in the lobby is free but the room wifi is expensive and extremely slow, go to the lobby if you're just checking your email. I did send a note to the hotel about all of this but as of today no one answered me. Oh well, San Francisco is beautiful so I am not letting it bother me.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: granteth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 this past weekend and had a great time. I had two totally different experiences though. For the first leg of our trip I purchased through hotel website and paid the standard rate. Upon check-in the room was not ready and we were upgraded to a penthouse suite on the top floor. You really can't get any better than this. If you can you should try and do what you can to get on the 29, 30, or 31 floor. Simply stunning. For the second leg of our trip I used priceline and got a standard two double bed room. It was pretty average, the hotel front desk saw that I had purchased through priceline so they didn't really care about much so I was rushed along; but then again I did use priceline and got it cheap. parking is really steep ($50 a day for valet) but you are in the heart of the city so deal with it. So there you have it, either way you look at it, solid hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Walls are paper thin - but great location”
Reviews.Author: bgrs2go
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 is at a great location - took the bart got off at Powell and the hotel is right there. Clean nice basic room. No frills. The biggest disappointment was hearing everything going on next door. First it was a family of kids jumping up & down and screaming and then a man with a deep voice. So now I know why there have ear plugs in the room. I was wondering why when we checked in but then realized you need them if you want to sleep. There are so many choices when going to SF - this price was good & location was great, but I will check out another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: nike85uk
Reviews.Content: Great location - felt pretty central; we walked pretty much everywhere. Right on Market Street, walkable to ferry terminal building. Also located well for BART, Trolley Line etc. Big Room - Club room, I think it was on 29th floor was really large, with a dual aspect I'm not sure if it was standard for the class of room that we had booked but it was marvellous to have the seating area where the in-laws from the room opposite could pop over to plan our day's activities, and the view out over SF, with the fog rolling in was lovely. The inlaws' room was not as big but still more than adequate, I would say. Based on the experience of our two rooms, I would certainly recommend the Club level. Clean, Neat, Spacious, big TV, Coffee Machine - all boxes ticked. Staff Service was not World Class, but it was fine. A bit surly at times but not rude or inefficient. Bar & Restaurant good - again service was fine. Enjoyed a few bottles of 'Champagne' and some snacks from the menu but did not eat a full meal (we were in the middle of SF....!!!). All in all, great value for money (we did book way ahead of time and prepay), brilliant location and clean, comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good location close to Union Square”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelcritic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for a family event. Got a good rate through Hotwire and used our Wyndham Rewards card to get the free internet (otherwise it is $14.95 a night). The hotel is around the corner from the BART Powell St Station which makes it easy to get back and forth from SFO airport. Lobby was spacious and modern. Rooms were spacious and quiet. Close to Union Square shopping, public transit, walking distance to Chinatown and Nob Hill (if you don't mind walking uphill). Plenty of nearby restaurants both affordable and high end Staff was friendly and attentive

Reviews.Title: “Will definately be back.....”
Reviews.Author: Mariah K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in the city for our honeymoon. I don't often post reviews as I don't have much time however I was so impressed with the service and quality of this hotel that I felt inclined. When we arrived we were greeted by a gentleman at the front desk that was not only friendly and professional but seemed as though he really enjoys his job. This was a great first impression I did not get his last name but pretty sure his first name was Andre. When we were heading out for the night he engaged us again in conversation and as we are not from California he gave us directions to several night clubs near by that fit what we were looking for as well as a great place to grab dinner first!! We came in for one extended stay and he gave us room #3007, which has an AMAZING balcony view!!! This was as far as I am concerned above and beyond. We all felt that each person we encountered during our stay there was what made it for us. The facility itself is very nice and so convenient to downtown nightlife and I highly recommend for anyone in the area looking to have a good time in a great part of the city!

Reviews.Title: “I left my heart in.........”
Reviews.Author: CanadaScrew
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wyndham Parc 55 for 4 glorious days........great location,very nice rooms,quiet,would go again...........

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: mariferwaffle
Reviews.Content: After looking a lot a hotel for our 5 days stay at SF I choose this one. (We wanted the Intercontinental but it was full). The main reason I choose this hotel is location, It is just one block away from Market/Powell St, Powell station, the cablecar and also really close to Union square, restaurants and all the shopping district. The price was less than $200 per night, which seems to be a regular price for hotels in the area. In general the hotel is anything amazing neither luxury, is an average clean hotel, decent price with an awesome location. Try to get a room at the higher floors, because is a busy/noisy street. The top floors have a good view

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to union square.”
Reviews.Author: jpmfv
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel to stay in SF and walk to almost everything, restaurants, bars, union square. Great rooms and helpful staff. No free wifi, parking is almost 60 per night, a total robbery but public ellis ofarrel is really close and I payed 80 for 3 nights. We stayed at floor 25 with an espectacular view, try to get the highest floor available for better view and less noise.

Reviews.Title: “Credit card alert”
Reviews.Author: Lea R
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights at this hotel. Room only average and parking was 50.00 a day. On top of that we were charged on our credit card for two fraudulent transactions . Trying to rectify this was a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: DelafieldJohn
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 Wyndham is located in a good part of SF, just a couple blocks from Union Square. My wife and I stayed at this property after arriving to San Francisco during a vacation to Napa Valley. The room was typical for a Wyndham - comfortable but certainly not luxurious. Beds were comfortable and the room seemed relatively clean. At 3:30 a.m. we were awoken by what sounded like a deep tunnel project outside our 10th floor room. Upon looking out the window I discovered it was the garbage men collecting MANY dumpsters and depositing their contents in their trucks. This process went on FOREVER! Neither my wife nor I were able to get back to sleep. When we were asked by the lady checking us out how our stay was (who incidentally was the same lady that checked us in) I told her of our nocturnal disruption. She shook her head as if to say "I've heard this before" and said "Next time you need to request the inside rooms away from the street." I can only wonder why she neglected to offer that suggestion at check in! There will be NO next time. Our next day in Napa was exhausting as we Sleepless in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: ShineNSun
Reviews.Content: Was there last week for 4 nights/5 days. Centrally, it was in the right location but far from major attractions. We didn't rent a car because didn't want to pay the outrageous parking fee but that's SF. Plus it was convenient as far as getting transportation to and from the hotel. Hotel was nice but it wasn't what I expected based on the reviews. Staffs were friendly and helpful. Entry way was nice. Not sure if we would stay again but would consider.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing spring break in San Fran!”
Reviews.Author: Julie L
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a trip from LA, up the central coast, ending in San Fran. After finding a great travel zoo deal, I booked a club level king room at the Parc 55. This hotel is amazing! At check in, I inquired about upgrading to a suite and we were given a complementary upgrade to a 1 bedroom corner penthouse with 2 bathrooms, living room & kitchenette. The views from the top floor are absolutely amazing. Truly love this hotel. Great location, friendly people and the club level offered enough full breakfast, evening appetizers which were plentiful enough for an actual dinner & nightly dessert. If you can find a better hotel in San Fran, I would be shocked.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: partyof51991
Reviews.Content: great hotel location for sure but if you have a car be ready to spend $48 dollars a night for parking!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Norma811
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The rooms were big,and well appointed. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Handy for Union Square and the trolley cars.

Reviews.Title: “Location Makes it Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: GoKoko
Reviews.Content: As many others have stated, this is an overall great property. By far, the best thing about this property is its location. It's really about the best you can do in all of San Francisco. We got a great rate at this property for $109 USD a night through a Travelzoo deal and it was definitely worth it. The main reason I'm not giving it 5 stars are because we had a few hiccups during our stay. After we checked in we wanted to relax for a little while in our room. We went to turn on the television to find it wasn't working. It took a good two hours for maintenance to get up to the room to fix the television. Another problem we had was one of our key cards became deactivated three times during our three night stay (and no we didn't keep it close to our phones or credit cards :) ). To go down 14 floors and wait in a long line to be able to get a new card to get into your room can be an absolutely huge inconvenience. Now for a few good things we especially enjoyed about this hotel (other than its fabulous location): 1) All staff we encountered were extremely pleasant. 2) It was very quiet and not noisy like some others have stated. 3) They have a great fitness center. 4) The views from the rooms are great, even from the 14th floor it was terrific. 5) Rooms are all very large -- especially for San Francisco standards 6) The water pressure in the shower was FANTASTIC! Overall, we would definitely stay here again -- especially if we're able to find another great deal on the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Safe choice at the right price”
Reviews.Author: Lingheadcrumple
Reviews.Content: Standard chain option in the main shopping part of SF. Hotel is huge, the room was clean and perfectly good (although bed tiny), the staff were fine, I didn't really use any of the facilities. Right next door to the BART station, a bus/street car stop and a tram stop. I wouldn't pay their normal prices but got it for about £70 a night through Priceline and was happy with that. Don't pay their extortionate wifi price - use the free internet in the business centre. Cable cafe over the road has good cheap beer, don't bother with Lori's diner round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location in San FranciscoSome rooms have nice views.”
Reviews.Author: Up69
Reviews.Content: No WiFi This hotel is clean comfortable. Seems to miss the boat a little on the business traveler. No room service during the day. Room service prices very high, again not good for business expense budgets. BIG NEGATIVE staff will not discuss prior to check in, or pre reserve a specific room or floor if you book thru Expedia or any third party. Again not recognizing the business traveler. Too Bad.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here and enjoy every minute”
Reviews.Author: ramede
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel. Everything was at the level of excellent. The breakfast staff were brillant except for the two grim ladies who greeted you on entry. Terrible personalities and no smiles. Room on the eighth floor was spacious and very comfortable and we could see the St. Patrick's Day parade on Market Street from the window. We stayed three nights and could have stayed thirty. Anyone staying here will be happy. Well, except for everyone who has to pass the grim reapers at the entrance to the breakfast area. Thanks to Rhodora for helping us with a little problem. What a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Central location near union square”
Reviews.Author: clairelovesholidayz
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were upgraded by Andre to a junior suite. This room was lovely and also granted us access to the club lounge with free breakfast, evening snacks and desserts- very nice. It also has amazing views of the city. The room itself was large and had a sofa area and a treadmill ! The hotel is centrally located near union square and Powell station. We paid 8 dollars for a Bart train to the airport and were quoted 60 dollars for a taxi so recommend this is you want to save money as it stops outside the hotel and is direct. The rooms could do with some updating in my opinion, they are a bit dated and the safe didn't work in ours. We reported this on day 1 but when we left on day 4 it wasn't fixed. All in all I would stay here again and recommend as it's very central, staff are friendly and it's reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Traveler49090
Reviews.Content: I found the Parc 55 Wyndham to be a very good hotel in a convenient location. This was especially appreciated when we got off the BART from the airport and it was raining. After a short walk of maybe 2 blocks we had reached our hotel. If you are willing to wait in line to take the cable car on Powell St. you are close to there as well. For the most part we walked to most of the locations we visited in San Francisco. Of course it helped that after our arrival we were met with sunny skies although there was a brisk wind. You are staying right in the middle of San Francisco so there is a lot of "city" noise. But as a previous reviewer said ear plugs are provided. I find ear plugs to be very helpful whenever staying in a hotel. They help to minimize being bothered by hall noise, sirens, etc. If I had a complaint it would be that the elevators seem to be quite slow. Although I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Extraordinaire”
Reviews.Author: Pat B
Reviews.Content: Our recent trip to San Francisco was one of our most enjoyable due to the fine customer service we received from staff and the 5+ star accommodations. From the doorman through the reception staff, bellman, and concierge everyone was dedicated to making our stay the most enjoyable and carefree stay. The room accommodations were plush with exquisite views of the city and my husband and I felt like we were treated as royalty. Pat & Sam

Reviews.Title: “Good But Not Great”
Reviews.Author: citygirlnyc034
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 recently underwent a remodel and while it definitely looks better than it did I still would opt for some of the other 4 star hotels in the area over this one. The Pluses - great location, great views on the higher floors, comfortable beds, nice products in the restrooms. The Minuses - internet was definitely hit or miss (and not cheap at $14.95/day), no light in the closet, room key stopped working halfway through the visit. All in all I would recommend staying here if you get a good deal but I will probably look elsewhere unless the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room, central location”
Reviews.Author: Relainey
Reviews.Content: I was surprised by the size of the room and was lucky to have a room at the end of the corridor with 3 big windows. The bathroom was huge, the bed comfy. Big flat screen TV and a nice work table made it complete. The staff were very friendly. Kudos to the doorman for unloading my broken (thanks, Delta) luggage without dropping it. I was also surprised to get a personalized voicemail from the concierge offering her services since it was just a 2 night stay. I was steps away from the Muni station, so getting around was simple. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Every Second”
Reviews.Author: The_Deity
Reviews.Content: Pardon how late I am with this review, but I recently just registered with Trip Advisor. Anyways, The #1 plus in regards to this hotel is it's location. Your right across the street from both San Francisco Centre (Mall) and the city's hub Muni & Bart Station train station (Powell St.). Also, your walking distance from almost any and everything in the downtown area (Union Square, Powell & Hyde Cable Cars, etc.) The hotel itself has a modern contemporary aesthetic (Nice Lobby and Restaurant/Lounge) with very spacious rooms (At least my was since it was a corner room). Because your across the street from the train station, easy access to either SFO or Oakland's Airport. I would stay here again in a heartbeat especially for the price that I paid.

Reviews.Title: “A Reasonable Fallback”
Reviews.Author: Mitz50
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through Hotwire and received an excellent room rate. Unfortunately, the hotel was not a four-star in our book. We should have realized that there might be a problem with the room when we saw a set of complimentary earplugs on the sink. Maybe it was just this room, but the wall was paper thin on the left side of the room and we heard continual noise from our neighbors. Also, the street noise on Saturday at night was annoying even though we were on the fourteenth floor. Other than that, the location of the hotel is excellent for exploring downtown S.F. The room was clean, the service was good, the view was beautiful, and an inexpensive continental breakfast was available in the lobby. Parking was expensive so we parked one block away for half of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view”
Reviews.Author: Renee W
Reviews.Content: I was in San Francisco tagging along with my sister while she was at a conference. We checked in late and were given a room on the 32nd floor. Every member of the staff we met were extremely friendly and very welcoming. Once we got to our room, the view was absolutely amazing. I thought it was just the downtown area we could see, but image my surprise the next morning when we could actually see all the way to the bay. It was so relaxing and beautiful to watch the fog roll into the bay in the afternoon. It is close to all of the public transportation San Francisco offers which makes it easy to get around. I would definitely recommend the Parc 55. From staff to location I could not have asked for anything better.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: sarahtham
Reviews.Content: This is a convenient hotel right in the heart of downtown san francisco with 3 minute walk to the BART. Lovely spacious and rooms. Business centre on 4th floor is great for online check-ins of flights. The "to-go" breakfast was good: pastries, bagels, fruits, teas, coffees, parfaits. Rooms were tastefully decorated. Noise from outside can be intrusive although ear-plugs provided in rooms. Beautiful view of city on 9th floor ( my room). No free Internet;(

Reviews.Title: “Million Dollar Panoramic Views”
Reviews.Author: TRTW
Reviews.Content: I decided to take a day trip to San Francisco to get my mind off my Persian cat who died. I was fortunate to find a room at the Parc 55 Wyndham downtown. Upon driving up they assisted with parking my car (parking is $48 a night). When I registered I requested a room away from the elevator/stairwell and they gave me a room just a few steps from the elevator. I thought that was hilarious. Anyway, I called again and requested if there was another room or perhaps an upgrade. They immediately transferred me to a room away from the elevator. Upon entering the room I quickly noticed the windows lined up along the right side. They gave me a corner room!!! The panoramic view of San Francisco is amazingly beautiful!!! Talk about a million dollar view...WOW!!! This made up for all the inconsistencies of my initial room I had requested. The staff at Parc 55 are helpful and attentive. The only issue I had was when I went to breakfast and the two ladies at the front kept reading something instead of seating us. Until my partner mentioned if we are to be seated and that's when they did. To me, no matter how busy you are, knowing that there was someone waiting, they should at least say "Hold on, we will seat you shortly". Instead, they saw us, ignored us, and continued doing what they were doing. Thought that was strange. But the service in the restaurant was exceptional. The registration/checkout was good too. The comfort of the bed is impeccable. The bathroom is in good working quality. I will definitely stay at this hotel. Found my home away from home. Plus, it got my mind off the sadness of losing my baby Persian cat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Lilogirl22
Reviews.Content: Conveniently close to the bart/muni stations and quick walk to the mall! Staff was really helpful and really nice! Thank you Ericka! After a plane and bart ride all you want to do is get to your hotel and she was very pleasant when helping us check in. Other reviews mention the noise. Yes you are in downtown so you can't avoid it! I stayed on the 26th floor and still heard sirens but you get that in any city in downtown. Room was clean, prompt room service, and great hotel views. You get what you pay for and I really enjoyed my time there. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “not good enough.”
Reviews.Author: outcastalien
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the St. patrick's day weekend. The rooms are pretty decent BUT definitely not worth the price. ( St. Patrick's day might have had something to do with it). The staff at the front desk was not friendly at all. We only dealt with 1 guy and he seemed couldnt be bothered to smile let alone offer any kind of apology for rooms being late. The concierge was less than helpful. Single worded answers to almost all my questions...... The bell desk ppl were very nice and friendly so full marks for these guys. Location is fantastic though. So all in all, not bad but not good enough.

Reviews.Title: “You'll need earplugs but it's worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Leslie255
Reviews.Content: Loved the service, the food, the decor and the location. I even enjoyed the view but the outside noise was problematic. I will stay there again for sure but I'll take a sound machine.

Reviews.Title: “good to customers”
Reviews.Author: Kyle D
Reviews.Content: Another trip to SF landed me at this hotel and I was glad. This is another nice hotel near the BART and MUNI stations, Being someone who wants to avoid the inconvience and cost of renting a car, that close proximity is a good thing, because it's easy to travel to the airports and to my office at the civic center. When I arrived, the hotel's computers were down, and I couldn't check in. To make up for that, they gave all of us waiting in line a $25 credit for any charges related to the hotel. I used mine at the restaurant, which I also recommend. The food was good and service fast and pleasant. Of course not within the budget for state employees, so the $25 credit came in handy. The hotel itself is clean, well kept up and my room was a good size with a comfortable king size bed. If you're a shopaholic, you may really enjoy this hotel because it's close to the Powel Street cable car and Union Square. Nordstroms and Bloomingdales are just two blocks away. Although I highly recommend this hotel, I will admit that my preferencesare the historic or well kept up boutique hotels - they always make me feel more like I'm in San Francisco. This hotel seems like you would find it anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for uncomfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Chris F
Reviews.Content: This place is expensive and is not impressive. Movies are super expensive, the Internet costs daily, Parking your car is super expensive too! We tried to buy internet last night and the server was down. Boo.  The staff was great about cleaning the room, but the room was bla in design and the bed was uncomfortable... Not great. The room comes with three pillows for a king size two person room. Huh? Does that even make sense? I won't stay here again. We travel once every two months and frequent many hotels. This hotel should lose a star. I should have stayed at the Hilton around the corner. However, San Francisco is the bomb!!! We love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rainy in San Fran, but Warm @ Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: Azuredirection
Reviews.Content: I've traveled throughout my entire life. My parents worked for the diplomatic core, then I worked for the diplomatic core before my career in education and counseling; so hotels have been a mainstay in my life. I consider myself a novice connoisseur of hotels - self appointed of course. A counseling convention brought me to Parc 55. Upon my arrival, I was greeted with sleek, modern lines, vibrant wall art, and a welcoming 'hello' by every hotel employee who crossed my path. The lobby area was airy and open, very suiting for the San Fran area. The front desk quickly check me in and I made my way up to my room. I'm a Wyndham rewards participant, and had requested a room on a high floor; so I was very pleased with my 23rd floor assignment, offering an expansive view of the city and the beautiful bay. The room was clean, open and accommodating. The bathroom (a pet peeve area for me) was spacious, clean and spa-like. I didn't hesitate to put my things on the counter, nor did I ponder before stepping into the shower. Whew- thank God for small blessings! Within an hour of my check-in, a complimentary tray of fruit, and my preferred beverages of sprite and bottled water were delivered to my room. Now that's how you welcome a guest! My stay extended over three nights and four days. My room was always clean, and fresh. The nightly turn over service was like clock work - and always done with a smile and small talk. The room service, was delivered with the same level of warmth; although I felt the menu options were a bit lacking for the San Francisco area, but they were able to accommodate my requests. The room offered a soft hum from the city, but it was welcomed as it served as reminder of being a new place. Not once did I see any signs of untidiness in the hotel, nor was anyone every rude or impolite. I think my visit to the hotel markets sums up the quality offered by Parc 55 Wyndham, San Francisco: Having flown for 8 hours, with a connector, and a 2 hour delay due to rotting fish - I was tired and my ears had not yet acclimated to being on the ground again. Every word that I said echoed loudly in my skull as if my it was empty, cavernous. Every attempt to dislodge the trapped air was met with shooting pain. I needed the warm end of a q-tip and of course I didn't pack any. I made my way down stairs to the hotel market. I was greeted by an aging man with a youthful smile. He welcomed me and asked if he could help me find anything. I explained my dilemma, and we began dialoguing. Before I knew it, we had shared our professional journeys, our travels, and our passion for inquiry and people - he was so gregarious and joyful; respectable traits to someone who was intrinsically introverted. His exuberant small talk made you feel hopeful about the world... a big statement for such a small act I know. While paying for my travel sized pack of q-tips I noticed that we hadn't even exchanged names. I looked to his name tag. "Nice to meet you Warren. It was a pleasure speaking with you", I said with a grateful smile. "The pleasure was all mine Ms. Graham. You have a nice day and enjoy your conference." The warmth infused into the simple task of helping a customer find q-tips is not at all uncommon at Parc 55, and I think that's what make this hotel exceptional. I love quotes, and I recently came across this one, “Truly great friends are hard to find, difficult to leave, and impossible to forget.” I visited the store one more time before leaving, with no intention of crossing Warrens path again, but I would be remiss in saying I wasn't hoping to get a little bit of his sunny disposition before heading back to the east coast. He wasn't working that day, but the experience provided by Warren and the entire Parc 55 staff is "hard to find, difficult to leave, and impossible to forget". Thank you for making my stay in San Francisco a wonderful one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: scott r
Reviews.Content: Easy trip from SFO via Bart! Jump on the train for 8 bucks, and you are in the heart of the city. Super location. Take a walk up Powell to get your exercise! Lots of good pubs close by.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the club level”
Reviews.Author: Azonie
Reviews.Content: Pay a little extra for the club level rooms on the top floors with access to the club room on the 31st floor -- expansive views in all directions; wide array of cold meats and cheeses, fresh fruit, pastries and bread items for breakfast; yummy appetizers cold and hot for cocktail hour (you buy the cocktails); fantastic desserts. The service staff is superb. When the weather is bad -- it was cold and windy during our stay -- you can just live in the club room and watch the world from this protected vantage point. The hotel is well-run, with friendly, efficient staff. Lots of conventions and cruise lines book there. The rooms are clean, modern and pleasant. The location is excellent. We flew into SFO and took the BART for $8 each one-way, then walked two blocks to the hotel. Street cars, cable cars and buses are within a block. Union Square is two blocks north. Try the Japanese restaurant next door -- great sushi!

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: timest
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful! Like other reviewers have mentioned the location is great. All the public transportation options are a block away and are very easy to use. The club level is very nice for a light breakfast or hearty appitizers Sunday-Thursday. Everything is clean and well taken care of. We had no problems of any kind.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent great location”
Reviews.Author: Dotty178
Reviews.Content: Me and my brother stayed in this hotel due to the Hotel Fusion being a dump but this hotel was great, big rooms, big gym would def go back and the location for the shops was ideal

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeff R
Reviews.Content: A block away from the BART System and Cable Car "station". Hotel was clean and comfy. Concierge was clueless. Asked what they recommended during a rainy day in SF and the guy told us to go to the movie in the mall across the street. That's the best you can do???? Also, another rep sent us to an Italian restaurant down the street only to find it closed. Best to have a gameplan before asking the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lloyddy81
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay in downtown San Francisco. The location was excellent with Union Square, Chinatown, Cable Cars and the BART all very close by. The room was large, clean and as we were on the 28th floor had a fabulous view of San Francisco. King bed was very comfortable and we had a good nights sleep. There was a massive TV in the room which actually had HD channels, which seems to be a rarity in American hotels! The bathroom was large and clean. Service was pleasant and efficient, even when we were checking in at 1am. They were happy to accommodate our requests. The concierge was also friendly and helpful. We enjoyed a drink in the hotel bar which was very enjoyable and not as expensive as I was expecting. Overall this was a great hotel and well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel- Ambivalent Staff”
Reviews.Author: jfeld0ax
Reviews.Content: The facilities and the decor are fine but if you have a problem or an issue..staff range from helpful to infuriating and ambivalent. I had a mix-up with my complimentary breakfast, a priceline error, and the staff were completely unhelpful and condescending. I've stayed in hotels with lower ratings before that made up for the lack of amenities with their rock staff. This is not one of them!

Reviews.Title: “Convienent Location”
Reviews.Author: Halle B
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location and centrally located to the BART (rail system) and dozens of delicious restaurants in the area. Our group walked to Chinatown and enjoyed a delicious and spicy meal that we're still talking about today. The rooms were clean and comfortable but seemed a bit on the pricey side. The only downside to this hotel is that you have to valet your car - there are no other options to park on the street (2 hour max) or in a garage. Valet was $48 a day but the valet man reminded us several times that we had in and our privileges. That sounds great until you remember that you have to tip them $5 everytime they retrieve your car. Overall the hotel itself was very nice and the concierge was extremely helpful in suggesting several different restaurants to eat at.

Reviews.Title: “We coming back!”
Reviews.Author: gw3ndolen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc Wyndham for four nights in August 2011. We booked a club room with a wonderful view over the city and the bay. Loved the complimentary breakfast and the hors d'oeuvres in the evening. The location is great. We're definitely coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Ehhh”
Reviews.Author: BrandyShores
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc55 in early March 2012. It was ok, but needs a massive update and I probably wouldn't stay here again. We got a corner room on the 21st floor. It was so loud from both outside noises and the rooms down the hall that it was next to impossible to sleep. The walls are so thin that housekeeping was knocking on the door across from us and I opened our door thinking they were at our room. The direct quote from the housekeeping staff- "Sorry, these walls are really thin." As if the noise were not enough, the bed was one of the single most uncomfortable beds I have ever attempted to sleep on. It was terrible. The hotel lobby and restaurant are very nice and the room was very clean. The location was pretty great, as it is right by the end of the trolley car line. But it is not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, beautiful views, great location for shopping and theater.”
Reviews.Author: Loriyas
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with a unique corner location offering easy access for those driving into the city. Unfortunately, parking is expensive - which impacts the value of this location. Shopping all around. One block from Union Square. The hotel restaurants are good! Nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Rinnie S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights here,very nice accommodation. The staff were friendly and we were able to check in early without charge. Has a great restaurant and the service was great there also. Good location with the trolley and cable car just across the street as well as Westfield shopping Centre. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and upscale at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: petersam
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I've stayed there since Wyndham took over. It has the modern feel of a Westin at a lower price. The rooms are in great condition. The fitness center is large with a variety of cardio machines and a smaller number of strength machines. Fruit and towels, but only a slow water fountain to drink from. Registration is on the second floor, but the main entrance is on the first. It becomes quite deserted at night down there and did not feel as safe in that part of San Francisco as I would like, especially considering Wyndham's reputation for caring about such things. All in all, I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Neurotiko
Reviews.Content: Traveled with a total of 4 friends for a weekend getaway, the hotel's location was perfect it was close to shopping, transportation, and eatery venues which made everything very convenient. We arrived around 530pm, registration was smooth no waiting lines, the person who helped us provided great customer service. We stayed at the Club level rooms on floor 29, The room was spacious and bathroom was a good size. The view from our room was amazing. Will definitely go back had a really great experience with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: AInstin
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good location, friendly staff. Pitty there's no pool, sauna or hot tub, but other than that, just lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in town”
Reviews.Author: Kimmmmmm
Reviews.Content: Rooms were decent, but wifi was extremely expensive. Close to Westfield and the trams

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Remgirl1
Reviews.Content: My husband had a Sun-Mon company-paid conference, so we decided to take a long weekend and book our own hotel for Thurs-Sat. Having visited San Francisco several times, we are familiar with the city, and thus decided to save a little by bidding via Priceline. We got the Parc 55 for $160. per night. Not a huge savings, but considering conference/convention season is in full swing, we were happy with the price. Upon arrival the doorman and bellhop greeted us and offered their service. The woman assisting us checking in was also friendly and polite. The only (slightly) odd thing about checking in is that you enter the lobby, then go up one floor. We soon realized having a separate lobby from the check-in & concierge made sense because this hotel frequently hosts conferences, meetings, tour groups, and is used by many different airlines as crash pads. This kept the check-in area free from the large groups clogging up the space. The airlines even had their own self-check in kiosk. We knew that booking via Priceline often means getting the least desirable rooms. That's why when we use that service, we only bid on the highest star-level available. With those hotels, the least desirable room is still usually better than an average room at a lower-star hotel. At the Parc 55, we were given one of those rooms, #814 (standard non-smoking King). Our room looked into the "courtyard" aka looking out at the back of the other buildings. I consider that a "plus" because those rooms are usually quieter than street side, (if I want a view, I don't use third-party booking agent). Pretty much everything about the room could be described as standard and comfortable for the star level. We found the bed to be a bit firm, but otherwise it was your average hotel pillow-top. The only thing that made the room sub-par was that the maid's access hallway ran right behind the wall our bed was against. So, from the time we checked in (around 6:30) to the time we left for dinner (8pm) we heard the trolley carts rolling like thunder through that hallway several times. When we got back from dinner, around 10pm, we heard nothing until around 9am the next morning, well after we were already up. This was no big deal for *us*. We live in an urban setting, so we're used to some noise. Plus, our sleep habits were not interrupted, and we didn't spend much time in the room by day. That said, I can easily imagine this room could be a nightmare to others with differing habits. The hotels seems aware of this, and a pair of earplugs are provided :) The bathroom: Average sized, Bath & Bodyworks products are nice, hot water comes on quickly and seems a bit hotter than normal (yay!) and the shower is fantastic. The only downside is poor lighting over the shower. I like a well-lit shower for shaving. Overall: Yes, I would book again via Priceline, and if the price was right, direct with the hotel. I felt we got our money's worth and had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: hkchloe
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Club 2 beds room recently. It is worth the money to be on the higher floor with access to the lounge that provides breakfast and evening hors doeuvres. Staffs in the lounge are friendly with great knowledge of the city. Nice to talk to locals!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Union Square”
Reviews.Author: rpwiki
Reviews.Content: This is always my first choice when I need to stay downtown. It's close to everything, room prices are reasonable for San Francisco and the hotel has been recently updated so it's comfortable and well appointed. If you can, try and get a room on the upper floors to avoid street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScholarGentleman
Reviews.Content: Right by the BART station--transportation hub. Lots of food steps away, from fast food to very upscale. At the terminus of the cable cars that can take you up to Fisherman's Warf/Tourist Mecca. Was here for a conference, and it was just about perfect for that. Great beds, nice shower. FAST elevators. Friendly and helpful staff across the board. Would be nice if it had a fridge (I didn't ask for one--I'm sure they would have provided.) And the room was quite clean and new, but--well, I'm fussy and the furnishings needed to be more carefully cleaned. It can get a bit noisy on the street on the weekends, though I didn't need the provided earplugs. Overall, I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Check the Hotel Web Site First”
Reviews.Author: petrus1966
Reviews.Content: First of all, make sure that you check the hotel's own website for special rates and packages before scouring other hotel discount websites. I could have saved a lot of time by doing so, as I found when I discovered a lower rate than the one I had obtained on Priceline. I did get a refund from Priceline to match the hotel's lower rate, but there were still certain limitations to having booked on Priceline versus directly through the hotel (e.g., I couldn't use my Wyndham Rewards card for points and free internet). The hotel itself was good- lovely, spacious lobby and friendly, helpful staff. Concierge was great. The lobby bartender was particularly helpful and pleasant but the prices were kind of hard to swallow. I agree with other reviewers- the location is quite central, especially for conventioneers, although you have to be careful how far you wander because you can be in rough area very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice and friendly Hotel. Close to lots of things.”
Reviews.Author: Paul T
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night while on business but this place is one of the best corporate hotels I’ve stayed in. The staff were amazingly friendly and helpful; answered every one of my questions with a smile. The room was big and comfortable. I loved the king-sized bed and wished my wife had been able to come with me. The hotel is within easy reach of most shops, transport lines and tourist attractions. It was just down the road that I saw two guys turn an SFC Tram around on a turnstile. Great shopping close by, as well. My only downer is the usual $15 for internet and $4.50 for a litre of water. Why not just include these in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: JC_chgo
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd time I stayed here. I was here for a conference 2 years ago, I went to the same conference this year. My room was a king, the bed, sofa and desk were nicer than I had two years ago, and it was fairly spacious. The bathroom was also upgraded, it seems the hotel may have done some improvements. Conference was at Moscone Center, it's close enough to walk- maybe 4 to 5 blocks. The Parc55 is right on top of Union Square; if you want to shop, it's literally 1 to 2 blocks from major boutiques and Macy's/Neiman Marcus/Nordstrom's. There's a Bart and Muni station 1 block away, the cable car turnaround is 1/2 block, and the trolley stop is 1 block. Wireless Internet is $15/day or $49/week, kind of steep even for a hotel. Join their loyalty program and I believe they give you free WiFi at all their locations (Wyndham). I would say this is an upper-midrange hotel, with amenities and prices to match. They know their competition, and you get what you pay for. I've stayed at nicer, but it was more expensive. San Francisco is not a city for cheap hotels, at least not ones you'd want to stay at. I would stay here again. P.S.- they have a 'Grab and Go' breakfast bar, you can get muffins/bagels/yogurt and coffee. 2 pastries and a coffee for $5- that's a steal in this town.

Reviews.Title: “Great night in SF!”
Reviews.Author: Leah F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Parc 55 for one night and really enjoyed this hotel!! It is super clean, comfortable, has a GREAT location next to everything (shopping, BART, trolley car, ect.) and the staff is wonderful!!! We will definetly come back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for fun and busines!”
Reviews.Author: Gustavo C
Reviews.Content: I had to go to SFO to do a training for 3 days so I took my family with me. So we looked for a hotel that satisfies all of our needs at the same time. We looked for other options at much higher price, until we found this one. Indeed this hotel met all of our expectations: close to everything with access to almost every public transportation, shopping, restaurants, Offices, etc. The people at the hotel were very kind and gave us lots of tips to maximize our joy while in San Francisco. It was very helpful! If I'm San Francisco again, I would love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Get away weekend- great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CAonthego
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Parc 55 for a birthday weekend getaway. Easy to get to off the BART line. Elegant, modern common areas...Our room was upgraded to the 29th floor.....Very nice room, well appointed bathroom....but the best thing was the view. OMG, we could see the Bay and all of downtown. Nights were spectacular with the city lights!!!! Everything was wonderful, and looking forward to a return trip soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in SF for the value seeking guest”
Reviews.Author: SodaTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel Jan 31st/Feb 1st on business. Reason for selecting this hotel was purely best price for the location without compromising on quality. This hotel was a pleasant surprise! Lobby was very modern and clean, front desk check-in was easy, pleasant, staff member very helpful. Stayed in room 1872 which is a corner room and it was excellent. Windows on two sides, terrific view of City Hall and the city. The bed was comfortable, room was clean, and included large flat screen tv. Only the bathroom was a bit lacking, (rather old looking, simple, no lighted makeup mirror, could use some hooks on the wall for hanging towels, some mold in the grout in the shower/tub combo (pet peeve), but it was large size so not clausterphobic) Hotel is within easy walking distance of restuarants, shopping at Union Square and bart, which was good, as we did not rent a car from SFO airport. Ate breakfast at the restuarant adjacent to the lobby. Standard/higher price for breakfast, but service was quick, friendly, food good). Will stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Right across from Downtown!!”
Reviews.Author: NanNanSF
Reviews.Content: Having worked in the hotels like Palace Hotel, Monaco and The Ritz in San Francisco, my standards for hotels are a bit high. At $250 a night, my boyfriend and I booked Parc 55 because it was close by to the venue we were going to be celebrating New Years Eve. The staff were nice, but sadly they could not give us a king size bed. We had to have double beds which was really annoying, however, I'm not going to blame the establishment because it was new years eve. Parking is a whooping $50 a night. If you're smart, you will park in a parking lot a few blocks away to save $$. The room was nice and tidy and the bathrooms were to standard. It has been one of the nicer hotels I have stayed in San Francisco and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for the Perfect Night”
Reviews.Author: Eric S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Parc 55 and had dinner over at their in hotel restaurant. The service from beginning to end was just excellent. The location was in the prime area of San Francisco. I stayed at the 32nd floor of the Wyndham hotel in one of their sky line suites, and can I say the view was just stunning. We had breathless views that were great, and can I say, this was well worth the price that I got the room for. The restaurant, which was Cityhouse, was a great restaurant, on their website, you can go onto OpenTable and do a reservation, which is what I did for Valentine's Day, myself and my girlfriend spent the evening there which was serene, the place is child friendly too just in case you would ever want to take your kids over there. The stay was wonderful, someone from housekeeping came into the room and closed all the drapes and left us some chocolates, which were made local in San Francisco, on our pillow. We chose to open up the drapes because the view was just great. I can't wait to come here for another stay again!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in San Francisco !”
Reviews.Author: Terrif264
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Parc 55 for my honeymoon night . I requested a room with a view and boy, did I get it ! The room was spacious and beautiful. I got the room and parking package. After shopping several hotels in SF, this was the best choice . I look forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Service, Location and Comfort Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: LovesSunshine56
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 day trip to SF with a girlfriend and our two teenage daughters. After too much research of where to stay in the city, we selected the Parc 55. Won't research other options in the future, this place was perfect in every single way!! We opted for the Club Level feature which is hands down the way to go. The breakfast offered was very substantial (2 fresh cut fruits, yogurt, granola, cereal, hard boiled eggs, toast, pastries, juices, coffee & tea). A quiet lovely environment with outstanding views. Also enjoyed other Club amenities - appetizers and wine, and later desserts and wine. Most definitely worth the extra money, especially considering the prices in SF. The staff in the Club room (especially Sergio!!) were gracious, friendly and extremely accommodating ~ loved them all. Our room was on 29th floor with stunning views both morning and evening. City noise didn't bother us, as no matter where one stays in the heart of SF, city noise is a way of life. Ample space for 4 of us in the room, very comfortable beds. Nice products in bathroom. Staff at front desk always polite, friendly, and genuine. Congierge Staff was extremely helpful and quite delightful personalities. On way to Alcatraz Tour one morning, Congierge made sure we knew our transportation options, food & beverage rules of Alcatraz, then reached in her purse and gave the 4 of us See's Candies suckers to wish us a fun day. While discussing evening and dinner options one evening with another Congierge, an impatient man behind me interrupted us and was extremely rude to her about wanting "his time". She handled it like a pro and never made me feel like I was taking too much time to discuss options with her. She was a star; only sorry now I can't recall her name ~ she deserves kudos for sure!! I had read earlier about this hotel being a block from The Tenderloin district ~ clearly nothing to worry about, so don't let that concern you. We took BART from SF airport to hotel, exited at Powell St station and were a 1/2 block, if that, from hotel. Convenience plus!! You do not need a car in the city whatsoever if you are there for sightseeing. Between F Line Muni Bus to Embarcadero and Piers, or Cable Cars, you will have all the transportation options just outside the door when staying at Parc 55. This property is worth the 5 Stars I gave it for Location, Service and Comforts in the big city of San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Realy good. good location. Close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: CarlJohanLsson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located 100m ( 2 blocks) from the center of Downtown. And is close to everything. Its located right next to a subwaystation and have the cablecars around the block. Very easy to access from the highways. Just exit from baybridge and the hotel is just in front of you. We stayed in the Club area at the top floors. Little more expensive but a great view. Also breakfast is included then selecting this club option. Only drawbacks is that they charge 50$ for Internet for a week and that parking is very expensive, 48$ per 24h. The staff are very service minded and realy nice and helpfull. The room have a very good standard and the morning view is exelent.

Reviews.Title: “Heart Of The City!”
Reviews.Author: mymothersbuttons
Reviews.Content: The Parc is the perfect location for shopping and the views of the city are incredible. Service was top notch. Only complaint would be that the beds were not as comfortable as they should be for an upscale hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kevin C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked in for a weekend following my conference at a different SF hotel. It was a rare weekend away for us from our typical routine of errands and kids activities. The hotel lobby had a very nice modern decor with a connected restaurant/bar lounge that was also trendy and inviting. The staff was courteous and friendly. We then checked into our room and found it spacious and nicely furnished. We were on a higher floor and had a nice city view. The hotel is in a great location close to Union Square for shopping and walk-able to the many great restaurants nearby. Being from the LA area, my wife and I really enjoyed walking everywhere and burning off dinner calories for a change. I was pleased with the price of the room. I originally booked our room via Kayak, but later found that the hotel AAA rate was even better. We've stayed at many hotels in SF but we'll gladly come back to Parc 55!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular view!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer G
Reviews.Content: First of all, the staff was very welcoming, each and every time we entered the hotel or public areas making us feel very relaxed and comfortable. Staying on the Club level afforded an easy breakfast and great lounge to relax in the evening before bed. I was here for leisure travel and it was a great central location to stay with spectacular views of the city and bay. Steps away is Union Square, BART, and cable car line. I thought the stay was a great value for its location and quality of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: MarilynH12346
Reviews.Content: Loved the property and the location and the friendly help! Special thanks to Andre at the front desk!! Kevin the dorr man greeted us so heartily that it felt like we were family. It was beautiful and clean and spacious and the price was great for al we got.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay as usual”
Reviews.Author: rexcab
Reviews.Content: Great location near Union Square, Muni/BART Train Stations. Well maintained facility and room. I usually stay on the higher floors so the street noise does not affect my sleep too much. I also ate dinner at the CityHouse restaurant at the hotel and enjoyed my meal. This is my first choice for hotels when I have to go SF.

Reviews.Title: “High Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Cyrus R
Reviews.Content: I was automatically booked for this hotel under priceline and thought many things because it was a 4 star hotel... My stay was booked and I knew my parking charge was going to be high because i knew i had a truck and trailer with me for a local car show. I knew would be paying close to 100 dollars. Well the hotel knew my situation and of course exposed and it first claimed 175 dollars a night! Of course i was lucky and had a friend call in and she was quoted over the phone 65 dollars a night, so whoever is reading this please call ahead and make sure you get quote and name if you have any questions about parking.. When i got to the counter to check in, I asked the lady for a King Size Bed and she first said she didnt have and checked again and said she has one but its for the handicapped, meaning the bathroom setup is a little lower than usual.. I had another option of taking a room with 2 double beds.. Not a great situation to be setup with for a 4 star hotel.. Overall the room was okay, not 4 star. I choose the Kings Size bed and it was really nice and the TV was HD and decent size. Location was awesome, right on union square and the valet was very nice, but the bathroom and overall setup was not that great.. I probably would not stay at this place again unless it was a killer deal. You can find better rated parking a couple blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “You have to stay at this Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: William S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay at the Parc 55 Wyndham Hotel 12 to 15 times a year and each time when we arrive to when we leave the staff treats us like were at home. the staff is wonderful, caring, helpful and very professional. Oh, you should see the views of San Francisco down town area. It's beautiful! This Hotel is close to Union Square the heart of San Francisco for shopping, restaurants, bars, cable cars and entertainment. Stay at this Hotel and you will have a great time. This is also important, the rooms and the hotel are very clean. Rooms are good to great in size. Wonderful ! Wonderful ! Wonderful ! Time at this hotel. My wife and I cant wait to get back. William Skelton Santa Rosa, CA.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for Convention Business.”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean accommodations. Within an easy walk of the Moscone Convention Center for my business trip. Also nice location to explore San Francisco with its proximity to the shopping district as well as transportation with the hotel near the Powell Street Trolley stop and BART.

Reviews.Title: “Great property - Just a few pointers”
Reviews.Author: mwm308
Reviews.Content: This property is excellent and in the best spot possible. The hotel is basically at the intersection of Market and 4th-5th street. It is right outside of the entry location for the cable car. The hotel has an awkward entrance. When you enter the hotel you are on the ground floor where only a bell hop station is located. You have to go upstairs to the second floor to registration. If you have luggage, it's easier to go around the corner and use the elevators to get upstairs verses using the escalators. The only complaint is that the hotel doesn't have a door man to offer assistance when you arrive. I stayed in a Club Room King which puts you on the upper floors and gives you access to a club lounge. The views from the upper rooms are worth the extra money. I stayed in a corner room on the 31st floor that gives you a front and side window. If you can book room 3107 you won't be disappointed. The onsite work out room is well equipped with a lot of machines and free weights. There is a Starbucks on site as well as a roomy restaurant and a side bar. The food was good and the Martinis were excellent. When you rent a club room, you get a continental breakfast every day in the private lounge on the 31st floor. Sunday through Thursday the club room offers a full highline bar, hor'devours and desert from 6pm until 10:00pm. This is worth it. As for the hotel room, it is updated with marble and wonderful beds and coverings. The bathrooms are well appointed and a nice size. I would like to see more pressure from the shower. I was really impressed that as busy as the hotel was, the elevators were always available and quick even while staying on the top floor. A few pointers. Attached to the hotel right outside the door is a coffee and donut shop when the lines at Starbucks are to long. Internet is pricey at $14.05 per day, but you can purchase a weeks pass for $49.00. Bottom line is that this hotel was worth the money. It's great for a holiday location and doing business at the Moscone Convention Center. You are within walking distance to everything in the Union Square. Everything else is accessible through the Cable Cars and trains.

Reviews.Title: “If they would only better insulate the windows to filter out noise...”
Reviews.Author: EasyGoingTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 is in a great location, with helpful reception and concierge staff, ample and immaculate room and bathroom, very comfortable beds, and all for a good value in the Union Square area. However, even asking for a higher floor room (weekend of 2/11/12), you could hear every little thing from the street level. I did have a corner room with lots of windows and a great view but they need to consider upgrading to double pane windows and/or better noise insulation so one can get to sleep a bit easier in those very nice beds. Had it not been for this noise factor, the rating for this property would be very good or excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Weekender with the mrs and 2 baby girls”
Reviews.Author: Alwaysonther0ad
Reviews.Content: Great location to town square, clean fresh and remodeled. Late night front desk staff were fantastic! I stayed at property 5 years ago for work and was less than impressed. Great remodel changes - I/we will be back..

Reviews.Title: “Location! Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Billscottvb
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 is steps from Bart,cable cars and the best shopping. Good value can be found online With club level rooms which include great view, free Internet and the executive club lounge with an outstanding breakfast, appetizers, and deserts. Best of all Mario in the lounge makes for interesting local information. He made my day. Thank you Mario!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel H
Reviews.Content: My assistant booked a last minute business trip to San Francisco for me here and I was a little concerned. No need to worry though - Hotel was excellent! Stylish, comfortable, well located, nice bar/restaurant and a GREAT value! Room was a good size and very clean and comfortable.One negative - the valet parking situation on weekday mornings is utterly chaotic. It took about 30 minutes to get our car even though we had called down beforehand. Just plan in enough time - all in all a very nice choice in S.F.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Hotel is modern decor, Street noise very loud, no hot water in the mornings”
Reviews.Author: Mark K
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely overall but does have some flaws and if you can overlook the negative things I am going to state then you will not be disappointed. 1st the POSITIVE items: If Wyndham member the hotel takes off the wireless charge at the end of your stay - make sure to give your Wyndham number and verify this deduction! Room is large - two beds and still room to walk around without bumping into the beds or furniture. Beds were very comfortable and quality sheets. Staff are very friendly and helpful! Did not eat at the hotel so can not comment on the food. The hotel has an adequate work out facility standard machines (no sauna/hot tub etc) but it is complimentary and open 24 hours. Hotel is easy walking distance to Union Square, shops, trolley and to the convention. Now the NEGATIVE items: Stayed on the 14th floor facing the North: We would get up each morning between 6 am - 8 am and there was never any hot water for a shower. The water was so cold (even turning straight hot water and letting it run for over 5 minutes and still no change - the water stayed cold) We learned to take our showers at night! Very noisy, in fact (thank goodness) the hotel provides ear plugs by the complimentary items in the bathroom. Needless to say after the first night we were using the ear plugs because of all the noise (for example there is a popular pub down the street and about 3 am they are dumping their bottles out usually 3-5 times and by the sound they have to be using those huge 33+ gallon trash cans). So if Parc 55 Wyndham hotel's price is reasonable and you know the negatives that I stated above then by all means stay there!
