If you have to have a hot shower in the morning, can not sleep with ear plugs, need a high end modern work out facility then I would stay somewhere else. In case you are wondering we do go to San Francisco frequently and we never had this noise problem with other hotels nor the hot water issue. Hope this review helps you make your decision!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very comfortable, clean and had a great contemporary feel. It is in a great location in union square and across the street from Bart. The food in their restaurant was excellent as well!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent SF Getaway”
Reviews.Author: rcommins
Reviews.Content: We live in the Bay Area, but every so often enjoy spending the weekend up in San Francisco. When we do, we always stay at the Parc 55. The hotel is very nice and has a modern edge to it that we like a lot. The staff is very professional and kind. When you book your room, try to get a high floor - the views are tremendous - especially facing east. The hotel is close to many of our favorite restaurants and shopping spots. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place good location”
Reviews.Author: AsfordbyVillagefolk
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying for one night in the Parc 55. If we ever go back to San Francisco we would certainly look into staying there again. Having read a previous review I asked ahead if we could get a high room with a bay view. We didnt quite get the bay view but it was a high room with a great view nevertheless. The room was excellent, everything we needed, the room amenities were good, large screen TV compfy beds. The reception staff were polite and helpfull. All in all a nice place to stay when in San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Absolutely horendous Valet parking fee!”
Reviews.Author: Kimfrost1980
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a short stay here, from January 27th - January 29th. Getting to the hotel is very easy from the airport and it's on a corner, so access is good. The location is unbeatable, right in the middle of everything. I booked this hotel via Expedia Unpublished Rates - So I didn't know, I got the Parc 55 until I had actually paid it and I was pleasantly surprised it got to be the Wyndham. Check-in was extremely fast and very nice, attentive staff at the front desk. I noticed the Valet sign at curbside when we pulled up - $50 for Valet! I have stayed at many 5 star Deluxe hotels- and resorts around the States and never have I had to pay a ridiculous $50 pr. night for Valet at a presumably 4 star hotel - That ain't right! The room was in very good condition, slightly dark and late 70'ish. Nice big flat screen Full HD TV, very comfortable beds (two queens) and the bathroom was nice, good water preassure even on the 24th floor - YES 24th floor and the view was to die for, literally, hit the street at that height, you're a goner. ;) No joking aside, when I asked the lady to give us a view, she certainly did. The entire skyline of San Francisco with the bay behind opened up in-front of us. Truly spectacular. We only had breakfast at the lobby restaurant one time; needless to say, this was very good. We had a la carte, didn't go for the buffet and it was very good, inexpensive and the coffee was very nice, good beans and freshly ground. Croissants were very tasty, bagels amazingly soft inside and a little "crust" on the outside. Jam was world-class stuff. It was a simple breakfast, but boy did it taste good. The cinnamon rolls; THE best. Pros: Free business center with computers and a printer, the small gift shop, SWIFT elevators, SWIFT Valet apart from the pricetag, the VIEWS from the room, breakfast. Cons: A LOT of homeless people just outside the hotel and even some inside the hotel on the ground floor, of course the $50 Valet, slightly late 70'ish look (rusty, gold, beige colours) ain't working so well in 2012. To many "weird" looking fellas hanging out outside the entrance by the cars, thought that was so strange. If you can hit it via Expedia Unpublished Rates, do it. Otherwise go to the Grand Hyatt or Four Seasons. Almost same price if booked as a named hotel and roughly $18 less in Valet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly415
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels while in San Francisco and decided to give the Parc 55 a try after a friends recommendation... and I'm glad I did! The location was central, check-in was quick and friendly, and I actually found my room quite quiet, being so close to Market and Powell Streets! The property and room was extremely clean, and I was fortunate to be in corner room which has a spacious bathroom. I will definitely consider the Parc 55 on my next visit to San Francisco. Kelly

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: Speckypilot
Reviews.Content: It is located next to Powell BART Station which connects directly to San Francisco Airport. It is also right next to the Cable Car station where one can experience a SF Cable Car ride to the Fishermen's Wharf. Within walking distance, Apple Store, Macy's and Westfield Departmental Stores, Bloomingdales, Saks Fifth Avenue, Union Square and The Cheesecake Factory! Nice bed, spacious room, shower with good pressure and temperature control. Front desk could be a little more friendly and efficient. Long queues can often be found at check in/out counters even if you just want to borrow an umbrella. Sirens from the streets could sometimes be heard probably due to its proximity to a Fire Department or Police Station, or is it just common throughout SF city? Homeless people could be found roaming around near Carl's Jr. Hamburgers fastfood joint right across the street from the hotel main entrance. Best not to go there at odd hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great romantic night in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: linda_ski
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we stayed at the Parc 55 and loved it. Elegant, safe, cozy, and great location. We celebrated Valentines Day a bit early and rekindled our relationship. The room we were given on the 23rd floor had windows on two walls which gave us a spectacular city view! The room was quiet even though there was a busy city down on the ground floor. Everything was perfect until we went to get our car. At checkout time everyone is waiting for the valets. We had to wait 1/2 hour in the chilly breezeway till our car arrived. Next time, and there will be a next time, we will call down to have our car brought around!!! Heed the warning, but don't hesitate to check this cool place out!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Woodstock1968
Reviews.Content: My company booked me at this hotel. I had not stayed there previously and didn't know what to expect. The room was nice/standard. They had a nice size fitness center and business center. My main negative was that the cost of the breakfast buffet for 2 was over $55!

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 we found all facilities to enjoy San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Jessica E
Reviews.Content: 2 weeks ago, I went to San Francisco with my chillaren and staying at Parc 55 was my first smart move. The location is perfect to enjoy all city. The cable car stop is only a few steps and Market street is perfectly connected to visit all zones. Muni, metro, bart,all in same avenue. We could enjoy all locations, piers, golden gate, museums easily and return safely for shopping and dinner in the Union Square zone where the hotel is located. Later to a nice, warm and clean room with a helpful staff to recharge bateries for next day. I would highly recommend it and of course we want to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “San Fran Perfection!!”
Reviews.Author: mindisue13
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stay here every time we are in San Francisco. The location of the hotel alone sold me. Upon arrival you travel to the second floor for check in. There has never been a wait to check in, and we have stayed here three times. Rooms on the upper floors give great views of the city surrounding. The room is well situated with a couch in the large window, attractive decor, and comfortable bed. You can hear city noise, but it is in the middle of a busy area. Walk around the corner of the hotel and you are in Union Square. It is the best place for shopping. It has everything from Tiffanys to small boutique stores. It is also within a 15 minute walk to China town.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: AnnieC_11
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel based on the reviews of other Tripadvisor reviewers and wasn't disappointed. It's a perfect base for exploring SF as you are so centrally located it's easy to get around. All forms of transport are easily accessible and within a short stroll from the Hotel. You can get to Fisherman's Wharf easily from Union Square. Most of the major shops are on your doorstep, so you don't have far to deposit your shopping bags. I even had to buy another suitcase and I was still overweight at check-in!! I had a room on the 18th floor which had fantastic views. The bed was nice and comfortable and had lovely fresh white linen. The bathroom was quite large, spotlessly clean with lots of lovely white towels. The reception lady on checking in was very courteous and friendly. As others have mentioned - you can hear street noise below, but that's city life for you. The Hotel have very helpfully provided ear plugs which worked like a treat for light sleepers like myself. I did not try the Restaurant as there were so many other options in Union Square and I was only there for 3 nights. The Airport Shuttle bus, stops outside the hotel several times a day and you do not have to pre-book it. I left on Superbowl Sunday and was slightly concerned that the city would come to a standstill and the shuttle bus would be delayed. This did not happen and I made the airport in plenty of time. I found the Hotel lived up to the positive reviews on TA and I would definitely return. Another thing I would highly recommend, is purchasing a travel "passport". This pass allows you unlimited travel on the cable cars, trolley cars, buses and BART. The scenic trolley cars (the ones with outside seating) are $6 per trip one way. So getting the passport is extremely good value for money, in my opinion. However, if you have no plans to leave Union Square - don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the heart of town”
Reviews.Author: jasreenmayal
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to visit SF and my family was flying in from all over the world to meet here. My brother booked us into Parc 55 and the hotel was just what we needed. The rooms were speacious and had a lovely view. The hotel has a stylish bar downstairs which was cool to enjoy a drink at. All the basics were well taken care of and our stay was very comfi. The hotel had a fab book about SF in every room and we used this to find some fantastic places to eat! The location was absolutely super right in union square close to all the bars, restaurants and shops so we walked around a lot. Parking was a little expensive though. Breakfast was okay, some of us chose to grab a bite in one of the cafes in union square. Concierge was helpful. Overall, a good place to stay if your intention is spend the entire day out and about exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great SF Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Loriwhitlow
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 is very centrally located! Rooms are a decent size with views from many! Loved this easy hotel with great sheets!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but really pricey parking!”
Reviews.Author: crayolagal
Reviews.Content: We loved our room during our 3-night stay in Parc 55. The hotel had a great lobby and service, our room was beautiful too. Ultimately, this hotel has wonderful location, being right smack in the middle of union square. If you're into shopping, the shops are minutes away! :) it was a great place to stay after a long flight from Singapore and being jet lagged, it was just nice being able to explore a little..then walk back to our room to rest a bit. The not-so-great parts..well gotta agree with everyone else on the forum. The parking of $55/day was horrendous and if you're unfamiliar with the area (and the left hand drive for us), the safest option was really to go for the crazy rate. And yes, bring your own water too.. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service.”
Reviews.Author: jdubs1175
Reviews.Content: I have to say right off the bat that my wonderful experience was largely in part due to Andre at the front desk. I checked-in with him and he was delightful to talk to. He knew I was staying at the Parc 55 all week for business and put me up in a corner king room (#2073). I was told that this room was very nice and had an amazing view and it did. The room was spacious and the view was amazing. After a long day, being able to relax and take in this view of the city was awesome. Thank you Andre! The room was nice and clean. The bed was comfy. I would have appreciated a little more storage space for my clothing items since I was staying all week but I made due. Room service was ordered one night and the food was mediocre at best but the service staff was a delight to interact with. I called for a wake up call and was in the shower and was not able to get to the phone...staff was knocking at my door to make sure I was up and that nothing had happened to me. How great is that? Overall I was very pleased with my stay here. The location is great and as I said, the service was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: beckybass306
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights and it was perfect for me. Very central, modern, clean and helpful staff. Andre at registration was especially helpful - I asked for a room with a view and I certainly got one! 24th floor corner room was fabulous. Only small criticism was that it was a bit noisy (from outside) but that is hard to avoid in such a busy, convenient downtown location. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Not great rooms.”
Reviews.Author: mmoc65
Reviews.Content: This is a friendly hotel in a good location but the rooms aren't that nice and the beds are hard. The bathroom was rather stark. The view was terrific but for a boutique hotel it wasn't that boutiquey.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: clserranoc
Reviews.Content: My first stay in SF was absolutely excellent thanks to Parc 55. The hotel's very clean, lovely lobby, the rooms are amazing. We had room 2418 and the view to the city was incredible. Definitely breathtaking. The receptionist was very welcoming, and the staff overall was very nice. Rooms and bathroom are spacious, and the location was wonderful. It was right on Union square, close to everything. The price was very good compared to other hotels that were much more expensive, and once being in SF, we walked in front of them and none looked like Parc 55. I will definitely come here on my next visit to SF. Really, really good. The valet is a little expensive, but we parked at the Sutter Stockton garage, which was cheaper, and you get to walk the wonderful streets of San Francisco for about 8 minutes before you get to the garage. It's really close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for any shopoholic!”
Reviews.Author: KlaudiaC
Reviews.Content: We only had one night in San Fran as we headed out to Napa the following day. We chose the Parc as we wanted to be central with easy BART access. we stayed near the ferry building last time so this time we wanted to explore union square and sourroundings a bit more. Location is fantastic, we even strolled easily back to the ferry building for dinner (20 min) as it was a beau I'll evening . For less mobile or tired there were so many other options via tram, Bart taxi etc which took only a few minutes. The room we had was amazing, big bathtub, floor to ceiling windows overlooking the city, huge king with great pillows and duvet . The lovely Roxanne at the front desk upon finding ou it was our honeymoon gave us a lovely free upgrade which made the stay even more memorable . The only surprise was that inspite being on one of the top floors , we still could slightly hear the city below . Usually we prefer or try to stay in more boutique hotels not in the big boys as we don't like feeling like just a number . But this hotel sure made us feel special .

Reviews.Title: “Close to excellent”
Reviews.Author: travlmaestro
Reviews.Content: Great location, decent price ( at least for San Francisco), nice clean room, ask for an upgrade to higher floors. We did and they threw in breakfast at the club floor (34 th floor) as well! Parking is at usd48+ 15pct tax but it's for 24 hours with in and out. If you just want to park your car without needing it for the next 24 hours, there a public parking garage right at the back next block ( behind parc 55, it's nikko hotel, when you are facing nikos front door, to the right. You will be able to see it down the next block. It's only 25 nett for 24 hour parking!. Before I forget, the guys at the club floor are fantastic! They'll help you with almost everything that they can! One of them, SERGIO. Thx. Salute.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Night”
Reviews.Author: T D
Reviews.Content: Only staying one night in SF so we thought we would give Parc 55 another go (last time was excellent, but we like to change up hotels for fun). I called and made reservations direct with them. It was an extremely great rate, but was for two double beds when we would have liked a queen or king. Got to the hotel and CHRISTINA at the front desk checked us in. I asked if they had the possibility of changing our room to a queen or king. She did it for no charge and on top of that got us a corner room which was perfect with full wall length windows all around. The location is great because it is slightly off all the busy streets but is central to Union Square, Market St., Trolley Cars and BART. Had drinks at the bar which is very nice and went out that evening. Hotel is clean, modern and great service. Only downside would be that parking there is very expensive, but you could always park in a public garage not far away. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Hardly A 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: Furnman61
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in union square, however room decor was only fair, business center was out of order and beware of parking fee over 50.00 with tax. Ill pick the Hyatt next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service...”
Reviews.Author: Gattogattogod
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good, besides a few minor mistype due to other guest on my floor, but where the hotel really stood out was with its great customer. I directly worked with Jeen, and Ericka abd due to them I will be staying at the 55 everytime I'm in town

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: Jsanzone23
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend on a little getaway with th family (6 year old and 10 month old). Hotel was a great value for the weekend with their rate of $111 on their winter escape plan per night even for the weekend! It is San Fran and that does come with some pitfalls such as the $48 plus an extra $10 if you have an SUV to park the car overnight in valet. The hotel staff was super helpful and it was the most painless check in to a hotel that I have had in some time. Rooms were not huge but enough to be comfortable in. Would gladly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Oh Aunty Em...”
Reviews.Author: FranklySpeaking53
Reviews.Content: My son went away to school in San Francisco. For the last 5 years, my husband and I have stayed at the Parc 55. It's a great location. The best shopping, restaurants and walking distance to my son's apartment. When we get there, we always feel so comfortable. The surrounding area is safe, busy yet quiet. There is also a great restaurant on the premises on the second floor. And great food - everywhere - right outside the door of the hotel. Bring some good walking shoes and you're ready to go.... The views are to die for; and the service is just a phone call away. The staff is so friendly and although I like to recognize any employee that goes out of their way, the best thing about this hotel, is they are all so accomodating. I used to travel on business to SF and have relatives there for years, but when I found this hotel, I stopped looking for any others. Between the staff, the location and the hotel itself, I didn't need to look any further...

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: Mandas76
Reviews.Content: The accommodations were excellent as a four star hotel should be,but what really impressed us was the outstanding customer service we received when we first arrived thanks to Andre. Andre, greeted us and was warm, friendly, knowledgeable about the area and helped us get a spacious room on the top floor with views of the entire city. Thanks, Andre

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nahed1
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel walking distance to all the fun places to visit...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in downtown SF”
Reviews.Author: Pstiger
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on business. Hotel and room exceeded my expectations especially for the price. Would absolutely stay again for business or pleasure next time on the city.

Reviews.Title: “Bleach, cheap wine, bad service and harassing maids.”
Reviews.Author: colorblind123
Reviews.Content: We will not be back. We reserved a room with a king bed. On check in we were told "you get a room with two doubles". No I am sorry. No nothing. Basically just rude. This was just the start of a miserable one night stay. After check in we spotted what looked like a cool open floor plan and comfortable bar / lounge. We decIded to stop in for a night cap. We both ordered a glass of wine. Granted "by the glass" wine is not going to be opus one, but I think box wine from Costco would have been much better than the skunk p.... We were served. Anyway on top of that both our glasses smelled strongly of bleach. We signed the check , left the wine, and went to bed. Some battles are not worth fighting. Anyway - in the morning we ordered room service. I ordered pan cakes. My wife ordered oatmeal with fresh berries. The berries were mushy and to boot moldy. And the coffee tastes like it was made a week prior. Anyway - as if that was not enough, the rooms were not fresh and smelled of body odor. And finally at 822 am maid began pounding on our door. I answered to a barrage of questions 1) when you leaving? 2) what time can we come in. 3) what time will room be empty blah blah blah. Anyway that is it. There are many better options in sf: taj campton, ritz, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Alvin C
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here for a wedding anniversary and birthday with my wife. Great location off Market Street, and an easy jump-off point to any part of San Francisco. Rooms are well-maintained and clean. Staff is very friendly, courteous and willing to help as they can with any ask. For an overnight stay, I typically look here first and find competitive rates. I'll likely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Parc 55 was exceptional. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left and all points in between, the staff went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. Ericka at the front desk greeted us warmly and did all that she could to make us feel special. The hotel's location is perfect, walking distance to many resturants, Union Square, Chinatown, galleries, etc. The starting point for the primary cable car lines are only a block away. The accommodations met our expectations but the friendly staff exceeded our expectations over and over again. Sergio and Yolanda at the Club 55 Lounge were so kind and attentive. We had an opportunity to visit with them as we enjoyed a drink overlooking the city. They took a sincere interest in our personal life and made us feel more like friends than customers. Even as we were checking out, Roxanne was warm and pleasant. We went to San Francisco to celebrate our 30th wedding anneversary . We wanted something really special and we weren't dissappointed. We would stay there again and we strongly recommend the Parc 55 Mr. and Mrs. Martinez.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: mamabanunu
Reviews.Content: Have been at the hotel for 10 days and just extended for another four! As a continuation of the great service extended by the staff, Andre went out of his way to ensure that I could continue to enjoy my Club room. Appreciate the extra effort as the hotel is very full. The location is ideal. Just about everything is within walking distance. The Club Lounge has become a stopping off point each day. A chance to kick back, enjoy the fantastic view and appetizer of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: bob w
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in San Francisco. Suite was great and views very good. The breakfast in the AM on the club level was better than most and helped us enjoy our time there. Location near Union Square was perfect. There was good energy in the bar and common areas. We walked to our event on the Embarcadero and found the central location in SF quite good. We found good restraunts in the area too. Staff friendly and helpful. Used valet parking; also very prompt. Definitely our overnight spot in the city from now on.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back soon!”
Reviews.Author: RDT_UCLA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 over the weekend of January 27-29, treating myself to a weekend in the city to unwind after working night and day for the past 3 months, and how you are treated upon arrival sets the stage for how you perceive your entire stay. Andre at the front desk has the perfect mix of professionalism and friendliness that can't be taught. It's a gift you either have or you don't, and despite my telling him any room was fine, he went out of his way to find me a great room that allowed me to relax and enjoy a panoramic view that made me not want to leave the room! He did joke that I was not allowed to work, and being a man of my word, I didn't. I turned off my work email (something I hadn't planned on doing), focused on enjoying my stay, and it was just what the doctor ordered. Between getting ultra-relaxed and the ultra-comfortable bed, I got the best night's sleep I have had in months on Friday night. Seriously. I've stayed at many nice hotels in San Francisco over the years and have my favorites, but I think the Parc 55 will become my new "home" hotel in San Francisco. The location is unbeatable, the rooms are modern, well maintained and spotless, the bed was incredibly comfortable, the wireless Internet was speedy and reliable, and the staff is excellent. And despite being a 32 story hotel with over 1,000 rooms, it doesn't have that sterile, huge chain hotel feel. I don't know what more one could ask for. I enjoyed my stay so much that I decided to do it more often. I have already made a reservation for next month and - and looking forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Mteast
Reviews.Content: My extended family and I met in San Francisco in Jan. and stayed at the Parc 55 on a holiday special rate. We expected small rooms with bad views at that rate, but we're pleasantly surprised to have wonderfully furnished upper level rooms with great views. The entire hotel is well cared for and clean, clean, clean. This is a great place to stay in SF!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TotalOfFive
Reviews.Content: Great location for walking the city, sightseeing, shopping, and taking public transportation. I booked on the hotel's website and they have a great feature: you can opt to get an upgraded room at time of check in (if they have one available) for only an extra $12. If they don't have one when you check in then you don't pay the $12. We got an upgraded room with a huge view on an upper floor. Fabulous concept, be sure to look into it. The noise from the street does seep in but the hotel provides earplugs so at least they aren't pretending that the noise level doesn't exist - honestly is always the best policy. The trip from the airport is $8.10 on BART and you exit at the Powell Street station and walk about 50 yards to the hotel. It's across the street from the huge mall with Bloomingdale's and Norstrom. It is at the intersection of Powell and Market streets and is close to Nob Hill, the museum of modern art, and other sites. It was about a 25 minute walk to the Embaradaro(sp) Center and piers.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Ty D
Reviews.Content: The front desk service is amazing. They are very helpful and accomodatiing. Ask for Roxanne, she made me feel at home right way! Thanks Parc 55. I'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kristin M
Reviews.Content: The business stay I had at the Parc 55 was a great experience. The hotel staff was extremely helpful. The hotel accommodations were among the best I have ever seen! I will stay at this hotel again, especially when I visit for vacation. I would recommend this hotel to everyone looking to visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “perfect city hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: MMK49
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Parc 55 Wyndham with high expefctations since the Wyndham hotels have become my gold standard hotel. I was not disappointed. Besides the beautiful enterance, the quick valet service (the price is on par with similar hotels in the area), and the perfect location in San Francisco, the real treat of this hotel is the customer service. The beds at renovated Wyndham hotels are by far the most comfortable of any hotel, and with the bath and body works products in the bathrooms, any stay has a 5 star feel. I have come to expect this from all my stays at Wyndham hotels. What made this trip extra special was the customer service by guest manager Brett Leonard. He went absolutely above and beyond to make our short trip our most memorable. Our entire party was upgraded to the most luxurious suite I have ever seen, and we were given complementary access to the club room for a delicious breakfast buffet. He was so friendly and made us feel welcome and relaxed after a 6 hour drive to reach his hotel. I do not imagine a more professional or personable staff member can be found at any hotel. Minor issues which were encountered during our stay (very loud partying teenagers in the room next door) were taken care of swiftly and courteously by security and after a little mix up with room service, we were able to enjoy one of the best nights sleep at a hotel. If you are ever in san francisco, this is the place to stay. You cannot find better service or a better location!

Reviews.Title: “Nice remodel upgrades, comfortable room, good value”
Reviews.Author: reywalwen h
Reviews.Content: People, especially Andre, are great, very helpful - attentive! I've stayed here many times over the years and the property is definitely on the upswing after several years of being only "ok."

Reviews.Title: “This is a great location and a nice hotel, Good value.”
Reviews.Author: mountainportal
Reviews.Content: A modern high rise building. It is a great location in heart of Union Square and they run specials. It is a great value compared to nearby hotels. A lot of international airline crews stay here. Some web booking sites call this a 4 1/2 star or 4 star.I do not know where they are coming from, but I would call it a solid 3 1/2 star. The rooms are big and clean but this place is showing a bit of wear since it's last remodel. This is especially true in the bath and showers. Check in and check out is strangely slow so be prepared if you need to check out in person and are in a hurry, allow time. The staff are very nice and attentive. The $15 per day charge for internet in a business setting, this in the world of free wifi in most hotels is a bit strange and annoying, but maybe they will get over this. All, in all it is a good value in an area of much pricier properties.

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 Wyndham San Francisco - Great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Mapleleafr
Reviews.Content: Located by Union Square this is an ideal location for business or pleasure. I happen to be on business and my wife accompanied me (to shop .. of course) we walked to all venues daily including Moscone Center. The hotel is steps away from MUNI buses , cable cars on Powell St and awesome shopping up and down Market Street including Westfield San Francisco Center - A huge Mall indeed. You can get to Fisherman's Wharf or the Golden Gate bridge very easily. Invest in a MUNI Passport for a multi-day transit pass and enjoy the rides all over the San Francisco area - BART is not included on this pass. I also recommend a trip to Alcatraz for $26/each. Don't pay anymore than that in "service fees". Check pricing online and book early for your preferred day and departure time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beebs54
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location in Union Square. We were very impressed. Close to trolley line, San Francisco Center, Macy's etc. We got a really great deal on this hotel and the rooms are very clean and the staff was very helpful. I recommend this hotel. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay, awesome customer service”
Reviews.Author: Mary S
Reviews.Content: Hotel was everything we hoped it would be. Great location, comfortable spacious room, helpful and friendly staff and good view of the San Francisco skyscrapers. We stayed two nights and were very pleased, but when our flight was cancelled due to weather issues, Parc 55 was there to provide two more days lodging for us at a reasonable rate with no more notice than a phone call from us from the Oakland airport. Within an hour we were welcomed backed with Sara at the front desk providing us with everything we needed to make our continued stay comfortable. Yes, we will be back to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “They do a good job”
Reviews.Author: GMKR
Reviews.Content: Great location. Not so far south on Market as to be gross. Not so close to the Financial District as to be just business. Not so close to Union Square as to be touristy. A mix of tourist, business, and convention; and domestic and international visitors. Nice decor. The rooms were in pretty good shape. Friendly staff. Have stayed here a few times over the years and it's a preferred hotel in the city for me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel & friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: 10062011c
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located by Union Square (walking distance), is clean/safe, with friendly staff, and offers a nice bar with a decent view. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Fernando G
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay in San Francisco about 30 days a year on business and pleasure. My wife loves the location of the Parc55 over many other more high end hotels that require a walk up hill after shopping. We enjoy the friendly staff that always greet us by name from Sara and Christina at the front desk to Arman at valet service to Sergio at the club level lounge. The price is always very good and at times you can find extremely good deals on room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for everything”
Reviews.Author: lbloliveoil
Reviews.Content: Great time, very nice lounge area for meeting. Nice rrooms, best is the location

Reviews.Title: “Christmas shopping in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: cindy1753
Reviews.Content: Every December my daughter and I go to San Francisco for our annual Christmas shopping trip and stay at Parc 55. It's a very easy walk from BART to the hotel. We always have a wonderful experience and love to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Diego1
Reviews.Content: This was a great experience all around. I would certainly recommend this place to colleagues and family. If your in SF and want nice views and great service this is the place to go. Keep up the good work Parc55! Thanks again for a good stay. Dirgo

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Excellent location Good value”
Reviews.Author: bobnmarians
Reviews.Content: Take the shared shuttle from the airport. Eat breakfast at Mo'z 1 1/2 blocks away. Try the New Delhi restaurant if you like Indian food. Cable cars and public transportation close by.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Jonvespa
Reviews.Content: had a great stay, good location for union square and shopping.....staff were nice. would stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Visit on a Rainy Weekend”
Reviews.Author: DallasGuest
Reviews.Content: Last minute trip to SF and had no idea where to stay or what to do. Checked out several hotels in the Union Square area and selected Parc 55 for the wonderful service Ana V. gave us when we arrived to inquire about rooms. The entire staff from Doorman to Concierge was friendly and professional. Ana assisted us in the hotel features and what was close by as well as answered all our questions about the city. She won us over. Thank you Ana, my partner and I truly enjoyed our first visit to the city and will return to Parc 55. The hotel and room was everything you said it would be. Thank you !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice - but way expensive!”
Reviews.Author: bjr11
Reviews.Content: I was here for one night on January 12th for business. It was clean, nice enough, gym was good and room service was fine. A bit noisy outside my room down on the street all night long. But was it worth the nearly $500 bill for the one night? Probably not. I realize it's San Francisco and was a busy time, but still - Wow! I had to stay there for business reasons, glad it wasn't out of my own pocket!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mszozobra
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a good size, clean and the hotel is in a great location to do all the downtown things, shopping, cable cars, the works. Our room was on the 25th floor, so we have a very quiet night. The bed was VERY comfy. The parking is pricey, but that goes with the territory. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: Tanyandjord
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here in October as participants of the Nike womens Marathon. The hotel was very central to anything that you may want. The rooms were very clean and nice. You walk across the street a block or two to the cable cars and a great shopping!! We were so pleased with the service and hospitality at thsi hotel. I cannot say enough about the location. We were on a higher floor which provided a lovely view of the city as well. Breakfast was quite expensive off the lobby, but worth spending a few extra bucks because it was wonderful service and great quilaity! I would stay here again if I ever make in back to SF!! Thanks for having us!

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Paul A A
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff, especially Brett at check-in, were extremely helpful, friendly and thoughtful. It is centrally located and easy walking distance to the Moscone Center, restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel and service in S.F. - Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: Jammer1
Reviews.Content: I and my significant other have now stayed twice in the last year at the Parc 55. Can't say enough how great both the accommodations and the service were on both of our visits. These were both holiday trips, including one right before Christmas when things were crazed in San Francisco, but the hotel was both an oasis of calm and an outstanding customer service experience. Rooms are very clean, modern and quiet. (Make sure you close the window vents before you crash - even up high you can get a pretty good earful of City noise if you don't do that!) Great beds, great bathrooms, my only beef is that they charge for Internet access (like most of the major hotel chains except for Residence Inn and Courtyard - in my opinion this is a goofy thing to do in the age of the Internet - like charging for cable TV access.) Lots of great places to eat near the hotel, it is literally half a block or less from the Muni and BART Station at Powell, there's a decent pastry and coffee shop just outside the hotel on the same block as Parc 55 heading towards BART, and you're only blocks from Union Square and all the shopping any human could stand. Also very close the Theatre District. Let me say it one more time - outstanding customer service. Everyone from the front desk staff to the hotel operators to the cleaning staff - everyone was great, friendly and nothing but helpful. I recommend Cafe Mason (on Mason) for excellent dining for all three meals - really a superb place to eat only 2 blocks from the hotel. Santorini just a block away walking North is great Greek food as well. There's a Starbuck's just before Santorini's, heading North. There are other excellent hotels in S.F. - of course. But this is one of the very best.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: KyleDenverCo
Reviews.Content: Attending a conference at the Intercontinental Hotel and decided to forego the "conference" rate and stay at the Parc 55 - great decision! Great room, great price only imperfect experience was no hot water one morning -which can happen but they did not handle the situation well initially but came through in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice room - great location - fair price”
Reviews.Author: MaineNick
Reviews.Content: I just spent 3 nights at this hotel. The service was excellent from the front desk to housekeeping. I admit I didn't use many of the hotel amenities, but only because my schedule and meals were in other locations. The hotel is withing walking distance of all of the Civic Center and Union Square restaurants, museums, and shopping. I look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “6 Wonderful night”
Reviews.Author: maisoncote
Reviews.Content: I was in San Francisco as every year for the Fancy food Show I usually stay at the Powell hotel in the same part of town but last year I fund a visitor in my room a big black cockroach and was just very discusted I decide to upgrade to the Wyndham and was I very satisfied a beautiful room with a great view, great service, I really enjoy my stay and will be back again

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Courtney C
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend lives in the Mission District, but we often choose to stay at Parc55 because we love being in the heart of the city and enjoy a romantic hotel stay wherever we are. This hotel has been very good to us. It truly feels like a home away from home while giving us a lot of perks. We love the rooms on the upper floors. The sweeping views are always breathtaking, no matter what direction you are facing. You might see the bay to the south, you might be staring at some of the most beautiful architecture, but it won't matter because you'll find yourself peering down at this magical city with awe. I like the layout of the hotel, the color scheme and the zen vibe. The staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. On several occasions, we chose to extend our stay (because we actually DO love staying here) and they bent over backwards to make it happen even during a "sold out" weekend. The reception level is beautiful and inviting with high ceilings, wood flooring and gorgeous orchids. Don't pass up the citrus infused water near the bar/restaurant entrance. If you want to grab a cocktail before venturing out, the bar has some great 2 for 1 deals on wine and specialty drinks. We have not tried the concierge/upgraded package yet, but plan to do so soon. When we were checking out last weekend, we noticed a different key card on our agent's desk. She explained that the tippy top floor rooms have special amenities that include breakfast and cocktails in a spectacular viewing space. I can't wait to book that package on my next trip. The only negative I can point out would be the beds. Although comfortable and elegantly dressed in fine white sheets with large Euro pillows, the mattresses aren't top of the line. You can tell that they are springy and not plush. It isn't a deal breaker though. Being near the Powell St. BART station has its pros and cons. It is lovely to go direct from SFO and be about 20 steps from your hotel, especially when toting a lot of luggage. The slight downside is dealing with people hanging around the BART entrance, both the panhandlers and the crowds of tourists buying tickets for trolley rides. It can get quite chaotic and loud, but once inside the Parc55, you don't hear the street noise below. You'll be hard pressed to avoid any unwanted street activity at most SF hotels anyway. Walk across the street to Nordstrom, their cafe is yummy with gorgeous views back toward the Parc55. Take a jaunt down Market street to the amazing Ferry building, especially on the weekend when the Farmers Market is bustling with energy from both locals and tourists. Our favorite secret find is jumping on the Sausalito or Larkspur ferry for only $5 (with a Clipper card) and boating across the water to have a reverse view of this amazing city! I have stayed at a wide range of SF hotels- from budget to luxury, but I will only choose the Parc55 from now on. It has everything I want for a wonderful San Francisco experience. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BuenosAiresRoxana
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very comfortable and clean, very nice beds for a relaxing sleep. Location was excellent, everything we needed we had near. We arrived very early in the morning after more than 20 hours of flight+airport time and the hotel staff managed to give us one of the two reserved rooms so we could "unload", get some rest and shower. Other hotels might have charged for an early check in but Parc 55 did not. Thanks Cristina!!! Also we had ordered a big amount of things, which could have been easily lost given that this is a big hotel (+1000 rooms), but all our packages were perfectly delivered, thanks Mr Sanchez!! Would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “nice location hotel very close to Union Square”
Reviews.Author: mariop79
Reviews.Content: this hotel location is very ideal its very close to the shooping area in San Francisco,if in the middle night you feel hungry just cross the road they have 24 hours burger king ready....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great views”
Reviews.Author: jackal3
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here about 3 times now. The rates are always excellent, and you can't beat being able to hop on the Bart at the airport and get off across the street from your hotel (and then hop back on the Muni and go wherever you like anytime). The shopping at Westfield Centre and Union Square is right there, and there are tons of great lunch options around. We got upgraded to a view suite this time, which was fantastic! Panoramic views all around. We'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 is a solid 4 star in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Jeff-in-Laguna
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Parc 55 several times, most recently for a quick weekend trip to the city. We are from Orange County, CA, and visit SF 5-6 times/yr. We have stayed at most of the nice hotesl in Union Sq, including the Westin St Francis, Hyatt, Parc 55, and some nearby gems like the Mark Hopkins (Nob Hill) and Palace Hotel (Off Market). The Parc 55 can definitely hang with them First, the location is a short walk to the center of Union Square. It's very close to Market street shopping, along with all the Union Sq shopping/restaurants. It's also a nice walk down market to the Ferry Bldg on a Saturday for the farmer's market. All in all, good location. The hotel is clean, well appointed rooms, and good service. We didn't eat at the hotel, but did have cocktails and appetizers in the lobby bar. Just ok on the appetizers. Not a great selection of beers on tap as well. Concierge was very good. If you don't visit the city often, this is important. You must be able to get good tips on eating places, and also areas to avoid. For example, the Tenderloin area is a short 2 blocks from the hotel. As we know the city well, we know how to avoid this area. But my wife and I often wonder how new tourists to the city fare if they mistakenly walk through this area by accident, especially in the evenings. It is a dangerous area, and one you definitely want to know about and avoid. A good concierge will do this for you, as well as guide you to great restaurants, make reservations (some of the fine hotels have connections that can get you a table that you might no be able to secure on your own), and popular attractions. We will definitely consider the Parc 55 on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 is a good choice for your SF stay”
Reviews.Author: Mangare_e_Bere
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Parc 55 Wyndam a handful of times in the past two months and have had a good experience. The hotel is conveniently located near Union Square and the Theatre District. The rooms are well-appointed, reasonably sized and relatively quiet. The only complaints that I can make is that the parking rates are ridiculous (as in all of SF) and that the front desk seems understaffed at times. This is not a dis on the people behind the desk, they are by and large very nice and very professional - it is just that I have had to wait to check in and check out for too long. All things considered this is a minor complaint. The hotel is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “smack in the middle of the city, not for the faint hearted”
Reviews.Author: cherlb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for a long weekend. It was located very close to Union square and around the corner from the main bus/trolley area. In addition, the bellman/staff are readily available to flag a cab for you if you'd like. The room was on the 27th floor and a corner. We didn't hear much noise aside from the sirens that occasionally sound in a city. We had a FANTASTIC view of the city. Ask to be situated on a corner if you can. If you are unaccustomed to city life, be prepared for an urban surrounding. There are great restaurants and major department stores located less than a block away, but there are also a good number of homeless peeps hangin about. Practice walking quickly and not making eye contact. I felt safe the entire time, but if you aren't used to it, you might be uncomfortable. We enjoyed the hotel bar. It had typical expensive prices, but the food was pretty good. We ordered a lobster cocktail - standard and prosciutto wrapped asparagus - pretty good. There are plenty of TVs and a lounge area complete with couches to sit back and relax. Overall great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it because of Brett!!”
Reviews.Author: Ilovetotravel201
Reviews.Content: It was a great location. The lobby was goregous but best of all staff was amazing. One in particular, Brett. He was so upbeat, friendly and professional. He gave us great recommendations for restaurants and places to sight see. Brett was so personable. Thank you Brett! When we are back in San Francisco again, we will be back at your hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Tracy H
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 Wyndham is a beautiful hotel right in the heart of San Francisco. My husband and I stayed for three nights in the amazing top floor suite. Brett Leonard was wonderful and we are already excited to go back. The hotel lobby really sets the tone for the entire hotel. It is elegant and contemporary. The staff is very friendly and you are very close to everything. The bart and other public transportation is a block away and while you can walk most places, the convenience is great to have as well...especially after long nights :). Thank you for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Location, a hip feel and quality service make this a great deal.”
Reviews.Author: geeman1017
Reviews.Content: We selected the hotel largely based on tripadvisor reviews - it scores well. And it did not disappoint. High scores for location, easy valet and parking, excellent and friendly front desk and concierge team and a great vibe which was unexpected for a pretty large property. Check in had a boutique feel. Lower scores for a concierge who didn't know some of the cool places around town that tripadvisor as well as some basic google searches would come up with - but very friendly. Still i think a great concierge is one of the most valuable assets to the front desk especially in a foody town like SFO. Extras are expensive. Almost $5 for a bottle of water in your room, $14 for wifi and it is per device so $28 for your laptop and phone for 24 hours. Thay's just wrong! But let's go back to location. San Francisco is a great city - and with the hills and streets some places are just naturally better starting points than others. This hotel is exactly where you would want to be. BART outside, you are right at the key point for shopping and Union Square and the trolleys are at your doorstep. As a home base and you want really (absolutely) nice sheets but happy with something fairly basic but truly well run and rather hip, this is a great place. Advice to get a higher room because of street noise was absolutely accurate. It's a buzzing part of town - so go higher. You'll love the view too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service & Most Ideal Location at Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: ddbirdLA
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 is a recently renovated, modern, more upscale hotel that has THE BEST location in Union Square if you want immediate access to all public transit options. BART and MUNI are a 1/2 block away; cable cars 1 blk. away; 2 blks. from the F-Line that takes you on a scenic route through the Financial District all the way to Fisherman's Wharf. From the Wharf, you can catch the cable cars straight back to Parc 55. I checked the hotel's website and booked directly with them and got a steal on the room rate! Always check their website for specials. Vicky (one of the hotel operators) and Mike (one of the bell hops) were extremely helpful in providing transit suggestions to get around the city most efficiently. San Francisco is a great city to see on foot, so equally important, Mike advised me of streets to steer clear of. Searching for parking around the city is extremely unpleasant, so using the MUNI or street cars is essential. Don't miss taking the N Judah MUNI train (outbound) to the Academy of Sciences at the Golden Gate Park (get off at 9th and Judah - a 20 min. ride). The Academy is an impressive planetarium, aquarium, and natural history museum all in one! Great, fun experience for the whole family. The deYoung contemporary museum is a few steps across the away. There are 32 floors at Parc 55, so ask for a nice view of the city in the upper floors. Noise is expected in such a bustling city, so an upper floor will help if you are a REALLY light sleeper. I am a light sleeper, but I didn't have a problem and I slept soundly each night. Parc 55 is a wonderful hotel, but I am most grateful for the friendly, professional, knowledgeable guidance of the staff who help make my vacation experience easy and stress-free.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: Planetary
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Parc 55. It is much-improved after the renovation. The lobby, restaurant and other public areas are stylish. The room was large and comfortable, with a great view to the north and west, including the Transamerica tower. The location is excellent, one block from the Powell BART / Muni station, two blocks from Union Square, surrounded by restaurants and shopping. Given the recent concern over bed-bugs in several US cities, we checked the bed carefully and found nothing. Wireless internet was available but cost $14/day, so if you have a 3G USB stick it will save you some money. Our only complaints are 4 minor annoyances that may have been the result of incomplete detailing after the renovation: 1) the TV cable box didn't work and required 4 technician visits to troubleshoot (ask for Allen to go straight to the best); 2) the bathroom door didn't close properly; 3) the alarm clock had no battery backup and had to be reset at least daily; and 4) one of the bedside lamps was not plugged in, and the nearest receptacle was inaccessible.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tammy t
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the hotel over the Christmas holiday and had 2 interconnecting rooms. The location of the hotel was just great, very central. We paid a little more to stay at the club level and had access to the club lounge. The breakfast selection was alright, they have starbucks coffee and a wide selection of tea, it would be perfect if there was some hot food. One of the butlers at the lounge, Mario was really helpful and friendly, he definitely made our stay at the hotel a lot more pleasant. The rooms are comfortable but do not expect 5 star furnishings, the rooms can do with a little refurbishment. Overall it was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here if you use american miles”
Reviews.Author: Gtown59
Reviews.Content: Paid in full for a night using americans miles. The hotel charged me $160(50% over the rate on their website) without giving my a bill on checkout saying my reservation was fine. Now its even more of a hassle to get it cleared up. Horrible customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RandieLynn
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything we could ask for in a hotel in San Francisco--it was a 1/2 block from BART, 1 block from the cable cars, all the very BEST shopping close by that you could ask for. We had a corner room with a wonderful view! We couldn't have asked for a nicer place to stay---and will plan on returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “Super nice desk staff!”
Reviews.Author: ExoticDave
Reviews.Content: I moved here from the noisy Sir Francis Drake hotel for my last 2 nights in San Fran. This property was farther from Union Square so wasn't so loud. I also didn't have a corner room. That helped. Being sleep deprived from being on the 6th floor at the SFD, I requested a high floor at the Parc and ended up on the 23rd. The BIG disappointment about this property is the lack of sauna. The information provided said that there was one on property. But when I wen't to sit and sweat, is was no where to be found. After calling the front desk from the house phone in the fitness center, they informed me that it had been removed when the fitness center was expended. Bummer. Instead, I went back to my room and opened my book. Aside from that, the room offered a nice view of the city, plenty of lounging furniture and space, a great bed, perfect climate control, and hot water that is one degree from steam...watch it! I would stay here again. Especially because I enjoyed a wonderful night (2) of uninterrupted sleep!!

Reviews.Title: “My staycation in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: sls1047
Reviews.Content: I just stayed 2 nights at the Parc 55. Great location! 1 block away from the amazing Westfield Mall. The parking attendant was right there as soon as I pulled up and got a bellman to take my bags. Checkin was fast and done with smiles. The lobby smelled so good! I was on the 29th floor with a wonderful view if the City. The beds are very firm! I must say I don't care to much for the room service menu, but I ate out most if the time anyway. All in all very nice, clean and quiet room!

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 good and bad”
Reviews.Author: nystyleformReno
Reviews.Content: Pro's: Booked through Expedia and halved the rate/night that was advertised. Staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. Ordered room service our first night and it was deliverd prompt and hot. Rooms are very clean and quiet...and our room was right off the elevators and we stayed there for 3 nights! BART and cable car connection right outside. Mall across the street. Con's: Hotel located on the 'line' of good neighborhood vs. bad! Literally. Cop cars park at the hotel corner to keep gang/street people from causing a rucus. So, in one way, very safe since cops hanging there 24/7! Matress quality was ridiculously poor for a 4 star hotel. We complained and the desk said they would switch out matress' for us. Instead they sent the housekeeping staff in with an inexpensive egg carton foam to put on top of the bed. Now the sheets didn't fit, so the corners kept sliding off during the night! Our room had 2 double beds, so my husband and split up and we each took a bed, to try and get some comfort to be able to sleep! (Not the best sleeping accomodation while on a vacation :( Other wise, the bed linens were nice, and a variety of pillow softness from downy soft to firm and plenty of them. TV in the room would only receive a few analog stations. National stations were being broadcast on HD, and the signal was 'broken' everytime we turned it on. Internet available in your room, but for an extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Room change given without hesitation.”
Reviews.Author: Oofie46
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline.com bidding and got it for $75 a night. We started in a great room on the 5th floor but found that if someone was on the treadmil lwe could hear them running, we requested a room change and were given it without hesitation. The location was perfect, being just around the corner from the cable cars, F-Line & buses, and if you are into shopping you can walk to all the great shops. The only down side was the cost of parking - $48 + taxes, but they were at least happy to recommend other cheaper locations.

Reviews.Title: “disapointed”
Reviews.Author: elobrux
Reviews.Content: when you spend more than 500$ for a hotel, you expect at minimum a good service, which was here the worst we could have: issue by checking, the desk agent was impolite, angry and didn't smiled at all, not only with us but she had the same behavior with other clients from the hotel (we were complaining during the waiting time, which is by the way unacceptable for a hotel in this standing (more than 30 min to have his "keys") ! we highly recommend to take the breakfast outside the hotel, which will be much cheaper what was positive: the location, the bed and the view but it's a minimum for this price !

Reviews.Title: “good location, pleasant room”
Reviews.Author: pattiorama
Reviews.Content: Nice room with modern, clean decor. Bed was comfortable and room was quiet (for San Francisco.) Lots of shopping within easy walking distance. Parking was valet and very expensive. Lots of restaurants nearby so we did not eat in the hotel. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great”
Reviews.Author: Amy B
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel a while back the rate was awesome- $120 a night. this is definitely the nicest hotel I've stayed in, obviously within my price range. I believe it was recently renovated- maybe the rate was low to attract new visitors. The hotel was in a great central location, walking distance from a lot of cool San Fran stuff, and super close to buses, trolleys, etc. Super clean, awesome location in Union Square and a good view! Would definitely stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Brett was so helpful.”
Reviews.Author: DeannaCrosby
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. It was priced fair and located centrally enough that we could walk anywhere we wanted to visit. Brett helped us and was so friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware when you Parc here!”
Reviews.Author: calman255
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the resonable rate I received at this Hotel...beautiful room with a great view and in a superb location. The only thing I can complain about is the parking charge. There is a sign at the valet desk stating a maximum charge for per day parking. When we checked out the man at the desk charged extra for what he called an oversized vehicle...close about 50% extra! I drive a Chevy Tahoe and the parking charge was close to $75 per night. Be aware that whatever great rate you get on the room they will do their best to get it back!

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Jnew02
Reviews.Content: Let's start at the beginning. Valet parking was such a cluster and so disorganized. It was hard to get help and we watched them put the tag for our truck in someone else's BMW (could've been a good thing) but they realized the mistake. Then we got inside and realized we had made the reservation for the wrong day. The front desk was very helpful in accommodating us. We got to our room and discovered we got the handicap room. The bathroom door wouldn't close all the way or lock. There was hair on the bathroom ceiling and in the shower. The walls were paper thing and even from 13 floors up we could hear everything on the street. We shouldve known when we found earplugs offered with the soap and shampoo. I've also never had a more difficult time getting a tv to work. There wasn't enough light and one of the lamps was burnt out. The coffee rocked and the paper towels in the lobby bathroom were amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Nice!”
Reviews.Author: clutchbomb
Reviews.Content: I was walked by the Clift Hotel and moved to this property due to an oversell situation, which was very inconvenient. However, I received a lower room rate at Parc 55 (first night was comp'ed for being walked) and was very happy here. The staff and room service were perfect, and the room was impeccably clean. The lobby is a bit sterile, but overall a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mark J
Reviews.Content: Had a great time here during New Years. The staff was perfect and the valet deserves there tips. stay here, its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Gret Location average to poor servie”
Reviews.Author: tassie4061
Reviews.Content: Family of 5 stayed for 3 nights in two club rooms. Booked the day before direct with the hotel and requested adjoining rooms or two rooms close together (no guarantees given and that was fine, I prefer adjoining rooms as were travelling with 3 teenaged daughters). Upon check in we were told rooms were not adjoining but relatively close together as the hotel did not have adjoining rooms. So we checked in nice rooms, however the room my daughters were in had an adjoining door? I rang down was told no adjoining room that night however there would be adjoining rooms available from the next day and we should talk with guest services and they could make the change for us. Long story short, we were moved 3 times (we move ourselves each time) as each time they allocated two adjoining rooms when we arrived at the rooms there was no adjoining door!! 1/12 hours of our holiday we can;t get back!! Finally I said we had to go as we had a tour booked and could they sort out the rooms and when we got back later in the day I would collect the keys. Guess what...... arrive back after a massive day of sightseeing, allocated new swipe cards and arrive at rooms which are not adjoining. To be honest we could have stayed in non adjoining rooms, but now it was a matter of principle, don't tell me I can have an adjoining rooms, make me move my suitcases 3 times and still end up with two separate rooms!! Arghhhhh super annoying!! An adjoining room is what we ended up with Other that the room debacle, the rooms were large, clean and hotel is well located. The staff (other than reception staff who don;t know the hotel room configuration were great) I was annoyed that I had to pay to WiFi but if you are happy to googled downstairs there are 2 desktop computers for guest use. Also I found that it there were several free WiFi ports my girls used from the room so that was fine. KInd of made paying for PARC 55 WiFi stupid. Would I stay here again, probably not, but I would stay in the Union Square area.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: Ying M
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews unless i have very strong positive/negative opinions. I booked this hotel based on the number of good reviews i read online. I was SO disappointed with the whole experience. It's very NOISY (neighboring rooms, floors above you and the street noise outside!) The breakfast area was so small - people had to stand up to eat & the staff couldn't care less about helping you with anything! The only decent thing about this hotel is its location but it's not worth the stress of staying here just for that!

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Good price”
Reviews.Author: Ropires
Reviews.Content: We went there for NYE 2012. Great location, value and service. Worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wireless Scam”
Reviews.Author: gstadler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine, big, generic. What's irksome is the 15 dollar charge per day PER DEVICE for wireless. C'mon Wyndham, that is a low class, TACKY way to make extra money off of your guests. It probably costs about fifteen cents to provide the service. And nothing for additional devices. Vulgar and disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient to everything”
Reviews.Author: donmhighland_NY
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 25th Dec to 28th and the stay was comfortable. Very good beds, clean room and big bathroom. Good view from 20th floor. Everything is so close from here which is why we loved the hotel. BART, cable car, union square is all on walking distance. burger king opposite the hotel served us as our daily breakfast and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: commanderbyrne
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Parc55 in May of this year. We stayed in a club level bedroom, so had us of the club room for breakfast in the mornings. Room was spotless and staff were friendly. Bar in the hotel had a nice mix of people and a good selection of drinks. Only gripe I would have is having to pay for wifi, which in a modern hotel is ridicules. Seems to be becoming the norm in 4+ star hotels in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Club room not worth the additional cost and book directly”
Reviews.Author: Froggystyle
Reviews.Content: After reviewing the hotel's website we selected a 'club' room thinking that we'd get something just a little bit nicer which we thought was worth it given that we'd be staying for almost 2 weeks. We booked in via a third party booking site and prepaid the whole stay via credit card so we were kind of stuck with what we got. It seemed quite apparent that the hotel knew that and we were stuck in a room which looked directly at another hotel. We asked whether we could get a room with a view of the bay and were told that we'd be given one in a few days which despite following several times, never eventuated. The room itself was quite small and not that special (surprisingly, in comparison to a very sexy 44th floor Manhatten hotel room that we got a few weeks later on). The hotel itself is very well situated if you want to go exploring SF, though you do have to run the homeless person gauntlet every time you leave, though this is pretty much the norm everywhere). In short, the hotel was ok, a bit overpriced and I'd recommend booking directly with the hotel so you can leave if unsatisfied. If you intend on it being a romantic getaway, request a bay view room and ensure you get it because the view from the other side isn't that crash hot. Don't bother forking out extra for the Club Room either the facilities of the executive level are ok, but not worth writing home about.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: doozi
Reviews.Content: Once again, got a great deal on Priceline! No complaints, even though there was quite a line for check in, it went pretty fast & Jenn took great care of us, upgrading to room on the Club level with a FANTASTIC view of the city, for just a small gratuity. Room was fine, no in room bar but those are always too expensive anyway. One minor issue; elevators were SUPER slow. It was a fairly busy holiday weekend and I was told only 2 of the 6 elevators were working so there was always a long wait and a crowded elevator to squeeze in to! But the location of the hotel is great, we didn't have a problem with street noise but then we were on the 29th floor so I'm sure that helps! The breakfast for Club level was better than expected & the appetizers & service in the bar was awesome. Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but has issues”
Reviews.Author: mmehtas
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights recently. The hotel is well located, in the center of everything. The staff were friendly, the room was immaculate, and housekeeping was prompt. Overall we had a good stay. The minor issue is with the street noise - emergency vehicles with sirens on in the middle of the night that can be clearly heard even on the 12th floor. The price one pays for being in the middle of the action! The major issue we had was with the elevators. There is one bank of six elevators that services all 6 floors. For some reason, they take forever to come. On our second morning (weekday), we waited 15 minutes for an elevator. One showed up every 5 minutes or so, but they were already full. Finally, we ended up walking the 12 floors down to to the street level. The elevators were slightly more frequent for the remaining of our stay. The front desk told us that "engineering" was working on a "problem". Not sure we bought this given that all six elevators were in operation. Seems more like not enough elevators to handle the traffic, or very poorly programmed algorithms controlling the elevators. The business's center was open 24 hours, and although the description we had read of the hotel spoke to free wifi in the business center, there was none. There were 6-7 computers each with an attached printer. We tried to use one to print our boarding cards, but found 3 of the computers not operational, and not a single printer working. Wifi in the rooms is available for a steep price ($14.99 per week?). Other than the issues above, we enjoyed the hotel. It was comfortable, the staff responsive and courteous, and the location was perfect for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service ,great place, coming back Forsure”
Reviews.Author: Tavi10
Reviews.Content: Great customer service, front desk job done by Ana Vasquez was superb! Made me a believer that the client is always first here at parc55

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great customer service, and amazing deals”
Reviews.Author: mb1wny
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a couple of times and have been impressed by how much they offer for the price. They staff are nice, the rooms are immaculate, and they offer great prices for the location. I look forward to continuing to stay with them on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location! Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: shannenavila
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to San Francisco, we were surprised how perfect this location is. We took the BART from SFO to Powell Street. As we emerged from the BART, we were steps away from the hotel. No steep hills to climb with our luggage-a major plus. The check-in was easy and most people working for the hotel were very friendly. The only exception was the concierge, who was not helpful nor friendly. Not really a problem because there are so many people that gladly offer suggestion in the city. The entrance of the hotel is impressive and that sets the tone for all hotels. Rooms were comfortable and much more spacious than I expected. House keeping did a great job. I loved that the Cable Car is one block away and great shopping/dining within walking distance. We didn't make any plans, just played our trip by ear and had one of the most memorable times of our lives. I plan on returning to San Francisco every year from now on, and will stay at this hotel every time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views in the perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: TC89
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend about 2 weeks ago and we left with smiles! Check-in was a breeze and we were actually upgraded to the King view room, more about that in a minute. The hotel is centrally located and towers over the city. Valet is pricey at about $45 a day/night but there are smaller parking garages within a couple block radius for about $30/day/night. Both the upstairs and downstairs lobby screamed of luxury and class, walking in we knew that we made the right choice. As I said before we originally booked the normal King room and I politely asked if there was a room higher up aka the King View rooms and if it was possible to receive an upgrade. The woman was kind enough to upgrade us with a smile and it made our day and night! Overall, the view you get from the king view rooms are amazing, panoramic views of the city that will leave you speechless. We will definitely be coming back and we are already thinking about this upcoming weekend!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: dalycalifornia
Reviews.Content: Great location. Awesome views in corner room. Mostly windows to the city!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice, don't regret it”
Reviews.Author: Hector A
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my son for 4 nights. We visited San Francisco to go to the Monday Night Football Game (49ers and Steelers). The location is great; walking distance from Union Square, many stores and places to eat. Public transportation and taxis always available. Room was clean, comfortable and service was excellent. Concierge (Rosanna?) was very helpful with recommendations and reservations for local tours. Other reviews mentioned street noise and homeless people in the vecinity, but none of these were ever issues for us. I would stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Always Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: HRH_Chelle
Reviews.Content: I first chose the Parc because of it's location but I keep going back because I love it. No matter what you are in SF for, the Parc is not far from it. And you will never be disappointed in this hotel. We stay here when we are in town for shopping, or the ballet. (When I'm with my daughter we usually mix the two!) The service is outstanding. The rooms are large, well appointed and comfortable. And the views get better with every floor! It's like a 5 star hotel at a 3 star price.

Reviews.Title: “Always pleasant”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust1979
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here 3x within this year. Pro: Centrally located, decent staff, nice rooms, clean hotel and quiet. Con: VALET: For some reasons, this hotel charges $48 if you look at other hotels nearby, some charges as low as $35. There is also a car garage less than a block away where you can park 24 hrs for $28 if that makes a difference just no in/out privilege. INTERNET: they charge per day or weekly. Sucks if your there for business.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale experience”
Reviews.Author: angela h
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, clean and friendly hotel. We could hear the cable car bells and see the bay...it was great! They give you ear plugs because the street noise is there, but it's not bad. I highly recommend this hotel in the middle of Union Square in SF!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for First time Visitor to San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: chargap
Reviews.Content: It was so easy-took the "BART" from the Airport, got off at Hallidie Plaza on lower level of station at Powell and Market St (Also the Visitor Info.
