Bureau) take the elevator up or escalator to street level and it is right there-Union Square and Cable car are just around the corner. Rooms were large, great view-join the Wyndham club before hand and your WI-FI is free. Rates were reasonable--it was a great place for our first visit.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location but not a tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: nikkiTT
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Parc 55 for one week and found the hotel to be adequate for business travel. I would not recommend it to tourists as my impressions were that they seem to be more geared towards the business traveler The Staff are professional and friendly but this hotel is strictly for business travel it is a no frills hotel that gets the job done. If your visit is for a little retail therapy this hotel is a great choice with the mall just across the road no need to call a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay-great location, rooms and staff are excellent.”
Reviews.Author: HarrisBH
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights through Priceline. We were upgraded to a corner suite. WOW. Everything about this hotel is great. Would stay here every time. Parking is expensive but BART is close to the hotel and other parking is also close.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: popey16
Reviews.Content: We booked this as an expensive treat at the end of our trip to the USA but it didn't compare to the so called budget hotels we had stayed in up until this point. Having splashed out for a club room we were told on arrival that the rooms had been overbooked and there wasn't one available. We had to settle for a lower priced room and agree to be moved the next day. We were given a $50 dinner voucher for this inconvenience. The next day we were moved but the club room wasn't that impressive and felt like an extra room tucked out of the way and we had to exchange our keys yet again when ours didn't work for the club lounge. We shared an outer door with the room next door which meant it was noisy when they were leaving an entering. The only thing that redeemed this hassle was the unfailing politeness of the hotel staff. Whilst the views were impressive the club lounge was not that exciting so I wouldn't advise paying extra. The gym was impressive, so this is a great hotel for a workout. The location is good and convenient for most San Francisco attractions. We ate in the restaurant once and found the food good but expensive and chose to eat out on subsequent nights. We also couldn't afford the wifi which we felt overpriced especially after having free wifi everywhere else we had stayed. Overall we felt we had overpaid for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, parking can be difficult sometimes”
Reviews.Author: LTAN72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights last week. The hotel is a decent business hotel. Check-in process was quick & we were even able to score a room 2 hours early. The rooms themselves are pretty standard - clean, but nothing exciting. The walls are a bit thin, but that's probably true of most hotels. The real draw is the location- you're right in the heart of Union Square. I guess the only (minor) complaint is the parking at certain times of day. The hotel is on the corner of a fairly busy street, so it wasn't uncommon to find a line of cars trying to valet and, as a result, block the street traffic. Similarly, it made it difficult for cars leaving the hotel to exit the hotel driveway. Still the valet staff worked very hard & as fast as they could. They were always very polite. If you want to be right in the middle of things & don't mind the hustle & bustle, this is a great place to stay. If you want a calmer experience, there are hotels 1-2 blocks away that are still close enough to the action without being too busy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, standard 4star”
Reviews.Author: VAF84
Reviews.Content: Not much to say, it's a fairly standard four star hotel. Got it at a bargain price on Priceline for the weekend. Had a close call and almost got stuck with split beds for my girlfriend and I, luckily they found us a King room last second and our stay was saved! I feel it was well located, close enough to most attractions. Not much to add, lobby was nice, room/shower, etc was nice. Would probably stay there again. Did not order any room service, so no comment on the food. Did try to get a late night drink at the bar on Saturday night, but apparently the two bartenders were having trouble keeping up. Got frustrated after waiting about 10-15 min for a drink and went upstairs. Kind of a buzz kill for my gf and I that night. Side note, we were on the 13th floor and we could hear a lot of noise from below. I'll sleep through most anything, but slight sleepers beware, you may want to find another place.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy, Dark and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Bon_voyage79
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in this hotel as we decided at the last minute to extend our stay for a night. We pricelined the hotel for $100, and I feel that we overpaid for what we got. In direct contrast, we stayed at the Intercontinental San Francisco for the previous two nights and what a difference. Let's just say that in shopping terms, the Intercontinental is like Saks Fifth Avenue, and the Parc 55 is like Macy's (the non-designer Alfani and INC floor). It wasn't good. I almost cried when I saw how gross the Parc 55 was in comparison to the Intercontinental. We were given a room on the 8th floor and looked out at the roof of another building. The room was very dark and had a grungy quality. For instance, the light switches were caked in dirt; the door looked yellowed (and had an old-fashioned chain security lock rather than the newer bars); and the blanket on the bed was like a yucky terrycloth towel. The decor made me want to just stay standing; I was afraid to touch anything. The couch in the room and the bed were both very hard and uncomfortable. The linens were not of high quality; the closet door was grungy and outdated. Everything about the room screamed for a makeover. It was not a pleasant place to spend your time. The clientele also left a lot to be desired. I was happy to leave the place behind after a night, and I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice!”
Reviews.Author: Blondietex
Reviews.Content: Club level with view was most excellent. Close to shops, dining options and mass transit. Chinese dim sum close by is good. Skip the sushi place Han Zen. It was awful. Beds very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: juljas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in a Club Level room. Worth the extra dollars for the continental breakfast and appetizers alone (nothing amazing, but very nicely done). Try and get a corner room - the extra space is so worth it (we had our daugher on a rollaway), and had more than enough room. Much bigger that the standard club level. Yes, was still noisy, even on floor 27, with sirens, however didn't bother us. We expect noise in a city centre. Concierge not overly helpful - I would have to say that the staff on this desk were the least willing to assist in any hotel across the US that we stayed at (in fact the staff in the club lounge assisted us more than the concierge!). Location was fantastic and very close to Union Square. We had no issues at night with panhandlers. Great hotel, would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: amisrn1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 on our vacation. The hotel was very nice. We stayed in a club level room, which was ideal because the free continental breakfast in the club lounge made it worth the extra money. Plus having a room on a higher floor meant a better view of the city. The club lounge also has free appetizers and desserts in the evening. Cocktails are on the honor system, but other refreshments are free. We stayed over a long weeked, so the club lounge was closed on Friday and Saturday evenings. The reception staff was friendly and helpful. The concierge was also great. It was our first trip to San Francisco, so we used the concierge for advice on several occasions. I was surpised at other reviews that mentioned the noise level. This is a city hotel, so one would expect a lot of outside noise (sirens, car horns, etc). Honestly though, it wasn't very disruptive. There was minimal noise in the hotel hallways, and we had a "conference" of teenagers staying at the hotel at the time, so if they weren't noisy then I can't see the noise level getting too high! The room had a comfortable king bed, flat screen TV, desk, chair, sofa, and a good sized bathroom. Plenty of space for 2 adults! I actually expected the room to be smaller, so we were pleasantly surprised. We never ate at the hotel restaurant, but it looked nice and was usually busy. The hotel does not have free wi-fi, except in the lobby, which was disappointing, but we were on vacation so it didn't matter much to us. The business center was small, with a handful of computers. At the time we went, the computers weren't working properly and none had printing capability. However, the concierge was helpful in getting our boarding passes printed for our flight. The location is great. Only a few blocks to Union Square, which was decorated nicely for the holiday season. You can also pick up sightseeing tours at Union Square. The hotel is a block from the BART and the Powell-Mason cable car, so easy access to transporation. Muni transportation is very close as well. Plenty of restaurants in the area within walking distance, but you can easily hop on public tranportation to go elsewhere. Taxis are also available at the hotel entrance. We went to Candlestick Park for the 49ers game and caught the bus just a couple blocks away (very covnenient!) Parc 55 is a block from the Tenderloin district, so it is reasonable to say going beyond Mason St. at night is not a good idea, but there really wasn't anything we wanted to do on that side anyway. Overall, Parc 55 is a convenient place to stay for travelers in San Francisco, whether it be business or vacation. We enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Don't get fooled by the lobby”
Reviews.Author: juju-anne
Reviews.Content: Upon stepping into the lobby I thought that the rooms were going to be very nice and modern (as this was what the lobby looked like), but was wrong as soon as I stepped into the room. The room itself had nothing wrong, but was quite outdated. I was also placed in a disability room, so I'm not sure if that had anything to do with the decor, and the bathroom had a shower over bath tub. Again this could be due to the room being accommodating to disabled persons. The thing that bugged me the most was that maids started to clean rooms at around 8:30am- I had to tell them to come back later a few times. I would stay there again as the location was quite good, but I think if you paid a little bit more you could get a better room.

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed staying here”
Reviews.Author: Glow_wormnz
Reviews.Content: I admit I was feeling a bit apprehensive as the other hotels we've booked over the internet for San Francisco have been complete dives. My room was really nice and only cost me $NZ150 per night. I enjoyed using the free internet available near reception and in the Business Centre. The location is good; close to the tram and Union Square for great shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay but pricey”
Reviews.Author: euexplorer
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this lovely hotel over thanksgiving. Without even asking for it I was put in this huge room with 2 windows and an incredible view of the bay. Lovely clean comformtable rooms and a great nights sleep. I can't really say if they staff are good because I did not have to go near them at any stage which I think is always an excellent sign. They have express checkout also which meant no queuing when leaving. The location is perfect - just a couple of blocks from Union Square. On the negative side lovely and all as it was it was certainly on the pricey side especially the valet service. It was 48 dollars a night which I think is ridiculous. I was waiting for ages to get the car back after checking out aswell. However if you are not driving and you get a good deal I'd jump at a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location and great deal!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan W
Reviews.Content: Located right off the metro and close to cable cars. This access enabled us to quickly navigate SF on our short 2 day trip here. The airport shuttle was right outside our hotel at 4am to take us quickly to the airport. Clean room, clean showers, what else could you ask for? I asked about using a discount before checking in and the front desk said it was not available because I had to do it when I originally booked. Then a minute later, the lady tells me it will be $60.00 less per night! Great surprise, she hooked us up :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: hushieprints
Reviews.Content: Great location with easy access to union square and BART. But take note that Tenderloin is also nearby. We read reviews that the neighborhood was quite noisy so we requested for a high floor corner room but our room was not ready upon check in. Reception was helpful and gave us the highest floor available (8th floor i think). We can still hear some noises from the nearby pubs from our room but it was bearable and we had no problem sleeping. Room was pretty big. Hotel also provided Bath and Body Works toiletries. Expensive internet and parking. We also skipped breakfast at the hotel and opt to try the different breakfast joint recommended by Tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bimats
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Parc 55. Our first stay was good, but this time it seemed a step above! The lobby really impresses, very modern. The room was clean with a fantastic view of San Francisco! We were on the 28th floor and it was a spectacular sunrise! The service was great, just what we remembered from our first stay. I must admit our second stay was mostly based on price and location (both ideal), but they have locked us in for future stays! Our only complaint was the pillows!

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is!”
Reviews.Author: gr8eats88
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 will do for me all I needed was a bed and earplugs. Stay here in November during thanksgiving week. I opted to get my own breakfast rather than hotel type. There was a donut shop on the corner of hotel with Bart police cars out in front that never seems to move. Maybe to ward of potential problems that may arise because the area is not too good. Got crackheads,prostitutes,pimps and thiefs walking around like everyday life. My advise is to walk with someone or if you must keep your hands in pocket or purse with thumb on pepper spray nozzle. Not trying to scare anyone just wanted you to get heads up of area.

Reviews.Title: “Aside from computer and Internet access, I liked this place much.”
Reviews.Author: Travelin_Al
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler, I have certain expectations about computer and Internet access. Extorting guests at $14.95 per day for Internet access and offering very limited access computers in the "business" center will not make a return guest of me. I could hardly believe that computers in the business center (4th floor) and in the hall on the 2nd floor were actually labeled with messages that they could not print. Even worse, when I tried to access my flash drive, I learned that ALL of the computers are on such a highly overcautious (paranoid?) lockdown level, that flash drives are not accepted. Seriously? This is 2011. I was told the concierge would print my flash drive files for me, but as I had changes to make to a presentation and couldn't access the file, that was hardly a convenient option. But then, he couldn't use my drive either -- on his own computer. He had the nerve to mark a Kinkos location on the map and suggested I go there. I waited until he left his post and the nice woman had no problem. Preposterous for modern travel. All said, the hotel itself was very nice. I liked my room. There was a hilarious high-heeled girl fight the first night on the street below, but they'd thought of everything: the staff provides earplugs. I liked the location (if somewhat touristy) and felt comfortable everywhere I walked. I even rented a bike and rode across the Golden Gate Bridge. I had good Thai food in the hotel itself, good pizza nearby at Blondie's, and a fantastic breakfast at Dottie's.

Reviews.Title: “Service could be better...”
Reviews.Author: ChienYeat
Reviews.Content: Good experience on a whole. Got a warm reception by Brett who was very helpful. Can't say the same for the rest of the front desk crew. I felt like an interruption to their work, especially to the concierge. Encountered 2 different concierge staff and both were very quick to dismiss me. One was reading a newspaper when I approached her! Also, I am astounded by the front desk's lack of knowledge of the hotel's services! I got this staff, Jessie, who told me that the hotel does not have laundry service! What hotel doesn't have laundry service for guest?! I call the valet laundry from my room and got my clothes picked up. Room was impressive, good view of the city. House-keeping is superb. I enjoyed my stay, but the front desk crew is hopeless, except Brett of course. Hope Wyndham will look into training their front desk and concierge crew.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, magnificent views, and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lindagn1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located in Union Square, downtown. It's within walking distance to shopping, Chinatown, Union Square Park, etc. As other reviews stated, the parking fee is on the high end at $48/night. The room rate was low so it made up for it. We took advantage of the room upgrade for an additional $12/day and it was so worth it. Amazing views of downtown and the bay. The room had the usual amenities but was lacking a refrigerator. It was clean and the bed was comfortable. The noise wasn't as bad as I thought it was going to be; in addition to shampoo and lotion, they provided ear plugs as well, which we didn't use. We were on the 23rd floor and was able to hear people on the street but it didn't keep us from sleeping throughout the night. We didn't take advantage of room service or eat at the restaurant but there's a cafe located next door where you can grab a quick bite to eat for breakfast or lunch. It's always nice to have room service available though. There were a bunch of taxes and fees added on to the final bill, so be aware of that. If you are on a budget, ask before you book so you know how much you'll be spending. The original room rate was $109/night but after all taxes, fees, parking, and $12 upgrade, the room rate was an average of $200/night. Overall, I would visit this hotel again if I wanted to stay in Union Square. The front desk service was great and the hotel lobby was nicely decorated. The bar area was nice with great views.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Fools4Food
Reviews.Content: Got a good rate through Priceline. The hotel is at the edge of a dicey neighborhood. Made a wrong turn last night and had to step over a dozen homeless sleeping in the street. Its also on the edge of a great area with world class shopping. Rooms for a four star are beginning to feel dated. Very expensive internet. Had to call desk to figure out how to watch tv that wasnt pay for view. That option is hidden. Not a service oriented hotel. Had to carry own luggage to room. At 100 US is value. Cant wait until wifi gouging is a thing of the past!

Reviews.Title: “from leticia of Norfolk VA”
Reviews.Author: Leticia B
Reviews.Content: the location is exelent for shopping and restaurants. The staff was very freindly,the manager NANCY,was really nice. The room was reallynice and clean . the view is AMAZING in the floor# 25. The beds are confortable and the bathroom, clean and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Location but with a price”
Reviews.Author: Anthony B
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. This hotel is in the heart of Union Square which makes it very convenient. The drawback is how expensive it is to park your car during your stay. So be warned. Otherwise, the room is clean and the bed is comfortable. The bathroom needs a little updating though. I was also expecting Internet access to be free in the room considering how much I paid for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: mela123
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing, the staff was very friendly (I was able to check in at 8am), and the room's are wonderful as well. One of the best hotels I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kyle B
Reviews.Content: Ericka at the front desk is absolutely great. She is extremely customer oriented and was very helpful at working out some issues we had with our reservation from a 3rd party source. This is our favorite hotel in San Francisco. The service and staff are extremely helpful and the location is perfect. The views are stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: JolieSalter
Reviews.Content: If you stay at the Parc 55 you will not be disappointed. The location is excellent for shopping and restaurants. The Front Desk Manager, Brett Leonard, made my stay AMAZING!!! He couldn't have been more courteous. I'm sort of a hotel snob and this is where I always stay and will continue to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - close to BART & Cable Car”
Reviews.Author: Rob-the-Traveller
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in San Francisco, as we were only staying for 3 days we wanted somewhere close to a BART station (for getting to/from Airport) and close to Cable Cars. This Hotel is one block from Powell St BART and the Cable Car starts from Powell Street. This hotel looks very impressive from the outside. As soon as we entered the hotel we knew that it would be a good hotel for us. Check in very quick and efficient and we were given a room on the 37th floor looking east. The room was very comfortable with two large beds and a well equiped bathroom. The hotel room was very clean and tidy. We did not eat at the hotel - there are plenty of good value places near by. Overall very impressed with this hotel, the location for us was important when booking. My only complaint is that they charge for internet access, we needed to check in for flight so went to Starbucks who have free wifi for the cost of a coffee! Will definately stay here again next time we're in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 Hotel, San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn K
Reviews.Content: The location was great and the hotel staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed on the 26th floor in a 'view' room & it was great.”
Reviews.Author: HappilyMarriedTravel
Reviews.Content: A good hotel... seems like it is a big 'conference-style' hotel. It is also where some airline staff stay (we saw them all in the lobby area). Charging for internet at a hotel like this is quite ridiculous - the hotel would be advised to just 'include it' really (in my opinion). Also, the air conditioning unit was noisy. We chose to stay at this hotel because we required 2 nights in a King Size bed as we both had really sore backs. The bed was comfy - a big plus!!! Staying on the 26th floor in a 'view' room was great & had an amazing view across San Francisco. The location of the hotel is also good. Would recommend the hotel. Budget conscious: Have breakfast down the road where there is a cafe (not in the hotel). We ate fresh cooked eggs brekky & coffee for two for $25 including tips. [The hotel charges $26 per person for a cooked brekky.] Please vote if you think this review has helped you! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “3 day San Fransisco Trip at the Parc55”
Reviews.Author: Klemense L
Reviews.Content: The Parc55 has a great location , just steps away from a BART station and near a ticketing stand for the famous cable cars. The rooms are quiet with glazed windows and the toilet's are clean and the bed's comfortable. The food is first class if you're willing to pay and the breakfast buffet is abundant with choices.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great service.”
Reviews.Author: bw73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very nice area; lots of shops and restaurants nearby as well as some sights. The foyer is impressive and the bar looks great. In the morning the area is used for breakfast: this as well as having to pay for wifi are my only complaints: the breakfast I had ordered was of very poor quality (extremely greasy and cold) but great customer recovery as it was taken off my bill. The receptionists, restaurant manager and concierge are extremely friendly, knowledgeable and always happy to help: personal, polite service with a smile. I'd recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, but seriously($50/night parking)”
Reviews.Author: Jamie M
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 is in an excellent location, literally across the street from the metro with shopping and dining in any direction. We watched Cirque du Soleil - Totem at AT&T Park and walked back to the hotel which was probably a 15-20 minute walk. We booked online at hotwire and when we checked in I asked for an upgraded room - for $40/night we got a 29th floor city view room with access to the Club Lounge on the 31st floor. Free continental breakfast, drinks, amazing views...worth the extra few bucks a night. So with taxes, internet, parking and the upgrade...what we paid on hotwire was cheaper than the costs we were charged at checkout. Worth it...for sure, but be aware that you pay for parking($48/night) and internet($15/night). All in all, we were very impressed with the Parc 55.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique feel; terrific location”
Reviews.Author: Mannyma
Reviews.Content: We were here for a conference over a long weekend. Couldn't have been happier with the proximity to BART, which is right across the street, and the ease of getting to all the other hotels for meetings and the Moscone Convention Center. My husband loved the bar and restaurant. The room was lovely. The service was outstanding. I was about to give it five stars when my husband just came back from the coffee service downstairs where he was charged for a coffee and a croissant. Now really! Parc 55 should be more generous with breakfast and with bottled waters, which are 4.50 in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; Priceline steal”
Reviews.Author: Rstlocal
Reviews.Content: We booked midweek stay at 8 am on same day for 125/N with Priceline - saving 50%; but taxes ($25) and valet parking ($48/N) expensive. Great location for walking SF; one block from streetcar terminal, 2 blocks from Union Square. Great room and amenities; did not eat here. Street noise on NE corner across from nightclub awoke us even on 13th floor corner room. I would stay here again if bargain available but perhaps avoid that corner.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in the middle of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Europe_Maedchen
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent a weekend in San Francisco to go shopping. The Parc 55 was the perfect hotel for this, right across from the large Westfield mall and a few minute walk to Union square and a block to the cable cars. The hotel was impressive, very modern and open architecture. I especially liked the room: 1972, a spacious room with a view of the city from 2 sides. The bed was large and comfy and the decor inviting and well thought through. Even the bathroom was spacious and well appointed with Bath and Body amenities. I have stayed at some other high end hotels in San Francisco, but they were much smaller and claustrophobic. We had a great time and were looking forward to relaxing in the room every night. This will be my number one choice in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Incredible Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: SJM1110
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 is my favorite hotel in San Francisco. The location couldn't be better and the facilities are outstanding. This hotel at 5th and Market is in the center of everything - convenient to cable cars, BART, and Muni. Rooms are bright and much more spacious than others in similar price ranges. But the best feature of all is the personal attention and hospitality - amazing for a hotel this size. Brett Leonard, the Front Desk Manager ensures the welcoming staff pay attention to individual needs and help you feel "at home". He is an outstanding asset to the hotel and knows how to give this very large hotel a small hotel feel when it comes to personal detail for his guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Review71
Reviews.Content: Great rooms and staff were very helpful. Had dinner in the restaurant and this was fantastic. Personally I love the location although some may find it a little busy

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned, standard 4 star service”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: This was a conference hotel option, we had a one day meeting here as a satelite for a bigger meeting at Moscone Center which is an easy walk away. The hotel is well positioned for most that SFO offers. Check in etc is one floor up with a lobby that connects to the Cityhouse restaurant and quite a nice bar. On ground level, the motor court turn around is crowded but flows and the taxi line moved del out front (it was raining). The room was pretty standard and everything worked. Shower above bath. Enough sockets etc. The bed was fine but there is some night noise from the street and also some comings and goings on the floor which produce minimal disturbance. The ice maker on level 30 was noisy. Room service: timely - lobster bisque ($12) and double smoked pork chop ($26) were deliver in under 30 minutes at around 9.30 and were of restaurant quality. Glass of wine and water were expensive although the house wine - city house cabernet - would have been a cheaper option and was commented upon as been very good by co attendees. (Bottle 750ml of this house wine in room was $25). Check out - smooth, no wait. Booking pass - free internet access on that level. This a a 4 star central hotel that often has special lines Priceline or Expedia blind picks and the like. It is comparable to the Hilton, Hyatt and other similar hotels in the area but not the same league at Palace, Intercontinental, St. Regis etc. I would stay again - it is in the Wyndham system so no Starwood or Hilton points which is negative for business travel, however, if i went for a last minute 4 star at a good price on one of the blinded pick sites and got Parc 55, I be more than happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: gravesend_foodie
Reviews.Content: Westayed here for 3 nights in November and would highly recommend this hotel! Our room was clean and modern with a comfortable bed and proper pillows (very rare in the US). The real winner though with this hotel is the fantastic location, its right by Union Square and the Bart (rail from teh airport), its also right by the Trams, so we NEVER had to use a taxi the whole time we were there!!!!!We ate in the bar one night and the food was lovely, and we're fussy. I'd definatly stay here again in San Francisco!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but a few disappointments”
Reviews.Author: wrzbm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, near shopping and restaurants, and the BART station. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were very clean. There were a couple minor annoyances though.The biggest was the street noise. I stayed on 9th floor, and was amazed at how much street noise I heard. Since the area is busy, you would hear people on the street talking or yelling until early morning. And you hear things like dump trucks and ambulances very clearly all night and early morning. So if street noise bothers you while you're trying to sleep, you should consider getting some ear plugs. The second annoyance was the absence of the a coffee maker in the room. I can't remember the last place I stayed that didn't provide coffee in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kellythirteen
Reviews.Content: We had a hard time finding the hotel but once we did, the parking valets and hotel personnel were very helpful. Check-in was quick and easy; we requested a corner room but none were available for that night. The room we did get was on the twentieth floor and was very nice with a great view of the city skyline. The only drawback was the connecting door to the next room. We could hear way too much of what was going on in the next room. I would definitely request a room without a connecting door when staying here. We liked both the bar and restaurant in the hotel; the bar was a hip, fun spot with plenty of people and lots of seating options - bar, lounge, couches, etc. The restaurant was next door to the bar but with a quieter feel to it. Service at both was great and the food was good. The hotel is in a great location near Union Square and we were able to walk to the cable car line or take a cab to wherever we needed to go. The parking fee is high - $50 per day - but parking is an issue in San Francisco. We parked the car and didn't use it at all. I would stay here again; the views are wonderful and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and classy location”
Reviews.Author: millerjeffcindy
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very comfortable and classy. The location is great you can walk everywhere and is very close to the cable cars, bart and other transportation. I recommend getting a higher room so that the traffic and street noise is less. We were able to get the concierge level which was very nice for the family. Also was able to get a mid-week discount which helped. Great views of the city from the higher floors. Staff was very helpful from the reservations telephone line to the front desk. Good choice to be able to experience the city in style.

Reviews.Title: “Chic with great service in the middle of all the Union square shopping.”
Reviews.Author: inthelooper
Reviews.Content: I'm sure this hotel is pricey but since I bid for my room, which ended up having a fab view from the 20th floor, I was overally impressed. Very large and modern. Quick walk to shops and good dining. Also, there is a car rental place as well as a "Go Car" (these lil yellow death traps are a memorable way to see the city).

Reviews.Title: “They give you earplugs - nuff said! Don't go here if you want quiet”
Reviews.Author: slambiase
Reviews.Content: the windows are very thin and it sounds like everything going on outside is actually in your room. I checked a couple of times to make sure the windows were closed! Overall, it is a nice hotel in a good location in downtown San Francisco. Easy walking distance to Union square and Moscone center. Clean room and common areas. Nice bar and front desk. Cool plug in center for your iphone, computer and other electronics

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel with no amenities”
Reviews.Author: nlgladstone
Reviews.Content: Good: big rooms, great views, very clean. Hotel is one block from BART and Market Streetcar lines. Union Square is not the most fun area, but you can leave really easily. The staff was very pleasant and professional and you never had to wait in line for the bell hop, concierge, etc. Not So Good: wifi is not included, which I always find ridiculous. In this case, it was also per device, so if you have an iPad and a laptop, you can only connect one of them for the wifi rate. No fridge/mini bar in the room (which given the size, is surprising) and the coffee maker didn't have a place to be plugged in. I had a conference rate, which was quite reasonable and I think I got what I paid for. If I had been paying full cost, I would have felt like I got poor value.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkably Poor Service/Technologically Challenged Stay”
Reviews.Author: Weary_Traveler_LA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 for a conference and stayed an extra weekend to enjoy San Francisco. The conference brought 10,000 people to town so it wasn't my first choice but was obligated to be nearby the convention center for the first four days of my visit. The lobby always reeked of cigarettes either from the street or from the bar, even early in the morning. The room was smaller than I expected but tidy and comfortable. I couldn't get the in-room safe to open upon arrival and asked for someone to check it. "Engineering" came to the room and flipped the power switch which was inside the fold of the door and looked at me like I was a complete moron. I tried to sign up for the high speed internet ($49/week) on my Ipad and got on just long enough to pay the fee and then it crashed and never worked again, despite 4 calls to the "customer support" number. I wasted at least an hour collectively -plugging in the tablet computer, checking the IP address, adding the Wi-Fi, checking the network connection with multiple different support staff to no avail. They did remove the fee and told me if I could get back on they would cover the cost of it, but I was never able to get back on. I had to do all my work for the conference in the smoky hotel lobby. The third night the television volume went out. I didn't watch TV but called the front desk the following morning when it still didn't work and asked someone to look at it while I was out for the day. I returned late in the evening and it wasn't fixed. No note, no message, and now the phone wasn't working so I had to go to the front desk the next morning to complain about this. They acted like they had never heard of this problem and offered not even an apology. This was finally fixed that day while I was out. Finally, on the last night, my bill arrived with a charge for two bottles of water that I didn't drink. I had to have the charge removed rather than just checking out and RUNNING for my life out of this hotel. Again, not even an apology but lots of questioning as if after paying over $2000 for my room that I was going to try to scam them out of $9.74 for their two bottles of water. It's unfortunate I had to stay in a place without any hospitality in such a lovely city. It really was unpleasant and I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience to a great anniversary weekend”
Reviews.Author: Youngkeems
Reviews.Content: Where do i begin, from the moment i arrived at Parc 55, the staff was unbelievably helpful, professional & friendly. From front desk to housekeeping to maintenance crew, when i tell you they go above and beyond, they really do (and i am a big stickler when it comes to service) and with a smile! I like extra towels for the bathroom and it so happened housekeeping was next door and i asked her if i can have extra and she gave me more than enough. My bedroom was fairly warm for my liking and immediately called maintenance to look at AC and adjust temperature. Not only did they fix it, they provided me with a small fan just in case it still wasn't cold enough for me (well more for my bf - he likes it tundra cold!) I believe maintenance guy's name was John. Beds are super comfy, lots of pillows which i love! Bathroom very clean and great water pressure with bath and body works products. Noise level is pretty loud unfortunately b/c you are right in the middle of union square so theres lots of going ons but i personally dont mind it b/c i live in NYC and need the 'white noise', but i would ask for a higher floor if you want less noise. The City House restaurant in hotel is good if you don't feel like exploring city and just want to stay in hotel. Location couldn't have been more perfect, the POWELL Bart Station (you can take the BART from SFO Airport to this stop - 30-40 min ride for $8.00! Beats $40 cab ride any day and its faster) is literally across the street by Forever 21 and the Powell cable street car where it starts/finishes, guys literally have to turn cable car around to start up line again. There is a fairly long line b/c its the HUB so buy your tickets ahead of time (located 20 ft from cable car, across from Bank of America). I also want to thank the hotel (i can't remember her name off hand) for sending two chocolate roses to my room, while the bf & i we were out and about with out tours. I made them aware that it was my anniversary weekend and again went above and beyond their call of duty. We will make this a yearly trip and this will be my SF based hotel moving forward!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service, Location and Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Christy F
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property recently on business. The location, close to Union Square is ideal for business and leisure stays. The hotel is clean, staff is friendly, knowledgeable and very customer service oriented. I only had breakfast at the in-house restaurant, but it was quite good and reasonably priced for San Francisco. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well located but average standard”
Reviews.Author: Mascha
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 its perfectly located for exploring San Francisco. Public transportation nearby, as well as a plenty of places to shop. The staff is very friendly but the standard of the rooms is not what I expected. We stayed in a view room, with view to a backstreet and the gym! Not spectacular at all. There's no free Wifi in the hotel (we stayed in 8 different Hotels on our trip, everywhere else they provided free Wifi). The room service nocks on the door before 8 am, if you put the "do not disturb" sign, they vacuum in front of your door to wake you up. We missed a Minibar or at least a fridge. Next time I would not stay at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bettina131
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 during a convention. The hotel is conveniently located within short walking distance to the Moscone Center and right off the BART Powell station. My room was spacious, as was the bathroom, there was ample closet space as well. The bed was very comfortable and the bedding was nice, I would almost say luxurious. My room was also very quiet. I was very annoyed however, that you have to sign up for one of their two loyalty programs to get free internet access. IMHO, any hotel that bills itself as a business hotel (and has conference facilities that are used during a major convention) should provide free internet access to its guests. Having to sign up for the program is ridiculous, wasted me time, but of course I did it to save money. I just wish they would be more customer-friendly when it comes to that. Aside from this, it's a good hotel, I would stay there again, and I can recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 Wyndham San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: SaraMarieCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! The location is great with so much shopping right out the front door. The hotel is very modern, clean and safe. I stay here whenever I can get a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Honest153
Reviews.Content: Satay away from this hotel (Parc 55, SF). They don't honor the specials they have on their own web site, One good example : "Wyndham Weekendar - Second night 50%" . It's B.S., I tried to book it this way and comes up full proce. I even spoke to the Reservations Hotline and I was told even they are having problems with this Hotel since it became Wyndham. Further, last here at about this same time, I tried to book a room there and I had a similar problem, to the extend that I even called the Hotel and had an ughly argument with them ---- I even had to insult them with 4 letter words to get my point across ------ they did the same and I doubled my 4 letter words to 8! Long story ..... In short, STAY AWAY !!!!!!!!!!!!!!! and you'll have a better and enjoyable stay at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best location”
Reviews.Author: fybr01
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Parc 55 Wyndham for a 5 day vacay in SF. The location could not have been better!! Surrounded by shops and sights, it was convenient to everything. The hotel was clean and classy. The amenities were very nice as well. I didn't use the gym but my friend did and thought it served its purpose. The rooms are spacious and tidy. My friend did wish there was better natural lighting in the room. Also it would have been nice if there was a minifridge. All in all, it was such a great stay and would definitely stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco get-a way”
Reviews.Author: arbin
Reviews.Content: Great location for a hotel. Easy to get to from the airport-train. Centrally located: so easy to get to all the sight seeing places tourists need to go to. Spent 4 nights at the hotel, next time will go for 1 week.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: LATraveler1727
Reviews.Content: This is a corporate hotel with conferences and meetings, but it's perfectly located in downtown SF. We've stayed here twice, and probably will come back again. We walked to several museums, it's right next to the cable car line, and surrounded by shopping malls and dozens of restaurants. Prices are reasonable for the area and there are often special rates online. Upper floors have spectacular views of the city or the bay, if you get lucky and snag a good view room. Rooms are clean and updated, the beds are fine, and the bathrooms are small but okay.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Irishstandards
Reviews.Content: Another typical stay here. Better then my last trip in August however. Room was clean, I had a balcony too which was a pleasant surprise even if it was about 2sq ft! I found every staff member to be pleasant and helpful. I asked for one of those Macy's Discount cards for foreign visitors and next thing I know the receptionist was getting all excited and letting me know about various sales that were on, I was DELIGHTED with her to offs cos I ended up getting half my Xmas shopping done! However I am still very concerned about the security access to this hotel! The ground floor has no staf so access to the lifts are open to anyone. There are a HUGE number of homeless people outside the hotel and they can easily gain access to the hotel and bedroom floors as the lifts do not require key access! I really wish they would address this! Otherwise it was fine!

Reviews.Title: “While in San Francisco,you have to try Parc 55...”
Reviews.Author: mirianmayumi
Reviews.Content: While in San Francisco,you have to try Hotel Parc 55... The impeccable service and cleansiness of The Parc 55 only leaves you to desire more. Great thank you to Riecky for the best treatment ever. She definitely made our stay a very special and memorable one. Parc 55 is amazing. From the minute we arrived for our 08 night stay the staff in front desk(Sarah,Mavis and Christina) were pleasant and helpful..The hotel is perfectly located close toUnion Square and the shopping area. The room is clean, comfortable and spacious. And the beds and bedding are to die for.. The bathroom is huge with gorgeous fluffy towels. Don't look anywhere else!! Thank you for all Warm Regards Mirian Shida

Reviews.Title: “Way beyond our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Justin R
Reviews.Content: From check in to valet, the service here is outstanding! Mr. Brett Leonard, The Front Desk manager, is the most helpful individual i have ever met. The way that he and his staff accommodated us was amazing. Attentive to our needs and requests, Mr Leonard was there for us from beginning to end. Bravo Wyndham for investing in such high Quality Managers and Employees. We will stay at the Parc 55 again very soon. We can hardly wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Location says it all!”
Reviews.Author: lawfamily
Reviews.Content: Super renovations, very hip, cool and fresh. Fast and easy check in, our room was nice and spacious, with a great tub and shower!!! We paid a little extra for the "club room" and privileges, which was so worth it. Great view, nice choice for breakfast and the nibbles in the early evening were handy and good. My new hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SandVBFan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 nights at the Parc 55. The rooms were renovated somewhat recently, and were clean and comfortable. Our room was spacious and quiet, as we were on the 24th floor. Considering it was the Nike Women's Marathon weekend, and many guests were a part of this amazing event, we were happy to find the room so quiet! The location can't be beat for its location in Union Square, and easy access to the F tram to go to the Embarcadero or the Wharf. We didn't keep our car based on the price of parking, and public transportation was very easy to get around other areas of town. The lounge was busy every night, and enjoyed drinks only once. I would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 in the Middle of it all!”
Reviews.Author: RadioLady2011
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in my dream area of San Francisco, one block from Nordstrom and other shops and restaurants. The hotel is lovely, well appointed and the service was OK. Had a few problems with the front desk, but they were later resolved. I was on 24th Floor where it was quiet. Some people on lower floors complained of street noise. The hotel is spotless and the brunch buffet is fantastic. The mattress was not totally comfortable...too hard. We walked to our event at the Moscone Center West and ate at Le Central and had great food in China Town! Beware: The doorman/taxi caller put me in a town car instead of a taxi and told me it "costs" the same. It didn't. It was 60.00 with a tip to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service”
Reviews.Author: Melissa S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 for only one night. After seeing our room (we were upgraded to a suite), we didn't want to leave. The staff was very respectful and receptive and the room was very clean. We enjoyed some cocktails in the lounge and ordered room service for both dinner and breakfast (all good). The location was perfect for us. We strolled to the Ferry Building and made our way back through Union Square. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we were expecting - in a good way”
Reviews.Author: anneastascia
Reviews.Content: To be honest we booked this hotel on hotels.com.au for a very cheap rate compared to all the other hotels in the area so we were not expecting alot. We figured we were only staying 2 nights so we could just deal with however bad it was... After surviving an earthquake in san diego, a delayed flight, a terribly turbulant flight and then raining and cold trip to the hotel we were dropped at the lobby and before we could tell the driver we were at the wrong hotel he had driven off leaving us there stranded! However it was the right hotel afterall - just so much more than we were expecting! This hotel is quite impressive - expansive open lobby area, bell boys at your beck and call it was something right out of a 5 star hotel. We were ushered to the second floor to check in where the desk clerk was fully up to speed on both of our names and thanked us immediately for chosing to spend our honeymoon with them before upgrading us to a corner suite of the 22nd floor which had amazing 180 degree views of the whole of SF! We were so impressed. The room was quite spacious - with everything your would expect - very clean and comfy bed for a good nights sleep. Hotel is central to everything we wanted to do and central for public transport. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and would definately stay again and again and again! The only thing I would agree with was the street noise was pretty clear from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special and poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Ozlover1023
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Wyndham for 2 nights. It is a very big place in the heart of the city. The atmosphere is very impersonal - so is the staff. The room was a little outdated but clean and quite nice. As business hotel it is ok but nothing more. It would have been ok if the not existing customer service would not have ruined the stay completely. We stored our luggage for our last hours in SF before we had to return to Europe. When we picked it up it was kind of a little chaotic - bags here, staff there. In this muddle we carelessly left our camera with all the holiday photos on it behind. We realised this on the plane and this was too late. We called the hotel right after landing but no one knew anything. We wrote three emails desperately trying to get the photos back - not even the camera and added a reward. They did not even bother to answer one of the emails. This was so disappointing - although it was our mistake of course - that we will certainly never come back or recommend this place. We would not dare to put the blame on someone but when we picked up the luggage there was only staff around ...

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 is one on the best hotel values in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: BBillingsley
Reviews.Content: After staying in the W for days , we thought the Parc 55 would be a downgrade - however we were pleasantly surprised. Great location , staff went over-and -above, and the rooms were spacious and clean. The only knock on the hotel is that the walls seem thin and your hear a lot of outside noise. I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Wen11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Parc 55 for 3 nights as a surprise hotel through Hotwire. We were very happy with * Location - parallel to busy Powell St and the Powell cable street cars that go up to Fisherman's Wharf, and right near Market St and the visitor's centre, Yes, behind the building is the Tenderloin area, which we came across one night and felt slightly unsafe, but just avoid that area and it will be fine. * Clean room - stayed in a standard room on the 8th floor. We had 2x double beds. They were small (and I weigh 50kg) for two people, but we slept reasonably well regardless. * Clean bathroom - with good hairdryer. Dislikes: * Leaking shower/tub leaked during the shower leaving quite a pool, but you can mop that up and it's no dramas. * Having to pay for internet with our std room package. Yes, there was also noise of sirens etc throughout our stay, but we figured you would hear that anywhere around Union Square. We weren't bothered. Because of the location and the decent rooms, we would stay here again. Of note - I would not stay along the cable car line. It would be far too noisy with the constant bells ringing to get cars out of their way!

Reviews.Title: “Great location to public transportation”
Reviews.Author: jjones4180
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time staying here and it is right across from the Powell St. BART (train to SFO and Oakland airports) as well as MUNI (local train, bus and Powell St. cable car). Also easy access to the F line trolley car that runs from Fisherman Wharf to teh Castro. My room was on the 6th floor and would recommend if you are bothered by street noise, ask for a room on a higher floor. The last time I stayed here I was on the 13th floor (yes the hotel has a 13th floor) and did not experience any street noise. The rooms are a good size. If it is a sunny nice day you will want to keep the blinds closed while you are out as the rooms tend to heat up rather quickly during the day. The club lounge staff on the 31st floor were very friendly and a great view from the lounge. Overall, all of the staff were pleasant and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: heb999
Reviews.Content: Have enjoyed many stays at this good hotel. The location is great, the rooms are spacious, up to date and very clean. The bathrooms are well equipped. The views are lovely and the beds very comfortable. Reception staff efficient and friendly. My only negative comments would be that there is not a mini bar in the room and the wifi is expensive at £14.95 + tax for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but nothing spectacular in the rooms, and noisy.”
Reviews.Author: jacobsjs
Reviews.Content: Room is good, very large with a huge bathroom. Location is close to the convention center and easy access to mass transit. My only real complaints are the noisy streets below and the lack of a coffee maker in the room. I understand I'm in the city by my corner room is really loud, I can hear everything happening on the street 16 floors down. I also find it strange I don't have a coffee maker in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: calliemae
Reviews.Content: This hotel has location going for it: one block from the subway and/or BART; one block from the cable car starting point; one block from local restaurants that serve breakfast; walking distance to China Town. BART turned out to be a big surprise. I can't think of an easier way to get to and from the airport. Think of it: no traffic issues when trying to get to the airport. As for staying near the harbor or Fisherman's Wharf, it might be a nice place to visit, but the whole place has a touristic feel that is unappealing. Boston Harbor, for example, would be a great place to stay, and Fisherman's Wharf by comparison comes up quite short. My final thoughts about Parc 55 are that it is reasonably priced, and the concierge staff is absolutely top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: MAWilbur
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in central location but it verges on the "Tenderlion" district which is where you DO NOT want to go - dangerous! - it was noisey with the sounds of police and fire but they give you ear plugs in your room. The staff is very freindly, the service great, the Cityhouse restaurant had great food. Parking is approx $50 a night. Can walk to lots of places as long as you go out the front door and up and away - if I were to stay with just females think I would go to the Westin or Sir Francis Drake - safer and up a block.

Reviews.Title: “Can you say remodel?”
Reviews.Author: TonyPSP
Reviews.Content: This place is tired...the rooms were not clean, dated, and in need of a total remodel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, okay rooms, expensive and awkward internet”
Reviews.Author: JohnNZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights recently. Location just off Market St by Powell Station couldn't be better if you are into the city scene, shopping, etc. Just steps to the MUNI/BART so access to and from the airport is quick and easy. The hotel is quite modern and the rooms are nicely fitted (great 40" widescreen TV with good connections for computer). Bathroom was large and spotlessly clean. But what really let the hotel down for me is their internet policy. $15 a day is out of step with the market. And then their wi-fi system is awkward in that you can't use it for multiple devices - even one at a time. I have a PC that I use for work stuff and then an iPad i like to surf the net with, run my apps etc and that's not unusual these days. Foo - well I don't eat in hotel restaurants so cannot comment about the food. Why eat in when there are so many great restaurants just waiting to be explored!

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond...”
Reviews.Author: seetobylive
Reviews.Content: I find hotels like this frustrating sometimes. Frustrating because they so clearly demonstrate what is achievable by people who care. Now I am left to continue on this life being constantly disappointed with some numb nut thinking I'd appreciate a free desert after judging me by my personal girth. Don't know if you'll be lucky enough to get Brett (Night Manager I believe) but if you do give him another hug from me. He took a late check in and short first visit to San Francisco and turned it into a real treat. Staying here was a last minute idea and we have found a new home in San Fran for sure.... As long as Brett is here to welcome us in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice find, spectacular view, noisy hood”
Reviews.Author: ChrisRogers46
Reviews.Content: Got lucky and found a room here after a convention had emptied out. Front desk staff was charming and helpful, bumped us up to the 24th floor. I'm not often impressed by views, but this was STUNNING! Room was nice, bed great, but I'll remember that view of the city forever. Only negative -- the hotel is on the border of a busy area home to some sketchy types. Lots of winos during the day, sirens and trucks at night.

Reviews.Title: “Central and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: nickodeemus
Reviews.Content: Took the park and stay package which removed the car parking niggle. Used the club level. All good. Nice and central on market - lottsa bums, but that is market...

Reviews.Title: “Served the Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nicole H
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location and it was comfortable. The only reason I wouldnt stay again is that there was no free WIFI and also the restaurant was quite over priced and really not that nice. But the service was good, the bed comftable and room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel location and lobby nice...rooms are okay”
Reviews.Author: Wendymcohen
Reviews.Content: The lobby space of the hotel is great. The rooms were a bit of a surprise compared to the lobby. The rooms look about 20 years old. The real frustrating thing to me was being woken up at midnight to the sounds of a cleaning crew outside of my door. After laying there for over an hour and continuing to hear banging, I got up to see what was going on. Apparently, they decided to clean a series of rooms across the hall at midnight. It was loud and ridiculous and went on for over 2 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Jillacious
Reviews.Content: It's a perfect location if you are into shopping and going to the famous places in San Francisco! The staff are friendly and very helpful if you need something from your room. Clean room, bathroom, great view also from our room when we stayed there! I'd definitely stay in the hotel again on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler187
Reviews.Content: We had a really good time in Parc 55. The location is excellent, just 2 blocks from Union Square, BART station is right in front of the hotel just like the cable car station. We had very warm greeting from the check-in lady, we were upgraded right upon arrival, everything was smooth, rooms are very clean and spacious, the property went through renovation recently so the rooms are really nice, I can just recommend to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: mamagoogoo
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Got a great deal of 30% off 5 nights, in the tower room, with free breakfasts, cocktail hour and desserts in the Club room. Sooooo worth it. The service was wonderful, housekeeping, hospitality....the only problem was noise at night. You are in the city and hear sirens, emergency and police warnings. They supply ear plugs, use them and I recommend them for light sleepers (like myself), my husband didn't hear a thing, but he would sleep through a riot!! Loved the location,close to BART, trolley cars, walking tor restaurants...What more can I say?

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: BigBerns
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights on vacation with my wife. Had a King Bed room on the 25th floor facing the City. Room was nice and clean. Location is good as it is withing walking distance to Union Square and good shopping. Only major complaint is the noise from the streets at night. Having read the reviews on this site prior to booking the hotel, I made sure that we got a room on the upper levels as I had read that the street noise was quite annoying on the lower lever floors. To our surprise, the street noise was very loud despite being 25 floors up. You could hear whatever was going on in the street below as if it was happening in your room. Having travelled quite a bit, this is the first time I have heard anything like this, it felt as if the outside walls and window were paper thin. Our only other complaint was that it seemed difficult to get a taxi in the evening to go out for dinner with there being lineups for taxis and having seemingly little taxis driving by the hotel (could wait 10-15 minutes before getting a taxi). Apart from that, the stay was great and the staff was helpful. If you do not wish to pay the valet parking fee which may be expensive for some, try the Ellis O'Farrell parking garage located two blocks from the hotel. I had a rental car which I parked there overnight for 32$ on a weekday and for 15$ per day on the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good service, some amenities not impressive”
Reviews.Author: Jenny_in_DC
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing, if you're planning to do a lot of public transport or walking. The service was great throughout the stay. I was disappointed with the quality, size, and ventilation in the gym. And I was bummed at the limited/expensive Internet options (no free wifi in the lobby, $15 fee for in-room Internet PER DEVICE).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: lemondrop
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Got a corner room on 19th floor. Circular outside wall that was all windows. Wonderful views. Saw fireworks that seemed to be over ATT Park. Friendly staff, good restaurant and we had the continental breakfast that was plenty for us before we left for Napa. Drawbacks - very slow elevators altho there were plenty and pricey wifi. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A great location for a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Nicky R
Reviews.Content: First of, don't write this off as a business hotel. We stayed here for 5 nights and loved it. The room was a great size on the 29th floor. We were facing the city and was amazed at the view every morning. We had a 40inch HD TV which was very welcome and the bed was very comfortable. It has one of the best locations of any hotels I have stayed at. One the same line as the airport and 5 minutes from the nearest MUNI station.

Reviews.Title: “Great first stop”
Reviews.Author: hotshowbag
Reviews.Content: Great first hotel when arriving on a long flight . Just get off the plane then onto the BART then almost to the front door .Can be a bit expensive at times and we chose another hotel for the weekend but would have loved to stay but quite a large jump in price ,

Reviews.Title: “Oldie but Good Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: katherineiris
Reviews.Content: This is a old hotel that had some upgrades to be modern. I stayed one night to visit up to tour Golden Gate and up to Napa. This hotel strikes me as very Business and uptight. I did find the staff helpful and I loved the lounge/restaurantas I stopped for breakfast. The parking is very high so maybe consider an alternative. For a good deal on orbitz or expedia it was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Visit to smooth thai a must!”
Reviews.Author: HCT120
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel over the Labor Day weekend. I had booked 2 king bed rooms through hotels.com and was told on arrival that there were no rooms available. After kicking up a fuss and asking for a discount on each room the receptionist was suddenly able to magic 2 rooms with king beds out of nowhere. When I arrived in the room I was impressed. Very comfortable bed, decent bathroom and flat screen tv, and a pretty good view. The hotel is close to Union Square and the start of the Trolley route although if you are going to use the trolley, would recommend that you walk up to the next stop on the Trolley route and get on there rather than queueing for half an hour at the start! My only criticism is that the room had a connecting door to the next room, and therefore there was quite a bit of noise which I could have done without. I ate in the Smooth Thai restaurant twice during my stay. Very good service, value for money and great food.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in convenient area”
Reviews.Author: redsamp11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business conference and was not disappointed. Hotel was well kept and rooms were clean. Staff was friendly. Hotel was in great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: themonstersmom
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a couple of different times and have always enjoyed it. The staff is amazing, the rooms are well done and clean. This time we were given a room on the 30th floor. Fabulous views of the bay and Union Square area. BART is literally across the street as is the main Cable Car turn around. There are resturaunts all around from fast food to expensive fancy places. Anytime you stay in this general area of SF the cost is going to be alot more than other locations. This hotel has great specials and rates. We have stayed at other hotels near this one and paid twice as much for less. Parking is expensive but not any higher than other area hotels. One minor complaint is that the elevators are super slow. They have 6 or more elevators but never seem to be running all of them at the same time. If you are on a higher floor it will take forever to get up or down. Also breakfast buffet is way overpriced! $24 a person for not much more than what you get free at Holiday Inn is a little much. Overall this is a great hotel. We will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The epitome of service”
Reviews.Author: Bill M
Reviews.Content: These people go 360 degrees out of their way to provide you with anything you want or need. Jennifer in the lounge is the most astute hostess I've ever seen. The concierge does not even know the word no.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with upscale ambience”
Reviews.Author: TA_Parag
Reviews.Content: I typically care about two things - location and the quality of rooms. Location wise, you can't beat this. It's a 2 minute walk from Union Sq and right by Market St as well as the Bart and the Trolley. It's always a toss up between the Marina versus Union Sq, and as a very frequent traveller, I think Union Sq is far more convenient. The rooms seem to have been recently renovated. There is a fresh look about the decor and the finishes. The size of the rooms is VERY substantial by typical San Francisco standards. Also, request a high floor because the views are fantastic. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel for great value to the upscale customer.

Reviews.Title: “Actually 3 blocks from Union Square”
Reviews.Author: BizTravelman
Reviews.Content: This isn’t a bad hotel, but there were several things I found annoying. First, this hotel says it’s “just a block from Union Square”. Huh? Check any map. It’s easily 3 blocks and several turns to Union Square. Mind you it’s not terribly far, but this is just false advertising, plain and simple. On my stay I paid big bucks for a Club Level room. The room was decent, but the Club (3 floors up) was disappointing; primarily the food. The evening fare was sparse: a cheese assortment, a lettuce only salad, and meatballs. Later in the evening they offered just two desert items that were virtually identical. Compared to other hotel club offerings, the food variety here was mediocre at best. But the real outrage was the fire alarm testing that occurred on several floors – obviously mine. Upon checking in this was NOT mentioned. When I got to the room there was a written notice, but it implied that sometime between 11am and 3pm, someone would need to access the room and check out the alarm siren. In reality, the alarm siren IN MY ROOM (incredibly loud even with ear plugs) went on and off for 4 hours. Work or rest was impossible. When I finally couldn’t take it any longer, they did offer to move me to a regular room on the 5th floor. The hassle of packing and unpacking wasn’t worth it for 45 more minutes of agony and the downgrade to a regular room. As for me, I won’t be returning.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: lizzieloola
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and it was a very pleasant experience. We had never been to San Francisco before and we were really looking forward to it. The hotel was central to everything, cable cars, trams, underground, shops etc. The porters were exceptionally courteous and attentive and the front staff were efficient and helpful. Our hotel room was lovely and very very clean.The decor was beautiful and well maintained throughout the hotel. We used the concierge quite a bit and they were extremely helpful & knowledgeable. Overall, this hotel made our stay in San Francisco a very memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Definite must stay in the Bay”
Reviews.Author: Tito G
Reviews.Content: I started staying at the Parc55 in June and havent looked back...On paper its a 4 star hotel but its really a 5...i cant believe they are rated the 45th best hotel in San Fran on here...Thats absolutely preposturous. They are easily, EASILY #1...im a very frequent traveler to San Fran and ive stayed everywhere...ever since the Parc, i havent looked back. Ive stayed there 17 times this Summer...the rooms are huge, and if you get a small room, its not "small" at all. its normal size...excellent rates, with wiggle room sometimes. You just have to ask at a hotel for a discount...there is a fine line between the hotel staff/front desk being overly nice (and seemingly fake, i hate that) and hotel staff being not nice. This staff from top to bottom seems very attentive,which i attribute to the managers because all shifts are cool.They wanna know how you're doing, is everything ok, etc...but they do it without bothering the [---] out of you and being phony and overly nice (which happens alot in the hospitality industry..again, i hate when people are phony) So yeah...the Hotel is great top to bottom with all the Bells and Whistles....cant find a better location, its in the heart of downtown San Fran...Theres a super Posh shopping district on the East side and a super seedy neighborhood called "The Tenderloin" on the West side if you are into that kind of stuff. No worries about safety here, big burly security guards everywhere with the suits and earpieces (which is a bit much for me, but im sure the Simpleton traveler will feel secure)....the price of the hotel may seem a bit high,but compared to other hotels, especially the lower starred ones, its a great bargain....The drawbacks of the hotel is parking is expensive, but unlike other hotels and garages, you get to go in and out, so its not bad. The hotel store is a bit small (and they are aggressive trying to unload their goods...just say "hey man, i want a pack of smokes and THATS IT" to offset this)...stay here for sure, if you dont you are blowing it..... i might look like a plant or a mark with this rainbows and waterfalls review, im not. I just stay there quite frequently and i always tell a manager how happy i am with the joint and the manager said "cool, you should write a review"...so i did.....anyways great hotel and staff. respect all around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: veebeeque
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be very nice. The front desk staff was extremely friendly, the rooms were very spacious, it was quiet. Very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Union Square, fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: Cathy090911
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel online the night before I arrived and requested early check in (flew in 9am) and high floor. On arrival was fortunate to check in immediately into a corner room on 23rd floor. View from room was stunning from two large windows. Great desk to work from looking out of one of the windows, great large screen TV, good bathroom and really comfortable king sized bed with 7 pillows. Couldn't fault the room. Whilst the hotel is unassuming from the outside with a somewhat bland reception area, the staff were great, printing out the BART timetable for me when I asked if they knew how often the trains ran the next night when I was leaving. Very convienent Union Square location across the road from the BART station (ideal if travelling light from the airport and costs only $8.10 each way) and accross the road from the SF visitor centre and perfect location if you like shopping as all the major shopping is located in Union Square. Will stay there again on my next trip to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: woolly546
Reviews.Content: Very good location almost opposite Powell St Cable Car. Plenty of restaurants close by with reasonable prices. Hotel offers some very good room deals on its website. Staff very pleasant, good sized rooms, clean and tidy. Only downside was breakfast very expensive-however plenty of lower prices deals close by.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, good conference facilities, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: JB24SD
Reviews.Content: convenient via BART train from the airport, and in interesting walking distance from Chinatown, piers and ferries, shopping if you like that sort of thing, financial district. close to cable cars for fun, and restaurants nearby are varied from fast food to elegant. Expensive but worth it. this is not a same-as-every-city hotel. wish they had a pool but San Francisco offers great walks for business-trip workouts.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with good amenities”
Reviews.Author: Wsh2905
Reviews.Content: Not inexpensive but a very nice hotel. Junior suite was worth the extra money. Staff was very considerate. Wrth the money!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: linglor2
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, friendly staff, convenient location, will go there again. but abit overpriced

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: kobrien3
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel option near Union Square. The lobby is attractive and updated, the rooms are perfectly clean, and the staff are helpful. We were upgraded to a room with a fantastic view on the 22nd floor at no charge, so that certainly helped our hotel experience. Overall, Parc 55 proved to be a great deal for the price ($144/night). We would certainly stay here again on our next trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located and Good Services”
Reviews.Author: cool_hale
Reviews.Content: We booked this through kayak.com at discounted price for my five day stay at this hotel. The price was reasonable for such kind of location near Union Square. All services were of decent standard as expected from this rate of hotel. Internet connectivity was an issue which I got resolved through their help-line. Overall it was a nice stay here for my business related trip.

Reviews.Title: “Pay Extra to Stay in a Club Room!”
Reviews.Author: Shaynassister
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy a personalized, friendly hotel experience, this is not the place for you. This is a very large hotel with the feel of a busy airport. The ground floor restaurant/bar lacks any kind of atmosphere or intimacy. If we had paid $125 like a previous reviewer, my review would have been less critical. But paying over $200 (with taxes), I noticed that the carpets in our "clean air" room were stained and when I turned over the cushions on the 2 chairs, it was obvious that the undersides had not been vacuumed recently. The bathroom electrical outlet was grubby, although when I called housekeeping, they were ready to change it immediately. When I pointed out some small black dots on the edge of the bedskirt, we were moved to a Club room. Why? Because the management of the hotel takes even a remote possibility of an infestation very seriously. I have to give them full credit for this: they offered to launder all our belongings (not necessary, since we had just arrived), and sent someone to move our luggage to a new room.
