We were repeatedly told that they take this issue seriously and we could see that this is really the case. Several men wearing gloves came into the room as we were leaving, and proceeded to take the room apart. I think that their quick and decisive actions were admirable and speak to a high level of operational efficiency. We LOVED the Club room that they upgraded us to; it also included evening snacks, desserts and an honor bar, as well as a lovely breakfast in the 31st floor Club Lounge with a gorgeous view of the city. I would totally recommend paying $30-40 more per night for a Club room; it's well worth it! So, although I was originally intending to rate the hotel as a 3, because of their swift, decisive actions and also the fabulous Club room experience, I think it merits a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 831jen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here three times all on business. Love the location. It's a quick walk to union square shopping. And the rooms even the basic ones are nice. I always feel safe here. The Cobb salad from room service is to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service at a reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: Loonbeam
Reviews.Content: Room Type: Standard Double (Booked King but not avail on arrival and did not want to wait) Rate Paid: $199 per night Cornference Rate Reason For Stay: Tradeshow Overall Average Score: 8.5/10 Location - 10/10 (with a caveat) If you are doing business in the Union Square area or attending an event at Moscone, the location is great. Walk to Moscone is less than 10 minutes, The hotel's location right at Market Street makes for easy access to public transit (major station - 1 block) , cable cars (powell line - less than one block) - and many shops and dining. The caveat: For tourist visits I would still recommend the Fisherman's Wharf area, but this would not be a bad backup plan. Room Design - 8/10 Nothing special (rather bland) but everything was clean and well maintained. The large windows of the rooms do allow a bit of road noise in (not too bad depending on where you are facing and level. The hotel offers complimentary earplugs, but if you are sensitive I would also suggest a high floor and facing the back side. I only had issues with a trash truck being very loud one morning. Room Amenities - 7/10 Standard amenities but a nice selection of them, plenty of towels on arrival. A refrigerator would be a nice addition, and as always $4+ for bottled water in the room is absurd. There is a charge for high speed internet ($50 per week!), although it is included in some rates. Design and Layout - 8/10 The registration area is on the second floor and depending on how you go up not immediately easy to spot. Amenities - Non Club - 8/10 There is a not too overpriced gift shop on the 2nd floor and a coffee shop on ground level outside valet parking. Not being in the hotel much due to the trade show I was unable to check out fitness facilities. Club Room - Not applicable this visit Hotel Staff - 10/10 From the bell staff to the check-in staff, everyone was very pleasant and friendly and willing to help! Dining - Did not use this trip Comments and Notes: The Parc 55 is a clean, well maintained business hotel in a decent location. If you can get a good rate, its an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Navygasser
Reviews.Content: Woke up several times because of noise from the party goers on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Edge of Tenderloin, otherwise great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ROCKintheUSA
Reviews.Content: Recently completed a trip here on a priceline bid of $125 a night which for pricey and overtaxed San Fran is a steal. First the bad news: When I arrived, the place was overbooked and had the longest line for reception I have literally ever seen, and I've been to 5 continents, stayed at dozens of hotels. Next, do not, repeat do not walk west from this hotel particularly after dark. San Fran is one of the most vagrant-infested cities in the Western Hemisphere (they seem to like it that way) and I grew up in NYC, so I should know. The hotel sits right on the border of tourist district and the Tenderloin, which is replete with some of the scariest meth and crackheads this side of jail. My sincere advice. Do not walk west. Every other direction is fine, as Union Square is just to the north/northeast and the mall is right across the street eastward. The room was nice, hotel staff nice, but I wouldnot pay above 200 a night for this due to the location, unless part of your itinerary includes massages, buying drugs and or getting into fistfights with homeless people. Also, another huge negative, we were on the 25th floor and we could still CLEARLY here the constant sirens, so either SF has super sirens or the glass windows were astoundingly cheap. Again, I gre up in NYC, so sirens are nothing new to me, but this is one noisy city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: vacationer519
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled here over the Labor Day holiday. The hotel looks a little dated on the outside but has been totally redone on the inside. We had heard that the check in can take a little while but we only had to wait about 10 minutes. Now the next night we did notice a line of about 10 people waiting to check in so maybe we just got lucky. The rooms are what you expect out of any hotel. They were very clean and the beds were comfy. Yes you can hear sirens outside during the night but they provide earplugs if it bothers you bad enough. My suggestion is to ask for a room on one of the upper floors. We stayed on the 22nd floor and it wasn't too bad. The restaurant is nice and we found all of the staff to be very friendly. This hotel is located in a very convenient place. Only a few steps out the door is an entrance to the Bart station and since it is in Union Square there are tons of stores and shops within walking distance. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: viccatbar
Reviews.Content: This is a pleasant hotel in an excellent location near to BART and other transportation. Perfect for getting in from the airport which on BART takes about 30 mins. We were on the 17th floor and the noise through the windows from traffic was still obscene. They give you ear plug in the room so that says it all. However, we wear ear plugs anyway on a night so used our own and weren't too disturbed. We weren't concerned about safety even though you can get straight into the lifts without seeing staff as the lobby is on the 1st floor. Wifi is quite expensive at $15 for a day but there is free wii at the strbucks just round the conner. Worth a stay, just bring your own earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary celebration”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler10057
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a fitness room and it was very spacious. The front desk staff was very courteous and although we had two reservations ensured that we did not have to move rooms. The breakfast buffet was provided with our package and it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Typical large city hotel - with some added annoyances”
Reviews.Author: desidou
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. It's HUGE, so you don't get the personal service of a small, boutique hotel. We checked in and had a room with two beds, I asked to be moved to a room with 1 bed and was denied citing "We're really full". Funny that a friend of mine staying in the same hotel on the same dates was switched from a 1 bed room to a 2 bed one with no issues. I suppose it's the luck of the draw on who you get at the check in desk. Our room was okay, typical hotel room. The high speed internet had issues and my husband (who was working from the hotel room for the week) had to call tech support because the connection kept dropping. The ability to have a wired connection was the main reason we chose this hotel and the connection was still unreliable. I should add that this hotel charges for high speed internet access, which is terribly annoying since most places offer it for free these days - and to have it be unreliable only added to the annoyance. The area of town (Union Square) is noisy as I found staying in the area last year. The hotel provides earplugs in the bathrooms as an amenity. I found a sound machine app on my phone worked better than the earplugs. The walls are also paper thin in this hotel. We didn't hear much during the week - perhaps our neighboring rooms were quiet business travelers or unoccupied. Come the weekend, though - we heard EVERYTHING in the rooms next to us. I even knew the cell phone ring of the occupant in the room next door and could hear every word of his conversation. That's no fun, especially when your neighbors come in at 1AM from a night on the town and want to loudly tell one another stories. Not a pleasant way to be woken up in the middle of the night. One more thing - the internet charge is not per ROOM, it's per DEVICE that you use to connect to the internet. We had two laptops and had two charges on the bill and had to get that resolved. I even called down to the front desk at the beginning of our stay to confirm that the charge was per ROOM and not per DEVICE. The phone was answered by someone who did not understand the language well and she just kept saying "Yes", so I repeated my question and just got a "yes" response. Upon check out, I explained my conversation, cited the date and the extra charge was removed. I am still annoyed greatly that (1) there is a charge for high speed internet access (2) the connection was unreliable at best and (3) the charge is per device, not per room. I think that's a bit greedy, if you ask me. Oh, and our TV didn't work, so we had to call for assistance with that, too. The cable was bad or something to that effect. It was still annoying. I have an annual conference in SF and I probably won't stay here again. There are too many other hotels in this area to deal with the annoyances I experienced in my week here. Oh well :/

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: todd k
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights for a vacation trip to San Francisco, and loved our time at the Parc 55! The staff was excellent: the concierge was extremely helpful and the front desk was very accommodating to us. We had a corner room with an excellent view of the city thanks to two walls of windows. One of our concerns was hearing the city noise, but that was not an issue. There was no problem sleeping at night. (Make sure the window vent flaps are closed!) The room was kept very clean during our stay. We were able to get anywhere using the many forms of public transportation which are all very close by. We would definitely stay here again on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Trusted the reviews and will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Kim H
Reviews.Content: I spent over three weeks combing over reviews for the Union Square area of San Francisco. It came down to Parc 55 and smaller boutique hotel. I trusted the reviewers and knew what I was getting myself into before I chose Parc 55. First I did ask for a higher floor and Secondly, asked that it be away from the elevators. Those were two common recommendations that I read in the reviews. For my stay, the room was clean and comfortable and just the right size for just me. I ate breakfast there all four days and although the prices were a bit steep, the breakfast was freshly prepared and delicious. Although I might tried to find a breakfast alternative, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Another business trip and another hotel”
Reviews.Author: colesyboy1978
Reviews.Content: I popped to SF from the UK for 2 days, for work. Being English I got the BART from SFO to downtown. My US friends say I'm mad getting a train, but it's so easy (30 mins). Getting off at Powell St station, the hotel is just 3mins walk away. Simple. Reception great you and sort out the room Witt little or no fuss. Sometimes you queue but really this is just minutes of waiting, not a lifetime. Getting my room key I get one of the half dozen lifts and I'm in. Clean, spacious and quiet. After an afternoon walking about SF I sleep like a baby in a very big comfortable bed. In the morning I use the gym (big and lots of equipment) and go for breakfast. Breakfast is about $25, perhaps cheaper to book as part of the room but I didn't check. My only compliant was the hotel bar closing at 1am. I'm used to bars staying open later in hotels, bit maybe it wasn't a bad thing!!! The hotel is well located, by BART, next to a big mall, a short walk from the designer shops (union sq) and near a collection of food, drinking and other outlets. In comparison to other SF hotels, the location is perfect. You're not far from anyone. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but better choices close by”
Reviews.Author: KTNashTN
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Aug/Sept for a conference. The location is great. The room was large & the bed was really comfortable. However it didn't matter due to the all night extremely loud street noise that kept me awake most nights. Housekeeping was inconsistent. Dirty glasses stayed on the floor in the hall all week. Room service got my breakfast order wrong. Wouldn't choose this hotel again with all the choices within a couple blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: IJKBF
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the hotel in 2+ years and on arrival Michael was as attentive and helpful as ever and importantly, knowledgeable of what is going on in the city. Check in was quick and as before, we stayed in a Club level room on 33rd floor which was clean and tidy. Shortly after arrival Housekeeping knocked the door to ensure we had everything we required, which was considerate and a nice touch. The two Queen sized beds were comfortable but note are similar to UK double bed size, not King. View out over the city was excellent with Giants stadium to our right, Alcatraz island just visible to our left, Union Square is 5-10 mins walk and Powell Street turnaround is just round the corner. However, even though we were high up in the building you can still hear police sirens during the night as street noise funnels up between the high rise buildings. Also, as the hotel is in the financial quarter/slightly downtown of the city there are a number of homeless/down and outs wandering around. These did not cause us any problems but may be unsettling to those who are less well travelled or of a nervous disposition. Club breakfast is continental style/reasonable, with cereals, cold meats etc. and the three staff present could not have been more attentive in finding English tea for us! The hotel reception area is spacious and has several pieces of nice, decorative artwork around. Overall, we enoyed our stay at the Parc 55 which was comparable to our previous visit there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good quality”
Reviews.Author: TCARBONNEL
Reviews.Content: We got a room in the executive floor with a city view : - room are very clean and comfortale - marvellous view Breakfast at the executuve lounge was OK, but not exceptionnal and crowded. Fitness center is very good with a lot appliances. Business center is not OK : printer doesn't work during our stat, low speed internet connection. It is not acceptable for a such standing hotel. Internet connection in the rrom is not free and was very expensive. This was a problem.

Reviews.Title: “I will be going back!”
Reviews.Author: Anita B
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay, my cousin and I went the 19th thru 23, .this was my treat to myself for my 50th birthday. If you friend the hotel on facebook, they have specials on there rooms. When I first registered my room, i started off with 4 nights at 20% off, so it was a $199 a night that went to $159 I belive. The hotel would run specials for certain dates, I ended up getting my room for $125 a night. Sounds good to me! If you coming to San Francisco, the Parc is the best hotel if you want to stay in Union Square where everything is. It's right at the Powell train station, up the stairs and you walk across the street you are at the hotel. You have to look carefully when booking rooms in expensive cities such as SF, especially if you feel you need to get a car. If you are coming for pleasure and are staying in Union Square, you don't need a car. The parking in the hotels garages are very expensive. You have the trolleys cars, the Muni, sightseeing tour buses, and if you like walking you don't need a rental car. I can go on and on, but overall, that was my first time in the city and third time to California. I love SF and Parc is my choice for when I go back. We had double beds, the beds are very comfortable. I loved the place! We were on the 13th floor, whether you were on the 32 floor of the first floor, you are going to hear the sirens regardless!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Great Service. Very nice suite.”
Reviews.Author: SCTO42
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights on a short business trip and was very happy with my experience. The hotel is a short BART ride from SFO to Powell and a short walk to the hotel entrance. The hotel is modern and inviting for a corporate type hotel. The bar is better than most corporate hotels and the Sunset Suite was large, clean and with very nice views. The hotel is close to shopping, Bart and Union Square. The Front Desk was capable, but nothing special. I would stay here again without thinking twice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Allyson S
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel very modern and chic. I was lucky enough to stay on the Club Floor and had a great breakfast compliments of the hotel for being on that floor. My room overlooked the downtown area and the view was stunning from the 31st floor. The staff was very polite and helpful for my first SF experience. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was very spacious. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it for others.

Reviews.Title: “A Memorable Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Luna_Lover827
Reviews.Content: I booked directly online with the hotel. I got a better rate, using my AAA discount, than booking through expedia, travelocity, etc. My husband and I were celebrating our 1 yr anniversary in SF and chose this hotel because it was centrally located in Union Square and got a lot of good reviews. When I booked the room, I mentioned that we were celebrating our anniversary and, upon arrival, were given a free room upgrade to the executive club level (29th floor). Our room had a beautiful view of the city. We were also given access to the club lounge where breakfast is served daily and hors d' oeuvres and dessert are served at certain times of the day. The hotel is very clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and clean also. The hotel is just a very short walk to the cable cars and Powell Station (where you can catch BART and muni metro). We well definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great location, very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ViajerosMAD
Reviews.Content: + Excellent down town San Francisco location. Just a short walk from the bart from the airport to the hotel (powel station); Perfect location to explore the city! easy walk to shopping and restaurants without hills. very close to Union Square. Short walk to all the main attractions and also you can easily get the trams/buses to Fishermans wharf and the other tourist attractions. + Friendly staff , because of our special occasion they offered us an upgrade in check-in. helpful and accommodating staff. + Fantastic room: good size (spacious), clean, and with great views and good bathroom. - Would prefer shower had glass enclosure, rather than curtain. Everything was great, very good value for money. Would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, fairly standard chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: off-for-a-ride
Reviews.Content: This was a very convenient hotel for a business trip to Union Square. The rooms and service are pretty much standard fair for a chain hotel so nothing much to write about. Average.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sleephla
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay here based on the good reviews and the deal we got on Expedia. This was a sub-par at best experience. First the good: The Parc 55 is centrally located at Union Square so if you're in to shopping, this would be your place. It was easy to get to off of I-80. There was an LCD TV (to which you would expect paying over $175/night for a hotel). That's about the jist of the good things. Here's what it didn't have: We booked a room with a king bed... yeah, they didn't have any available. We were stuck with two full beds. Wi-fi was extra $15 per day, parking was an extra $50/night (had no choice), the hotel is also centrally located to a gang of ambulances. Understandably, this isn't the hotel's fault, but being on a higher floor (floor 29), you would expect it be less noisy. Not the case. We were both up a majority of the night every 20 minutes because of this. No fridge, no microwave. Bathroom and shower were fine, room was okay size, elevators were good. All in all, it was nothing that you couldn't get from a travelodge for a hundred bucks cheaper per night. The staff were kind and friendly, as were the valet guys. But, being that there are hundreds of hotels in SF, I would definitely recommend staying somewhere else, unless you have a huge fix to shop and that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: cope2945
Reviews.Content: We needed two hotel rooms for four adults. We arrived a few hours earlier than check-in, and the front desk made one of the rooms available immediately. We used the concierge desk every day, and their recommendations were superior. The restaurant/lounge was a great place for a quick breakfast in the morning or drink at night. We would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, fun location, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: lettezilla
Reviews.Content: Month long roadtrip means a lot of nights in hotels and motels. This was the first place where we decided to splash out a little, and also to stay for 2 nights. We got a corner room with a great view over the bay and city, and the room was huge and very comfortable. Sheets were super soft, and it was very easy to relax here. Service was super friendly, and check in and out were both pretty easy. Valet parking is very expensive here, I think $45/day? So we looked online and found a garage around the corner that was $25/day. No in and out, but we didn't want to drive, so were happy to save a few bucks. Only other note I'd make is that the front neighborhood was fancypants, but if you go around the back, you're in the Tenderloin, which is...colorful. There are a lot of homeless shelters and people sleeping rough here, only a few blocks away from this luxury hotel. Didn't feel threatened at all, but I can imagine it might be a new experience for someone that hasn't been to a big city before? We loved the location-- went to Dottie's for breakfast one morning and BlueBottle Coffee for breakfast and coffee the second day. Also enjoyed cocktails at Bourbon and Branch's secret detective agency, and cheap but tasty bahn mi sandwiches for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “good enough”
Reviews.Author: vincentinparis
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 enjoys a convenient location just above Powell Street station -great if you're coming in on BART from the airport, for example - and spitting distance from Union Square. Upper floors have decent views. Otherwise, there is little to distinguish it from other chain hotels around. Pleasant service, nice rooms, no surprises.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel view the night views”
Reviews.Author: TiggerGalHollister
Reviews.Content: We took a fun trip for my husbands birthday with family and little ones. The staff all greeted us with a smile upon entering the hotel. Our rooms were very clean and a little noisy but what do you expect you are high up. Great view of the city and the Giants Stadium. Their Lounge on the higher floors has a great Continental Breakfast that is offered for the higeher rooms. The only down point was not haveing a restaurant that really fit towards little kids as well. Great Amenities!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: s_ton003
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 (2 teens) stayed in 2 rooms. Check in easy rooms well furnished clean with good bathrooms. The hotel is well located to get access to shopping mall, BART, MUNI, street cars. It is also close to Union Square and unfortunately is the central point for SF's homeless community. Therefore expect to be asked constantly if you can spare any change in that area. The hotel restaurant served a great breakfast a la carte breakfasts were better than the buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: bekkSanDiego
Reviews.Content: For the price this hotel is just average. I booked with American Express. Our flight was delayed and by the time we checked in it was 11:30pm. The 2 doubles room I had booked was not available. They told me rooms booked with Travelocity are not guaranteed for room type. I told them I used Amex... and they said Amex is the same as Travelocity. Live and learn. They put us in a room with a king and brought in a roll-away. My trip was a shopping trip with 2 teenage girls. I let the girls sleep on the King and i took the roll-away. The walking space was pretty tight with the rollaway. I wasn't terribly upset that they did not have my 2 doubles room because the room they put us in on the 29th floor was an upgrade of sorts, since the higher up you are, the less street noise. The room was clean and had a tub and shower. There was a nice size flat screen tv and a large bay window with a city view. There was an in-room one cup at a time coffee maker.... but I never use these as the water tank areas are always cruddy and gross... this one was no exception. There was no refrigerator. There were two nice robes in the closet for use. Towels were good quality, as was water pressure. When I went to use the business center to print out boarding passes all the printers were empty with no paper. It took me 40 mnutes to get someone to reload the printers. That was pretty annoying. My other experiences with staff were better and mostly above average. Next time I will stay at the Powell Hotel across the street - as it is a better value in the same great location.... and I don't mind the smaller rooms of a botique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to see San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: familytrippers_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Parc 55 for 5 nights during our visit to San Francisco. We chose it for its central location, club breakfast,.price and the good reviews on TA. We were not disappointed. Everything touristy was easily accessible. Large shopping centre across the street. Check in was quick. I was slightly disappointed as I had booked directly with the hotel 9 months previous and had requested a corner room. However I was told that this was not possible as the rooms were all occupied. It didnt matter really as we still had a good view over the city and out to the bay from the 28th floor. The room was compact but not cramped (2 adults and 2 teenage boys). It was nicely furnished and spotlessly clean. Bathroom was a good size and shower was powerful. The hotel itself was quiet as was the aircon. There was some traffic noise and music from a club across the street but that didnt affect our sleep. Turn down service each evening and mints on pillow. Club breakfast on the 31st floor was included in the price of our room. Only one morning (Monday) proved to be very very busy.( no where to sit and no plates or cutlery) The other mornings were pleasurable. Unlimited tea, coffee and fresh juice. Cereals, pastries, toast, cheese, ham, boiled eggs, fresh fruit and yoghurt. Selection of different finger foods between 5pm and 7.30pm tea and coffee and an open bar. Dessert from 7.30pm til 10pm. Good gym although we didnt use it. Bar and restaurant inside hotel but again didnt use this. Well stocked hotel shop. We had a great stay and would recommend to anyone looking for a clean comfortable modern hotel in an accessible area.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GemC1985
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying here, the lady who checked us in was very nice and helpful and our room was upgraded to a junior suit without the extra cost. I think the suit would maybe be a little pricey but from what I saw, the other rooms were perfectly adequate. Clean and right in union square near plently of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: mollymop
Reviews.Content: We expected some street noise but not the constant noise from the hallway, elevators, ice machine, maintenance room and especially the paper thin walls, we were also subjected to extremely loud snoring, voices and tv on both nights. We returned to the hotel mid afternoon to take a quick nap as we were having a very late night and were tired from walking most of the day. Luckily, we were in our room when someone gave a very quick knock on the door and when I asked who was there they just opened the door and say they were checking on us. Before I could get to the door to talk to them they were gone without saying who they were, there was no sign of anyone in the hallway when I opened the door. We asked to speak to the manager on duty but this turned out to be a waste of time. He first said he could not say who would do this and thought that it was the maid wanting to clean the room. This had been done earlier in the day. He then suggested it was a staff member checking to see if we had used the water for sale in the room but they did not mention this or ask to come in the room to see for themselves (we also had read on the website that water was complimentary but it actually costs $4.50 a bottle)! Finally, the manager said he could check to see who last used a key in our door but he never bothered to contact us again. He did give us a $25 voucher for use in the bar where the staff were extremely nice. We decided to cut our stay short and left the next day. We felt the security in the elevator area was non existent as anyone can walk in from the street and access the elevators. This is definitely not a four star hotel in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “good environment & good service!”
Reviews.Author: joey t
Reviews.Content: the location is great & it's very convenient to shopping and taking the tram to travel within downtown & fisherman's wharf. The staffs are nice with good service. I'll stay there again if I travel to S. F. next time.

Reviews.Title: “Started rough, but the hotel made up for it.”
Reviews.Author: Ledsak
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during our trip up the California coast. We booked the room on Hotwire and got a pretty good deal. When we arrived, we were a little worried because the outside of the hotel looks a tad outdated, but once inside, the hotel has been completely modernized. We were given our room keys and headed to our room. To our dismay when we arrived in the room, it had not been cleaned after the last guests had checked out. Obviously a bit surprizing, but not unheard of (mistakes happen). We called downstairs and complained and they sent a bellman up with new keys to another room. When we arrived in the new room, not only were we upgraded a few floors, but they had given us a suite. The room had an amazing view (when it wasn't foggy - which isn't often in SF). There is a great bar in the hotel and there are many restaurants, diners, and other shops all within walking distance. All in all, the hotel made up for their mistake and we would definately go back if we are in SF again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and security lapses”
Reviews.Author: Irishstandards
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, comfortable if dated rooms, clean bathrooms and excellent location! As for the rest....well I had room 725...there is a very good reason they supply earplugs in the bathroom...For the two nights I was here I didnt manage a full nights sleep once! The noise from the street below was horrific. The windows were not insulated enough and the noise seemed constant. I have stayed here before and managed to get rooms on the other side which doesnt seem as bad (the hotel is L shaped, if you can get rooms on the side that looks onto the other wing of the hotel you may be slightly better off noise wise). As well as the noise I found that my Air Condistioning was ineffective and provided very little cool air, certainly not enough to keep the room at my required temperature. On top of that I found the bathroom flooded everytime I used the shower regardless of how I arranged the shower curtain which could present a safety issue for some. But perhaps my greatest concern about this hotel is security. The lobby is a level up from the entrance. I arrived in the hotel a 11pm on a Saturday evening only to find the entrance level empty of all apart from one rather aggressive homeless man who had clearly wandered in. As I made my way to the lifts he tried to follow me. The lifts have no key access so they are open to everyone who enters the hotel and anyone can gain access to the room floors. He tried to follow me into the lift but I told him not to, to which I got a hurl of abuse shouted at me. This should not have happened under any circumstances especially in an area which is known for it homeless just outside the hotel. All in all I would not recommend this hotel for any reason other then its location and only then if there was little else available!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - rudest and unfriendliest staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: spalatin_01
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Parc 55 started as the worst trip ever. We arrived at 3.30 p.m. with an exhausted preschool kid after hours and hours on the road. The woman at the front desk was unbelievable rude to me. She said that there was no room for us ready (note: we had absolutely no extra wishes, just an ordinary king or queen room) and we had to wait at least another 60 minutes for any kind of room. She behaved in an really aggressive way and the interaction with her was so unpleasant. So I went back to my nearly crying little kid and watched guest after guest checking in without any problems! After 30 minutes I could not stand the wait any more and returned to the front desk where (by chance!) I was warmly greeted by one of the guest managers. He was so helpful, offered us a choice of rooms and could not in any way explain why the rude lady refused to check me in. He told me, that they had plenty of rooms (now and 30 minutes ago!) and apologized for his staff. The rest of the stay was unspectacular, the room was nice, the view was good, the food (we tried the bar and room service several times) was tasty. The only thing is I cannot forget about the encounter at the registration desk. I am a very frequent traveller and we have been (with and without our little kid) in 5-star-hotels around the globe. Never before I have been treated in such a rude and hateful way. I dont know if I would return to this hotel (despite the overall stay really was ok) but I am kind of traumatized.

Reviews.Title: “This was our second visit to this hotel -- we love it!”
Reviews.Author: JillD1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel -- friendly and helpful staff, nice clean, modern rooms. Great location close to shopping, movies and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “We were so well treated and would love to be back”
Reviews.Author: Mejap
Reviews.Content: The location of the Wyndham in San Francisco is just fantastic. One block from the beginning of the cable car ride, and across the street from some fantastic shopping. The hotel itself is very appealing, clean and comfortable and the staff very helpful. We were travelling with my daughter and grandaughters and wanted rooms that were close by. When we arrived the first night, we were quite late and that was not possible. The next morning we were able to switch rooms and we were placed in a beautiful room right next to my daughter on the 27th floor with a fantastic view of San Francisco by night. Because we were on the 27th floor, this gave us access to the 30th floor club which served a continental breakfast every monring, serve hors d<oeuvres at 5 p.m. and desert at l0 p.m. We found this very appealing and was well worth the extra few dollars. There is a concierge on location who knew her stuff and was very very helpful in discussing with us the many things there are to see and do in San Francisco. Her tips were very useful for our stay. All in all staying at the Wyndham was a wonderful experience and I would definitely stay there again if I go back to San Fran. This experience has made me want to stay in other hotels owned by this Chain.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: RichardE_8
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 3 nights in a spacious, clean and reasonably appointed room on 12th floor. Easy walking access to the BART rail system, trams, shops etc. Wifi a bit pricey at US$15/day ! Noisy streets below but that is San Fran. Didn't use the restaurant but looked OK. Great cafe called Daniel's next door.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: roxy12c
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient to all the attractions. But OMG, parking is very expensive. It is about 50 per day. We decided to park around the corner for 25 per night. This place did not have in and out privileges, so we did the attractions that needed driving then we parked for the night We stayed on the 31 floor. We had a view ofw the city andq the bay. The view in the day and the night was amazing. Waking up to this views is priceless.

Reviews.Title: “A formerly good hotel that needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: arizonaac
Reviews.Content: I wind up returning to hotels that I had positive experience at over the years. I had not stayed at the Parc 55 in over 10 years and I doubt I will return. There are far too many 4-star hotels in San Francisco to stay at one that needs to be remodeled. I will say the bed was wonderful but the rest of the room was pure trash.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Ana O
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Parc55 for business a few weeks ago and had a pleasant experience - the hotel is nicely decorated and very clean. The bed was comfortable but the non-feather pillows (I have allergies so I had to use the foam ones) were not comfy - feather ones seemed great though. You do hear any hallway noise from your room, so if you are a very light sleeper, try to get a room at the end of a hall. At Check in and Check out, there was only one staff member there to process me so it took a little while, but they were helpful and friendly. Internet is a good price but painfully, painfully slow, so bring a wireless card or maybe try to business center, the land line internet may be faster.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Bit Pricey”
Reviews.Author: CoastCrystal
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about staying here after I read the reviews on the discount website that I used to make the reservation. They only show you what hotel you are staying at AFTER you pay. But the Parc 55 was a nice hotel. The room was nice and clean. Great water pressure in the shower. And, yes, there is some noise, you ARE right in the middle of the city. I was on the ninth floor. I sleep with earplugs anyway, as I'm from the country, so the noise didn't bother me. It was a Thursday night though. Might be worse on the weekends. There is a great shopping mall right across the street which we visited. There ARE some homeless people around, but I didn't feel "unsafe." One BIG negative for me was the parking! $50 for overnight, and it's ONLY valet. It is nice to not have to walk to your car in a parking garage given the area, however. It was a bit pricey, but I don't regret staying there. It was only one night, so I didn't get to try the restaurant or spa.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dwrgodden
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at Parc 55. Was fortunate to have a room on the 29th floor, so the view over the city was spectacular. The room was very large and clean with fast internet connectivity. Breakfast was plentiful and the services excellent. The wait to check in was a let down - long queues with very few staff on duty. There is a very small shop in the hotel to buy water, postcards, stamps, etc. The bar is great and gets pretty lively at night. The best part is the location - near Union Sq and all the shopping on Market Street.

Reviews.Title: “Warm Hotel in the City”
Reviews.Author: AliciaLosAngeles_CA
Reviews.Content: I must say the Parc 55 consistenly delivers a quality hotel stay. After a full day of meetings, it is nice to be able to rest in the comfort of a beautiful room, or, have dinner in the many restaurants in the area. Located in the Union Square Park area of San Francisco, it is easy access to Bart, and is a perfect base for my business trips to Oakland and the East Bay. I have also walked to Chinatown and Little Italy with no problems. If you have time for shopping, the Westfield Mall is a block or two away. I appreciate your knowledgable and welcoming staff (and the Club Lounge.) Makes the business trips more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good service”
Reviews.Author: Fernando G
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times, my wife loves the central location easy walking to Macy's, Norstroms, etc. and does not have to walk uphill carrying her finds. Easy in and out parking and plenty of close restaurants to eat at. And very close to the SF Muni systems and Bart. A nice walk to the SF Giants ballpark. Staff is very friendly and very accommodating. Prices do vary so you need to find the right time to get the best price.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: pdou2484
Reviews.Content: Nice accommodations; needs mini-fridges in the room; internet connection is horrible and $15 a day!; this type of hotel should offer free internet for the price you pay for the room; no swimming pool!; hotel bar is expensive, but what you would expect for San Francisco; location is excellent for public transportation; wouldn't stay at this hotel again unless the internet was free."

Reviews.Title: “A few flaws but overall good hotel”
Reviews.Author: californiasunlove
Reviews.Content: I was at the Parc 55 the first week of August for a conference. I can't comment on the price because my organization had a group rate negotiated for us. The rooms were nice and put together, clean, and housekeeping left a message every day making sure that we didn't want any services done. That being said, it seems that when Wyndham bought this hotel, the changes were mostly cosmetic. You can tell from the old discolored outlets and vent in the bathroom. And other reviewers weren't kidding when they were talking about the street noise, there's no soundproofing at all. The first two nights weren't bad from being pretty tired, but the others were filled with piercing sirens that even cut through the earplugs that we had brought in preparation for it. The hotel does provide complimentary earplugs too, which is nice. It's a rather busy part of town, and they are aware of it. Sirens are one thing, you may be thinking, but that's pretty common. Well Foley's Irish House (amazing, I'll review it soon) is a block away, and at 2 AM you could hear the Saturday night revelers emptying into the street as it shut its doors for the night. Luckily, I didn't seem to have a problem with noise within the hotel, even though I had a connecting room. I didn't use the in-hotel restaurant, but I was in the ballroom for the majority of the time. It's large and has good sound and presentation equipment. I kind of wished there was a main large projector screen in the middle rather than two smaller screens to each side of the room, but that's a small complaint. My biggest complaint is that it was so cold in there! Apparently the day before I arrived it had been rather warm, so they cranked up the air conditioning. Unfortunately they overdid it, it wasn't all that warm outside, but it was even colder in the ballroom. I had to wear two jackets and a scarf just to keep from shivering. I don't know if anyone complained to the staff; I would hope that if they did the staff would have done something. The business center was a little disappointing, but it wasn't totally the hotel's fault. I liked that it took a keycard to enter, but there were only five computers, one of which didn't have internet, and the others were taken up by people on facebook, while I needed to check-in to my flight. Printing from the computers was very easy though. One last thought: it's in a very convenient part of town, close to the BART station, lots of eateries around, but there were a lot of very aggressive homeless people around, so just be aware of yourself and your surroundings. Other parts of SF are much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Parc!!”
Reviews.Author: Samiam1st
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a number of times and have never been disappointed. Rooms are very nice, staff is friendly, location is perfect, service is outstanding. I highly recommend the Parc!!

Reviews.Title: “Not totally 'in love'”
Reviews.Author: stuckathome007
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a few days in San Francisco with my husband... we stayed at the Parc 55 Wyndham. I was leary in making the reservation at first because I hadn't had any experience with this hotel, but it was a last minute trip and options were limited. The rate was significantly lower than the other hotels we usually choose, but the pictures looked nice and it was definitely in the area we were interested in staying. Upon arrival, valets were super friendly and very helpful, and so was the help at the front desk. In fact, ALL of the personnel we encountered on all levels was VERY friendly, and accomodating... a definite FIVE-STARS in that department! The room was nice (very tasteful and modern decor)... spacious bathroom with granite countertop. The only thing I wasn't thrilled about was the shower. Nothing luxurious... not even a tub... just a standup shower. Even had a handicap seat in it. The gal at the front desk told us that all rooms with 1 king size bed had a "handicap shower"... and all rooms with 2x double beds had a tub/shower combination. I also didn't love the fact that our room had a "buzzer" outside it for "handicap reasons?!" IF someone chose to push it, a siren sounded INSIDE OF OUR HOTEL ROOM! And, our room was RIGHT next to the elevators... so all evening I was preparing myself for the SHRILL of someone playing a game and pushing the button. lol! Luckily, it didn't happen... but I really couldn't figure that one out. Our room was on the 28th floor and had a SPECTACULAR view of the city AND of the Bay... it really doesn't get much better. Also, our room smelled like smoke when we arrived (YUCK!)... and when we complained/asked about it, we were told there were no other rooms available. The front desk gave us a $25 coupon (which was unneccessary, but VERY kind!) good in their restaurant/lounge and said they'd move us the next morning. They also sent a air purifier to our room which actually helped the situation... totally cleared the smell in a matter of an hour... so we ended up not switching, and appreciated their attention & concern to the situation. The hotel was in easy walking distance of great shopping and eating! HATE the "oversized vehicle" charge of $66/day for our SUV... but I know parking is a premium in the city. We love San Fran and will be heading back often. I'm not 100% sure I'd stay here again as I like a little more plush a hotel. HOWEVER, there is nothing wrong with this hotel, it's quite lovely, and the personnel was fantastic! I would certainly recommend it to others! PS: Bring your own pillows!!! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: olsonator
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location The location of this hotel was awesome! For the work portion of my trip I was only 5 blocks walking distance. For my personal time afterwards with my wife we were within a couple blocks of Union Square, a block from the BART (rail transit system), and a block from the cable cars. The hotel is somewhat across the street from a Westfield Mall and Market Street where there is a lot of shopping. The hotel is also around the corner from the GAP flood building which my wife loved. San Francisco has great transit and this hotel is close to street cars, cable cars and the BART. My recommendation for the cable cars during lower season is to go up near union square to get on the cable cars. This is how the locals do it and they skip the entire lineup scene. You can simple pay for your ticket once you hop on. This will NOT work during peak season as the cars seem to be jammed right full. Service Other than check-in I did not interact with the hotel staff much. They were pleasant. Value This was a part-work, part personal trip. The value was pretty good for the area. Parking was extremely expensive, but parking anywhere in San Francisco is extremely expensive. Sleep Quality I was located higher on the building so the street noise was a little less intrusive. Luckily I sleep like a rock so the street noise was not an issue at all. Cleanliness The room was cleaned very well and all areas of the hotel were kept immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff with great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Ardsleygirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel smelled great!! The staff was always friendly and helpful. The location was in the shopping district and convenient to lots of different eateries. Close to transportation to get around to other areas of the city. Cost to park at hotel was high and internet charges were high, but there was access to free computers in lobby. The location was fine, just don't go too much further southwest of hotel. I parked in that area because it was cheaper. Nothing happened, but it is a seedy area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: stephp
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at quite a few hotels in Union Square in the past, including this one when it was owned by someone else, and the Parc 55 met all of our expectations. We reserved 2 rooms and one of our rooms was ready early, at 1pm. The other room wasn't ready until after 4 pm, but was just a few rooms away from the other room so we didn't complain. The rooms were clean and well appointed. I had forgotten my toothbrush and the front desk gave me a small kit with a new toothbrush, a small toothpaste, and a flossing pic. My room was much quieter than my parents room. It almost seemed like my room had newer windows which blocked the outside noise. I was able to sleep with the city noise and my parents had a much more difficult time with the noise. Actually, watching tv in the evening before dinner was much more pleasant in my room than in theirs. There really was that much of a difference in noise and, like I said before, we were only a few rooms apart. We ate dinner in the hotel restaurant and it was delicious! All of the entrees that we ordered were outstanding, as was the service, and desserts were delicious. We would return to the hotel again to eat dinner there. Breakfast, on the other hand, was almost inedible. Actually, I was not able to eat my waffle. Parking was not cheap, but we expected that. I did get the rooms for $200 each on priceline, which was a savings. I had looked at other hotels in the area before bidding on priceline and this was a decent deal. 3 star hotels were going for more than this for the same night, so we were happy. I have read other reviews of this hotel where the staff was noted to be less than stellar, this was not the case for us. We were extremely happy with the front desk staff, valets, and the concierge. We did find the lack of bell hops to be disturbing, but we had relatively few things and managed to get our luggage to our room by ourselves. The concierge was extremely helpful in recommending great restaurants located extremely close to the hotel. We ate at an Italian restaurant just across the street from the hotel, something and Puccini (I can't remember the name) and it was excellent. We would return to the Parc 55 Wyndham again, we just won't eat breakfast there!

Reviews.Title: “We would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Amsel4
Reviews.Content: After our 12 hours flight to SFO we got on the BART to Powell station and were in a few steps in the hotel. This was a bonus. The view from our room was stunning! We had a club room for our familie of four and it was fabulous.The room had enough space for the luggage and we did not feel cramped.The bathroom was very clean and had a good shower. The breakfast at the club lounge was good with fresh fruits and had also enough to choose from other food.The lounge itself is a bit on the smaller side and maybe it takes a moment to finde a place to sit. We never feeled afraid around the hotel area and would recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “definitely would stay again”
Reviews.Author: turkmurphy58
Reviews.Content: Great location, very helpful staff. Rarely have breakfast in a hotel but did this time and was surprised at how reasonable the price was.

Reviews.Title: “This is how a weekend hotel trip is supposed to be.”
Reviews.Author: WellTravelled070
Reviews.Content: Start with the rate -- $174 -- on a Saturday and Sunday night in San Francisco; add to that a corner room with panoramic Bay Area views, comfortable king bed and well-apportioned room; throw-in absolute quiet, not a sound from neighbors; season with a free business center for internet access and workout room that is nicely appointed; finish with a perfect location at Market and Powell with the BART station right there, cable cars and buses at the ready and a very helpful staff. The rate came from waiting until the last minute to book, but it worked in August in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “This pace never disappoints!”
Reviews.Author: nmcmorran
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is amazing and the view from any room is spectacular. It's centrally located near Union Square in San Francisco; it's so close to shopping in Union Square and the Westfield mall. I've stayed here several times and I've never had a bad experience. My boyfriend and I stayed at another hotel down the street once and it just couldn't live up to this place. If you stay here make sure you get a corner room; it has more windows and you get to more sunlight!

Reviews.Title: “Definately would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting SF”
Reviews.Author: dez069
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a trip to beautiful San Francisco. After a bit of research we booked at Parc 55 Wyndham. I must say after staying at other hotels in the same vicinty in the past, we were extremely impressed with this particular hotel. From the time we arrived to the day we departed we were treated with nothing but kindness. Hotel was accessable to the BART and shopping in Union Square. You can take the BART from the airport and be within one block of this hotel in no time at all. The room was better than expected and extremely clean. If I had to identify any downfall about Parc 55 Wyndham, it would that it has no pool...other than that it was exceptional. We will definatly be back.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: gilaga
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Rooms are spacious and clean. Hope for another opportunity to stay at the hotel.Amazing view from the room

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ngpereda
Reviews.Content: Check-in was very pleasant. We were a few hours early, yet were accommodated with a room when we arrived. Our housekeeper was so nice,and waited daily for our late departures from the room! There was a street protest while we were there, and when I called the desk about it, they were very forthcoming about the situation, with no sugar-coating--or drama. I would return to this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED EVERYTHING- STAFF, ROOM, ETC.”
Reviews.Author: OscarColorado
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Francisco and the Parc 55 was a great place for us to start. The location was absolutely wonderful as it is convenient to BART, the F Line, major bus routes, and the cable car stop at the end of Powell Street. The room was very nice (obviously recently remodeled) and also comfortable and quiet. From the moment we arrived we were treated exceptionally well by the staff who were friendly and also extremely helpful with giving us tips on getting around and places to see. The location also provided a welcome respite from the major tourist attractions such as Fisherman's Wharf that are just a cable car ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: JonW_62
Reviews.Content: Location is good - right in heart of teh city, but a little clos eto some neighbourhoods that are a little 'dodgy'. Car parking is extornionate - DON"T park there. there are garages in the area that will park you for literally 1/3rd of the price. Nothing actually wrong with the hotel, but it is expensive for what it is. Next time I would stay at teh Marriot close by - same price, but nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and modern - missing a little quirck and charm though”
Reviews.Author: D_Shi_12610
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon, following a disastrous stay in Yosemite, where my husband got pneumonia. We left Yosemite early, came down the mountain cold, hungry, tired and in desperate need of pampering. And we got it. Parc 55 let us check in a day early at the same discount rate we had booked with months previously. They also upgraded us to a wonderful suite on the upper level floor with a gorgeous view. That first night we just snuggled in and relaxed! And magically, the next day, we were feeling much better! The breakfast option on the top floors is wonderful and plenty to get you started on a great, busy day of sight seeing. The rooms themselves are large and wonderfully luxurious. The view was absolutely amazing. The staff was also extremely helpful. One night, I asked one of the security guards to escort me to a nearby restaurant to pick up a late, late dinner. He was very helpful, and kind to do so. (I was afraid of getting lost by myself, and my husband was still sick as mentioned above). Overall, I have no complaints. It's a wonderful hotel with great staff and amenities. My only regret is that it was so modern and luxurious, it lacked the quirck and charm some of the older San Francisco hotels have that make me adore the city so much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice rooms at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: SergioB_1978
Reviews.Content: Hi all travelers, the hotel is very comfortable and has a great location just meters from BART, and Union Square We pay $ 110 per night through Priceline, and worth it, the hotel staff was friendly and helpful, let some bags in the storage for a week while we went to Cozumel and did not charge us anything. Cons, Cons: There were many homeless and crazy in the corner of Carl Junior, a little scary but not to warry, and parking is very expensive. The rest was excellent, a great city and a great hotel will saty again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: noegdurts
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Fran. The hotel was gorgeous and located in the heart of the Union Square area within walking distance to dining, shopping and public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, fabulous, fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: MrsMoss6382
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in San Francisco celebrating our anniversary and having never been there before we picked a hotel based on the reviews of others; boy were we glad with our decision! We thoroughly enjoyed The Parc 55. Each person associated with the hotel that we interacted with was professional and quite helpful. Although it was probably a little farther from Fisherman's Wharf than we would have liked it was otherwise fairly centrally located. We would definitely stay here again and again. If you are in town this is a must stay at place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with large, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: cpowers
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through a Priceline bid. The location is great, especially if you are taking public transportation. The BART took us from the airport to just across the street from the hotel (Powell St) for $8.10 per person. Buses and cable cars are also very close. Sarah was very pleasant and helpful at check-in as we requrested a king bed on a higer floor. The room was spacious and very clean. If attending a Giants game, you can easily take public transportation, or it is about a 40 minute walk. We did both. The only negatives are that the internet connection is slow (and you have to pay for it), and you can hear some noise from the other rooms/elevator, but it wasn't unbearable. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ariesnz
Reviews.Content: Hotel was across the road from BART Powell Stn, we took the train from SFO airport for $8.10 each way, takes approx 30min. Visitors centre just by station entrance, free internet there. Cable car kiosk also near station exit. Westfield shopping centre, Macys, Nordstrum, Ross, Old Navy, Apple store etc all within a few minutes walk. Hotel had computers with free internet in downstairs lobby but sadly no free wireless in the rooms. $14.95 for 24hr access. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms comfortable, clean and well serviced. The aircon was a little loud however. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely remodeled”
Reviews.Author: mdmjw
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby and restaurant very nice and modern. Good fitness room with a lot of equipment and cool temperature. Room was large - like a suite, with large windows. Had been recently remodeled, but still reminded me of a Wyndham property (i.e. not the W). Rooms could have been more modern in feel. We received a nice welcome amenity (Wyndham rewards member) consisting of nuts, 6 sodas, waters. Right across the street from the train, so you won't need a car.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: njmom4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our four kids ages 16, 14,11 and 8 while on vacation for 2 nights. We had two rooms that were connecting. I was very impressed with the service as we pulled up, checked in and then delivered our bags to our room. The rooms were slightly small, but not too small. The location is great. You can walk or take whatever means of transportation you like. Everything is right there. I wasn't sure what to expect at this hotel, but I was really impressed with the service and would definitely stay here again. The rates were great too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, a Couple Things to Consider”
Reviews.Author: doctor16
Reviews.Content: Great Service, clean rooms, comfortable beds and covers. Amazing staff that was ALWAYS friendly and helpful. A doorman that gladly got you a cab when needed. The rooms could use a little more drawer storage and the rooms are starting to show a little age, but that is the extent of my complaints concerning the hotel. The location is great in terms of, you can take BART from the airport to the Powell Street Station for $8.10, and when you come out of the station, go up the stairs to your left, you are standing in front of the hotel. There is a mall across the street, and a cable car location a block away and several good places to eat all nearby. (Side Note: Get pizza delivered from Uncle Vitos one night, they deliver to the hotel quick and for free, and the pizza is even better than the Trip Advisor reviews for it!) The only draw back for this hotel is that it is in the SUPER BUSY Union Square location, where literally you can walk 1 block and get solicited for money from homeless people 5+ times.

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst hotel experience/service/hostiIity I have ever experienced - Frequent Traveller”
Reviews.Author: Aussie6_11
Reviews.Content: At 1am in the morning prior to our departure date from San Fran, we received two prank calls followed by a hostile and aggressive intrusion by the hotel's security, who demanded we settle an already pre-settled hotel bill (internal communications fault). Two security guards had been dispatched because the 0.30am calls (we thought they were prank calls) had not been answered. At first, when we heard that security was knocking on our door, we believed that the hotel had come under attack or that there was a fire alarm, but then we were treated like criminals. For someone who spends up to 6-7 months a year in hotels I have never experienced hostility and poor service at this level. I advise the travel industry, write for travel magazines, and do scenario planning for airlines, and frankly this sort of treatment is totally unacceptable. What made it worse was the manager O's response the following morning. Rather than apologise in a situation when both me and my business partner were clearly distressed, he argued that sending out security at 1am is a proportionate response (because the hotel experiences travellers who don't settle bills). I asked him if this is a hotel policy for all guests and he answered 'yes, in these circumstances'. So if you are going to stay at Parc 55, make sure that all their internal communications and accounts departments are up to speed with your Expedia bookings, otherwise you might expect a nasty wake-up at 1am. He then offered a coffee and a sandwich (which he forgot to order from the restaurant for us) as a respite. His follow up email to the situation (4 days later) invited us to a free upgrade next time we choose to stay at the hotel so 'we can better feel about our property'. This is a hotel I will never re-visit. Overall the stay was very disappointing, and the over the course of 3 days they didn't have working Wifi either. The only upside were decent beds, and a well equipped gym.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, EXCELLENT LOCATION SHAME ABOUT THE RUDE CONCIERGE”
Reviews.Author: jbg7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 days at the Parc 55. This is our 3rd time in SF but, our first stay at this hotel. We caught the BART in to the city from the airport after dropping our rental vehicle off. It takes about 20-30mins and is clean and very safe to use. The hotel is about a 5min walk from the Market Street / Powell Street station. Check in was quick and easy and the staff were friendly and helpful. We were in a standard room on the 14th floor. The room was spacious and clean with a good size bathroom. The king size bed was very comfy. There's a good selection of channels on TV, there's also a sofa and work station to work from. The only thing missing was a fridge/mini bar. A fridge is available but costs $35. Internet is reasonably priced at $14.95 for 24hrs. Previous reviews complained about the street noise. Whilst we could hear traffic throughout the day and night it wasn't bad enough to effect our sleep or request another room like other people have done. It is a central city hotel after all so expect some noise. We used the gym daily. There was a good selection of cardio and weight machines. Whilst the cardio equipment is okay and serves it's purpose, the machines are old, noisy and in need of an upgrade. The hotel is ideally located practically in the center of the city. The BART and trams are nearby, the Westfield shopping center opposite the hotel and Union Square is a 5-10min walk. The only issue we had with the hotel was Hanif the concierge. We found him to be rude and unhelpful. We initially thought he must be having a bad day but we encountered this behaviour a further two times on two separate occasions. Overall we found our stay to be excellent and highly recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: CoastalCass
Reviews.Content: This was the first time my husband and I have stayed at Parc 55 and I must say we would go back in a heartbeat. The valet is steep but we expected that in San Francisco. The check in staff were very polite as well as helpful. Our room was clean and very spacious. This hotel is very close to a BART station and one of the trolley stops as well. My husband and I walked to the Starbucks, which was only a few block away, every morning to get our day started. If you want a hotel that is walking distance to restaurants, bars and shopping this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE - GREAT VACATION”
Reviews.Author: maggie030
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked in here after an awful first night experience in another hotel in San Francisco! We arrived just after 9am and were greeted at reception by Erikka. We explained that we were on our 'trip of a lifetime' to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary. We arrived in SF late the previous evening, and had the worst hotel experience ever! On hearing this, Erikka was absolutely brilliant. She checked availability of rooms and appointed us a fabulous Bay View room on the 26th floor.The room was spacious, spotlessly clean and had everything required to make our stay memorable. We were really impressed with the level of customer service given to us. Erikka was an absolute gem and she is a credit to the hotel. During our stay in the city we took a ferry to Sausilito. Beautiful little place. Spotlessly clean with lots of good restaurants etc. We visited Fishermans Wharf and tried the famous Clam Chowder - delicious! We then queued for 2 hours for a cable car - boarded it and then had to jump off quickly as the clutch had snapped! It took quite a while to have it repaired so we decided to walk back to the hotel. Bad idea - we obviously looked as if we were lost (we were) and a lovely lady stopped to give us directions. Great to know that people will take the time out to help strangers to the city! We found eating out to be quite expensive but it no different to any other city. I would love to return to San Francisco one day and I would definately stay at Parc 55 @ Wyndham without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Very unassuming. One of my best experiences.”
Reviews.Author: brooklynola
Reviews.Content: From the minute I checked into my wonderful, clean, well equipped room at 10AM til the bellman effortlessly got me loaded into the 615a shuttle 3 days later, my service was impeccable. The club room is worth it. Really nice extras. I would not drive in San Fran if you paid me, so parking was a non issue. As far as wifi goes, if you are a Wyndham loyalty member, your wifi is complimentary for your entire stay. Also provide multiple places for printing documents, boarding passes, etc. Wonderful CITY location, if noise is a concern, do not pursue ANYTHING in Union Square. You'll have a hard time NOT finding something in Union Square. The shopping, restaurants, and proximity to all things touristy is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: IMA7588
Reviews.Content: Great location near Union Square, Market St., and BART. Everything you expect from a reputable chain hotel - good service, clean room with nice amenities, pleasantly quiet despite the busy location. Found a great deal for $129/night for a king bed, sitting area, and great views of Union Sq.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Marriott_Owner_11
Reviews.Content: Our stay was in a standard room. We were on "standby" for a room in an upper floor for the view, but passed. The foggy weather wouldn't justify the added expense. The hotel is in a great location if you like to shop. Lots of great restaurants in the area. Amenities in the room were fine but not outstanding. You can take the Bart to the Powell St station from the airport and you're right there. Also the terminus of the cable cars is also there if you want to go to the Wharf. Biggest cons: internet charge of $14.95 a day. Please, in this day, it should be standard. Also, panhandlers are everywhere and can be a nuisance. This is a general problem for this city. It works against the tourism efforts, but they probably already know this.

Reviews.Title: “A great night in san Francisco”
Reviews.Author: ghsonoma
Reviews.Content: It was a beautiful room with a outside deck that I could take pictures from .We sat outside in the chairs and had a nice bottle of wine before heading down to dinner.The room had a separate room for the bedroom with a awesome bed with lots of pillows.We slept like a baby.The staff was very helpful and the free continental breakfast was just perfect to get the day started.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place I have stayed in San Fran, they are rude, clueless about customer service”
Reviews.Author: Louisenet
Reviews.Content: Bell men, front desk, restaurant, bar, house cleaning terrible rude worst I have seen or dealt with. If I come back to San Fran I will not ever stay here again hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Good value room...but expensive everything else.”
Reviews.Author: joemackjoe
Reviews.Content: Can't best a $130 room downtown sf, but parking $48 plus tax? Wifi 15 per day? C'mon! Dont get me wrong, the hotel delivered on the room and great view for the price, but getting nicked takes its toll. Great for shopping downtown and very clean, just wish the "extras" came down a bit to get it in five circle status.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: travellinsusie
Reviews.Content: classy hotel, most comfortable beds and cannot beat the location in downtown. also used their conference rooms, though pricy was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “safe bet in the city”
Reviews.Author: Totality01
Reviews.Content: strange entrance, good views, good pricing. Great location for public transportation and cable car. Hotel parking expensive but unlimited 24hr access. can park for under $10 a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great service for being so busy”
Reviews.Author: Khaton13
Reviews.Content: A huge hotel that was so busy but they still gave us a room early. Very close to BART and Union Square. Large rooms with nice amenities. It was noisy out the window but overall is really a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, location and service....well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Lily0911
Reviews.Content: We chose Wyndham Parc 55 for it's location, familar brand name and recently renovated guest rooms. The entire experience exceeded our expectations. The location was perfect since we didn't want to stay at Fisherman's Wharf along with the thousands of other tourists and tourist shops but wanted to be in the heart of SF within easy walking to shopping, dining and most important...for our three kids....the start of the trolly car! We took the trolly car directly from Wyndham Parc 55 to Fisherman's Wharf then chose to walk back to the hotel which in itself was one of the highlights of our visit as we saw the city firsthand. The hotel was very clean and updated. The hotel concierge created a plan for us to see the city which was a huge help. We would highly recommend staying at Wyndham Parc 55. We used the hotel's parking garage which was a few more dollars than a local garage but we were able to go in and out at will and we didn't have to wait long for the car.

Reviews.Title: “A decent home base”
Reviews.Author: fregien
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in San Francisco. Last time we stayed at the St. Francis. It was running about $400 for a room with a view for July 4th weekend, so I started looking for something more reasonable downtown. Park 55 sounded great. We booked through the hotel website and upgraded to a "view room" on the 24th floor. We took the BART from the airport, which has a stop right in front of the hotel. That was very convenient. Renting a car, driving in horrible San Fran. traffic, and paying crazy $50 parking fees didn't interest us. We spent about $60 in cab fare getting around the city for the entire 4 days. Anyways- Check-in went smoothly and the woman at registration was very pleasant. We headed to the elevator bank and waited with about 50 other people. After finally getting into the elevator with around 12 squished people, it took about 5 minutes to drop everyone at each floor. I thought- Uh Oh! My boyfriend is not a patient man... We arrived at our room, set directly behind the elevator and ice machine. I was a bit worried as many reviewers complained about the noise level. (Indeed there are a set of earplugs offered as an "amenity" in the room.) The room itself was fine- tastefully though blandly decorated. Our "view room" gave us a view of the city, though it looked out on the not so nice side of town. The bathroom was average- nothing special. The outlets and wallpaper look to be 25 years old, but the fixtures where relatively updated. After dropping our luggage, we went down to get a bite to eat. Another 10 minutes in the packed elevator, stopping at every floor.... and we were down. Cab service was convenient and always available out front. Overnight- The bed was comfortable enough. We didn't have any problems with elevator or ice machine noise, but there are always sirens at night from emergency vehicles. I think this is more prevalent as we were so close to the not so nice part of town. I am happy to say the elevator situation became much less busy during our stay, so either there was a big convention that left or maybe some elevators had been out of service. Who knows. Anyhow, if you need a hotel that is reasonably priced downtown, Park 55 isn't bad, but it certainly wasn't a luxury hotel to me.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: juicylala
Reviews.Content: great hotel except for your next door neighbor(s) you can hear them talking and the TV and the outside noise was horrible. please wear your eye plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed! Nice room”
Reviews.Author: Droppinloads
Reviews.Content: First time ever staying at PARC 55. Had a great stay. Easy arrival, used valet, yes it is close to 50$, but welcome to SF. Check in was great, very nice red headed lady (I wish I got her name) very pleasant and helpful, made us feel welcome.AMAZING room on 26 floor, very spacious, bathroom big too! Flat screen, and very very quiet. Drank at the hotel lounge , the servers in the lounge are VERY nice and attentive, I wish I had gotten their names too, lol. Clean hotel, modern looking. Good location , walking distance to LOTS of shopping and bars. I can't wait to stay here again! Only bad thing was the valet the next morning took forever, they did not answer their phone to arrange pickup in advance so I had to go down and wait in person.

Reviews.Title: “Very large, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rickpw
Reviews.Content: The hotel has 32 floors and about 1000 rooms. It is a block from Powell Street and conveniently located next to the Powell BART/MUNI station. The room was nice and contemporary. I stayed on the top floor and had great views. The breakfast buffet was good but over-priced (true of most hotels, to be fair). My only complaint was the noise coming from the room next door. Why do hotels have so many connecting rooms with only a door separating them? I got a good rate on quikbook.com for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Trey85
