Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just came back from our first trip to San Francisco. We stayed at Parc 55 and loved it! The staff was very nice and helpful. The room was clean and very modern. It took us 2 months to decide on a hotel, and I'm so happy that we chose Parc 55. We never spent more then $10 on a cab ride because it's located in the center of everything. If you are looking for great hotel and willing to pay a little more it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay I've Ever Experienced!”
Reviews.Author: ReallyRick
Reviews.Content: After a very unexpected 4 day hospital stay upon arrival in San Francisco which caused me to miss one of the cities most famous events, I found myself at the Parc 55 for some rest and recuperation. I could not have been treated more fantastically by everyone on staff than I was! From the concern about my bandage by Wendy at the front desk to the personal, superior compassion and thoughtfulness shown by Julia, the hotel office manager and executive assistant I felt like a King in a grand castle! I hated to leave so much that now just 2 days later I am returning! You cannot go wrong at this property! The location is absolutely ideal for anyone visiting San Francisco with attractions, food, transportation and entertainment just steps away! Rooms are immaculate, beds comfortable and inviting, bathrooms and amenities are impeccable, business center and Internet computers around the hotel are extremely convenient and that staff goes above and beyond you ensure you feel as if you are truly a valued guest. Do not hesitate to stay at this premier hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lusanti
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 days on a business training that was being held in Oakland. Preferred staying in SF and commuting to Oakland for obvious reasons. Never having been in SF I wanted to have the convenience of being in the thick of things once the training was complete. The location of this hotel was great for this. It is located a block from a BARD station that would have me at the Oakland training location in about 15 minutes. It is also located about a block from a cable car stop and several street bus stops. This made it very convenient to travel throughout San Fran. Room was very spacious and clean, concierge was great! I decide against renting a car upon reading on the extensive public transportation options and do not regret my decision. I arrived early Sunday, rented a bike and rode across the west side to ocean beach, up through Presidio and across the GG Bridge to Sausalito...this was quite an experience and one that I would recommend highly. Checkout was easy. Bed was very comfy, I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice !!”
Reviews.Author: travel_nolimit
Reviews.Content: First impression of this hotel was it was admist all the buzzling downtown ! the cable tramps were just below the hotel. Rooms were good enough and best thing was that the rooms had humidifiers which people like us coming from asian countries for holidays there, deffinately need that. So thumps up to that !!!!!! :). Hotel was very busy. Guess it was in downtown area. Here again we booked 2 rooms as we are 4 adults, and the rooms were quite roomy. Staff and service was alright. I guess we asians expect a little more hospitable service when it comes to star hotels. But overall not bad as the location was good like the way we wanted it to be as we were there on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in union square”
Reviews.Author: jamesteroh
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times since 2001 back when it was part of the Marriott family. I stayed there this past weekend for gay pride and it has been my first stay since they have joined Wyndham. This is my favorite hotel in Union Square due mainly to it's convenient location. Seeing I never go outside the city when I am in SF, I have no need for a car and take cabs or bart/muni. It is very easy to find a hotel and coming from the SFO, it is only a $8 BART fare and all you have to do is go up the escalator from the bart station and cross the street and you are at the hotel. Same if you need to use the muni. The rooms are good sized for that area and recently renovated. This past stay I had a really nice corner room. The by request welcome gift waiting in my room was very nice, a couple diet cokes were waiting for me on ice when I entered the room at checkin along with a couple bottled waters and a generous tray of organic fresh fruit. I have seen others complain about the internet speed but I had no problems with it. I used my IPAD to connect and the speed was fine. One thing that was sort of a pain was having to create an account to log on and having to log on again every time I wanted to use my IPAD and it would never recognize the user name and password and I would have to create a new account. At other Wyndham properties, I just had to enter my byrequest number for the access. Staff was great this stay as always. I never rent a car in SF, but I am told parking is very expensive at the hotel and is valet only, so if you have a car, the parking charges could be a drawback. Also noise can be an issue, I was on the 17th floor and heard a lot of street noise, but it is in a very busy location and they do provide ear plugs if someone wants them.

Reviews.Title: “Best 5 star hotel for its value”
Reviews.Author: keonigaspar
Reviews.Content: I always stay here at the Parc 55. I am a Wyndham rewards member, and for the longest time Wyndham never had a property in the Union Square area in San Francisco. Recently 2 years ago, Wyndham bought out the Parc 55. It is a fairly priced 5-star hotel, but priced as a 3 or 4 star hotel. Rooms are big for San Francisco. Other hotels have rooms that are 150-200 square feet. The Parc 55 is a well 250-300 square feet, flat screen tv's, ipod hookups, marble bathrooms, plush bedding, and rooms all with a stunning view for the price. Rooms are very quiet, cant hear any neighbors all the times that I have stayed there. I have stayed here maybe 6 times in the last 2 years and love this hotel. Perfect location above the BART station, in union square. The only bad thing is no pool, and parking is $65 which is average for hotels in the city but I usually take BART to the city and park at SFO. All the employee's are very accomidating. Best 5 star hotel for the money. Usually its $150-$200 a night compared to the other 5 star hotels which are usually $200-$300 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Meet all expectations”
Reviews.Author: gt2638
Reviews.Content: My first choice to stay in SF union square was up to now the Hilton O'Farrell . I decided to give a try to Parc55, based on the fairly good reviews here, and the fact that they had much better prices for my dates. If you book early enough in advance, the have competiive packages, one including car parking: this avoids you 48$+tax / night extra . Nice deal . I had a very large room, probably twice the size of a normal room, due to location around the emergency exit stair. The "normally sized" room however are of decent size. If you are above 10th floor, you will get a nice view. The rooms are , as stated on the website, recently refurbished. Everything nice and clean. Personnel is very friendly and courteous: bell men, houskeeping staff, valet parking,..... They always address you by name (if they have it) and welcome you back . Nice change from the indefference at some other hotels. Housekeeping is swift and they look at the details (for example room service trays do no stay in hallways for hours or up to the next day ....as seen elsewhere). Very good sleep quality : no noise from inside, very ecceptable noise from outside. Only two negative remarks: - parking is valet only, so it takes out some flexibility. Besides, the parking area is not that big and can be busy. The valet parking personnel however are veru efficient to clean up the are as quick as possible. - internet . As expensive as other places (15$/day ar 50$/week). However, they have a real capacity problem. At peak times, the speed is awfully slow to non-existent (from 54 to ....1 or 0 bps). This is resulting in multiple pages loading failure and error messages. You have to give sometimes 5 tries to get your page loading . Clearly exagerated for the price asked. In cocnlusin, Parc55 Hotel is definitely a very nice hotel to stay in San Francisco's union square. All -almost- promises that you can find on the web site are genuinely delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Business with family along for a great trip”
Reviews.Author: Lbh1478
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. We enjoyed our stay the staff was wonderful and knowledgable of places to see and the best food. It was a bit noisy at times but we managed to live with it.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: KOC44
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and was so pleasantly surprised with this hotel! Great service and great location! Clean rooms, free breakfast, great pool! Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Hung_La
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights and enjoyed every minute of it. Our room was huge and had a nice panoramic view of the city. Situated directly opposite the Westfield Shopping mall, its location is ideal for anyone who would like to explore the city and the many fine restaurants SF has to offer. Excellent value for money and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with the property - need to work on free Internet access!”
Reviews.Author: sassycoleslaw
Reviews.Content: I am an SF local and have stayed in 15+ properties throughout the FiDi/Union Square areas, always looking for quality hotels to recommend for visiting family and friends. Parc 55 is an excellent property with knowledgeable and helpful staff, quality amenities and well-designed, comfortable rooms. Given its location, it makes it a great locale for tourists to hit all the hot spots from one, central location. Keep in mind it's in quite a busy area, so street noise can be significant, especially on weekend nights. What keeps me from giving this a 5-star rating is the hotel's policy on Internet access. $14.95/day or $44.95/week In this day and age, in the heart of Silicon Valley, why are guests still having to consider a la carte pricing for Internet??? Any rooms in the $150+ range anywhere in the city should have Internet included!! I'll definitely recommend the property if it changes its Internet policy.

Reviews.Title: “great location/excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: bagman3914
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat. Easy access to SFO with BART just outside the entrance. Union Square area, lots of shopping, restaurants within walking distance, including Chinatown. 1 block to the Cable Car. The rooms were spacious, clean and updated with widescreen TV. The concierge staff was very friendly and had consistently good recommendations. We did not eat in their restaurants but they had a great breakfast option in the lobby where you could get 3 items for $5 - Starbucks coffee, bagels, croissants, danish, fruit. great quick way to start the day. We had a great rate thru Wyndham on line specials. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our club room”
Reviews.Author: CY83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park 55 at the beginning of June 2011 and had a club room. The location in down town was great as you can easily reach your favourite tourist attractions from there. The club room was nice and spacious. It was very clean and we had a great view. The club lounge offered snacks, free soft drinks during special times in the day/week. The view from the lounge is even better than the view from the room. When available, you have to enjoy a wine up there (they charged for the alcoholic beverages). We also tried the main bar near the reception which was for us a little too full of corporate people. It suits people who like it a bit more buzz. The breakfast at the lounge was superb. It included healthy fruits, muesli, toast, Starbucks coffee and more. The staff in the club room was very attentive and helpful. The only thing which was not so good, was the Internet connection. It should have been better especially as we paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location, average service/amentities.”
Reviews.Author: em5585
Reviews.Content: The location is the only reason this gets a "Very Good" rating instead of "Average" because the location is just that good. Right in the Union Square area and just steps away from the Westfield in SF. BART is located right out the doorway of the hotel which is good and bad, but there were always several BART police cars parked right nearby. The cable car stop is also right outside. Shopping and food choices were great for someone there working most of the day. Other than the location and the fact that the hotel looked upscale, everything else was pretty average. Maybe it is because I don't ever stay in SF, but hotel parking was pretty ridiculous ($48/day + tax) and so were internet charges ($14.95 per day or around $50-60 per week). No fridge in the room and housekeeping kept turning my A/C off so it was always really stuffy when I came back to the room (temps were around 70, so fairly warm for SF). I did like the Bath & Body Works amenities. I was supposed to get a "view" room but ended up on the 9th floor, which didn't really seem to qualify in my opinion. My room definitely reeked like pot one day but it was gone by the time I got back from work luckily. The fitness center was good, with lots of machines to choose from. The other bad thing was the walls seemed pretty thin. My room was the first one by the elevators, so I could hear a lot going on. They do give you earplugs in the rooms. On the 9th floor I couldn't hear much ground/traffic noise other than sirens. Bed was pretty firm and not that comfortable for four nights.

Reviews.Title: “Another Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cyranno
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 is a first class hotel. The room was nicely furnished, including a flatscreen HD television. Great location, too.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Key”
Reviews.Author: kcribb1
Reviews.Content: San Fransisco is one of my favorite cities in the US to visit. Got his hotel on Priceline ($78) during a trip for 49ers and Buccaneers game. I was very skeptical when I was "assigned" this hotel but after arriving I discovered it was prime real estate. Everything I needed was at the door step of the hotel: Metro station, shopping, cable cars, and restaurants. I would stay here again without hesitation. Dottie's True Blue Cafe is around the corner (get there early) and the food was fantastic as advertised on Food TV's Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives. Also, I definitely recommend Momma's on Washington Square for breakfast. The place is small and the line can be long but it is worth the wait!

Reviews.Title: “Falling in love with San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: cjsmith_11
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a night at the Parc 55 Wyndham in San Francisco arriving on Monday, June 12 and leaving on the following day. I booked the room through priceline a couple hours before arriving, however when i made it to the front desk I was told that there were some technical difficulties with their systems and computers and that I would be given my room as soon as available. While I was waiting Ericka from the front desk routinely checked on me, offering me something to drink and doing all she could to make me feel comfortable. After a very short wait, she called me back to the front desk and personally took care of the matter and put me into a gorgeous room facing the bay. Since then, she has gone far above normal duties making my stay as easy and smooth as possible. She and Rhodora have made my stay so great that one night was simpy not enough and stayed the entire week. I spend half the year in hotels and this is the first one that I've felt obligated to comment on. Thank you to all the staff. I look forward to visiting again very soon. Christian Smith rm 2219 7/12/11-7/18/11

Reviews.Title: “Best location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: VitalSpring
Reviews.Content: My favorite thing about the Parc 55 Wyndham was the location. If you are planning on taking BART from the SF airport, get off at the Powell station, and the hotel is literally across the street from the station. So if you're lugging a suitcase, that's very convenient. No trekking up hills or through the downtown area. You just take the stairs up from the BART/Muni station and cross the street to the hotel. And then whenever we went out, we were so close to the station, so it was just fabulous. The hotel itself is very nice. We've stayed at the Hilton Union Square too, and the Wyndham is more updated and nicer. Once you check in, you never see the front desk people again because you enter the hotel on a different level, but that's okay. The rooms are spacious. You do get a lot of street noise. We were on the 26th floor, so even that high up, you could hear drunk people singing down at Union Square, but I don't think that's the hotel's fault. Overall, the location made this hotel perfect, and I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, nice. Lousy internet.”
Reviews.Author: MikeMorton
Reviews.Content: Your basic business hotel. Very nice staff. Good bed. Only downside was poor internet, even the room’s wired connection. Tip: there’s a vent hidden below each window. Housekeeping liked opening them every day, and for the first couple of nights I couldn’t figure out why the room was so chilly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location -- would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: melhojo
Reviews.Content: Frankly, I didn't know what to expect from this hotel based upon the reviews that I read on TripAdvisor. Staying in San Francisco is expensive, and we got a great deal on this hotel. Overall, I'm glad we stayed here. We were kind of frantic when we arrived at the hotel because we were due to return our rental car any minute (we had just arrived from Sonoma), but we wanted to drop our stuff of first. The staff helped us unload the car and get in and out quickly so we could take care of business. While some people on here claim that the hotel looked dated, it looked nice and modern to me, but hey, what do I know? The room was a size that you would expect for a major city, maybe even a little bigger. There were no king bed rooms available yet when we arrived, so I took a 2 double bed room rather than wait. It was less comfortable, but it was my own choice I guess. There was some street noise (we were on the 14th floor), but no more than you would expect from staying in a downtown area of a major city, and not anything that would keep you from falling asleep if you're at all acustomed to urban living. If you want total peace and quiet, why on earth would you stay in downtown San Francisco? The location of the hotel is perfect for sightseeing. The cable car, street cars, buses and the BART are all within a block of the hotel. You can walk to Chinatown, Union Square and City Hall. It simply could not have been easier for us to get around the city. Some people on here complained about the neighborhood. San Francisco has a homeless problem. It's not a secret. From what I observed though, the problem is all over the city, and not just in the area surrounding the hotel. If you exercise common sense and ordinary street smarts, you should be fine. Or you can just stay in a hotel by Fisherman's Wharf and not leave Fisherman's Wharf (but why on earth would you want to do that?). Or you can just not go to San Francisco. There were a few things that irked me. On the first day, housekeeping inexplicably took all of our towels but didn't replace any. We had to call down for towels. This did not happen again, though. Also, I am a Wyndham Rewards member, and should have been entitled to perks like free wi-fi, free domestic calls and a welcome basket. None of that was given or offered to me, although I admit that I didn't ask either. We did have a good experience with the conceirge. My husband wanted to go to this restaurant he had seen on the Food Network. All he knew of the place was that it was on Food Network, they served roast beef, and the outside is colorful. The concierge knew exactly where he was talking about and gave us directions for walking and by bus. Overall, we were pleased with our stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bedrooms ok, meeting space nothing special, internet dreadful”
Reviews.Author: Pro-Travel-Buyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week beginning of June for a company meeting. Hotel bedrooms are on par with a Holiday Inn from the 80's so major updating needed, no minibar, cheap coffee machine, internet both wifi and cable failed to work when the hotel had many clients staying and working in the hotel. Bathrooms tired and toiletries standard for a 2/3 star hotel (no molton brown,gilcrist & soames or anyone else of quality here). Didn't experience breakfast in the restaurant apart from during our early morning meetings, served infront of the meetings room, pretty disappointing. The lunch that was served was ok, no complaints there. Time to raise the level/standing at the hotel, needs a refit and major rework /investment as hotel is not in the best location (right on edge of Tenderloin-bit dodgy area) and to command the rates it charges, it needs to raise the bar. Advice, San Francisco is noisy , hotel is not double glazed and they supply ear plugs for you, so request a room as high up as possible and if possible on the quiet side (if it exists).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and style but with street noise!”
Reviews.Author: Bronail
Reviews.Content: Rooms are large, clean and comfortable. Room service is fast and friendly. Dining is in a fun area. Our room faced Ellis street which is a late night venue w lots of traffic, so use the ear plugs (only one set provided in bathroom). Would likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location- Easy Access to Beautiful San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: fldrifter14
Reviews.Content: Last summer, as the final destination of a cross country road trip I stayed in the Parc 55, located centrally (only a few blocks from Union Square) in San Francisco. And I must say, the hotel is nothing less than grand (especially after having camped in national parks for two weeks prior.) Check in is a smooth process, as valets are readily available to park your car and help with luggage. The room was pretty standard in size, but the furnishings were top-notch (I can't think of a softer bed.) There really isn't anything negative I'd have to say about the hotel itself- the rooms, the lobby, the bar, all were immaculately maintained and guest services was readily available to offer advice on getting around the city (which wasn't difficult as the hotel was only a few minutes from a trolly turnaround, bart station and bus stops- but if you want a cab, the doormen are more than happy to flag one for you.) The only hang up that I can think of would be the valet fees, which over the course of 4 nights, added up a bit- but there were no issues with the car or the contents- which is a plus considering some of the horror stories I hear of valet. All in all, if you can afford a little extra, the Parc 55 is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Needs work”
Reviews.Author: funkymusic
Reviews.Content: Good location and nice looking lobby but the rooms are in desperate need of a make over. Very old hardware in the bathrooms, dim lighting, no refreshment bar, a charge of $5 for a bottle of water, and dingy. The flat screen TV is nice but beware that when you turn it on it immediately defaults to "On Demand" movies and pay television. I ordered a movie while I was trying to find a news channel. Reception took the charge off of my bill but I had to have directions over the phone how to use the remore properly. There are no directions in the room. Service is just average in this hotel. If you get a low rate you can probably put up with the less than wonderful surroundings and average service but San Fran has so many wonderful properties it would be a shame to waste your time here. There is a wonderful Italian restaurant across the street - Puccinni & Pinetti where you can get a good meal with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: GeeGeew00t
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is excellent. It's close to all sort's of public transport which makes travelling around San Francisco a breeze. Could do with more counters at the reception desk. Checked in the day before the Zazzle Bay to Breakers Run and the queue at the reception desk was long. However there was a supervisor on site to talk to guests which sort of negated the frustrated feelings one would get when a queue does not move. Room was cosy, The room service excellent (the chocolate coins is a nice touch). The WiFi however I felt was a bit of a letdown considering I paid good money for it with the slow connection being my main gripe. The breakfast service at the Exclusive Club Lounge was so-so. Could do with a larger selection of food. Despite my gripes I still think this hotel deserves a Very Good rating as the location, the cosiness of the rooms and the friendliness of the staff makes my stay an enjoyable one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms great value”
Reviews.Author: jmfox1985
Reviews.Content: We ended up getting this hotel for $110/night after bidding on Priceline. It ranks, to date, as one of the best Priceline values I've ever gotten. The standard rates are reasonable too and I would pay the advertised rate for a room here (which is not something I often say). The staff was incredibly pleasant and check-in was a breeze. The lobby is strange (on the second floor), but very nicely appointed. We had a room on the 7th floor that wasn't huge (which is to be expected in SF), but space was used very well. We had a decent view considering our room was on a lower floor. The room was clean, comfortable (great bed) and even a bit stylish. While we never ate at any of the on site restaurants, we heard good things. The reason we never ate on site is due to the location. It's very good. It's immediately adjacent to the Powell St. Transit hub (BART, Muni Metro, F-Line- Buses and yes, the Cable Car all right there). It's a great jumping off point for tourists, and also ideally located for business travelers. It's about 2-3 blocks to Union Square and shopping. A nice, easy walk. As has been noted, the Union Square area quickly transitions into the seedier tenderloin. While I never felt unsafe at the Park 55 (the entrances are strategically oriented towards Powell Station and Union Square while turning their back on the Tenderloin), you'll encounter some panhandlers (who congregate around transit hubs and busy areas) without a doubt. This is true no matter where you stay in San Francisco. It should be noted, that the Tenderloin isn't as horrible as it's often made out to be. I've been to a few good bars over there and had some great eats (late night tacos without going to the Mission). In fact, I'd go so far as to say it has a unique flavor/character all of its own. Still, it's not what most tourists want to see when they visit SF and it IS right next door. A bit of advice. San Francisco is a walking city and has good public transit. Parc 55 is right on a transit hub too. Parking in downtown SF can be expensive. I would suggest NOT renting a car for the duration of your stay (you will pay $35+/night to park downtown) and renting one only for when you need it (i.e. a 2-day window where you head to Napa or down to Monterey/Carmel). There are a bunch of car rental places (everything from the big chains like National, Budget, Enterprise, etc. to smaller, local companies) within a block or two of the Parc 55. Save money on nightly parking and only rent on the days that you NEED a car. When you're in the city, you won't need one. In the end, Parc 55 is a great hotel and pretty reasonably priced (even if you don't use priceline/hotwire). It's wonderfully located. I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful modern hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: 701LongBeach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came here for a weekend trip away with no kids. The hotel is located in the heart of union square with tons of restaurants and shopping nearby. The renovations done a few years back have transformed this hotel to a very hip, modern and comfortable hotel. The view from our room was spectacular and the service was impeccable. My hats off to the managment of this hotel who are doing a lot fo things right...We had a great time in SF and in the hotel's very hip bar. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: FromBadgerState
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my daughter for a conference at the Moscone Center. We found this hotel to be conveniently located, clean and well cared for. Make sure the little vent on the bottom of the window is closed securely--we had terrible street noise the first two nights and I believe the vent may have been partially open. Hardly saw anyone in the hallways, staff was friendly. We were disappointed with the selection of local dining options. There is a great little cafe/pub a block south that I HIGHLY recommend. This hotel definitely needs free wireless in the rooms and a minifridge/micro. With the limited food options nearby, this would be a great feature. Jasmine at front desk was wonderful at check in.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay A Few Things To Say”
Reviews.Author: MyAbundance
Reviews.Content: I live in SF so this was sort of a out-of-street stay. The Parc has good package deals and the location is right in the middle of Union Square. For tourists I imagine this to be ideal. You cannot hear the street noise which is a huge bonus, atlease from the higher floors. I also recomment a corner room, goes without saying. Union Square is obviously bustling and a great many things to do around the hotel and BART and MUNI are directly below at Powell and Market with several surface entrances. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jjones4180
Reviews.Content: Hotel check in was easy and effecient. I needed a refrigerator for medication storage and thanks to Donna at the customer service, it was noted in my reservation. The refrigerator was delivered within 10 minutes of my check in. Also the house keeping woman stopped by about 15 minutes after my check in to make sure I had everything I needed. The bed was comfortable and I did not hear any street noise. I was suprised that the hotel had a 13th floor which I was on. The room was average size and the shower drained a liitle slow. I was surprised they had no Kiosk to print bording passes in teh lobby however the concierge offered to print it from his computer. Overall the hotel was a good choice and the price was less than other hotels. I will probably be staying here again in October when I travel to San Francisco with Friends.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, Not so Good and Ugly”
Reviews.Author: snwong48
Reviews.Content: Now this hotel claims to be a top hotel in SF and there is a mixture of bad, good and ugly thrown in. The good: 1. Location is excellent. A few steps away from Union Square, the cable cars, trains and other attractions. It really is pretty central for most things 2. I was lucky, I got a corner room which was very large and made the long stay there very comfortable 3. There are free computers with internet to use downstairs but to be really good, there should be free WIFI. This is after all 2011! 4. Housekeeping - very clean Not So Good 1. The furnishing - dated. I can't quite believe that this hotel was recently furnished. Except for the flat screen TV and the comfy bed, everything looked like it came from the early 90's. The toilet was even older - like from the 70's 2. The club facilites - we were given lounge faciilites which was good but the breakfast offerings are limited and I find it odd that they don't offer the dessert and snacks from Thu to Sun. In fact the lounge is closed! That is half the week, so what is the point. Club facilities should be offered every day. 3. The gym - machines are old. But I am grateful it is open 24 hours. 4. Lack of communication - we paid to extend our stay in the room till 6pm but housekeeping barged in more than once (after I bolted the door) to clean the room. Apparently front desk and housekeeping don't communicate. The Ugly 1. The conceriege service is dismal! They were unhelpful when a tour of mine which they book did not materialise. Kept on saying that they have used this company for 15 years.

Reviews.Title: “Great views of SF in a spacious room!”
Reviews.Author: mzmelanie
Reviews.Content: Ok, so this isn't your typical review of Parc 55. I stayed in a suite on the 31st floor. And let me tell you, the views are A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!!! The suite was huge.. master bath w/ jacuzzi, enormous half bath, fax, sitting area, dining table, desk in room, mini bar/kichenette. There was 4 of us but you could easily sleep 8-10. Pros: spacious suite, VERY clean, comfortable rollaway/cot (I didn't get to try out the bed), True Blue Spa (Bath & Body Works) products, =) I *love* the little vent thingie under the windows... can breathe fresh air any time. Con: The TV remote didn't always work (may just need new batteries). Gets a little noisy even that high up. Expected tho since it IS downtown. Their solution.. provide earplugs! Awesome. =) Concierge Lounge: Hor d'ourves -- soda, Starbucks coffee, crab cakes, artichoke/veggie dish, various cheese & crackers, fruit. Dessert -- lemon meringue cake, cookies. Slept in so didn't get to check our continental breakfast. =( My favorite memory: Coming back from spending the day downtown and finding a box of Le Helge chocolate on the bed.... and on the dining table.... complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries!!! =) HEAVEN. I do have one suggestion though for the manager (should they ever read this): PLEASE invest in a full size mirror. It can easily go in one of the bathrooms or in the bedroom. Us girls love to do a head-to-toe outfit check before we head out on a night (or day) out in the town. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: JSpaulding
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Parc 55 for a getaway night for our anniversary. We live in the suburbs and were looking for a "night out on the town." The staff was very helpful and responsive. The hotel is a couple blocks to Market Street, Cable Car turn around, and Union Square. Our room was clean and the beds were comfortable. We were on the 6th floor so we did hear some traffic noise but this is SF. Got a deal on the hotel and would stay here again. If you are looking for a getaway or a hotel close to a few areas then you should look into the Parc 55.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: wagales
Reviews.Content: I was in San Francisco for a convetion at the Moscone Center. Parc 55 is an excellent location. You can walk there in ten minutes. I had breakfast every morning and the staff was very pleasant. During the evening you can walk to dozens of restaurants of all types, and when you have leisure time, the cable car is100 feet from the hotel. Unon Square is a ten minute walk. I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: CharlieA_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. Room was clean, everything worked and the bed and shower were fine. However there was no refrig in the room and only paper cups for tea making. There was some street noise but no more than would be expected in the heart of a city. The location was excellent, right by the subway (for access to the airport), cable car and Union Square. There is a nice coffee shop ajacent to the hotel which serves a great breakfast and fresh orange juice. The only downside to the location is the rather seedy environment back of the hotel - however there is no need to go in that direction. The hotel has good functioning free computer facilities and an ATM. Our only problem was the consierge who mucked up a tour for us by telling us the wrong hotel pick up time and wrong location. As a consequence we had to pay for our own taxi to the other end of the city to meet the tour bus. We were not pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Looking...”
Reviews.Author: snlpacific
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here for our 10 year wedding anniversary and upgraded to a "King view room". When we reserved I even made sure to request "a great view room please" as this was a special occasion and we we paying full price for a lengthy 5 day stay. However, once we got to our room we realised we were on the bare minimum floor to be considered a "view room" (25th) and because we were the first room off the elevator and in the wing of the hotel, our view was half obscured by the adjacent wing and our privacy was close to nill! When we went to the window to admire the view, several times the room next door had people standing looking out their window too, the rooms across in the other wing waved at us. There was no privacy. We called down to front desk see if we could be switched to a different room due to the view blockage, privacy issue, etc... all they offered is the room directly below ours, which wouldnt be considered a "view room" which we paid a preimium for, or a room with 2 double beds on the same floor, which also was no acceptable as we were there for our anniversary. We were so disappointed as there was no way the hotel was full and we were there for 5 days and paid ALOT of money to stay there. The view and location we good but there are other choices that would be comparable. The lobby is beautiful but once you get to the rooms, they are standard, nothing special, except for the view. We feel there was no perks staying here and felt nickel and dimed. They charge a ridiculous fee of $15 a day for internet access that you can get at a hostel or Comfort Inn for free! Seems crazy that a hotel is still charging for what has become standard service in most other hotels. Also they charge $4.50 for the Aquafina bottled water in your room. Parking $50 a day. We were disappointed with there in room coffee as well as it is individual 1-cup-at-a-time deals and ordering a pot of coffee in was over $12! Breakfast prices were outlandish. I made a direct long distance call home (Canada) and for 69 seconds I was charged $12! The walls between rooms are really paper thin. Several times we were woken up by the neighbouring room flipping over in bed. There is alot of noise from the street below, but we didnt mind that as it is apart of the city life we came to experience. The king bed was fine, but they give you 3 standard size floppy pillows and then 3 ginormous cushions that are far too big to try to sleep with and we ended up chucking them on the floor everyday. All in all the hotel is fine, but not worth the $$ they charge, and then to be charged for every extra thing that comes standard in many other places, left a bad taste in our mouth. We were really very disappointed that they didn't try to be more helpful with finding us a better room considering we were staying there for a good stretch of time and we made it clear we were celebrating a special occasion. I was also put off by the $15 a day internet charge, charge for local calls, charge, charge charge. On general principle I refused to pay for the internet and went to the mall right across the street and used their FREE wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with some great staff”
Reviews.Author: Shirlene5757
Reviews.Content: I was in San Francisco for shopping last Thanksgiving. Picked Parc 55 because of its location and it used to be one of our corporate hotels. I chose Pacc 55 even without our usual corporate discount because we love the location and service. The response and service from Donna from the reservation dept has always been consistently great. I had some issues with billing and I had to get through Donna to get a response. Although she is from reservation and not billing, she tried to help me get a resolution from the relevant dept. Unfortunately, i did not get any resolution but i decided not to pursue the case because the service from the hotel is overall still satisfactory. A plus point is the internet connection is reliable (although you need to pay) - impt as i am required to work even when im on holidays. We are from Singapore and a little obsessed with cleanliness and glad that the room was very clean when checked in and throughly tidied every day. Housekeeping staff was very friendly and did their job very well. The staff were attentive and quick to help. When we were checking out one day at 5am, the staff on duty was quick to help us get a taxi and help us with the bags (and it was raining that morning) Beside having some issues with the billing, our stay in Parc 55 was great and enjoyable.. I am planning a trip to SFO again this month and will stay wiith Parc 55 again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Bebej1976
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel. Generally pretty good. The rooms with a decent view face Union square but they are also noisier at night. PROS: - Fantastic Location with a Muni/BART terminal at the front door and many shops around. - Very friendly and courteous service from Front Desk Staff. - Decent Fitness Centre - Free internet access in Business Centre CONS: - Breakfast quite expensive and service not very good. No omlette included in buffet which is pretty standard with most US hotels. - The lobby and restaurant has obviously had a refurbishment but rooms and corridors could definitely do with one also. Though rooms are clean and comfortable. - i was jetlagged with the UK/west coast time change and was asleep/awake quite odd times. I was really disappointed that there was no Room Service between midnight and 6am. I wasnt expecting the full menu but at least the option of sandwiches or SOMETHING...even if it was something delivered from outside the hotel. But absolutely nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and dime you after you think your getting a good rate.”
Reviews.Author: Olson145
Reviews.Content: Paid $200 for the room. Then $60/day for parking. Want Internet - extra. Extra bed- extra. Had a lotion called "grin and bear it" in the bathroom. That says it all. Won't be back here.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible attitude”
Reviews.Author: allancsn
Reviews.Content: When we checked in the first thing the clerk said was she would change our booking as we must have got a king bed in error. We hadn't - we're a couple who like to sleep together - but that wasn't right in her eyes. Not the bigotted attitude I expect from a 4 star international hotel- especially in San Francisco. When I told her the booking was correct she looked annoyed and then proceeded to give us a room set up for disabled clients without telling us - I phoned down to complain as we were not willing to stay for our six days in a room with no bath tub and hand rails all over the place. Guess what we got the same clerk who huffed and puffed about the hotel being short of king bedded rooms and then allocated us another room this time with a connecting door - which I find really creepy - again without tellingus and making us feel she was doing us a big favour. We asked to be moved again and again over the next three days and we're given the run around - on the third day I was promised a call from a manager - never happened though. We just gave up in the end as it was clear they reception staff didn't give a damn about us being unhappy and made us feel thet they didn't want us to be there. The hotel itself has seen better days and feels tired - the rooms are cramped and the room seating isn't sufficient for two adults to sit unless one sits on the bed. The lack of free wi fi is amazing in this day and age - the weird thing is you could stand outside and get free access but not in the rooms. The area is full of beggars durung the day and turns really scary at night. All in all I'd say avoid and stay somewhere that gives a damn.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BryceReading
Reviews.Content: Being located right by the cable car this hotel couldn't be in a better position for seeing San Francisco. The room was clean and the shower was great. Staff were also very friendly and helpful.The fitness centre was well-equipped. I would definitely stay here on my next visit. Great hotel, great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly helpful staff, comfortable beds, windows that allow fresh air”
Reviews.Author: gregnashleigh
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 accepted our bid via price line. We weren't familiar with them and after looking at some of the reviews on trip advisor, i have to admit, we were a bit concerned. I know there can be various experiences at the same hotel, but sometimes I wonder if some of these reviews are done by other competing hotels as a smear campaign because we didn't experience any of the problems that others have written about. Location- one of the best! Steps to the trolly car(must do in Sf), buses and train to the airport. Yes there are homeless people around the block ( not outside the front door), but this is seen in a lot of big cities. San Fran seems to be a city that allows panhandling to happen more than most, but it's not dangerous and you can keep walking Staff- very friendly and accommodating. My wife is fighting cancer alternatively so she needs to have a clean possibly hyper allergenic room and a fridge for her supplements and specialized food. She called parc 55 and explained her need for thos things plus a quiet room since and they put us in one of their 'pure' rooms. This is A Hyperallergenic room that has a medical grade air purifier in it. This was huge for us. They also put us on the 19th floor so road noise was not an issue. They also delivered a minifridge minutes after we asked for it. Thanks to Winnie For helping to make our stay a great one! Pure Rooms- very clean, very comfortable bed, decent layout, great views. Furniture is not super modern,but they do have flat screens with a ton of channels including movie channels. Business center- was able to scan a doc to my thumb drive at no cost. Windows- we love fresh air and most high rise hotels do not have windows that open. The parc 55 has a luver at the bottom Of each window that Allows fresh air to come in. Simple, but Great invention! We are heading back to SF today and we hope to get lucky with our price line bid and get the Park 55 Wyndham again!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Dodgy Location.”
Reviews.Author: sugarrain73
Reviews.Content: The lady who checked us in was extremely friendly and welcoming when we arrived. She also offered us a free upgrade which we quickly accepted! I'm glad we did as the room was just average. Quite small with two queen beds, as opposed to one double, which seemed to dwarf the room The bathroom was quite tired and shabby; the lack of fridge was annoying. The best thing about the room was the view; we were on the 26th floor and could see right down to the bay. This could have been the reason why we experienced no noise from outside. In fact, the thing that constantly woke us was other residents slamming their bedroom doors when leaving; why some people seem unable to close a door quietly is beyond me. However, as average and acceptable the hotel was we would not return due to the dodgy, and at times, scary location. We found some nice bars near the hotel but it was like running the gauntlet between them in the evening because of the beggars and pan-handlers. It was like a scene from shaun-of-the-dead every time we left the hotel! It became exhausting just to step outside and on the Saturday night we returned to our room early just because we so sick of the hassle we continously had when walking around the area. Would never stay in this location again; San Francisco is beautiful and there are so many other nicer places to stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing! Poor service, dated accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Discerning12385
Reviews.Content: Decided to reserve a club room so I could get daily breakfast, evening dessert, soft drinks and snacks in the afternoon, etc... Upon checking in, the front desk clerk said I was a club guest but then proceeded to put me on a NON-club floor. The interior decorations look very 90s, the bathtub is out of the 60s, so I called to ask if there was a renovated floor. The operator said all the rooms were recently renovated (yikes!), and only the club floor rooms are bigger. Telling him my room was small, he said that I was not on a club floor. Then told him I paid for a club floor room, he checked my reservation, said I was correct and put me in touch with someone in the executive offices. She quickly told me I should have gotten a club floor room and would send someone to move my belongings. A bellman soon came to the door. My belongings were waiting, basically in easily movable form, and he told me he wouldn't move my shoes. What? He told me I had to pack them up. He had a giant travel cart and couldn't put my shoes on it? So I took a laundry service plastic bag and packed them up. He finally took them. I arrived on a Thursday night, so I enjoyed the gym and then got some sparkling water in the club room. It is then that I see the placard stating that EVERYTHING except breakfast is UNAVAILABLE Friday through Sunday. No dessert, no free soda, no quiet views - nothing that I paid for except breakfast. That should be stated in large letters before one books through the website or any vendor. Finally, to add insult to injury, I woke up Sunday morning around 9:30 am and got to the club room breakfast at 9:45, 15 minutes before the place was closing. The pickings were slim. No more bagels, no more croissants, the dregs of yogurt. So I asked if there were any more croissants, and the Wyndham employee looked at me like I had asked him to donate the contents of his wallet to me. It seems to me that I paid for this breakfast, and everything should be available at the end of the meal time as it was at the beginning. The Ritz Carlton makes sure everything is filled consistently from beginning to end at the club rooms. This was a disappointing hotel experience from beginning to literal end. I am typing this in the club room at this very moment.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: klingerkrew
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. Extremely nice staff members. We enjoyed our stay very much and the location was within walking distance to many great San Francisco sights!!!! Room was spacious and large bathroom as well. If I ever go back to San Francisco, I will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls make for an unpleasant night”
Reviews.Author: Westlakeguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 for a conference, at which I was a speaker. I asked for a quiet room on a high floor, and the hotel check-in person said she had a "very nice" room for me--#2511. The room had a terrific view, but the room was small and more importantly, the walls were paper thin. I was awakened by the guy in the next room at 1 a.m. speaking (in a normal voice) on the phone, and then again at 6 a.m. It wasn't his fault because I could hear he was using a normal voice, but the walls are obviously paper-thin. If you must stay at this hotel, make sure that you at least don't get a room that connects to another with double interior doors. In addition, several personnel insisted on having conversations outside my room (which was small) early in the morning. Also, the bathroom sink drained very poorly, and it was not cleaned well: there was mold on the grout in the shower walls. The hotel is designed to cater to airline crew (they have a special airline check-in desk) and large tour groups--I saw a coach with 50+ suitcases in the downstairs lobby, so they clearly don't expect to need to cater to repeat business. While the location was excellent, the price reasonable, and the bed comfortable, I was glad I only had to stay one night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: NCM1982
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location - steps away from the trolley cars that take you up to Fisherman's Wharf, union square and fantastic shopping. It is also beside the BART train that you can take to/from the airport. For location, Park 55 really can't be beat. Otherwise the hotel rooms were pretty average. Classic two double bed set up. No fridge in the room. Outdated decor throughout. Nothing 'fancy' but definitely convenient!

Reviews.Title: “LOUD, RUDE, NOTHING SPECIAL!”
Reviews.Author: afficionada23
Reviews.Content: i thought the hotel will be sexy and trendy, it was just average. the worst part is, it is extremely LOUD there. you are in the middle of the city, yes. however, i always stay in centers and have never experienced such thin walls and such drunken screams from outside. we were on the 9th floor right by the elevator, there was construction and the men spoke right in front of our door, LOUDLY. when i called to complain about a broken light bulb and the fact that my room was cleaned when i put the "do not disturb" sign on, i was told, i didnt put it on, ummm, why would i lie about that? i suggested for them to give me 1 morning of free bfast and that didnt go anywhere. at check out, no one asked me how the stay was. there are better hotels in the area, im sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Picassox3
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Parc. Both times have been a pleasure. We picked Parc because I was having a 2 day outpatient procedure at UCSF. My husband wanted some where close to the hospital, quiet, relaxing and stress free . Parc 55 met our needs . We had a lovely room and were greeted with a fruit basket and bottle of wine. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service, 1 block from a bad part of town, lots of external noise”
Reviews.Author: paulamwilliams
Reviews.Content: My husband and I called twice before our trip to confirm that we would have a King bed. Once we got to Parc55, we were informed there were only double beds left. We were staying 3 nights and were very uncomfortable in a double room. Every day we asked to be moved and were refused. While this hotel is near the shopping district, it is loud at night and is very close to a suspect area of SF. I would pass on this hotel--especially considering the price.

Reviews.Title: “4* = expensive internet and parking”
Reviews.Author: aeternalis
Reviews.Content: I have nothing to say against overall quality of this hotel: it is well located, clean and staff was very nice. But I am fed up of being charged for internet in high end hotel: charging 15$ for 24hrs of internet access in 2011 is NOT OK. I depend on internet to work and I EXPECT IT when I go to a 3* hotel or higher. I have decided that from now on excessive fees will directly impact my ratings. In this case, I would of given 4/5 -1 for internet (15$) and -1 for parking (50$) = 2/5.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mau_nj
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Parc 55 for two nights at the beginning of April. We booked this hotel through Priceline and got a great deal. The location was perfect for us...we went to many of the nearby bars and restaurants, walked to North Beach and then to Ghirardelli Square and took BART to visit a friend in Oakland. The BART station really couldn't have been much closer, so that was great. We had a room on the 10th floor and had no issues at all with noise. The room was okay...a decent enough size and clean. We were hoping for a little more from the room, but as we got such a good deal on Priceline, we definitely couldn't complain. We appreciated the free internet in the business center which we used for printing out our boarding passes, but would of course preferred free WiFi in the rooms as well. Overall, I'd say with this location if we could get another good deal, we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, informative staff and a very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: poli11
Reviews.Content: A great location with many fabulous restaurants within walking distance. Lots of shopping, cable cars close. We walked to Fisherman's Wharf three times. The Moscone Convention Center is a nice walking distance away. Felt very safe walking everywhere. The service at the hotel was superb, right from check - in, to the maid. All personnel were friendly and willing to help out in anyway possible. The restaurant was pricey, particularly for breakfast. Lots of machines available in the fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “used to be better... very, very noisy”
Reviews.Author: mikek0118
Reviews.Content: In the good side, it's well maintained. Clean, comfortable. Awesome shower heads and water pressure. Very friendly staff. Good food and room service. However, the Parc 55 USED to be a good business hotel in a decent location. Market Street has really gone down hill with the economy - and sometimes dead scary (two homeless people started a fight next to me as I was waiting to cross the street last evening about 9pm). The hotel, while well maintained, has an old infrastructure. The plumbing is noisy. The doors don't keep out any hallway noise - and many tourists come in large groups and congregate outside of their rooms. I can hear every footstep in the room above me (despite it being carpeted?). The street are very noisy (even late at night) and the windows not particularly sound-proof (they're vented, which is good when you want fresh air, but not when you want quiet). On this stay, the fire alarms went off three times in the middle of the night (no apparent fire, thankfully) - which I expect is not a regular occurrence. I grew up in NYC, so being in a big city is not strange to me. This hotel just isn't meant to be a big city business hotel any more. Finally, bring your own wireless hotspot - they want $15/day for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great service will have you coming back for more”
Reviews.Author: DanBruzzone
Reviews.Content: Our airline did everything they could to deliver my wife and I from Minneapolis to San Francisco as late at night and tired as possible. We missed the last BART train for the night, and ended up taking the Super Shuttle to Parc 55, arriving around 3am. I called the hotel when our plane landed, and I think the Parc 55 representative was the only friendly, helpful person I talked to that night. No problem, she said, we'll keep somebody at the front desk until you get in. Sure enough, when we finally came in, smelly, unshaven, and tired, to the Parc 55's elegantly remodeled, stone-and-glass artwork of an entryway, the front desk staff was waiting for us, knew our names and had the room keys prepared. The concierge was helpful and knowledgeable, but for a hotel of this size it would have been nice to staff the desk with more than one person; especially during the morning hours when guests are headed out on an unfamiliar town, the line can get a little long. One morning it was 30 minutes' wait, because one guest wouldn't stop asking questions. When you only have one line, there's nothing you can do to speed that up. I'm going back to SFO in November, and this will be where I stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very well done business hotel”
Reviews.Author: GHG4
Reviews.Content: Had only one problem....lady at check in spoke/understood English as a 3rd language. Caused a problem with getting in room internet service. Overall,very helpful hotel re excepting incoming packages, didn't lose any or charge for the days storage. Have loaner umbrellas, went by the green rules regarding not giving out new towels if you hung yours up. Business centers well equipped and at no charge.

Reviews.Title: “Centre Of It All In SF”
Reviews.Author: Sorefeettoproveit
Reviews.Content: Great hotel right in the thick of it. Basically the transit hub for all of SF, you can get there from here. Asked for corner room, got it, no extra charge. Would not hesitate to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, wonderful location, not great for sleeping...”
Reviews.Author: Where2Gowhere2go
Reviews.Content: Noisy. Needed ear plugs and was still woken up by the people in the adjoining room at 4 am. Lots of street noise. Wonderful downtown SF location, but soundproofing in the rooms could be MUCH better.

Reviews.Title: “nice/business class hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaNYC3
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Parc 55. Service was nice but not overly so. Hotel was a very nice business hotel and a good deal for what we paid. ($250/night incl free parking and club level amenities). Nice gym, bar/restaruant, and central location with access to Bart, buses, and taxis. (normal parking is $45/day) - south of the hotel on market street seems a little sketchy though. Only real con for me was that the mattresses and pillows were really too firm and uncomfortable. *We stayed on the club level which was a nice room with a view and access to the breakfast/wine room most days. Breakfast was fruits, starbucks coffee/tea, toast, danish, and boiled eggs. Appetizers during weekdays were tasty and wine/beer was available for purchase.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and view”
Reviews.Author: guleed
Reviews.Content: Best location and view i can think of. Close to all forms of transport. Service was very good. Room was clean and well serviced. The hotel is fancy but the rooms are basic. It still doesn't make sense to me to charge for internet access in the room. Business center is small and has 3 computers that you can print boarding passes from. Food prices are high. There is a small cafe right next door where you can get good breakfasts for cheap. Exercise room is large and full of equipment. We could hear some street noise but it was not a problem for me.

Reviews.Title: “great location, cleanliness not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: forrest73
Reviews.Content: overall this hotel was ok. it is a four-star hotel and the service is pretty good albeit a bit slow at times. the location can't be beat at just a couple of blocks to the powell bart station. cleanliness wasnt the greatest as i realized the bed sheets hadnt been changed prior to my check-in to the room (there were some hairs which were a bit longer than the ones on my head). i called down and they changed the sheets right away but not the quality of cleanliness you'd expect from a 4* hotel. overall id say its a decent hotel in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay! Love it!!”
Reviews.Author: hotmissy71
Reviews.Content: I loved the location and thought the hotel had wonderful service and were very courteous. I would stay there again matter a fact I plan on it!!

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable Beds and Hidden Costs”
Reviews.Author: hkyd
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Parc 55 recently for a gay-themed event. First, when we checked it, the staff member seemed uncomfortable when we asked him for directions to the staffing tables for the event. Considering the event is huge, this ignorance seemed quite ridiculous to me. Also, the beds in the room were quite uncomfortable; I don't think I slept well for one of the four nights we stayed there. There were two problems with the room that we had to report: the fan in the heating assembly was burned out and needed to be replaced. There was a burnt out light in the entryway of the room as well. The problems were quickly remedied, but clearly the rooms were not checked regularly. There were also many additional costs associated with the room. In addition, to the $120 / night cost, the hotel charges $14.95 per 24 hours for internet (sluggish at best). Also, the hotel charged us $5 for each short LOCAL phone call. This charge is absolutely absurd when calling within the city. The sheet on one of the beds was covered in some sort of dried blood or other substance. Since the bed is covered with lots of pillows, we did not notice this until we checked out. Yuck! Overall, the hotel looks pretty on the outside, but is not worth the price to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “My Top Choice In San Fran”
Reviews.Author: bagoda1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on three occasions, although this is my first review. Simply put, this hotel is in a great business location, it is nice, clean, professional, and it has a great price to boot! I do not even check anywhere else anymore, which as a chronic Tripadvisor junkie, is hard for me. The rooms are good sized, with big picture windows with panoramic views of San Francisco. There are a ton of restaurants and bars of all variety right outside the doors. The service has always been good. But I do have one teeny warning. Many flight crews stay here, so reception can be challenging if you are behind two or three flight crews waiting to check in. Save your money. Don't bother with the Westin. This is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “i liked”
Reviews.Author: ntxhais
Reviews.Content: only misadvertisement is beds are NOT queen size, full size. they might need to change their misrepresentation of that or change all the beds in the hotel to properly represent themselves great view/ layout front desk didn't inform us of layout of hotel, but eventually found a map near elevators to get a gist & walking around asking ppl; bellboy was helpful with sightseeing tips; housekeeping is accommodating overall stay, I enjoyed it. But for a 4 star hotel to NOT have a refrigerator is kind of inconvenient for people wanting to refrigerate their dinners from a night out, medication, drinks, etc. (another disappointment) didn't stay in room except to sleep in and bathe. saw the exercise room, it was nice, but had no time. water vending machine was at $3, I think, so bring your own water to the room. it offers a nice view and mostly cardio equipment don't take a room next to ice machine, you can hear it operating at this hotel side note: I enjoyed the town a lot. there is much to see and the area is a little dangerous, so go in groups--someone i knew got hit in the back of their head in the area by a bunch of prankster men (men! what the heck--they have not grown up enough) scared her and her boyfriend so much they left town and didn't stay the night. just BE CAREFUL, SF is still fun.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect to check-in on time”
Reviews.Author: SARCruzer
Reviews.Content: We spent almost an hour waiting with several others that were trying to check in for our room to become availabe. We were in a hurry since we had other things scheduled, and being told " We are not sure when your room will be ready" doesn't really work for me. The room was fine otherwise but won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms and views. Club lounge well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: trell0v04
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Parc 55 end December 2010. Had 2 rooms booked. Arrived on an early morning flight and had requested early check-in if available. They had one room ready which was great after a long flight. Everyone loved the Club lounge and great value as we had breakfast, entree and dessert at night and only needed to buy one meal a day. Terrific location close to Union Square and transport. Staff mostly friendly and helpful. Had read reviews about the noise problem but didn't notice any from the 28th floor. Would highly recommend if we visit again. Didn't have free wifi but able to use computers at the Business Centre free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cupcake1Reading
Reviews.Content: When we booked this hotel we had some reservations about the location but we need not have worried at all. This hotel is in a fantastic location for visiting San Francsico, its central to all local attractions and some brilliant restaurants. The trolley bus stop is 2 minutes walk away and the Westfield shopping centre is on your doorstep. All the big name American shops are all in walking distance too. The hotel is faultless, the staff were absolutely fantastic and cannot do enough to make your stay comfortable. The rooms are spacious and spotlessly clean with nice views. I have recommended this hotel to some friends who will be visiting the area this year. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Definitely 4 star +.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and not friendly”
Reviews.Author: ARGIGGLES
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel close to Union Sq, China Town and the Street Car, this is a good hotel. But if you actually want to sleep, stay away from this hotel. The room was extremely noisy from the outside traffic to the neighbors next door you could hear everything. The hotel staff was not friendly. When we checked in my husband asked for some directions to local pizza place for a quick lunch and the receptionist told him he would have to go wait in line and talk with the Consierge. Overall we were treated as a bother than a customer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location...”
Reviews.Author: D5Irl
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for 6 nights in November 2010. Booked a queen room but nice lady on reception offered to switch us to a double double (which was our preference but we chose not to pay 90 Euro extra for this when we booked thru www.ebookers.ie). Room was spotlessly clean, very comfortable beds, big HD TV etc with a great view of the city (from 24th floor). Only noise was occasional firetruck or ambulance but it's a city so that was to be expected. Room serviced & fresh towels daily. Very impressed with housekeeping particularly on 1st morning @ 5am (major jetlag!) when hairdryer was broke & a quick call had replacement at door within 5 minutes. Hotel is perfectly located near Union Square. Opposite Bart, Cable Car & Westfield Mall. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and wil be back. Despite reading some other reviews, we felt very safe in the surrounding area. The staff were pleasant & very helpful. Special mention to the lovely doorman who found us a stretch limo to the airport when the shuttle was late - for only $45 plus tip!!! A couple of minor negatives - (1) Wifi - very expensive daily charge which we didn't opt for. There are free PCs on floor 2 lobby and in business centre complete with printers (great for online check in) but would have like free Wifi in room. (2) Security - elevators & floors accessible without using room key. Can make you feel a little vulnerable. PS - a lot of reviews mention the homeless people around the area. I didn't think there were any more than anywhere else. Didn't encounter any hostility, in fact the same homeless man asked us politely every day to buy him lunch!

Reviews.Title: “I would give a Fair review.”
Reviews.Author: Maikolo
Reviews.Content: From the outside, this hotel doesn't look like much. When you walk in you can tell that the place have been newly furnished with modern decor and amenities. I would say this place is nice, clean and comfortable, but I do have a few minor complaints that ruined the stay for me. Two small things that I must have that you will not have in this hotel is a microwave or a refrigerator. I was told that the refrigerator would cost $20. Before I touch anything in a hotel room I do a small inspection of countertops, toilet, windows etc., just to see how well the room was cleaned. I noticed that the desk in my room had stains from someone's greasy arms and food stains. Same situation with the remote control that I had to sanitize about three times to get the grease off. Also, if you are someone who likes to use the gym, this one is pretty bad. The Gym has about 8 treadmills and only 2 are in working condition. Dumbbells are in an area where you cannot do anything overhead due to ceiling height. Bring your own water bottle because the only water available in the gym is from a drinking fountain. Overall, I would probably stay here again, but I have stayed in almost every hotel in the downtown area and there are better options for the same amount of money.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel that almost made me stay in room and not see city”
Reviews.Author: Dacrow1970
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with bed linen that is so soft and comfortable that I wanted to sleep all day and all night. It was very comfortable and the rooms adminities were amazing. I loved the coffee in room, the TV was great with lots of good channels. There were alot of great resturants right next to hotel and it was centrally located. I would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE AND COMFORTABLE”
Reviews.Author: Silviaround
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice and clean. Hotel has a good location, close to transports and good services. We had some missing towels from our room but they provided us with them immedeately. Then someone the day after put on our door the sign do not disturb and the room wasn't made up..but overall it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the Street Zombies”
Reviews.Author: Antkneee
Reviews.Content: Our corporate travel department made us stay at this hotel and I was amazed at how nice it was. The last time I stayed near market st was like 14 years ago and I vowed to never do it again. The area has definately gotten worse. The homeless people are more aggressive then ever and there is someone attacking you ever 6 feet. It just makes this are incredibly negative. Thanks to the Wyndham by Request Club I had a bottle of red wine and peanut M&M's in my room...just a nice perk. Our corporate travel agents also got us free internet and a Grab and Go Breakfast...which gave us two items and a cofffee...nothing incredible but it was nice. The rooms were really nice too...comfy bed, flat screens, showtime, amazing views from the 28th floor, Bath and Body Works Bathroom lotions and shampoo, Coffee Pot....etc... Door guys were great too...very funny and helpful with any of our questions. I also asked many people why they called this place Parc 55 and no one knew. I finally figured out that after taxes and tip it cost us about 55 bucks to park here each night, so maybe that is where the name came from. Also the first elevator I have ever seen that stands up for a cause...it is repectful to vertically challenged people...the numbers go in opposite directions on each side. One side starts at 1 and goes down and the other side starts at 34 and goes down...confusing to us tall people at first but once I figured out I wasnt crazy I thought it was very cool and caring to others. There was also a really nice health club...this was the first time that I did not have to wait for a machine...I went down here at 5am and 6am and there was never a crowd. The equipment is new and has a TV attached to each one. I would highly recommend this hotel, but beware once you go outside you will be bugged for money from all of the homeless people...it is kind of like a movie where the zombies keep coming and they try to eat your brains!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ghill5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 for just one night for a quick business trip. Took the BART from the airport to Market/Powell Street Station, just across the street from the hotel. My co-worker and I arrived early in the day but I was able to check into my room and we stowed our bags until her room was ready later in the day. Stayed in room 1619, very nice and clean. Updated furniture, bedding and a large flat screen TV. Everything was very clean and the view was spectacular. Then only negative thing I would have to say about the room is that I had to wear the ear plugs provided with the other toiletries because - even on the 16th floor - it was quite noisy at night. I was informed that you really have to be on about the 30th floor of a hotel in SF before it's quiet. Grabbed the vintage MUNI Streetcar across the street for $2 and took it down to the end of Market Street. Got off (after taking a transfer from the driver) at the Ferry Building. A really nice place to spend lunch looking in fun "foodie" shops. Got in the rather long line for the Roli Roti porchetta sandwich and was not disappointed. Worth the 25 min. wait. Got back on the streetcar to Fisherman's Wharf. Walked around, took in the sights and took some pictures. Grabbed the trolly at the turnaround by Ghiradelli Square and took it to the other end which was a block from the hotel. A perfect way to spend the afternoon in SF when you don't have a lot of time! As a business traveler we were offered a "free" breakfast which was from their "Grab and Go" bar. Included a selection of pastries and fruit along with coffee. Not very hearty but it was "free"! We ate dinner at "Smooth Thai" which is located on the main floor of the hotel. EXCELLENT food and reasonable prices!!! Checked out with no problems. Overall a wonderful hotel in a super location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Choose another hotel”
Reviews.Author: NuclearAli
Reviews.Content: There are so many hotel options around union square- I'd suggest choosing another one. Hotel is clean, good location, nice rooms but we experienced some of the worst service I've ever received in a hotel. We stayed there two different times in July and both times had line ups of 20+ people to check in. Also was woken up at 2 AM the second time we stayed there with a call from the front desk asking who we were and what we were doing in the room! Turns out we were not properly checked in (though obviously we had working room keys...) and other guests were trying to get into our room. Good thing I bolted the door or we would have gotten a surprise! Complaints were made to the manager in the morning but he didn't seem very interested. Oh well, plenty of other options for hotels to choose from. Don't bother staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: ks1547
Reviews.Content: This is the second time staying here, the staff are all very friendly, the accomodations excellent, very close to BART (their subway system, literally across the street!) and just a few blocks from Union Square, and the conference centre, and the 24h gym is convenient too and well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: y5740
Reviews.Content: On the morning of December 28, 2010 I woke up in Room 764 at the Parc 55 with two bites on my hand which were in a row (classic bed bug). After returning home we began getting more and more bites. Nightmare. Spent the past two weeks trying to get rid of them ($200 in covers for every bed in the house, vacuuming, washing everything that can be washed, taking apart bed, DME, Spray, more vacuuming, cleaning the house). Nothing worked. Terminex is coming tomorrow to get rid of bugs for $700.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Artemus_Gordon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Parc 55 for the Fancy Food Show. Location is ideal to everything right off Market Street. Very comfortable, comparable to ther good hotels in area but a better value.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: millyc28
Reviews.Content: I must start with the disappointing factor. I uncovered the sheets to find dried blood stains in the middle of the bed, this is totally unexceptable as if they didn't bother to look or change these, what else did they not do. Reports on bed bugs 3 months ago. A great hotel which has been newly refurbished. Good and attentive service. Excellent central location if you want to be in the heart of the city although some rooms I'm guessing maybe noisy. Across the street from the BART!!
