The roonm in general was lovely and 3 members of staff came to change the sheets and I received 50% discount on the room, still no excuse for dirty bed sheets though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms, fine bar - AOK”
Reviews.Author: agena10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend trip to SF--great central location, right across from Powell St BART and trolley. Nice lounge/bar area also, good drinks/apps, and reasonably priced for a downtown hotel. Would stay here again easily.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised. Great rate. Nice room. 5 star staff.”
Reviews.Author: Shastaboz1
Reviews.Content: I got an incredible rate directly through the hotel web site. It was a "Monday" special. It was so cheap that I knew it would probably be a terrible room. I was so wrong. The hotel was beautiful. The staff was pleasant and efficient. The room was clean and great. It wasn't a 5 star, but I didn't pay for a 5 star. I would say 3.5. However the staff was 5 star. The location is outstanding. There was a coffee maker and a safe. The walls were a little thin, as we had a noisy group next door. However, that can happen at any hotel. They even gave us earplugs for the traffic ten stories down. I have stayed in SF many times, and this introduced me to a new place to stay. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good location but management has poor and defensive attitude”
Reviews.Author: travel_man_hk
Reviews.Content: the hotel is conveniently located in the center of San Francisco downtown. many transport options, shops and malls are within walking distance. the hotel room is spacious and its amenities are modern. mattress are comfortable. the only thing i must criticize is their management attitude. i was assigned to a room facing the street and next to a gym. the noise was constant and unbearable. hence, i requested to have the room change. however, the hotel management refused to change the room until the next day though many guests were checking out then. and the management was extremely rude and impatient. instead of resolving the issues, they took this issue on a very personal ground. many other staff i came across are generally friendly. but when situation arises, i find their management was rude and extremely unhelpful

Reviews.Title: “so so accomodation and service. overpriced. disappointed”
Reviews.Author: 4blinkies
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed 4 days in Dec 2010 at 55 parc hotel in san francisco. we paid $189 for a club room including parking ($44 night). Although we enjoyed the convenient location of union square, we find the hotel accomodation and service disappointing for the following reasons: 1. Upon arriving at the entrance, we were told by the valet staff to "unload your bags and leave the keys". there were no concierge staff or luggage carts to assist. Better service would have been a hotel staff member with a luggage cart meeting us at our car to help with our luggages in. 2. Checking in was smooth until we got to our rooms and discovered that the rooms had one king bed each instead of two queen as requested. we called the front desk and were told by Jeff, the manager, that there were no other rooms available and the options were to have another bed brought in or stay where we were and got changed the next night. we told jeff the choices were unacceptable. we were then told to wait in our room until concierge call us back. after half an hour wait, we went down to the front desk, waited in line for another half an hour before talking to another manager, Tasha. she then was able to change our rooms without any problem. Instead of the run around, better service would have been to switch us at our first request. 3. A club room stay included continental breakfast between 6 am to 10 am. At various time, the room was packed with no seats. There were people standing with breakfast in hand while eating. ?Requests to take breakfast to the room to enjoy was denied. Better service would have been to use a larger room for breakfast or allow guests to bring their breakfast to their rooms or have more than 2 hotel staff to clean tables and have them ready for next guests. 4. I used the gym once at 5 am during our stay and was disappointed at seeing used towels on the floor. at that early morning, the gym is empty but should have been clean. Better service would have been a staff attendance to clean the machine and pick up dirty towels. A nice touch would have been a water dispenser or some kind of refreshment corner for guests to enjoy. Instead, the hotel had a vending machine. Guests usually don't carry money when going to a hotel gym to exercise. 5. Room was comfortable, limited storage place, had two 12 by 12 inch drawers for clothes storage. Better service would have been more than 2 drawers that size. We ended up using our luggages as storage. Internet use was $13 /day. The hotel boasts its reputation for business/leasure travelers. Better service would have been free internet. 6. Upon checking out, we found out that the hotel charged us for parking anyway, despite confirmed reservation for free parking. The staff was quick to fix the error, but again, at our inconvenience of waiting in line for a resolution. 7. Security was poor. Anybody from the streets could have walked into the hotel, taken any elevator to any floors. Room access requires a key, but the hotel halls and bathroom facilities are open to all. Better security would have been a room key access at least to the elevators. With its prime location, parc 55 would have to step up its service and accommodation to justify its room rate for travelers to choose to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable room, friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerYYZ
Reviews.Content: I was given a great large corner room on a high floor with an excellent view in top condition without asking for it on a great rate from Expedia by the friendly front desk staff when I checked in. I had read the reviews about the location being noisy but other than the odd muffled siren from an emergency vehicle typical of any large city downtown, it was very quiet during my 10 night stay. Along the bottom of the windows in the room there is a lever to open and close a narrow space if you wanted fresh air, and perhaps those folks who found it noisy had that open without knowing it. The thermostat in my room worked perfectly if I wanted more heat on a cool night. The location couldn't have been better and very safe for walking to restaurants, theaters, shopping etc. The tenderloin is just West of the Hotel and I would avoid that area as there is nothing to see there anyway, [except for a great restaurant/bar 'Farmer Browns' close to the hotel] and as is the case in SF panhandlers are out in force around the West side of Union Square but only want spare change and will not hassle you if you pass them by from a distance. They are a fact of life in that part of the city. The Hotel service staff were skilled and very friendly. At times I could see a line up to check in at the very large hotel but it moved quickly. For such a large busy hotel there was no waiting time for the elevator and the common areas were not crowded or noisy. I had the breakfast buffet there twice and it was very good as was the service. The only criticism I could think of was that the Wi-Fi in the room could have been faster as it was slow during peak periods, but I was able to use it just fine. I would definitely stay here again and I highly recommend the hotel to anyone. It is a very good choice and excellent value for families, couples, or single travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: mrsant27
Reviews.Content: Thanks for such a wonderful stay Parc 55! The room was clean and the service was amazing. I would definitely stay again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Parc 55; my favorite spot in SF”
Reviews.Author: Tombo_in_SoCal
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice rooms and helpful staff. The only place I stay in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Another stellar experience at the Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: Gary_n_Kimberly
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best people working there. The rooms are cozy and clean. We stayed here before, and this last trip was from Dec 24 - 27. It only gets better. What I really liked this time was the relaxing lounge area at CityHouse, their restaurant & bar. Anna at the front desk completely took care of us.

Reviews.Title: “Location is unbeatable!!! Hotel is fantastic :)”
Reviews.Author: HonestLadyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I was in San Fran during the summer for the San Fran Marathon. We stayed at the Parc 55 Hotel, and our stay was AMAZING! We were directly across the street from the bart, which we used all the time - including transportation to and from the airport/Berkeley, which would have been super costly if we took a cab! Besides the bart access, the hotel is only one mile walking to the Embarcadero! We would run there everyday and then run down the Embarcadero towards the Warf. It would be quite a walk to the Warf, but you can take the F tram (the stop is also right down the street from the hotel) and this will take you right into the warf. We were surrounded by shopping and restaurants! The staff at the hotel is AMAZING! They were so friendly and helpful, giving us recommendations for dining and the public transit system. If you are staying here there is no need to rent a car as it is located so close to all forms of public transit. If you do drive, the hotel has its own parking garage though. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to San Fran! We hope to be back soon :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pooh_bear_tx
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it is close to the BART station and bus stop. We took BART to SF for a concert and had to walk from the bus stop (5th and Market street) to the hotel at late night. We definitely made the right choice. The actual distance between the bus stop and the hotel is much closer than it looks on the Google Map, because the hotel has an entrance on Eddy (where its valet parking is). We were allowed to check in at about 10:30am. The front desk staff was very friendly. We were upgraded to a high floor room with city view!!! We enjoyed the beautiful night view as well as the the sunrise in the early morning. The room was clean and quiet; however, around 8:20am the housekeeping started to knock doors on the hall way. It was quiet annoying although our room was skipped because of the "do not disturb sign". My children were still asleep at that time, but they were not awaken by the knocks, so I think it was not too bad. Our TV remote control did not work, so we called the "guest response". They quickly delivered a new one to us. The next morning we had some problems with the hot water temperature, they also fixed it promptly. I am very satisfied with their services. Overall, I highly recommend Parc 55 especially if you travel by BART and bus!

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay, Still Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: chbruce
Reviews.Content: After a very enjoyable stay last Christmas, we decided to bid again through Priceline, and got this hotel for Dec. 24 & 25 for $72 per night ($10 more than last year). The hotel is very nice. Large, comfortable room, convenient location, nice amenities. Be sure to ask for a corner room on an upper floor to get great city views, and less street noise. Even with priceline, they were happy to do this for me. The hotel is very conveniently located steps away from the BART train to the airport, as well as cable cars and muni to take you anywhere in the city. As was true last year, my only minor complaints are not enough counter space and towel racks in the bathroom, and very uncomfortable easy chairs in the room (the arm rests came up to my ears, so it wasn't really comfortable to sit there. The only other observation is that there seemed to be much more panhandling in the hotel area this year compared to last year. I imagine it's an issue any time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: lightofnyx
Reviews.Content: Excellent location right in Union Square and by transportation. Room on the 27th floor was very nice, super quiet, and had amazing views. The club room was excellent and we loved having a great breakfast there every morning-definitely worth the extra cost. I know other people mentioned noise problems, but that high up it was very quiet and we got a very restful sleep. Customer service was excellent. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “So Noisy! But hotel is OK”
Reviews.Author: 400driver
Reviews.Content: Ok. This is an average hotel in good location but for some the good location may be the problem. The level of noise from the street is very high. If you have a room on Cyril Magnin street you will be woken up by the constant siren noise from the fire department. They seem to need to keep the sirens on to avoid running down the countless people of questionable mental health who frequent the down town area. At 0400 local i was awoken to the shouts of a "local" at street level doing his best to wake up the neighbourhood. Now my room was on the 15th floor and every word he was shouting was audible! The windows in the hotel seem insufficiently glazed to keep out the local noise. The hotel staff seem very nice and the rooms are typical by US standards but when a hotel leaves you ear plugs as part of your amenity pack then be warned! I realise this is not the hotel's fault but to have such close access to the down town area is not without its price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CNPREME
Reviews.Content: Staff is absolutely amazing! Everyone from the bell hop, check-in/check-out (Ericka & Riecky), conceirge, room service and maids..... they were all VERY pleasant and always smiling, Location of the hotel is "spot-on"; BART is approximately 250' away (easy to tote bags to/from), mall is across the street and Union Square is a short walk away. Rooms are very comfortable and inviting. One downfall... the windows are NOT sound proof and you can hear all the vehicle traffic.... if you can handle that, it is the perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel right in the centre of it all”
Reviews.Author: MAB28
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 Wyndham is located a stones throw away from Market/Powell St BART station on Cyril Magnin St so it is close to everything. If you are arriving by air, the BART should take approximately $8.25 and it's a 30minute ride or thereabouts, when you leave the station, it's easy to spot. Looking over to Market St, you have the Westfield Shopping Centre with all the stores you could possibly need for a spot of retail therapy. The Powell/Market cable car stop is at the end of the line or beginning, however you'd like to look at it, is nearby the BART station and hotel. There are various restaurants in the Union Square area and surrounding streets of the hotel, so there are lots to choose from and you will find something you fancy. As you enter the hotel on the ground floor, you can take the lift or the escalator to the 1st floor to where the reception area is, along from the reception area is the Cityhouse bar and restaurant, the bar have some great cocktails and bar snacks it has to be said. Check-in was of the usual professional standard that one expects, efficient yet courteous. After a long day of travelling from the east coast, we wanted to relax and unwind. The room was located on the 24th floor, we had booked a deluxe king room which was very spacious and afforded some nice city views - namely of the Transamerica Pyramid and a bit of Union Square. There was no complimentary wi-fi available in the rooms BUT, located on the 4th floor at the business centre are a bank of computers where you can check emails etc. There are also 2 additional computers located on level 2 opposite the gift shop, however there was no codes or passwords to enter so it seemed that anybody could walk in off the street to use them. Be mindful though, that there are a fair share of homeless people in and around Union Square, so of course, near the hotel, every city has it's problems but to me, this is something that is very noticeable. Having been to San Francisco on a few occasions, I accept this and don't let this bother me or get in the way of having a good time. The hotel is conveniently situated for anyone who is looking to use the cable car a lot and do a lot of shopping and of course use the BART/local transport. I had stayed at another property on Powell St during my previous visit and most definitely prefer this hotel, so I would consider using again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect location, excellent experience.”
Reviews.Author: Girasol66
Reviews.Content: My two night stay was great. Had higher floor room so it was fairly quiet. Check-in was quick & easy. Housekeeping had everything well stocked & spotless. Reservation through hotel’s website: unbeatable price. LOCATION is perfect. Just steps from Bart station, cable cars, F bus. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND Parc 55!

Reviews.Title: “If you like cold showers, you'll love the Parc 55!”
Reviews.Author: cincytraveler123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 with 5 other colleagues for a conference. The first night the internet access didn't work for anyone. The first morning we all took cold showers because the hot water was gone. We tried to eat breakfast at the hotel restaurant but they couldn't handle the crowd, so we went elsewhere. The room phone has buttons for "Guest Response" and "Express Checkout", but they don't work. I completed the form on the hotel's website and never received a response. The only positive about this hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - in my opinion expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: crystart
Reviews.Content: Great downtown location. 1 block from cable bar and Market Street. Don't go behind hotel as you can easily see the beginning of the Tenderloin district. Rooms were average to nice. Decent bathroom. A/C/Heater/Fan was loud in room. Would kick on throughout the night but was loud....I didn't sleep well for the 2 nights we stayed at this hotel but I chalk that up to the fact I was drinking each night. Buffet breakfast was $22 or $24 or something - didn't do it as I couldn't bring myself to spend that on eggs. Vale parking was $55/nt (oversized vehicle) - again expensive in itself, but seems average for the city of San Francisco. I forgot to take pics of the room but the pic on Trip Advisor are accurate.

Reviews.Title: “I got an excellent rate!”
Reviews.Author: mixalakh
Reviews.Content: I was very please with the hotel. The only downside were the fact that the windows were noot double glaze as a result the room was really very noisy especially at night. I did not get a good night sleep eventhough I was on the 13th floor and the food was not that nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: chalioacosta
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay at. Just a couple of blocks away from union square and less than one block away from the bart system. Very good service for a great price. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Central, functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: stirling98
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a sales kick-off. The purpose was business and to be near our offices - centrally located in SF. The hotel fulfilled this purpose very well, but unfortunately struggles to stand out from the crowd. The positives for me were: Great bed and sleep quality Central location with only minutes walk to Union Square Friendly staff It is difficult to say where I felt the hotel could do with an improvement, but it did not stand out in any particular aspect. It was all very mainstream and standard. Even large hotels like the Parc55 can do little things that make your stay more special. Having said that - there is nothing wrong with reliability and if you want romantic and boutique you'd be staying elsewhere anyway. There is no lack in things to do in the area and the hotel bar has a good choice of bar, food and sports TV as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a tasteless and expensive Thanksgiving dinner”
Reviews.Author: Johnrmaniz
Reviews.Content: Room was nice but small. Our biggest beef was the Thanksgiving dinner. Expensive at $59.00 without coffee and wine is extra. Turkey and stuffing tasted terrible, salad was good and dessert was ok. Waiting service incredibly slow! Would not recommend their restaurant for dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Katiesarahread
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for one of 2 nights we spent in the city during our stay in SF. We thought the hotel itself was very cool, the room was clean and nicely done out. The best thing about this place was the location, it's a stones throw from forever 21, the cable cars at Powell and also westfield shopping centre! We booked the hotel through hot-wire so got a really good deal. We spent the evening in the bar drinking a few beers while we watched the giants win game 1 of the world series! Had some garlic fries from the bar too which were amazing! Staff were really nice and I would definitely stay here again!! A must have for people looking to have a good shop while staying in SF!!!

Reviews.Title: “By far the best service I've experienced in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: LDeRose
Reviews.Content: I had previously spent time at the Parc 55 for a conference and was really impressed with the rooms. Recently I was planning a romantic weekend with my SO and thought it would be the perfect place. Our plans were to see the city and spend little time at the hotel so service wasn't my main concern, but I knew we would be happy with the room. Since my previous stay, the Parc 55 was purchased by Wyndham Hotels. Upon our arrival, we were greeted with a very warm smile and the desk clerk seemed genuinely happy to be assisting us. I had requested the same room-type as my previous stay, but thought my chances were slim as we were checking in quite late and it was a busy weekend. To my surprise, we got the room we requested! Not only did we get the room we wanted, the hotel has had a complete renovation of the lobby. The restaurant, (which is very comfortable and the bartenders certainly know their craft!) is spacious and full of friendly and attentive staff. I recommend this hotel to anyone. It is conveniently located just off Market near the best shopping and restaurants. Union Square is a few short blocks away and we were able to walk most of the city with ease. I will certainly return. Thank You for an enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly nice, good location”
Reviews.Author: WrldTrav-7
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a five-night visit for a conference. I upgraded to a club-level room, which was perfectly nice, if nothing luxurious. Lovely view and it was nice to have a little couch to hang out on (I turned it around to face the window). The club-level lounge is well-run and all the folks who work there nice. Actually, contrary to a lot of reviews, I had good experiences with all the staff, save one outside valet/doorman (?) who actually stole a cab from me before he realized I was a guest at the hotel. The room was extremely clean, the bedding nice, and the in-room coffee surprisingly good. The elevators are fast for such a large hotel. The location is good, though there are a lot of homeless people in the area, so be prepared for that, and in one direction (towards the Tenderloin neighborhood) it gets a little rough. There is a mall very conveniently located about 1.5 blocks away (great for traveling on business for those forgotten things and there is a grocery store on the lower level). Traveling in and out on the BART was a breeze. Cons: The Internet (paid) is really slow, both on wifi and wired. The bar has a really bad selection of wine (I have my priorities!) relative to the area. The biggest problem was actually noise (as many have mentioned). The windows don't seem to be well-made, and I could hear people laughing on the street on the 27th floor. There is also a sizable gap under the room door. I stuffed a towel under to mitigate hall way noise. Otherwise, nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Ginsberg
Reviews.Content: The location, near Union Square, of the hotel is great. Though the hotel looks and feels a bit outdated for its pretensions. Not great, not bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory, but there are other less expensive options in same area.”
Reviews.Author: JalAmes
Reviews.Content: My room was clean and comfortable, hotel staff friendly and helpful, and my stay was overall satisfactory. The biggest assets for the hotel is location. It's within easy walking distance of the conference center, shopping, and great restaurants. But, after walking around the area during my one week stay, I found several other hotels that are also in this same area for considerably less cost, and they look equally as nice. There was nothing about the Parc 55 that made me say, "wow, this was worth the price, and I want to come back."

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that does the business...”
Reviews.Author: ethy12
Reviews.Content: Primarily a business hotel (conferences) this hotel is still great for tourists in down town San Francisco. We contacted the hotel ahead as we had booked through Priceline, they replied, but understandably, there was no guarantee of our request of a high floored room, however this information was still communicated and reception honoured the email - we were given a room on the 23 rd floor (great view) which seemed to avoid most of the street noise and anyway there's something very charming about hearing the bell of the cable car whilst you're lying in bed. Superb bed with great mattress and high quality linen. Flat screen TV and good toiletries were welcome; on the down side the tea and coffee making facilities were less than adequate for 2 people- 2 tea bags and 2 sachets of powdered creamer in a hotel of this calibre is mean isn't it? We were given a disabled room which whilst large, had an adjoining door to the next room- we wondered whether this was the reason for being able to hear our neighbour's conversations relatively clearly and their TV noise? The area felt safe (although please note there are more homeless people than in other cities we have visited). We used the business centre for free internet access everyday and only had to wait once. They have a printer so you can print off your boarding pass too. We heard the corridor outside our room being vacuumed as early as 3.30am and whilst housekeeping were excellent they did tend to knock our door as early as 8.30 am. Location is great for Union Square and is perfect for the BART to the airport but it will take you 30 minutes or more to walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Staff were polite and they don't charge you for looking after your bags on your last day. Access to food outlets and restaurants was superb, we even bought a few meals from the diverse food hall in the Westfield shopping centre and took them back to our room. Overall, we thought it was great and with a few minor tweaks it would be excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Local, Easy Travels & Clean!”
Reviews.Author: ChristineSomma
Reviews.Content: Great things: 1. Clean-The Room, Bathroom, Floor, Elevator, Everything. 2. Close to...-Union Square, Market Street, a block away from the Trolley system & 30 seconds away from BART their subway system. So easy to travel to from the Airport. Not So Great things: 1. Bed-Looked comfy, yet was extremely firm. 2. Noise-We stayed on a Friday, Saturday & found they give you earplugs in your room for a reason. Union Square gets busy and is right below your hotel. Couldn't sleep without them. A Little of Both: 1. Amenities-No refrigerator in the room. Many guides and magazines. Coffee maker with coffee & tea complimentary, but if you tried to refill in the lobby they charged you :/ 2. Staff-Encountered 4 or 5 staff members & 2 Concierge. The staff was extremely courteous and friendly, while BOTH Concierge were rude & not very willingly helpful. Overall: a fairly pleasant, definitely easy, definitely clean stay.

Reviews.Title: “amazing, so central...!”
Reviews.Author: SanchaP
Reviews.Content: Great location, so central and so easy to explore the city from ... Staff were really friendly.. and so accommodating to our needs would definitely recommend to a friend or family traveling to San Fran .. the only thing that I missed in this hotel was a pool.. the fitness centre was great though

Reviews.Title: “Great location in SFO.”
Reviews.Author: Manfrey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located in downtown SF next to a Bart station and the San Francisco Tourist Info Centre. It's also near the cable car turn around and right across Market St from Westfield shopping centre. We got a good deal/package through Facebook and had a great view from the 28th floor with continental breakfast and evening hors d'oevres/supper included. Breakfast was good but evening supper was very basic. Room size okay for 2 people with 2 queen beds. Staff generally were not very friendly and you get the impression it's a big hotel and you are just one more guest they have to process.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, good rooms, great location in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: TeachMKE
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at the Parc 55 Wynhham. Staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms were very clean, and the beds were comfortable. We had a great view of the city from our 13th floor room! The best part about this hotel is the location in Union Square/Downtown San Francisco. It is within blocks of great shopping, restaurants, and bars. It is across the street from the BART line, easy to get to from the airport. It is also close to trolley cars and bus lines.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: venicegirl05
Reviews.Content: This is a great gem of a hotel. Large hotel but not overwhelming. Service was efficient and attentive. Got a good night sleep. Great for a business traveler and leisure traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: GEM0
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Parc 55 for 5 nights in a club room. The location of the hotel is great - right across from the BART station (easy transport from the airport for $8) and the cable car. It's a block away from Market Street giving easy access to most attractions with both the cable car and street cars going to Fisherman's wharf etc. There are lots of shops, restaurants and cafes around with good meals and cheap drinks. The room was clean and comfortable. I had read a lot of reviews about the street noise - however our room was quiet and even sirens were not a problems (or no worse than any other inner-city hotel), we were on a high level which might have helped. Staff were very good but not intrusive and check-in/out was quick. I thought the club room would come with a few more extras but apart from the included breakfast (good) and being on the higher floors with access to the lounge, it wasn't that much better. They still wanted a ridicules amount of money for internet access (why do big hotels do that?) and charged $7 a drink from the 'honor bar' in the lounge. The business center gave free internet access but was busy. I paid a fairly good rate for advance (no refund) purchase but I haven't seen that particular rate again - I don't know if I would want to pay any more than I did.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice full service hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: traveler212121
Reviews.Content: Very nice full service hotel at a great location. Right next to the Powell street BART stop. The view was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Next choice”
Reviews.Author: crod80
Reviews.Content: While the location is near the Bart and close to the shops, it borders a neighborhood where you find very sketchy characters. I didn't feel particularly safe walking around at night there. I would recommend staying on the other side of Union Square and not near the Tenderloin area. The staff was also not friendly and our room was not ready at the time of arrival (mind you we were checking in at 11:00 p.m., how can it not be ready). They also blamed booking on expedia and travelocity as the reason why there was no non-smoking rooms available, which that was later remedied after we complained about that. We later discovered that there were plenty of non smoking rooms available. So they lied to us. The room itself was nothing to brag about. It could definitely use some fresh paint on the walls. And it's a noisy area of the city, so they have to provide ear plugs for your comfort, yikes. Overall, I think there are better hotels in the area at the same price in a safer location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: felicarrillo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great location, there are several restaurants near by and if you have plans shopping spare spending the big bucks on hotels that are on Union Square and instead stay at this hotel, just 3 mins from the square. It was my first time at SFO and wanted to get to know the city. Since I could not visit all the places I wanted to see, next time I might stay closer to the piers and the golden gate bridge. Rooms are nice and service is very good, the hotel was at full occupancy during my weekend stay and staff were at full, still they took the time to spend time with me and answer all my questions.

Reviews.Title: “A Truely Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: indie_jewel
Reviews.Content: We were first time visitors to San Fransisco and wanted a hotel that was near everything and clean. Parc 55 really exceeded our expectations! We stayed for 5 nights. This hotel is located within 2 minutes of the bus line that takes you to Fisherman's Warf, or the Trolley is right across the street. Chinatown is also nearby the hotel. The street that the hotel is on (Market) is one of the main streets with all the shops. The mall is also a couple of minutes away, which is convenient. Parc 55 was very clean, we did not find any complaints with our room. Beds are large and so comfy! There is also a nice flat screen t.v. A large window offers lots of natural light, and a wonderful view of the Financial District. The rooms are very cozy and comfortable. The employees are very helpful and answer any questions you may have. We would definitely return to Parc 55 as we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed.....”
Reviews.Author: wofwnr
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel thinking it would be a great locale for our needs. The street noise never ended and we only were able to sleep when I called front desk at 3:00 a.m. to have them get us another room. Rooms were adequate. Very expensive for what you receive. No wireless..(unless pay for)....50.00 for parking your car...We definately overpaid for what was given.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special at all -- lots of better options right next door”
Reviews.Author: Gimmeshelter76
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews have said most things that need to be said - yes, the location is great, but so are the locations of scores of other hotels around Union Square. The room was very small; acceptably comfortable and clean. But no refrigerator or microwave for $160+/night? Huh? Other than Motel 6, no other hotel has attempted to charge for wifi...until I found this jewel: $15/day for wifi. Oh well....I laughed it off as I tethered my cell phone. The extras and hidden charges (including $46/day for parking) continue ad infinitum. Unacceptably long wait at check-in followed by rude service by asinine staff. Their attitude is that they're granting you a special privilege in letting you stay there. What a joke. Outdated 70's schlock architecture and interior design passes as "avant-garde" at this concrete hulk. They will always be able to sell rooms to the wide-eyed tourists who don't know better. That doesn't mean you have to be one of the chumps. Do yourself a favor and check out the Fairmont, Handerly, Triton, or one of the many other wonderful hotels in this world-class city!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service and hotel - would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: stsang
Reviews.Content: We were travelling with a 6 month old baby and the noise from the 6th floor room was incredibly loud (especially when the clubs let out). We asked if we could change our rooms (we had ajoining rooms - 2 doubles and one King) - they accommodated us perfectly and moved us up to the 23rd floor while we were out for the day. We also needed a fridge for the baby formula - they sent one up at no charge. We paid $165 US per room (which included parking) - can't beat the price in that location. I'd definately stay there again. We thought the rooms were well kept, clean and the service was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55, Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: BearsRus
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 Hotel is near Union Square in San Francisco, near both buses and trams as well as load of shops, restaurants and entertainment. Westfield shopping centre is only 2 minutes walk, with a huge foodhall on the bottom floor, great shops and on the top floor when you've shopped and seen all the sights, there is a cinema complex with all the latest movies. The hotel has a very good restaurant, the rooms are very comfortable, wifi available at a cost $45.00 for 7 days, but no bar fridge, however there are ice machines on each floor, with ice buckets provided in your rooms. Tea and coffee is also available in your rooms, with powdered milk, but having this facility in an American Hotel is quite rare and welcome. Get yourself a 7 day bus/tram passport for just $26.00, you will save this amount over and over. Overall a great hotel in a fantactic location.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly Not The Best Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: KingsCo
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is certainly not the best hotel I have stayed at recently. The rooms seem dated and need refurbishment. While the view is stunning the rooms lack natural sunlight and seem gloomy, even on a sunny day. The hotel needs to improve on cleanliness - rooms as well as public areas such as the lobby. Furthermore, being in an area that at night seems to be suffering from a high crime rate visible security would be appreciated to provide a sense of comfort and safety.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with incredible views”
Reviews.Author: elaine r
Reviews.Content: We like to stay at Parc 55 because the location is in the city, right across the street from the Bart station and also the cable cars. This part of the city is so wonderful for shopping, dining, nightlife, etc. We almost stayed at the wharf, but it's so q u i e t there, we prefer a more high energy location. Hint---call the hotel directly, NOT the 800 number, and you can often negotiate a better rate. Rooms equipped with a safe and a rather large bathroom, though the shower is pretty dark and could use an overhead light. Friendly staff, but location is the best part of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in the City”
Reviews.Author: CorndogCorndog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 for 4 nights in late October. The location is fantastic. Close to great shopping. A block from the cable car station. Easily walk to the water. One night we did go to the bar and have drinks/appetizers. Both were very good ... highly recommend the pizza! The fitness center is one of the best in a hotel that I have visited. About 10 treadmills and 8 eliptical. Free weights and lots of machines. Personal TV's on all the machines Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise is in store for you.”
Reviews.Author: K-traveler13
Reviews.Content: I have passed this hotel in a taxi countless times without ever staying there. To be candid, the bland hotel name was a psychological turn-off. When a client recently booked me into this hotel, I remained a doubting Thomas. Not any more! This hotel is good in every dimension. Its location is ideal--off Union Square, a hop, skip and jump from the Powell Street cable car and BART station. You can take BART to or from SFO in 20 minutes for $8.10, and not worry about traffic jams. The deluxe room boasts a king size bed, sofa, desk, dresser and closet and doesn't feel in the least bit crowded. The closet is full sized. The bathroom is spacious. Although the bath tub and shower are combined, the shower was excellent. Hotel service was prompt and competent. Concierges were cooperative and knowledgeable. As in most hotels that cater to business people, buffet breakfast is the default. You can order a la carte but it is advantageous to take the cold or hot buffet-- service and pricewise . In the evening the restaurant serves an assortment of small plates. I tried two and they were both quite good. The bar was a popular evening gathering place when I was there--most of the patrons were cheering on the SF Giants. Finally, you should check the travel websites for price deals at this hotel--for whatever reason (is it the bland name?), it can be highly price competitive--a superior value to be sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maxfish001
Reviews.Content: First to say is that this hotel is in an excellent location for discovering the heart of the city, the shopping districts, nightlife etc. The public areas are tastefully and modernly decorated, the rooms are comfortable and of a high standard, if not quite as cutting edge in decor as some hotels i've stayed at (don't take this the wrong way they're definately up to the standard you'd expect). The staff are friendly and courteous, although I did leave the concierge feeling a bit like i should've known where the mall was after i'd asked (but this is a small point - maybe i took the turn of phrase the wrong way). It certainly wouldn't stop me staying here again. Room service is excellent! Try the Angus Burger, its awesome! I also had breakfast in my room which was very good. Hotel take note: I do resent having to pay for internet use in my room, especially when its not particularly good! I have an iPhone and laptop and couldn't use both at the same time on wifi. Maybe this is a small point but i found it annoying when i've had to pay $44 for internet connection during my stay (quite an astronomical charge I think). Overall i've had a good stay, and would recommend it (but consider it may be a false economy if you need to use the internet throughout your stay). This has definately knocked the value rating I have given for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So convenient!”
Reviews.Author: blacklabsocks
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 has a super convenient location. Highly accessible whether by Bart, streetcar, taxi or bus. Right in the middle of shopping and numerous food choices. While the room (especially the bathroom) looked a little tired it was very clean. I didn't hear street noise but that's probably because we were on the 29th floor. Free Internet access at the business centre was much appreciated. One comment was that the breakfast at the lounge was understaffed. There was inadequate seating and staff to guest ratio was so bad that we had to eat with the previous occupier's dirty dishes and trash still at the table because the staff were too busy to keep up with the guest turnover!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but I won't go back”
Reviews.Author: love2travel040
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel on priceline for a fair rate for three nights. Were put in a smoking room on the first night and it was incredibly smokey as soon as I stepped off the elevator. Our clothes smelled like smoke for a couple of days. Management moved us to a non-smoking room as soon as it opened up with no hassle. This hotel is is a good location, close to Union Square,shopping, BART and cable cars. The kicker for us was after we checked out, the doorman arranged a ride for us to the airport. A few blocks into our ride, we were pulled over by the police because the driver made an illegal turn. The officer told us that it is illegal for doormen to arrange drivers for tourists and if they are asked, they must put the customer in a taxi cab. We were told that there has been a number of issues with town car drivers robbing customers or worse. I'm not usually a fear monger but I do not trust a hotel who's staff is not concerned about their guests safety, even after they've paid the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with great customer service”
Reviews.Author: CrankiestOne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel having booked through an opaque travel site (i.e., we didn't know the name of the hotel when we purchased). Many times this means you are given the worst room in the hotel at check-in; however, the hotel honored our request for a king bed and gave us a huge corner room. The representative at check-in was very pleasant, as was all of the other staff we encountered. Our room was very nice, with windows along two walls. The bed was comfortable and the housekeeping staff was patient. They never bothered us to clean the room early. The bathroom was small, with one sink and a regular tub/shower. The room was noisy, and earplugs were provided with the bathroom amenities (although neither my spouse nor I used them). I woke one night to sounds of a woman screaming outside and another night to sirens. The location is excellent. Westfield Center (shopping mall with great food court, Nordstrom, Bloomingdale's, Barney's) is across the street, as is the BART station and bus stop. It is 2-3 short blocks to Union Square. Taxis are readily available at the front door. Free internet is available on the 4th floor but there is a charge for in-room use.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a big night out”
Reviews.Author: FragrantEdwards
Reviews.Content: First of all, the suite was just awesome- 30th floor with a panoramic view of San Francisco. Tastefully decorated and spacious, our party was kicked off shortly after checkin with a close-range-fly-by of the Blue Angels- I swear we could see the whites of pilots eyes as they showboated at sub and supersonic speed. The staff were friendly and accomodating as we went about the business of celebrating my forthcoming marriage. Classy bar areas and delightful surroundings in the hotel added to the fun of the evening; the feng-shui inspired master bathroom was welcomed with sweet relief the day after, providing comfort after a heavy night of celebration! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - and very friendly and effective staff”
Reviews.Author: TCLP
Reviews.Content: Myself and my two sisters travelled to San Fran to my sisters wedding. Having spent a wonderful week at the Russian River we spent our last 3 nights at Parc 55. On arrival the receptionist was very friendly and thorough. Our room was at the side of the hotel so we had a view over the roof tops but not of the Bay - no big deal. The air con was not functioning fully in our room and we called housekeeping and within 45 mins John the engineer arrived to explain what might be the problem and also to advise us on how he was going to fix it which he did in rapid time and also phoned us later that evening to see if all was ok. - we very much appreciated his efficiency and friendly customer service. We booked a room with 2 x double beds - the room was a normal size more suited to two than three t- the beds were very comfortable and the linen was of a very high quality. A large tv screen and comp coffee and tea are supplied and ice water on the landing which we thought was a nice touch. A negative was the expensive bottled water at $4.50 and a very pricey hotel room menu. The bathroom was again a good size with plenty of accessories - plus a shower and bath. The rooms were thoroughly cleaned everyday. The hotel is very centrally located - which is excellent! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and found the staff very friendly and accommodating they gave us great restaurant recommendations and the bar staff even gave us the use of their beautiful wine glasses and a cork screw. The only down side and nothing the hotel can do about it is the noise of the fire brigade and police sirens at night but it is a city!! The total cost of our accommodation was $1000 - not cheap for three people sharing - they could be a little better on their pricing. If staying again I would insist on a front room that overlooks the city and bay. In saying all that I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, classy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Eicher02
Reviews.Content: Above all, the Parc 55 has one of the BEST views and locations in the city. It is just a block away from the the trolleys, cable cars, and there are taxis shuttling around which are always ready to take you to and from. There is a great little donut/breakfast shop on the same block and the hotel is within walking distance to just about any food imaginable. There is great shopping close by! The front desk staff experience was the only part of our stay that wouldn't get a 5 star rating, but the hotel itself and our overall stay was truly fabulous. I would definitely stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: colmirl
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights at this hotel, and found very few faults. My room (a corner room) was spacious. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom excellent and well stocked. Like others, it always seemed busy, but never crowded - and there was very little waiting time for elevators etc. Staff were friendly, and housekeeping was great (a late morning/afternoon lie-in meant that I missed the housekeeping round, and the room was unmade when I returned in the afternoon. There was a voicemail on the room phone saying to call them and it would be done - I did, and when I returned that night, the room was made up. The location is excellent for central SF with many attractions near by, and excellent transport links (BART and MUNI) within easy reach. The BART makes it especially easy for travel to SFO. Yes, there is street noise due to it's location - but as others have pointed out, if you ensure the small vents at the base of the windows are shut tight, then it should be fine. Wi-fi was expensive, which is a shame, but I've seen worse prices elsewhere! I'd definitely stay here again and recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ibraiker
Reviews.Content: A stay was very enjoyable, loved their homemade Roast Beef hash for breakfast and pigged out on the potato chips they make in the bar. Room was spacious and well appointed. An easy walk to Union Square and many of the popular spots.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not as many amenities as I expected”
Reviews.Author: ScreenName97
Reviews.Content: This hotel had beautiful decor, helpful staff, and a great location. But on the downside, it was noisy and did not offer the amenities that other 4 star hotels have. I'm usually a budget traveler for leisure, then stay at nice places for business. But I was disappointed. There was one restaurant with limited hours. The room service hours and menu were even more limited. I ordered a breakfast delivered one morning during my stay, but it was more than 45 minutes late and I had to leave for work before it arrived. The staff was very helpful about correcting the situation. I stayed on the 5th floor, next to the gym, and had the same problems as the previous post. But the gym wasn't the only noise problem. I could here everything on the street, entire phone conversations of nearby guests, televisions of nearby guests, etc. The hotel even supplies ear plugs with the bath toiletries. I had to use them because the street noise repeatedly woke me up every night This was not a bad hotel, but don't expect 4-star. If they advertised as a 3-star hotel then I would give them fantastic reviews. But when I hear 4-star, I expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel...would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Simonkey
Reviews.Content: Frankly I was a little worried about staying here based on some of the mixed reviews I read here and on Yelp. I stayed here for two nights over the recent Columbus Day holiday weekend with my partner. I had another reservation at an upscale hotel in FiDi (twice the rate of the Parc 55 but was still considered a fantastic rate for that particular hotel) but in the end, I chose to stay here. I thought I would regret the decision I made. I thought the Parc was going to be too large, too impersonal, and overall, just not live up to my standards. I was ready to be disappointed and regret my decision to stay here...boy, was I wrong! Valet parking was a breeze even though the hotel was booked to capacity on the dates of my stay. The cost of parking for a SF hotel was reasonable ($41 + tax per day). Check-in was easy as well. The hotel lobby was nice and spacious. When we got up to our room, we'd found that we'd been given a handicapped room. It would have been fine but we found the sliding bathroom door did not close all the way. Since I was traveling with my partner and this was only our second trip together, I did not find this to be acceptable. I went downstairs and the front desk staff was apologetic and searched for another room. Within a few minutes, they were able to locate another room (higher floor, same bed size, corner room! upgrade!!). They also rerouted our refrigerator that had been sent to our original room to our new room. There were no hiccups with our special request and they never acted like I was bothering them at all. Our new corner room had two windows, a large TV, and a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was large and very clean. The shower pressure was awesome! We never heard another peep from the neighbors except for the occasional door closing. We did hear sirens from the streets below (we were on the 23rd floor) but this was to be expected. This was not an extremely large room but for traveling with one other person, this was a good size. No complaints here whatsoever with our room. For such a large hotel, I never had to wait long for an elevator. Even though the hotel was bustling (a good feeling), it never felt crowded. The valets were quick to respond and extremely pleasant and helpful. We never had to wait long for our car to be pulled around. Staff was also helpful with organizing cab rides at the taxi stand conveniently located near the entrance. The concierge was also helpful with directions and maps. The front desk graciously gave us an extra hour to checkout as well. Finally, the hotel is conveniently located to the 80 freeway making it very easy to get in/out of the city. I've been to SF many times over the last 15 years and have no worries about staying near the Tenderloin. As long as you don't make yourself a target, walk briskly and confidently, and don't walk through there at night, it's not a problem. I know this has been mentioned on here so I just wanted to put my 2 cents in... I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city. Fantastic value for your money and first class service all around! Thanks Parc 55 for making this one of the best stays I've ever had in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, decent value”
Reviews.Author: nymancorey
Reviews.Content: If you want to be close to Market Street, Union Square, shopping and downtown SF, this is a great hotel for you. It is extremely large (convention hotel and over 1000 rooms) but doesn't feel like it at all. Rooms are decent sized, but the bathrooms are plenty large with ample space on the counter. The service at the bar was underwhelming and the offerings were average, but we wanted to have more local food based on the city's reputation. One item I found obscene was overnight parking, which was over $50.00 per night! This is crazy. I would return as the value of the room to price paid was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location as long as you are not a light sleeper”
Reviews.Author: KimZ13
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms for our group of four on Hotwire, $87 per night in August. Great price for this property, right across the street from the cable car turnaround and walkable to lots of shopping options. Coffee shop on the corner, coffee and pastries were very good, service was quick on both weekend and weekdays. The hotel rooms were a decent size for San Francisco. We had a room with two beds facing the back of buildings, and our other room (a king) had a great view facing the water. The king came with two side chairs, and the other room had a sofa. As I recall, we were on the 19th floor, with a room on each side of the hotel. So, we were able to 'test' the sound level on either side of the building. It was loud, both weekdays and weekend nights. It seemed there were constant police and ambulance sirens, horns blowing, etc. There were also garbage collections very early in the morning. There is not much the hotel can do about this, but it certainly impacted our stay. They do provide ear plugs in the rooms, if you can use them. This is a great inexpensive choice if you bid on Hotwire/Priceline for Union Square, and don't mind the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views of San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: deepestBlue22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a business conference from September 17-24. This hotel is in the heart of Union Square. It is steps away from the Cable car stop, avenues of shopping and in the heart bustling city streets. I enjoyed waking up to the sounds of the city. Our room was a corner king on the 21st floor. We were upgraded to a room with Club Access. The room was very spacious with views of two different parts of San Francisco. It included a small couch by the window that provided a very pleasant atmosphere. Overall the room was very clean and the maid service was excellent. The one complaint are TERRIBLE pillows. Very difficult to sleep on. I would advise requesting extra pillows or inquiring about better pillows. Club Access includes a complimentary breakfast, evening snacks, cocktails and desserts. Club Access is a very good option for travelers with children because the breakfast offering is very diverse and includes fruit, pastries, various sliced breads, cereals, cold cuts and juices. The house coffee is Starbucks. Internet/Business center Wireless in the room is $15/day or $44/week. The business center is fairly small but has enough computers and printers. Health Club Health club is very well equipped, with free weights, machines and numerous cardio machines. The cardio machines have personal TVs, but not all of the TVs work. Cityhouse restaurant We ate there twice and the food was good, but pretty overpriced. The late night scene at the Cityhouse is very lively and it is a great place to grab a late night meal and drinks. Keep your eye open for celebrities that walk in. Room service We ordered room service one morning and our bill was $70 for two omelettes and a pot of coffee. The food was delicious and it was nice having breakfast and enjoying the beautiful views from the room. Overall a great hotel, amazing location, great for business travelers and families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain for Stay in Union Square (Except Parking)”
Reviews.Author: duckrb
Reviews.Content: I went to San Francisco with friends for a weekend in September. All my friends are in college and I just graduated so we don't have a whole lot of money, but we wanted to stay as close to downtown as possible. Parc 55 was a great place to stay for what we paid (around 150/night) it was centrally located and inexpensive (in San Franciscan terms), the rooms were modern, equipped with plasma tvs, clean white sheets, etc, etc. In other words for this kind of money it was definitely a bargain, everyone was very friendly at the hotel, prompt room service, great customer service, only complaint is that valet parking was around... 44 dollars a night, I think? But hey, it's San Francisco parking is expensive and at least this covered valet. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Parcsfo
Reviews.Content: We traveled with family that had never been to San Francisco, and they absolutely loved the location of our hotel. It was within walking to the Westfield Mall, Apple store, cable cars, F Train pickup and Bart. We picked up a Muni passport which was also highly convenient. We love Parc 55 and will stay there every time we go to San Francisco. The rooms are clean and service excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting - avoid this hotel at all costs”
Reviews.Author: mel201082
Reviews.Content: I had a horrible experience at this hotel and would NEVER go back. When I checked in, I was told that the hotel was full and the only room they could put me in was a smoking room. There was cigarette smoke coming through the vents in the room and bathroom. People were smoking just outside our room in the hallway (next to the conveniently placed ashtrays). I asked to be moved multiple times, and the front desk staff was nice, but completely unhelpful. Finally, on the last night (of my four-night stay) they moved me to a nonsmoking room. Too little too late. This was the worst experience I have ever had at a hotel. I informed multiple staff members, including a manager, of this fact, and they were politely ineffectual. I fervently hope this hotel goes out of business before one of the smoking guests (whose convenience they obviously value more than the health/comfort of nonsmokers) falls asleep with a lit cigarette and burns the whole place down. If you want to get a decent night's sleep in a room that doesn't smell like an ashtray, do NOT stay in this hotel. I have advised everyone I know to avoid this hotel like the plague. I got a great deal on Priceline, but it wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, reasonable, and great location”
Reviews.Author: thirstycanuck
Reviews.Content: We went to San Francisco for a short getaway and found a great deal on priceline - $113 CDN/ night. We have found this hotel even cheaper ($80/night) depending on the season. Since their renovation a year and a half ago, they lobby and rooms have been updated and are pleasant. Very comfortable and clean. However, the real reason to stay here (besides the great pricline prices) is the location - less than a block from a BART station, close to Union Square, and walking distance to the Ferry Building.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: pattim1007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four days, went down the coast for six days and liked the Parc so much, when we returned to SF we booked it for one more night before we left for home. It is located at Market and 5th, which is a great central location. Bus, trolley, and train are right outside your door not to mention fantastic high end shopping! We even walked to Chinatown twice. Also, several car rental stores are right there so you don't need to rent a car at the airport. I do suggest booking your car online in advance. The line on a Saturday morning to get a car was out the door and down the street at the Hertz rental! We booked a car online for a Friday to visit Napa and had no problem and it was a lot cheaper, too. The concierge was very helpful with directions and suggested some fantastic restaurants. Our room was clean and spacious, although pay the extra to get an upper room to avoid the street noise and for a better view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Iamirish
Reviews.Content: We took the Bay Shuttle from the airport to Parc 55, $17 each. It was a good experience. We had a very quick check in. The hotel is close to all transportation. We did not have a car so that was a plus. We bought a Muni pass, $20 for three days. It was well worth the money. We used it for the cable car and the street cars. We were on 29th floor, excellent view of the city with access to the club room. We had breakfast there and it was good, lots of choice. We did not go in the evening for the free cocktails. The club room is spacious with lovely views of the city. It is however closed on weekends which is too bad. Our room was a good size. It was well maintained, fresh and clean. We were not bothered at all by street noise. We never had to wait on an elevator. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. Hotel is within walking distance to a large mall and many good restaurants are nearby. Would stay again, perfect location

Reviews.Title: “Poor Reservation Management - but good location”
Reviews.Author: its5pmsomewherenow
Reviews.Content: I reserved this room on the hotel's Wyndham website 3 months in advance. Although there was a large convention at the Mascconi Center for the entire week -- this hotel was taking reservations for one night on Sunday-- at a $299 room rate. All the other hotels in this neighborhood were not taking reservations for this one night. We flew in from Boston on a Sunday AM, arriving at SFO around 10am. By the time we picked up of rental car and traveled the 12 miles north to SF - we valet parked ($44) the car at about 11:30am, and checked our luggage at the bell-stand room. We went over to the Marriott to watch football at a sports bar we know of -- part of the whole reason we wanted to stay in this neighborhood & this hotel - in order to be sure we could watch the NE Patriots vs. Jets at 1pm PST. We ate & drank beer, and watched football until about 3:30pm. Upon arriving at the front desk to check in, we were told we were being "relocated" to another hotel in Foster City, approximately 20 miles south of SF. We asked to speak to the manager, as we did not think it was appropriate to relocate us due to our afternoon beer-related activities & our rental car parked in the garage. Needless to say, they agreed to take our $390 (room rate, valet parking & taxes) for one Sunday night. We were not upset with the rate, or parking - because we knew that location was where we wanted to be. We ended up with our original plan, taking a nap and then heading back out to walk the streets, ride the cable cars, etc. and have a nice dinner. Overall it was a comfortable & clean room with a great location. We got what we wanted, when we pushed the issue at the front desk -- but the reservation management process leaves a little to be desired. We've stayed at this hotel before, it turned out okay this time, and we would stay there again. GREAT location, and finely appointed decor. Clean, and comfortable. It will do.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Rosedew78b
Reviews.Content: I travelled to California with my 20 year old son and very much chose this hotel based on previous reviews. All Trip Advisors' reviews were most helpful. It is a fact that you are much better off chosing a CLUB room which gives you access to upper floors, a separate breakfast room on the 31st floor and snacks which are handly for jet-lagged travellers who cannot face going out.after a day out on the town. You also have access to the business center which made it easier for us to print boarding passes or check some information on internet. Well worth the few extra dollars. Our room was on the 24th floor, large, bright with robes and plenty of towels. I enjoyed our 4 night stay there and felt at home. One drawback, there is no minibar/fridge. We did not have too much noise as we were high enough but it is true that if you close the small vent just under the window, it will be almost silent. Plenty of good restaurants around - good shopping on the door step and right in front of various transports. The staff was efficient at check-in, you can do an electronic check-out. We took a taxi from and to SFO airport and paid USD 30 which we thought was great. One small advice, if you are looking to buy 3 days or 5 days travel cards, go later in the afternoon for the next day or you will be facing a huge queue. I can recommend this hotel and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and location”
Reviews.Author: heiditrekking
Reviews.Content: Most of the hotels in SF are located in the downtown/union square area. Parc55 is conveniently located on the MUNI/BART lines, plus Powell St. cable car. Also, located next to Union Square and Westfield mall - making it perfect if you plan to do a bit of shopping. The Westfield mall food court is one of the nicest I've ever scene with quite a variety of good food. Good for families. Pros: Good price/value. Nice rooms. Friendly, helpful staff. Cons: The hotel is downtown in a major urban area; it can be crowded with tourists, but it's to be expected... Not a good idea to walk around at night. Its perfectly fine to walk around during the day and easy to grab a taxi or hop on the train. No coffee machine or coffee shop in the lobby (but that may not bother you)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and relaxing break”
Reviews.Author: lwa3
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very clean, with very helpful staff. The hotel room is cleaned everyday if you want it and they do make a very good job. They give lots of towels and cleaning products as well. This hotel is very popular with flight staff & pilots so does get really busy when waiting to check in/out. The hotel rooms are very big & clean. The air conditioning is a bit poor, doesn't make the room very cold. The hotel gives free computer and Internet access in the reception area which is very handy for online check in. The hotel is in a fantastic location, only 2 minutes walk round to Union Square. All in all, a very lovely hotel, which I would recommend to anyone! Definitely worth a booking!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: EmDallasTX
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in late August. We arrived early (10 a.m.) and our rooms were available so we were given keys! That was a huge plus - didn't expect to see the room until 2 or 3 p.m. Bed was comfy and clean, and the bathroom was spotless. The hot water in the shower was HOT and had great water pressure. LOVED it! Never needed the internet, but you have to pay for it. Never tried out the bar or restaurant because we were too busy enjoying the city. Menu looked good though. We stayed on the 21st floor and had a great view of downtown/financial district. There is a BART station a block away, bus stops, cabs, and all manner of public transport within a block or two. Good value, happy with the room and service, and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Not the Best”
Reviews.Author: kanata-pete
Reviews.Content: Great location for shopping. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. I wasn't pleased with the staff. They never seemed very pleased to help or answer questions. My biggest complaint would be that you had to pay for the Internet. No hotel should make you pay for the Internet . If I were to go back to San Francisco I would try one of the other many hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reddon14
Reviews.Content: Everything I expected. It was a standard, cleaner than average hotel. I stayed on the 27th floor which ended up having great views including downtown, the ocean, and even the golden gate. We didn't really spend much time in our room, but did find the rooms well appointed and very clean. The turndown service at night was nice, especially the chocolates!! Cant comment on room service, in house dining, etc, because we didn't use any of that. You cant beat this location. Convient to loads of shops and restaurants, and only a short cab/cable car/trolley car ride to everything else you might want to see and do. We never had a problem with noise, other than the odd siren (big deal). Yes there are homeless people around the hotel...Any big city with decent weather and lots of tourists has a problem with homeless people. Would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially if you get a good rate!!!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: owen30
Reviews.Content: i was happy to get this hotel on priceline, as the first hotel stop of our honeymoon trip to the US, and gladly my huch was correct. located in a good place near union sq. getting around was very easy. the check-in was fast and the room was clean and met our expectations. if you go to SF, i would definitely recommend PARC 55.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Thelma K
Reviews.Content: After a very long flight and a terrible time going through immigration, this hotel was the best thing on my first day in San Francisco! Check in went as smoothly as possible, and the room was not only clean but very comfy, with all the usual hotel amenities (missed a minibar though). The staff was very helpful and nice, and despite what I read in some of the previous reviews, they did offer help with my luggage. About the location, I believe this is one of the closest hotels to the BART station on Market St. and to the cable car's final stop. For those sightseeing there is a hop-off bus stop on Union Square (just a 5 min. walk), and for shopping, there is a mall just across Market St. and tons of stores around Union Square. The only negative aspect of the hotel i have to say, it's the noise from the street, but I used the earplugs offered by the hotel and didn't have any problems sleeping. The wall was also a little bit thin, so sometimes I could overhear my neighbours, but it wasn't too loud and it didn't bother me. Check out was also very easy and quick, and as soon as I finished it there was an airport pickup service waiting for guests at the entrance (apparently they go to the hotel every twenty or fifteen minutes).

Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: CanalcruiserDerby
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel via Hotwire. Great location. our room on the 21st floor was a reasonable size, very clean but lacking in storage space for our clothes. No problems with noise and a great view. staff were friendly and helpful.. The lobby and the reception area are a bit austere (where did they get the red plastic? chairs) a small change here would be a great improvement. we enjoyed our stay and at the Parc 55 and would recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience with checkin and room readiness!”
Reviews.Author: Tuckerman41
Reviews.Content: We checked in and upon arriving in room discovered that it had not been cleaned from previous occupants. After a long (6 hour) flight, this was a great disappointment. Called down to desk to arrange another room and were told to wait for delivery of new key so we didn't have to lug bags back and forth. Never saw the key delivery after about 30 minute wait in dirty room, and two phone calls to desk. Went down to desk with all of our bags, expecting immediate attention (luxury hotel better attend to something like this immediately) and was brushed off by receptionist. When finally attended to, apologies started. A bit late considering that we were now almost an hour from the first check in. We were give a room key that allowed access to the 'club' level which basically provided us with free continental breakfast. Since we were touring we could not have taken advantage of any other privileges. Room we were given was also an upgrade but that was also a minor comp since we really were hardly in the room. Remainder of experience was fine but I have to say I've never had a check in experience this bad before. As such, I have a difficult time recommending Parc55 in San Francisco as a place to stay that claims to be luxury and strong attention to clients.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic central location-great value”
Reviews.Author: mblr
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Parc 55 were very friendly and provided excellent customer service. Walking down the hall, everyone said hello and was so attentive. The rooms were a good size and were very clean. Our room had a small deck and we were able to open up the door and get some fresh air into the room. The noise from the street made it challenging to keep the door open for long, but surprisingly never heard any noise at night. It is super easy to get to from the airport-it is 1 block away from the Powell street station and the bus/trolley stop is less than a block from the hotel. Save yourself some money and shop for food, drug store or liquor store before you get to the hotel-the neighborhood is expensive. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: lagal32
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay close to Union Square, this is the a good, quiet place to stay. It's walking distance from everything - trolleys, cable cars and subway system below. Every single store and restaurant you can think of is just steps away as well. The hotel rooms are cozy and relaxing. It's one of the quieter hotels I've stayed at, so you can definitely relax and get some rest. The fitness room is excellent if you're interested in working out and the bar below is great if you'd like to have a drink. The only downside is that the staff isn't the most attentive. I was there for 3 days and not once did I have a staff member greet me. The staff member who checked me in wasn't the most welcoming either, but she did her job. If you don't care about amazing customer service and just want a great place to stay at a good value, then this is a perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: TimboCambridgeshire
Reviews.Content: A fabulous hotel in a great location if you prefer to be closer to the city rather than fisherman's wharf. Right opposite the shopping mall and next to the Powell Street Cable car terminal turntable. Public transport is great, I recommend the All day pass giving you unlimited use of bus/tram/cable car. We were on the 22nd floor and some evidence of city noise. Earplugs supplied :) Can't recommend Alcatraz tour highly enough, DON'T miss it!

Reviews.Title: “10 anniversary - great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: dukeswalker
Reviews.Content: Hubby & I stayed here for 3 nights. We were placed on the 20th floor, in a corner room with windows facing West & South....what amazing views!! The room was spacious and incredibly clean. In fact - I place on calling the hotel in the AM to give kuddos to the housekeeper for our room. Was there noise? yes....you are in a city...in a hotel. When a firetruck goes by our neighborhood at home, I hear it. When the kids take a shower upstairs....I hear it. Why people think that you wont hear that here is beyond me. One night we slept with the vents under the window open but did need to shut them as it made a huge difference in noise. We also chose to keep the fan on (the fan on the a/c controls) to help drown out the street noise. We slept great all 3 nights. The only downside was the concierge that was on duty on Fri. night. We stopped by to talk to him twice - he was the least helpful person we met in SF. The concierges in general seemed to assume that "everyone knows how to use public transportation". Thats not always the case - hubby and I come from a large city - that has NO form of public transportation....trying to find a bus/street car in crazy Union Square during rush hour, is a daunting task. A little guidance - or even a step-by-step how to guide would be incredibly helpful. We spent 4 great days here - we stayed out of the "touristy" traps and really SAW SF. What an amazing city. If anyone is looking for any casual, easy, fun ideas for a 30+yo in SF...hit me up! I'd love to share what we did..

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: mattkrae
