Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for four nights in early September. We stayed on the 27th floor in a club room which came with a very nice breakfast. The location is excellent (especially for access to the BART) and our room was very quiet. The service at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. We had trouble closing the window and after calling down this was remedied promptly. Beds and linens were very comfortable. The value was good (about $200 per night) especially considering the breakfast that was included. It would be nice if for that price, wifi internet was included in the price of the room (it cost an additional $12.95 per day). We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Close to Shopping and Trolly - Only Disappointments were the Restaurant and Lounge”
Reviews.Author: Ocean8_Calgary
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location should you visit San Francisco. The rooms are clean and front desk staff are friendly and helpful. The restaurant and lounge were disappointing. The steak that was to be medium was raw in the middle as well as my husband and I were surprised that staff do not ask if you would like a refill on your coffee considering the cost to have one. I found the options for non alcholic beverages in the lounge also disappointing especially when you are pregnant and you want something "fancy" to drink. They didn't even know what a Shirley Temple was - so my husband had to inform the bartender how to make one. Since San Francisco has lots of pubs/bars/restaurants in the area you don't have to worry about relying on these services at this hotel. If you are on a short visit to San Francisco I would recommend visitng Alcatraz, the Golden Gate Bridge, Chinatown and don't forget to do some shopping --- you will find a great deal - somewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: TrvlinAlltheTime
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the fifth floor over labor day weekend. We found bedbugs in the bed! When I slapped one at night, it popped with blood! We ended up with bites on our arms and legs. Now I am afraid that they have followed us home. I looked up bedbugs on the web, and it turns out they are coming back and are very hard to get rid of once an infestation occurs. I am not sure if it just taking time to get past all of the bites - they are very, very itchy - or if they have hitched a ride to our home in our luggage. Yuck! Also, our room was very loud from the noise of people outside. The room came with earplugs in the bathroom that I had to use to go to sleep. That should have been the warning right there. The staff wasn't very nice either and gave us a hard time when we tried to change rooms. The bell man and the valet service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: camara73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Parc 55 over the Labor Day holiday and it was wonderful. This is a very nice hotel that seems to be located right in the middle of everything. There are 3-4 restaurants(from Thai, sushi, sports bars, burger king, Carls Jr. and too many more to name) located on every street surrounding the hotel so food options plentiful as is shopping choices. This was ouf first trip to San Francisco and the hotel made it a wonderful experience. We booked through Expedia and got a good rate, however if you get a rental car be aware of the $50/day parking fee. We knew this ahead of time as I read several reviews here so it was already factored in and the parking situation in the city isn't great and can get pricey. Looking forward to visiting San Francisco again and the Parc 55.

Reviews.Title: “AS Expected”
Reviews.Author: mirabili
Reviews.Content: The reviews I read about Parc 55 regarding its convenient location, the cleanliness of the room and the warm welcome came out true as expected. The little nice details included how the housekeeping people kept even the tiniest clutter (shoes, toiletries, pens) in place. There was a construction going on at the side of the hotel which made noise during the night, but it is something that is temporary. Other than that, we enjoyed our stay at the hotel because of its convenient location and reasonable rates and pampered by housekeeping department. We stayed at the 21st floor for 5 days.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: she-muff
Reviews.Content: After reading some negative reviews about this hotel on tripadvisor, I wasn't sure what to expect during my stay. Any worries went out the door as soon as we got there, though! We took the BART from the airport to the Powell Street station and, upon exiting, were happy to see our hotel staring us almost literally in the face. We were cordially greeted by the doorman, housekeeping and front desk staff, who let us check in hours early and into what I suspect was an upgraded room (thank you, Elmer!). It's a bit disappointing to not have refrigerators in the rooms but we were impressed by the decor and chic style of our room and the hotel itself. A crib was delivered to our room almost immediately after settling in, and then my family and I decided to explore the area. We were happy to discover that shopping and restaurants were only steps away, and if we wanted to head out farther, BART and Muni stations were right around the corner. Extremely convenient! It was a terrific location to be based at for our first trip to SF in a long, long time. Even at night, we found it easy to get around with our 6-month-old son and found lots of places open later, which was helpful as we got used to the time difference. We were on the 6th floor in a corner room and were not bothered by street noise at all at night, although we had friends staying on the 19th floor who said they did have to make use of the earplugs supplied by the hotel. Even so, all the guidebooks I read said Union Square is a noisy, bustling hub of activity so some noise level should be expected. All in all, you can't go wrong booking this hotel, with its terrific location, friendly staff and beautiful rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel... and some tips!”
Reviews.Author: JayH1977
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great stay. Very clean room, a good size, and well appointed. We had a room on the 12th floor (hotel is 30-35 stories I think) and even that high up you could hear the traffic, but it didn't impact our stay. The staff was friendly, and it was very convenient to BART. We are used to staying in hotels that have swimming pools, but they do have an up to date fitness center. I've noticed many of the reviews for this hotel mention three things: parking, a charge for internet access, and not getting the room type they requested online. The parking is very comparable to the prices other hotels in the area are charging, and public parking garages aren't much cheaper. If you book the room with the hotel directly or with Wyndham you can join their membership program Wydham Request which is free, and gives you free internet access and some other perks. The last thing applies to all hotels: if you book at an online website like priceline you cannot always guarantee your room type, which is part of the reason they often give you a bit of a better price, but you should read the fine print and not be surprised when you get the smoking room or double beds you didn't want.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: pamian37
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located so great for getting around. Rooms are great and check-in staff helpful ad friendly. Recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, room quality and cleanliness. Staff could improve.”
Reviews.Author: Diogo_Rio_de_Janeiro
Reviews.Content: Hotel had a good overall value (reservation through priceline.com). B-fast not included it has a good location (next to Union Square and BART station), great comfortable bed, room decor. Only downside was a hard time getting a friendly staff orientation at the frontdesk (not really a big deal).

Reviews.Title: “The same great location, improved design”
Reviews.Author: SFO-World-Traveller
Reviews.Content: I've stayed before at this hotel when it was a Renaissance and absolutely loved the location, particularly after BART opened its line to SFO. You cannot ask for a more convenient location or property. I will admit that toward the end of its reign as a Renaissance it was starting to look a little long in the tooth. Wyndham's refresh of the property was nice. It freshened up the common areas and improved the layout and flow of the reception desks. The rooms are nicely remodeled and reflect smart business design choices. I always loved the little outside air vents in the windows particularly when you face west and have a constant breeze cooling the room with clean air versus recycled AC. Overall this hotel is a great value for the money. It's easy to find a good rate for this location. Given the quality of other hotels in this price range I'd definitely say the Parc 55 is worth consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, Great value.”
Reviews.Author: Link3
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Parc 55 twice recently while visiting San Francisco on business and have gotten great deals booking through Hotels.com and Orbitz.com. The hotel is in a great location and I have been very happy with the size and comfort of the rooms. Staff have been friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: rmsht12
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel.Near everything(dining.shopping,transportation etc). Stayed @parc 55 last week & the hotel is very nice & all personel were fantastic. Never wanted for anything. They have a free continental breakfast every day & free desert @ night. Also free cheese & crackers in the late afternoon. Rooms were spacious & clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sci01
Reviews.Content: Got this reservation at the last minute through Priceline for a great deal -- and when I checked in they assigned me a wonderful room with a view. I will definitely choose this hotel in the future. Rooms are very nicely decorated and clean. Staff is very nice. Location is top notch -- steps from the Bart station and right by shopping, places to eat. At least on the twelfth floor, the room was quiet (i.e not too much street noise). Noise can be an issue at the smaller boutique hotels. Used room-service since I got a great deal on the room: good food.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from a Wyndham.”
Reviews.Author: MooseMom57
Reviews.Content: We were a bit disappointed in this hotel. The rooms were fairly small, no mini fridge or breakfast included. The hotel restaurant was pretty pricey. It is conveniently located to Union Square, the cable car and transportation. The room wasn't incredibly clean - the vent in the bathroom didn't work and it was filled with dust. The few times we dealt with the front desk there was no real interest from the staff. Maybe because it is such a big facility the small details are overlooked. We were there to drop our son at school so it was convenient but that's about it - just a basic room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Makes it Worth Overlooking Other Issues”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine103
Reviews.Content: First, a tip: If you have a car you need to park (no in and out) and are staying at Parc 55 (or any other parking gouging hotel nearby) check out Jessie Square Garage (google search). It is safe, secure and about half the price. It's about a 10 minute walk - one of the best moves I made in planning this trip. Now for the rest of the review: You could hardly do better than Parc 55 in terms of location. Right next to BART and the turntable for the cable cars. By taking a gamble on Priceline it was priced right. I would not have paid published rates. Due to such high traffic all the carpet and common areas look soiled and well worn. The place is so sterile and gray it seems fairly institutional and depressing - very stark. My children had a hard time believing we were actually in a hotel until we made our way to the room. If you're not planning to hang at the hotel all day - who really cares? The location really does make up for a myriad of deficiencies. The room was nice and of a decent size with an excellent view from the 16th floor. If you do have children who seem to be more interested in the hotel pool than they are in the Golden Gate Bridge - this may not be the place for you. Although, knowing there was none, we didn't hear the constant usual nagging as to when we might be able to swim. It seems they are very short staffed on housekeeping. We'd been gone from all day - 8a-4p. When we came back, no one had been to tidy up at all. At 4:30 they finally showed up and wanted us to leave so they could clean. 4:30? Really? We politely told them never mind but they kept interrupting us every half hour until about 7 to make sure we really meant it. Bottomline: If you can get it at near half published rates go for it. If you're paying published rates I think you could do better on all counts except maybe location.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Mis_Adventurous
Reviews.Content: Our usual hotel (the Westin St. Francis) has been so disappointing that we decided to try a couple of new hotels for this trip. We started at the Parc 55 and were not disappointed. The BART literally stops across the street from this hotel. Shopping, restaurants, and the Blue Bottle Coffee bar are all CLOSE! Our room was large, clean, and had a beautiful view of the city. We would have gladly stayed there for the entire trip, but decided to try keep our original schedule in order to have a few choices when we go to SF. In all, this is a nice hotel . . . it would be nice if there weren't such a vagrant population in this area, but that is beyond the hotel's control and seems to be an epidemic in SF.

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst hotel choice we ever made”
Reviews.Author: kellylauren
Reviews.Content: We booked a non-smoking room, and when we got there they put us in a smoking room. When we tried to change it, citing our reservation, they stated it would be $20 extra per night and it was considered an 'upgrade'. An upgrade when we already reserved the non-smoking? I asked to speak to the manager, and he said he was the manager on duty. He was very rude to us, and due to allergies, we were forced to pay extra for a room we already reserved at a specific rate. Not cool, dude. Not cool.

Reviews.Title: “We have just left the parc55 and could...”
Reviews.Author: Missylis
Reviews.Content: We have just left the parc55 and could not have been more pleased with our stay. The location is fantastic and the staff were very friendly, I did not find a cold unwelcoming atmosphere as some have stated. We were on floor 12 and had no noise issue it's a big city so u will hear outdoor background noise but we closed the air vents and this blocked most out. I would stay here again if I got the same deal on hotwire as for the price it was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints. Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: JCL1903
Reviews.Content: Centrally located to Union Square. Big room & bathroom. Very clean. Lovely service from very helpful staff. 24hr fitness centre which is quite well equipped. Free fruit/newspapers/internet access. You can hear the city noise at night, but earplugs are provided. There is a reasonably priced Thai restaurant in the bottom of the hotel. Westfield is across the road, with a decent food court that is open till 8pm. And best of all, the BART (subway) station is only about 25 metres away, which means you can catch a train from San Fran airport directly to the Hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: captnkirk
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Parc55 on a stop over from Sydney to London. I had booked it 5 months in advance from the cracking photos of rooms and reviews on the website, in the event we arrived too early for the room at 10.30. they couldnt say when it would be ready and offered another room which as we were tired after the long flight we accepted. They also rang up later to see if we were OK which was nice. The room on 24th floor was perfectly adequate if not as cracking as the website, it was of reasonable size, great beds and linen, good tele, coffee maker, desk, nice bay window with slight glimpse of water through buildings and small table and chairs. The bathroom was a good size with good shower and fitments but the bath was very low indeed which made it difficult to use without flooding the floor and there were bath requisites with soap bars rather than shower gel. There was very little drawer space which didnt matter too much to us on a short trip, there were two suitcase frames for suitcase living. There was a connecting door but this didnt impact on us. The decoration was a little tired as were the public areas, we saw a lot of cleaning going on but I dont think the colour scheme helps.The room was quiet (high floor helps) and we slept well. We taxied in quite reasonably from the airport, and the hotel luggage attendant offered us a stretch limo back for a little extra. A couple of niggles about unneccessary meanness : there were 2 bottles of water in the room which were charged at quite a high rate, complimentary wouldve been a nice touch: The room wifi charge was high, OK for business users on expenses but annoying for poor tourists, there was a free business centre with 6 ish PCs and 2 printers and a further 3 or so and a printer in the corridor but it was generally clogged with facebook refugees from the room wifi charge. I had to join a queue at various times including trying to check in, might be worth designating a pc and printer for checking in like other hotels. Also it would be nice to have more seating by the door area while waiting for taxis tours etc. The location was great being near Union Square but also near the vintage cable car terminus and the interesting trolley buses stop, both for Fishermans Wharf. A favourite trip was trolley bus to either the Ferry building and/or Pier 39 and then cable car back from the Mason Street terminus. We breakfasted at the Sunflower Cafe in O'Farrell Street a block up from the hotel and we liked Swiss Louis on Pier 39 for its views of the Rock, the Bridge, the sealions and their food and service .

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Taqone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 7 nights and enjoyed it very much. As stated by other reviewers it is very easy to commute from SFO by BART underground system to Powell Street station (which takes 30-40min). The station is very close to the hotel within viewing distance, (2min walk). The reception staff were very nice and so were the cleaners. Our room was on the 10th floor at the back of the hotel, which meant that we didn’t have much of a view, but we didn’t suffer from any traffic noise that some reviewers had commented about. The room was also larger than I had expected with a king size bed, large flat screen TV, desk, sofas (one of which was a sofa bed). It also had a wardrobe which contained the typical safe and also an ironing board and iron which was a first for me. The bathroom was clean and adequate and the shower was nothing special. It is also worth mentioning at this point that it seems that this hotel is favoured by airline companies. We have noticed large groups of staff from BA and Lufthansa waiting for their rooms . We enjoyed a buffet breakfast at the restaurant which was very good. It had a selection of cold meats cheese, cereal, juices, smoothies and also a selection of hot food with egg, bacon etc. Just behind the lifts were 3 computers which were free to use, with access to the internet, which was very useful. The hotel location was great near all forms of transport, almost on Market Street, which has all the top end shops. It is near the Westfield shopping centre, near Union Square and near the tram that connects Market Street to Fisherman’s Warf, which is a big attraction for tourists. Just one note I would like to make here. If you are new to San Francisco please look up the areas that you should stay away from (its easy to do with your search engine), as for some reason the top end hotels seem to be in or next to areas that are not very nice and you wont want to take a wrong turn to these places which is easy to do. SF also seems to be full of homeless people who are on the whole harmless but when it get darker can make you feel unsafe. (don’t let me put you off I just want to warn you what to expect, the people in the city are nice) Over all we thought the hotel was great but we would suggest if you are new to SF to try to find a place near the Fisherman’s Wharf, which is more pleasant and offers more activities for you to do away from the shopping area and safer during night time.

Reviews.Title: “I love parc 55”
Reviews.Author: lovelynurse
Reviews.Content: i took my boyfriend here for celebrated 4th of July i picked this hotel cuz i came here befor with some of my friend last year which i really had a good experian with this hotel the room was so nice and clean and close with eveything ,shopping,transportation,union square.....etc but the food kinda expensive though...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hip lobby, not so good service”
Reviews.Author: StrangeTripper
Reviews.Content: So, i read a few other recent reviews---and there were some familiar issues........... My wife Pricelined this hotel for something like 80-90 bucks a night---not a bad deal for a hipster-type hotel in a kick-a** location in San Fran (REALLY near the BART, like 50 yards from the front door; near Market street and trolley line; restaurants etc.....). My trip was for a wedding and I stayed 2 nights. When i got there, the clerk told me the only room available was a SMOKING room. I'm thinking: WHAAAT?????? I thought smoking in public buildings was banned in San Fran, or even the whole state! She told me the Parc 55 somehow loopholed its way around the smoking ban... And since it was booked thru Priceline, there's no guarantee of what type of room you get, so she said.... OK, so i accepted it. The entire 8th floor is smoking, so when i got off the elevator, it hit me like a ton of bricks.... The room was a bit better, but when i woke up the next morning, i had a headache... Meanwhile, my wife learned of my situation and called the Parc 55 to raise hell. The manager said she will make sure i have a non smoking room my 2nd night. Well, she came through with her promise and it was great! In conclusion, eliminate the smoking floor, and you have a great hotel in a great location. The rooms (and bathrooms) were roomy and not gloomy. The beds were comfortable. The lobby was kinda cool and hip, as was the restaurant, from what i could tell.... But, as long as this hotel has that dreaded smoking floor (and seemingly routinely sticks its Priceline customers there), i can't give it a great rating. Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Quality stay”
Reviews.Author: JM07Wirral
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel in the UK months ago, before we left - at a non-refundable price - which was good but not what I would call, "a deal." The hotel was easy to get to from the airport via BART and also great for all other tourist transportation links including MUNI, buses, cable cars and street cars. We had an easy check in, Sarah on reception was very friendly and helpful. Our room on the 25th floor was large and extremely comfortable and cleaned impeccably every day. Yes, we could hear the city traffic (apparently the fire engines are called first in an emergency as they have paramedics on board) but after a hard day sightseeing we were out like lights - even my husband who is a light sleeper. The ice machine by the lifts was very useful and we used the business suite several times - although I would have preferred the convenience of free internet connection in my room as we had in the MGM Grand the previous week. There were plenty of lifts which were very quick- nothing worse than waiting to go to your room or to get out. The homeless people do not approach you but can be disturbing if you are not used to a city environment. We would recommend this hotel and use it again if we went back to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “great time in san fran”
Reviews.Author: khyron1969
Reviews.Content: Just got back from parc 55 and it was great! Check in was quick and easy, Asked what floor we were on and the desk person (Denis I think) asked what floor do we whant to be on and we got a room on the 26th. The room was large and had a great city view. The bed's were not the most comfortable but I could sleep on anything after a day out in the city. Sure there was noise but you are in the middle of a large city (suck it up). The location could not be better with access to miuni and bart with in feet of the hotel. Also the resturants are to many to count around this hotel and for those who need their starbucks there is one a block away, and several withen 3 blooks. I can not to say enough about this hotel from the front desk to the cleanning staff thing 's were great and the hotel made are first trip whith out our little one a great vacation

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience!”
Reviews.Author: jenjenzz
Reviews.Content: I was in SF on business the week of 08/08-08/14 and stayed at the Parc 55 because the Hilton was sold out for the conference. I loved every single thing about the Parc. I might add that most of my co-workers that stayed at the HIlton were so jealous that I had a view and better accommodations. Tip for those of you that may have a conference at the Hilton stay here! You can walk out the side door near the Thai restaurant and cross the street and you are at the back door of the Hilton. So convenient and you don’t have to deal with the conference crowds. First thing off the escalator I was greeted by Elmer and his smiling face. This was such a joy after a long flight and a horrible shuttle ride. Thanks to you guys here at Tripadvisor I knew to ask for a room on a higher floor due to the noise. So I asked Elmer if he could put me on a higher floor and boy did he! I was on the 28th floor with a wonderful view and an air purifier. I was pleasantly surprised to say the least. I never had a problem with noise at all and I would sleep with my curtain open just to have the view in the morning when I woke up. My bed was so comfortable and the air purifier was such a plus in helping me sleep that I am actually going to buy one this weekend. Now some important info for the ladies :) The bathroom was stocked with Gilchrist and Soames shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, scope mouthwash, facial soap and bath soap. The shower had great water pressure and was so relaxing after 8 hours of classes and 4 hours of site seeing. I did have an issue with my keycards constantly being deactivated but this too was not a problem and Mavis always fixed me right up. I have to say being a single female staying here made me feel completely safe and this was in part due to the keycard issue. Once I explained to Mavis that my card didn't work and my driver’s license was in my room she was very kind and helpful with getting a security guard up to my room. The additional times it happened she still checked my ID and never failed at protecting my safety. In addition, there was a housekeeper cleaning my room one day during my lunch break and I told her I didn't want to startle her but I was there for lunch. She said she needed my key and of course it did not work. :) She jumped right into action and said I could not come in and called security. She was too cute guarding my stuff until security got there and I might add in less than a minute. She continued to apologize once my identity was verified and I told her that I was very pleased to know that I am safe here and don't have to worry. I wish I knew her name but I do not. If management reads this please give her recognition for her bravery and fast response to a potential crisis in room 2815 on 08/10/10 (I think that is the correct date). My only complaint is they give you 2 bottles of wine (additional charge) but no corkscrew and believe me I tore that room apart :-P I also have to say that I never once missed the internet as I have seen complaints on here about the charge. You are in SF get out and enjoy and if that email is that important they have computers on the second floor. I walked by numerous times and they were empty and I never felt the urge to get on. At home I am on this thing nonstop so I guess it was a much needed break. Finally, I highly recommend the Parc 55 because it’s clean, comfy and SAFE! The staff here is the absolute best hotel staff I have ever encountered and I travel all over the world. I really am just overwhelmed at the kindness and professionalism of all the staff including front desk, security, restaurant, housekeeping, concierge and valet they all treated me with the utmost respect and courtesy. I very rarely fill these things out but I felt I needed to in this case. I WILL stay here again and I have already spread the word on Twitter, Facebook and Myspace. Great job guys!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: BostonVince
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several hotels in San Francisco, and I think this has to be my favorite. The rooms are very clean with a nice large bathroom. Check in was a snap, the maid was wonderful, and the location is tops. Got a AAA rate of $97/night over the 4th of July holiday. Would absolutely recommend and stay here again. Thank you Parc 55, you made our week in SF just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Sijxn
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, great comfy beds with big pillows of different shapes and sizes. Flatscreen TV, coffee maker, desk and armchairs. Bathroom is your normal American hotel bathroom, they all look the same. Service here is always good. Staff friendly and attentive. I always enjoy staying here. Nice restaurant, bright with big windows. Good location, just next to Market Street. Hotel is quiet but as in most big American cities there is occasional noise from fire engines who seem to think they need to use their horns even at 2am when the streets are empty. Hotel provides earplugs in the bathroom but its not a problem falling back to sleep if woken up because the beds are so comfortable. I dont know the room rate, my company pays it, so I cant comment on value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Another hotel guest open my door with his key !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: blackhole_child
Reviews.Content: Sunday night 8/15/2010. I stayed at room 2469, just got out of shower, standing naked in the room. Another guest opened my room door with his key!!!! I was so shocked !!! I have been staying at hotels about 100 nights per year for the last 10 years. Never had anything like this happened to me. But Parc55....wow...a total crap hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Not four star”
Reviews.Author: AW2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel at the end of my vacation on a Pricelined rate since funds were running low. I thought going from one 4* to another would be an easy transition to comparable accommodations, but it wasn't and it quickly became clear to me that this hotel is not a 4*. At check in, I was told I could only have a smoking room, which is totally unacceptable to me. I asked if there was anything else non-smoking available, but the attendant said that because I used Priceline I had to have the smoking room (number of beds was not an issue to me as a solo traveler). While I have been using Pricline for years and do realize that this is a possibility, I have never actually had a problem getting a non-smoking room. She said she would check with a manager, but for whatever reason she did not need to and was able to open a room on a lower floor for me. She made me feel like I should be praising her for going out of her way, and that I shouldn't really be getting a non-smoking room. So, I had to settle for the horrible 5th floor you may read other reviews about. On top of my neighbors playing music literally 24/7, the view was horrible (eye level to an AC unit), and the beds were just awful. I hope they're better on the other floors, but if not this hotel should really look into upgrading them. They're super springy and not comfy at all. Had horrible sleep and wish I had just splurged for the extra night at my other hotel. I will say it is a great location for shopping and BART, but I definitely don't think it's 4*. I think if they upgraded the beds and lighting in the halls, and addressed the sound issues (the ear plugs they offer are mearly a bandage to a larger issue), they could get to 4*, but IMO I would say this is a 3-3.5* property.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels I've ever stayed...”
Reviews.Author: Jason H
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in. I'm writing this review at 3:15am after getting an erroneous wake-up call from the front desk. Just another in a laundry list of mistakes the staff here has made. Our reservation was supposedly prepaid, but on arrival we were informed that the charge for the room was never made 8 months ago and that they would have to charge us now. They then booked us into a smoking room, even though our reservation clearly said nonsmoking. The credit card hold for incidentals is $100 per room per night, even though there are no minibars in the rooms. The bell staffs' idea of opening the door is hitting the handicap door button while they ignore you as they text on their phones and the valet service took an average of 25 minutes to retrieve our car, even though we were paying $50 a night to park here. Now to be fair, the rooms are clean and the location is excellent, but the awful, awful service just ruins that fact.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for hotwire price”
Reviews.Author: BriannaJ2010
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotwire for the price of $89 a night, for 3 nights. Stayed on the 9th floor in a handicapped room with a walk in shower. You could definitely hear the street noise, but our air conditioning unit in the room was loud enough to drown the noise out. Check to make sure the little vents under the windows are all closed, the second day we realized that one of our vents was opened, and closing it helped to cut out some of the noise as well. We found all of the staff to be very friendly and willing to help us if needed. Nice to have little gift shop downstairs with snacks and souvenirs. We checked out at 12, but left our bags with the concierge. They were kept in a separate storage area that seemed to be locked, not just behind the desk, seemed very safe and felt comfortable leaving them there. The location was great for shopping, but the area directly behind the hotel was dangerous and seemed to have a lot of crime. I would not recommend walking in that direction. Overall we were happy with our stay for the price that we payed through hotwire. Could use an update for the prices that they are charging through their website.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great price, rooms could use an update”
Reviews.Author: thelowest
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right on the outskirts of Union Square, but close enough to walk the area. The rooms were nice, but it needs some updates before it can be considered "luxury". Great price of $140, when other hotels in the are were 25%+ higher. I was on the 19th floor, but the street sounds didn't bother me. Then again, I don't mind that noise.

Reviews.Title: “If you like to hear your neighbours; take this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: atalanta_visitor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is comfortly situated in the center of San Fransisco. Easy ride from the airport & near Union Square & westfiels CC. Expensive parking for 50 dollars+ per night. The hotel is frequently used by tour groups. The rooms are somewhat outdated but have a large bathroom and flatpanel TV. The queenbeds are quite small for double sleeping. Citysounds easy to be heard even op 20+ floors! Walls are so thing you can hear everything from your neighbours. Doors close with a big bang. If you are the kind that sleeps every where even on a crowded airport this is the hotel for you. All others who want to seep either buy earplugs (good ones from CVS!) or accept you won't sleep from all the noise you hear. This hotel must be a huge success as we as well got the message "fully booked" when we wanted to change to a quieiter room

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: blaze_amaze
Reviews.Content: This hotel has clearly been renovated recently. The rooms are nicely decorated and extremely clean. The beds are super comfortable. Even the common spaces of the hotel have been renovated. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. The location is absolutely perfect and convenient to major shopping areas and all transit lines. I had no issues with this hotel and I would definitely stay there again. Highly recommended. I booked through Hotwire so I was lucky to get a good rate. My rating on value is based on this price. I'm not sure what the regular nightly rate is for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK but for the price would check elsewhere first”
Reviews.Author: jlafrentz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights for leisure activities in downtown. Its a very big hotel, rooms are on the small side. In addition to the room charge, you are charged approx. $50/night for parking ($44 + taxes) and $13 for internet if you choose to use it. The pop machine on our level was out of soda pop both nights so we had to go to other floors to get a soda if we desired one. There is no pool at this hotel which was a bummer for my two teenagers. Stamps in the gift shop costs $1.99 x tax for two - I thought stamps were $0.48/each? Things add up pretty quickly here so if business is paying go ahead and stay. If its coming out of your own pocket and you aren't a millionaire, I would look elsewhere first.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Thal
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location, access to shopping, public transportation, view, efficiency of staff, coffee maker in room, size of room Cons: Charge for Internet, no mini-fridge in room, parking cost, no soap in room first night, widely variable room costs depending where you book This is a big hotel, I usually stay at a smaller property when in the city and I was pleasantly surprized, for the most part. I paid substantially more than some of the prices described in these reviews. Some incentive should be offered to those who book directly with the hotel, such as free internet or continental breakfast. The view was great, the room was comfortable, everything was clean. I never found the business center, but I did see some teenagers using computers in a hallway where it looked like a bank of phones used to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: lv2bmom
Reviews.Content: After getting my room on Priceline and reading the reviews, I was very worried about staying here. I was pleasantly surprised by how friendly the staff was. I checked in early and they gave me a room that was ready. I requested a non-smoking room and they were happy to accommodate my request. The room was very nice, my only complaint is the noise. It is like sleeping with the windows open. However, they do provide ear plugs so you can sleep. Every employee that we ran into was very nice and always asked if there was anything that we needed. I can not say enough good things about the customer service here. It is close to all the shopping and restaurants. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing hotel, snooty staff”
Reviews.Author: lilbopeep
Reviews.Content: Chose hotel based on location to Union Square and a previous stay at a Parc55 in New York. We arrived by cab and walked in to the foyer and looked for where to check in, all we saw was a concierge desk and when asking where we checked in we were told to go up the escalators rather abruptly. We had a large suitcase each, so this was no easy task. At reception i tried to check us into our king room as booked to be told they were very busy and are short of kings and we could have a double twin instead. Only when i complained were we issues our 'deluxe' king room. The room had a decent bed, a shabby sofa in a bay window looking out onto the rooftops of the city and a mini fridge that was sat on a piece of wood on the floor. There were no luxury amenities as described, just the usual soap, shampoo etc. We did try the hotel bar one evening where you could only get a drink by sitting and waiting and waiting for one of the bar staff to approach you and take your order, then eventually bring your drink over, we had to ask in the end for our bar tab bill as even though we were sat with an empty glass for 20 mins, we were just ignored. By checkout we had discovered the lifts rather than lugging the suitcases on the escalators again and asked the concierge to get us a cab. He poited us in the direction of the hotels own service car rather than a cab before we demanded a cab service out of there. Glad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Good location if you want be near Union...”
Reviews.Author: danp777
Reviews.Content: Good location if you want be near Union Square, renovated rooms, decent prices, friendly front desk staff. If you need in room Internet, though, stay somewhere else. $12.95 per night for slow, mostly non functional wifi. Abri hotel next door has smaller rooms, but is much nicer overall, with reliable in-room internet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: jandres12
Reviews.Content: Very well located, specially for the $90 we paid on priceline. Nice if not sterile feel, huge lobby, felt very business oriented. Paid $44 for parking plus a $6 "parking tax", which is ridiculous but typical for San Francisco. I will caution that you should try to get as higt a floor as possible. We were on the 5th floor and could hear every time a merchant rolled out their transh and recycling, a car beeped its horn, or an ambulance came through, things that happen very often on the busy streets surrounding the hotel. I would not, however, choose this place if I had an option. But for $90 on priceline, I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location, Moderate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaFunTravele
Reviews.Content: The Parc55 is located just off Market and Powell. Easy access to the cable cars make it a great place to explore SF from. The hotel itself is pretty nice, but the rooms are showing their age and could use freshing. Overall, booked through PriceLine at $99 a night, hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “good place in SFO”
Reviews.Author: alex-s2000
Reviews.Content: San Francisco appears to be a bit difficult concerning hotels. This one seems to be a good choice, but make sure you get a room at higher levels, maybe even pay an upgrade. The advantage is quietness and a great view. The service was friendly and professional, however, we received two double beds instead of the booked king size bed, but this was changed quickly without any waiting time. They charged us a bottle of wine even though we did not have one, but this was fixed during check-out without problems. Since we were at a very high floor, we were scared of earth quakes and had trouble to calm down my parents. Of course this is not the hotel's fault :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Wine_n_Dine22
Reviews.Content: We booked through Hotwire for $100/night. We were told at check-in that because of this we had to have a room with two double-beds, rather than one king (which we were fine with). That all changed after the first day, when the manager called us up and offered to move us to a junior suite on a high-level floor. Apparently they needed to work on the air conditioner in our original room. What nice luck! Everything else went smooth. Nice workout facility. Close to shopping, restaraunts, and transit. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: 59sunlady77
Reviews.Content: This hotel has recently been redone and it is great. Clean, well kept, great location and friendly staff. It is located in an ideal spot to use public transportation to get around the city. There are many great restaurants right in the area and loads of shopping nearby. The hotel bar/restaurant was a great place to unwind after a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it.”
Reviews.Author: jaxb27
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed 3 nights, and really enjoyed our stay. I booked on Priceline, and it was an excellent deal. In reading other reviews we were worried about the street noise, and our rental car, We did not have an issue with either--if you are from a major city, or have stayed in one before, you will think the hotel is actually pretty quiet. If you are used to complete silence, I can see where the street noise would bother you, but you are in the biddle of a city so...no issues with our rental with valet. The only thing I would recommend is doing your research if you are going to be parking a car, while walking around we saw quite a few lots/valet services that were more affordable than that of the hotel. Pros: amazing location, friendly staff, comfy beds, convenient "grab and go" breakfast. (tip: take your bagel and your coffee to Union Square Park and enjoy it there, great way to start the day) Cons: local calls cost $1.00/call--this was not disclosed on the phone--if I would have know I would have used my cell. Tried using the business center computers to print our boarding passes, took us 30 min b/c the computers are so s_l_o_w. Parking is expensive--comes out to about $50/day with taxes.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad service, old hotel room fixtures but a great location.”
Reviews.Author: travel_luvr133
Reviews.Content: GOOD: Excellent location - very central. The room was quiet and big, and the bed was big and comfortable. And they did give me a room on a high floor with an ok view, as I requested. BAD: The service and the hotel itself looks quite old ('70 ish fixtures in the rooms). The staff at the front lobby were rude. I was never greeted in a friendly manner. When I did check in the lady at the front desk looked at my passport, walked over to another man and whispered to him and then walked behind a closed door, returning a few minutes later (to photocopy my passport I presume) but never said anything to me. She gave us our keys but didn't say anything welcoming such as enjoy your stay etc. I went to our 19th floor room and the room keys did not work for the room so I returned to the front desk to report the problem. The staff member at the desk sighed loudly and implied that I hadn't used the key correctly. He asked me for my ID (which I had just given to the lady a few minutes before) but had left with my partner in the hall of the 19th floor who was waiting there with out luggage. When I said that I had already given my ID to the person that checked us in so could he please refer to the photocopy so that I don't have to go back up and down 19 floors, he sighed again and said "You not got ID?".... Then he impatiently asked for the last 4 digits of my credit card. When I couldn't remember them in less than 2 seconds he said in a loud impatient tone 'E-Mail!". Very bad service! He reassigned the keys and gave them back but didn't even apologise for the inconvenience. On another occasion the same man at the front desk told me to "Google it" when I asked about the cost of and time it would take to get a taxi to Berkeley - "Google it" - Unbelievable! I would try to "Google it" if the so-called business center, which is three computers in a hallway with guests walking by, was ever free to use! I won't be staying in this hotel again - the Parc 55 Wyndham in San Francisco, and I will think twice before I stay in any Wyndham hotel again now. Very disappointing. Ironically, I stayed here on business travel and paid the full rate (approx. $300/ night) but then stayed on in San Francisco for some personal travel and booked another hotel through Priceline - I got the Westin St. Francis for a fraction of the price of the Parc 55, and that was a much better experience and an even better location - right on Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised about Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: traveldiva2u
Reviews.Content: After reading a few of the reviews about Parc 55 I was a bit leary about my choice. On my way to the hotel riding the shuttle to the hotel I noticed the area we traveled through to get to the hotel. My first thought was uh oh what I have gotten myself into. Previous reveiws commented on the homeless people near the hotel and that was a concern of mine. But once I got to the hotel and in Union Square I felt better about my choice. The hotel was very nice. The staff was courteous and aside hearing the guests above me walking across the room, I slept pretty good. I booked my room on priceline and got a pretty good deal so I did not pay the regular rate which in my opinion is a bit steep. If you want to be in Union Square I think it's a good choice. Shopping is a walk away. I even rode the bus from Fisherman's Wharf for $2. The biggest con in my opinion is that there is no free wi-fi. A hotel that charges this much for a room should offer free wi-fi. All in all, I would recommend it if you want to be in Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “King Size Bed Unavailable Location still Excellent”
Reviews.Author: inaamak
Reviews.Content: Hi, we checked in around 2:00 AM as we missed our flight from Washington. The check in was smooth we got the bookings from Hotwire. Disappointing was that no King Size Beds were available as we were on our honey moon and still no favour was shown. Probably due to the booking being from a discounted website. The rooms were comfortable and nicely furnished. We were on the fourth floor. Noise was never an issue for the three nights we stayed. This hotel is a great location for visiting San Francisco. The Trams stop is very near and then the Powell St train leaving for SFO Airport is also very near. For the ladies stores for shopping are also nearby. At check out time they gave us two hours extension after check out time. We stored our luggage in the Concierge storage which let us enjoy our last day in San Francisco.We really enjoyed our stay with them the only disappointment was not having the King Size Bed. They could have showed some consideration.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: Maf-sh
Reviews.Content: Everything was just perfect. Reception, hotel cleanliness, location, etc. Housekeeping staff very knowledgeable and available. Room was very clean and comfortable. Hotel is quiet. Two steps away from bus, subway, union square, shopping mall, restaurant. Everything was just perfect. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Potential Overbooking Problem”
Reviews.Author: sheryl0202
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with one King bed. I know we are going to arrive only late at night so I specifically emailed the hotel to inform them this to ensure that our booking will be secured. I received a response from the hotel and they take note of our arrival time. However, upon arrival at the hotel, we were informed by the font desk that the hotel is fully occupied and our room has been given to others. What was left for us was just a room with 2 queen beds. How can this even happen after my effort of informing the hotel? As it was late at night and we were tired from our 20+hours flight, we had no choice but to take up the room with 2 queen beds. The front desk staffs were not very understanding and apologetic, basically he was trying to tell us to take it or leave it. I believe our case is not a single incident because when we came down again to grab some food after checking in, I overheard that there was this couple at the front desk facing the same problem again. Further, I would add that there is no free wifi in the hotel, the internet would costs $12.95 per night. As part of the Wydham group hotels, I do not think this is justifiable. There is also always a queue for checking in, checking out and concierge service. I do not find the staffs particularly friendly, other than this chinese girl at the front desk. Most of them were kind of fierce and unfriendly. Other than these issues, the room was alright with a bay view.I hope the hotel can improve on this. This is one huge disappointment to us. I will never book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Really it is a no brainer. Stay here for a romantic get away!”
Reviews.Author: MrsBarta
Reviews.Content: Really it is a no brainer. Stay here for a romantic get away! This hotel is beautiful and unbelievably clean. My husband and I loved it. Our room was lovely and had a great view from the 24th floor. We slept like babies. The bed was very comfortable. It is perfectly located. We took the bart in so we never used their parking, which is around $44 per night. The staff was amazing (everything from the concierge, bellhop, frontline staff, and restaurant servers). We saw Wicked (3 blocks from the hotel) and got a 3 day pass for the trains and trolleys for $20, thanks to the helpful concierge. There is always a taxi outside the hotel if you want to go out late and don’t want to drive (which I recommend). We had dinner at this great restaurant (Basil Thai Restaurant & Bar - 1175 Folsom Street) it was very romantic and packed for a Wednesday night. Make sure to call ahead before you go. There is a little coffee/pastry shop (right off the valet before you cross over to the bart) they had delicious croissants and fresh fruit! If you are into wine tasting check out the Press Club located between 3 and 4 streets just off of Market. We also did the 3 hour Mr. Toad’s Tour located at the corner of Mason and Jefferson on Fishermen’s Warf. We will be back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Comfort in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: msu17
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 is in an awesome location in the heart of Union Square area. The hotel is huge and stylish. There are eight elevators, so you rarely have to wait. The bell staff was helpful, and we were treated kindly by the front desk. Upon arrival, Jon at the desk helped to locate us in a nice king room on the 27th floor. Even though we booked through Hotwire (a steal at $89), he granted my requests without any hassle. The room was spacious and came with a great view of the city. The bed was extremely comfortable, and was one of the highlights of our entire stay. There are definite noise issues coming from the streets below (sirens are consistent at night), but we were never kept awake by them. One nice touch was nightly turn down service by the maids. They did a great job. We loved the location...steps from the cable car turnaround, bus and BART access, and the F Market street car. Also, there is more shopping around here than you can imagine. We would definitely stay at the Parc 55 again. For such a large hotel, it still made for a comfortable retreat for us during our first trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, beautiful rooms, courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: cvanwyn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just across the street from the Powell Street subway station and Cable Car stop; a perfect place for tourists that are unfamiliar with the city. The room was elegantly appointed, with bay windows overlooking the City and surprisingly spacious for a downtown hotel. The only downside is the noise volume generated by the busy city streets below, but this hotel has considered this as well--complimentary ear plugs are available next to the soap and shampoo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, PerfectCentral San Fran location”
Reviews.Author: Kurto125
Reviews.Content: We struggled to find the Parc 55 on travel search engines and review sites. We also compared vacation rentals,. Nevertheless the description of the rooms, location and the room rates made it worth a try. We were amazed when we got to the hotel. It is the best ocatio in the Union Square area. Across the street from the visitors' center. Diagonally across the street from the Hilton San Francisco, two blocks from union square central. Best rates of any hotels in the area. We got a 25th floor room, stunning city view. Great service. Buffet breakfast was great albeit pricey (@ $21). Staff was very helpful and responsive. Take the hotel limo to the airport $45 flat) cheaper for 4 than any shuttle or cab. Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Shopping Location”
Reviews.Author: teacher34
Reviews.Content: I loved how easily this hotel was to get to using the BART from the airport into town ($8.20). Walk out the doors, up the stairs, a few steps and there it is! We were on the 26th floor and could see the Bay and the city. This hotel is located in a shopping mecca. If shopping is your thing, you will not be dissapointed! All forms of trasportation are just outside the hotel. There are a great deal of homeless people in the area, but no one bothered us. The hotel staff was very nice. Our room was roomy. We were close to the elevator, and really didn't hear anyone. I thought the bed a bit uncomfortable, but I am picky. I would definitely stay here again. My husband and I both enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice downtown business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vidiot42
Reviews.Content: Couldn't beat the location (literally steps away from Hallidie Plaza, where one can find the Powell St BART/MUNI station and the Powell St cable car turnaround), but know that it's right on the edge of the seedier Tenderloin neighborhood (it didn't bother this New Yorker, but I'd be careful what direction I walked in after dark.) Very close to Union Square shopping/attractions/etc, and an easy walk to Chinatown, Ferry Building, and other places. Good deal through Hotwire, which describes this as four stars. The rooms were nice and comfortable and clean. Great housekeeping staff kept the place immaculate and cheerfully accommodated our requests for extra towels. Comfortable beds (two doubles -- would've liked two queens, but that would've made the room pretty cramped), some oddly deep (but comfy) armchairs, inroom coffee, and a massive flatscreen TV were all features we liked. The "business center" down near the lobby was three computers and a printer, and it'd have been nice if all three computers (two of which worked) were connected to the printer instead of just the closest one -- rather than wait for the perpetually-busy computer near the printer to be free, so I could print out my airline boarding pass, I bailed and did it at the airport) Front desk and bell staff were very helpful (letting us borrow a wheelchair for the day to help an 89-year-old member of our party get around the city) and friendly, and I appreciated not getting the hard sell from the bellmen -- they hustled to do their jobs, but didn't hustle the guests. I also liked the big jug of ice water with lemon slices in the lobby -- refreshing while we waited to meet people. The only negative I saw was minor, but I didn't exactly relish seeing the open condom wrapper on the lobby carpet near the elevators one evening when we returned back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: KavehK
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect! Near Market Street and Union Square and all the great shopping. The rooms were comfortable and quiet. Everything just worked and we have basically nothing to complain about besides the WiFi-connection that was slow and costly. When we return to Frisco we're gonna stay here again, no doubt about it.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade worth every penny. Great location & view of city!”
Reviews.Author: redwoodsgirl
Reviews.Content: Started with moderately priced room and upgraded at checkin. We stayed on the 26th floor, with a city view and parking incl. in our room rate. Hotel location is centrally located so you can easily walk to almost every district in the city. There is a wide variety of dining and shopping options nearby. Rooms are clean & spacious and ours had a spectacular view. Because we got the "park and play" room rate, we could take our car out when visiting areas further away ( Golden Gate Bridge, Muir Woods, etc.) Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “More money doesn't mean better value”
Reviews.Author: ChumsMum01
Reviews.Content: We tried Priceline for the first time and were excited to see our bid accepted for a 4-star hotel in an neighborhood in SF we were interested in. However, we didn't take into account that Priceline gave us an AVERAGE price range of the hotels in the area.....so what we THOUGHT was a deal was really only about a $10 discount at the Parc 55. Live and learn. For the same price we paid in the Pacific Grove/Monterey area, we got a much smaller room with double beds. It was on the 15th floor and from the reviews I had read previously, anything above the 5th floor would be good, especially for street noise. I guess SF is really noisy because we could still hear everything. The room was very clean, had nice bathroom amenities, but $14.95 for Internet use and $44 for parking was difficult to swallow. Just so you know, you can find cheaper parking a couple blocks away. Not having internet access in the hotel was a greater hardship than we thought since we were not able to research activities/venues/attractions, etc. We did find a Starbucks around the corner offering free Wifi, but it would have been better to surf at the hotel rather than lugging a computer around, especially at this area. The hotel area was interesting......one block over is really seedy, but go the other way and it's really nice..... Having the Powell/Market cable cars stop was very handy and we made great use of it traveling all over town.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Brooklynite7
Reviews.Content: We were unsure about the hotel due to mixed reviews but got a good deal (and unnamed hotel) online. The staff was friendly and kind (especially housekeeping). The room was luxe and spacious. The hotel was nice to come back to after a long day of sight seeing. Our room faced the inside of the hotel so it was a quiet and restful sleep for us. I enjoyed using the high-tech gym every morning. The shopping nearby is great with every store you can imagine and mass transit is at your doorstep. The adjacent area is a little sketchy but downtown is a tourist hub so what can you expect. There is a noticeable police presence as well as what appears to be hotel security outside. We ventured to the border of the adjacent area for SF's #1 burger and it was pretty safe. We would recommend this hotel! Good deals are there to be had.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in SF”
Reviews.Author: Tienne
Reviews.Content: I was arrived at this hotel at 2 PM and was informed my room won't be ready till 3 PM. I got my room which is facing the street. It's loud and quite often I heard the sirene but this is a tipical SF downtown. Overall, this is a nice centrally located hotel in the Union Square. The PRO: The room is clean and spacious. The location is the best. It's the central of Union Square. Just 2 minutes walking, you will find a westfield mall where you can get your lunch or dinner easily (the foodcourt in this mall is great) and it;s very closed to cable car Powell street station. Within 5 minutes walking, you are in "Sugar Daddy" park, where you can join hop on and hop off tour bus easily and also within walking distant to china town to enjoy asian food and get souvenirs. The CON: The location is very good but in the same time, it's very noisy. If you are a quiet sleeper, then it would be hard for you to not wake up couple times in the middle of time. Oh, did I mention that the parking here costs around $50/night (not including tips - because the parking here has to be valet).

Reviews.Title: “Good location. A few nice staff members. Many complaints”
Reviews.Author: oliverlevitt
Reviews.Content: 1. The location is write in Union Square which is perfect for shopping, and using public transportation to get to the various neighborhoods. 2. There was one concierge( an older Asian woman) who worked during the days and was totally rude and unhelpful). I wouldn't be surprised if others have complained about her as well. The younger Asian woman who worked in the late afternoon and evening was great however. 3. Make sure you don't get a room next to the elevator because you hear them going up and down all night through the wall. 4. You can hear everything that goes on outside your room. 5. My girlfriend liked the bath products. She said they weren't cheap. 6. The price we paid was good, but I would have paid more for a better place. 7. They refused to store our luggage after we stayed there for four nights. They said it was a security issue. 8. I would not stay here again, but if you are on a budget it works I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: wine_on_vaca
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel for the overall quality of the rooms and staff. The concierge is one of the best I have ever seen, so friendly and willing to help. Just be prepared that this part of town has some sketchy people lingering around and you drive through some rough parts of town to get there. It was not anything that really made us concerned for our safety, but we wished we had chosen a different part of town because of it. The city does do a nice job of hiring security guards to walk around and they are very friendly and offer to assist with directions.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from the Fifth Floor!”
Reviews.Author: Snoozan
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate through PriceLine, and when we arrived the hotel was empty, and I asked for a room as high up as possible with a bathtub. The receptionist looked me in the eye and lied--said the hotel was booked solid--and she could only give me a room on the fifth floor, noting that I had booked through Priceline. It was punishment for using Priceline plain and simple: we walked through the convention floor (fourth floor) and they had no one coming in and no one leaving. Of course, the fifth floor was so close to the racket from the sleep that we couldn't get any sleep at all. The walls were paperthin and the family in the next room had a crying baby. The room itself was nice and large; the bathroom was roomy; the mattress was comfortable. The room service meal was okay but too expensive and they forgot my husband's entree. I have booked in four star hotels through Priceline before and been treated just fine--and I write recommendations accordingly. If you have any trouble sleeping, I wouldn't stay lower than the tenth floor.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: riceburnergrace
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Parc 55 for our recent trip to San Francisco. We paid $70 on Priceline for our Sunday night stay. The room was large and the bathroom was giant for San Francisco standards. We stayed at a luxury hotel on Powell Street a few years ago and the luxury hotel rooms were less than half the size for four times the price! I felt like four people could have easily fit in our room. The hotel was recently remodeled and the check-in area is comfortable and trendy. I would have given the hotel 5 stars but it was a bit difficult to sleep because the noise from pipes knocking in the wall (my husband is a plumber so he’s an expert at identifying that sound). I’m hoping it’s only a temporary situation. I will always stay here when in San Francisco. It’s a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SaFot
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights and we got a room with panoramic view. The stuff is very friendly and the amenities are clean. The decoration could use a fresh up but the location is just great. You have the cable car, bus and metro station right in front of the hotel. Union Square is just 2 blocks away and there are many shops and restaurants near by. We didn't have to use the car at all. If we go back we would probably stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased Indeed”
Reviews.Author: HappyRambler
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5-night stay at this hotel and was very pleased with the overall experience. My room was ready at check-in and was spacious and immaculate. Bed was very comfortable, and the pillow choice was fantastic. San Francisco had been experiencing a "heat spell" (at least, for San Francisco), and the air conditioning worked very well, The bathroom was well stocked each day and included a real hand-held hairdryer, rather than a box stuck on a wall with tepid air coming from a narrow plastic tube. Also, real hangers (my other hotel pet peeve are hangers that you have to hook to use). My initial concern had been about noise, as reported in previous reviews. Yes, ear plugs are provided. However, the room was absolutely quiet, perhaps because I was on the 13th floor and facing a side street. Breakfast was not included in the package that I selected, but there is a self-serve breakfast bar in the lobby with Starbucks coffee fot two dollars or a continental breakfast consisting of tea or coffee and a choice of two other items (choice of pastries, bagels, fruit) for only five dollars. Nice touch. Hotel staff were great with a helpful concierge, pleasant wait staff in the restaurant, and a charming young woman who was doing housekeeping on the 13th floor. As others have mentioned, the location is perfect for those using public transportation. Be aware that the street people can be overwhelming, even for someone like me from a large East Coast city with its own street population. However, this is certainly not the hotel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: NZGrant
Reviews.Content: Positives: - Well located as next to BART, MUNI and Powell St cable car. - Good views (15th floor) - Really good continental breakfast - Sharp room rate - Clean and quiet Negatives: - Arrived from UK at 4pm and our king bed room was not available. Being tired, we took a room with 2 double beds which are on the small side. - Got woken up at 7.30am by a staff member wanting to take our bags, thinking we were part of a group. - Internet charges at $13/day too high. Better to push the room rate up and offer free wifi. - Close to some seedy neighbourhoods (6th) to be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Ronow
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days in this hotel for our West Coast trip. After staying in 5 different hotels for the trip (range from 2 - 5 stars) we concluded that the stay at Parc 55 was the most comfortable. This hotel is right in the middle of everywhere. A few minutes walk from BART/ MUNI/ cable car stations, Market St., Union Sq, shops,... At the time of check in I requested a quiet room and we were given a room on the 10th floor facing north (or west). I think we got a room upgrade too it was one with sofa bed, coffee table, work table and a king size bed. I would definitely stay at Parc 55 again when I come visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed, but I got it at a decent price.”
Reviews.Author: senordukes
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 is in a decent location, just as all Union Square hotels are, which made it easy to get around the city. But, don't be fooled by the 4 star rating. This hotel room just looks like any normal hotel, but I got a good deal on it through Priceline. It was around $100 per night. The hotel is pretty close to Tenderloin and there were a decent amount of street folks wandering right next to the hotel. But, that is to be expected. However, the room came with earplugs, which is not a good sign. The room was very noisy, so loud that we were woken up quite a few times during the night by police cars, this was clearly Parc 55's lack of sound proofing because I also stayed at Hotel Nikko (which is one block up) and it was silent. Overall, I wouldn't stay here again. Spend a little extra and go to Hotel Nikko.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for a week. Amazing location...”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryFlyboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week. Amazing location, close to the BART station. I would stay again. I only have one complaint, in room Internet should be free. They do have a business center which offers free Internet. So I really can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, fantastic hotel, service, and location”
Reviews.Author: HeywoodJ
Reviews.Content: Bid <$100/rm/night for a weekend stay using name your own price on priceline for 2 rooms in a 4 star in the union square area and got this hotel. I've never used name your own price before but figured this was a good time to start. I was concerned because there were 5 of us, and the hotel wouldn't pre-book anything when I called them after they had my money. All their connecting rooms connect 1K to 2D. Nearly all of their 1K rooms also have a pullout couch. Their rooms with 2D are so small they can not take a rollaway. They told me a rollaway in a 1K room would not be a problem. At checkin, they didn't treat me like a priceline deadbeat, they put me in the rooms we needed with no problem. By mistake those rooms didn't have a pullout, so by asking very nicely we were offered a free upgrade to one of the rooms to a minisuite, which was fantastic. The hotel is pretty much at the edge of the Tenderloin, the sketchy part of town - the area to the west and perhaps south is 'iffy'. If that bothers you, you're not likely to avoid 'sketchy' by paying more for another hotel in another area. The area to the north and east is the heart of downtown SF, which is why you're here. Walk 1 block to the cable car, take it to fishermans wharf, and enjoy the world's most beautiful city. The hotel charges $53/night for parking which is insane even for this area. I found Best Parking at 525 Jones St for $20/night - had no problems. Jones St area is a tad sketchy but I don't worry about such issues. Note that is you are flying in from out of town, it would be insane to rent a car to travel into SF - take mass transit instead. You do not drive around SF or to or from the airport - take bart, muni, whatever.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: medinalynn
Reviews.Content: Had a great trip to San Francisco and if I went back ,I would not hesitate to stay at Parc 55 Hotel.It's right across the street from Westfield Mall,which has all kinds of eating places.Transportation is right there and cable car turn around.Hotel treated us good.Upon returning in the afternoon,the room was all made up.The best part was,the hotel limo took us back to the airport and was cheaper then the super shuttle that brought us from the airport to the hotel,amazing!!! There is a lot to see and do in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Iwouldratherdrive
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 1 night at the Parc 55 on our way through San Francisco. We got to check in quite early (Around 11 AM) and found the service at the hotel to be outstanding. The hotel is newly renovated and the rooms have all the updates you might expect (improved linens, flatscreen tv, etc). The only complaint that I have of this hotel is that the high speed internet costs around $10 and there is no Wi-Fi. However, the location is very convenient (1/2 block from the Powell St. BART Station) and we truly enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Don't care for remodel”
Reviews.Author: Aunteen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Parc 55 many times over the past years, and I do not like the remodel. The hotel is cold and unwelcoming. There are no nice public rooms, the restaurant and bar were uninviting, the lobby is barely more than a counter where people work. Very, very sparse. Service in the bar was not good either. We had trouble getting the waiter back after we asked to look at their wine list. We ended up leaving. The hotel just isn't that nice anymore. The location is great if you want to go to the shopping center, but very seedy around the hotel itself. I won't be staying here again. It is too bad, I used to really like this hotel. The hotel seems to be trying to be hip, it used to be more elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money; 5 star Service”
Reviews.Author: luxe_mom
Reviews.Content: We booked Parc 55 through Hotwire for only 89USD per night. It was a steal! Great location, great amenities. Downside is that they don’t offer free internet in lobby or in the room. If you visit their business center, they will let you use their PCs for free. The location is absolutely perfect. It’s a block from Macy’s, it’s right in front of Westfield mall and the Cable Car stop is right next to it. We woke up our second day very early and hopped on the cable car as there was still no line. It was one of the most memorable things we did in San Francisco. After reading about one of the reviews here on tripadvisor, i was worried about getting a smoking floor. I called the hotel in advance and told them about my asthmatic condition. They blocked a room for us in advance and it was a good thing as there was a convention going on when we arrived. We were given the 13th floor. Rooms were a bit dated, but clean and big. The cleaning ladies were friendly and approachable. The bed was comfortable and the linens were soft and luxurious, pillows were fluffy. Overall, we would definitely stay at this hotel again. I was expecting a package to be delivered to us, but the concierge had an incident. But they were able to fix everything for us at the end.

Reviews.Title: “Very good...but beware the sirens...”
Reviews.Author: PhilipW4
Reviews.Content: I spent one evening at the Parc 55 before meeting friends in town. Great central position just by Powell Street BART station so easy access from the airport. On checking in, I was pleased to learn that I'd been upgraded to a corner room on the 29th floor. Following a 10.5 flight from London I just wanted to crash for the night so I ordered room service. Very prompt and friendly service - it was quite pricey but good food. nonetheless. My only criticism is that sirens from a nearby fire station kept waking me up all night. I was going to be awake at the crack of dawn because of jet-lag so it didn't bother me too much but I can imagine that it would really start to get annoying if staying for any extended period of time. Staff were friendly, good central location in San Francisco and amazing views (room 2920) so overall good value for money . I paid approx £70 through hotels.com.

Reviews.Title: “You can never go wrong with this hotel...excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: r_sarda
Reviews.Content: I think a paid a little more but am not overly bothered because the hotel exceeded my expectations with regards to location and comfort. But I am not happy about the breakfast charges. It should be included in the room rate and then at the rate I paid to priceline this would have been a great deal. But the hotel itself is excellent. It is located at one end of Union Square but bang on top of a BART station. The sightseeing/tourist Trolley starts almost from the doorstep of the hotel. Going to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square etc. is very convenient because trams of this area stop in front of the hotel. Chinatown, Nob Hill all within short walking distance. It is in the middle of shopping district with lots and lots of showrooms nearby. A couple of Indian restuarants next door and I think Little Delhi is one of them which serves good food at reasonable prices. Negative: Can't think of anything but as mentioned before get the breakfast included in the room rate because I found the buffet breakfast rate very high.
