Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, large spacious...”
Reviews.Author: Pennypincher5
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location, large spacious rooms, Separate dressing area, large tv, updated bath with plenty of towels and toiletries, decent room service and good, if expensive, wi-fi. We got a great deal on Priceline, but be aware the front desk may not be quite as friendly since the hotel sells the priceline rooms cheap. But for everything you get, a little attitude is no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Hiden fees”
Reviews.Author: Pensacolagirl
Reviews.Content: When you check in to the hotel the put a $100 a day hold on your credit card. That means if you are staying for six days they put a $600 hold on your credit card. The cable car is les than a block away. Every time I purchased anything from this hotel I was over charged. Such as the internet fee of $12.95, which I used one time, was charged $112.95. They did finally give me my money back. The purchase at the store, the price on the box of $8.99 and was charged $9.99. If you are on a budget this is not the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Han550n
Reviews.Content: Me and my sister stayed at Parc 55 and had a great time. Great service, nice and clean room. Great breakfast and a location close to most things. I recommend this hotel to everyone and I would stay here again if i´m going to SF

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Andidroid
Reviews.Content: Stayed May 21st for a weeks vacation. Hotel greatly appointed for all amenities, travel shops and restaraunts etc. Hotel very clean spacious and airy. Had room 16th floor, which was also kept clean. Beds and pillows lovely and comfortable. Even though on 16th floor, could hear traffic noise below, but Hello you are staying in the middle of a city at the end of the day, and there are vents on bottom of windows that cut a lot of this noise out. Had a few minor issues, that were soon dealt with promptly, check-in was ok, just about bordering polite, but nothing above or beyond, think that maybe down to what member of staff checks you in! Above all had a great stay in San Fran, and would recommend this hotel!!.........Only slight niggle, no in-room safes

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: sarhm
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderfull stay at Parc 55, good location, spacious room, good food at the restaurant and the staff was very helpful. All in all I would definitively stay at Parc 55 again.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star but definately 4!!”
Reviews.Author: maccaj73
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fabulous location near both Market and Powell street. We were very pleased with a rate of around $130USD a night which is well worth it. Take advantage of the free internet and the nice restraunts in the surrounding streets. The receptionist on check-in obviously saw we were staying for 4 nights so gave us a bigger room on the corner, little thoughts like these do help! Obviously the airlines know its a great hotel as the crew for Cathay, Lufthansa and BA all stay here. My only negative points would be that we encountered a conciege who was not overly knowledgeable and didnt really show a strong desire to help us out. For those who are light sleepers this hotel could pose some problems as the walls are paper thin, on a weekend the sirens are blaring all night long and we could still hear them on the 23rd floor!!! The Pets friendly policy is also a bit disturbing!!! The person in the room next to be had a large dog and i find this unhygenic the rooms would not be cleaned adequately enough to make them safe. Despite the minor issues it is overall an excellent place to stay in SF!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal and location”
Reviews.Author: EasyE808
Reviews.Content: I used to live in SF and realize how expensive it is to stay in the city. I was expecting to pay about $200+ for a nice room and parking. To my surprise I got a great deal on the Parc 55 hotel and parking for under $180. It is located just outside Union Square - about 2 blocks and the rooms are clean and nicely decorated. If you are into the nightclub scene this would be a nice spot as there are a few clubs just around the corner. I would recommend a higher floor as San Francisco does have an active police and fire department.

Reviews.Title: “Came on a business trip and had a great...”
Reviews.Author: Bill1950z
Reviews.Content: Came on a business trip and had a great stay. Was checked into my room quickly, the room was very nice and clean, and the hotel was in a great location. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: SydNat
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is fine. Nice, clean rooms in a great location. Got a great price on Priceline. It is in a noisy area -- they give you a pair of earplugs! Customer service was really poor. The people working at the desk were clearly just going through the motions -- not friendly, didn't say thanks, answered questions very shortly. Would be a different experience with happier staff.

Reviews.Title: “ROYAL TREATMENT”
Reviews.Author: kmoriarty
Reviews.Content: On our last trip to San Francisco, my husband and I ended up getting engaged in our room at the Parc 55 in SF. This was not initially his plan, but today it makes not only SF, but also the Parc 55 sentimental to us. We ended up getting married in California and planned to stay at the Parc 55 for a few nights of our Honeymoon. My husband emailed the hotel our story and told them that we would be returning. The most sentimental part of our engagement story was that we were engaged on the 22nd floor. When we checked in, we were surprised to see that they actually read the email! They put us up in a room on the 22nd floor with a fantastic view! That wasn’t it; they also gave us access to the VIP club at no additional charge! We were highly impressed by this and by all of the staff members! We especially enjoyed Sergio, a worker in the VIP LOUNGE. There are so many great things about this hotel, It is located right in union square and is close to several great restaurants including an AMAZING Indian restaurant right across the street! We appreciate the great service at the hotel and will DEFINITELY be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room in great Union Square location”
Reviews.Author: Christina38
Reviews.Content: I got my room through Priceline. I paid $100 plus taxes for a $499 room, and it was a total steal. The bed was extremely comfortable, as were the oversized chairs overlooking a spectacular view of Union Square. The bathroom and amenities were great, and employees were very friendly. The hotel is within walking distance to restaurants, theaters, and parking garages (I recommend the 24-hour garage at O'Farrell & Mason instead of the Parc's valet parking). Even though it backs up to the Tenderloin, you don't notice because the entrance to the hotel is on a safe street. I wouldn't mind staying here again, although I'd like to sleep in next time since the bed was so comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable. Got a great rate, but wouldn't stay here if I had to pay full price”
Reviews.Author: SydneyShane
Reviews.Content: Why I booked ========== I booked this hotel as because of its location, it is close to Union Square, the BART (rail) station and Westfield is just across the road. We got a fantastic rate and it was just behind the boutique Hotel we staid last time (Hotel Abri). Now the reality! Check-in ======= Be prepared to hand over your credit card, they wouldnt take a cash deposit for our room - I've never had a problem at any other hotel before (if you are travelling to multiple destinations you know how annoying it can be if all money is tied up in pre-authorisations). What was most concerning is that the check in lady simply started swiping away and charging my card before she'd even told me what she was doing or what the amount was Then on checkout we saw the fineprint on our bill that the hotel policy is that the funds dont get released by the hotel for up to two days after you actually checkout. Rooms ====== I STRONGLY suggest you ask for a room on a high floor or you wont be able to sleep. The rooms were clean and neatly appointed. Other things worth noting ================== Gym - Really good - good range of machines and free weights, all brand new. No Pool No Guest Laundry No in room safe - small deposit boxes (passport size) are available at reception Location ====== Generally good, the hotel located close to shopping in Union Square, Westfield San Fran Centre, cable cars, and street cars. If you catch the train (the BART) its easy and cheap but so you aren't shocked, there are a heap of homeless people that congregate around the BART station, it can be quite confronting if you arent expecting it. The area behind the hotel is pretty seedy as well worth being careful Overall ===== If I had to compare this hotel versus Hotel Abri where we stayed last time I would hands down choose the Abri. However the price we paid particularly over the Easter weekend was a really really good deal and if this is a consideration for your stay it may be worth while .

Reviews.Title: “Best location!”
Reviews.Author: Simba0313
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 is right in the centre of Union Square. The price was brilliant, the rooms were clean and the service was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the Heart of it All”
Reviews.Author: jleuthard
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice. It was exactly what I expected, very modern. We got a deal because we were there for a conference but probably wouldn't stay there for the full price. If you exit the hotel, you're better off exiting the main entrance because if you go out the back glass doors, you have to wade through all of the smokers hanging around the door.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: EricLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Hotel is immaculate. Everything is new. Beds are comfy - rooms quiet. Best value for upscale hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel. Great location!”
Reviews.Author: vacaynowplease
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through Hotwire, so we paid less than $100/night. Hotwire has this hotel set as a 4 star, which I disagree with... I would give it max 3.5 stars. That being said, the hotel has its good (and best) point: location!! The BART station is right in front, the cable car turnaround is a block away and there is a streetcar stop right across the street. All your necessary means of transportation are at your disposal. Though I do see what some reviewers said about it being on a "seedy" part of town, I never felt unsafe walking around, though the latest we were out was around 10PM. The outside/public areas of the hotel are gorgeous. They have these amazing San Francisco "scenes" (cable car, painted ladies, gg bridge, etc) carved into the walls outside by the entrance behind the valet parking attendant. The lobby is also very big and modern. The service is ok. The staff are polite enough, but not overly personable. If you are looking for that, I wouldn't stay here. That doesn't bother me so much, so it wasn't an issue. I did, however, feel that because we were "pre-paid" customers, that we weren't "worth" getting our room request. It ended up working out in our favor but felt a little snubbed, lol. Another note, this hotel has smoking rooms. I'm not sure if this is the norm in San Francisco (I thought the city was generally about good health!) but that surprised me. We almost ended up with one but luckily a non-smoking room turned up! (Phew). Ah yes, about the noise, we asked for a room AWAY from the cable car turnaround and heard nothing at night or during the day. Earplugs not needed! The rooms are ok. Very clean, which is super important. Modern-looking, really very typical. Big enough, it had a small double couch in it, though made it feel a little tight. A few things though. The room did not have much drawer space at all. There is a closet to hang stuff but only a few hangers. It also did not have a safe, which really surprised me. I had thought that was the norm in hotels these days, maybe I'm wrong. The hotel does have safe deposit boxes at the desk but seemed annoying to have to go up and down to get things so we didn't bother with it. Actually, housekeeping was great and didn't really throw ANYTHING away unless it was obviously supposed to be so I actually had no problem with leaving stuff unlocked (though I didn't leave it out in plain view, of course)! There also isn't a fridge in the room. This may be expecting too much. But when we walked in, the TV is on a huge stand that when opened looked like a fridge should have been in it, but just had open space. Maybe it was supposed to be there? No idea. Anyway, overall this hotel isn't a bad choice. The location is great, the rooms are clean and the staff is polite enough. I wouldn't be as ok with it if I had paid even close to what they normally charge, but as I hadn't, I would have no problem "winning" this hotel through Hotwire/Priceline again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: VegasJetsetter77
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Priceline and got a great deal. We got the BART from the Airport to the Hotel and the hotel was literally around the corner around the BART station. Quick check in and the rooms were lovely. We did want a King Bed room but only Queens were available so we accepted this as we were only staying 2 nights. Bathroom was also nice and lots of towels. Room was extremely central and we didn't hear any outside noise. We would go shopping. come back, drop out bags off and go out again. The bar was also very nice and reasonable. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in a luxury central hotel and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: dinerdogg
Reviews.Content: I agree with so many other reviews that the location of this hotel cannot be beat. Proximity to anything you could want to do while in San Francisco is just outside your door. I found the rooms to be very average and although the lobby has a modern upbeat feel the rest of the hotel has a kinda drab look about it. You definitely need the earplugs that are provided in your room (although we only got 1 pair for 2 people) since it is very loud. We were on the 22nd floor on a weekend and it was crazy both outside and guest in the hallway at 2-3am. I did expect this a bit staying in the heart of a city and enjoyed staying the next 3 nights at a quiet, peaceful, B&B in Yosemite! If you are only there for a few days stay in Union Square and deal with the noise. If you have a car or want a more low-key place to stay look outside Union Sq. The price and location were right for us.

Reviews.Title: “what a great find”
Reviews.Author: debbiewestsussex
Reviews.Content: I got a fantastic rate for 2 rooms for my family so I must admit I was not expecting much for the money I paid for 4 nights, how wrong can you be. On arrival I asked reception if they could put us on a high floor which they kindly did floor 22, wow what a view it was amazing. The hotel had a free business centre with computers which you could use which was great for our teenage sons, and a free gym which they used. This hotel is perfect for shopping and sight seeing and restaurants everything was on our door stop. The rooms were very nice we had 2 beds in our room and had no complaints at all. If you are looking for a city hotel near to everything this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: guoning
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location, close to Westfield/tram (literally just outside the hotel), union square (a few mins walk) and many different restaurants are around. However, Tenderloin neighborhood is on the west of the hotel, friends who live in SF had told me to avoid this area is possible. The hotel itself was ok. I stayed in one of the standard rooms on upper floor, had a partial view of union square, room was kinda small, amenities were pretty standard, nothing really spectacular. I would recommend this hotel to budget travelers looking for great location at reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “nicest hotel i've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: rwk87
Reviews.Content: We got this place for a good deal via priceline and were extremely impressed! Really stylish, modern decor. Very clean. Awesome service - bellhops brought our luggage up, brought a bottle opener when we asked for one. Nice bar. Food was too expensive so we did not eat there, but that is typical for a hotel. Some noise from the street but with a pair of earplugs and the a/c running, we had no problem. No noise from adjacent rooms. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, but needed those earplugs to sleep...”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 for 3 nights at the beginning of May. The hotel has a fantastic location! The Bart, Muni, Cable Cars, Buses, etc are all virtually seconds away. We rode all of these types of public transportation as having a car in San Fran adds to much stress to your holiday. We dined in the restaurant one night and found the food to be ok and the service to be a little stale. We tried to have fun with our server but he was not interested. The rooms and lobby are very clean and the beds were comfortable. When the hotel supplies each room with earplugs, you will know that there is a noise problem. Wow, was it loud. We were on the 9th floor and heard everything that happened outside. It took us until our final night to start getting used to the noise. Would I come back to this hotel? Maybe... The price and location was right!

Reviews.Title: “trendy”
Reviews.Author: caalie
Reviews.Content: Trendy hotel in Union Square. Very comfortable, nice views, great lobby and bar. A great bargain for the location. Parking is very expensive in San Francisco, but this hotel is across the street from BART station- $8.10 to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a VIEW”
Reviews.Author: maninomaha
Reviews.Content: I arrived on the 28th of April, think it was the day Wyndham took over the hotel. There was a lot of confusion. The computer systems were not functioning properly. I did arrive early and the room was not ready. I checked my luggage with the bellman, and went out to enjoy the day. When I arrived back a gentleman at the front desk apologized for the confusion and gave me a corner room on the 27th floor. The view was amazing. The room itself felt large was was clean. My luggage was sent up, but to my surprise and the bellman's it was someone else's. I had to go downstairs and easily found the right bags. The view was so great I ate in the room. The only downside is that bed was extremely hard. Every one at the hotel was great and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience - Staff is AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: FitzLA1
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here the weekend of April 16th for a last minute trip to San Francisco for a celebration. Upon check in, the front desk staff could not have been nicer. They were aware of our celebration and had reserved us a corner room on the 26th floor with access to the club lounge. The room and views were spectacular. The entire hotel has been recently remodeled and they spared no expense. The lobby is beautiful as are the rooms. FYI, it's San Francisco. I wouldn't go to a large city and not expect noise. The street noise was never bothersome and our neighbors could not have been quieter. The staff were amazing all weekend and really made for such an enjoyable trip. If you're planning a trip soon, I would not hesitate to book this hotel. Prices can't be beat for the quality and they really make you feel welcome. We can't wait to go back, and as a matter of fact, have already booked our next stay over 4th of July Weekend.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in the foggy city”
Reviews.Author: paulmac83
Reviews.Content: A wonderful corner room with a view that could not be described- A fantastic! The hotel was definately 6 star luxury at 3 star prices- very good value for money. Breakfast was fullsome, slightly pricey but lasted until dinner. Bill incorrectly calculated but on query was quickly remedied. A wonderful experience and would definately returnif in sfo again.

Reviews.Title: “The Parc 55 Front Desk is the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: kmbarrette
Reviews.Content: The highlight of my Parc 55 Hotel experience was all the help that Mavis at the front desk gave me. I had an issue with a hold placed on my credit card that wasn't being released and Mavis spent over an hour on the phone with my credit card company trying to resolve the issue for me (which she did!). It was thanks to her hard work and dedication that the rest of my trip was stress-free, and I couldn't thank her enough. The entire staff at the hotel was very friendly and our room was always immaculate. I'd definitely recommend the Parc 55 Hotel to anyone staying in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, central location!”
Reviews.Author: franciscob
Reviews.Content: Great experience!, the location is great, jus two blocks fron union square, and the cable car stop is around the corner. For shoppers, there is a big shoppping center one block away. The view fron the upper rooms is beautiful!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Matt_Ries
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent a long weekend in San Francisco. We stayed at the Parc 55 and were pleasantly surprised. We got a free upgrade that included a continental breakfast, all of the staff were polite, helpful, and customer service oriented. The views from the room were great and the location was perfect for the leisure traveler or business person.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: dln40
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, the staff made me feel like a valued guest and did all they could to make my stay nice. The room was an upgrade and I was very pleased with it. I had a wonderful view of the city. The location is in the perfect spot for shopping, buses, BART and eateries. The best part of my stay was how nice the Hotel was for the price and the courteous staff was very helpful in directions ect. I will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: AB_Team
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the hotel this past weekend and we really enjoyed the location, the room, and the customer service. I was disappointed we had to pay $50 a day for parking. I do have a few minor complaints, the toilet paper was super thin, the shampoo/body soap did not lather well so bring your own shampoo and soap, and no mini refrigerator in the room. The hotel lobby decor was really trendy and I would definitely stay in the hotel again for the same price I paid online.

Reviews.Title: “Stay someplace else - lots of better choices are available.”
Reviews.Author: sparkerxx1
Reviews.Content: Neighborhood is convenient, but borderline in terms of the panhandler/hooker index. The internet access costs 12.95 per day and is limited to one device - which is not disclosed on the connection site, so I would have paid $26 per day to use my wireless hand-held and netbook. I did without the netbook, since I don't care to be taken advantage of that way. Parking is $44 per day, which is outrageous even for downtown SF. The amount of street noise on the weekend nights was excruciating, and providing earplugs is no substitute for dual pane windows. No mini-bar, fridge or in-room coffee - I understand some hotels consider those down-market amenities, but I travel so much that breakfast out has little appeal. There are many better choices in terms of amenties and cost right in that neighborhood. On the good side, it was sparkling clean and the furnishing were nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: bbb92
Reviews.Content: I had the unfortunate experience of staying at Parc 55 through booking a Hotwire room. Usually- I never have a problem using Hotwire. However- upon check in at Parc 55- I was informed that since I was Hotwire customer my room was not guaranteed. They said the only room they had for me was a smoking double room and it was my fault for not booking directly with the hotel. The room 818 that was given to us smelled terrible. Even the bedding smelled like smoke which made me believe that the linens were not fresh. The light switches had dirt crusted on them. The bathroom was older- the tile dirty around the tub. The staff was unfriendly. When I did call for new pillows that did not smell like smoke- they brought me towels. The entire 8th floor smelled terrible and I gagged every time I had to walk in the hall. I am sure the non smoking rooms were nice. And if you book directly with the hotel that they treat you better.. I would say it is a 3 star hotel that has seen better days. The location of the hotel was fabulous. Parking was $44. I wouldn't have stayed there if it wasn't pre-paid through Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, comfortable, good location, but falls short of top notch.”
Reviews.Author: msqinc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location that is convenient to everything. I was at a conference and made my life easy that it was with in walking distance to the center. The one day I had free I was able to walk out the front door and hop right on the cable car. The hotel was recently remodeled I was told, and in general they did a very nice job. But there were small details that were overlooked that are the difference between a good place and a really top notch place. Such as the room was very clean, the bed and bedding beautiful a nice desk and large flat panel TV. The bathroom was spacious and clean. But if you looked at the little details...the outlets were old and discolored and dirty, the frame of the mirror in the bathroom had some touch-up work done with a paint that doesn't match the frame. The patches stood out like a sore thumb. The towels were hard. There was a phone in the bathroom which was a nice touch except it looked like it was from the 70s. It looked oddly out of date. The heating/cooling was loud and didn't work very well. It was the little touches that separate a good place from a great place. Also there was no safe in the room. That being said the staff was all very nice and did their best to accommodate with the exception being that I called and asked if I could get some utensils sent to the room and it took an hour. They were very nice about it but I thought it was excessively long. The other being when I tried one night to set up a wake-up call and the front desk wasn't picking up. I let it ring over 20 times and had to call back 3 times before someone picked up. House keeping I have to say did a very nice job. When I came back to the room at the end of the day it was nicely freshened up. I had a "special rate" for the conference I was at, which looking at their current posted full rates for this week were actually higher, which of course is annoying. It was a nice place..but for the money they ask they can do better...and possibly offer a cup of coffee or light breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous location! comfortable beds! very near bart!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon1224
Reviews.Content: love this hotel! great location! very comfortable beds and large room size. Friendly staff! bart and bus lines just out the front door. great price!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: blackwrx
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I've stayed at the Parc 55 and it was as good as the first time. They have remodled the first floor since I as there last April so it just looks cleaner as you arrive. (Checkin is on the second floor) Overall the only complaint I could possibly have it that the rooms can get a little loud at times at ight due to the fact that you are in the heart of downtown. I accidently left the vent cracked on the window the first night which made it loud. Let me just say that the Parc is truly positioned perfecly to see down town. Its right across from the bart station and the cable cars and across the street is the mall. I'll be coming back here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Rebster65
Reviews.Content: This is right on top of Union Square with all of the adjoining shopping and restaurants. Its also right near the beginning of one of the cable car lines. The staff was very helpful. The hotel is pet friendly and when my wife told the desk check in person that she was sallergic to dog hair he immediately switched her to a non pet hypoallergenic room with a spectacular view. Although the hotel appears to be slanted to a business traveler it was very accomodating and welcoming to us tourists

Reviews.Title: “very modern, fantastic location and unbelievable customer service”
Reviews.Author: markoshust
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Parc55 for 4 nights for a computer convention. The stay was just great - the customer service was amazing (everywhere from the front desk to housekeeping), and the bed was so extremely comfortable. One of the huge downsides was to valet your car, it was $44/night, and there is very little public parking anywhere in the area (I would expect parking at a hotel to be free for guests). The only thing this hotel was missing was a pool. I didn't check out the gym, but my brother said that it was better than a lot of the standalone gyms he's paid for. When you walk outside, you are right in Union Square which is a great place to be in the city - tons of food everywhere, and steps away from the cable cars to get to Fisherman's Wharf. Overall, my stay was fantastic and I would stay there again - but next time I would take the subway directly to the hotel (Powell exit). I would never take a car there again, as they are really unnecessary in the bay area - and I'm a guy who loves driving. I was in a room with a view and one king bed, and the room was very big and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but cramped”
Reviews.Author: glkh
Reviews.Content: The location of Parc 55 can't be beat—just a few blocks to the Moscone Center, fabulous shopping just across the street, and plenty of good eats close to the hotel. The hotel itself is clean and the staff is friendly. The rooms are a bit cramped, ours had two full-sized beds with barely enough room to walk between the furniture—I've got bruises from trying to get past the armchairs and end table to wrestle the blackout curtains closed for the night. There is no dresser in the room to unpack in, though there were two drawers in the TV stand and two more in the night stand. I was staying at Parc 55 for a tech convention and it was one of the hotels recommended by the convention organizers. As such we were extremely frustrated that we could not maintain a solid internet connection. My fiance came with me on this trip specifically because he would be able to telecommute from the hotel, but he spent a large chunk of his work day each day of our stay on the phone with hotel tech support (who were, btw, extremely helpful and knowledgeable—not your typical tech support experience). One other thing I would note about Parc 55 is the noise level. When we checked in, among the regular in-room amenities (shampoo, shower cap, lotion, and the like ) the hotel had included ear plugs. First time I've ever seen that, but after the first night of our stay lying awake listening to panhandlers on the street (we were on the 24th floor!) and waking abruptly to garbage pick-ups and sirens I was thankful for the ear plugs and I'm not a light sleeper. Really great workout room. When we checked in, we were offered a room one or two beds. We honestly had no preference and were given a 2-bed room not knowing it would cost an extra $20 per night. We were also offered a room with a view and were not told that would be an additional $40 per night. I'm just figuring this out now as I'm looking at our bill and the room rates on the Parc 55 website. Seems a little shady to me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location -- but a couple downsides”
Reviews.Author: adasmann
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was nice. Not great --- just comfortable, clean and in a good location. I opted for a view room. The view was nice with a couple caveats. The windows were filthy which tends to spoil the view. Also, I was in a corner room section with adjoining doors (closed). I could hear everything from the adjoining room. I also found that my room on the 23rd floor had a horrible wireless connection. Since I was in town on business this was an annoying problem. I could have paid for a separate wired connection but the wireless was free as part of my conference package. So overall I'd rate the Parc 55 as average. They're food prices are outrageous although that's pretty standard in SF. Fortunately, there are lots of restaurants, coffee shops, etc. right near by.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: powerswitch
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights and loved the quality, cleanliness and decor of our 23rd floor room with stunning view over the city and bay. Excellent price at about 90 a night, probably best value in whole 10 days of US travelling. If I have any comments I'd say the sit down breakfast buffet is way overpriced and your better off to take the grab and go breakfast. Location is excellent for shopping though do watch you don't turn down one street next to hotel which i took walk thru one early morning and regretted! All staff were great, thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: LolTM
Reviews.Content: After staying in other Union Square hotels for our annual trip to the Moscone, we decided on Parc55 this year. It was a good choice - far better than previous hotels which had cost a bit more. Rooms were adequate and they still offer smoking rooms for folks like me allowing me to avoid the pan-handlers when waking at 5am due to jetlag. The bar was quite expensive and we didn't try and restaurant but in terms of location to central San Francisco, you can't really beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, modern common areas, no pool”
Reviews.Author: PLaLa
Reviews.Content: The staff was quite friendly and my hotel stay was good. My view left a bit to be desired but then again, I was away at a convention most days. I was disappointed in not having a pool but did take advantage of the exercise room. The business center was of value also. The concierge provided very good information with one exception. In directing me to the Farmer Brown restaurant by foot, he suggested that I walk the length of Mason Street. This street is not a good suggestion for a lady at night alone. It would have been better (and closer) to direct me down Market Street.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location of the Parc 55!”
Reviews.Author: Tabcolorado
Reviews.Content: This was my very first trip to San Francisco. We bid on a hotel via Priceline and ended up with the Parc 55 for only $82 per night. We took the Bart from the airport, and while we knew the hotel was just across the street, it still was a surprise how close the hotel was to the BART station. We literally walked out the door of the station and was looking straight up at the hotel. We checked in at about 9:30pm, and the very nice lady at the reception gave us a wonderful corner room on the 7th floor. The room was huge. As others have mentioned, the street noise was prevalent but luckily I'm a heavy sleeper. There are ear plugs provided in the bathrooms, in case you need it. We were there for 4 nights. We never ate in the hotel, or tried out the happy hour, club or restaurant. My husband used the fitness center - while I slept in - and said it was very satisfactory. Our bed was very, very comfortable. The location of this hotel is fantastic. A few steps away from the cable car turnaround, and all the shopping and restaurants of Union Square. We loved it, and would definitely recommend it to anyone else traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Very conveniently located.”
Reviews.Author: AtlNYTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very conveniently located. We walked to shopping, restaurants, China Town, and public transportation. We stayed on a high floor which helped to reduce the noise from the traffic outside. But we could still hear the noise. The hotel did provide ear plugs in the room. The pillows were a little too soft. The view was great but the windows were so dirty that it took away from the view. But overall it was a pleasurable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel besides the horrible room service”
Reviews.Author: msipana
Reviews.Content: I stayed that this hotel for three nights. Everything was pretty good when I got there. When I first checked in I asked if they had any rooms on a higher level and they had one. When we got to our room we found out that it was a handicap room. Neither my girlfriend or I was comfortable with that. It would have been nice if he had told us that before he gave us the room. I called front desk and they switched it. We got a room that was on a lower floor but that was ok. The last night we stayed we decided to order room service. I saw on the menu that they were going to close pretty soon. When I called down they said “its good that you called now because we were going to close. Giving me no indication that there was going to be any problem. I ordered the ceaser salad and some cheeseburger sliders. I am serious when I say it only took them from when I got off the phone to when that brought up the food less than 10mins. I just thought they had really good room service but I was wrong. It seemed like they took a half of a head of lettuce and cut it in half and put it on a plate. Now with the burger, I started to eat the burger and I noticed it was really juicy. I looked at it and the inside was RAW. I looked at the other ones and they were all raw and only cooked on the outside. I called down immediately and I was transferred over to the restaurant manager. She said she was really sorry and she would take the bill off the room. I asked if she could cook them again because I was still hungry but she said she could not. She said everything was put away and she did not know where anything was. I was not too happy about that. And yes I do have pictures The next morning when I went to check out the lady there did not seem really sorry about what had happened. I told her that I do not think I will stay at this hotel again and she said that was too bad. So just a reminder to all, if you stay at this hotel do not order room service when they are about to close because that won’t cook your food…. For the hotel manager: If you have any questions please feel free to ask

Reviews.Title: “Over rated”
Reviews.Author: MITravelerDetroit
Reviews.Content: The hotel is over rated and the pictures are not a fair example of what the hotel looks like or the rooms. Front desk staff is rude and heaven forbid you get in before 3:00. There are no rooms with queen size beds all double rooms are full size beds. Ask a question and you may just get a flyer thrown at you.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: TroubleTicket
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel in which I have stayed on any business trip. The location was great, the room was clean and modern, the staff was friendly and efficient. There was lots to see in the immediate area once the business day was done, cable car line is a block away, and we were able to walk approximately 10 blocks to the Giants game as well. I would not hesitate to stay there again, and would recommend it to friends. I thought the city was charming, although the homeless people are camped out in force and can get a bit aggressive by east coast standards. I never felt that it was unsafe, though. Overall, great trip, excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted”
Reviews.Author: Martin61Wales
Reviews.Content: All of our party were just delighted with our two-night stay at the Parc 55. The staff were extremely helpful, the rooms were very well appointed, and the location could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel,perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Beachmuse63
Reviews.Content: We were in town seeing a band and wanted a comfy hotel. Found it in the Parc 55. We drove in this time and they had a parking special price(SFO expensive to park).Never noticed the hotel before when we have been in Union Square area.Very modern and sleek inside lobby.Rooms were pretty large and bed comfy. Got a little warm at night had to turn on the air to cool it down. The gentleman in the little snack store was so charming(I needed chocolate). Only bummer was a end of stay car attendant drove husbands car like a maniac. He will not drive again there. Would stay again if we took Bart.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SLIKWILL
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 is a great place to stay. The hotel is clean with comtemporary decor. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. The room was bigger than the usual big city hotels. The restaurant has a good Happy Hour special. The location can't be beat. We have been in a few hotels in bigger cities and this one takes the cake. Everything about this hotel makes you feel comfortable. We were on the 22nd floor and the view was amazing. Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service, amenities and view”
Reviews.Author: fiddle_man
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 20th floor to minimize noise from the City. Great view of City, beautiful, clean well appointed room. Everything fresh and new, great service. We would stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: AllanMarston
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous to look at right from the first minute you enter. The staff were fantastic and if you get deal with Elmer at the front check-in desk then you are in for an even more amazing experience. The room was very well laid out and the bed was extremely comfortable. I always miss my own pillow but they had such a variety of pillows that I finally found the one that made for a great night's sleep. The convenience of being so close to everything is also fantastic. Powell Street Bart is less than a block away and the famous San Francisco Tram that takes you to Union Square, China Town and Fisherman's Wharf is also less than a block away. The San Francisco Shopping Center, the massive Forever 21 Store and if you are like my wife and are addicted to the great deals at Ross then all those are within 3 to 10 minutes walking distance. Everything about this hotel was just first class. Having stayed at The Hilton and The Palace before both of which I loved I would still have to place Parc 55 at the top of my list of hotels in San Francisco even though the Hilton has a much grander lobby. But when I was in the hotel I spent more time in my room than in the lobby so that was okay. I will be back for sure and the next time I want to try out their Pure floor to see how it helps my allergies. Thank you to the Check-Out person whose name I can't remember unfortunately who took the time to tell me all about that feature.

Reviews.Title: “The best San Francisco has to offer”
Reviews.Author: ready2fly1955
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the parc 55 just off Union Square for a long weekend. The hotel itself is SPOTLESS---big, comfy rooms, quiet, beautifully maintained. The location is the best in the city. It is LITERALLY steps from the best shopping, dining and transportation in the city. Want to ride the Powell Street Cable Car---walk one and a half blocks. BART? Ditto. Buses and trams---across the street. You are in the middle of shopping Nirvana---The Westfield Center is across the street, and the neighborhood is packed with stores. If you can't find what you want here, you'll never be satisfied. I booked with my AARP card, and got a rate that beat the government and conference rates. The staff was superb, and I'm planning a return trip there in a few months. My advice---book yourselves in here for a WONDERFUL stay. You'll leave your heart in San Francisco---at the parc 55.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It”
Reviews.Author: dvandici
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a horrible location. I would not recomment it to anyone. There are beggers and criminals right outside the front door. The hotel was just redone but it's tacky and cheap. And to top it off service is unimpressive and cold. We rarely got a smile out of any of the employees and the food was horrible. Don't event bother to step foot in this god awful shack!

Reviews.Title: “Great for groups and conferences”
Reviews.Author: csr123
Reviews.Content: Recently hosted a conference at Parc 55. Stayed there as well. The staff was excellent - very accomodating and friendly. Got lots of compliments from conference attendees on the facilities and the staff. The rooms were nice, spacious, and clean. Front desk staff - esp. Diana Lopez and Kat (?) - were great. They both worked dilligently and went above and beyond to help me with a problem charge on my credit card (no fault of the hotel). Would definitely stay and/or host an event here again!

Reviews.Title: “Double Check your Bill”
Reviews.Author: aussiefaraday
Reviews.Content: This was the most amazing 5 star hotel, and probably the one I will compare all others for the rest of my days. The bed was so comfortable, my husband was reluctant to leave to go sight seeing around the city. After 'roughing it' for a week in another city, this was the perfect hotel for sheer luxury. However the experience was spoiled by some incredible charges on our bill. It seems far too many people linger around the hotel, and we found over $200 in meals charged back to our room that we did not eat. Turns out (after much investigation of receipts) that someone must have misheard our surname, and saw us going into our room (we were on the floor with the gym). Only the fact they misheard, and thus misspelled our names on the dockets made them suspicious. We certainly didn't eat 3 times at the same restaurant in the one night. Better yet, just tell the staff to not allow any charges back to the room, and this problem will go away. A great facility, however, and I would go back again (but with a bit more caution about the people loitering around). The concierge even arranged a stretch limo to the international airport as we left - a beautiful way to end a trip to the USA!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RunnerGirlOH
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in March. Location is terrific, cable car, buses and BART are 1/2 block from hotel. Easy to get around the city to anywhere from the hotel. You can also walk to Union Square and Chinatown (if you are up to the hills). The hotel is average, I would rate it a low-end 4 star. Nothing "wow" about the rooms or the hotel overall. It is a good place to lay your head. It had all the basic amenities and the health club had a good number of machines. The price is hard to beat in SF. I liked the location, but would probably try a different hotel on my next visit that is a more solid 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for shopping, sightseeing and relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Travelingtwin
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a very relaxing couple of days in San Francisco at the Parc 55 and can't say enough about the hotel! We had a room with fabulous views on the 26th floor, it was quiet and serene inside the room and close to everything you would want to see in San Francisco! The bed was comfortable, room large as well as a well appointed bathroom. The only problem was the shower/tub combination was malfunctioning and it was reported at check out - couldn't take a shower the day of check out! Otherwise, would highly recommend the hotel for friendly staff, great location and comfy rooms...we'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: flargh
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Parc 55 before when it was still a Renaissance hotel. Since then it's undergone a management change and a renovation, particularly to its lobby and registration area. The rooms are comfortable and roomy, the service is top-notch and the restaurant and lounge area offer a nice place to meet and socialize during the evening. Met several friends and business colleagues there during my week-long stay, always pleased with the service and attention. Really, I only had one annoyance during the entire week, and it's a relatively minor one: the cost of Wi-Fi Internet access, and its relatively limited bandwidth (had trouble downloading some files I needed for work because access was rather slow for file transfers, for some reason).

Reviews.Title: “Great location,nice stay”
Reviews.Author: mountainportal
Reviews.Content: Near the famous shopping at Union Square this modern hotel is a perfect location. Often they have special deals making it a good choice. Nice rooms a solid 3 - 4 star property. We found it to be quite a bit less expensive then the Nikko Hotel that is across the street and almost as nice as the Nikko.

Reviews.Title: “parc 55 is cut above”
Reviews.Author: solotrips
Reviews.Content: parc 55 is cut above. I had a great stay for 10 nights at Parc 55. The staff was outstanding and fulfilled every request with a smile. Will definately stay again in S.F.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from Parc 55! Valet caused my car windshield to be bashed in! i've uploaded photos to substantiate this”
Reviews.Author: shirroo
Reviews.Content: rooms (good): clean, exactly as pictured in photos from hotel site, bathroom nice as well. walls were not super thin, so noise wasn't an issue. price (good): one of the better bang for your buck hotels. our stay was about $130 per night. location (great): cant beat the location. a couple minutes walk to union square and right across the street from bart station. service (bad): not a single, genuine smile from check in to check out. parking (horrible): $40/night. no self park, valet only. and this is where the trip went horribly wrong. after checking out, we waited for valet to bring our car (from what we later found out is a remote parking lot about 2-3 blocks away). we see our car finally, and the *WINDSHIELD HAS BEEN BASHED IN!* the valet driver rushes past us without saying a single word and talks to the valet manager, who says, "are you [--] me?" this is where it gets good... the driver claimed that 2 pedestrians were arguing near our car when one of the guys turned around, hit our car with his FIST, cracked the windshield, and then ran off. SERIOUSLY??? that's the best story you could come up within 3 blocks worth of time? my take is that the valet driver probably almost ran someone over and didnt want to tell the truth in fear of the consequences... and come on, no windshield could be smashed the way ours was with someone's hand without flesh bits and blood smeared all over our car. the police came and filed a report, and even they did not believe the guy. "why didnt you call us at the time of the incident?" they asked him. he gave no real response. these valet drivers have been trained to have a police report done ANY TIME there's an incident, so this driver's failure to abide company policy was quite suspicious to me. but i thot, "whatever. as long as they can fix this situation and reimburse us, i'll let bygones be bygones." boy was i wrong... management (atrocious): i informed the valet manager that we expected to be reimbursed for the costs of windshield reparation and that i wanted a refund for my night's stay as compensation for the inconvenience of this whole ordeal. he said that he would have to talk to the hotel manager about this. fine. 45 minutes later, the hotel manager came up to me and said, "so i hear you expect a refund." WOW no introductions, no apology, no explanation.. nothing. she claims that the hotel should not be responsible for the actions of its valet department... ooo-kayy. and the timeline for reimbursement for the windshield supposedly is indefinite as such claims are in yet another department that is third party. allllrighty then. conclusion: so it's been about 4 months and about 20 phone calls had been made harassing management for reimbursement since the incident. the check for windshield reimbursement finally arrived and cleared a couple days ago. so the last thing i must do to FULLY right this wrong is to write a horrible review of the hotel. PARC 55 IS HORRIBLE AND HAS NO SENSE OF HOW TO DO BUSINESS AT ALL. if you do decide to stay here, god help you. pray every night that nothing bad happens, because if it does they will do close to nothing to justify the wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place!”
Reviews.Author: LandonAuger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc55 for 3 nights. HUGE benefits to this hotel is that the BART train is only a couple hundred feet from the hotel and the Trolly is only about half a block. The Hertz only being about 2 blocks away is also very convenient. The hotel itself was very nice. There's a ton of elevators to waiting for one isn't a big issue. The Fitness Room is well stocked with treadmills. ellipticals, free weights and pretty much every type of weight lifting machine there is. Overall it is a very nice place!

Reviews.Title: “No requests please!”
Reviews.Author: GuptaDebjani
Reviews.Content: If the reservation services can be ignored, Parc 55 hotel is comfortable to stay with nicely appointed rooms and a great location. Its a stone's throw from the market street with resturants of all kinds of cusines surrounding the hotel and a short walk from the Union Square. Stayed at the Parc 55 for 5 days between Feb 28 - Mar 5, while attending a conference at SF. While booking the room I had requested for rooms at higher floors and a late checkout. Was amazed to note that none of the requests were taken into consideration during my stay. When I went to the reception desk personally on the day of the check out to request extension of my checkout time for a couple of hours, after some consideration I was given an hour extension. Quite disappointing to say the least. Will probably recommend this hotel but with a word about the reservation desk to others.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis!”
Reviews.Author: Nature4
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our 2nd stay @ the Parc 55, I probably will never stay anywhere else. Top notch service, they put us on the 32nd floor upon hearing we were there for our sons birthday. Beautiful rooms with views, did we hear stuff in the middle of the night?? Sure we did, it's San Francisco baby!!! But we were snug in our very comfy beds with beautiful views. The accomidations were luxurious, took a bath in the oversize deep tub, utilized the complimentary robes. Took most of our meals take out just so we go enjoy our room. Can't wait to go back, hopefully in June for my b-day!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, A bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: TX_Flyer001
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location with lots of retail and food close to it. Access to Bart is very easy as well. The rooms are clean and spacious. The only issue is noise, I can here street noise from the 15th floor. Also the housekeeper is vacuuming outside in the hall at 10pm tonight for some unknown reason. They have free earplugs in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Night & Day”
Reviews.Author: kendrick
Reviews.Content: That was the difference between the 2 rooms I had at Parc 55. As others have said, this is a wonderfully-located hotel, close to great shopping, food & the Powell St. Cable Car stop as well as the BART and Muni station. The first night I was given a room which was on a lower floor in this odd little cul-de-sac, I say odd because there was a large pole in the middle of it, making it impossible to see if anyone was behind there. It was kind of nerve-wracking as a solo female traveler. The room itself was gorgeous - it was an updated king and the beautifully appointed, the view was nothing to look at. The bathroom was oddly configured with a lot of wasted space - the towel rack was over the toilet, at least 6 or 7 feet from the tub and no hook near the tub on which to leave your towel. Huge, flat screen HD tv, not many options in terms of channel selection (I know, they want you to pay for the extras) The room was above a busy street and it was unbelievably noisy - I stayed on Bourbon St. during LSU football season and had quieter nights - someone was loading case after case of glass bottles onto a truck at midnight, bar revelers at 2; dumpster trucks at 5 - and did I mention that people were yelling in the hall in between? I called the front desk and asked to be moved for the second night. They could not have been more gracious or accomodating. I was given a room on a top floor and was able to move up early on Sat. morning. The room and bath were not updated, but the view of San Francisco bay and the blissful quiet was more than worth it. Staff throughout were warm and helpful. If you go, make sure to ask for a quiet room!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cewm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Parc 55 for a couple of nights. It was the last two nights of a honey moon trip to California. The location is great, near everything (Union Square, Shopping Mall, restaurants, cable car, etc.). Unfortunately, rooms in front of Market Street (my case) are noisy during the whole day. When I first arrived, there was nobody to help me with the luggage (did everything by myself, 4 large suitcases). Check in and check out was quick enough. The rooms are outdated and need some refreshment. They are ok, but i think I could get better places to stay for the same price and at the same region. Definitively not a 4 star hotel as some websites claim.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in union square-close to everything”
Reviews.Author: daisyi295
Reviews.Content: very accessible to all the fun things in san fran. We had a great view-I suggest you request a high up room. It was quiet and the bed was very comfortable! I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Aspen82
Reviews.Content: If you are going to San Francisco and want to be near all the sights, stay at the Parc 55 Hotel. The hotel is in excellent condition, the rooms are very clean and quiet, the lobby and bar area are very modern and trendy. The location is right off of Market Street. If you take BART from the airport and get off at Powell Street, you will be right at the front door. There is a ton of shopping and excellent restaurants in the Union Square area. The cable car and street cars stop right next to the hotel for easy access to the rest of the city. This is a great home base and a very comfortable place to come back to. The views from the rooms are unmatchable. I highly recommend Dottie's True Blue Cafe for breakfast (just around the corner from the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 is in the heart of it all...”
Reviews.Author: Gettin_My_Travel_On
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of downtown, totally accessable to all public transportation, the mall,cable cars, you name it. We had a corner room on the 29th floor and could see the bay and the cith thanks to the 3 huge bay windows in our room.. Nice staff, really reasonable rates as well... This was a very good choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: newstead5
Reviews.Content: When arriving at the hotel by taxi our bags were taken for us and we were shown where reception was. Quicky checked in by a very friendly woman and about 2/3mins in the room our bags arrived. Very clean, very friendly and an excellent location. Right on Market Street where the trams, buses and cable buses which are really easy to get use to get around. Buy a 3 day pass for $20 in stead of a day pass which saves you a few pounds. China Town was a amazing, food great adn people so friendly. Mosty of the museams are free and the locals are very proud of thier city - when on the trams and they see you are visiting they will tell you where to go and what to do. The hotel though was so central and I didnt use the safe and still left me passport and moey arounbd in the room with no worries. If i go again to San Fran this is where i will stay.

Reviews.Title: “sadly lower class that it appears”
Reviews.Author: WinstonK
Reviews.Content: On the surface this seems like a nice hotel. Unfortunately, they have little respect for their guests. We booked a stay for three nights but stayed with friends the second night. We returned to find they gave our room away only when our keys did not work. After some pointless negotiation, we got a lower quality room for the remaining night of our prepaid reservation. In the mean time, our cell phone was taken from the car during valet parking. It remained missing until we returned home and agreed to pay for shipping. It was shipped only after the memory card was stolen out of it. This hotel may seem cosmopolitan on the surface but is low class at the core. Do not trust or believe the condescending attempts to make you feel comfortable. It is nothing more than a snake oil con.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel, hate the parking rate.”
Reviews.Author: breedean
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel several times and we love that it is close to great shopping, restaurants, and BART. We love the rooms (comfortable, great views, clean). We do not love the parking rate which is $44 a night, PLUS a $6 parking tax fee. Seriously? A parking tax fee? Unbelievable! Two blocks up we can park our car for less than $25 a night but we shouldn't have to do that. You should be able to park at your hotel! To top it off, you may have to wait 20 minutes to get your car or 30 minutes for a valet. A hotel that is this nice and expensive should have enough staff to be Johnny on the spot. It really ticks me off. As much as I love certain things about it, I'm going to try a new place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SFVguy
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by my recent stay. Although the parking fees are outrageous, the location is great and the room was very comfortable. There is some noise that filters in from the street, but hey, you're on one of the busiest intersections in SFO. I have only a few suggestions: toiletries made in China? Can't you do better than that? How about some Aveda or something that would be 4 star quality? And offering bottled water for $4.50 is tacky. You should have a couple of FREE bottles of water for your guests. And as previous reviewers have stated, a refer would be nice. Other than that the quality was very good.

Reviews.Title: “It's a great hotel, but they overbooked this time.”
Reviews.Author: neyugnanit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Parc 55 for the first time last March. It was great. The walls were kind of thin, but that's ok. We got a free upgrade & got a corner room. The view was lovely. For our recent visit (we celebrated Valentine's Day on the 13th), unfortunately the hotel was overbooked. Luckily, they had other options for us, so we decided to stay at the San Francisco Marriott instead of The Palace Hotel since our car was parked closer to it. The person that helped me at the front desk mentioned that we were helping them out a lot. Unfortunately, it was an inconvenience for us since we parked our car somewhere else & we were not given anything for it (such as an upgrade or free internet access). I understand that the Marriott was helping out Parc 55, but it would have been nice if Parc 55 gave us something for the inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Breath Taking”
Reviews.Author: Blessed312
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Parc 55 for our 22nd years of marriage and we could not have stayed at a better place in the world. Thank you Daniel for honoring my request it was more than I expected. My room was on the 27th floor and we had beautiful views of the city. I thought the staff was mistaking me as a celebrity because they were treating me so special until I saw how they were treating the rest of the guest (the same) The staff are so nice and helpful. I am a first timer in san franscio and all the questions I needed answered, were answered right at the hotel. I know some people mentioned the homeless outside of the hotel, if that's a discourgement for anyone reading this, they may not want to go to san franscio because they are every where. They are no problem. This was a great hotel and the staff are excellent I met a guy at burger king and he was smiling and speaking to me and when I returned to the hotel he was a hotel staff. The staff of Parc 55 are nice even when they are not at work. Thanks Drew and to the others that I did not get their names you guys keep up the good work. Oh yeah the only thing I did not like about my stay was "LEAVING" Hey I got to go now because I need to book my next stay at Parc 55.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here next year - fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: COOPSADELAIDE
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our three teenage children and booked by previous recommendations from Trip Advisor. Fantastic, right next door to the Bart so we caught train from airport...easy as. Hotel staff sensational, great bar downstairs. We paid the little extra and booked the executive rooms it was great to get the extra service and private breakfast etc. Location, couldn't fault, close to trolley cars, cable cars, shops everything. Only 10-15mins by trolley car to fishermans wharf. Excellent value and will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Less Than enjoyable visit.”
Reviews.Author: hagadizzle
Reviews.Content: I was kinda skeptical of the hotel when pulling up in the taxi, it looks quite a bit older, but once inside the hotel has been beautifuly renovated with a great attention to detail and modernized accents. The price for the room was actually not to bad at all for the hotel type. My room was on the 18th floor in a corner view room, it was nice the bed was decent not the most comfortable, but the thing that caught my attention was the Ear plugs that are provided on the bathroom counter i just thought they were for picky guests. That night i soon realized why the yellow ear plugs are put in the room. I was 18 floors up and it sounded like my bed was on the shoulder of the freeway with firetrucks driving by every 10min or so, i used the ear plugs all 4 nights. On saturday night i was woke by the fire alarm going off, so i got dressed and went into the hall and asked an emploee if there was a fire they said they werent sure and to go back to my room!? not the most safety conscious hotel after this incident i had a drunk guy knocking on my door half naked for 15min until security finally came up after the 3rd phone call to the front desk, worst hotel experience i have ever had. Bar is nice though, drinks wayyy over priced. Oh and house keeping cleans rooms at 10pm?

Reviews.Title: “"Fantastic"”
Reviews.Author: video4all
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at Parc 55. The place to stay if you're in San Francisco. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “SalesForce Conference”
Reviews.Author: bauso1
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! Property Location, Staff and Accomodations of a five star hotel for the price of a three star. Highly recommend this hotel for both pleasure and business.

Reviews.Title: “Please do yourself a favor and AVOID Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: ruberman
Reviews.Content: If you like rude service, paper thin walls, being put in harms way and having your car damaged then by all means stay at Parc 55. We arrived to find that in order for hotel guests to park you must fork over $60.00. Must be some of the most expensive overnight parking in all of San Francisco. We booked our room weeks in advance only to arrive on the day of check in at 5:30 pm and were told our room wasn't ready by a VERY rude desk clerk. He places us in another room and told us that there weren't any king beds in the entire hotel. We went to "our" room only to find that the desk clerk gave us the keys to an already occupied room, needless to say we were all horrified to walk into someone else's room, a complete violation of customer safety and privacy. After informing the desk clerk of his mistake he rolled his eyes at me and acted like it was no big deal. We spoke with another desk clerk and what do you know we get a room with a king bed.(The ones that apparently didn't exist only 15 mins ago.) We couldn't sleep at all because the hotel is made out of paper. We could here every single noise from the streets below to the rooms on all sides and we were 25 stories up! and yet could hear conversations on the street like they were in the room with us. To top off the already less than satisfactory experience I got my car from the valet only to find that they damaged my brand new car's paint job. Yep, that's right, rude service, given an occupied room and they damaged my brand new car that I paid $60.00 to park. I have been getting the run around from Parc 55 ever since and I am just sick of it. I think the hotel depends on tourist staying at the hotel because it looks nice and they don't know any better. I for one hope that anyone even considering staying at this hotel checks this review and reconsiders. DONT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, front desk "Surrogates"”
Reviews.Author: Tschaller
Reviews.Content: Two nights at Parc 55: great rate on Priceline at $66/night; Negatives:front desk service was lacking and impersonal in this four diamond-awarded hotel. Great example of you usually get what you pay for on Priceline and a 4-star hotel really means top 25% of hotels in the area selected. Positives: very clean, fast room service response and business center staff terrific. Also, if you're looking to be in the middle of all that downtown San Francisco has to offer this hotel's for you.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice, glad we didn't pay too much though...”
Reviews.Author: LEBG
Reviews.Content: Thankfully we booked through priceline, so we got really good rates. I would have been disappointed if we'd paid their website price though. Rooms are nice, but very basic. The lobby is really nice, however staff aren't exactly what I'd regard as friendly! Parc 55 is in an excellent position, - shoppers dream position really, also so close to Powell st Tram and BART. There are lots of restaurants and cafes in the neighouring streets. Overall the hotel is nice, however nothing special. It's location is it's strong point.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but drop it in a different neighborhood and it would be better”
Reviews.Author: Lorenti912
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Priceline.com; it came up as a 4 star. While the hotel itself was very nice and clean, I do have a few gripes: 1) The noise. We were on a corner room facing a building construction site and they started at 6:30 to 7 am daily. GOOD MORNING! You could hear the machinery, the yelling, the banging. I should have known when I saw the earplugs on the tray in the bathroom with the soaps and shampoo. 2) The neighborhood. It is right on the cusp of a great shopping district and homeless squalor. We walked to a restaurant northwest of the hotel one night and we passed no less than 4 homeless shelters. While I understand it is a major issue in San Fran, we were really surrounded by it at this hotel. I lived in NYC for 7 years and I was uncomfortable walking to this restaurant. At night? Forget it, take a cab. However, the rooms were clean, roomy and nicely decorated. So there were pluses, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: JRwisconsin
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying the second of two weeks at this hotel. We have a wonderful large room with two bay windows overlooking a great view, on the 19th floor. The king bed is heavenly with very high count sheets, good pillows and terrific mattress. We had no problem with noise at all. No complaints, although a frig might be nice and a table with chairs to eat at for such a long stay could easily be added to a room of this size. Staff have all been pleasant and helpful. Would stay again in a flash. Location is also very convenient, near both BART, the cable car and all Market Street Muni transport. Nice walk to the Ferry building at the bottom of market. Do have oysters at the Hog Island Oyster bar at their 5 pm happy hour. Buy picnic supplies at Cowgirls Creamery. What a nice hotel in a super city.

Reviews.Title: “Location cannot be beat, but beds and pillows were poor”
Reviews.Author: jvg62
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week in January for a business trip. I checked with several hotels before arriving and felt this one offered the best value. Overall, the value as rated above was very good. The best thing about this hotel is the location. You are a block from all BART, MUNI, and cable cars. There are a hundred restaurants within blocks of this hotel and you can shop for anything you want within a few blocks also. This hotel does border the shady Tenderloin district, so make sure you know which direction to walk when you leave the hotel in the evenings and you will be fine. I stayed on a higher floor and you should consider this as the noise in the area is quite loud at times. I imagine the noise on the lower levels must be borderline intolerable (from constant sirens, etc., not clubs and such). I enjoyed the free breakfast on the 31st floor during the week. I wish it was also available on the weekends, but not a major issue. Most of the staff was friendly and helpful enough, however one of the concierge's (I cannot recall his name) seemed quite aloof. Twice I asked for something specific and he directed me to something that did not match what I was asking for. He didn't take much time to explain things either. The beds and pillows were way too "Super 8" for my tastes. Very, very uncomfortable. You would expect more from a $200+ per night hotel. You are paying for location here, nothing else. There is no refrigerator in the room either, which for a week long stay was a big pain.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A FIND IN DOWNTOWN!”
Reviews.Author: theallens04
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself, and 7 month old stayed at the Parc 55 during New Year's Eve. We were worried about the noise since we were traveling with our little one, but it wasn't a problem at all. We were on the 22nd floor with a beautiful view of the city. You can not beat the location! Across the street from the SF shopping center..you are in the middle of it all. DOn't bother renting a car..public transportation is great in SF. We have tried many hotels in SF since SF is one of our favorite cities to visit, but the Parc 55 takes our number 1 slot! Staff is very friendly too!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view from our room, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: travelmikestlouis
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at the Parc 55 for five nights. We were on the 26th floor and had beautiful views of the city. The location was fantastic, we walked everywhere. Great shopping, restaurants and site seeing. The staff was friendly and helpful. Making car rental arrangements for a day to Wine Country. Two places we enjoyed for breakfast at good prices were Tad's Steak House and Lefty O'Douls. Lefty O'Doul's also has menu or buffet meals at good prices, as well and a very friendly neighborhood pub with a piano bar. Fun place! I had read that the homeless hung out around the Parc 55, but we didn't experience any near the hotel. We also didn't encounter any aggressive homeless on our ventures. We had room service twice and the service was prompt and good food. If you love burgers like we do, don't miss the Burger Bar at Macy's. Alcatraz tour is well worth the trip. We took the evening tour which was alot of fun. The hop on hop off buses are great for getting your bearings and where you want to site see. We chose the SF City Sightseeing bus and thought we had good service from the drivers and tour guides. The only downside that we experienced at the Parc 55, we felt the bath amenities were inferior and none of the computers worked in the business center. Which was frustrating when we wanted to check flights and print boarding passes and check e-mail. Overall, wonderful experience and will plan our next trip to SF to stay at the Parc 55 and will recommend to friends. I booked through booking.com and thought the price was a good value for the type and location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean spacious comfortable an excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: DorsetArk
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in mid December on special pre booked budget rate. Very impressed by easy access to airport and the courtesy of front desk staff , the cleanliness and spaciousness of the room and most of all by location so close to the central shopping district

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Clean and Comfortable business hotel”
Reviews.Author: ningen
Reviews.Content: I managed to get 2 rooms in this hotel for $95 each on priceline.com. We like the location and how close everything is to the hotel. Everything is clean and functional in the hotel. I noticed a 4 diamonds award they proudly display in the hotel lobby. However, the staffs are not interested in their customers who don't wear a suit. Seems like they welcome business travellers who travel solo more than family of 4 who travel with old parents. I understand that this is not Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton, so I didn't set a high expectation. There was a big crowd that came for the Fancy Food Show due to the fact that its just a few blocks from the moscone center. I was surprised it wasn't unusually loud with obnoscious people all around. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were not offered help with our luggages at the lobby. They prefer to stand around and chat and choose to ignore us. We don't have a lot to carry so its fine. Check in counter was very busy, the girl helping us was friendly. We got into our room and was relief that it was at least nice and clean, not as bad as some of what was described in the other reviews. Perhaps because we got the rooms cheap, our views werent that great we were looking into the windows of the next building. Thats ok, becuase we only spent the morning getting ready and came back late. We didnt check out the restaurant in the hotel. Fifth Floor in Palomar was great. Ruth Chirs in town was great. I forgot the name of the restaurant in the Westfield mall. They have pretty decent dinner too. Overall the stay is not too bad. I wont say its over the top. But I do get what I paid for. So I am pretty happy. Despite the fact that Internet connection is not working the time I was staying here... Jan 15 - Jan 19

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BinzAustralia
Reviews.Content: After considerable consultation with TripAdvisor reviews, we decided to try Parc 55. We were very happy with our experience. We checked in on 31 Oct and were met at reception with staff dressed up for Halloween. Prompt and efficient service. The room was pleasantly clean, and did not smell. We also discovered that the small vents at the bottom of the windows could be closed to minimise the noise from the street. Restaurant staff for breakfast were friendly and helpful, and as we stayed 7 days, the regular restaurant staff recognised you, and remembered your specific requirements. Parking valet was ok, but if you want to have your car ready by the time you get to the valet, give them a call about 15 mins prior. Great location, as already mentioned by other reviewers.
