We had some products sent to the hotel, as we are from Australia, and one did not arrive in time, but the service and follow-up provided was excellent, and we did receive our package duly forwarded to Australia - great service, thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniet, courteous, and clean.”
Reviews.Author: SBurnsey
Reviews.Content: As first time travelers to SF we found the Parc 55 to be a fine base to explore the city. All reviews prior to this have pretty much summed up what you get. I tend to disagree with the reviews about noise. We found our 19th floor room with guests on both sides to be quiet. TIP: There are small flip up vents below the windows. When open they allow in plenty of city noise, but also nice fresh air. Keep these closed and you might hear a siren from time to time. I rise early and shower. The shower cannot be heard in the room and will not disturb sleeping family. You cannot hear other guests running water for showers. Hallway noise never intruded into room. We were right around corner from elevators and never heard them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with minimalist approach, but some minor service concerns”
Reviews.Author: Unbiased&FairAdvisor
Reviews.Content: First timer to the PARC 55, with some basic expectations of good hotel. Somewhat met expectations, but some caveats for you: LOCATION: Very convenient walk to tourists' heaven = On the outer edge of Union Square shopping and very close to Market St (street trams) & Westfield Shopping mall, as well as Powell St Cable Car terminus. Plenty of restaurants in the area. It is also however, on the edge of the Tenderloin district ... which can be gritty and touch-n-go at night especially. Hold onto your wallets and children! (I exaggerate a little) ROOM: Spacious, clean and comfortable, but minimalist approach. Some background: Asked for a corner room, which with some additional 'nudging' we finally received from a somewhat reluctant, unsmiling front desk. Probably didn't help that I booked thru Hotwire at low rate for SF. When asked a second front desk person to see if can change room to higher floor facing away from Market St (due to some street noise), was only offered lower floors ... again, probably due to rate. Went with original. The room was on 13th floor, overlooking Market St. Room included a full-sleeper sofa with coffee table, desk & chair, flat-screen TV with connection panel (remote was worn out with no #s on many keys), and king bed. NO SAFE in room, and no minibar/fridge, but coffee-maker was available. Toiletries provided were tiny, used up very quickly ... not even enough for one person, esp. body-wash, shampoo ... bring your own or need to ask for more! Decor was basic. Bed was comfortable, though mattress a tad hard. Couch was comfortable for 2 sitting. Sink drain was plugged up, and could not raise stopper, so water filled sink quickly ... though did go down slowly .... DECOR: Lobby had a large set of stairs and escalators to 2nd level registration/front desk, but just 4 chairs for guests for such a large area. Front desk area had a small semi-couch, and then it was bar/restaurant. No decor, colors ... drab ... almost sterile and uninviting. SERVICE: Very disinterested staff at front desk, from check-in to check-out. It wasn't that busy, so not sure why not friendlier, welcoming ... maybe us? but same to others. Did not use valet, bellhop, room service, gym/spa ... so cannot assess. OVERALL: We would have rated it 3.5 stars/circles instead of 4 if available. Would we stay here again? Maybe, on the likely side. Depends on rate. If you're looking for a relatively comfortable, somewhat basic hotel, close to many conveniences (i.e.-Cable Car, shopping, BART, restaurants, etc.), this will do. Our suggestion: request a corner room, highest possible. Street noise not an issue, but we're from a large city .. so, no biggie. Curiously, the toiletries included ear plugs... prob for country folk not used to big city noise. Hope this review helps !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: circumventor
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Nicely renovated room, very comfortable, great bed. We encountered some of the nicest staff in the restaurant, lounge and on checking in and out that we have ever come across. Would definitely book the Parc55 again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location; an awesome choice!”
Reviews.Author: BlooBunnie
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Parc 55 from December 28 to January 2, 2010 to celebrate New Years and the anniversary of our engagement. We decided before the trip that instead of taking a taxi, we would take the BART. It was more than half the price cab fare would have been and it was fast, easy to use, comfortable and convenient. We noticed that a lot of other travelers were also using the BART. If you take the BART to the Powell Street station, the hotel is just across the street. It doesn't get more convenient than that. Check-in at the hotel was a breeze. Mavis helped us with our room and she was very friendly and chatted with us about our stay. She put us in a corner room on the 17th floor with lovely views of the City through the two large windows on two sides of the room. The room was spacious with a large bathroom, closet with an alcove for your luggage, large flat screen TV, writing table, coffee table, and couch. The bed was very comfortable and after long days spent walking around town, it felt really good to sleep on such a comfortable mattress. The shower was very good too with a massaging shower head and plenty of hot water. The room was always kept in excellent condition by the cleaning staff. At night there was street noise like police sirens and car horns honking but it was never so bad that you couldn't fall asleep. It was more like background noise than anything else and didn't have any negative impact on our trip. The hotel was very modern looking, clean and impressive. The elevators were always very fast and you never had to wait long for one. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is close to everything - BART, Municipal transportation, cable cars, shopping (Nordstrom, Macy's, Neiman Marcus, Tiffany, Bloomingdale's ... just to name a few) and restaurants. Everything is just steps from the hotel which made the location ideal. We went to see "Wicked!" our second night there. During the daytime, we had walked to the theatre to see how far it was from the hotel It was a bit of a walk and we wouldn't have minded walking there to see the show but we noticed that along the way, there were many (and by many I mean A LOT) of homeless people and people smoking pot. For some reason the theatre is located in a very shady neighborhood. This is coming from someone who lives in New York City and sees shady people on a normal basis and thinks nothing of it but what we saw there took it to another level. In fact, there wasn't a single day where we didn't smell someone smoking pot or where we weren't standing near someone who reeked of it. It was nasty. Also, we've never seen such a concentrated mass of homeless people anywhere either. Anyway, not too many of them approached us or bothered us but a word of advice would be to take the BART from the hotel one stop to the Civic Center and get to the theatre that way. That's what we did and that's what many other theatre goers did as well. It's cheap, fast and safe. If you plan on going to Alcatraz and booked tickets, you can go right onto Market Street by the hotel and take the F-line Streetcar right to Pier 33 where the ferry to Alcatraz is located. When you get back from Alcatraz, you can take a short walk to Pier 39 (Fisherman's Wharf). There you can find shopping and a whole lot of restaurants. Then when you're done, just take the F-line Streetcar back to the hotel. If you plan on going to the Golden Gate Bridge, you can take the Municipal Bus there and just ask your bus driver for a transfer ticket although they really do automatically give you one. The transfer ticket is good for a few hours so you can hop on and off buses until it runs out. Not bad for two dollars. You'll need to take the 45 bus (we hopped on while in Chinatown) to Chestnut and Laguna and then get off and transfer to the 28 bus. The 28 bus will drop you off a few steps from the Golden Gate Bridge. That's what we did and it was pretty easy and convenient. We walked part of the bridge until it started to rain and we had to turn back. When going back, be aware that there are two 28 buses that stop there. You need to make sure you get on the 28 bus headed to Fort Mason and not the one headed to Daly City. The Fort Mason 28 bus will bring you back to Chestnut and Laguna where you can get off and transfer back to the 45 bus. As for food, we didn't have the best of luck finding good food while in town. We ate at a Chinese place by the hotel called Tian Sing. It was the most expensive dim sum I ever ate in my life! We had one plate of vegetable lo mein and about 6 different dim sum and a pot of tea and it cost us about forty-five dollars! I almost fainted. In NYC that would have cost us like $20 maybe. So yeah we wouldn't recommend eating there. We also wouldn't recommend Blondie's Pizza. Being from NYC, we know what good pizza is and Blondie's was inedible. It was too doughy and had practically zero tomato sauce. We had pizza another night (because nothing else was open) from Pizza Prada and that was much better. It wasn't too doughy and had a decent amount of sauce. I know this is going to sound absolutely insane but it's so true ... the BEST pizza was at the airport! I swear to you. It was from Firewood Pizza and it was amazing. They make it fresh to order and it was like brick oven pizza with a thin, but not too thin, crackly crust, a flavorful generous heaping of sauce, mozzarella and fresh sliced tomatoes with basil. I know ... the airport?! But yes ... the airport. Crazy but true and trust me ... you have to try it! Okay so back to town. We also ate at the hotel's Thai restaurant (Siam Thai) twice. The food was good but sometimes they could have used some more spice or something to make the food more flavorful. They could have also used more sauce in their pad thai because it was too dry. We ate at Boudin Bakery where we both had bread bowls filled with soup. One word - Amazing. The bread is fresh, flavorful and so good and the soup was just delicious. My fiance had the clam chowder and I had the rustic tomato. If you're going to eat anywhere, we positively recommend Boudin Bakery. They have a location at Fisherman's Wharf and another location bu Ghirardelli Square. There was also a location by the hotel and on Friday night we wanted to eat there so badly but when we got there at 7:00 it was closed and we were so devastated and that's when we went to Pizza Prada. We also ate at Bellini and had the bruschetta, garlic bread and the capellini pomodoro. The food there was really good and was actually much better than I thought it would be. We wanted to see the sea lions but while we were there, reports on the news stated that the sea lions were gone and that scientists believed that they left due to the dwindling food supply. In the end, we would definitely recommend the Parc 55 Hotel. It was a wonderful hotel in the middle of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great in many ways, but missing some standard (and necessary) amenities”
Reviews.Author: dbsccp
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD: Spectacular location, central to virtually everything (including many transportation options). Impeccably clean. Hip and modern, but still very comfortable. Extremely reasonable pricing. THE BAD: The rooms are somewhat small, but that's not unusual for San Francisco. What was most surprising (and disappointing) to me was that our room had no fridge/mini-bar, and no safe. The lack of a fridge meant that leftovers from SF's great restaurants basically had to be trashed. More troubling was the lack of a safe. Because of that, we simply left our "privacy" sign on the door for the 3 days we were there. That worked out fine, but it would've been nice to have been able to get our room cleaned and been secure in the knowledge that our valuables were locked away. Overall, though, a great, central, hip, cost-effective option in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location near Union Sq, but terrible service and management”
Reviews.Author: mallen90274
Reviews.Content: I booked a Club Floor on Expedia, however, when I checked in, which took over 30 minutes given the lack reservation attendants and large line of guests waiting, I could not access the Club Floor. After spending a half hour calling the front desk, operator, and concierge, without getting a response, I just gave up. I left a complaint with management but given my experience during my stay, the hotel does not care about customer service. All that said, book it for the location for a steep discount, otherwise, I suggest staying at the Intercontinental in SOMA or Grand Hyatt near Union Sq for the same cost if available.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, fabulous staff, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: 40andFabulous2010
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 is an incredible hotel for the value. Very friendly staff. We stayed in the renovated king size bed room. Nice, clean and roomy room. Bed was a little hard. My biggest complaint would be the price to park at the hotel as a guest. You pay the same price as a non-guest would. The cost is much to high for parking. Parking cost us 50% of what we payed for our room. Please check all parking fees before you book any hotels in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “San Fran”
Reviews.Author: KevinS2
Reviews.Content: Good location and reasonably priced. Rooms were well maintained. Cost of parking was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location Near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Never Too Old to Travel
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews, I reserved a room in the Club Level (Floors 27-32) at this hotel. It was a wonderful room with a 180 Degree view of the Bay and the city. The location was perfect for us as we were right on the bus line at Powell & Market and right across the street from the Nordstrom (Westfield) Mall and only 4 blocks from Union Square. The staff was the friendliest I have ever experienced to include the housekeepers, the wait staff, the concierge and front desk staff. The 2 night trip couldn't have been nicer. The hotel is very contemporary inside with stark, minimalist decor. The Bed and Breakfast package we booked included a plentiful morning buffet breakfast and as a club member we had access to the club on the 31st floor where appetizers, desserts and drinks (and honors bar) were served from 5pm to 11pm Sunday - Thursday. A continental breakfast is also served at 6:00am in the Club Room. The only slight negative was that we were surprised that there was no coffee maker in the room, but that was minor. The room was spacious with a very comfortable bed and flat screen TV. A perfect getaway!

Reviews.Title: “70 Bucks a Night! Great Location and Spacious!”
Reviews.Author: Writingandtravel
Reviews.Content: After a long delay due to lightning on the flight out, we arrived four hours late. Front desk was great--put us right into a room and upgraded us to the 25th floor the next day when we explained how lousy our flight was--not their fault and a nice touch. What a great room--windows on three walls--views of the west and south of city. Spacious bathroom, too. We did room service every morning--good value/service and prompt--and used the workout facility- fresh towels, disposable earphones, and washed shiny apples every morning except for a Friday morning. Yes, aggressive panhandlers prevail throughout the tenderloin area, which borders the hotel, which bills itself as Union Square--it's sort of marginally both areas. The restaurant in the lobby is a little pricey, but does a good cocktail hour and a very nice breakfast. The lack of WiFi is a pain--we were able to hijack some nearby company's WiFi with a few attempts at the most obvious passwords so it wasn't a real problem. We had a funky experience with CitySights tours to Muir Woods--overbooked open bus on a cold morning (but, in a previous trip and on this one, the wine-country tour guides were excellent and very friendly). There's a really fresh sushi place, Hanna Zan, I think it is, right across the street, toward Union Square. Try Millenium for what we thought was the best vegetarian food we'd ever eaten. We bought a five-day MetroCard and it worked great with the iPhone's googlemap feature. Try MOMA, the Tea Room in Yorba Linda Park by the Metreon, and the Press Club, a really upscale wine tasting bar just down the street. We booked direct-flight round-trip airfare and hotel from Philly for 14 hundred for two--very affordable. Want to avoid situations with the homeless? Wear sunglasses and never stare--a topless male2female TV was panhandling right on the street out front one morning, one other morning walking thru the tenderloin we got to know what crack smells like, and right outside the hotel a so-called "drunk veteran" stepped on my Converse All Stars while bumming a smoke from an acquaintance. Oh well, this has become a trip review instead of a Parc 55 review--we would definitely recommend it and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome weekend in SF”
Reviews.Author: MiaLora77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from a wonderful weekend in downtown Union Square for my birthday weekend. We normally do this every year and have stayed at various hotels, however, this hotel became a favorite of ours in the city. We found awesome rates on the web and decided to give this hotel a try. We live about 2 hours south of San Francisco and decided to stay for the weekend in downtown. We stayed at the Parc 55 Hotel and I was simply amazed how nice it was, and how close it was to almost everything! This was our first time staying there, and we truly enjoyed our stay . Upon check in, the woman that assisted us was very kind and informative about the hotel. This hotel was recently renovated and re opened a couple of months ago. What was even more nice was she even upgraded our room to the 28th floor belonging to the Executive Level. Having a room at the Executive Level provided awesome views and complimentary breakfast at their clubroom on the 31st floor. The rooms had a nice contemporary look to it, plenty of space, and were very clean! The beds were very comfy as well! The hotel is situated in a widely popular centralized shopping area. It's right acoss the street from the San Francisco center and Bloomingdales. And right around the corner, not even a block away, is Powell St. which leads you to Union Square as well as Market Street. So you can imagine all the shopping and dining you can conquer being that the hotel was so close to everything! At night we walked up about 2 blocks up Powell Street to the Sir Francis Drake hotel where they have a nice dining lounge at their very top floor with amazing views of the city called the Starlight Room. There are also so many others that are only a walking distance away! The only downside we experienced was the valet parking. It was way too much. They charged $45 a day. So even though we felt we scored awesome rates staying at this hotel, the cost of valet makes it even more costly. But that's usually what you should expect in the city. There are parking garages nearby for half the rate, however they're not as close as you think and you'd still have quite a walk to the hotel. Overall, this hotel is awesome. If you want to stay centralized to everything, I would definitely recommend this hotel. It's really nice, friendly staff, clean, and fairly new!

Reviews.Title: “Enhanced our trip”
Reviews.Author: keybjones
Reviews.Content: We used Priceline and got the Parc 55 for an excellent rate. I called the hotel to request 2 beds and they said no problem. When we checked in, I asked for a room on a high floor and we got the 25th floor facing the Bay. We really enjoyed the view. The location was perfect for the sights we wanted to see. The parking at the hotel was about $50 a day with tax but most parking in that neighborhood is $40 or more. The vallet guys were quick and careful, thanks! Check in was hassle free and the concierge was very helpful. If you are going to the King Tut exhibit or Alcatraz tour, get your tickets in advance. The room was clean and comfortable. I wasn't crazy about the mattress but the kiddo and hubby didn't mind. We ate at the Italian resturant right next door, Puccini & Pinetti. We all really liked it. The pumpkin cheesecake was great! I read other comments about the riff raff around the hotel but that's all over downtown. My husband and I have stayed a few times at the St. Francis and we saw even more homeless types being right across from the square. You will encounter pan handlers and some of them are mentally ill and/or under the influence. Just be extra careful/observant and that element won't impact your stay. Overall the Parc 55 was a good hotel in a great location. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 let me down”
Reviews.Author: tag78747
Reviews.Content: I know not every one reads these all the way so if you do decide to stay here do yourself a huge favor deman a room on the club level and make sure its a corner room, these are the only rooms in the hotel that are fair. Big diff from the reg club room and the corner club rooms trust me.. This is one of the hotels that you view pics of and say wow this look nice and the price is reasonable. However the pictures are of there finest rooms. I booked 3 rooms at this hotel on the club levels. 1 Room was very large and was well laid out. However the furnishings are strait from the motel 6 catalog. Now, to the hotels defense I did just check out of a 5 night stay in Las Vegas at the Encore a 5 star and by the way most fantastic hotel I know. Our other two rooms was Dim, lacking wall coverings or art, Very bad layouts ect. Oh yes and if your planning to eat breakfast in the club or go to the club for drinks don't. Bottom line is if your looking for a quality memory of your hotel on a romantic or magical trip to old san fran do your self a favor and stay some where else. The bell hops and valet were very nice and quick. Thank god this city is so freaking beautiful otherwise I would have let this hotel ruin it for me.. Just keep looking for other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Pindeyah
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Parc 55 hotel, it was clean and comfortable. We booked it through Hotwire and it definitely exceeded our expectations. The downsides are: - Parking was quite expensive. - Basic coffee / tea was not a complimentary inclusion. - Wireless internet was not a complimentary inclusion in the rooms (had to go to the business centre and after playing around with the set up, I gave up and went back to the room). However, the price was reasonable which made up for the above negatives. Great location - walking distance to great shopping! Would definitely consider staying here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kurt12
Reviews.Content: Judging by the reviews, I'm guessing that some guests may have stayed in an unrenovated room at Parc 55. Our room was large, clean and lovely. It was an inside room, and we heard no street noise. We also didn't have any problem with noise from the adjoining rooms. Check in was perfect. The lobby is lovely, and it feels like you are in a much more expensive hotel. I am from San Francisco, so I was not surprised by the presence of homeless people. I don't consider it to be a fair criticism of Parc 55. In my experience, the area around Parc 55 is completely safe. My only complaint is we were given a room with two double beds instead of one Queen or King. It was late and we had unpacked before we noticed the size of the beds, otherwise we would have asked for a different room. However, I was disappointed that the hotel would assign a room with two double beds to a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: wrenmelb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 on two occasions in October for two nights each time. Each room I had was spotlessly clean and furnished to a high standard. On my request I had a smoking room so I was on the 8th floor. I obtained my room through Priceline but nevertheless my request for a corner room was granted on my first stay. I preferred to leave the window vents partially open but the noise in the street below after dark funnelled up into the room as my room overlooked Mason Street. The loudness of sirens was disconcerting but it was the shouting and arguments I had most difficulty with. I didn't want to use the earplugs provided as I was worried I wouldn't wake at 7 AM but it only became quiet outside around 3 AM. I'm sure it would make a difference according to the level and location of room allocated so I would suggest requesting a room higher up and away from Mason Street. The location of the hotel can't be beaten for access to BART from the airport as the Powell St station is just a few minutes walk away. Any hotel in this location is going to be subject to noise and I was perhaps more sensitive to it being somewhat jet lagged after a 20 hour journey when I first arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for downtown SF”
Reviews.Author: kjtrunky
Reviews.Content: If you want a good hotel in downtown SF which is close to BART (Powell) station from airport, this hotel is it. Downtown and Waterfront are within easy walking or MUNI and Tram stops making this a great location. Can be noisy at night, even on the 18th floor as I was.

Reviews.Title: “Just renovation and great location!”
Reviews.Author: HKexpat88
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel at least 5-6 times a year. The location in unbeatable right next to Union Square, a bit noisy but I think that's what can be expected if you want to stay smack downtown! The hotel just went through a major renovation and the impression now is light, modern and open. Above average service for a US hotel. Nice gym as well. Just don't park your car here, it's 50 bucks for one night!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Harmony177
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and spacious, hotel had nice amenties, and was in good location. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: DigitalDub
Reviews.Content: We booked a club level king room at this hotel for 5 nights. The room was great, we had a great view of downtown, we were on the 23rd floor. The room also had a LCD TV and had a built in outlet to plug in your one AV equipment (RCA/SVideo/VGA/MP3) and watch it on the TV, great for families who might want to bring a portable DVD player. The bathroom was great, nice a big, lots of room for our toilette bags. And the room had a nice closet to hang our cloths and well as provided us with 2 robes. We also had access to the club lounge which provided breakfast every morning and snacks and desert weeknights. I think it was great... we didn't pay that much extra and always had a great breakfast. The location was great, just across the street from the Bart and Muni station and a cable car stop. And just across Market street was the downtown shopping mall. We didn't really eat around the hotel, just one night we went to the mall, in the basement food court there is a great farmers market kind of store with tons of pre-made meals. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “never stay here ever!”
Reviews.Author: troyathome
Reviews.Content: Upon checking into the hotel we find out that our room we booked through expedia got "bumped" and the one king size bed we reserved got changed into two full size beds. Our room was cleaned the second day but the garbage, which was over flowing wasn't taken out, when we came back the garbage fell over spilling all over the floor. When we called to notify the front desk about the garbage and our discontentment with the room, all they were offering was to send a supervisor up to investigate our garbage situation that was already cleaned up (by us) at 1100 at night and were very persistent on sending someone to our room. The person who took our phone call was not concerned with our needs but rather looking to reprimand someone. We are not picky or hard to please but the hotel aspect of our trip was so bad that we felt the need to post a complaint. The rooms aren't that great, your basically staying for the location. Save your money and stay at a Holiday Inn. This is my first review of service/products, i wish it could've been a positive one.

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal and institutionalized.”
Reviews.Author: tcake1
Reviews.Content: Service was good enough, but indifferent. Blaring music greeted us as we got off the elevator, which made us want to leave as soon as possible. The manager explained the music selection and level was to wake people up - even at 10:00 p,m,? Their restaurant service was indifferent, robotic and food mediocre. The best part of this experience was the cleaning staff. We happened to be in our room when the housekeeping supervisor came by to check the rooms after they had been cleaned. She wanted to know about every little thing we thought about the condition of our room and continued to follow up when we pointed out a few neglected areas.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't really like it”
Reviews.Author: CJSLubbock
Reviews.Content: If you can stay for less than $100/night, then this hotel is fine. There's nothing disgusting or unsafe about. However, if you are looking for a nice place to stay for $100 or more per night, I would choose somewhere else. First, on Tuesday night around 9 p.m., I called for a wake up call and no one answered. I hung up and kept calling back every 15 minutes with the same results. After an hour of trying, I called every number I could find -- front desk, conceirge, housekeeping, room service, etc. and NO ONE answered the phone. This was very frustrating. (However, I was able to place a wake up call request on the other nights of my stay) Second, I wouldn't rely solely on the wake-up call. It wouldn't ever be right at the specified time. Third, the street noise was extremely loud. I heard sirens and construction noise all day and night the entire week. As I was checking out, a colleague told me there are floor vents that are left open, but if you close them, it quiets the noise significantly. I wish I had been told I could close those vents (or if those vents had been closed in the first place.) In conclusion, this hotel is fine, but I'd stay somewhere else with all the great hotels San Francisco offers!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: cspinelli
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the last minute and was very happy with it. It is right across the street from the Westfield shopping center and the Powell Street BART station; quite a convenient location. The hotel itself is very modern and clean. It felt very safe, which was important to me as a female traveling alone. When I arrived I notiiced there was a conference of Ebay taking place there, and also that many pilots and flight attendants stay there. To me, that says the hotel is good, because big companies and airline employees know where to stay. I had some drinks and appetizers in the bar which were tasty and reasonably priced. The bartender served my wine with a "back"; a little extra portion in a seperate glass, which was nice. during happy hour, buy one appetizer and the second is 55 cents. We had the fried calamari and chicken satay and both were very good. The room was on the smaller sie but fully equipped, and the beds were comfortable. the view of the city was fantastic. The only complaint I had was that the movies on the tv were very expensive ($16.99) and the tv was hard to operate generally - I could not find the local channels at all. Also, there was a wireless internet connection in the room but it was quite slow and they charged $12.99 for each day. Overall I was very satisfied with this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and good value”
Reviews.Author: GaryinSydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights end Sept in a Club room. Firstly, it was a breeze to locate and adjacent to the Powell St BART station, so no taxi necessary from airport. I couldn't imagine a better location, as its opposite Westfield SF shopping centre and right on the Powell st cable car stop and Union Square shopping district. Choosing a club room was well worth it - the views from the lounge were fantastic and friendly Sergio made everyone welcome. The breakfast in particular was really good and cheese & bacon bagels with Starbucks coffee, set us up for nicely for each day's sightseeing. Overall we were extremely happy with our choice and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “The greatness stops at the second floor...or if you step outside.”
Reviews.Author: kymm824
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a couple nights to catch Wicked and do some sightseeing. The show was great, the stay was a bit scary. The streets around the hotel are packed with homeless and the police are poorly staffed to manage them all. We decided to grab a bit close to the hotel and then walk to the show. The further we got towards the theater, the more my wife said, "let's take a cab back..." The hotel wasn't even the haven it pretends to be on the website. The "renovated" rooms are difficult to see any change. The furniture is cheap, the beds are hard, and the overall feel is cold. The pictures make it look like rich and dark mahogany, the reality is press board with light red faux cherry flat boards and furniture. No mini-fridge, and we found the previous occupants PJ's hanging on the bathroom door. The fixtures are old, the furnishings subpar, not for the $250.00 a night we paid for a King room. The club lounge, well, it was nice, but the food was not worth the elevator ride. All in all, it's a hotel that is trying to be more than it has achieved and disappointedly advertising otherwise. Stay in closer to the financial district, little Italy, or fisherman's warf.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Choice!”
Reviews.Author: JupiterBeach
Reviews.Content: Great Location, great rates, great hotel! Stayed 5 days in October and was very convenient to Union Square Shops, very very convenient to BART, Cable Cars and the MUNI. Would recommend in a minute for budget concious travelers looking for a little luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: IdoTLV
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Beautiful rooms, especially those on high floors with view of the city - Great location at Union Square - Well maintained and clean - Airconditioned rooms (which is not trivial in SF) Cons: - Staff isn't that friendly (especially front desk) - No fridge in the room - No safety deposit box in most rooms (there are deposit boxes at the front dest for free) Overall, a very good choice for visiting SF.

Reviews.Title: “Only let down by the little things”
Reviews.Author: JeffBarnes
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean rooms etc but just lacking a bit of class and thought. First example is when you check in. Total bedlam if it is busy. Never enough check-in staff and because there is no roped line people just jostle for position and hope that no one tries to jump the (non-existent) queue. I'm sure it turns ugly there sometimes and all for the sake of a rope and some extra staff. I was upgraded to a suite on the 31st floor which was great. However whoever did the lighting in the rooms favours chic over practical. Even with all the lights on I could have done with a torch to find my way around. And with all that space they couldn't find anywhere to put a full length mirror? And $50 for overnight parking?!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Average Facelift”
Reviews.Author: lestarvinmarvin
Reviews.Content: I read that this hotel was given a complete remodeling in the summer of '09, so I was looking forward to brand new fancy rooms. I was disappointed- the rooms weren't fancy, but they were comfortable, which is what is most important anyway. But I could still tell the building is quite old. The location is very central to everywhere you would want to go, including just a few steps to the cable car. Stay here if you didn't rent a car, because you can walk almost everywhere. If you did rent a car, don't park in the overpriced hotel lot. Overall, If you don't pay over $200 USD (for the basic room), it is worth staying.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location”
Reviews.Author: ScarletDublin
Reviews.Content: We paid 200 euro for a deluxe king room, this was two thirds of the actual price, as we got it for a reduced rate. The room was decorated really well with a wide screen tv, and the bed was very comfortable. It was in an excellent location, central to everything. Do not pay more than 200 for a room though as it's not worth it. I only have a couple of criticisms... 1). The coffee maker was bogging! So it needed a good sterilizing before use. 2). As we were staying for 9 nights we thought that they might give us a complimentary breakfast or dinner, but the manager kept telling us to call back to the desk later. I wasn't impressed by this at all. It would have been a nice touch at a small expense to the hotel. They seem to favour the more lavish guest (a lot of business people stay here, pilots and I.T. professionals) and not give the same welcoming to all their other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Good Value via Priceline”
Reviews.Author: Bristolians40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Parc 55 for 3 nights at the beginning of Oct. We paid £64 per night through Priceline, which was a bargain. We were on the 11 floor and didn't have any problem sleeping. You need to remember that you are in the middle of a city, so there will always be noise! The location of this hotel is fantastic. Its in the downtown area of San Francisco, 2 blocks away from Union Square. All the shops are on your doorstep as well as the buses, bart and trams. Parking is pricey at the hotel but there is a couple of car parks within a block or 2 away. We would definately stay at Parc 55 again and we recommend eating at The cheesecake Factory on top of Macy's, Union Square on th outside patio!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent deal through Priceline.com”
Reviews.Author: naterday
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 has expensive parking. If I had not Pricelined my room I don't know if we would have stayed there but I am glad that we did. The staff was super helpful and friendly(including a girl named Tip). The bar was a wonderful addition to our stay, we frequented it often. The room was clean and attractive with all the amenities. Taxis are always waiting outside and the subway is a two minute walk. Not to mention the trolleys are close. The one problem is our room was hot because of no air movement. When I checked the air conditioning filter it looked like it had never been changed. I called the front desk and the promtly brought me a new one and the roon stayed cool the rest of the trip. Always check your air filter. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel,gr8 location and staff,calls from room, a rip off!”
Reviews.Author: Sammie,bicester,uk
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms, but some face the road and are too noisy to sleep in, esp with fire engines etc...constant noise explains earplugs provided in bathroom! Staff polite and helpful, but the calls, esp so called "loca"l calls, were a rip off..not explained to us by operator when we asked...£5 for a few seconds!!! Daylight robbery!! Do NOT use!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, if you get a good deal”
Reviews.Author: BobbyFrings
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on the Parc 55 and were very pleased. The rooms were clean, the location was good and the hotel staff was courteous. It may not have much character, but it provides a soldi's night's stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn82
Reviews.Content: What a brilliant hotel! The location is second to none - a minute's walk from the Bart Powell station (which costs $8.10 per person from SFO). It is also right near the tram Powell line Cable Car turnaround which makes it very easy to get around the city. We bought a 7-day 'muni passport' (which costs $24 per person) which enables you to ride any municipal railway passenger vehicle within the bay area - this paid for itself within about 2 days as the cable cars alone cost $5 each way. We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and had a 'club room' which was fantastic. We were on the 27th floor, and the views were amazing.Breakfast was also included in the 'club lounge' on the top floor which was very good. On arrival, our greeting was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and spacious and the bed was heavenly! I would say the only improvement would be to offer free wi-fi (we also stayed at the Donatello hotel which did offer free wi-fi).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: radman_9
Reviews.Content: Newly redone rooms, comfortable beds,some rooms with view,located close to union square shopping and muni for transportation...a little street noise...sirens...we were only on the 8th floor

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LSBBeachBum
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times over the last few years, the hotel is in a great location near all the SF shopping, the rates are great and the rooms are very nice. I would definitely recommend it for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel, terrible service.”
Reviews.Author: mmatics
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Parc 55 because it had so many good reviews. It was a little pricey but we went for it. The rooms were nice and the hotel was clean but as for customer service is was terrible. They charged us extra fees with out telling us so we had less to spend on fun in San Francisco. Also, when we wanted to talk to the concierge about restaurants we had to wait an hour (along with about 10 other people) because he was on a break (on a Saturday night). When I asked a receptionist to call the concierge from his break, she told me that she couldn't pay attention to me because it wasn't her job. Made our anniversary very stressful.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: GinnyHR
Reviews.Content: I booked our hotel through Hotwire, so I didn't know where we were staying until after booking. Then I read reviews online and I must say that they were all over the place -anywhere from poor to excellent. So I was a little concerned and I called the hotel directly to see what our room would be like. I was told I could make a request for the type of room and location, but that they couldn't guarantee I'd get that. When we arrived to check in, the clerk said "I have the perfect room for you." She was absolutely right because she gave us a corner room on the 17th floor and we had a fantastic view of the city through two huge picture windows! The room was bright, clean, large, and quiet. The shower had great water pressure and we had absolutely no complaints. The staff were friendly and helpful and the location was perfect for us. It was close to all public transportation, restaurants, and shopping. All in all, it was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SHORT STAY”
Reviews.Author: SuzyWM
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night pre cruise last month and had a great stay. Caught the BART from SFO, walked out at Powell St, turned left, walked 1 block and there it was.....very handy for our weary bodies! Room large with good view, 2 king size beds, very clean and lovely reception. Very handy for both the Union Sq shopping and the tram....always a must for the SF traveller! Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations”
Reviews.Author: ncgrandma4
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel that was in a safe area & centrally located to trolley, cable car & shopping. Couldn't ask for anything better. The rooms were a good size & very clean. The staff was friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Always Great”
Reviews.Author: gemneye
Reviews.Content: I go to SF at least once a year, sometimes twice and have for almost ten years now. Consistanly, the Parc 55 hotel is always a pleasant stay and a reasonably priced hotel to stay in. Another key factor I like about Parc 55 is there seems to always be a room available. It's not the only hotel I have enjoyed in San Francisco, and it's not the only one I will return to, but it's one of the few I can say I loved the stay, I loved the room, I love the view, the price is always reasonable (comparably) and I will be back. Try to get into one of the higher floors.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, Clean, Friendly Room”
Reviews.Author: Janet060
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay, clean room, friendly staff, great bar! The Hotel is located about a block from the Cable Car ... easy walking!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: hkwikai
Reviews.Content: We were in SF for a few days and thought the hotel was in a great location. Booked several months in advance so got a really good rate. Very close to Union Square and lots of shopping. The parking was expensive (about $50/day) but that seemed to be the going rate at most nearby hotels. The room seemed to be recently renovated and was very comfortable. I would definitely stay here again bc of the location.

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AJackson08
Reviews.Content: The only negative thing I have to say about Parc 55 is that the elevators moved incredibly slow (lol) and the rooms were kind of small. I was expecting the small rooms though. We stayed almost on the top floor, but could still hear a little bit of noise outside. However, after sightseeing all day, we just passed out. The location was excellent, the women who checked us in and out were extremely friendly, and the hotel was nice and clean. We got a great deal on Expedia too!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel ...front desk service however is questionable”
Reviews.Author: krzy_kuching
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel ..great location and very central to shopping, restaurants etc . The room was amazing eg View room with panoramic sight of the city lights. Was a little disappointed however with check in as when I got there, they couldn't find my booking!! Booked it online with hotel website and yet it was confusing to them! They made up for it however after standing around for 15 mins. By the way concierge was amazing - thank you crew as they managed to make reservations at my favorite restaurant the Slanted Door at the very last moment. Will I go back..absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. very clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bk2002
Reviews.Content: Hotel very clean, very friendly staff. The room was a nice size. the bed was very comfortable. Price was Excellent for a downtown location. And hotel is walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “If you like the sound of ambulance sirens, this is the place for you!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTerry92
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 hotel, near the Union Square in San Francisco, has wonderful cushy pillows and beds, but the noise level is a bit disturbing, especially when one is trying to sleep through the night. We heard ambulances throughout the day and night at different times, which was annoying. If that doesn't bother you, then the location is stellar and close to the main downtown attractions (e.g. Chinatown, Coit Tower, etc). The accommodations were comfortable and inviting, and the service was fine. We got a good deal from Priceline-$79 per night, although parking fees can add a hefty amount of money if you choose to use that service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, comfortable rooms and good location”
Reviews.Author: mockingjay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 for 4 nights for a conference in July. The hotel itself is very large and seems to be have been recently redecorated so the rooms and the lobby area are trendy but comfortable. I was sharing my room (a double queen) with some friends and while the room is quite spacious there is not a lot of space to keep luggage. The hotel itself seems to be geared towards hosting conferences etc. so the majority of people would not be in their rooms all that often but rather in the conference facilities which are nice and very large. I did not get a chance to check out the other facilities such as the gym or spa but I heard they were good. The Parc 55's location is very convenient. it is in the middle of union square which has a lot of up market shopping and department stores as well as being nearby the financial district. it is very easy to travel to other parts of the city (Fisherman's Wharf etc.) by bus or tram if you can stand the wait, but otherwise it is a central point to walk to other areas such as Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: kammil
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, rooms are very well presented, clean and spacious. Check-in was smooth and receptionist was very nice and friendly (we were upgraded to higher floor room with view). Hotel is in really good location and if you drive, you can manage to see a lot as the hotel is not far from anything really. I have not experienced any noise whatsoever as some complained, but maybe it's because we were on a higher floor. There are awful lots of homeless people around the hotel though. Also, parking in the hotel is very expensive but there are lots of other places around the hotel where you can park and they are a bit cheaper. I would not hesitate booking this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel, would stay again. Located to EVERYTHING!!”
Reviews.Author: Raider78
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze. Our room was very nice. I recommend to upgrade your room to get a better view of the city. We stayed on the 22nd floor, had a corner room and had views that were AMAZING!! Staff was very nice and helpful. Hotel was clean and didn't smell like smoke/cigarettes. Just steps from the hotel is the Visitor Center where you get a lot of transportation information, maps and help on where to go and how to get there. There is a lot of places to dine,shop and explore galleries in that area too. Cable car is 1 block away and that one takes you right to Fishermans Wharf. You really don't need your car in this city, just take mass transit everywhere and if you get the $11.00 daily pass at the visitor center it is well worth it. Yeah parking is expensive, like $50.00 a night, but we didn't mind. The hotel was well worth our stay in San Francisco and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Fabulous Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bahama_Gator
Reviews.Content: If you're thinking of a trip to San Francisco, Parc 55 is the hotel to stay in. I visited San Francisco for 5 days including my birthday and we had a great time. The staff were unbelievable and very helpful. The Concierge was wonderful and help us arranged tours of the city and Alcatraz. She also assisted us with dinner reservations at Morton's steakhouse, where the service was excellent. The view from my room was spectacular. At the heart of the shopping district, the proximity to the BART train and public transportation, the location cannot be beat. Thanks Parc 55 for making our first trip to SF memorable and enjoyable. We will definitely be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Be ready to hear your neighbor's every move”
Reviews.Author: oldorangeCa
Reviews.Content: These walls must be made of cardboard. Great location. And they let us check in early. The rooms are like an 80s Ramada Inn. Great place for a deaf traveler.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: laketimeAZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc for 1 night last week as the first night of a 6 day NorCal trip. For our $71.00 rate through Last Minute Travel, we got a very nice room on the 22nd floor with a bay view. I'm not sure we would have been as happy with a lower floor and higher rate, but were very happy with everything - cleanliness, service, location - nothing could have been better. We even had a bedtime view of the fireworks at Candlestick Park - a great start to a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel,Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghGraemekidd
Reviews.Content: Average large American city centre hotel.Though lobby area being updated at time of visit.Nice room great view though lots of street noise.Great but simple Thai cafe on 1st floor.Great location for the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - we truly enjoyed our say . . .”
Reviews.Author: earldobs
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Parc 55 last week and could not be happier. The location is perfect, central to most areas in SF. When we checked in we asked if they had any rooms available with a view. This was an anniversary trip for my wife and I and we were upgraded to a lovely room on the 24th floor with a fantastic view of the city. The staff was excellent in all areas. We would recommend the Parc 55 to all and look forward to our next visit to this wonderful city. When we do return the Parc 55 will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “it was okay. average”
Reviews.Author: happybess
Reviews.Content: fabulous location. not so good service. not so good lobby clean room with nice view, but that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but expected more for the money”
Reviews.Author: LS-Los_Altos
Reviews.Content: From the hotel's website, we expected a much more luxurious experience for the "club floor" reservation we paid extra for...still can't figure out where the floor to ceiling windows are in the hotel, having seen nothing that resembled the pictures on the hotel's website. Biggest disappointment was with the "complimentary" appetizer/happy hour. Food selection was minimal--far below what is normally offered at a boutique hotel or B&B--and there was a charge for wine, which was not apparent either from the website or when making reservations. The staff in the continental breakfast "club room" wasn't overly friendly and began putting items away before the end of the posted hours of availability. While our room was nice, it wasn't anything special. However, the location of the hotel was GREAT! One final note...We were somewhat uncomfortable with the fact that anyone could enter the hotel and directly access the elevators, and thus room floors, without a card key.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Nipper100
Reviews.Content: I would have given this hotel five stars if it wasn't for the $44.00 a day for valet parking and $12.95 internet access. However for $99.00 a night, it made up for it. You can't beat the location. Right next to a BART Station and Trolley stop, you don't need a vehicle. Get a $11.00 day pass and it will get you where you want to go. Rooms were clean and spacious. The staff were very friendly. The noise and street people are to be expected for downtown San Francisco. You just have to learn to ignore it.

Reviews.Title: “great location but very noisey”
Reviews.Author: Karkstraveltips
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ver central to everything. Tourist infomation is just across the road and are very helpful. The reception area is up one level. The rooms are quite good and they are clean with great linen and towels. The room we were in faced the road and i should have know when they give you ear plugs that you are in for a load night. Beacuse of the location there is an ambulence or police station very close and so there are sirens all night really load so not much sleep was had. we had 2 double beds in the room and they were quite big rooms. The other downfall is the amount of homeless people near the hotel and also they did not give us a map of the area when we checked in which I think is really important for out of towners. On the plus side there is grat shopping with the main malls right across the street, and also very close the the tram and cable car. the cable car is good if you want the experience but expensive it is cheaper to pay the $2 to get the the pier then I think an $8 for the cable car. We did not eat in the hotel but the breakfast buffet look quite nice. there are great resturants around and the indian across the road is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Very central”
Reviews.Author: twadders
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here for 2 nights. We caught a taxi from the airport which did not cost very much at all. The reception is up 1 floor and on arrival the hotel was spotless, and the greeting was good and efficiant. The room was very clean and spacious and it was a very quiet. We did not use any of the hotels facilities, we just used it as a base to explore. We caught a bus close by and went down to Fishermans Wharf to see the sea lions, and we also went to Alcatraz. The hotel was ideally located to explore.

Reviews.Title: “The best location”
Reviews.Author: bigbadbruins
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 5 nights on Expedia, great rate (under 500$us with taxes). The location is perfect. Took the BART from the airport. Arrived at the hotel at 2:30 PM, the only room available was with 2 double beds. After a long flight, didn't want to wait 30 minutes for a room with a King bed so we took it. We were told we could change room later in the week but never took the time to do it. The room we had was fine. We were on the 5th floor, so no view. I read a lot of bad reviews about the noise at this hotel. It wasn't that bad. Of course we heard sirens at night, but it's not a bed & breakfast in Vermont, it's a downtown hotel so you should expect that. The CityPass was a great buy. the Muni 7 day Pass is a must. I would recommend Parc 55, you cant beat that location !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and price”
Reviews.Author: tstrayer76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at Parc 55. We paid under $100 a night on Hotwire and were pleased with the hotel. The room was clean with comfy pillows. Their laundry service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms were fine”
Reviews.Author: Carrie105
Reviews.Content: This is a very tall hotel! We had the huge fortune of having a room really near the top and as such we had fantastic views. The sunsets from the room were amazing. We had to wait a couple of extra hours after check in for a high up room to be cleaned, but it was definetly worth it. The rooms are pleasant enough, clean and do the job, nothing in particular to rave about. We have an interconnecting door and could hear the man snoring in the next room, so try and avoid this if possible. One of the best things about this hotel is it's location, it is literally on top of all the useful transport links, you arrive at the train stop from the airport and the hotel is right there. The cablecar turnaround is a 2 minute walk away as well that takes you all the way down to fishermans wharf. Also, if you are hiring a car when you are moving on from the city as we did, the big rental companies all have offices on the adjoining street - perfect! I would be quite happy to recommend this hotel as a base to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: JimMain
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on vacation for 5 nights. I got a great deal booking in advance with a AAA discount ($550 including taxes). Several days before arriving, I called to confirmed and to mention that we would be arriving on a late flight. Upon check-in, I was told that they didn't have any King rooms availalbe and was asked if a double would be okay. I mentioned that I confirmed with a late check-in several days ago and didn't really want a double. After checking with a manager, I was told that a King had just become available (at 11:30 PM!). The room (1719) was beautiful. The bathroom was large as was the rest of the room. Throughout the stay, the room was keep very clean. We didn't eat at the restaurant and didn't really use any other services as we were out most of the time. The staff were very helpful when asked for directions, reccomendations. They also printed out of boarding passes for us. The location is prime! Right accross the street from the end of the cable car line and BART/Muni transportaiton systems. Used them often. Even got to the Giants game and over to Oakland for an A's game. I would very much reccommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it --- great rooms, staff, and location -- will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Ouch-I-Tripped
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 is a delightful hotel. Airy, large bright rooms; pleasant staff; cozy bar; good location. We came to SF for the Outside Lands music festival and stayed four nights here. Everything went smoothly -- from checkin (early, at 1:00 p.m., with no fuss), checkout (late, no charge, again no fuss), larger room than expected (corner), charming and pleasant staff from desk clerk to housekeepers to doormen. Our room, on the 12th floor, was our base for exploring and for take-out food at night. The room was very clean and well-maintained (one evening housekeeping brought a bed bolster that we never knew was missing). Large LG flat-screen TV was fine, on a credenza with multiple electronic media outlets and two cables in drawer. View was reasonable and nicely lit up at night. Loveseat/sofabed combo, small coffee table, desk and desk chair all allowed comfy seating and relaxing/snacking. Water bottles provided in room at $4.50 USD for 1 liter each were pricey: instead, run to the corner and half a block east to Walgreens and grab a sixpack of H2O. We didn't use the small coffeemaker, but ran to Starbucks and local coffee places each morning (expect 15-20 minute waits, coffeehouses stay busy). Air conditioning (internal unit) was responsive, audible but not too loud. By the way, there are vents under each window that roll open to allow fresh air in! I didn't notice these until the third day. We didn't visit the hotel restaurant but it looked elegant and the menu was appealing. There are numerous restaurants within a block or two: Indian/Pakistani, Thai, sushi, Irish, Italian, pizza, etc. (Punjab was our favorite, on the southwest corner behind the hotel.) The bartender did pour generously on our visit to the bar, and the space was welcoming with relaxing chairs and careful lighting. The Parc 55 is located near the Powell Street transport station, so it's near buses, underground, surface rail, and streetcars. Easy walking distance to shopping, museum area, Union Square, and a bit longer hike to Chinatown. Taxis are queued for longer trips. On noise: San Francisco is a busy city. You will hear traffic, fire engines, police sirens, and sometimes loud voices frequently during the day and night, no matter WHERE you stay. The Parc 55 provides a set of foam earplugs in the bathroom if needed (we didn't). We will definitely will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Girl Weekend”
Reviews.Author: cdafft
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently stayed at the hotel for a long weekend and we were looking forward to shopping during the day and going to the clubs at night. When we approached the concierage to plan our excursions and to get suggestions for the "best" areas to go to shop and then be put on the guest lists at night for the "best" clubs for our type of music that we preferred...we were treated very rudely. We were handed a map and told if we wanted anything more detailed to go to Walgreens. When asked about clubs he had no clue as to where to go. We thought we would try later as we had a few already in mind with a different staff person, but found that the night shift to be no better and even less informed as they didn't know what being put on a guest list meant??? The staff the next day was no different and didn't even call us back or follow up like they said they would on making arrangements for us. To say we were disappointed in this type of treatment was an understatement. We ended up doing all our own leg work and research, but that is what a concierage is for for goodness sake!!!! I will not go back to this hotel although it is in a perfect location for shopping and getting to where you want to go...too bad!! But it truly is the little things that count and customer service is paramount in my books!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Alisrico1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just spent 5 nights at this hotel. This was recommended to us by a friend, as he location is excellent for sight-seeing around San Francisco. It is situated close to trams stops, bus stops, and the cable car is just around the corner. Also, the underground is close by, meaning that the BART can be used to get from the airport, saving the expense of a taxi fare. It is close to shops , and many restaurants. We did find it a bit noisy at night -not the hotels fault, though, as the noise was mainly police and fire sirens, which seemed to go all night long! The hotel was spotless, and the room was beautifully furnished. We did not eat in the hotel, but there are so many places nearby to try. Excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 Visited 20 months later...last minute deal”
Reviews.Author: pulgadelmundo
Reviews.Content: My original review was for January 2008... I had wanted to go up to SF for a couple days but was tentative of commiting to the purchase a hotel room due to the threat of a BART STRIKE...Getting into the city would of been VERY problematic. (see parking tip) Now, since my trip was Last minute (No Strike, but I was told many Bay Area people took that monday off because they expected horrible traffic issues) I was having issues making a SF purchase on Priceline with the usual hotels I like. Usually I try to pay between 80-100 = taxes.. I tried the PARC 55 site which has a room for 125ish a night without taxes. I kept clicking around for specials on their site. I found a NON-REFUNDABLE special for the same room for 102 a night (two nights with taxes was 235...PERFECT!!). The hotel is close to the POWELL STATION...I knew it was SAFE, CLEAN and though VERY large doesn't feel so which is why I liked it the last time I visited. My biggest issue my last visit was the lack of consistent Internet...I actually called PARC 55 to ask them if it was more stable. They said they thought so. They also mentioned that the Internet cafe around the corner I mentioned in my last review is closed for 6 months of remodeling ( FYI) The hotel has done a remodel since I visited last. Check in is now in a much more modern area on the second floor. They let me check in early at 12pm which was pleasant since I had been driving from LA and on thr BART for 40 min . The lobby was full of people but not a long wait. Originally they were going to put me in a 13th floor room but I asked my receptionist if they had anything with a view..She upgraded me to the 23th floor which was VERY appreciated by me.Sometimes being pleasant, asking with a smile makes a difference...AlsoTheir new lobby/close by bar area welcomed the NEW York Mets...I heard this is a hotel for a lot of the teams... My room was as I remembered, big bathroom with a cimfy bed, I did like that they no longer used LATHER for products which I though were sucky on my last stay. THE INTERNET was $12.95 a day but WORKED perfectly. they had both wireless and plug in. I was VERY HAPPY! AREA COMPARISION: Since I know the city better this time around I can confidently tell you that this location is WAY better then the Union Hilton and Hotel Nikko. Though they are only a block away sometimes you can feel it in a city such as SF. Plus both those hotels looked SOOO BUSY. **PARKING TIP: Go to the BART SITE, buy an extended parking permit ($5 a day,not 24 hours) Then take the BART into the city. Parking in SF can be 35-50 a day depending on the area. 3 days of parking (15) + a roundtrip from pleasanton (10.55) was = $26 bucks... Also If it is a three day weekend, that Monday parking is free! ***Dining. Hotel is super close to a SUBWAY, WALGREENS (buy water), COLDSTONE, PIZZA PLACE within a block. There is a nearby Chinese Resturant. My fave is PUCCINI & PINETTI off Ellis and Cyril Magnin..GREAT happy hour ($3 champagene but not boozy.

Reviews.Title: “Review with cheap tips for travel on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Planbhorizon
Reviews.Content: Location: My girlfriend and I decided it was time for another San Fran trip. We love the city and this time we booked a week trip through a website traveling service. The building outside reminds me of the 70s, i love the look. Although i was paying more attention to the bums about to aggresively panhandle me like they did the entire week with their gimmicks for a buck or two. Although everything else about the area rocks, stores, union sq. and bars! The Old Siam across the street is the best Thai ive had in a long time. Dont bother going out late at night for the bars unless your a big dude or you have a load of friends with you, the bums out there are on full force and stop at nothing to get your attention (typically black dudes are the aggresive ones by my experience). Room: The room was whatever.. just a plain typical room on the 16 floor. The bed was really comfortable but thats not saying much since i still sleep on a 12 year old bed at home. The view was amazing! but you have to pay a lil extra to get the best sides. There is no fridge that is free or even a small microwave so all our leftovers always went fast. The shower was blah and high pressured. the drainage was HORRIBLE .. before you know it you were standing in 4 inches of water and a load gurrggling sound of the drain desperate to make way for the dirty water. gross! Also NO FAN! it would mug up the entire room and the window would fog.. but one plus is in the morning the people in the next hotel over sometimes wake up and look out the window naked and they are usually care free european tourists.. thats a plus or a minus really.. lol Service: It was fine.. cept this one asian lady at the counter didnt know how to work our room phone and said "ive never seen the phones in the room".. wow Value: the nightly rate was pretty good since its a recession but DONT BOTHER parking your car in their lot.. 1. you cant get the car yourself (valet and that means tip) 2. it now costs 44-49$ each night!.. there is secure parking garages all up and down union for much cheaper.. just got to walk a few blocks.. Dont bother getting their expensive room service breakfast or buffet.. since there is way cheaper restuarants down the street that serve breakfast. Their bar is really expensive but the bartenders are really cool.. there is a few bars right outside Parc 55 and a liqour store down a block.. IF your trying to thrift it out in san fran.. oh and their is wireless service for free at various coffee shops in the area DONT bother with the 12.95 per 24 charge in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “terrable”
Reviews.Author: tomfsantacruz
Reviews.Content: our room bathroom smelled of mold and mildew. the carpet was dirty and crums on the carpet floor. I complaned to the front desk . No change. The airconditioning was also sub par. We could smell what they were cooking in the kitchen thru the aircondition ducs We would never stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Even the Housekeepers are Extremely Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Emma_27
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel as it was newly renovated and found a great rate on their website for a club room on the 28th floor. I am writing this while curled up on a little couch in the bath robe they provide while looking at my spectacular view over the city and bay! The lobby and rooms are very nicely done and the staff are extremely friendly. You expect the Bell Hops, Front Desk and conciege to be friendly but here even the housekeeping staff is extremely friendly. Also great central location!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Parc 55!”
Reviews.Author: PG1006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Parc 55 for 2 nights while touring San Francisco and had a wonderful stay. While it is 2 blocks from Union Square, there is a trolley, street car and subway station literally outside of the door! There are also numerous shops and restaurants making it an ideal location. The hotel is newly renovated and we were very pleased with the cleanliness and spaciousness of the room. We also went to the hotel bar one of the nights and had a great time - service was great. We were able to get a great deal on Hotwire ($89 a night) - for that price, this hotel cannot be beat! I would recommend parking in another location, since they charge about $50 a night (we found a lot right down the street that was $25 a night).

Reviews.Title: “Thoughtful amenities and accommodations, yeah if you pay”
Reviews.Author: Classifiedtech
Reviews.Content: It is an OK hotel, the location was awsome. I like the Amenities and Accommodations they list on the website, basically every single one you have to pay for, you want a fridge, you have to pay for it, internet, you have to pay for it every 24 hours. Parking, even if your a guest you have to pay for it, $44 for 24 hours, as a guest. If you want to rent a movie,basically it will cost $12 for it to watch once, if you accidentally change the channel you will lost it and would have to pay again to watch it. It was totally rediculous, I'm surprised we didn't have to pay for air we breathed in the hotel. If you like wasting money for no reason at all, this is the Hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the bellhops at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: LunaSeay
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with nice rooms, easy access to all the tourist spots in San Francisco and some of the worst service I have ever experienced. I am a regular traveler, staying in hotels about once every other month or so for several days, and I have stayed in several other hotels in SF that are rated the same as the Parc 55. The biggest difference between these hotels is that the Parc 55 really doesn't seem to value customer service. There was a convention going on during my stay, but from what the staff said there is usually a convention going on. This might have had an effect on my service, but if conventions are a regular event, then I doubt the service improves much from week to week. The good: I got a Club room on the 29th floor and the room and view were beautiful. The breakfast was delicious and varied and I was very glad I upped my reservation for this alone. The bad: The service in general was awful, but be especially wary of the bell staff. When I first arrived my luggage was loaded on to a cart and taken up to meet me at the 2nd floor registration. During the 5 minutes of travel time a small bag containing cash and other valuables went missing. When I pointed this out I was asked to check my car, person, etc. to make sure I had not misplaced it. I did and the bag was just gone, but I know for a fact it was on the cart. This was dismissed by the staff when I brought it to their attention and I was not even offered an apology. Then, on my last day, I had a bellman up to my room to collect my bags and AGAIN during the trip from my room to the bell staff area downstairs THREE items were lost. I was again told to check my room, person, etc. to make sure I hadn't lost these items. Unlikely, as the missing items were a fedora hat, a foam pillow and a t-shirt that was on the pillow. I did as I was asked, but my items were nowhere to be found. I was then berated by a bellman who insisted that I had lost the items on my own. I asked repeatedly for the bell staff to check the service halls and elevator for my missing items, but I was told they were not there. I spoke with managers, bell staff, housekeeping, everyone they could shunt me off to, but no one was helpful at all. I finally had to leave without my items, but I took the names and phone numbers of those involved. I called the next day and spoke with another manager who SHOCKINGLY said, why yes, those items are sitting here in our lost and found. I had to drive nearly two hours to pick them up because the hotel refused to mail them. I will never stay at this hotel again for obvious reasons, but if you choose to do so PLEASE DO NOT USE THE BELL STAFF!!! FOR THE SAFETY OF YOUR LUGGAGE BEWARE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: NC_Rambler
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 was a perfect choice for several days of touring in San Francisco. We were able to get the hotel on Priceline for a very good rate several weeks before traveling. We arrived at the hotel a little after noon. Although the room was not ready this early, the staff gladly kept our luggage as we ventured out for the local sights. When we returned in the evening, we were excited to find ourselves in a corner room (panaramic view) on an upper floor. The view of the city was amazing! The hotel has been recently redecorated in a very trendy style, and the beds/furniture are very comfortable. The location cannot be better....right next to BART, MUNI, cable cars, shopping, etc. There is construction across the street, but the noise from this is not a problem unless you plan to sleep really late in the AM. Also, some other people complain about street noise at night, which is to be expected in the heart of the city. However, it never kept me awake. I would definitely return to the Parc 55 on future trips to San Francisco. The location is ideal, the rooms are large and comfortable, and the staff is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: speedyje9
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Parc 55 hotel and will not be the last. I love this hotel it is my favorite. The service is great, everyone is helpfull. One night the ladies at the front desk got my sister and me on the guest list for Infusion Lounge, to which we had a great time. Our stay was very pleasant, the service was great all around from the valet, technical support, guest service to bell service.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: mademego
Reviews.Content: Close to Powell St BART station with easy access from the airport. Quick check-in. Overall friendly staff thoughout my stay. Room was spacious and appeared to have been recently remodeled. Side chairs were pretty but not comfortable. Roomy bathroom. Great bed. Nice size closet, but limited size on the room safe...could not get my laptop inside. Internet connections for a daily charge. Plenty of good eating options nearby. Barbary Coast Coffee on the corner for breakfast and people watching. 5th floor room facing another building under construction. Very noisy during the day. That convenient location does translate into noise in the evenings too with BART trains and sirens and general traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nwat
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at this hotel. Clean, spacious,quiet and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: bartleby
Reviews.Content: I was in SF for a conference and got a great rate at Parc 55 through priceline. For $100/night, this was a great value. The Good: - Fabulous location. One block from the Union Square Cable Car stop, 2 blocks from Union Square, 5 blocks from the Moscone Convention Center. - Room was clean, spacious. Had a double with two full beds. - No functional problems with lights, heating/cooling, internet. The Not-So-Good: - Our room wasn't ready when we arrived at noon (completely understandable). I was told by the attendant that a room had been set aside for me but needed to be cleaned; I should return at 3pm.
