When I returned at 3pm, I was checked in by a different attendant, who informed me that the first guy had never tagged the assigned room for cleaning, so the room was still not ready. After a short wait, however, she was able to find another room for us. - They have a limited number of small storage lockers in which guests can lock their computers when leaving luggage on your check-in or check-out day. However, if all of the lockers are already taken, they would not take the responsibility of checking my computer bag, and I was stuck lugging it around hilly SF on my check-in day while waiting for my room to be ready. I made sure to check my computer bag early on my check-out day to avoid a repeat of that situation. - No minibar/fridge. Very small in-room safe. Very limited drawer space, though the closet was sizeable. - it's never a good sign when the hotel purposely provides earplugs in every room. Having read the prior reviews about thin walls, the sight of the earplugs was worrisome. However, I never had any problems with noise during my stay. The Just-Plain-Weird: After an extensive recent makeover, you would think that this reasonably handsome hotel would try to exude a cooler vibe. Yet, on my various trips through the main lobby area, my ears were greeted by songs like the theme from Footloose. While I don't mean to insult Kenny Loggins, it just seemed odd for a hotel in an enviable location in a chic city - nothing wrong with this, just odd. All in all, I'd stay there in a heartbeat if I could get a similar rate. Not sure I'd stay there at the advertised rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious and expensive, but great location”
Reviews.Author: oleiros
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location in Downtown San Francisco. It's posh and elegant, and staff are well dressed and pretentious (but friendly). The rooms are modern and well decorated with lots of space. There's an excellent Thai restaurant in the hotel, and a trendy bar. The hotel is pricy and parking is expensive, like most hotels in downtown San Francisco (we parked our car in a nearby multi-story parking garage for less). This is a great place to stay if you want to feel trendy and hip, and the rooms offer great views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, convenient location, great service, all at a low, low promotional price.”
Reviews.Author: JustRelaxGeorgia
Reviews.Content: We planned 4 days in San Francisco, but could only stay at the Westin St. Francis for the last 2 days because they were booked, so we stayed at the Parc 55 for the first 2 days. The hotel far exceeded our expectations and we found the Westin St. Francis far less comfortable and elegant. This 1010 room hotel has been renovated to a very modern theme (not my style) though, peculiarly, did not have a dresser. Our 23rd floor room was large and comfortable with breathtaking view of downtown and the bay. The location is a very short walk to the F line street cars that can take you to the ferries and Fishermen’s Wharf along Embarcadero for only 2 dollars (75 cents for seniors). Nearby are numerous restaurants for a fast breakfast at moderate prices. We’re sorry that we couldn’t stay for the full 4 days but we had already prepaid the Westin St. Francis, which turned out to be less than the elegant hotel we expected. If you are going to visit San Francisco, you should check the rates at Parc 55; you may be pleasantly surprised that this conveniently located, upscale hotel is offering very low promotional rates.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2MNtravelers_JnA
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel located in Union Square. Perfect for transportation as BART station & Cable car stop was located right by the hotel. Made traveling around San Fran very easy, and it was nice hotel to kick back and relax when returning from a full day of touring. The only downside is the restaurant/bar at the hotel is VERY expensive. Stay away from it. We were very disappointed how much they charged us for our drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: krissiejade
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Parc 55 in one of their double club rooms. The front desk staff were incredibly helpful and allowed us to check in early which was great after a long long flight from Australia. The room was huge with 2 full size queen beds, cable tv and a great bathroom. Rooms were always incredibly clean and towels and amenities replaced daily. The location of the hotel is FANTASTIC. The cable car is right outside the hotel and Westfield Shopping centre only a 2 minute walk. Heaps of restaurants and other shopping within very easy walking distance. Staff at the hotel were always very helpful and willing to do whatever they could to make our stay more comfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “This was a beautiful and comfortable place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: mikeg427
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel fearing the worst. With some reviews I've read, it wasn't supposed to be good, but it was far better than I thought. I'll mention four things I noticed that others may want to know. First: Service. When we checked in, the first lady I met wasn't too friendly, and I feared the worst. Having been there too early to check in, I went into the city to sight see before coming back to check in. The second lady I had was very nice, welcoming, and interactive. Many of the staff I had encountered from then on were exactly the same. Even in the morning, the house cleaning lady was very persistent to clean our room (Someone took our Do not Disturb sign) but that was a nice sign too. Second: noise. My response, "What noise?" yeah, there was the sound of traffic outside, but it wasn't too bad in my opinion. Given I was on the 10th floor, it shouldn't be too bad. On lower floors I can see it being a problem, and they know that too. That's why they provide ear plugs in the restroom. You could possibly ask for extra pairs if needed. The only reason my friend needed it was in the morning when the building next door was doing construction work. There was a crane outside our window! haha that's the only bad thing that we noticed noise-wise though. Walls aren't as thin as others claim. The hotel was pretty busy but didn't have any bothersome sounds through the floor, roof, or walls. Third: Area. If you're a music lover,then you'll be happy. The hotel is roughly 4 blocks (don't quote me on that) away from the hotel. My friend and I walked to the concert hall 45 minutes before the concert, and got there 15 minutes early. The area has a few interesting characters, but we did notice that the BART police and SF police did patrol the area and so we felt fine. Fourth: Look. The outside doesn't look like much (to me anyway), but on the inside it is beautiful. The bar and restaurant area is a beautiful area to hang out and relax, and the staff there is very attentive. and here are a few prices you may want to know: The water in the hotel room are $4.50 + tax, and they're 1 liter. The internet costs roughly $12 and it is good for 24 hours. Parking is roughly $55. and they put a $50 deductible on your account when you check in (as many hotels do) Also, any purchases at the bar (I'm not sure about the restaurant, but it should be the same) are charged directly to your room, so no need to fuss with money at the moment. You just enjoy your time. All in all, it was a fantastic stay. I certainly enjoyed myself, and I plan to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alxmaoboc
Reviews.Content: The perfect hotel with a great location. Clean room. Great staff

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 is a "no brainer", sincerely”
Reviews.Author: Supergilbys
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Parc 55 for a week between July 4 and July 11 and my wife and I were treated like "part of the family". On arrival night (at around 9 PM), they gave us a junior suite on the 5th floor. Pretty convenient, but we wanted at first to be in an upper floor. Since it was the 4th of July, the lady at the front desk told us to come back the next day and they would take care of business. That's what happened and we moved to room 1701. Plenty of windows, great views of the city of San Francisco, and well furnished. Place was really quiet in both rooms we were and really nothing at all to complain about. Staff was first class and always ready to give you a hand. Besides, it's really difficult to find a hotel as "central located" as this one. You just have to cross the street to be at Powell St station (with the BART system coming from the SFO airport and going back to it for around 16 $ roundtrip). Same thing for the MUNI system and the trolleys... almost right at your footsteps! If I had to do it again, I would do the same way I did a few months ago when I made my booking through Expedia. And even if I have read a few negative comments about this hotel on this website, I can honestly attest that Parc 55 Hotel is a great place to stay and make the most of what all the magnificient San Francisco area has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Lot of noise and reservation group & hotel check in give diferent info”
Reviews.Author: 1bostonguy
Reviews.Content: I was part of a group of over 300 staying at the hotel. We were given a gaurenteed rate, however the reservation group did not have the info from the sales group and they tried to charge me double. We were also told that a depostit at check in would be $50 per night booked, check in stafff insisted on full cost of stay. The rooms are noisey. If you say anything to the staff the answer is "we provide earplugs in the bathroom". Insulated windows might be a good investment for this hotel. The chairs in the newly renovated room were very uncomfortable. Maid service failed to show up one day of the stay. The supervisor asked if I wanted someone to come out, I said yes, but I needed to get ready to go out and asked for after 5 PM, they arrived at 4:30 disrupting my plans.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: SavageLawyer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in San Francisco over the 4th. Parc 55 was an excellent hotel in a great location close to a huge mall and public transportation. Really good restaurants and Union Square are within a couple blocks. They gave us a huge corner room on the 23rd floor with windows galore. We will definitely stay at this hotel when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very chic, modern hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: dhodory
Reviews.Content: This hotel just went through a re-model and was formerly a Marriott property (it's now independent property). The lobby and reception areas are both very nicely done. The lounge is a great place to relax, enjoy a drink and some appetizers (the food was excellent, if not a little short on portion size). The rooms are nicely done for a hotel in this price range, but not extraordinary. The workout facility is fairly well equipped with multiple treadmills, bikes, steppers, free weights, and machines. The hotel location is great, as it's located right across the street from the rail system as well as a large mall (should you want to do any shopping or need to pick up some essentials). Overall, I'd give this hotel a solid B+ or A- for it's price range and even though it is not part of a chain (where I could get points), I'd strongly consider it if I were to go to SFO again.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls, nice location..”
Reviews.Author: SamiSeppala
Reviews.Content: Extremely thin walls in this hotel, you would think people in next door would be living with you all the time ! We were glad to have nice, almost quiet people in next room, horrified thinking if some youngsters would have been there... Otherwise service ok, nothing spectacular in there. Breakfast buffet small but worth the price. Nice location, but those walls....

Reviews.Title: “Great experience - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisloris
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a great staff. Everyone employee went out of their way to be helpful and friendly. Room was modern and comfortable with a great view and a fantastic bed. Ate in restaurant for dinner one nice - pleasantly suprised. Great food and good service. Price and location can not be beat. This will remain our homebase in San Francisco. Maybe the best hotel experience I have had in last 5 years.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great location”
Reviews.Author: BayGuy08
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very conveniently located for the convention center as well as area shopping, restaurants, BART, and the cable cars. Check-in was a breeze. Our room wasn't ready (due to morning flight) but we were able to store our luggage and go out to eat. When we returned the room was ready. There are plenty of elevators, so never had to wait long, even after returning from a conference event with many people. The rooms are clean and well styled, with lots of comfort (5 pillows on the bed). We did have an early morning fire alarm (4:20 a.m.) - they are loud. The security staff quickly investigated and sounded the all-clear. I would avoid the hotel restaurant - there are many places to eat in the area with better selection and value. But we had a great time staying at the Parc 55. We took BART from the airport to Powell St, only a block away, and also located there is the cable cars if you want to go to Fisherman's Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend with Parc55 as our home base with "No Worries"”
Reviews.Author: CowboyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Overall, we were more than happy with our stay at this hotel. Our weekend started out rockey, cancelled flights, placed on stand-by, missed a lunch cruise but, our stay and weekend was perfect. We stayed at Parc 55 this past weekend for the 3rd and 4th of July 09. This was our 4th wedding anniversary. Deciding to stay at Parc55 was decided after a few calls late night calls to the hotel with questions, and each time we were transferred to the front desk staff and based on the helpfulness of this staff I booked two nights. The questions I asked were not just hotel matters but, on items such as getting around and things to see and do. They made recommendations for Breakfast, Lunch even Dinner, none of which disappointed us. Although they will not grant early check-ins, I was told that I could check bags with the Bell desk for keeping if we were going sightseeing until we checked-in. We arrived back later that afternoon (Friday July, 3) at the front desk and to my surprise the hotel had upgraded us to a premier view suite with a balcony on the 30th floor due to it being our wedding anniversary. The room was five stars all the way with everything down to the Turkish bath robes to the King bed with feather pillows with chocolates. The front desk person was one of the most pleasant people I met during our entire stay in San Francisco. The people at the front desk really took the time to provide the care that is not often found with a large hotel especially when they cater to a large volume of business from airlines and conventions; CISCO was having a convention at the time. Although I was extremely satisfied with the staff of the front desk and bell desk and quality of the room... I cannot say the same about the hostess and host in the Cityhouse restaurant / bar, our waitress was wonderful. I typically wear Jeans and Polo shirts with jogging shoes and can afford to dress however I like and have no need to impress anyone, the Hostess especially, made us feel like I she was advising us that I may not have enough money to eat or drink in their restaurant and could I afford it? The Host just ignored us than looked the other way and walked away almost offended? Go figure, I’ll spend more on lunch than he makes in a week. We chose to have a couple of glasses of good red wine and eat at one of the upscale restaurants in town. I am giving this hotel a 5 star because the view from our room was wonderful, the staff, excluding the hostess / host in the restaurant, were first class and the beds were amazingly comfortable. Also, the location the location could not be better. The F-Line electric buss go to Fisherman’s Warf and the Powell- Hyde cable car line is across the road which gives access straight to Union Square (only a quick walk away anyway) right down to the piers on the waterfront for $5 a ride (if you are in San Francisco more than a day buy a mutli-pass 3day ticket it’s $18.00 it is not sold on the cars only at a ticket window). Tourist Information office is just adjacent to it too, as is the giant five floor shopping mall with many upscale stores in it. Going to and from the Airport is a fun ride on the BART for a round trip cost of $16.00 and takes about 60 minutes. The BART Station is a block away from the hotel. This will be my hotel of choice whenever we are in San Francisco. Had a great time and wonderful value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nephy
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel through Priceline for under $100 - what a bargin! Its right across from the BART - which made it easy to get to and from the airport. Located right in the middle of Union Square, you're close to all the shopping. The hotel was recently redone and the rooms and common areas are very nice. They gym is small, but has the necessary equipment. I just wish it had a hottub!

Reviews.Title: “Tried and Tried again...”
Reviews.Author: Business_TravelMan
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed after getting comped a room because previously the hotel was overbooked and didn't have my room. After finding another hotel the previous trip, I called and complained and they were very good at remedying the situation and giving me a free stay while back in town. The wait times at the front desk are long. The hotel key maker wasn't working so after several trips up and down to try and get it fixed we just waited it out. The door staff etc. were friendly. There is no pool so this hotel isn't very good for young kids, but the location is great for shopping and seeing downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Go Somewhere Else!”
Reviews.Author: mmiranda415
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights. Very close to BART and Muni. A/C didn't work, tv reception was not clear, very, very thin noise and they didn't disclosue nearby construction. Most expensive room I'd ever sweat in as I paid over three hundred dollars for saturday night and not one sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great Location, Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: K82Travel
Reviews.Content: A friend and myself checked into the Parc for a 5 night stay while in San Francisco for leisure travel. The hotel itself was gorgeous, when we walked in we were impressed at how nice and contempory it looked. I had stayed there before and noticed how nice the upgrades looked. A friend who lived in SF came to visit our hotel and noted how 'swanky' it looked. We checked in with no problem. The room was gorgeous, plenty of towels, large, clean bathroom. I used the gym and was impressed how nice it was. Very modern equipment, lots of free-weights, machines, and workout balls, ect. Our only issue was with customer service. We called the contiegre and left a message and they never got back to us. We wanted a shuttle to take us to the airport, but we were leaving very early. We then asked the belldesk and they told us no shuttles ran that early. Little did we know that plenty of shuttles ran 24 hours and would pick you up wherever. And cost less than the one recommended by the hotel. It would have been nice to be told than instead of given attitude. We also asked for directions to Golden Gate park and the bellhop was very confusing. Instead we went down to the service area and they were able to tell us how to get their quickly and even gave us a map! We also ate at the restaurant. It was very overpriced, mediocre, and we were seated by an overly romantic, PDA couple. Watching them made me want to vomit up my entire dinner. In conclusion, great place to stay if appearences are what matter and you don't want to talk to the employees.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, decent price”
Reviews.Author: rainier98
Reviews.Content: The service was friendly and adequate. Nothing spectacular but nothing to detract from the experience. The room was nice but the giant treadmill in the corner was a big eye sore and waste of space. We had the corner "view room" and the views were spectacular. Very comfortable beds. The bar and restaurant are very nice. We did not have an issue with the walls being thin and they did not charge a $100/day deposit to my card as other reviews have mentioned. The noise from the street on the 29th level was very loud. I could not imagine being on the lower levels. We spent most of our time at Fisherman's Wharf so the travel back and forth was a hassle. The F-Line can be difficult to get on to return to the hotel due to high passenger volume. If you intend to spend most of your time at the Wharf, I'd suggest getting a hotel closer. A cab ride from the Wharf to the Parc 55 is only $9-10 (not including tip).

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: danielchu
Reviews.Content: Internet is not working, and walls are thin -- if you are looking for a place to rest and sleep after a long day walking around SFO, this is NOT it! I have to admit that the location is amazing. It's 2 minutes from Powell BART station; hence, I can see a lot of businessmen and airline crews here. The room was clean, but the walls are way too thin. In a downtown area, you need pretty thick walls to block the noise out there. This decreases your willingness to stay especially after a long day walking around SFO. Therefore, I don't recommend any travelers who are not here for business to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Wanderers98
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in Union Square, the Parc 55 is walking distance from the BART station which is perfect for families having just arrived on a long flight. Easy check-in and check out, rooms were clean and surprisingly quiet, although this might be due to the fact that we requested a room on a high level having read previous TripAdvisor reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: ciara99
Reviews.Content: We satyed here as part of our honeymoon whilst travelling in the US booked last minute - and where really happy with the hotel. Two large beds in all rooms with a modern twist - a lot of business people seem to use it - great shops restaurants and bars right on your doorstep. Staff can't do enough to help you - I would give this hotel 100% concierge booked all our trips to alcatraz at discount prices. Rooms great and spacious air con also great not that you need it in san francisco!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but walls are thin”
Reviews.Author: eveysiy
Reviews.Content: the location is great as others have said, but the walls are so thin. we could hear every word our neighbors were saying and they weren't even being loud. sounded like they were just having a normal conversation. hallway noise is particularly loud too. we had to ask to move to another room because we couldn't sleep. that room was much better, but we could still hear the hallway noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: NL1982
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the most perfect location - just across the street from the Powell BART station which brings you from the airport to downtown and at the cable cars and buses. Some people have complained about the hotel being too close to a "bad" neighbourhood (Tenderloin). We've spoken to some locals and though they don't encourage us to wander through the area at night it really isn't that bad. Just to give you the complete picture: the hotel is located directly opposite Nordstrom, Bloomingdales and lots of really fancy shops. The exterior of the hotel looks a bit outdated, but inside it's really nice. They have recently renovated the rooms and reception area (which probably also explains the noise other reviewers were complaining about) and everything looks fresh, modern and tidy. We stayed in room 1311 and the airconditioning did need some TLC to get started. The bathroom and room itself were great. Super comfy bed, huge tv and a clean and large bathroom. There are complimentary ear plugs which I had to use (light sleeper) but they did the trick. The only thing that disappointed me was the 13 dollar fee for 24 hours use of internet! We tried getting an unsecured WIFI connection but ended up in Starbucks one block up the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: SouthernSkier1154
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in San Francisco for a few days before spending several days traveling down the Pacific Coast Highway down to L.A. While in SF, we had a very enjoyable stay at the Parc 55 and would definitely stay there again! First of all, we took BART from the airport to Union Square and were pleasantly surprised that the hotel was right across the street from the BART station. It was great not having to drag all of our luggage several blocks or having to pay for a taxi or bus. As we approached a hotel, a doorman immediately asked us if we needed help bringing in our luggage, and the rest of the staff was friendly and courteous. Both the lobby and our room were modern and well-appointed. We paid a very reasonable AAA rate for a two club rooms (located on floors 28-32) and were not disappointed. The views were beautiful, and the beds were extremely comfortable. Club rooms also included evening hors'devours and breakfast at the club lounge on the 31st floor. The food was delicious! The hotel's location was always a plus, as well. Besides being next to the BART station, it is a block from the cable cars and convenient to great shopping. The backside of the hotel is near the seedy Tenderloin area, but we never walked towards that direction, and never felt unsafe at all. I also understand that the valet parking is expensive, but we waited to rent our car until the day we left San Francisco so that was not a problem for us. Overall, we would be more than happy to come back to the Parc Fifty Five if we return to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “This place sucks! NOISY! A/C does not work! Don't GO THERE!”
Reviews.Author: lovintraveling3
Reviews.Content: I was referred to this hotel by a friend and therefore had pretty high hopes. Positive: This hotel is within walking distance of the mall Lobby is beautiful and contemporary, the restaurant is as well. The hotel room looks nice online, however once entering the room it looked like it once was an older hotel with newer furniture. Location: This hotel is on the outer edge of union square across from the Westfield Mall and backed up against a shady neighborhood. Even when checking in the reservation employee circled our current location & then drew an arrow directly behind the hotel stating that it is an area of high crime. We did not wander that way during our stay but on the day of check out we did drive that way and all we saw were crack addict looking people. So she was right! Room: New Furniture, no mini bar, drinks at the vending machine outside is $2.50 so you are better off going to Walgreens before going back to your hotel. AC does not work we had to turn it to 62 degrees to get cold air and even then it took several hours to finally get cool. You are even better off a the Marriott. Internet; There were several cheaper places that offers free wifi around the area, I was disturbed to find out that this hotel charged $13/day. Parking: $44/day! Room Service: Food arrived cold We stayed very high up on the 19th floor however it was extremely noisy. We had a king suite next to apparently noisy people who stayed up until 4am talking loudly and drunkenly probably. Banging of the doors etc...I can deal with outside noise which is expected of a busy city like this and New York. However the class of the people staying in this hotel is ridiculous. There must have been 10 girls in 1 room partying. Its not the RED ROOF INN! My boyfriend and I are a young couple, we drink go out and have fun but even the noise was just ridiculous. When reporting the complaint to the desk they did not resolve the matter after continuing to hear the noise and disruption for another 20 mins, I called again, finally speaking to a security personnel who resolved the matter. I've learned my lesson and will gladly pay an extra $100 for class. This place is horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding- much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: california_trip09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights before heading down to LA and received an upgrade to a suite from a superior room(without asking, still not sure why but obviously didnt complain!) . It was amazing, much bigger than our own flat in London! We were on the top floor with amazing views across San Fran. The hotel itself was lovely, modern, and clean, with polite desk staff. We didnt eat in the restaurant so can't comment on that, but the cafe beside the entrance had great value for breakfast/lunch. The area was perfect for us as we were there to do sightseeing and the odd bit of shopping - it was across the road from a big shopping centre and right beside the tourist info centre, the BART stop (which goes to and from the airport so is really handy) and its really near the start of the cable cars/trams that take you down to fishermans wharf. We got the three day passport for the carts which was good value. The reason I gave a 4/5 for service was only because they didnt replace the coffee and milk in the room on 2 occasions, but otherwise it was good, with 2 services/day to the room. The bed was really comfortable and the decor was modern. I would really recommend this hotel for anyone visiting san fran for the first time and who is interested in shopping and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: lovessanfran
Reviews.Content: The rooms were good, location was convientent and view was amazing but the customer service was dreadfull!! We had plenty of money to spend but walked in wearing jeans and t-shirts, a lady at check in, named Cristina, was extremly snoody not one that should work with the public. I will never stay there again due to her attitude!

Reviews.Title: “Sure, It's Loud....But Great Location & Nice Value”
Reviews.Author: TexasLover
Reviews.Content: It's no secret that the Parc 55 Hotel is in the path of lots of street noise, especially if you are facing Market Street. The sirens are the biggest culprit at all hours of the night, but it's something you get used to pretty quickly. The hotel is really nice and the rooms are comfortable. The views are amazing. We are certainly in the category of budget travelers who were pleasantly surprised that this hotel showed up on a Priceline bid. We were double upgraded at check in. Our Priceline rate assured us a Deluxe Room (up to the 19th floor with a king bed). We asked for a high room and got a 20th floor View Room (20th-26th floors) with two double beds. The double beds are considered an upgrade at this hotel....at least price wise. We were very satisfied. No problems at check in, but we did not get in until 8:30 p.m......no line at all. We liked the 37" flat screen TV and the 5 soft pillows on each bed. The noise kept us up the first night, but we did better with our sleep from there. No problems with housekeeping. The room was very clean. Thanks to the great information on Trip Advisor, we knew not to rent a car. We were glad to avoid the very high nightly parking rates and the hotel is right on The Powell Station for BART and the cable car turnaround. It was easy to get around town. We bought a City Pass at the Visitor's Center at the Powell Station and it was a reasonable value. We did not use the Internet service or the restaurant. There was a nice mall acroos the street with cheaper dining options. The business center would have cost us $20.00 to print out our boarding passes, but the Concierge did it without charge.....and we tipped for the courtesy. The bellman was very accommodating and held our bags after checkout so we could sight see with free hands up until 2:30 p.m. when we needed to head for the airport. We were pleased with the hotel. It met everyone of our very basic needs and was in a really nice location for wide eyed tourists like us. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, great location, would definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: gkinny
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel on travelocity.com for half price. I stayed with 6 friends in connecting rooms. One was a king room one was a 2 double bed room. I called a couple of weeks before our stay to request connecting rooms, non smoking rooms and I also requested a room on an upper floor(because of the street noise). All of my requests were met. One room was ready when we arived so we checked into that room early. The other room was ready just a couple hours later. We had a great time in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: GingelaOK
Reviews.Content: If you are planning on going to Union Square for shopping, etc., then this is wonderful. We couldn't have asked for a better location. The room was clean and well-appointed, and when we had a problem with the shower head, it was fixed immediately and courteously. If you want to complain about parking rates, you haven't traveled to big cities often enough to know to check on that before you rent a car and go downtown. Locating reasonable parking garages was easy in that area because we knew to do that. Parc 55 was easy to get to, and it was close enough to Powell to be handy, but far enough away to keep the noise level down. The bar served a great drink. We were very pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and unexpected costs”
Reviews.Author: SantaBarbaraJohn
Reviews.Content: Not a good hotel and not a bad hotel. It goes to what is important when you are on a business trip. Parking is $55.00 per night. Drive one block up from the hotel and there is the parking garage that the hotel uses. Self park there for $20 per night. Internet is $17 per day. Three doors down at Starbucks it's free. Noisy. Requested a room on one of the upper floors. Got the 18th floor and we could hear music and revelers from the bar across the street and streetsweepers woke us up at 4am. The inconvenience for business travelors doesn't make this place competitive with the customer service oriented, comparably priced boutique hotels that surround it.

Reviews.Title: “Ehh....”
Reviews.Author: babunsanti
Reviews.Content: Other than being nickled and dimed for every little thing, the room was clean, the location great, the base rate reasonable, and the service friendly. I would recommend the hotel to friends/colleagues with the warning of the outrageous parking fee, and other service fees which are higher than most places I've stayed. Noise was an issue - both outside traffic (didn't really mind) and in-hotel (thin walls?). For the price, I also expected nicer rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms at the Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: txn
Reviews.Content: My son (college student) and I did a quick trip to San Francisco this week. We arrived at 10:30 a.m. after a very short walk from the BART station ($5.35 one way from SFO) and were very happy that they had a room available for us despite checking in hours before the official check in time. Our room didn't have much of a view (was on the 13th floor) but we didn't expect a view room with the price we got on the hotel's web site (109/night). The beds were very comfortable and the room was very stylish. We had a flat screen tv which had a nice variety of channels, including HBO. The bathroom was large and even had a phone in it. The only complaint I really would have with the bathroom would be that there is no vent fan and the bathroom is a bit dark. But everything else was good with a generous amount of towels and even a magnifying mirror. The location, as I said before, is really good if you don't plan on bringing a car, since it is very close to the BART Station, a cable car turnaround, and a very nice mall. There are several Walgreens not too far away if you forgot something and on the other end of the spectrum, at the Mall there is a Nordstroms. There is a charge for the internet but we didn't use our computer there at the hotel. They have a fitness center and a business center, again neither one was used by us. I would stay at the Parc 55 again if I go back to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice remodel”
Reviews.Author: Leslie K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 May 13-15 at the end of a trip to the Wine Country. Got the hotel for $86/night on Priceline and we were very happy with the accommodations for the price. The hotel went through a remodel that was finished about 6 weeks ago and it's very sleek and modern looking right now. Definitely a nice surprise, especially for the price we paid. Location is great; walking distance to several restaurants, Union Square and the cable car/BART stop. The only negative was that the bathroom was a little small. Other than that, great hotel, we'd definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: Besos111
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited San Francisco for the first time and stayed at the Parc 55 Hotel for five days. The hotel rooms are very clean and the service was great. I had called ahead and requested a room on a higher floor and my request was granted with no problems. Our room was a bay view with exceptional views! Everything was just steps outside of the hotel...BART....cable cars...downtown. We were very pleased with the location and will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location!”
Reviews.Author: katunga29
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in early April 2009. Positives Located right in the middle of the shopping area of San Farncisco at 55 Cyril Magnin St, about 100 metres to the new Westfield shopping centre . Room was comfortable and clean. Staff were very helpful and couldn't do enough for us. Terrific location. Very reasonable tariff if booking online. Negatives Entrance was difficult to locate as it was off street at level 2. No swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Pleasure to Stay at Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: nycgeorgian
Reviews.Content: I can't say the negative reviewers are wrong, but I've stayed at this hotel 6 or 7 times, maybe more. My traveling attire is always casual, running pants and baggy shirt, light jacket, gators. So, I know they don't give you a bad room because of your dress. With each visit if a room on a high floor with a view was available, I was given such a room. Service has always been professional and friendly. Rooms are lovely and beds are comfortable. Rooms are business friendly too. Good lights, good chair. Sorry for the trouble the other reviewers had, but I've always had a good experience with this hotel -- and I've always booked through hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer (Credit card) Beware!!”
Reviews.Author: EBSIrl
Reviews.Content: I and my three friends had the pleasure of visiting San Francisco in May this year (wonderful city). We chose to stay in Parc 55 and the hotel did meet our expectations. The rooms and location were ideal for our trip. HOWEVER!!! I came home to find an extra charge on my credit card for a 3rd room apparently attached to my booking. This is despite the fact that I (as directed) printed my booking and produced it upon check-in. I have a copy of my reservation confirmation stating that 2 rooms were booked and listing all four guests. There is no mention of a 3rd room. When I realised there was an extra charge and a charming lady informed me that the hotel would not have chosen my name or credit card out of the millions of people in the world to charge and couldn't have been less helpful. She did eventually suggest that she could pass the "case" to a manager. I await his call...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but be aware of . . .”
Reviews.Author: afishinSC
Reviews.Content: I would not rate this hotel as a 4 star, but it is a 3+. The rooms have been upgraded with new furniture and linens, but they left the old carpet (really, just change it), and the rather old wallpaper. However, they are clean and neat. At first, they gladly informed me that there were only two rooms available, a suite that they would gladly give me for my quoted price, and a room on a lower floor, that was just the deluxe I reserved. Well of course I opted for the suite, BUT when I got there, it was a bit nasty - stained carpet, horrible view - not so great bathroom, so I went back downstairs and asked if I could see the Deluxe I reserved. They said sure, and when I went to that room, it was much cleaner, nice view, just better overall - I kept that room and told them no thanks to the upgraded suite. During check in, after they took my id and credit card, they informed me that they just charged my credit card and extra $100. per day - surprise! Apparently it is their policy to charge this for any incidentials that you might rack up during your stay. For me it was an extra $500 seeing I was staying for 5 nights. I protested a bit letting the clerk know that she really should not charge one's credit card without their knowledge. It is unacceptable to inform me AFTER the fact. With that she said she would reverse that charge, and just have me pre-pay for the room. I still don't know what that was all about. But I did not feel too comfortable with all the charging and reversing she did on my credit card, so when I got settled in my room, I called my credit card company to see what just went on. Well I am glad I did because she charged me twice for the room and twice for the incidentials and only reversed one of the incidentials charges. I call the front desk and explained what I just learned and at first they were a bit pompus and said they will explain how a credit card works. When I told them I was clearly aware how a credit card works and didn't need their lesson, they did indeed correct the charges (as I verified the next day with my credit card company). There are plenty of amenities at this hotel, but NOTHING is free. The bottled water left in your room - $4.50 each, a fridge $25., internet access $12.50/day, etc. Just know whatever great price you landed on the internet for this hotel, is for the room, and the room only. The location couldn't be better. Every type of transportation available in SF is available to you right across the street, and you never have to wait more than 5-10 minutes for any of them. We bought the City-Pass, and it was the best thing we did. We could get on and off of any type of transportation, (trolley, cable car, bus anything except taxi's) without paying extra, and it included coupons for many attractions. This also can be purchased right across the street at the Visitors Center. Take Lorries Shuttle from the airport to the hotel for about $16 pp, and they will give you a coupon for your return trip for $12 pp The bellman services were exceptional. The restaurant is over-priced. There are too many great, reasonable restaurants around. I say yes, go there, but understand that nothing is free!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience.”
Reviews.Author: armyxrays1978
Reviews.Content: I am writing to complain about my experience at this hotel on May 16th 2009. I arrived to check in to the hotel at approximately 4pm and waited in line to check in for 20 minutes. When I got to the check in counter, the staff member explained to me that there was not a room available despite my fully prepaid reservation. She explained I would have to relocate myself to the Marriott Hotel. When I asked to speak to a supervisor, the supervisor went on to explain that because I had booked through hotels.com, we would be asked to leave the Parc 55 due to overbooking. I had these reservations well in advance. This night was meant to be special for my wife and I who were celebrating our 7 year anniversary. Needless to say, this huge unexpected inconvienance ruined our night. This took a full 3 hours out of our evening. I do not understand the hotel's policy of allowing a room to be booked and paid for, only to give the room to someone else. If you do not honor your 3rd party bookings, why allow it at all? I felt completely disrespected, embarrassed and humiliated by this experience. I also feel that I was discriminated against based on my age and my dress. I was dressed to attend the SF Giants baseball game that just finished. Regardless of my age or because I had jeans and a Giants T-shirt on, I have plenty of money to spend at hotels like these, but I will not return to the Parc 55. I am thankful that the Marriott took us in, but I did not receive what a paid for, which was a renovated deluxe King room at the Parc 55 hotel. The room at the Marriott was not to standard, dirty, outdated, and the view I had was of the hotel interior. Hotels.com has issued me a full refund. The Parc 55 should be ashamed of itself.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience at Parc 55- brilliant location and professional staff”
Reviews.Author: Manny08
Reviews.Content: I had the most wonderful stay at The Parc 55. recommended by my sister as amazing value for money and excellent location in the heart of all the shops and things to do. Catch the trolley to the Quay or just shop until you drop. It is all there. Ericka at Reception checked me in and Hanif is an encyclopedia about where to go and how to get there. he is calm and so professional. Thanks to Ericka and Hanif for an amazing stay. see you soon! Manny , Vancouver, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4 star hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: dominik_r
Reviews.Content: I wasn’t really sure where to stay in San Francisco and found the Parc 55 @ a very good price and expected not much. As I do like to use public transport wherever it is offered I took the bart train from the airport to powell station, which is next to the hotel. This is already a plus for the hotel. Check in was hassle free and I took the advantage to use their Club Lounge as well. Room was on a high floor with nice view over the city and comes with to small double beds, flat screen TV and a bathroom with bathtub. Layout and style was pretty nice- I would rate it 4 Star. In room Internet access for 24h is 12.95USD. The Club Lounge is typical American fair- you need to use your Key Card to enter- so no real concierge service. The view is nice and the complimentary continental breakfast contains bagels,toast, cold cuts, fresh fruits and pastries of a good quality. During the evening they do offer small snacks like cheese and crackers and some sweets. Soft drinks are free of charge but for the booze you will have to pay. If you are not fancy about a Club Lounge- there is even a grab and go breakfast buffet in the lobby. This is indeed not a world- class hotel but overall I was quiet surprised with the service received.

Reviews.Title: “Very positive experience for 2 picky travelers”
Reviews.Author: RockChalk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights, after booking for a very reasonable price on Priceline. Given the low rates, we were prepared for (and honestly would have been fine with) anything. We are both somewhat light sleepers and our biggest concern at any hotel is noise. Obviously, staying so close to Union Square and the cable car turntable, we expected to hear some street noise. Thus, we asked for a room on the highest available floor (without paying for an upgrade). The check-in representative was very willing to accommodate us, and she even went out of her way to make sure we weren't stuck in a room adjacent to the elevators. Ultimately, we had a room on the 23rd floor, and noise--from the street, from other rooms, etc.--was never a problem. We were quite pleased. The room, in all other respects, was fantastic, too. The bed and pillows were very comfortable, and the room and bathroom were very spacious. We had a great view, and the location was unbeatable (steps from the BART, cable cars, and other public transit). We did not explore much of the hotel outside our room. We didn't pay for wireless internet access (a fairly high rate). Likewise, we didn't have a car, so the steep parking rates didn't affect us. Given the rates and the hotel's great location, I would strongly discourage bringing a car. Overall, we were very pleased with our two nights at Parc 55, and we will be happy to stay there again on our next visit to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: 19robbo66
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights from 7 May on a room on the 27th floor, which gave us access to the Club Lounge on the 31st floor for Continental breakfast. Because the rooms are currently being discounted, this was good value for money. We didn't get a spectacular view of the city unfortunately, because our room was facing the wrong side. But apart from that the breakfast, room decor, and service were all what I would expect from a city center hotel of this calibre. There was a lot of noise from the street, but the complimentary ear plugs blocked it out (I am a light sleeper). I agree with the other reviewer about the enthusiastic housekeeping staff. Not only do they want to start early, they also knock later to check the room was serviced. So make sure you put that "Do Not Disturb" sign out if you want some privacy. The location, just a few steps from the Powell St cable car which takes you to Fisherman's Wharf was great. You can also take the retro F-line trams from Market Street (again, just a short walk from the hotel). There are also plenty of dining options in every direction. On a more general note, I've never seen so many beggars before visiting San Francisco. But none was aggressive. Personally, I prefer to tip the buskers who are at least doing something in return for money.

Reviews.Title: “Would return again”
Reviews.Author: mswesleyforever
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time being in the middle of union square...the room was nice the bed was excellent. The view was not what i wanted, but they were going under construction so i couldnt get it....our check in time was suppose to be at 3pm, but they let us check in early.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for its superb location and value”
Reviews.Author: TheHOs
Reviews.Content: Had booked two rooms for my family and sisters after attending our daughter's wedding in Los Angeles. The extended trip was equally momentuous where we had great time shopping, sightseeing and including drinking in the comfort of our rooms. Was glad to have booked the Park 55 club . Must say that the staff, Robert, and Sergio in the platinium lounge (30th floor) were superb in their service making us feel very "at home". The hotel was very conveniently located to the shopping areas and near to the tram station and bus stops along market street. One recommendation is for better signage and location to the business center which was rather deserted on the 4th floor making it quite frightening for your guest to be alone using the internet , if at all. Also, Your chambermaid enthusiasm to do their job woke us up at 8.30am when they knocked at our doors to check if we want our rooms to be made. Overall , Park 55 is a highly recommended hotel for anyone going to San Francisco notwithstanding an uncalled unpleasant and snide remarks by your bellboy ,Oscar over his tips when handling our luggage.! Room 2853_57

Reviews.Title: “very happy”
Reviews.Author: sarahjoshua
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel. we found the staff and concierge in particular to be extremely helpful. for the price we paid we couldn't believe what we got. Theres a cheap coffee shop just down stairs so no need to use the hotel breakfasts...

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly staff, fabulous views and location”
Reviews.Author: FirstClassLady
Reviews.Content: I didn't know where to stay and got more confused the more I looked, really. Decided not to stay at Hotel Drisco as it is a bit far away from the attractions and public transport, but did take a chance on Parc55, spending a bit more money on a Club Floor room (so we could use the lounge and take advantage of the continental breakfast, evening hors d'oeurves and desserts - all very nice, too). This hotel is in a great location, only minutes from Union Square and the cable car and some great shopping. There were a few panhandlers, but actually they are everywhere you go, including posh Union Square and eclectic Fisherman's Wharf, and they are not at all threatening (some are even funny). The room was fabulous (we got the upgrade of a lifetime)with great views from huge picture windows and the hotel staff were friendly and very welcoming. It was a lovely place to go back to at the end of the day. One downside was the noise of the city (which reached even the 32nd floor, but was less noticeable once the jet lag wore off!). I thought about spending a lot of money on a hotel room in Nob Hill, but really, value for money (and I include friendly service in the value) is very important these days and the Parc 55 provided all of that.

Reviews.Title: “Only positive feature is the location.”
Reviews.Author: JJ_NYC2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a few blocks from Union Square. That's it-- that's its only selling point. Otherwise it is oddly configured, cheap, and NOT a four star hotel. Also, the elevators were not functioning well and a constant source of irritation. As we attempted to check in, we entered through the streel level and had to wait for an elevator to reach the second floor for the registration desk (which is odd). We had to wait behind 30 people who were also using the hotel for its event space -- the whole process was dispiriting and annoying. In short everything about this hotel feels wrong, mostly because it is aspiring to be a 4-star but only putting in half the budget. It just doesn't work.

Reviews.Title: “totally unexpected”
Reviews.Author: kenaus1
Reviews.Content: Paid 89.00 got upgraded to king view. We were so happy. This is a very nice hotel.Shopping all around, Bart across the street. Bed very comfortable.What else can I say???

Reviews.Title: “Go for the executive rooms”
Reviews.Author: pean
Reviews.Content: Booked an executive room directly on hotel website. Rebooked 3 times beacause the price got lower. Ended up with a 124$ + tax for an executive (double)room on 29th floor including lounge acces with free breakfast and afternoon hors d'euvres. Location: Perfect for tourist purpose, absolutely Check-in: No problem when we arrived around 4 pm Room: room 2920 which was a very large corner room with fantastic wiew from 3 windows. Walk-in closet, large flatscreen and even a a fitnessmachine. Coffe and tea maker as well. Icebucket so you could get icecubes at the icemachines. No fridge ;o(. Wireless internet was 12.99 for 24 hours, but we had a 50% discount. Cleaning: No problem Conclusion: A very big hotel, but we did not feel it that way. The upper floors have not so many rooms. The price was very attractive, don't know if we just were lucky. Tip: Go to biscuits and blues a short walk from the hotel, ok food and good blues/jazz Lounge: Nice breakfast and ok hors d'euvres. Softdrinks was free.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in Parc 55 - THIEVES ARE ON THE PROWL”
Reviews.Author: TheGoldenMidas
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 nights on the executive floor of this 4 star hotel and can't say I would recommend it to friends. Firstly, the executive lounge located on the 32nd floor is tiny and bleak. It can be a real scrum to get breakfast first thing in the morning, and about 50% of the time, it wasn't even possible to get a seat in the lounge. The staff in the lounge aren't particularly helpful either. There's nothing executive about the experience. The staff aren't particularly helpful either. The number of times we called the front desk to speak to a manager and were told they were either in a meeting or unavailable was extraordinary. They always promised a call back, and without exception (on 3 occassions) that call never came. WARNING: use the in-room safe. The hotel publicity states that safety deposit boxes are available at reception, but they are actually in the room. We had over $200 stolen from our room and whilst the wannabe cop who is the director of security was initially helpful, we never had contact from him again. Customer service in the hotel is a real let down, which is a shame, because the hotel is in a fantastic location and comes at a great price. All in all, my advice is don't spend the extra money on the executive floor. It really isn't worth it. Shop around other hotels in SFO, and if you are planning for staying for more than a few days, telephone them to try and negotiate a better rate. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: as530
Reviews.Content: this is one of the cheaper 4* places in such a prime location. Rooms great, but the reception is on floor 2, which is a little strange. No free wifi. TV OK. I requested view, got 18th floor, giving great view over city.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Convenient Location & Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bliss920
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 was a great place to stay - especially since it was our first trip to SF. The location is extremely convenient - it is around the corner (less than a block) from the Powell St BART station and the beginning of the cable car route (also Powell St)! Taking the BART to and from SFO was SO EASY and definitely recommended at $5.35/person each way (much less than taking a shuttle or taxi). Union Square is only a few blocks away and Market Street is a half block (not even) to the south. The hotel staff was very polite and accomodating. They were very helpful in booking a rental car for us for the one day we left the city. We had a GREAT room on the 31st floor (2nd from the top) - with an amazing view of the city and the bay! The room was clean, plenty big enough and the (king) bed was very comfy! The only complaint is the lack of drawer space, but we made it work! The bathroom was also a good size and very clean! Also since we were so high up, we heard barely any street noise, with the exception of the occasional sirens. They also provide travel books/magazines in the rooms with GREAT suggestions for places to eat -- we found some of our best restaurants in them! The lobby is still under construction, however aside from having to head to the 2nd floor to check-in (which is very easy to do), you wouldn't know it! I never heard any noise or encountered any issues! The 2nd floor lobby area is very nice and looks as though it is supposed to be there! The restaurant was nice, but we didn't eat there - just stopped in for a drink one night before heading up to our room. Drinks were about average price for the area. There is a great bar/pub a block up from the hotel - Foley's Irish House - we frequented this place the 2nd half of the week - great beer and they ususally had live music! Overall, this was a great, convenient place to stay and we would recommend it to anyone! Insider tips: 1) Buy the Muni Passport (I believe they come in 1, 3, 5 or 7 Day passes) - it pays for itself very quickly (Cable Car ride = $5 each way)!! We used the cable cars, trolleys and buses every day - which is a very convenient way to get around! 2) Although the lines get pretty long at the cable car turn-arounds -- they usually move pretty quickly - or you can head up a block or two and jump on!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rate, Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hjmover
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 4/10/09-4/12/09 over Easter weekend. I landed the hotel on Priceline for a rate of $72 plus taxes and fees. Parc 55 webrates were in the mid 80's so I saved just a few bucks. The hotel was very busy when I arrived and the hotel front desk said the property was full. There was alot of activity but I am always surprised when my Priceline bid is accepeted at a hotel that says they are full. The hotel entrance is located right near the Powell Street BART so its very convenient to take the subway from the airport to the hotel. It costs $5.35 each way for about a 30 minute ride. It is is very easy to use. I got off the part and walked across the the street onto Cyril Magnin. The hotel entrance is right on the corner and one has to take an elevator up from the Cyril Magnin Street entrance to the registration desk on the second floor. I had to wait a few minutes for an elevator since their was a line. Their was a small line as well waiting to check-in but I only had to wait a few minutes. The clerk was very gracious and greeted me kindly. She made no mention on Priceline and honored my verbal request for a room on a high floor. I knew from reading tripadvisor.com that a room on a high floor would be less noisey with a nicer view. I was assigned room 2957. I was a bit disappointed when I got off the elevator to see my room was very close to the elevator and right across from the ice and soda machine. Yet, I was pleasantly surprised when I opened the door to see a sleek, well appointed room. The room had a large king bed with nice sheets and a quality duvet. There was a flat screen tv, a small couch, a desk, three telephones, coffee maker, and a large window that had a partially blocked view of the bay and civic center area. I could see what I thought was Alcatrez. I was even more satisfied when I laid down on the bed. It was very very very comfortable. Since I am diabetic and did not see a minibar to place my insulin, I called down for a refrigerator. Housekeeping brought one to the room very quickly for no charge. I quickly umpacked my clothes for the weekend and noticed there was not to much drawere space for clothes. There were a few hangers in the closet along with two robes, but storage would be a problem for a longer stay. I checked out the bathroom which had all the stardard amenitites, a free bottle of water, a nice tub and three large, fluffy bath towels. Some of the bath amentities included ear plugs for noise and mouthwash. After checking out the room and the view I hooked up my computer via a wireless connection for $12.95 per 24 hours. The connection was strong. After checking emails, I went to the gym, which is free of charge, to work out.. The fitness center was great, It has lots of aerobic equipment, free weights, and weight machines. The room was relatively empty and I had a great work out. After the work out, I headed via BART to the Mission District for some burritos. The tacqueria's in the Mission make great, really large burrio's. I grabbing a carne asada burrito at El Farolito near the 24th and Mission BART stop for under five bucks. The burrito tasted amazing. Although there was a chill in the air I took the long walk back to the Parc 55. It took about 35-40 minutes. I walked along Mission to Gough to Market whcih is a very colorful neighborhood. Maybe there is shorter way but it was great to exercise after the filling carne asado burrito. I got up at 9 AM the next day and planned for a free City Guide walking tour of the Yerba Buena area. The tour started at 11 AM in front of St. Particks church by the Contempary Jewish Museum. I drank some fo the in-room coffee, took a long bath, and planned for a fun day exploring San Francisco. Yerba Buena Gardens is a short five minute walk from the Parc 55 so after getting dressed I headed outside. It was a bright sunny day and Union Square was packed with people. I made my way over to the St. Patricks church and there were a few people waiting for the free walking tour. The tour started at right on time and the guide was a local resident of the area. She had a real love for Yerba Buena and it showed it her presentation. She explained the history of the area and how it went from an inpoverished but nuturing community with many single occupancy hotels to a thriving area with large hotels, museums, shops, and a dynmic public garden. The tour lasted about one and one half hours and was terrific. I decided to go to another City Guide tour of the Embacadero area. It was such a nice day so I walked down to the Embarcadero. The walking tour started at 2 PM so it gave me time to grab some lunch. The pier has lots of places to eat and is very touristy. There is a fresh farmers market in front of the pier building and I would have been wiser grabbing some fresh fruit from a local merchant. Instead I went to the San Francisco Sea Food Company stall and had some fish chowder and fried oyster loaf. It costs abit over $16 and was less than enjoyable. After finishing up lunch I headed under the clock to meet the tour. There was a lot more people waiting for this tour and the area was pretty crowded with people. The guide was not as vibrant about the area but did his best to describe theis salty,sea port area of SF. This neighborhood has a colorful history and has gone through significant redevelopment. We walked in and around some of the buildings near the Embarcadero but I did not find the guide very engaging. I left the tour after about one hour and headed back to Union Square. I wanted to check out the easter flowers at Macy's which were really spectacular. Then, I headed back to the hotel to prepare for a facial appointment I made a LeBelle Day Spas which is located at 233 Grant Avenue. I had a facial at LaBelle three years prior and it was fantastic. The facialist Stella has great charisma and it was the cleanest my face has ever felt. I thought about that facial for years and could not wait to go back. I was excited for a similar experience. The spa has three levels and is not quite as male friendly as I would like. The male changing room is small but once you are ready, well, LaBelle is very pampering. After changing, I went to the waiting area where my feet were placed in a bowl on hot water. I ate some sweet honeydew melon as I waited for Stella Relaxation started to overtake me. My facial was fantastic. I am not sure how Stella does it, but my skin felt clean, fresh, and hydrated. Although, this was a bit expensive at $150+, well, it was worth every penny. It truly was two hours of bliss that ended with a clean skin and a relaxed mind. I walked back to the Parc 55 as releaxed and comfortable as I have ever felt. Later, I grabbed a quick dinner at King of Thai Noodle Shop. The duck and rice plate which was under ten bucks was fantastic. I headed back to the hotel for another quick work out and then to read before bed. It was a truly great day between the walking tours, facial, and inexpensive, delicious dinner. I slept soundly again. I woke up at 9 AM and drank some in room coffee and watched morning TV. Slowly I got up and began packing for my weekend getaway was soon heading to an end. I did have one more place I wanted to visit, so after packing most of my clothes I headed out to Chinatown to grab some dim sum at a small take out place I read about called Delicious Dim Sum. Its located at 752 Jackson Street. It was a long walk up a steep hill via Powell but I made it to Jackson. You really need to have stong legs to make it up that hill. I found Delicous Dim Sum which truly was a small little hole in the wall. I order shu mai, har gaw, and some sticky rice. It cost $5.40 which I thought was a bargain. The woman put the dim sum in a container and gave me a fork as I walked outside. I walked across the street and sat on the curb by a small alleyway. It was really interesting to sit on the street corner. watching people walk through China town as I ate this really delicious dim sum. The har gow and sticky rice were very good and the shui mai was some of the best I ever tasted. I was smiling brightly as I walked back to the Parc 55. I got back to my room and finshed packing. I looked out at the beautiful view and tried to breathe in the last parts of my nice weekend as I left my room. It took a while to finally get from the 29th floor to the ground floor with all the stops but the sun was shining as I headed across the street to grab the BART to SFO. It was a nice weekend and the Parc 55 really helped in making for a very pleasant, affordable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Starting Point for Vacation”
Reviews.Author: NYGrlWnts2Trvl
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 is immediately on the corner opposite the BART (best deal to travel from SFO) and around the corner from the cable cars running on Powell Street. Although the lobby is still under construction, the signs directing you to the 2nd floor were easy to find and the bellmen were quite helpful offering to take our 1 large bag and 1 carry-on for us, as well as directing us to the elevators. The gentleman who checked us in, I think his name was Robert, was also very nice and helpful. We initially had difficulty checking in - we booked our trip with Travelocity (got a great deal on airfare and 6 nights hotel stay) but we were told Travelocity had canceled our room. After sorting everything out by calling Travelocity we were able to check in. Robert attended to us the entire time I was on my cell dealing with the issue instead of asking us to step aside so he could help someone else. The room was very nice, up on the 26th floor facing City Hall. The only street noise we could hear was sirens passing by. You couldn't hear the traffic or construction. The room was nicely decorated, the bed was extremely comfortable, and the bathroom was very big. There wasn't a full dresser to put your clothes away, although this wasn't a big issue for us. The concierge was helpful in booking a rental car for us to use on the one day we planned to visit Muir Woods and Sonoma. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant, but had drinks one night after dinner elsewhere. The prices were comparable to if we had stayed at the restaurant for another drink. There was a great bar up the block called Foley's that had live music most nights so we ended up there a lot. All in all I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again myself. The only real negative was not all of the elevators were working, so you had to wait a few minutes at times. A few tips when planning a vacation: Use the BART to/from SFO - 5.35 each way per person beats the shuttles Get the 1 3 or 7-Passports to use the public transportation - this includes unlimited rides on the cable cars/trolleys/buses The guidebooks in the guestrooms have great suggestions for places to eat

Reviews.Title: “Great central location for BART and MUNI”
Reviews.Author: egyptdragon
Reviews.Content: I was trying to do a bargain trip for Spring Break, but did not want to get stuck in a one star hotel in the Tenderloin. So, I booked on Priceline and got an amazing rate. I'd never even heard of the hotel before and am really glad I took that gamble. Their list price is about $200-250 a night, and I paid less than that total for 2. Their website did have some specials very near to the rate I got on priceline, so poke around to find the links to the coupons and special rates. I liked it enough I might intentionally book through their own site. The desk clerk let me check in early! I was very happy about that since I had read other reviews indicating that they would be unhelpful in that regard. I also did not look like their normal clientele, but did not seem to get treated differently at all. Most of the people checking in and out were wearing suits and fine designer dresses, and I showed up with a backpacking backpack and REI fleece. This was my third trip to SF, but the first time staying in a hotel-- I used to stay at a friend's place. Some of the reviews here complain about the noise level, but, the noise level is about the same if you are staying in a residential area. San Francisco is just noisy at night. I came primarily to see Wicked again and to see the Bhutan exhibit at the Asian Art Museum. Both of those are one stop on the Muni. I also took the bus system to the Legion of Honor and once again, this hotel was a really good central starting place. It also helps that the websites for all these locations have muni directions on them from multiple places in the city. The only complaint I could make is that if I paid the full price for the hotel, the room seemed rather small. But once again, in San Francisco, there are so many people crammed into such a small area, this might be pretty standard. The Westfield Mall is right across the street, so you have plenty of restaurants. I went to the Bristol Farms grocery store at the bottom level and stocked up on fresh fruit and tea. The coffee/tea maker is in the dresser under the TV, so don't forget to look for it before you give up and order room service!

Reviews.Title: “wow, just wow”
Reviews.Author: norcalchevy99
Reviews.Content: WOW, so i had originaly reserved a club room with a view, a nice room and i had got a very good price. However, when we arived they told me they had to upgrade us to the "PRESIDENTIAL SUITE", yes, no joke. the 700+ sq ft room with bay and city views on the 32nd floor was absolutely the most amazing room i had ever stepped foot in. Parc 55 made this night one to remember. Location is A+, staff was friendly, I couldnt have asked for a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS TIME - DON'T TAKE OTHERS REVIEWS SO SERIOUSLY”
Reviews.Author: plyonsden
Reviews.Content: I am a very picky person staying only at the best hotels when we travel. I'm 49 and took my 17 yr old daughter. I have stayed in San Fran many times, at some little boutique hotel & yes noise was always a factor. Wasn't sure booking with Parc 55 but turns out this is a wonderful hotel, no matter where you are in the city you will get noise from the street. The Gaming convention was in SF so the hotel was full. Staff are fantastic with all your needs and help (directions, restaurant suggestions, taking transit, etc). The front desk offered to confirm and pre check us in on our flight, which saved a lot of time at the airport. ALL HOTELS HAVE PROBLEMS. Yes flight staff book in here, but they are gracious & wait for everyone to arrive & all book in at one time rather than taking up every staff member at the counter. Remember San Fran airport is one of the largest in the US. Airline staff stay at many hotels there. This is a city of many cultures and colors. If you are bothered by this then don't go to SF.. People, regarless of who they are were friendly and helpful...WOULD DEFINATELY STAY HERE AGAIN. If you get a chance go to Cafe Du Nurod to take in a concert....GREAT TIME. I'd be more than happy to offer further feedback.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: diachris
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Parc 55 hotel. We took the BART from the airport and was amazed to see the hotel as soon as we walked outside the terminal. The hotel is large. We were on the 16th floor and we were awoken every morning from the construction that is happening next door. They start at 7:00 am. I like to sleep in on vacation and this made it difficult. You can also hear the sirens from the firetrucks and ambulances throughout the night. I would recommend asking for a higher floor and you might be able to avoid some of this noise. The room was nice. We had a king size bed that was very comfortable. Nice size flat panel TV. I wish the rooms had small fridges. The location is great if you are a shopper. I was in heaven having so many shops so close to the hotel. Nordstroms and Bloomies are just across the street! It is very close to Macy's, Nieman Marcus, Saks, Tiffany's, and so many others. We also appreciated that the cable car pick up point is also across the street. We took advantage of the MUNI pass and used the cable car system often. We loved the city. We would definately consider this hotel again, especially because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “A Tale of Two Cities”
Reviews.Author: FGCESQ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights to celebrate her 50th birthday. The good: great room, very helpful concierge, courteous staff. The bad: weird entrance, location too close to tenderloin district. First, I'll discuss the good aspects of the hotel. Upon check-in, I requested a room as high as possible, to minimize the street noise and maximize the view, and the reservation desk gratiously offered me a room on the 18th floor, provided I didn't mind waiting until it was ready at 3:00, and I accepted. ( I should explain that when you book a deluxe king room through Priceline, you can get a room only up to the 18th floor. The rooms above that are more expensive "view" rooms.) It was only 12:30 p.m at that point, so we went to lunch at Lori's Diner down the street and enjoyed a lunch at a 50's theme diner, very fun. Lori's is a great spot for breakfast too, $11.25 for a huge breakfast with eggs, potatoes, pancakes,sausage, bacon. When we returned to check in at 3:30 p.m., the room still wasn't ready, so they upgraded us to a view room on the 22nd floor. Wow! Really nice, big room with big bay window overlooking city. The bed was oh so comfortable, the bathroom fantastic. Even a couch,and a flat screen tv with HBO. We loved the room. During the course of our stay, the concierge gave us helpful tips on visiting places, and they even printed out our boarding passes when it came time to leave. Very helpful and courteous, as was the rest of the staff. The maid kept the room sparkling clean, absolutely no complaints at all. Now, for the bad. The main entrance to the hotel seems to be where the garage is. You enter where the bell man is located, then have to go up 2 floors to reach the main lobby. Very weird, and it takes away from the impression you get upon entering the hotel. If you visit the Westin St.Francis, you'll notice what an amazing impression the entrance area can make. Now, there is a side entrance, which seems to me ought to be the main entrance, but people just stay outside those doors to smoke, and the doors don't even have real handles to pull the doors open, just strange knobs. Fine, this may be an unimportant criticism, but the location of the hotel is a legitimate beef. I know that there are tons of hotels right next door to the Parc 55, including the Hilton, the Abri, the Bijou, and many others, but because of the ridiculous number of homeless in the area, and the proximity of these hotels to the Tenderloin area, I would not choose to stay in any of these hotels for a leisure vacation. The homeless problem is terrible in this area. If you just move east a couple of blocks, the area becomes substantially less seedy. Hence, the title of my review. Don't get me wrong, the area is close to everything, restaurants, shopping, cable cars. Very convenient location. In fact, having looked around San Francisco, I am very glad I didn't book a hotel in the Financial District (too sterile and business-like) or Nob Hill (the hotels like the Fairmont or Stanford or Mark Hopkings are amazing, but I could not face the hills each morning) or the Wharf (too touristy). I like Union Square, however, I just would like to be a few blocks east of where I was. Now, would I stay here again? For business, definitely. The rooms and service are fantastic. And, the hotel seems to cater to quite a few airline crews and business meetings. But, for a vacation with the family, I think I would pick something further away from the edge of the Tenderloin.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and close to all the tourist locations, very close to shopping area. The rooms are large and very comfortable with coffee and tea facilities.
