Nice little cafe next door for breakfast, toasted sandwiches and pastries, very good value. The noise.... between 11pm and 5am all you can hear is the bin collectors. Every nght the same. If you can sleep with ear plugs you will be fine. I would probably use the hotel again, but ask for a much higher floor. Must be above 15th floor. Hotel would benefit from double glazing..........

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in great downtown location close to all the Union Square action”
Reviews.Author: cjwCalgary
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a 5 night holiday break and overall had a mixed experience. The initial check-in was smooth and courteous and our room on the 21st floor with a Bay view was high enough to escape the constant city noise. However, our second night there was wrecked by very noisy and uncouth guests next door. (The bad language was unbelievable!!) Next morning, we checked with the front desk who confirmed that those guests had checked out. Whew!! Next evening, the same mayhem, so we checked again with front desk only to be told that they had checked back in!! Insisting on a move, we were given a larger corner room on the 25th floor, with a City view, which was considerably less scenic than our previous Bay view. Overall, the standard of the rooms was very good, but in the second room, we had a shower which leaked all over the floor and also an air extraction vent which never switched off and in fact blew cold air out 24/7. There were also 2 occasions when our magnetic room keys barred us from entering our room. The front desk never really explained why that was happening to us, but merely gave us replacements and on the second occasion, the same lady who initially checked us in actually asked us for proof of ID before handing over our new keys!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BobbyCAZ
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Parc 55 Hotel numerous times. I can't say enough about this hotel....comfortable beds, super clean, friendly staff and most of the the time, reasonable prices. We use to live in the Bay Area but now live in AZ and stay at the Parc 55 3 or 4 times a year. We have stayed at several different hotels in the Union Square area....the Parc 55 is always our first choice!

Reviews.Title: “Cancellation policy is 72 hours in advanced. Don't stay there!”
Reviews.Author: 4ever88
Reviews.Content: If you don't care about cancellation fees of 72 hours in advanced -this hotel is for you!!!! If you do care about it since there is always a chance that something can happen at the very last minute of your trip, DO NOT stay at this hotel! Even if you talk to the manager of the hotel with more than two days and a half in advance, the manager will not wave you the cancellation penalty....YOU'LL HAVE TO PAY THE FEE... You need to call by 4:00pm 72 in advance!!! In addition, although I've never been in San Francisco I've seeing many more hotels in the internet that looks much nicer, with better prices and without that 72 hours cancellation fee. So why staying on this hotel?...My advice is AVOID Parc 55!!

Reviews.Title: “Lobby under renovation, $13 net, nasty ID policy, fee for late checkout”
Reviews.Author: zippy47
Reviews.Content: The Parc55 not only wants to see photo ID, they record the number of that ID, which I find disturbing (SF isn't a police state, folks!). Down duvets, good pillows, fluffy 100% cotton towels. Both wired and wireless net, each $13/day. Had some trouble getting connected, but tech support was fast and helpful. Adjustable desk chairs that lock upright. Four power outlets right next to the desk, but none near the beds. Flat panel TV. No coffee maker, refrigerator, microwave, or minibar. The lobby escalators are undergoing renovation, which leaves getting in and out of the hotel to be a bit of a maze. They wouldn't offer a checkout later than than 12:30pm without a surcharge. Reasonably competent desk staff and fast response to maintenance issues, but the housekeepers spoke too little English to understand simple questions. All-in-all, a fine place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent, delightful city but beware noise from traffic!”
Reviews.Author: valethatch
Reviews.Content: Our trip was a quick four days from UK! Location was excellent as very convenient from Bart(Powell) less than 200metres away making easy access and cheap access from the airport. Rooms tidy and clean and well appointed. reception little slow but in fairness whole area in renovation. Housekeeping staff friendly and exceedingly helpful, in fact in many years travelling some of the best. Advice though if English take a supply of decent tea bags! For leisure travellers convenient for all public transport with cable car right next door(to Fisherman's Wharf). The Wharf warrants one day but no more as very tacky( enjoy meal at Wines of California at end of pier)! The Golden Gate Bridge worth seeing(take bus to bridge 5 then 28) and walk across .... remarkably few people do ... on to the peaceful town of Sausalito returning by ferry to the Ferry Terminal via Alcatraz .... with lunch at Socama's(super halibut and Dungeness Crab). from Ferry Terminal take cable car from Market Street up to Powell then join at intersection car from the Wharf, Area near Parc 55 very pleasant with Union Square 5 minutes away. Enjoy a coffee and croissant in the square. Plenty of good eating houses around, try Italian across from the hotel(great value Happy Hour 4-6). Beware price of wine if from UK. A bottle from a liquor store of local wine $20 upwards, buy at Heathrow(3 bottles $26!). for shopping Parc 55 just opposite Westfield, ultra modern cathedral to consumerism. Go to top level above Bloomingdale's to see what I mean. Good value Internet cafe at rear of hotel($3.50 for 30 minutes) Parc excellent value if seek Internet prices. Only real downside is the traffic noise particularly on lower floors(we were on 11th) however sirens and rubbish collections noises will be encountered where ever you stay in this super city. Trip capped by two excellent flights by BA! on time, excellent service and very comfortable seats.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: spindoctor_UK
Reviews.Content: Booked this place via Priceline and it was a real steal! This is a well located hotel near Union Sq and great for shopping and seeing the city. The service was good as they accommodated all of our requests, including being put onto a high floor, to minimise noise. The rooms themselves were of a very good standard and were up to scratch for a 4 star hotel, especially when we were upgraded. We didn't try the bar or any of the facilities of the hotel during the stay, but did not encounter any of the staff unfriendliness eluded to by some articles. Parking is very expensive ($55) and it is recommended that you park your car yourself in the nearby garage at 5th and Mission for $30 for 12-24 hours. The have undergone some refurbishment work and have changed their check in location and this makes the place look very smart indeed. Some work needs to be done to the dated entrance area though. All in all if you want somewhere central and nice to rest your head at the end of the night, this is the place for you as it is a bargain. If you want to spend more time at the hotel rather than the city, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Service not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: jessicalacie
Reviews.Content: Staff was unhelpful and unfriendly, yet waited expectantly for tipping. (fat chance!) No help offered by bellmen when struggling with luggage-not a good first impression. Front desk was quick to promote hotel restaurant, but when asked what they served/offered they had very little information. Room was very similar to a Holiday Inn Express-minimal decor, plain walls. The walls were very thin and we could hear everything (EVERYthing) going on next door as well as in the hallways. The view of Market Street was redeeming, unless you were trying to sleep-then the noise from outside could be unbearable. If staying for a short business trip, being in the heart of downtown would be convenient, however if on vacation or looking for good customer service, this is not the right place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: momoney1687
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our babymoon. The location is good, but the neighborhood gets a little sketchy only a couple of blocks west. The rooms were very nice, only complaint was a little too much street noise. Very close to the BART, trolley cars and public transportation. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Price ... and Fabulous Service!”
Reviews.Author: rstark223
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this hotel! It is right at the Powell Street Bart Bart stop, so I can get to and from the airport in under ½ an hour (usually much faster than driving). The workout facilities are great, and the proximity to shopping, baseball, Union Square, is perfect. The great internet deals make it my “must stay” choice in San Francisco. I checked in after a day of Travel Hell (snowed out of my ski vacation, then flights delayed for hours, pouring rain in the city). The manager, Deanna, was incredibly sympathetic to all that I’d been through, and sent wine up to my room, which was exactly what I needed at the time. This is the kind of gesture I expect from an expensive boutique hotel, but for $100 a night? Too awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Dated”
Reviews.Author: TXScooby
Reviews.Content: Have picked up great rates through Priceline at the Parc 55. Travel to SFO about once a quarter and have stayed at most of the 4-stars in the area. Use Priceline to bid. I am always getting 4-stars for $70-85 range around the downtown area. The Parc 55 is right at the southern edge of Union Square. Easy walk to the area, great restuarants and shopping. The hotel is nice. I dont know if it is a true 4-star, but not far off. It is a little dated regarding decor and such (lots of mirrors), but they are updating. It is a very large hotel. Considering its size, not that large a lobby or common areas. Very much like a NY hotel. The rooms are large and well appointed. Good staff. Can get a good view if in the right spot. Other times could be staring into office building next door. Did not eat at the hotel. So many great places around, never wanted too. Great service, location and value. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS GREAT!! Read on and find out why...”
Reviews.Author: Martinimom
Reviews.Content: So for about $100 give or take depending on the when you stay, you can't go wrong. It is clean, updated, well located (right across from Bart station, Nordies, etc...) Service is wonderful too. It's a no nonsense business or pleasure hotel. I know my friends stay here too and always return. Unless you are looking for super posh and luxurious...or quaint and small...BOOK IT!! You won't go wrong. :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice corner rooms with great views”
Reviews.Author: Socalsailracer
Reviews.Content: Well to start with I saw a lot of poor reviews on this place but they were contrary to my experience. I arrived around 1:30pm on a Friday I had no trouble checking in, they set me up with a corner room with a king bed, which is the way to go, 2 big panorama bay windows on separate walls with spectacular views. Furnishings were nice with dark cabinets and desk, (see hotel photos) nice color schemes, well designed. Nice big flat screen TV, nice bathroom a little smallish but well laid out and not at all cramped feeling. On a side note I booked through a “name your own price” type website and got a weekend rate of $78.00 per night, so at that price I’d be hard pressed to complain about this joint. The beds were very comfortable with nice soft white sheets and comfy pillows. Also the “bedspreads” were nice fluffy duvets with white removable covers, you may read this as clean as opposed to bedspreads with who knows what on them, big plus if you ask me. I had very little interaction with the hotel staff aside from check-in, bell desk and the valet parking attendants who were a constant as they happily whisked my car in and out of their lot over and over again. By the way parking here is on the spendy side at $44.00 plus taxes and fees per night, ($50.00 total, and don’t forget tips) but considering my use it seemed alright to me. I think the parking staff got the drift and kept my car close by as after a few trips my car always seemed to be there moments after I hit the lobby doors, proper tipping doesn’t hurt in situations like that which may have explained why I seemed to fly by others waiting for cars to be brought up. All in all I liked the hotel, stylish and clean room, desk with a view, nice couch, convenient location, little need to interact with front desk staff. I think a corner room with a king is the difference between my experience and the poor reviews I’ve read. Have a look at the hotel photos and you can see from the exterior shots the 2 windows on the corner rooms, and if you look through the photos you will see an interior shot of the corner rooms with 2 windows. remember some people only review hotels they don’t like… “grrrrr I’ll show them”, I take really nasty reviews with a grain of salt but hey that’s just me. Don’t know the regular rate but I’m a brave soul and book on the bid system often, most times it works out for me, this time it did. So go, have fun, enjoy San Francisco and if you are very particular then just book a Starwood Hotel and be done with it, the “W” hotel in SF is a very nice joint, so is the St Francis, even the Palace is alright, I’m fine at all of those as well as the Parc55, heck I have no problem with Parc55 at all, I would go back. Oh and as far as noise goes, this is the city good luck no matter where you go.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: jaysabz
Reviews.Content: I love to travel and usually stay at 3 to 5 stars hotels. My expectations are very fair. I don't really have high standards or by any means high maintness. As long as these hotels and rooms are somewhat similar to the pictures I see in their websites and providing decent level of service then I'm satisfied. But this hotel is far from any of it! Rooms are nothing like what they show you in their site, they are very small with small windows. Beds are very uncomfortable and bathrooms are small but ok. Hotel itself is ok from outside looks good but inside looks like old burned down hospital. Worst thing about this place was their service. I was at the front desk at least 4 times a day to solve one problem after another. from my hotel bill to not being able to get to my room to being charged 4 internet charge all in less then an hour. on the first day my frinds and I checked in at the same time they gave both of us wrong keys to our room! Club level was terrible as well.... I hope think twice before staying at this hotel and don't make the same mistake we made. This is San Francisco and you have alot of hotels to choose from so choose wisely!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Malim27
Reviews.Content: Stayed for an overnighter at the Parc 55 at the end of a business trip. Hotel is in a great location, a minute or so from Union Square and cable cars. Room was very nice - I got upgraded to a corner suite which was spacious and clean. Air con was a bit iffy, otherwise a well proportioned room. Worry is that currently, the hotel is undergoing major renovation - especially in the public areas (dining rooms etc). Web site does not make it very clear, so either wait a while for the work to finish, or ignore it and enjoy the rooms. For such a large hotel, the bar was small and not very welcoming. Bar Menu looked good (didn't eat) and the few people that were in there made for little atmoshpere. Good value for money, but would wait a few months for the renovations to be completed before I stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Great Location, Comfy Beds”
Reviews.Author: robo44
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night in the City and chose the Parc 55 for its convenience and location to Union Square. We received an excellent rate from their website and like another reviewer as time drew closer to the reservation, I realized that good rate had gotten even better, and yes it was easily changed. We arrived well ahead of check-in and had no problems with gaining access to our room We have a club level room on the 27th floor with a wonderful view. The room was a nice size and the bed was very comfortable. Staff was good, continental breakfast was good and the bell staff was very friendly. The only draw back is the huge fee of $44 to park your car overnight. Room was a corner room on 27th floor with panoramic windows. Despite the fee I see no reason not to give the Parc 55 a try.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: kitkataf
Reviews.Content: The 2 rating is for my previous stays. The view rooms are clean, comfy, and modern. Didn’t have trouble with noise issues on the upper floors. Great central location and price is affordable with their specials. However, after my stay this past weekend, I will never patronize them again. I booked a view king 2 months prior in anticipation of Valentine’s Day. Upon arrival at 5:30, the receptionist insisted I had booked a double and tried to check me into one. Uh, I don’t think so. I overhear others mention that they are fully booked and view kings wouldn’t be available for at least 2 hours. She tells me the same. Normally it would not be an issue, however I needed to prepare and had dinner reservations at 7:30. Long story short, I ended up with a smoking king on the 8th floor, which turned out to be two doubles when I arrived at the room. I was over it at this point. The room itself, aside from the smokey halls, was clean and furnished the same as my previous stays. If you’re a light sleeper as I am, be prepared for a restless night. There’s a reason they provide earplugs. Overall, their lack of care and concern is troublesome. They didn’t even bother to refund part of my rate until I mentioned it. This hotel is large and caters to conference goers and airline crews, so I doubt they care about the occasional traveler. Don’t be enticed by the low rates. All it brings about is uncertainty. They couldn’t pay me to stay here again – ever.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: fool4travel
Reviews.Content: We live very close to San Francisco, but when we are really going out on the town we always stay the night. Usually we do Priceline's Bid Your Own and enter "Union Square East, 4 star." We either get Westin St. Francis, Hilton on O'Farrell St or Parc 55. We always hope to get Parc 55. Hilton is nice because you can park a little cheaper right across the street in the garage, but Parc 55's rooms are so so nice. They are plush with big bay windows, sometimes two of them. Every room I have ever had here has had a really nice view. The rooms are spacious and sometimes quite spacious. If you are lucky enough to get the corner rooms, wow! All that for 90 to 130 USD depending on the time of year. My favorite hotel in the City for location and value!! Oh, and by the way, if you read really bad reviews, double click on the reviewer's name and see how many reviews they have. If they have only one or all of their reviews have been poor, then you know what you're dealing with. If you are still unsure, send them a message and see if they respond!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay at Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: jeffinhouston40
Reviews.Content: Booked 3-night reservation directly with Parc 55's website for a very good rate. As time drew closer to the reservation, realized that good rates had gotten even better. Easily changed reservation to a club level room for same cost as original reservation. Room was a corner room on 27th floor with panoramic windows. Very spacious and very comfortable bed. Air conditioning was less than adequate (even for January), especially during the day when sun beat on the windows and curtains were drawn. Housekeeping service was not very good - we were gone much of Saturday, returning after 3 pm, and maid still hadn't done our room. Even on 27th floor there was quite a bit of noise at night from the street. And the restaurant(s) were frankly a joke considering the size of the hotel. But since we were so centrally located other than the first night when we arrived we never used the restaurant or bar inside the hotel again. Because of it's awesome location and wonderful rate I would stay there again in a heartbeat. There is so much they could do to make the hotel better but we received wonderful value for the rate we paid for the 3 nights we stayed at the end of January.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in the city”
Reviews.Author: Shugsterhibs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our four year old daughter for four nights at the end iof January, using it as a place to stay while we checked out San Francisco. As others have said, the location could not be better. The Powell- Hyde cable car line is across the road which gives access straight to Union Square (only a couple of blocks away anyway) right down to the piers on the waterfront for $5 a ride (cheaper if you buy mutlipass tickets). Tourist Information office is just adjacent to it too, as is the giant five floor shopping mall with Bloomingdales in it. It is used by a lcouple of airlines to put their staff up in, and that's a good recommendation for me - they wouldn't place them somewhere bad! Rooms were a good size and well maintained, staff were very good. Airport is a ten minute $40 trip away. We did have a problem when checking out when we were charged for a breakfast we had never had, but this was dealt with quickly and removed from our bill no bother. Overall, we were very happy with our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: pollardville
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Parc 55 Hotel and what a fabulous Hotel, newly remodeled, very clean, very helpful staff. The location of the hotel is perfect. We rode BART from SFO, got off at Powell and literally walked across the street to the hotel, it couldn't have been more convienient. The Cable Car is right there as well. Nice restaurants and plenty of shopping all within walking distance. Very enjoyable stay and will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Just by the underground and cable car”
Reviews.Author: Waikatosflyingkiwi
Reviews.Content: Check in and out quick and friendly. Questions answered with knowledge and a smile. No in room safe but reception has free security boxes. Room clean, comfortable and with a view. Stayed four days and it was a great base to explore the city. Yes there are vaigrants in close prox but these cup people ARE all over the city not just by this hotel. Fishermans wharf very very quiet. Feeling the pinch. A walk to the Golden Gate Bridge is for the fit but the reward is worth it, a bike can be hired from many shops but carry photo id just in case they require it. Told of a bar down Haight st just short of Filmore st called Toronado. 50 beers. Bar staff very knowledgable, so just ask for the style you like and hay presto one will appear thats just right. A walk through the San F gardens also well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rate Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Joedogg1968
Reviews.Content: My wife and I needed lodging for a night out in the city close to the Warfield for a music venue.My buddy was staying at the Park 55 and we decided to gve it a shot.I read countless reviews some better than other but decided to keep an open mind and give this property a chance.The location was perfect for our needs and I booked through the hotels web site and found a great deal on a renovated king room that included parking for our vehicle.Room was clean and had a nice view it was a corner unit.The 2nd floor resturant it self was a joke.It looked more like an employee calfiteria.We met friend for a drink before heading out for the evening.All in all if I were to get the same rate with the inclusive parking deal I would stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: blondeegal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in November, and really had no problems. Room was nice with a large bathroom. Clean, comfortable beds, pleasant people and the hotel is in a very convenient location. Will definitely consider staying here again, if they run a special. Parking charge is terrible, but that's San Francisco! One comment I will make is the bar was pretty pricey in their drink charges, so beware!

Reviews.Title: “Its the little things that could have counted”
Reviews.Author: DragonKaty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 for a few days prior to my trip to Australia. I had chosen it because of its location, and that certainly didn't disappoint. A block to the trolley cars and to Market Street, a couple blocks to Union Square - it was all so close. This is clearly a hotel made for meetings, conventions and airline staff. Us other folks were pretty much ignored or stared at by the staff - somewhat disconcerting. I went looking for the hotel restaurant one morning, taking the escalator right next to the bell station and the four or five bellmen there just stared at me as I went up, and then again as I came down a few minutes later. Here is a thought: instead of staring why not mention that you can't get to the restaurant that way? Why not move the big sign for the restaurant from next to the escalators and put it next to the elevators, as that is the only way to get there? I also got the stare when I tried to find a way into the hotel from Ellis Street. In fact, despite seeing lots of people struggling with their bags, the only thing I ever saw the bell men do was stare blankly at people... If you are going to stay, try and get a high level floor. I was on one of the lower floors, which provided a lot of traffic noise and no view. I am used to that so I wasn't too upset by the former, but the view provided gave me a direct look into the apartments of the people across the street. Another problem with low floors is that it is impossible to get on an elevator on your checkout date. I waited for almost half an hour, watching full elevator car after car go by, unable to get me and my heavy international suitcases in. I finally ended up taking a car up and then coming down again. All of those things are sort of expected in a hotel, so I could put up with them. The one thing I did wish was fixable was the thickness of walls. On my last night there was a large Christmas party being held at the hotel, with many folks staying over. The people in the room next door returned to their room VERY noisily around 3 a.m. and were quite active for a while after (he likes to the called "the King" if you get my drift). Still, the room itself was very large, water pressure int he shower was great and the bed was WONDERFUL!

Reviews.Title: “Never never again”
Reviews.Author: rttfons26
Reviews.Content: DONT GO THERE!!!! They are stealing me money!! I stayed there 3 nights for a conference, then when I wanned to check out they wanned to charge me two breakfast that I never had. I complained and they said they were no going to charge it, but now I have just come home and saw that they did it!! They are just stealing me money!! Now I am in Europe and I have to spend I don't know how much money calling them for cancelling that if they want!! The place is ok, but as good as any other 4 stars hotel, you don't get a penny more than what you pay. I honestly don't recommend it at all!!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!!”
Reviews.Author: shoegal517
Reviews.Content: N E V E R A G A I N !!!!! I'd stayed here twice prior to my last experience and had an o-k stay. I booked a room online for my bf and I when we were thinking of going to the city for New Year's eve to have dinner but then we changed our plans so I cancelled the reservation online the next day. I ended up getting charged $234.00 anyway, and when I called to have the charge credited back to me, it took them 3 days to call me back and then they refused to credit me because they were unable to find the cancelation in their system. Please don't stay here...I wrote a long complaint letter to the hotel manager, so we'll see if I even hear back. Maybe they don't care about service because they have contracts with airlines because I always see flight attendants leaving....

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelTX
Reviews.Content: After seeing this hotel during a tour on the cable car, we walked in to see if they had any rooms available for that night. They told us they were completely booked and if they had any rooms, they were $229 per night. We then went outside and used my husband's phone to call Hotels.com. They immediately booked us a room in this same hotel for only $119.00. It was a very nice hotel and a beautiful view of downtown San Francisco. It's not something I would do all the time but nice for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasurable Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: SanCarlosGuy
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay but not my last at the Parc 55. I arrived in the late afternoon on New Year's Eve. The streets around downtown SF were packed with visitors as was the hotel lobby. I'd estimate there were at least 50 people checking in ahead of me. However, the professional desk staff greeted each person with a smile and never lost their cool. I asked for an upper floor room and they gave me a choice of three. I selected a room on the 19th floor facing Market Street. It was exactly as the pics. on their website. Very nicely refurbished with a goiod size bathroom, large flat screen TV and sensational views. The entire hotel, including my room, the hallways and public areas are very clean and neat. One caveat, the room would be smallish for more than two people. Great for a single person or couple, but probably a bit snug for families.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: AndyT_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here around our 30th wedding anniversary. We had a Club room next to the Executive Club Lounge with complimentary cold buffet breakfast and evening hors d'oeuvres. We didn’t have a car, and the disabled entrance is in the parking bay which I thought a tad odd, though a reasonable compromise. Quite often, I would tell my wife to go into the main entrance, while I dashed around. As a disabled person, the whole infrastructure at San Francisco was the best I have ever encountered anywhere in the world. The room was huge and exceptionally clean comprising of a kitchenette (with two types of fully stocked coffee makers), dining and living area, and two bathrooms. The views were excellent and we didn’t really notice any noise either from traffic or from other guests meaning that the walls were well insulated. A request for a fridge for medication was responded to within 15 mins of arrival. All the hotel staff were very amicable, especially the executive lounge hosts and the doorman who was full of information and always very helpful. The only criticism is that checkin was quick in our case, but we often noticed queues of around 5 -10 mins. Not really an issue for us as we only needed to go there on arrival and departure. I highly recommend this hotel if staying at Club Level and want to be close to Union Square. We would certainly not hesitate to book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service needs work”
Reviews.Author: girlygil
Reviews.Content: For room a city view room with 2dbl beds spitting distance from Union Square and SF Center at under $140/nite, you can't beat this place. The hotel is just steps from the cable car turnaround on Powell, and directly across the street from the entrance to the new Westfield mall. While this is not a luxury upscale type of place, it is a good value for the money. With newly renovated rooms, reasonable rates and it's convenient location right off Union Square and directly across the street from the Westfield shopping center - this was the perfect hotel for a holiday shopping weekend in the city. Despite it's small size, the newly renovated rooms are pretty comfortable and very clean. Carpets are all fresh and clean, bathrooms were all clean with the usual basic amenities, and our room on the 23rd floor had a great view of the city, with glimpses of the bay winking at us between the skyscrapers. There's not much in terms of restaurant/bar scene in this hotel, but your just steps away from some amazing restaurants and bars right outside the hotel. Do not expect bellmen to help you with your bags, they seem to be few and far between, or even for the front desk to get your room billing correct - we had a snafu with them refusing to put room and tax for the three rooms i reserved on my bill, even though i'd specifically requested they not show the bill to my guests 3x - but what can you do? Breakfast buffet in the hotel is serviceable, but really, for $20pp you can get an amazing meal just right outside the door of the hotel. The lone bar in the hotel seems to close down by 11pm - but again, why stay in the hotel when you're in SF? Good value and would probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel sucks!!!”
Reviews.Author: worldtour94
Reviews.Content: Not only does this hotel have horrible service but the noise from outside can be heard all through the night (even on the top floors).

Reviews.Title: “could be better....”
Reviews.Author: kaitheguy
Reviews.Content: it was not perfect i tell you! they had great deal on parking package, and that's the reason i chose this hotel over others. when i entered the room, it was not bad, it's smaller than i thought, but we are in SF rite. i found those things are not acceptable when i stepped in the room 1. cigarette burnt towel 2. stained bath tub 3. HUMAN HAIR ON THE BED! Which is very very very disgusting i called the for housekeeping, waited for quite a long time. but the service was nice and quick. the other thing are not acceptable are: 1. really bad tones over the phone (one is jenny and one i forgot) 2. takes long time to pick up the phone 3. concierge is almost never there (and that's wat i need) the hotel is old, but not that bad, some are not nice, but the valet people are polite compare to others. the location is great tho. very close to every major shopping places, and close to union square (but seriously there are not much things to do at union square, seriously!) after all, it was not a bad trip. oh it has a sofa bed (single size) so if u wanna save money and crush with friends, u can do that

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: niklev
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous....location, excellent! It was beautiful, clean, well-staffed and felt ultra upscale without an ultra upscale price. We had the most gorgeous view with enormous picture windows on two side of our room. It felt wonderful to come home to at the end of each long sight seeing day. Will definitely stay again on our next trip to San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fabulous City!”
Reviews.Author: Sassyfitz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as part of our honeymoon. The location could not be faulted, really close to Union Square and the Trolly lines. We arrived a little later than planned due a flight delay, so just ordered some room service, and I've never had such delicious French Onion soup in my life! The room was great, the staff were all very helpful and pleasant, and we had no complaints what so ever! Would love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: billybastings
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week after a cruise. Location was perfect as close to Union Square & easy access to all local transport. A few pan handlers in area as close to the Tenderloin but no concerns about safety. The hotel itself would not win any beauty contests as quite bland (apart from the bedrooms) but very comfortable and clean. Reception staff were always very friendly, allowed us to check in at 8am and also upgraded us! Busy hotel and particularly popular with airline staff. Before arrival I had concerns about excess noise as had read previous reviews. The hotel had provided ear plugs which I used on occasions because I'm a light sleeper. I didn't have any problems with noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Value”
Reviews.Author: kdeely
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here in mid-November following a friend's recommendation. Wonderful location in the heart of downtown a stone's throw from the Cable Car terminus. Walking distance to great stores, restaurants and convenient to all of the major attractions. Rooms were clean, modern and extremely comfortable (our view from the 26th floor was magnificent!). Concierge was extremely helpful and staff very accomodating. Excellent value for the location (about $140 per night plus tax). Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in downtown SF”
Reviews.Author: Dec105
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 had a very good deal for a week's stay in November - the more nights you stayed, the lower the average rate per night. So, a week's stay worked out pretty well. The hotel itself is quite excellent (noticed a lot of airline crews staying there - always a good sign). Room quality and other creature comforts are of a high standard, as might be expected. The best feature, of course, is location - right in the middle of the downtown action. Close to Union Square for shopping and nightlife, and right beside the Powell St BART and Muni stops - ideal for airport connections as well as general public transport around the city (the wonderful F-line street car on Market St runs all the way down to Fisherman's Wharf or you can take the scenic route using the cable car). We didn't rent a car (no need) but the hotel did seem to have decent parking facilities. Bars and restauarants within the hotel were good, although we tended to eat elsewhere - given the wonderful selection of eateries and drinking emporiums all within ten minutes of the hotel (and no need for taxis either). Highly recommended if you can get a good deal on price.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: AJ J
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location (right next to union square) and it's easy to get to. The rooms are spacious and have a great decor. We upgraded to the Club Level and were able to get free continental breakfast every morning. The staff were very friendly and always helpful. The only complaint would be the price of parking at the hotel, comes to about $51/night with tax but the valet staff is very attentive. We definitely enjoyed our stay and the hotel was a good deal for a large city.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined Our Anniversary!! :o(”
Reviews.Author: nutbass
Reviews.Content: We would like everyone to know that this anniversary weekend was completely ruined by the hotel and it's staff. How anyone stays there is beyond me with that kind of service and complete disregard for their guests well being. There are many things that I have listed that are completely the hotels fault and responsibility - I left a comment card and information regarding the concerns we had in the comment box in the lobby. I will go to all sites of reservations and let them know exactly what the hotel has done and not done and how it completely ruined our weekend. This weekend had been planned in advance and special request for a romantic anniversary was made and not delivered. Instead we were treated with disrespect and discourtesy. Not only did we not receive one apology for the hotels mishaps but we were treated this terribly from the moment we stepped foot into the lobby to the time we checked out this morning! * 11/14/08 arrived at hotel with itenerary in hand and the woman at the front desk did not have our reservation. *we were booked in a deluxe view room with a king bed, and they had booked all those and took that room away from us and gave us a standard double queen room with a view that seemed smaller! * once she found the reservation (5 minutes) she gave us the two room keys to room # 2520 * we had been driving a while and were thirsty so we went to the hotel bar on the 2nd floor = when we asked for the check the waitress stated that our names were not in the computer and gave us someone else's name on that room number 2520. * we walked up to our floor 25 and our room 2520 and when we tried to open the room it would not allow us to. we were confused and tired and had to go back downstairs to get a new room?? a new key?? * when we came back downstairs there were several people in line which we had to wait for 15 minutes to get a key and new room. * when we were helped the woman (a different one this time) did not really apologize and just said something that the original agent must have made a mistake and gave us our new key to a new room #2570 * when we finally got the right room number and room keys we went up to our room there was absolutely nothing in the room that indicated that it was our anniversary or any special items left for us to enjoy... there was even no refridgerator!! It had been stated in the original booking that it was our anniversary and to make us a more romantic weekend - but not one "happy anniversary" or anything! *I came down around 3am to talk with a manager because I figured there would be no wait at the front desk. the night manager said that I should mention my concern to the daytime manager and also mentioned that booking with expedia you are not guaranteed your original booking... which I thought was completely absurd - shouldn't the hotel take good care of every guest - no matter who made the reservation???!?!!?!? *while staying on the 25th floor we got thirsty for a sprite - so I walked down the hall and put 2 dollar bills and one quarter ($2.25) for a sierra mist out of the vending machine and the money was stuck - so I called the front desk as referred by a hotel staff that noticed this, I called and was rudely told that I would have to come downstairs to the front desk and ask for a refund and you don't think that's sort of an inconvenience?? I would have bought a soda at the store if I had known there would have been such a problem! *for an evening of trying to make a terrible weekend turn a key - we decided to stay in and get a bottle of red wine to enjoy while we watched the view. I called to have some "Kim Crawford" pinot noir, it was listed in the menu in the room, I called room service and was told that they don't have that wine but they had "Chalone" pinot noir and that the bottle price wasn't listed but that it would be $40.00, when the bill came with the wine it was 55 dollars and was never informed what the $15.00 overcharge was for. Overall I would never recommend this hotel to anyone and would give very bad reviews to where ever we can to let people know that we were guests but were made to feel like outcasts at this Parc 55 hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at convenient, well-priced hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jw263
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two-night stay at Parc 55 Hotel in Union Square, San Francisco, CA and it was wonderful. The hotel is very conveniently located: from the SFO airport, we took the BART to Powell St. station (~45 min) for $5.35 one-way and the hotel was just across the street as we exited the station. The desk staff was very friendly and efficient--it took <5 minutes to get our room. Once upstairs, we were pleasantly surprised. Our room w/ king-size bed was nicely sized and everything from the carpet to the furniture looked clean, modern, and tasteful. We were on the lower floors so there was no real view but ample sunlight in mornings nevertheless. The bed was comfortable and the towels were fluffy, relatively new (old towels are a big pet peeve). An attendant even stopped by 20 minutes after we check-in to make sure everything was okay with our room. Hotel prices were as expected for 4-star hotel. Internet access was $12.95/24 hrs, room-service continental breakfast $16.95. My only (minor) concern with our stay was that the hotel's surrounding area could be pretty noisy at night (something the hotel acknowledges given the provided earplugs). It didn't really bother us but those who may have trouble should consider requesting a higher floor. Being in Union Square just off Market Street, the location was as convenient one could get in San Francisco for tourist and business-types. However, convenience can attract all types of people so definitely keep wits about you, especially at night. Overall, this hotel was a great value and experience. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: calikid12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a romantic getaway and show in the city. Location can not be beat...We went to the Warfield for a show and walked the 1 block back the room after.Had a room on the corner of the 25th floor. Panoramic windows on 3 sides provided breath taking views.. Room was super clean and the bed had like 10 pillows for you to choose from. Staff was very friendly.Hotel is large enough that taxi service is never a problem. Valet parking was $50 a night but thats the price you pay for valet in the city. All and all great stay. We also used AAA membership for slight discount.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: renophilly
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the Parc 55 and it was incredible! Great location convenient to many types of transportation, food in the immediate area was abundant and incredible, the service was top notch, from the valet and bell staff to housekeeping and all the behind-the-scenes folks who made it such a wonderful experience, and I must compliment Maria and Ericka at the front desk who made great customer service seem so much a part of what they do that one wonders why all establishments cannot make it work as well as the Parc 55. We absolutely look forward to our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean, and Elegant”
Reviews.Author: Bedhog
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on October 30, 2008. I had to go to the San Francisco airport the next morning, and the hotel was conveniently located near the BART station in Union Square (ticket to the airport was $5.30 and takes about 30 minutes). The hotel was elegant, and very clean. My room, which was located on the 10th floor was luxiourious and spacious. There was a little sofa in the room, and the bedding was really nice. The bathroom was spacious, clean and stylish--with hairdryer and nice toiletries. Overall the decor of the room could be described as classic-modern. There was LG flat-screen 46" TV. The one thing lacking in the room was a coffee maker and coffee/tea.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and large room”
Reviews.Author: NMcNam
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for 5 nights in one of the newly renovated rooms. Very nice large room which was well serviced and cleaned each day and had a very comfortable bed. Only drawback in the room was they seem to have lost the keys to the safes in the room so you would have to use facilities at reception for any items needing safekeeping. The hotel is very close to Union Square, cable cars and Powell street station where you can catch the Bart to the Airport for $5. We didn't eat here at all as there are so many places nearby better value. We had a lovely meal in the Daily Grill and you can get reasonable priced breakfasts in Lefty O'Dowls beside there. There is also a good bakery beside the hotel with bagels, sandwiches etc. I would stay here again but only if I was assured a renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “Not Four Stars - Location only saving grace”
Reviews.Author: lunasey
Reviews.Content: Not great. Good location is the only good point really. Prices for copies and room service are outrageous, even for San Fran. Customer service isn't horrible but could use improvement. Things were often broken or disheveled. Floor plans for rooms and lobby are not flattering. Not four stars.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at Parc55”
Reviews.Author: s2miller123
Reviews.Content: Making our reservations more than one month out, we called to verify and found they had us arriving a day later than planned. Arriving early we understandably found our room not ready and were asked if we could come back in approximately two hours...we did and our room still wasn't ready. As a solution to the problem Parc55 gave us a similar room which was so hot that it was unbearable even with the air conditioning on. To there credit they were able to switch our room when a complaint was made. Overall I was very disappointed in this hotel. For what was paid I would expect much more than what I could receive from any roadside Motel 6. Rooms are lacking the basics. No microwave. No refrigerator. I'm not asking much, but when paying $200 dollars a night, I would expect more. Bathrooms are small. Wall paper is bubbling in areas. Outlets are old, faded, and dirty. Not what I would expect from such a "luxury" hotel. Next time I will stay at the Hilton across the street. The only positive is that the staff seemed to be helpful when asking questions or addressing complaints. Parc55 is also central to downtown. Unfortunately for Parc55, this experience will not find me recommending their Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Huge Rooms”
Reviews.Author: dubsyd
Reviews.Content: Huge Rooms with amazing panoramic views of San Francisco. Was great to look out the windows in the evenings of our corner room. Check in, no King bed available so had to change the second day. Replacement room was only Queen size bed but the room was huge and well maintained. Separate closet and dressing area that lead to large bathroom. The location could not have been better. Powell street BART station, Cable car to Fishermans Wharf and cable car down to Castro area all on your doorstep. Also only across the road from huge Westfield Shopping Centre and close to Union Square shopping and dinning. Staff were ok. Cabs easy to get outside hotel lobby. Would definitely stay at this hotel if going to San Francisco again, as long as the price wasn't too excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: 122309d
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at check in we were informed that there weren't any rooms available for the booking we had made and we were asked if we would be happy to stay in a twin room. I said politely that if they didnt have the room we had booked that we should be upgraded. The receptionist excused herself for 30 seconds and came back and said that we would be upgraded to a Queen City View Room for no extra charge, and apologised for the inconvienience. When we got to the room it was large and spacious. We were on the 25th floor and had the best views. I would recommend staying higher up to avoid the noise of the traffic. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was as big as the room. We had already read the reviews about the extortionate valet parking so parked our car two blocks away at payforless for $20 a night, without any problems. The hotel is centrally located to the shops, is right near the cable car terminal and trams leave from opposite the hotel. If I went to San Francisco again I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, Good Standard”
Reviews.Author: RebelRanter
Reviews.Content: Could not get more central than this, well maybe Westin Hotel Union Square, but that's just being pedantic! Central location next Powell St Station was handy but there was a concentration of bums across the street form hotel which is a bit unnerving when you first emerge from train station. However the hotel is of good quality, busy hotel with a lot of air hostess & pilots constantly checking in and out! Seems to the airlines hotel of choice! The homeless people you will realise are not really a particular problem any more so then other parts of San Francisco. The bed was comfortable, room well appointed. The staff seemed to be very busy but not unfriendly by any means. Would recommend this hotel if you want to be centre of the action, cable car, Bart (subway), F line Street car (tram) & many buses, Union Square, major shopping areas all literally steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay overall”
Reviews.Author: thomd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Parc 55 Hotel reluctantly at first. We wanted a spot near Fisherman's Wharf, however the hotel we originally booked was beginning renovations and all other hotels in that area were booked. Parc 55 and Union Square seemed the next best option. The location is great, it's less than a block to the Market/Powell cable car turnaround. All of Union Square is convient as well. However, the other side of the hotel seemed kind of sketchy. Our room was a standard king bed room on the 17th floor. The view was great as we overlooked all the skyscrapers in San Francisco. The bed was comfy, flat panel TV was a nice touch, and the bathroom was spacious and nicely appointed. The only problem I would point out is the noise. My wife and I live in a small apartment on a busy street so we are used to it, but I did notice that you can hear people in the rooms around you quite clearly. Also, despite being on the 17th floor, I could hear the traffic outside (along with the bell rining from the cable cars). Again, we are used to the noise so it was no problem for us, however I can see why some people may be bothered. The staff was more than friendly and helpful. They even allowed us to check in 3 hours early (we just drove 4 hours from Yosemite and badly needed to relax and freshen up before exploring the city). Parking is expensive, but that is to be expected in the city. Same goes for room service.

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: MrArthur
Reviews.Content: Parking here is overpriced, considering a fairly lengthy wait to collect the car from the valet service. Hotel Internet access is incredibly slow. Rooms are reasonable, although last stay I had a staff service corridor behind one wall, with staff banging trolleys into the wall repeatedly (enough to jolt the bed). Bell-staff are downright rude. I got asked to make sure I left the handle to the suitcase up in future (because it's so much effort for them to do, obviously). I couldn't find my luggage receipt and was in a hurry; they said "There are too many bags to look" and didn't intend to let me have my luggage back. I pressed the issue and they let me point to my luggage in their storage room. Not sure if they expected me to just give up and let them keep my belongings or not, but they sure gave that attitude. -10 out of 10 there. My second stay here, and the Hertz counter still never, ever had anyone working there. (Avoid booking anything to pickup/drop off at that hotel from hertz, but that's another story).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sunshinebois
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Parc for 3 nights in late August. Love the location and the hotel although being remodeled at the time was in very good condition. Check in was quick and smooth. Loved the room. Very comfortable bed, great shower. The hotel is close to all the great downtown shopping and restaurants. Also there is a small bakery right outside the door for a quick breakfast. Across the street is a BART station and very close to the Cable Car line for a jaunt to fishermans wharf. My only complaint was the cost of internet in the lobby - I believe it was $5.99 for 20 minutes-I bit too steep for me! There is a sports bar and an asian restaurant on premises. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: SimonW6
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in down town San Francisco, right next to Market Street and where cable cars run from. Only issue is noise of police sirens at night: kept us awake despite being on 20th floor, maybe we were unlucky. Children really liked breakfasts there, though quite pricey. Rooms have everything you'd need given you are staying in a downtown location Simon

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonDilly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in early september, this is a large busy hotel, a short cable car ride away from Fisherman's wharf. We had a room on the 17th floor, we had amazing views of the city. The rooms are of a high standard, I would highly recommend this hotel if yiu are looking for a good location and high standard room.

Reviews.Title: “A very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: TravellerOnBusiness4
Reviews.Content: This is without doubt the worst hotel we have EVER stayed in. And, i've stayed in over twenty hotels inLA and SF this year alone. So what was wrong? Firstly, they completely messed up our bookings, this was their fault, as they admitted, not ours. But the treatment we then recieved by their counterstaff was unhelpful and downright rude. At 1.30am in the morning we were still arguing for rooms, which they eventually gave us. But, without telling us, one of the rooms was on the smoking floor, which simply wasnt acceptable, even in emergency for someone who has allergies. We felt decieved and it was too late to do anything about it. There was no help in getting our luggage from the taxi to the reception and we had to stack and wheel the luggage cart ourselves. No porters were working. When they did find one to bring the cart up to our rooms, a Fed-ex package that had arrived for us to be put on the trolley taking our luggage up simply disappeared (!!) The only helpful person, who actually semed to care, in the entire hotel was the bellhop! It took until 3.30 the following day for them to sort out the rooms properly and then they failed to transfer the luggage from one room to another as promised. On requesting a delayed checkout by an hour we were informed that there would be a large charge for this - despite the previous failures of the hotel in our booking. I have one main comment - staff here just dont care. They are officious, rude and inept and everything takes at least a minimum of eight hours to process. Even simple requests. For this mess, we have recieved no apology, and for certain, will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: liveforvaca
Reviews.Content: Bit of delayed response, but finally have some time on my hands. My fiancee and I stayed here for 3 nights over Valentine's Day weekend and had a great time! We got the room at a bargain rate ($100 per nite) off of priceline! If you don't know about booking through priceline, you need to learn about it. I do it whenever I can now!!! One of the best things about this hotel is the location! It is literally right above the BART station and across the street from the F Street Car stop! We took the BART from SFO and didn't need a car our whole trip. Checking in was a breeze. For those that have booked through PL, you know you need to sweet talk the counter person to get a good room. After making some small talk, we ended up with a high level room w/ 1 king bed and a GREAT VIEW!!! The bed was very comfortable and the room was a very good size! I would also like to mention that the sports bar they have there has really great munchies! Get the wings and calamari! Like I said before, the location is fantastic! Walk 3 blocks up, you are in Union Square. Cross the street to the F Car or the Cable Car and you can anywhere you want! Would definetly return, even if I have to pay a little more!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but took a little griping to get things right”
Reviews.Author: aamcgol
Reviews.Content: We booked our 2 queen bed room on Expedia for a family of four. When we arrived after midnight for a guaranteed late arrival, we were told our room was not ready, but that we could go to the hotel across the street for the night and come back the next night. We declined and (nicely) asked for the room we had already paid for. They offered us a king bed and a cot. We declined and (nicely) asked for the room we had already paid for. Eventually they agreed to offset the cost of our stay for our troubles and quickly made up a 2 queen bed room for us. It was quite comfortable - and ended up just fine in the end.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, large rooms, but that’s it because VERY NOISY”
Reviews.Author: divinidylle
Reviews.Content: First of all I realize it is difficult to find a good hotel in San Francisco for a good price. I paid around USD 200,- (taxes included) for this one and as the hotel is not that new, the room internet and parking could be much less expensive) Stayed here for 6 nights Positive: - good location (next to the shopping area, union square, market street, trams, cable car…) - pleasant and nice people at reception and at the reservation desk when calling - a lot of elevators (so you never wait too long to get one) - a bit expensive as the hotel is quite old - Burger King just across the road (convenient when travelling with kids) - good bed lining - lat flat screens (in new rooms) Negative: - very very noisy (even when on 17th floor and above), you can hear the police and ambulance sirens as if you were sitting in it (I than understood why there were free Quies ear plugs in the bathroom :-) : because of the bad thin windows - very big hotel (more than 1000 rooms), therefore always very busy and crowded. I know some people do not like it - bathroom not cleaned very well (a lot of hair found everywhere etc …) - no safe in the rooms. The hotel offers a safe room (like in banks) but the problem is that you better be very well organised as you have to queue each time at the reception between the people check-in in/out to have access to the room - valet parking is not very well organised and very expensive (above USD 45) I would not specially come back to this hotel or recommend it to friends but again hotels are very expensive in S.F. Also be aware, that not all the rooms are renovated !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: WineTool
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel for a night out in San Francisco. We booked two rooms: One for ourselves, and one for our sitter, who was watching our young kids while we were out to dinner. LOCATION It's centrally located, close to Union Square. It's easy to get to. It's not the greatest neighborhood, but it's not all that bad, either, unless you're accustomed to living in one of those places where you never lock your doors and everyone, um, looks the same. I wouldn't hesitate to stay in the area again. ROOMS Our room was nice. It was adequately sized (a little small with two beds, but not cramped). Our sitter scored the excellent room: When we checked in and mentioned that she would have our kids for quite a few hours in the evening, they upgraded her to a deluxe room that was huge. She had plenty of room to entertain the kids without going completely bonkers. The beds were very comfortable, the bathrooms were nicely appointed, and in general the decor was pleasing. There was no minibar/fridge in the room, which was disappointing, but not a big deal since we were staying just one night. The room was quiet, which is always a plus. AMENITIES The hotel lobby itself is fairly small, but there's a lobby bar upstairs that looks nice. (We didn't have time to linger there, unfortunately.) Other common areas were clean and well-kept. The workout room was rather large by hotel standards, and in good condition; I managed to get a decent workout in. We ordered room service for the kids and sitter; the food was good and service was prompt. Mind you, we were ordering for kids, so I don't know how good some of the more complicated items are. In general, the hotel had everything we needed for a one-night stay. STAFF Staff was very good - as good as or better than that of other SF hotels we've stayed at. The treated us and the kids very well. Reception/front desk staff was particularly helpful. Bags were deliverd and picked up promptly, and we didn't have to wait long when our car was brought around. Since we'd already made all of our plans before arriving, we didn't use concierge services, so I can't comment on that. MISCELLANEOUS Parking was outrageous, but you expect that in San Francisco. Still -- ouch. SUMMARY We liked it, and would stay there again. We paid a significantly reduced rate through Priceline, and it was an excellent value. We had no problems, the staff was helpful, the upgraded room was a nice surprise, and although nothing stands out as particularly excellent, it's a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Sammyt27
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because I got a good deal on one of the travel websites. I wanted to explore the city outside of Union Square but I stayed here due to their easy access to public transit- the BART station is about 50 steps from the front door of the hotel. I also chose this hotel because it was one of the few in SF that didn't charge you to use the gym ($10 to $15 a day to use a gym for a few days adds up!). The gym had new equipment, lots of cardio machines, and was clean. Each cardio machine had its own TV- better than the view outside the window, which is a view of the side of an old building. Overall, the stay was above average. I was on the 10th floor- I wish I had asked for a higher level or a courtyard room as SF is a very noisy city- I think sirens in this city go off 24 hours a day and are 10 times louder than normal sirens! Luckily, I brought my own earplugs but the hotel provides you a pair in your room. Don't stay on the 5th floor- that is where the gym was and so there was alot of foot traffic there! I had booked a room with a king bed but they only had a room with two doubles available- luckily I am short because they are small beds! I did not have a fridge in the room, so the only way to have cold bottled water was to buy one for $2.75 from a machine on a different floor! There was one drawer for your clothes, so be prepared to leave all of your clothes in your suitecase. If you like to unpack your things like me, you may have a hard time with that. I thought this was odd, as the TV stand could easily have been both a TV stand and a bureau with drawers as other hotels have. The hotel itself was clean and housekeeping was quick to respond to my requests when I needed their assistance a couple of times. If you can overlook the no fridge, small beds, and no drawers, the location can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: elleh11
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night over the labor day long weekend. The hotel was fine. They let us check in early (11am), but couldn't give us a late check out. The room was clean and most of the hotel interior is new. The decor is pretty tacky. All the staff were friendly and the work out room is pretty well equipped and not a bad size. I think overall it was a bit overpriced for what it is (and the fact that there isn't a pool). Location is central, but getting a bit close to the bad area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - tytpical city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Raggy123
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Parc 55. Very impersonal as most city hotels are but there was just something about it that did not endear you to this hotel. It was fine for what we needed - excellent location. Took the BART from the airport and it is nearly on the doorstep. Great location for all transport and seeing the sights. Room was fine however a little pokey for family of four and the double beds were very small. It was noisey and the people in the room next to us had the TV blaring until 4 a.m. - just what you need when you have completed a long haul flight and have been up for nearly 24 hours! There was no help getting through the door from the bell staff even thought we each had a case and rucksack - they just watched us. We picked up our hire car (dollar just round the corner from the hotel) when we were leaving San Francisco but heard that the parking was extremely expensive and a bit of a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Deal !”
Reviews.Author: Adomvatik
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 3 adults, in a two double bed room. Price was great 212$ per night including tax. (relative to other hotels from same class). Room was nice, with all the amnities you need. The hotel is located an walking distance from Union Sq, adn othe SOMA attractions!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel during our trip”
Reviews.Author: UliPhuket
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay in a downtown hotel in San Francisco and made a "good deal" with $199 plus tax at the Parc 55. Had we known the hotel before, we would have spent more money for one of the better hotels around the corner. We arrive and see that they charge over $50 per night (incl. tax) for parking - even the public parking around the corner charges only $34 (incl. tax). C/I, after waiting in line for around 15 mins(!) at around 1.45 pm, we we're told by the agent that we would have to wait 2 hours until our room gets ready (C/I time: 3 p.m.). Besides that (which can be understandable in some cases), the lady was unfriendly, if not to say rude - no welcome, no thank you for staying here - nothing. You rather feel like you are an unwelcome work load. The concierge gave a map to explore the city in the waiting time, however we first saw our luggage standing completely unattended in the lobby - the bellboys we apparently more interested in rating the women in the lobby than checking on luggage. We asked them to store our valuables in the meantime, the only comment we got was: $40 dollars if you lose the key. Both of us working as hoteliers - we were amazed how this hotel survives, given they treat all customers the same. The room was standard, but nice and clean on the 28th floor with a nice view of the city, the only staff that can be honoured is housekeeping which have been very efficient; rooms were neat and tidy. We didn't even dare to try out any of the F&B offers they have. If you don't give anything for service, choose the Parc 55 - otherwise two words: Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelsInTheSun
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Parc 55 Hotel after a long drive from Los Angeles. Check in was fast and efficient and as we walked into the main lobby we were suprised at how grand it looked. The room was lovely and spacious with two large queen beds. We had our towels changes every day and the place and room spotless. The location of the hotel was great as it was only a couple of blocks away from Union Square. The cable car stop is only a few blocks away too and within walking distance. While you are staying in San Fran, you must go to Alcatraz, it was actually the best thing about San Francisco. We managed to see the whole city in two full days, but that was not done at a leisurely pace! Also, the Golden Gate bridge was spectacular and Longbard Street was cool too. Visit Pier 39 to see the sea lions and look round the shops and attractions. The only thing I didn't like about San Fran was the amount of homeless people on the street. Me and my friend wanted to go out for a bite to eat one evening and no sooner had we left the hotel and walked a couple blocks, we were harrassed by homeless people. I am usually confident in large cities like this, I have been to many places, but I have to say that in San Fran I felt very uneasy. We ended up getting a subway sandwich and eating it in the hotel room!! This was a shame as we would have loved to have sampled the food in China Town etc but as two young women, we did not feel safe at all. The hotel was lovely though and if they could pick it up and put it in another location it would be ideal. If I decided to go back to San Fran (which I don't think I ever will, but never say never) I wouldn't stay here as a loan female or small group of women. The only way I would feel safe is if I went with my partner or in a large party.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: californiatrip
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel very central for sightseeing. We booked a club room thinking it would be big, but it was quite small compared to other places we stayed in. Everything was great except for breakfast, which is served in the club lounge on the top floor(great view), but unless you are early it's a bit of a bun fight and the quality was not great. The canapes and desserts offered at other times of the day as part of the package were great.

Reviews.Title: “fast lifts”
Reviews.Author: mobi11
Reviews.Content: This is a smart hotel with slow checking in service. Close to Macy's for shopping. We had a room with two double beds , but the beds were very small for double beds. The hotel is used by lots of airline staff and the information desk was very helpfull for maps and sightseeing info.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and good location”
Reviews.Author: Ms_KP
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really well located - it's next to a BART station so it's easy to get to and from the airport without having to get a cab; it's one or two blocks from all the great shopping at Union Sq; it's around the corner from the cable car; it's walking distance to some good bars/restaurants. Getting to Pier 39 was no problem as it's just a short cab ride away. China Town is also walking distance - about 10 minutes or so as long as you don't mind walking up steep roads! It is best to get a cab to go to Golden Gate Bridge - and get their number so you can call for a cab back as it can be difficult to flag down a cab here! The rooms are well equipped with the basics. We booked a standard room which was compact but prefectly fine. Rooms are clean. The bed is big and really comfortable. The bathroom could do with an update as they are really old. It's not a fancy hotel, so if that's what you're looking for don't stay here. However, the hotel does have lots of pluses, location being one of them and which is why we chose to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Geraint Jones
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife and daughter for 2 nights on our first trip to the USA and it was a good decision. The only downside was that after booking a club room I was told on arrival that the club rooms were being refurbished and we were given a standard room on the 26th floor. We weren't given the correct club key cards and had to exchange them on day 2 at reception to get access to the club lounge where we had an excellent breakfast on our last day.Fantastic views from the club lounge. The hotel is very convenient for all the attractions such as cable car,shopping,restaurants etc - Why does anybody stay at Fisherman's Wharf?(Blackpool with an American accent!!) as the center of the city is much more varied. Had a light meal in the bar/dinner called Barley and Hops and it was fine with friendly staff. The other night we had a chinese meal across the road from the hotel which was fine. The weather was cold,foggy and damp - as Mark Twain said 'The coldest winter I ever spent was a summer in San Francisco!'

Reviews.Title: “great rate, service and location”
Reviews.Author: petthekat
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a trip with my aunt. She is notoriously picky, so i was concerned about negative reviews, but the location seemed ideal. Everything was great. My desk clerk, Maria, went out of her way to accommodate me. I had special requests and she worked diligently to accommodate them. We were given a corner room with fantastic views. It was clean and recently updated, with great bed linens. My main concern was other travelers comments about the noise level. If you live in a city, noise is common. It's part of city living. I felt this hotel was quieter than my home, but i live in the city. If you are a suburb kind of person, noise will be an issue in any city. There are adjustable vents at the bottom of the windows that are loud if left open. Otherwise, my stay was quiet. The bellmen are great. They will get you a limo to the airport for the same price as a cab. Overall, i would not resitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok, Front Desk needs retraining”
Reviews.Author: buzzkill1974
Reviews.Content: Requested a high corner room in February through the hotel website for my August trip to San Francisco. Front desk was unaccomodating upon check in. Checked with them every day of my six night stay and they were not able to honor my request. Staff with few exceptions seems cold and unapologetic. Location A+ (get the muti-day Muni pass) Staff D- Customer service training needed Room C- Clean but Average, AC did not work properly in room, bed ok but not wonderful, three oversized pillows useless Extras C - Business center will let your print a boarding pass for your return trip for free, anything else costs per page with internet access $10.00 for 20 minutes Overall C- Location is the key with this property. Service is lacking and upgrades bring them to about the year 2000. Not impressed and will stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly, A good experience”
Reviews.Author: runandbehappy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were a little nervous about staying at Parc 55 b/c the rates were so low. (we paid only $120/night) All the reviews on trip advisor seemed fine, and by the pictures it looked to be a nice hotel. They were right! The hotel was recently renovated, and so all the furnishings were up to date and very nice. It seems like it was an old Hilton or Hyatt that was bought and updated. It's not the 'boutiquey' hotel you typical see in San Fran, but it was a very nice and clean place to retire at night. We would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed my stay at the Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: pjdc8082
Reviews.Content: Visited San Francisco for the first time and based on the price, location and overall good reviews on Trip Advisor decided to stay at the Parc 55. Overall grade C ..... Paid a little more and got a corner room on the club level. Nice to be up that high and get a good view, but save the cash and get a View room. I got access to the Club Lounge ( really NOT WORTH IT). I went there in the morning for coffee and muffins, but that was it. When everyone comments on the great location, BELIEVE IT: if you take the BART from SFO, the powell st stop is a 1/2 a block from the hotel. this is right next to the Powell St. Cable car Turrn Around. And YEs.... the Westfield Shopping mall is just a block away. MY opinion only ......DO not waste your money eating at the restarants( the barley & hops especially)they are very overpriced and the food isn't all that great. As far as the " Remodeling " goes...... gee if this is what it looks like now, what did it look like before. Yea , its nice, but nothing lavish. Now I understand why all the reviews focus just on the location aspect of the hotel, overall its a very nice hotel to stay at, but for accessability and location to everything, it can't be beat. P.S. I stongly suggest taking the San Francisco Comprehensive Shuttle Tour. you get a great tour guide and an idea of where everything is located so that if you want to go on your own you have an idea of where it is and what you'll see.

Reviews.Title: “Plain Vanilla, Overated”
Reviews.Author: Mercboy
Reviews.Content: The room itself was OK, but here are the downsides: typical deceptive pricing: get them in the door with a cheap quote, and then charge extra once you got them: Internet (per computer) $5 Aquafina water, $50 per night parking (the attendant lied at check-in about neighboring options. Unfriendly service at check-in and concierge desk. Just completely uninspired. OK value, if you expect 3 star hotel in good location.
