Reviews.Title: “Better Options Nearby”
Reviews.Author: herbkim
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a couple nights in mid-July 08 based upon the highly positive TripAdvisor feedback. OVERALL The Parc 55 is ok. It's not terrible and it does the basics fine. However, if you're expecting a "nice" hotel I recommend you look elsewhere. In particular, checkout the Intercontinental San Francisco which is only a couple blocks away offering similar pricing but a much nicer and new building, decor and rooms. THE GOOD Very central location. Express checkout. THE BAD The broadband in this hotel was shockingly slow. Remember 128k ISDN speeds? That's what I was getting in this hotel. Totally unacceptable for a business traveler. The hotel is just plain dumpy. Decor in the lobby, halls and rooms is ok but not nice. Overall, it's an ok value but I do believe better options are nearby for similar pricing. I'm unlikely to return.

Reviews.Title: “great two years in a row”
Reviews.Author: mistyt
Reviews.Content: I would like to give the Parc 55 credit for being a nice place to stay in SF. The higher floor view rooms are wonderful. This is one of the nicest bed and linens in a hotel that I have found so far. I would suggest that you try to get breakfast outside of the hotel, it is too pricey for what you get. Also, one needs to be careful in the area. The hotel is very close to some unsavory activities. The staff can and will help you with that though.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: joshkspa
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on priceline for 109 a night. The location can't be beat. The outside of the hotel is a little ugly (who cares?) but the inside is great. I will attach pictures. Rooms are quiet, nice flat screen TV's. GREAT views. Ask for higher floors. I plan to stay here whenever we visit SF.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: NikoNZ
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a few hotels in San Fran, and this by far was the best. Great location, right in Union Square and heaps of shopping and restaurants close by. Tram stop just across the road. Only 30min from airport, $17 by shuttle. Pay for the upgrade: I paid a little extra ($20 or so a night) and got the Large King suite, with access to breakfast, desserts and more. Well worth the extra. This suite was HUGE. Would highly recommend this property. There are the odd homeless person around neighbouring buildings, but where isn't there in San Fran. Unlike other areas I have stayed, I felt safe here.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but for goodness sake, take care of the little repairs!”
Reviews.Author: Scapegoat512b
Reviews.Content: The Good! Location location...100yds from from the Powell St, trolley station. Service service service...Delivered wine glasses to the room in minutes...Pillows pillows pillows! By far, the nicest collection of pillows that I have ever stuffed under my head and between my legs!!! The Bad! An electrical outlet didn't work. An electrical outlet cover was broken. The shower pipe coming out from the wall left repaired with a white silicone caulk, obviously not finished. Overall, a nice place to stay, but in the price range of $300+/per night, there is a lot to choose from in "The City." Will try another place next year for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TBegay
Reviews.Content: Paid 115$ for each night thru a special on their website and for that money we got every penny out of it. Nice comfortable beds..great shower quite rooms and a great location. Check in was quick and they gave us a corner room on the 16th floor so we had a 2 window veiw of the city and only 1 neighbor! Like any facny hotel you pay for everything from 40$/night parking to 4.50 for bottled water. We parked at a lot down the street 2 blocks for 20 bucks instead. I helped a couple who spoke only Italian with their mixed up reservations and the front desk gave us free breakfast which was REALLY REALLY nice. The breakfast buffet was fantastic and I would recommend it but I have no idea what it costs....free to us :) Would absolutly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally disappointed”
Reviews.Author: pepdawg33
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were beginning a trip from LA to Seattle with San Francisco being the 2nd night. We chose the Parc 55 through Priceline and were excited to get a pretty good deal with naming our own price. We normally stay in 2 or 3 star hotels, and were excited to try a beautiful 4 star hotel! After our flight was delayed, we arrived at the hotel late and checked in, only to walk in to a room that was already occupied, with the occupants in bed! After returning to the front desk, we got a new room but no sincere apology for the mistake and were disappointed once we were settled in. The rooms with two beds are very cramped, the windows were broken and we had to keep the shades drawn the next day because of window washing. The bathrooms have horrible lighting and almost no ventilation. I believe the fee for internet access was around $15, and although they did offer two large bottles of lukewarm Aquafina in the room for $4.50 each, there was no mini-bar or refridgerator. The beds were comfortable, but it was a little gross to find long blond hairs on the bedspread in the morning, considering that everyone in our party is a brunette. Also the fee for parking with tax is $50/night which we thought was pretty steep. All in all, we were disappointed with our stay. The location is OK, but definitely not the reason to stay at this hotel...... as far as the rest of the trip, we stayed at Ramadas and other common hotels where the rooms were clean and spacious, with amenities like free internet, parking and fridges. We ended our stay at the Westin in Seattle for two nights, and I highly recommend it. Try the Westin in San Francisco.....you'll be happy you did!

Reviews.Title: “Above average, good for the price”
Reviews.Author: JaxAnn
Reviews.Content: My review is somewhat late, my girlfriend and I stayed there last Thanksgiving 2007. But I've been meaning to write since then. You get what you pay for, but Parc 55 offered a really good rate which was well worth it...you'd pay the same price staying in a 3 star and I'd say the hotel was well above a 3 star and a little below a 4 star. I'm only saying that because the furniture and decor were a little dated and somewhat worn but it added to ambience and the hotel and room was very comfortable. The hotel is centrally located and walking around the hotel I thought it was in a central location and felt safe to walk the city. With that being said, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: gottagettabreak
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location in the city; catch the cable car less than half a block away. Our room had recently been remodeled. Very spacious. Great bedding. Bath nicely done. Only complaint was that noise (just normal conversation on a phone) carried too well from the room next door, via the connecting door (which we weren't using, of course). Fortunately, our neighbor went to bed at the same time we did, so no sleep was missed. Struck me as odd, though, that among the amenities provided in the room (nice soaps, coffee, etc.), there were earplugs! Fortunately, we didn't have to use them! Would book again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: RobMichelle
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect location for seeing all of San Francisco. We had never been and the concierge was extremely helpful. We could walk or take a trolley almost anywhere. Pricelined for $115, it was worth $250. Parking was expensive ($45 per day).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: wakenswimmin11
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for one day to go into the city for my birthday. When we got to the hotel we booked a view room, but when the reception found out it was my birthday, they upgraded me to the club rooms which was nice. The club room comes with access to the club lounge which you can get appetizers, desert, and breakfast. The overall hotel was nice, our room was on the 29th floor and we had an amazing view of the city. If you are going to stay here (which i recommend) then I suggest you book the Club rooms because they are much nicer. When you walk into the hallways of the other floors (not club) the walls are very plain and boring. But when you get into the club rooms. you have nice wood pannels. Overall this hotel was very nice and a wonderful birthday stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: rchasewms
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect stay here on our family vacation to SF. The hotel is in a great location--next to the cable car turnaround (buy the 3-day pass) and a block off Union Square with shopping my teenage girls only dream about. The concierge was particularly helpful, giving us great restaurant recommendations (not the same old tourist traps) and getting us preferred seating at a very popular rooftop restaurant overlooking Union Square (which made for a perfect last night in SF). The rooms were clean, roomy and best of all had a great view of SF. We stayed on the club level which is a great value as it included a lovely breakfast (Starbucks coffee), snacks and dessert, and just that added space so all four of didn't have to be in the room at the same time. The Hertz desk arranged to have our car brought from another location to the hotel so we could begin our drive down the coast. I'm an experienced traveler (Million Miles on Delta) and it is not easy finding a good hotel for a family with two teenagers without buying a second room. This was a perfect hotel. Be sure and take the Alcatraz tour (book ahead) and we loved the Movie Tour that shows you clips of dozens of movies made in SF while you visit them. We saw more on that tour than on the double decker bus tour. Pick up at Union Square convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay!!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaFlighty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 for 5 nights in September. Upon arriving into San Francisco (for the first time), I caught the Bart Train (Bay Area Rapid Transport) into Powell Street. I got off the train - walked upstairs and out the doors - There was the PARC 55. A 2 second walk across the street and I had reached my accommodation. This was very convenient for me as I was traveling alone at that stage and was a little worried about being in such a big city (well, bigger than Auckland that is!!). I need not worry at all. It was in good proximity to Union Square and also the Powell Street Tram (turnaround just over the road) as well as local restaurants & bars. Good shopping in the area too! I ended up walking down to Fishermans Wharf (took around 45 mins and a few steep hills) but was really nice! From here we rented bikes and biked over the Golden Gate Bridge !!! That was fun. I recommend this property to all of my clients for convenience reasons. It was well furnished (Modern) with a bit of a few of the bay!! Was a tad on the expensive side at the time we went as it was peak time due to a conference in the area but I liked it and would definately stay here again!! I did not thing my room was run down in anyway and wasn't concerned at being on a higher/lower floor at all!!! Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: alexaBoston
Reviews.Content: Disappointed in my experience here - a hotel trying to compete with luxury chains that just doesn't get it. -- Booked a room with a view on a high floor. Got a room on a low floor. They didn't bother to refund the difference ($40/night) until I asked. -- Booked a non-smoking room and it stinks of smoke. -- Service is mediocre -- nobody answers at the front desk. Though some individuals try to be helpful. Overall I would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OlimpiaPR
Reviews.Content: Good location in downtown San Francisco. We booked by Expedia and the price was significantly cheaper than the one in the hotel website. The room was big and clean and had a great view. The valet parking is extremely expensive ($50/day).

Reviews.Title: “Great buy for Location & Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Z1Y1
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location to enjoy the vibe of Market St and Union Square shopping. Steps away from Powell St Bart station and bus/street car stop. Friendly/efficient front desk staff, bell staff, room service staff and housekeeping staff. Comfortable rooms with fresh air access. First rate bed linens and comfy beds. Rooms under going some updating, otherwise, existing rooms/baths still very serviceable. Been staying here regularily for a number of years and never disappointed. Book directly with the property via their website or over the phone for best rate and don't hesitate to ask them to match other major travel website rates if those are cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mrmark
Reviews.Content: I recently was in San Francisco for a couple days after some business in Palo Alto. I booked Parc55 based on trip advisor reviews. It is a great hotel just off Union Sq. It is a large hotel, with marble etc in the entrance. ITs a really busy hotel too and a lot of airline staff seem to stay there. I requested a room high up and got one on the 28th floor. It had a pretty decent view. The room itself was spacious, a king size bed which was comfy, and a decent sized bathroom. The only negative about the room was there seemed to be some A/C vent or something outside which made fair bit of noise, but they supplied ear plugs so I slept like a baby. Its about 1 min to the Powell mason street car, and BART/subway, 5 mins to Union Sq, all the major shops are nearby. I payed $145 a night and I think I got a great deal. Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carrliadiere
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Parc 55 for five nights this month, at the end of two weeks in California and Nevada. First impressions on walking in: amazing! A huge lobby, bustling with people and activity. Had to queue to check in, but it only took about ten minutes. Check in desk was fully staffed and everybody was polite and helpful. Room was fantastic! Paid for standard room on Expedia, and we got a corner room on the 7th floor, huge room with a massive bed and enormous bathroom. 32" flatscreen TV and coffee making facilities (which seem to be rare in the US) topped it all off perfectly. Tried out room service on the first night, and it was seamless. Was referred to by name on the phone, they knew exactly who I was and which room I was in without asking, taking away a lot of the awkwardness associated with room service. Food arrived in 15 minutes and was very good indeed. Tried out the hotel bar, which is a fabulous setting. Great service and ambience, although I think the same piano music every night might get to the people who work there eventually. Only blip came on check out, was billed for $350 when I had paid for the room outright on expedia. The woman at the check in desk I spoke to about the bill was quite curt, didn't offer any apology for the huge and erroneous bill, and merely handed me a new bill for the room service and drinks. This is a momentary blip though, as the service in general was first class. Concierge was helpful, bell service worked perfectly, and I was completely satisfied with the hotel in general. Highly recommended, especially at the great prices expedia are offering!

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: craignsandra
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised, the rooms were big, the service was great. Everyone was very eager to please. We had a room on the 29th floor with a great view, the morning breakfast was great for a light snack to start your day. It was convenient to have Hertz right there, and the concierge was knowledgeable and gave great service. The lounge was nice for relaxing and having a drink at the end of the day, very comfortable. I would definitely stay again, we got a great Internet rate for around $125, the best bargain we've ever got traveling for a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Few Issues”
Reviews.Author: Travelinsider
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, generally clean and well maintained, although somewhat dated. Excellent shopping location, although beware, the Hotel borders on what is refered to as the tenderloin district. Straying the wrong way out of the front lobby can be a scary proposition. Keep in mind though, that otherwise, it's a good location. About 25 yards from the lobby is an underground entrance to a very large nice mall. Near that entrance there is a large food court in the Mall with plenty of selections of really good reasonably priced food (not the normal mall food court food, would even suggest it for dinner if you are on a budget). Cable car is one block away. The front desk checked me into a room that was already occupied - that has never happened to me before, and it should NEVER happen. Fortunately, I heard them in the room before I entered. When I was given a new room, the keys didn't work. The front desk checked me in a third time which worked. I was concerned because that third time the clerk tried to get security to meet me at my room to make sure everything was OK, but she couldn't reach them - I never did see them. Room was relatively clean, although I noticed a thick layer of dust on the bathrrom vent and behind the bedside table when looking for an electrical outlet. They have an excellent workout room, with plenty of great well maintained equipment at no extra charge. Nice view out my room.

Reviews.Title: “Too Much Noise”
Reviews.Author: smacthayer
Reviews.Content: While I agree that the location for this hotel could not be better, I had major issues with noise during our recent stay (Memorial weekend). We got a good deal on the hotel's website ($127 per night for two double beds). However, upon check in, we were placed on the 5th floor, facing Cyril Magnin Street. Even with the earplugs in place that were so thoughfully provided, we could hear street noise. Fire trucks, police cars, motorbikes, and yelling reached our rooms. Then, at 2:15 a.m. on Saturday, we were awakened by a group of drunken guests making their way back to their rooms. Nice! No fault of the hotel, of course, but just added to our annoyance. On Saturday evening, we were entertained into the wee hours by a prom that was taking place in the 4th flloor ballroom. Nice of the hotel to advise us that such an event was taking place. My husband had to call the front desk and ask when the thumping rap noise might cease. I would have gladly paid more for a higher floor had I been advised of the noise issues and the party. The room was OK. Decent size, clean, nice bedding, comfortable beds, good sized bathroom with very good water pressure, very prompt maid service. No fridge, lousy coffee maker, no key for the in-room safe. I would not stay at this hotel again. I prefer the quiet and super comfortable Orchard up on Bush. You pay more, but the rooms are a delight, breakfast is included and you get a really good night's sleep. Had dinner at R&G Lounge, a must in China Town (reservations advised) and also at Hyde Street Seafood Cafe, a very good place for fish. Good value, good service, on the 28 bus line and the Hyde Street cable. Walk back down the hill after dinner for exercise!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: shelma
Reviews.Content: The reviews are right, the location of this hotel could not be any better. You are surrounded by everything you need. It is located 1 street over from the cable car line and BART station. The is a mall one street over and the hotel is surrounded by numerous stores of all varieties, all within walking distance, if you enjoy shopping. For dining there are 2 restaurants located on the 2nd floor of the hotel or there is a Burger King and a Carl's Jr directly across the street if you prefer fast food. The hotel offers a nice 24 hour fitness center on the 5th floor. The staff is very friendly. They normally charge additional for 2 queen beds instead of 1 king but upon request at check in we were given the 2 beds at no additional charge. We did rent a car so did take advantage of the valet service. It is $44 + 14% tax a day. I believe that is an excessively high price but you have all day in and out privileges and it never took longer than a couple of minutes for them to bring our car up and they were always very friendly and courteous. The rooms are decorated nicely and the beds were really comfortable with lots of comfy pillows. Do be prepared that you are in a city and will hear city noises! There is a fire station located within a few blocks of the hotel so you will hear sirens in the night or very early morning. Ear plugs are provided with their toiletries. There also is an extremely large homeless population in San Francisco and the hotel is surrounded by them so do be prepared to be begged for change. These are things to expect at any hotel in San Francisco however are not vacation spoilers. I would definitely stay at this hotel again! For the great service and very reasonable rates I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “it was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: thirstytraveller1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very cheap for the location ($99 US/night and we were there on weekends too). It's right beside the San Francisco Shopping Centre. A hop away from Powell line cable car station, a block away from Union Square... what more would you want? Service is friendly. 24 hrs conciere ensured we were not hassled by the wandering homeless at night (We ran into one homeless man/woman asking for change, and the security came outside right away). Room is clean, and enough tables and chairs to put our stuff on. It's not very fancy, but I think it deserves a 4 star. Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice, great location”
Reviews.Author: CrystalVancouver
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here for a conference I did at the Moscone Center. It was priced similarly to the Hilton (about $220) but this hotel was rated higher on this site. We weren't disappointed. The hotel is perfectly located for a lot of things -- easy walk to Moscone, close to shopping on Market St, BART station, streetcar, and the financial district, and also close to our favourite restaurants in the opposite direction. Check in and check out were fast and painless, with no unexpected charges. We were initially offered a room with double beds, and the desk clerk said there were no king beds, but we did get a queen which was fine. The room was on the 20th floor which would not have been our initial choice but it was very nice. The view was fine, and we had a bay window with a little loveseat. You do have to pay 12 or $13 per day for internet acess but the $45 per week is a much better deal if you're staying more than 3 days. The internet connection was tempermental, sometimes fine and sometimes slow. We initially signed in as "wireless", and when that was slow or not working, we had to call IT. They told us to sign in again with a wired connection, pay twice, and he'd get the front desk to reverse the charges. True to word, there was only one charge on the final bill. By the way, the hotel does not charge for 1-800 calls. We seemed to have got one of the "renovated view rooms". The furniture was new enough although the decor was a bit beige. The bathroom was small but nicely finished with tiled walls around the bath enclosure and granite counter. The bath isn't huge but my husband, who is 6'2'', found it fine. The water for the shower is high-pressure and instantly hot at any time of the day. The room size was decent (bigger than the last place we stayed in SF). Our room had a flat screen TV. Strangely, there was no minibar which we usually use for milk or soy milk for coffee, so we had to use the ice bucket to keep it cool. Initially we didn't like the location near the elevators and ice machine, but the soundproofing is so good we didn't notice noise at all. The gym was clean and very well-equipped with good-quality treadmills, ellipticals, free weights and a variety of weight machines. The hotel has a lounge with live music several nights, and there are a couple of other restaurants in the building. Room service menu was pretty standard with average prices. Our only tiny complaints were the lack of minibar/fridge in the room, and the strange little coffee maker which used up a new plastic tray every time (and the paper cups rather than real coffee cups). These certainly didn't wreck our experience. One huge benefit -- the whole hotel is non-smoking, so you won't accidentally get a stinky room. This is not a "luxury" hotel but offers value for money. We'd definitely return, whether for a conference or just for a fun trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MichelleNSam
Reviews.Content: We added 2 days to our San Francisco trip, and decided to book ourselves a nicer hotel than we usually go for. We booked the Parc55 for $115 per night. The front desk staff was so enthusiastic at checkin, and though we were expecting a lowerfloor room (we find most hotels give you the crappy rooms when you book through discount online hotel providers), we were given a 20th floor with a view of the financial district! My partner, an urban planner, was enthusiastic and we sat on the couch by the window both nights and enjoyed the view. Comfy bed with luxurious bedding, very clean rooms, friendly staff who always said hi. There were no problems with this hotel and I would reccomend it to anyone who wants a comfy room and confy hotel. Locatin was extremely convenient to BART, which was nice since we arrived at 11pm at night, and to the cable car (and its fun to watch them turn the cable car around on the tracks since you're on the end of the line!) We were surprised at the lack of decent restaurants within a two block radius, but within a five block radius choices were unlimited. On the negative side, we were a little shocked by the number of homeless people that come out at night around the two blocks of this hotel. Also, the "extras" that the hotel offers - concierge service, fitness centre - were lost on us, whereas the "extras" that we usually take full advantage of - free high-speed internet, continental breakfast - were absent. Internet would have cost us $15 a day, and the two rounds of drinks we had in the hotel bar ran us up a tab of $50. Finally, I am a "bath" person and I found the tub a little too narrow and shallow for my liking (though the high-powered shower was awesome). My partner and I would recomend this hotel to anyone who wants a comfy room with a great view, and is not too worried about the cost of extras.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with a great corner room -- feels very business though”
Reviews.Author: FLcs
Reviews.Content: We paid only $133 per night for a "renovated view room" and were in a corner room on the 27th floor which offered really amazing views in three directions. For the price we paid, I would definitely return to this hotel even though I much prefer a more boutique, stylish feel to a hotel. Upon checking in, we found out that parking was $45 plus tax per night (more than a third of our nightly rate!) so we parked down the road at a parking garage for $20 flat per night. The lobby is fine, though very bland...reminds me of a typical business hotel. Everyone was very courteous and business like. At the front desk, I requested a corner room due to previous reviews of such rooms being larger, and the woman was very helpful in pulling a high floor for me and reserving it even though it had yet to be cleaned. Later when we were able to get our keys, we walked into the room and it felt more like a suite. Upon walking in there is a small room without furniture and a very large bay window. To the left around the corner is the large bathroom, next is the closet, and then beyond is the bedroom with a bay window at the end of the room and a very large bay window over the desk. There were views in every direction. From one window you could see the transamerica building, from another you could see the very top of the golden gate bridge, and from the other you could see the southern part of the SF bay. The room itself had been renovated nicely, though it felt very corporate. Still, the bed was very comfortable and the furnishings were fine. They advertised a plasma tv in the room, but it was a standard box tv (not that we cared much). The bathroom was spacious with good amenities by lather, and the shower had excellent water pressure. Room service was very good, quick, and reasonably priced. We ordered both dinner and breakfast on occasion and it was presented very nicely and was delicious. The location is incredibly convenient. Literally a block from both the subway (Muni and Bart) and the Powell Street cable car. The walls of the hotel also seemed to be very thick because when in our room, we felt like we were in a sanctuary, unable to hear anything or anyone else other than ourselves. If you like the chain-type hotels, you will surely love this one. But even if you like the more stylish independent boutique hotels, you may find that the value and comfort at this hotel is more than satisfactory. I would definitely return. The only downside that I could find was that the gym was being remodeled and there were only three treadmills that had been stuffed inside a very small room on the second floor. They did, however, offer a free pass to a gym a few blocks away, but neither my partner nor I wanted to hike our stuff up there and back. I didn't care about this at all, and my partner was only slightly peeved, but if you're a big workout person, you should probably know this.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: grobma
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on business. I did not choose the hotel, and likely wouldn't have simply because while I love the neighborhood, the Hilton where I have points is right across the street. That being said, I was pleasantly surprised with how enjoyable my stay was. The exterior and lobby harken back a few decades and seem somewhat dated. My room had been recently renovated and was spotless with nice furnishings, including a couch and coffee table. Only problem is that with the new multimedia panel built into the dresser under the 40" HDTV, there is very little in the way of drawer storage. I had to use the drawers in the two night stands - something I've never had to do before. As I'd read other reviews that indicated noise was an issue (I had absoluetly no problems during my stay), I found it interesting that the bathroom amenities included a pair of ear plugs! Staff were friendly and helpful. I found the breakfast buffet to be over-priced for what it was - even in SF - but the coffee was delicious and the service outstanding. Best part about this hotel is the location. Assuming you want to be in the Union Square area, it can't be beat for convenience to all transportation and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: beckybr
Reviews.Content: Every single staff member we spoke with at Parc 55 were incredibly RUDE and unaccomodating. I was shocked at their behavior. In addition, the rooms were not clean, and are in need of renovation/refurbishing. I am a travel agent, so believe me when I say DO NOT stay at this hotel. You can find a much better SF hotel for the price (or less!) of a stay here, and you will avoid a very unpleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: KevinBlackman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the 20th and 21st April 2008. The Parc 55 is a large hotel, the room we booked was clean and tidy, maybe slightly on the small size but it was fine. We booked a Club room which are on the higher floors and have fantastic views either over looking the bay or the city. The complimentary breakfast was fine and also the afternoon refreshments in the executive lounge were a nice touch, we obviously received this as we had upgraded to a club room. The hotel is just off Union Square near to all the shops and the hotel provided a good location for our final 2 nights in San Francisco before flying home. As I understand the hotel is going to be refurbished in certain areas in September. I think this is probably a good idea as it could do with this in some places.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Fair Price, Not a 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: the_admiral_MB
Reviews.Content: The overall experience was fine. It was the little things about the hotel that make me feel that it was not a 4 star hotel. There was a tear in the shower curtain. The front desk people were...not the friendliest. The view and location were great. Across the street from a BART station and very close to Union Square. Lots to do in the area. Some advice for a traveler on a budget, it cost $45 plus 14% tax to park at the hotel. If you are not looking for in and out, there are two public garages, both within 2 or 3 block, that are much cheaper ($30 max incl. tax).

Reviews.Title: “It was just ok...”
Reviews.Author: 3travelers3
Reviews.Content: First I’ll start out with the good…For our recent trip to San Francisco, we really wanted a hotel with a good view and in a good location. This hotel had both. We paid extra to be on the club levels (27th – 32nd floors) and we requested, and received, a corner room after reading advice on this forum. The room had a good view of the city, but I was hoping for more of a view of the Golden Gate Bridge and the water. The room was spacious and clean, but the hotel is majorly in need of updating before it can be considered a four star. The location was good – close to shopping and public transportation. We had a pizza and beers in the hotel sports bar one night. Our waiter was great, but the pizza was just so-so. We were hoping to watch a boxing match but the sports bar didn’t have HBO! We were going to have a drink in the lobby bar but it was freezing in there & it was on the 2nd floor with a view of Burger King so we decided to go down the street instead. Now the bad…the service was terrible. When we arrived, we wanted to check in and drop off our luggage – then return our rental car around the block. (We had driven down to Big Sur for 2 days and then drove to Parc 55 for 2 nights.) The bell man told us that our luggage would be brought to our room in 5-10 minutes so we could park there briefly and wouldn’t be charged. After getting into our room, we waited 20 minutes and our luggage still hadn’t arrived. We called the bell desk and asked for it. We had to describe our luggage to them, then they brought it 5 minutes later. The person who brought it just threw it on our floor and left. After all that, we were charged $10 for the short time we were parked there. Other hotel employees that we encountered just seemed to have the attitude that they could care less about the guests or their jobs. In my opinion, everything about this hotel fell somewhere on the scale between “ok” and “bad”. I was disappointed and will stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Valet Broke my Mirror”
Reviews.Author: foxdog40
Reviews.Content: The rooms are o.k., but there was a problem with the room price. They charged me more on one night than the other despite the fact we had negotiated a group rate. The biggest problem was the fact that the valet broke the mirror on my car. They said they would send me a claim form, but never did. My calls have not been returned, so I pretty much gave up on them ever following through with their promise.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, but very poor service”
Reviews.Author: travelbound42
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself if wonderful, but the level of care for thier guests was not there. I booked through hotwire and got a great deal. I called to confirm a room was available, they told me absolutley. Check in time was quoted at 3 pm. I arrived at four, and only a room with two very small beds was available. Not a problem, I told them i understood how hotwire works and i was willing to wait for a better room. They told me it would take an hour. I came back over an hour later, they gave me a key to the room, which upon entering we realized was never cleaned after the last occupant. Long story short, we left the hotel again until they rectified the situation. We finally were able to check in and get our bags into the room at 8:30, they never extended an apology, charged us for everything down to internet fees.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location but not a four star”
Reviews.Author: abbeyn
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent off union square and next to the main shopping centres. Overall the hotel is very tired with both the rooms and the reception area in dire need of a refurb. The bedroom corridors were very depressing and musty. The size and shape of the bedrooms were good, the corner rooms were best with very good views over the city. This is not a four star hotel but with a refurb this could be so much more.

Reviews.Title: “Health Risk - Unsanitary Conditions”
Reviews.Author: trolleytransitman
Reviews.Content: After seeing news stories about hotels not washing the drinking glasses in the rooms, I decided to mark the glass to see if it was exchanged. The next day after the room was made up the maid neatly placed the glasses on the vanity with protective tops placed over them. When I checked, sure enough the mark I had placed proved the glasses had not been washed. I notified the hotel manager and she sent "security" to take a report. That was the last I heard from the hotel manager, so evidently the Parc 55 is not to concerned with Health Department regulations. I guess they got mad that I complained because the next day the room was not made up at all. Finally at 5:00pm a maid knocked on the door and asked if we wanted the room cleaned. I didn't bother to complain just won't stay here again. This hotel is not a 4 star as advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: antzona
Reviews.Content: In case you couldn't guess, I think this hotel has the perfect location for visiting San Francisco. It is just off Market Street, and two blocks west of Union Square. It is also just a couple blocks north of the Yerba Buena Parking Structure which is a nice option for overnight parking. I have had some bad luck with hotels booked through Hotwire not living up to their star rating. The Parc 55 is truly a 4-Star hotel. The entire staff was friendly and very helpful. My room was well decorated, clean, and well maintained. The bed was very comfortable and the linens were excellent. The shower was also very nice and had the best water pressure of any hotel I have stayed in the last five years. I will definitely make a point of staying here anytime I visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 was perfect”
Reviews.Author: MyReview22
Reviews.Content: Hotel looked like any other American hotel upon arrival, lots of mirrors, gold bannisters, marble and lots of sofa etc etc. Staff friendly and an excellent concierge called Rosa. She was very busy but happy to help all! Rooms were lovely, I have a room on the corner which was massively spacious and good city views. Would have liked a fridge in the room, but this didn't matter as there was an ice machine 20 metres down the hallway. Lovely comfy beds with big duvets and a million pillows! Location couldn't be better!!! Close to shops, restaurants and Union Square. You could walk to the Wharf in 20 mins-ish. I didn't eat in the hotel so have no opinion there, we chose nearby diners and restaurants, all of which were lovely. There's a great Italian across the road which is great after a long day sight seeing. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Union Square Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LELMD23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 in mid-March and coudn't have been more pleased. We stayed in one of the newly renovated "view rooms" which I'd highly recommend. The room was clean and newly decorated. The bed was comfortable and the linens and down comforter were great. The bathroom was fine - not spectacular, but with a new massaging shower head that was nice. The best part of this hotel was the LOCATION! It was fabulous - mere steps from Union Square and the origination of the Powell Street cable car lines. We'd recommend purchasing a 3 day Muni Passport that gives you unlimited cable car rides and bus fares (I think you can even ride the BART) thus negating the need for a car in San Francisco. Would stay at the Parc 55 again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderul Way to Stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: GreatSanFranLocation
Reviews.Content: My son and I recently traveled to San Francisco for a three day trip. I booked the room on Hotwire for $99 a night, which was half of what other hotels were asking. The location and accomodations were excellent. We took the Bart from the Airport for $5.25. The quick half block walk from the Bart was a breeze, even with our luggage. The location for food, shopping and transportation to all the local areas are basically right in front of the hotel. The rooms were very comfortable with immediate service for any special requests. We stayed clear of the Tenderloin, but visited all of the other communities with ease and without any concern for our saftey...bumped into some panhandlers each evening but they were very kind and nonagressive. Highly recommend bus 69 from the Wharf to Coit Tower to watch the sunset. When departing the doorman coupled my son and I with four other guest for a limo ride to the airport at the same price as their shuttle. I would definitely look to stay at Parc66 for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ert23904830924
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Parc55 and was very happy with it. For the price that we paid, and the location, it was great! It's walking distance to all the best shopping, a quick cab ride to all the good clubs, and tons of excellent restaurants all around. I would definitely recommend Parc55.

Reviews.Title: “Good shopping location”
Reviews.Author: Luvlie
Reviews.Content: Love the location of Parc 55, as it is fairly near to Union Square and Westfield is just right across the street. Powell street, which is parallel to Cyril Magnin Street where the hotel is, is also good for shopping. Stick to the main roads though, as the back roads around the hotel are a bit scary. A lot of bums around the area, hassling you for change and a sandwich. Suggest not to walk back to the hotel when it gets dark, as I have heard of stories where people get mugged just right outside the hotel, behind the big pillars. Hotel room is comfortable, although it would have been better if it comes with a safe in the room and some bedroom slippers. Overall, a good feel about the hotel though. Would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience th Parc 55 Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tango01071955
Reviews.Content: The extra cost for the Club style rooms is a wonderful value!!! We could not have asked for a better hotel. The Parc is centrally located, right in the middle of everything. The hotel staff was a pleasure to assist, the bath products were wonderful, the linens were top notch - just like the quality we have at home. I can not wait for our next visit. We stayed here for business, but are looking forward to a vacation there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: KaelinCB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a nice post-Valentines weekend at the Parc55. We got a great room rate from Hotwire.com. Our room was smallish, but comfortable. The king size bed was comfy, especially the down pillows and comforters. The bathroom had a phone in it! Good location for those who don't mind exploring the city by cable car, MUNI, BART, taxi, or on foot. We had an OK lunch in Barley & Hops Bar and Grill. Downsides: we were near the elevator, so we experienced a lot of noise from the hallways. The hotel was hopping, full of airline employees. Mold on the bathroom ceiling above the shower. After depleting the in-room coffee we went in search of lobby coffee for which they wanted $3. Fortunately, a coffee place was right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: kidsmurf2000
Reviews.Content: Reception was clean, well kept, attractive and the staff friendly. The first room they assigned me had severe A/C noise problems, so straight back to the front desk for another room. The room was average, but with a very old, cheap and somewhat small TV and very bad TV reception. Room service took a look time and the food disappointing. The internet connection was terrible, with a speed below dialup. Not all ammenties were replenished each day. A lot of room noise, both from the adjoining rooms (mainly footfalls from above) and street noise. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare front desk at checkin, good location, hefty parking fee”
Reviews.Author: norcaltravel
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms at the Parc 55. Arrived around 2PM (check-in 3PM) Was told no rooms were available until at least 4PM. The front desk (Erika I believe) was as unfriendly as I have ever experienced in years of travel. Probably better suited for a less visible position in the hotel. I understood 3PM, but 4 or 5 would make us late for our dinner and show. Also, parking came to a whopping $61 for a 24 hour period so keep that in mind if driving in as that raises the cost of the hotel significantly. We will take BART next time as the station is about half a block away. Finally got the rooms around 5pm but not on the same floor even though booked together. This was OK except that one of the rooms turned out to be a handicap room with no tub, a modified toilet seat, doors, etc... Called the front desk and they agreed to move us. Back downstairs and another wait in line for a room. By now it is almost 6PM and we are still not checked in and definately not able to eat dinner prior to our show. Back up to our new room and we discover that a makeup bag is missing. We speculate it was left in the handicap room when we moved in and back out so quickly. The front desk has already reassigned this room and cannot, or will not, allow housekeeping and/or security to check the room without the new occupants permission. (even though the bag is unmistakable and has been described to them in detail.) The front desk indicates they do not have a lost and found, only housekeeping keeps things left in rooms. OK, we agree to try later as it is our fault the bag is missing. When we come back from a late night out we check again with an extremely helpful night manager at the front desk who tells us she will check lost and found and with security again. (Thought there was no lost and found. Hmmmm.) No luck. We go to bed and about a half hour later gun shots in the neighborhood and lots of sirens. We had just walked two blocks from Mel's Diner. Yikes! Next morning we call the other room ourselves and low and behold the bag is there and is retrieved. Much better start to day two than day one. All in all, the location is excellent and the rooms were good. However, the front desk (Erika at least) needs a lesson in customer service. The night manager and the doorman were as friendly as you will ever find.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: daggar
Reviews.Content: I was just at the hotel while attending a convention at the Moscone Center. While the convention supplied transportation from the hotel, I chose to walk the short distance. Maybe 10 minutes. The hotel was great. The location was great just off of Market street, where you could catch a bus to anywhere. The turn-around for the old streetcars is just around the corner. In some directions, there are plenty of homeless, but, almost entirely, they were very passive. We didn't get approached a single time, though we passed many people with hats, boxes, or hands extended. I think that's just what you get in the big cities. If you do stay here, I highly recommend a breakfast at Dottie's True Blue Cafe around the corner. It's an old diner, but a real gem, and the breakfast was awesome. 622 Jones Street I think. Hotel services were what you would expect in a high end hotel. While I didn't eat at any of the hotel restaurants, the hotel bars and pub were a great place to hang out with friends. Also, there is plenty of other nightlife within a couple of blocks, including a very interesting Irish pub. Highlights: Dependable lodging. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Fitten06
Reviews.Content: Comfortable bed, wonderful staff, and exceptional location. Very easy to get to from the Bay Bridge (which was important since my friends were in Oakland), and a convenient walk away from the major SF attractions. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous luxury in the heart of SF”
Reviews.Author: IslandRandR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 en route Auckland - Vancouver on New Year's Eve. The hotel staff were very friendly, even though they had to get us to sign waivers saying we wouldn't have a party in our room (a problem in SF, apparently, on new year's eve). They also allowed us to check in early at 11:00 am after our flight from Auckland. The bed was extremely comfy after a long flight, and the hotel is close to everything a tourist could want.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay”
Reviews.Author: hydepark
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at this hotel, it was my 3rd stay. It was the best experience of all my stays. I decided to book a room which had a better view this time and was given a room on the 19th floor that had a really nice view of the Civic Center area. Check-in and Check-out was fast. As I mentioned in my other reviews, the best thing about Parc Fifty Five is its location. My only minor gripe, and it is very minor, is to find out after I booked the reservation, that I could have got it $15 cheaper if I waited till later to book. Winter is slower, so hotels are willing to lower their rates if they have rooms available. Also, the sheets had holes in them, although the room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: figgyburn
Reviews.Content: great location right next to the bart station.but i must say the area around powell st and the cable car turnaround really is getting downmarket what with all the bums panhandling all day, everyday.they don't hassle you but you have to dodge them all the time.we went in december heavens knows what it would be like in the summer months.the hotel is great and the beds are wonderful i wish i could get one of these beds here in edinburgh i might get a good night's sleep!!.got a good price $110 which i think is great value.enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Julesbusiness
Reviews.Content: Parc55 is located about two minutes walk from Powell Street BART station so travelling from the airport to the hotel by train is so easy. Check in only took literally 30 seconds as the receptionist just swiped my credit card and gave me my room key. When booking, I opted for a room on one of the top floors as previous reviews have mentioned about traffic noise. The top few floors are named as an ‘executive’ section, and as such this allows guests on these floors to enter the ‘executive room’ on the top floor that has a small self service honesty bar, serves a continental breakfast in the morning and has a great view across the city. The room itself was very large, clean, fresh and in an excellent state of repair. I was fortunate enough to have a room on a corner of the hotel so had two large windows that gave me two different, but good views of San Francisco. The room had a large comfortable bed, large bathroom/shower, large wardrobe (and iron), sofa, TV and desk/chair. Daily maid service was excellent as was the turndown service. The room was quiet, and I didn’t experience any noise either from in the hotel or from outside. Checkout through the TV was simple and I just dropped off the key in the box in the lobby on the way out. I have to admit that aside from my speedy check in, I didn’t interact with the staff at all as everything was to my satisfaction and all of the services that I used could be self activated and were easy to understand and follow. I guess the only downside is that, as mentioned in a previous review, the amenities in the business centre are very expensive. I used the internet, which was somewhat pricey, but had no intention of using the printer which had an outrageous price per sheet. San Francisco is well known for its homeless population, and a great number congregate around the BART station area just around the corner from the hotel. Whilst they may be an annoyance, I found them to be harmless enough and not in the least bit aggressive. In fact, one of my evening forms of entertainment was going to a convenience store around the corner from Parc55 to buy some chocolate and join in with the banter from the people hanging around outside. This may not be everyone’s cup of tea for an hours entertainment in SF, but it demonstrates that these people are approachable and not out to kill us all. Parc55 is in an excellent central location. As mentioned, it is very close to the BART station, so great for the airport, and is also close to the trams that take you to Fisherman’s Wharf and the cable cars for exploring the city. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from the large department stores of Bloomingdales, Macys and Nordstrom as well as all of the others in Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and outdated”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegan78
Reviews.Content: Yet again, here is a tale of the ratings. What constitutes a four-star accommodation in a metropolitan city with more hotels than pigeons? Four star hotels position and price themselves as "superior", but, in my experience, there is very rarely any superiority to them. I rate Parc 55 "Okay, but some problems". And I mean exactly that. I booked a non-smoking room with a king bed. Our room was only ready by 4 PM on check in day, but we were initially delighted to have obtained a "20-th floor room with a city view". Unbelievably, street noise was almost as loud as at the street level, and indeed very disturbing during the night. To add to our discomfort, the mattress was horribly uneven, and every single spring could be felt through the thin mattress top. Pillows, on the other hand, were very small, too soft and of rather inferior quality. Our bathroom was relatively spacious, but all fixtures and decor were outdated and in a need of an upgrade (i.e. chipped wall tiles, chipped mirror and rust stains on fixtures). The bathtub drain was extremely ineffective, and we had to stand in a bath half full while taking showers. We had a desk, a chair and a small sofa with a coffee table in our room. To our disbelief, there was no mini bar and no room safe in our room. The TV was very old and small. The hotel very enthusiastically nickel-and-dimes you at any opportunity. They charge you by the minute for using their business center, and a printed page costs you more than $2. We paid a total of $11 for the luxury of checking in for our outbound flight and printing two boarding passes. When I called the front desk in the evening asking them to have a taxi for us at 5:15 AM next day, I was bluntly told that cabs were available in front of the hotel 24/7. Indeed, we had to crawl to Market Street and look for a passing taxi next morning. Altogether, they provided us with a bed and bath. I however would not recommend staying there. The general manager should walk 500 yards over to the Orchard Garden to see for himself what level of comfort and service a similarly priced same category hotel can provide.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mtabakman
Reviews.Content: Pleasant welcome, clean and comfortable room, nice location next to Powell St. BART station, and just a couple blocks from Union Square. What more could you ask for? Oh yeah, got it for $99 on Priceline too. Add this to your list of downtown SF hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Too Small, A Little Too Noisy”
Reviews.Author: cblase
Reviews.Content: So I bookedthe room through Hotwire and you could say I got what I deserved, but usually Hotwire gets me one of those cute boutique hotels in the shopping district. This time I got a big, bland building full of glass and steel. The room was disappointingly small and not high enough up to avoid the street people screaming and acting crazy. The creepiest parts were the dirty room service tray parked right outside the room and the dirty hand towel on the rack above the toilet. My suspicion is that the staff thought they only needed to do turndown service and not a full room cleaning. So who knows if the sheets were used? Beware of the $45 parking fee. I think nearby garages will charge less. If you're willing to hoof it, I'd check theSutter/Stockton or the 5th and Mission garages.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: cienpasos
Reviews.Content: January 4, 2008...the Bay Area's worst storm in several decades. The wind outside was ripping trees down, knocking over trucks, and carrying small children and dieters down the streets like runaway cable cars. The rain was coming down in horizontal torrents! Stepping-out of the hotel was risky. Obviously, the Parc 55 had no control over the weather. However, I didn't see them do a single thing to ease the burden of their challenged guests. Could they have offered free hot coffee and tea? No, Parc 55 decided to continue charging for this basic service. Could they have offered free WiFi to guests who were stranded in their rooms for two days? No, they charge $12.95 for internet. Could they have opened a couple of cheap bottles of wine and offered a social hour in their lounge (many hotels in SF do this)? No, their crews with ladders and other equipment commandeered the lounge to take down Christmas decorations forcing all to retire to their rooms. I spoke with the front desk suggesting that perhaps the WiFi charge could be waived concerning the circumstances, the answer was, “We have no control over the weather.” Don't get me wrong...Parc 55 is a beautiful property with a splendid location. I am sure that the staff was as stressed as the guests. I am disappointed, however, with the Parc 55. This was an opportunity for them to step up and make a difficult time for their guests a little better...even memorable. Too bad, huh! The whole time I was sitting in my room looking out the window, I kept wondering what the other hotels were doing for their guests.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION & COMFORTABLE ROOM”
Reviews.Author: lancer808
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had stayed at the Parc 55 Hotel to celebrate New Year's. We chose this hotel because of its reasonable price and its close proximity to Union Square and various restaurants. I have read previous TripAdvisor reviews about the hotel being in an undesirable or "seedy" location. I found the hotel's surroundings to be fine, especially during the day. Cyril Magnin Street, where the hotel is located, is very busy with vehicles and pedestrian traffic. However, as with any vacation, it is always important to remain vigilant and aware of your surroundings. The check-in process was quite easy. This is a rather busy hotel which is heavily used by the flight crews of various airlines, convention attendees, and business travelers. The hotel staff was courteous and helpful, except for one of the bellmen who seemed to be having a bad day. The seven elevators were rather efficient, timely, and spacious. Our ninth floor room was typical but very accommodating. The bed was very luxurious to sleep in. The bathroom was clean with sufficient ammenities. Street noise was heard throughout the day and night, mainly from police and fire vehicle sirens. But that's typical for any downtown hotel. A temporary fitness center was created on the second floor while the regular fifth floor location is being renovated. It is heavily used by guests and only offered five (5) cardio machines. Free weights and/or resistance training equipment were not available. The only complaint that I had was the hotel's valet parking. Guests are charged $40 dollars a day (plus tax) with in-and-out privileges. This fee could add up if you plan to stay several days. Also, allow between 10-25 minutes for the parking valet person to obtain your vehicle. One day that I waited about 20 minutes. After complaining about the long wait, I was informed by the valet supervisor that my vehicle had been parked at an alternate lot because their hotel garage was full. If you arrive back to the hotel late in the evening, chances are that your vehicle will be parked at the alternate lot. If you're looking for a convenient hotel that provides affordable daily parking, you might want to consider the Cathedral Hill Hotel, just a few blocks away on Van Ness Avenue. They provide a discounted room/parking package. The daily parking fee would be about $10. Better yet, you park it yourself and leave at your own convenience. Overall, my friends and I had a pleasant stay at the Parc 55 Hotel. I would recommend it to any traveler who would like to be in the heart of Downtown San Francisco. TRAVEL TIP: Rather than travel across the busy Market Street to get to the San Francisco Shopping Centre, a quicker and possibly safer way is to go through the underground Powell Street BART station. A Starbucks Coffee is located at the mall's entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RoadTripsRUS
Reviews.Content: I think the location of this hotel is great if you enjoy Union Square and the Market Street area. My husband, my parents and I flew into Oakland and took BART into the city. The BART stop at Market and Powell is directly across the street from the hotel. While I think the hotel was in better shape when it was a Marriott property, I still think you can get a good price for a fairly nice room. The only complaint I have was that our rooms were not ready until after 5 p.m. This is a large conference hotel and several events were going on when we visited. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and will stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best!!”
Reviews.Author: lauderdalebob
Reviews.Content: Almost let this review get away, but I decided I definitely do want to write something about this hotel. Stayed there for 5 nights from Dec. 3-8, 2007, and didn't have one complaint about the place. I booked a few months in advance over the hotel's website and got a fabulous rate of $111 per night plus tax for the Club Room Floors. Ended up upon check-in being put on the top floor (Rm. 3209) and the room and the view (in particular) were spectacular. Stayed at the Grand Hyatt last year (also club floor) and paid more than twice this price and I really feel the Parc 55 is superior. One reason being that I had a rental car for both stays and where the Grand Hyatt you have to pull up in the street in a lot of heavy traffic to hand the car over to valet parking, the Parc 55 has a circular drive off of the street and it was a cinch. Yes, parking was $40 a night plus tax plus I tipped them each time I got the car out, but it was still cheaper than staying at one of the other hotels, given the $111 Club Level room rate here The Club Level breakfast was teriffic! Bagels, cereals, croissants, etc. Even sliced meats for breakfast if you wanted them. Couldn't have been any nicer. I lived in SF for 10 years and love driving there, maybe it's just me but I love driving on all the hills. Anyway, do not hesitate about booking here. The place was immaculate and service was outstanding, from the parking valet to the housekeeper to the front desk staff. Enjoy SF!

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience, not worth the upgrade, poor reception staff”
Reviews.Author: vangelisd
Reviews.Content: Spend a few days at Grand hyatt , few in Monterey and back to SF for a few more at Parc 55. That was the worst experience of all. I did book quite in advance, requested a city view room, paid for an upgrade to a "View" room, mentioned that it was our honeymoon, and all I got when I arrived was a 21st floor room with a view at a construction yard at the back of the hotel! After numerous attempts to request a front city view I was turned down with typical answers such as "we're fully booked", "your room has a spectacular view, why do you want to change", "try again tomorrow morning". Apart from overlooking the construction yard and hearing all the noice in the morning the stay was quite ok. Nothing special, rooms are big but the bed was not really comfortable, carpet was/looked dirty, bathroom ok, amenities ok. Cleaning staff were superdb but the front desk were really bad and counldn't be botherd. Same for the conierge who weren't very helpful and looked quite bored just sitting there. The hotel caters for a lot of business travelers and lots of airline crews! Didn't bother with any of the bar/restaurants as the are so many at close proximity. Location was great though, oposite from the Shopping centre and the Bart/cable car stations that was very convenient. Our stay at the Grand Hyatt was so much better, great rooms and views, superb beds, nice touches such as an ipod docking station, great bath and bathroom products, a lot friendlier staff. Wish I had stayed there for all part of our SF stay. Not worth the view upgrade unless they can guarantee a city view. Other wise you get as bad view as you would get with a cheaper rate but on a higher floor!

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay, as great as the 1st”
Reviews.Author: nookielu007
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time I've stayed at the Parc 55, and both times it has exceeded all expectations. There was a special offered for Dec/Jan on Travelzoo. In the past few years I have become more accustomed to nice hotels. I enjoy duvets and robes in the closet, etc., and of course this this hotel had all that, a nice sized room with an amazing view of the city, even chocolates waiting for me on the bed, turn down service, etc. It has a great location, just across from the BART/MUNI station, and good shopping at the Westfield mall, Gap, Old Navy (which is better in SF), the trolly, etc. It is in a safe part of Union Square. Best of all, I wanted to make note of the staff. They were amazingly cordial and generous, and made my stay so nice. Jose Luis at the front desk has a wonderful sense of humor and did everything possible to make my stay the best it could be after an ordeal at the airport. Thank you to him and the Parc 55--my family and I will continue to use the Parc 55 to all future trips to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Tainted Experience; Risky Reservations”
Reviews.Author: seafloorscott
Reviews.Content: "Anyone can take a reservation; the trick is holding the reservation" -- Jerry Seinfeld Had reservations for two nights, Dec 13 - 14 2007 but stayed here only one night. Why? I tried to check into this hotel early on Dec 13, when I arrived in the city. I picked this hotel because it was near Moscone Ctr and BART and had a reasonable price. This hotel is a haven for foreign flight crews leaving SFO. A flight delay meant that at least myself and the two people in line with me had been bumped from the hotel so these stewardesses could cool their heels for a few more hours. Bonus - they comp'ed my stay at the Fairmont. They gave me a taxi voucher which wasn't accepted to get to the Fairmont. It took them nearly an hour to deal with the mess on their end, and another hour to deal with getting up to the Fairmont and checked in there. I came back to the Parc 55 for my second night in the city. The room was nice, pretty much unremarkable for this class of hotel in downtown SF. Even on the second go-around the desk staff was very slow. Given all of the problems that I experienced, and the I would rather stay at one of the large number of other hotels near Union Square that might actually hold my reservation.

Reviews.Title: “loved the parc 55. perfect”
Reviews.Author: mickeytheshoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Parc 55 for 5 night from 26 nov and had an excellent stay. We arrived late at night and luckily there were no queues.Before I had arrived i had mailed the hotel looking for a high floor room as im a very light sleeper and to my surprise they had upgraded me to a Club room on the 29th floor. When i got to my room i also found out that this includes a free continental breakfast buffet every morning and hors duerves in the evening.I never had the evening spread but we made full use of the breakfast. Excellent for setting you up for the day sightseeing. The room itself was very large with massive bed. It must have been close to 7 ft across and amazingly comfortable. The bathroom was also large with excllent toiletries and an amazingly powerful shower(something very important to me) We didnt eat in any of the restaurants(why would you with so many restaurants nearby). The hotel does get busy with airline staff and is definitely business orientated but what is wrong with that. when on a city break to see the sights and shop all you want is a professional clean and cost effective hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: pabl01neum
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 is an acceptable hotel. I arrived mid-day on a Sunday for a conference. The line to check in was long, about a 15-20 minute wait. I checked in and went to my room, only to find that they'd given me a smoking room in spite of the fact that I'd reserved a non-smoking room. Back downstairs for another 20 minute wait in line, when they informed me that they didn't have any non-smoking available and that I should come back in a couple of hours when more rooms had been cleaned (this was at about 1:30 PM, well after check out time). I came back at about 3:00 PM stood in line again for 20 minutes and was then finally given a room. The waiting in line was a very bad start for my 6 days at the hotel. The 10th floor room was acceptable. The room was clean and the king bed was just fine. I'm not sure why they put 8 pillows on the bed now. The swing valve from the main bath spigot to the shower head broke on my second day there. The plumber guys arrived promptly and fixed it. Internet service was fine (although pricey at $12.95 for 24 hours). Street noise was fairly audible, but that's probably true for any San Fran hotel room. I'm a city kid, so it doesn't bother me too much. The hotel maid did a nice job of keeping the room clean. She actually left me a note thanking me for my tip the day before I left. The hotel "bar" was below average. Go visit the Irish pub up around the corner for a lively spot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, above average rooms”
Reviews.Author: OP2002
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 hotel is well located if you are looking for somewhere close to Union Square. I took the BART from the airport and the hotel is as good as on top of the Powell Street stop right on Market St. You've got a large shopping centre just across the street which was good for me as I was over from the UK and looking for retail therapy. Union Square is a couple of blocks away, as is the Powell Street trolley stop for trips to Ghirardelli Square. I was put on a high floor (somewhere in the 20s if I recall) and facing north. The room was nice and spacious, very clean and felt recently renovated (this was September '04) although it didn't have much character, and felt like a business hotel. The bathroom seemed like it had missed this renovatio though. There were computers on the second floor with pay by the minute internet access which was handy for checking in for my flight back to London. From a location standpoint this is excellent, just a short walk from Union Square, right next to the BART, the trolley and the shops! If you are looking for somewhere in Union Square then the Westin St Francis is a better bet, ask for their newer rooms as the old ones aren't so good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a weekend in the city”
Reviews.Author: blackford1
Reviews.Content: Excellent modern hotel in Union Square area. Hotel is literally just steps from the BART station and the cable car to fisherman's wharf. Great area for shopping too. The room was clean, modern, and well appointed, with a spacious bathroom. I have no complaints, and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in SF”
Reviews.Author: UKflightattendant
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I didn't think I'd like this hotel. I think it might have been the awful architecture - it's hardly a pretty place - which looks very dated, and I suspected this might be reflected inside. However, I was pleasantly surprised. What really sells the Parc 55 is its location, right in the heart of things. Don't go and stay out in Fisherman's Wharf - this is where you really want to be. It is unfortunate that the panhandlers congregate very close to the hotel and I can understand that this might make some uncomfortable. However, as has been said, be polite and I don't think you'll get any trouble. The hotel is very handy if you're planning on taking a cable car, especially if you want an early start and to be ahead of the crowds and that long queue/line waiting to board. Also nearby are countless shopping opportunities, and the recently extended Westfield Mall is a great addition, with many familiar names. Rooms are remeniscent of many a hotel chain of this calibre. By this, I mean they're not especially individual, but I don't expect that from a property of this size. My room had two queen beds, and was, I felt, spacious for a US city-centre hotel - there aren't many I've stayed in which also accommodate a little lounge area with two cosy chairs! The 'bay' window style gives the room greater depth. Furnishings are pretty standard but of high quality and the room has a large closet with iron and ironing board. Altogether very comfortable. The bathroom is equally spacious with plenty of ameneties. The only thing which concerned me was the provision of earplugs - that didn't bode well! My room, on the 18th floor, wasn't exactly low but there is a fair level of noise throughout the night. Nothing more than the sounds of a major city, and I was only aware of it when I awoke during the night through jet-lag, but it might disturn some. I used the wireless internet access, though wired is also available in the room. Wireless fees were US$12.95 per. 24h. This I fee is reasonable, but then again, I am used to highly inflated fees in UK hotel rooms! A good option in SF if you want to be in the heart of it all, close to dining/shopping and with easy access to tourist opportunities.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: dc240v
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel very comfortable and in a great location, a wonderful place to stay while exploring San Francisco. I dropped my bags off at the concierge stand before checking in and they arrived at my room minutes after I arrived. Later the concierge was very helpful in finding restaurants and getting tour information. If you can arrange it, stay in the club level floors, I think it is 27 and above, the club lounge is a great place to relax breakfast is free in the morning and hor'orderves and available in the evenings with an honor bar also available. Our corner room had breathtaking views of downtown San Francisco from the Embarcadero to the Golden Gate. This hotel will be high on my list when I return. We stayed the week of September 24th.

Reviews.Title: “Nice large room, in desperate need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: travelSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Although the Parc 55 is one of SF major hotels, I have never hear great things about it so I was just a bit skeptical. Because it is a large hotel, the room was a bit hard to find, it feels almost like a beehive. However, the room we got was a pretty large room with floor to ceiling windows on one side of the room. Even so, the room looks very much dated and in need of renovation. The carpet looks old, the furniture, the curtains, even the television. The windows also need cleaning. Although I was happy enough with the room, I would hesitate to rate it higher than 3 stars as shown on Expedia, and even their rates seem to high to me. The location of the hotel is both good and bad. It is right in front of the BART station, across from Westfield shopping center, down the street from major theaters and restaurants. But if you walk the opposite way, you are right in front of the Tenderloin area and should be very careful of walking around there. Unfortunately, there is not much the hotel can do about this except to warn you. Check in was quick and efficient. This was really the only interaction I had with the staff so I can not comment on them.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely 4* hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: willowy74
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for £102 a night though priceline. arrived at 11.30am and was checked in immediately sob a great start. We were put on the 13th floor ! im not suspicious luckily. Lovely reception area ~(very gold/brass) with six lifts. Gift shop on 2nd floor - open from 7am-9pm which sells soft drinks/gifts/stamps/sweets etc. Adequate health club and a bar and grill on the 2nd floor (sports bar type). Staff friendly, especially concierge/bell staff. The hotel is at the bottom of Powell St near the start of the cable car lines. Tickets can be brought at that point. You are in shopping heaven here - the westfield shopping malls house Bloomingdales/Abercrombie/eateries plus lots more). The BART station is outside the hotel and pan handlers do frequent this corner. They may ask for change but if you say sorry and walk on they leave you be. Dont turn right as you come out of the main area as this is the tenderloin district - dont venture. head towards cable car powell street (left). Beds comfie/hotel very clean / staff courteous - i would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Mandy7162
Reviews.Content: It's a large hotel with almost 1000 rooms and 32 floors. We stayed on #23 with nice views over the city. The room was alright and clean but the water pressure is weak and it took up to 10 minutes to get hot water. Internet is not cheap either with $9.95. Unfortunately this is from noon to noon, no matter when you check in or out. Its centrally located near Market and Powell Street with BART, bus and cable car right next door and many shopping opportunities nearby. We booked relatively late and paid $229 (1st night) and $249 (2nd night). I would only go back if we could get a lower rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for location and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: OCruiser
Reviews.Content: I know a lot of people hate big hotels, but I really enjoy them, and this one is no exception. It's very conveniently located to shopping and transportation (BART, MUNI). I know others have said that they found the vicinity unsafe, but I felt quite comfortable walking by myself in the evenings (and I'm a female). I didn't run into any panhandlers and it's so close to a busy shopping area that there are always a ton of people around. I found the rooms to be very up-to-date, clean and comfortable. Their bar soap (from a Pasadena company called Lather) was really nice and moisturizing. I didn't interact all that much with the hotel staff, but I did notice that every time in went in and out of the hotel, the doorman said hello with a smile I also ordered room service which was delivered in a timely fashion.
