The person that delivered my meal was very pleasant. The food was very nicely plated and surprisingly good for hotel food. I'd definitely recommend Parc 55 and stay there next time I'm in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 still a walk in the park”
Reviews.Author: Flankster
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Parc 55 (and its predecessor, the Ramada Renaissance) perhaps a half dozen times during the eighties and early nineties. I always enjoyed the location and found the rooms to be clean and comfortable. I was a little worried when I read some of the reviews here in Trip Advisor which warned of indifferent staff and aggressive panhandlers, but decided to book a room anyway. Even though there were a bunch of people waiting in line to check-in, the process was surprisingly quick and efficient. The room (and bed) was very comfortable, the street noise only minimally audible, and the staff was fine. Barring bad weather or physical problems, SF is a great city to walk around in ... Parc 55 is a great location ... I recommend walking to Bocadillos (Basque Restaurant) in the shadow of the Transamerica Building for a good walk and excellent (but casual) meal!

Reviews.Title: “Skip this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ontario_Sun_lovers
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because the rate seemed reasonable for San Francisco but we feel we would have been better off paying a bit more for a better hotel. The room is not too bad but our bathroom was in the need of some updating and the plumbing needed some work. We waited for so long for our luggage to be delivered that my husband ended up going and getting it himself. When we approached the conceirge with a question he was rude even though he had been standing doing nothing at all. Don't plan on eating breakfast at the hotel as the prices are ridiculous. The best part about the hotel was the location for day travel. It is close to all means of transportation which is really important because you should avoid coming in by car if possible. The valet rate is $40 per night! There is really good shopping nearby however I do feel that this area is not safe at night. We went for a walk but returned very quickly because there were many, many beggars and street people as well as teenagers fighting in Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Not fabulous, but pretty nice....”
Reviews.Author: Minivern
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 in October, 2007. We found it to be a nice hotel. Its courteous staff and superb location prompt me to give it a 4 star rating. As just noted, one of the hoteIs best assets is its location, which is conveniently situated to easy access to Union Square, BART, and the nearby conference center. That being said, however, the rooms are not well sound-proofed, and as the hotel is in the 'heart' of things, it can be a very noisy place to stay. During the night, we heard not only street noise (sirens, people shouting, garbage trucks) from our 16th floor room, but we also heard other guests coming and going (one particularly loud party woke us from a sound sleep at 2:15am). If you are sensitive to noise, you may want to consider asking for a room on a higher floor or taking earplugs with you for your stay at this hotel. Our room was comfortable, especially the bed. However, the decor was somewhat dated and didn't feel at all 'fresh.' The even more dated, large hotel bathroom somehow felt a little grimy -- perhaps because of its dated fixtures and circa 1980s tiles, but it also might have felt that way as a result of the the fact that some of the floor tiles were dirty. I like things really clean when I stay in a hotel (my husband would say I'm too picky), so the dirty floor tiles bugged me. We were unable to locate the safe in the room, but otherwise found everything we needed, includind hair dryer, iron, and coffee-maker. The staff we encountered were very courteous and professional, and this included everybody from housekeeping to the concierge (Rob was especially helpful) to the bell hops. After calling the front desk and asking for a nail file, as I'd forgottent to pack mine, one was delivered to my room within 5 minutes by a nice man. This expeditious, friendly service was a nice bonus. I would stay at this hotel again for its location and friendly staff, but wouldn't recommend it to someone who is really sensitive to dated room decor, somewhat dirty bathroom floor tiles, or noise. Although it isn't the nicest place I've stayed in SF, it is comfortable and was a terrific value for the area at $130/night via Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “In like Flynt”
Reviews.Author: spoon47
Reviews.Content: Booked the 55 ages in advance as the start of my coast to coast trip across the US. A great spot to explore SF and also to unwind after about 18 hours of travelling. Service was excellent and recommend any room over the 7th floor for a decent view. Front desk even brought up a nice botttle of bubbly from my famry! Beds were comfy and loads of room in the rooms , internet access downstairs as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: santamonica2006
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right close to the main public transportation, including cable car, BART and Muni subway. Check in was smooth but no one offered to take our luggage up or to show us where the bedroom was. Our bedroom was a king size club room located in the 27th floor. There was no grand view, just some buildings. The room was small and not 100% clean (dust on top of furniture + hairs on corner of bathroom floor), there was also no mini bar. The breakfast was nice at the club lounge but as there were a lot of people there was at least a 10 to 15 min wait for you to get to a table. The buffet was small but very nice. You can also access the lounge in the evenings when they have a big selection of drinks and it isn't at all crowded so you can relax. Overall it was a nice stay but I would expect more of the club room especially as you do pay more, so maybe it would be a better idea to have stayed in a standard room. San Francisco is trully an amazing and beautiful city, lots to see. It is essential to get a MUNI transport passport as it is a good money saver. Just one ride up the cable car will set you back $5 so the passport is definately good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: windvalley
Reviews.Content: My bf and I stayed at the Parc 55 Hotel for 1 night while exploring the city for 2 days. The front desk and concierge were fantastic and helpful, check in wasn't until 3pm but they gave me a room at 11am. The room wasn't huge and our view wasn't great but it faced away from the street (8th floor) so didn't have that much street noise. The location was superb, just steps from BART, shopping and Cable Car. I can definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A few problems, but never the less, a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Musclebearnz
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Parc Fifty Five last Thursday night, just after midnight. Got a great rate on Expedia for a "view room" and requested a high floor (the hotel has 32 floors). I was given a room on the 14th floor. On arriving in the room, I found the room had not been cleaned after the previous guests had checked out. Trapsed all the way back to reception to complain. Some other guests were at reception complaining of the same thing!! The reception agent wasnt too pleasant and it seemed to be my fault the room hadnt been cleaned properly.. He gave me a room on the 9th floor.. Hardly a "high floor view room" which was what was requested. Next morning, I got an early "wake up call" at 7am.. Unfortunately, I never requested a "wake up call", again, the caller wasnt that pleasant or apologetic. Those were the only negative aspects of the stay! The room and facilities were lovely. After arriving from London and staying in a minute and cramped London hotel room, this room was huge by comparison. The facilities were great, lovely bed and a coffee maker that make beautiful coffee. The cleaning staff were lovely. On checking out, the doorman was excellent and rung the airport shuttle service twice to give them a hurry up as they were late picking me up. The hotel is in the Tenderloin region, which means a few homeless people around, but I never find them a problem, some of the time, they are very colourful and humourous, Ive never felt threatened by them. The hotel is also in a great location, right at the exit to the Powell St Bart/Muno station. Would definitely stay again..

Reviews.Title: “Great first experience”
Reviews.Author: badbadsal
Reviews.Content: After reading some mixed reviews of the parc 55, we decided that we would take advantage of their great online "labour day" special and book with them via their own web site. We were very apprehensive as other reviews noted alot of beggars in the area around the hotel. We found this to be true although it did not detract from our overall experience, they seem to be a way of life in Union square and are not at all aggressive. The hotel lobby was very clean and there was no line at check in. They had our reservation easily and the lovely lady on the desk got us a great room with a fantastic view of the city and the bay (see our candid traveller pics) The concierge was accommodating and friendly infact all the staff were very smiley and helpful. Check out was easy, done via the telephone in the room. Room was clean, quiet and plenty big enough. We did not take advantage of the bars or restaurants in the hotel as there are so many other great places to eat and drink in relatively easy distance. The hotel is literally across the road from the trams and the Bart station. We got the bart from the airport straight to the union square station and it was ideal. I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a good base in san francisco as the location is superb, and there were no problems with service what so ever.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, great location. Good value via Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: korokoro
Reviews.Content: Excellent room, great location. The deal via Hotwire was exceptional (less than $100) so the value was superb. Shame the high speed net isn't free.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Place”
Reviews.Author: mahenry
Reviews.Content: We went for our 40th anniversary on Sept 5, 2007 for 4 nts. and had a wonderul time. The location is ideal for any transportation. Took the Bart right from the airport and only cost $5.15 each. It is practically out the door from the station. The Cable, trolleys,buses etc. are across the street. We were only a few blocks from the theatre and Union Square 2 blocks away with all the shopping you could want. The service at the hotel was excellent, we had a real sweetheart at the desk that could not have been nicer. Stayed on the 26th floor with a gorgeous view of the city. The room was spacious, nicely decorated and very clean. The bed was comfortable. I would recommend staying above the 19th floor because there is city noise and construction noise that may bother you. We had breakfast at the Club room each morning and it was wonderful with great service, they also had drinks etc. in the evening with a fabulous view from the 31st floor. The concierge desk is very helpful with all your needs and directions for what to see being taken care of. The only down side was $40. a day to park. We flew in so that was not a problem and after our stay we headed back to the airport rented a car and finished our trip to Napa,Reno and Tahoe. We figured we would not need a car in the city. Also if you will be there a few days or more get a pass for all the transportation for a flat rate. It was $18 for 3days, where as just a cable car ride one way was $5. so a very good deal. For safety reasons if i were a woman in the area on my own I would not be out late alone, San Francisco does have a lot of homeless so take cabs if necessary. I would definitely book again online and stay at Parc 55 and recommend anyone else to do so. You will not do better anywhere in the city for your money. Hope this helped and enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LynnClarke
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Only yards from cable car, trams and buses. Ideal for shopping centre and eating out. On the plus side the hotel rooms are big, clean and beds are comfy. We also had complimentary breakfast in the club room and soft drinks were on offer P.M. On the down side we could hear street noise and sirens at night even though we were on the 27th floor.. On our first night I found a blob of poo on the toilet floor. I guess if I had rung housekeeping they would have dealt with it, but I felt it wasn't worth making a fuss. Although it did mar my initial feelings about the place. I also have to say that this was the only thing that offended me on the cleanliness of the hotel and I guess it was just and over sight of the maid... We stayed here a week and I have to say that everything else was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: sweetka
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location Cons: Everything. Parking expensive. Food is terrible. Rooms are way outdated. Dont stay on lower floors (we stayed on 8th) and you can hear everything that is happening on the street. Sirens of all kinds all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Massive room and great bed”
Reviews.Author: Gifford
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights at the start of a round California trip. Like most other comments we found the hotel very central for the shopping and was virtually the first building we saw as we came out of the BART station. Like others we felt the downside was the number of beggars in the vicinity of the Powell Street station, but this just seems to be a fact of life in San Francisco. The hotel is enormous and on arriving found the check-in extemely fast and we were upgraded to a mini suite which consisted of an enormous room with a massive bed and a sitting area with a 3 piece suite. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was large if a little dated, but overall we were extemely impressed. The public areas were attractive and there was cocktail lounge and seperate sports bar where you could have very reasonably priced food (although we didn't eat there). Checkout was also very quick and we found all the staff pleasant. I would recommend the cafe next to the hotel for breakfast and there is a large food court with various different types of restaurants in the mall across the road. There are more attractive parts of the city in which to stay but overall for conveience and value I would highly recommend the Parc 55.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: AnnaSeattle
Reviews.Content: The loaction is gr8. You are only a block away from Bart station, MUNI stops and cable car turnaround. The visitors center is also there. From the airport, we took the BART and reached the hotel with no hassles. There is plenty of shopping and restaurants close by. There is a cafe next to the hotel where u can get small eateries, milk, juices etc. The hotel was clean and the service prompt. Our stay was pleasant and I would definately consider staying there again. The only bad experience was at a chinese restaurant right across the hotel (near the burger king). The prices were atrocious..we paid about 50 usd for one fried rice and one chicken dish. There was a 15% gratutity added to the bill for serving two items at a table for 2. Then there is still space left for you to add a tip. So if you miss the gratutity addition, you may end up paying adding tip.The portions were small and did little to fill us. (we went to burger king later and ate again). The moment you are seated, a trolley with different appetizers appear and they hard sell to make you buy it. The way it is presented, you are led to believe that it is complimentary. Thankfully, I asked !! Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: chuckenpen
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at Parc 55 hotel for 3 nights in August/September. We booked a double deluxe room at $129pn. I have mixed feelings about this hotel as there was good and bad about it. The room was a good size, with a seating area near the window. The bathroom was small and dated, but the shower was really powerful. Our view was down on a back street which was extremely noisy at night. The safe was broken so we couldn't use it. The real thing this hotel has going for is the location, it is in the heart of some serious shops, the cable car, BART and tram is a two minute walk from the hotel. All in all if you are not too fussy about your room this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service & Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaelifeisgood
Reviews.Content: We just spent a get-away-weekend at the Parc 55. It was within walking distance of so many different attractions. Shopping was a couple of blocks away. We walked to Fisherman's Wharf (about 20 to 25 blocks), walked all over once we got there, and took a trolley car back within one block from the Parc. Took a little side trip through Chinatown. It was a wonderful hotel and GREAT service. We thoroughly enjoyed every minute of our stay. The bed was super comfortable, plenty of extra pillows. FANTASTIC EXPERIENCE. We'll definitely be back to the Parc.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EmRC
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at this hotel. We stayed during Labor Day weekend - August 31-September 6, 2007. The service was excellent everywhere. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly - everyone! That includes the front desk, concierge, bell hops, maids, Veranda breakfast staff, etc. We will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and families. And when we visit again, we'll definitely stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Poor Reservations Service”
Reviews.Author: Traveler10017
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night for a family gathering. We made reservations through the hotel website. A day prior to checkin, I called the hotel to confirm our reservation. I was told that I have TWO reservations under my name, for TWO nights each. I asked the person I was speaking with to fix it to be ONE reservation for ONE night, and he said that he did it. At check-in, we were told that we've got two reservations, which means that the person I spoke to on the phone did not fix the reservation to correspond to what we booked on the hotel website. So, at check-in, they fixed it to ONE reservation, but told us that a king room, non-smoking is unavailable, only king smoking and double non-smoking are available. Time being 6:30 (checkin time is published to be 3:00), I got irritated and the front desk rep IMMEDIATELY found one more non-smoking king room that we initially reserved. But he did not see in the system that our promotional rate had free breakfast vouchers included in the rate. He took another 15 minutes to verify that and we got our vouchers (needless to say that the folio under our door the next morning prior to checkout had charges for those breakfast vouchers that were supposed to come free with our promotional rate. They fixed that when we came down to complain). On to the good part -- the room was the cleanest room i've ever been to. Not a stain was anywhere -- which is great in my book, and redeems the poor front desk service. The hallways are spacious and clean; as are the common areas. The buffet breakfast is excellent, and there is a piano bar upstairs, as well a a really delicious and suprisingly cheap Thai restaurant on the second floor. All in all, I LOVED the hotel, and would recommend it to anyone who appreciates a nice, clean room and spotless linens more than a seamless check-in experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: phlavorful
Reviews.Content: We stayed here August 10-13 and had no problems. My husband booked it on priceline for 120.00 a night, but I've read of some people getting it cheaper. Check-in was quick and I was glad to find out that we had a corner room. However, the windows wrap around the corner rooms so you probably get more light in the morning, but that didn't bother us. They had two sets of curtains, but light always finds a way :) The room was clean and spacious with cool decor. It had a separate room with a closet and enough space to store your luggage. That room led into the bathroom. The bathroom was fine, nothing spectacular. I did like that the shower curtain curved out to give you more room in the shower. I didn't like the smell of the shampoo/conditioner, but they got the job done. The bed and pillows were comfortable, check the closet for the extra pillow. The TV was large and the picture was clear so my hubby was happy. We kept the do not disturb sign on the door so I can't comment on the maid service. We ordered room service one night and were satisfied. We also had an overpriced buffet breakfast with okay food on last morning. There is a shuttle service that comes every 15 minutes to take you to the airport and I think it was $16.00 per person The location was great. If you plan to explore the neighborhood on foot, DO NOT make a right when you walk out of the main lobby. I think that is the Tenderloin section, a ghetto part of town. A block over to the left of the main lobby is where you catch the cable cars. Some tips and things we enjoyed: The best was watching the sea lions at Pier 39. If you plan to cover a lot of the city in one day you can pay $11.00 for unlimited rides on the cable cars, buses, and trolleys. A one way trip on the cable car is $5.00 so we cabbed it a lot. It was cheaper to take a cab from Parc 55 to Fisherman's Wharf. We had a great meal at Sauce ( It's on Gought St. I think it's in the Pacific Heights section) Alcatraz was cool-we happened to go on their annual anniversary event so there were scheduled speakers (former inmates, guards and family members that lived on the island) Before we went I searched a calander of events for things going on and found a lot of time specific things to do. i.e. The Nihonmachi Street Fair in Japantown. I think [--] has a list too. It was worth it to take a cab over to the GG bridge. Have Fun

Reviews.Title: “Not fabulous, but OK”
Reviews.Author: EarlyGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 last Saturday night while we were in town for a wedding. The entrance to the hotel is not striking; as a matter of fact we spent time trying to figure out where the front door was! The lobby is elegant, although in kind of a wierd layout. In the room things were clean and the furnishings were nice and looked new. The bathroom was serviceable but somewhat small and the amenities were basic (soap, shampoo, creme rinse, no shower cap.) On a low shelf in the bathroom was a one-cup coffee maker that you apparently put on the bathroom counter and plug it in there if you want in-room coffee. The two full-sized beds that we requested and got were comfortable with lots of pillows. The TV remote did not work. As far as I could tell, none of the rooms at the Parc 55 have a breathtaking view - it's mostly rooftops and other buildings. The biggest thing that I didn't like was the inconsistency of staff coverage. When my parents drove up into the valet driveway, there was no one there to come and take their bags. So we had to commandeer a cart, pack it with the luggage and bring it inside (which we later found out was "against hotel rules", putting us in a no-win situation.) Another day, we needed a taxi. But there was no one at the valet station to call one for us. We ended up walking down the street until we found one. These are not horrible things, but they are basics that I expect from a 4-star hotel. On the upside, the hotel is in a safe location to walk to Market Street, including the cable cars, the "Union Square" Amtrak bus stop and the Powell St. BART station. From this hotel, you can ride transit and get just about anywhere in the city. Just be careful not to walk west of the hotel via Ellis St.: it will take you straight into the Tenderloin neighborhood which is not safe. Would I stay here again? If the price was right and I didn't want to bring a car into the city, I'd say yes. If I was looking to spend a lot of relaxing/pampering time in the hotel, probably not.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: allydee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in August and found it to be a ferfect base for our holiday in San Francisco. Rooms were first class. Restaurant staff were very efficient and friendly. There were a few vagrants in the vicinity but this was of no problem. A good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is an excellent all rounded hotel”
Reviews.Author: Minnx
Reviews.Content: Cool dude place we think !! Great location in city centre with all the facilities within a block of the front door, Big hotel feel, though were made very welcome by the resturant staff in particular. Nice pub in the building which also served excellent food, Excellent room with ultra quiet AC Did not have much time to use all of the excellent facilities as we were out and about all day, and tired out by night time. Very comfortable beds. Fantasic view from room across Market Street, the centre and the bay from the 8th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CACruzin
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I just returned from an overnight excursion to San Francisco. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. Being a little bit leary after reading some unfavorable reviews, I asked for a quiet room and was given 969 which I thought was a quiet room for the heart of downtown San Francisco - and we live on remote acreage in the California mountains. There was no waiting when we checked in at 6:30 p.m. The beds were comfortable with a selection of pillows. We loved the fresh air vents below the windows & left them open all the time. They have a well-equipped exercise room and we fit in a free-weight workout. All of our driving was done during the day of arrival. After checking in, we drove up the block to a 24 hour garage to save $20 on the SUV. These type garages do not have in & out privileges, but that's fine, because from the Parc's location you can walk or take the cable car almost anywhere. It is located at the Powell Street cable car turn around. We walked to the financial district for dinner and came back through Chinatown. We didn't try the restaurants or room service. All in all it was a fantastic experience for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for downtown”
Reviews.Author: Brossie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights at the end of our trip around California. I had chosen the Parc 55 for it's location as I knew we'd be doing last minute shopping. As other reviews have mentioned it is ideally placed for public transport and very handy to Union Square and Westfield shopping centre. We were upgraded to Club room (27th floor and above?) and this was a pleasant surprise. Very nicely decorated room, 2 double beds, large tv etc. The Club Lounge was a bonus for us but I definately would not pay to use it. The food was pretty meagre for the hors d'oeuvres and desserts - better for breakfast. The Lounge was closed on Saturday (take note if you are thinking of paying for this!) and no evening service on Friday so we only got 2 breakfasts and 1 evening in the end! The staff in the Lounge were very disinterested. The dressing gowns in our room were great though! Didn't try any of the restaurants but the coffee shop next door is good for breakfast. We ate at the foodcourt at Westfield in the evenings - excellent range and healthy options (for a change!). Overall, an excellent location. And definately ditch the rental car - no need for it and very expensive to park.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: TVTravel
Reviews.Content: San Francisco is a terrible place to bring a car. Hotels charge $35 - $55 a day to park yours (plus tax). Finding a hotel that makes using public transportation easy helps avoid the neeed for a car. The Parc 55 is the perfect place if you fly into SFO, then take the BART (Bay Area Rapid Transit) train into the city. It is right next door to the Powell St. station. It's one block to the cable car terminus, about 3 blocks to Union Square, 5 blocks to SFMOMA. A vintage trolley car runs up and down Market Street for easy access to the Ferry Building and even onwards to Fisherman's Wharf. Booking online revealed several unadvertised bargain rates and went smoothly in May. When I tried to repeat the experience in July, the website totally hung up and I ended up booking in another nearby hotel. Check-in went smoothly with none of the problems other reviewers have mentioned. The rooms are on the nice end of normal. Ask for a high floor if you want fantastic city views.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Parc 55!”
Reviews.Author: lhutchins13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from San Francisco and had a wonderful time staying at the Parc 55. Check in was surprisingly --fast! We arrived early around 11 and were immediately given our room on the 5th floor. The view was great, overlooking the shops from downtown. The location was wonderful, we bought a 3 day muni pass and hopped on the trolley (which is right across the road) or bus daily to take us to the wharf or wherever we needed to go. Also took the Bart to the airport --very convenient. The room was comfortable, not the best I have stayed in, but nice compared to other places I have stayed in San Francisco. Everyone at the hotel was very nice. The sportsbar has a happy hour and cheaper drink prices. I suggest hit them up during this time to save $. Overall, we can't wait to go back. Very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location, some minor service problems”
Reviews.Author: Mme_X
Reviews.Content: This feels like a good business-class hotel in a Marriott category. My overall rating mostly reflects a very comfortable room in a great location (right at the Powell Street BART station on Market Street, near Union Square.) Room 2763 is a very good size, with two double beds looking towards Union Square (visible a LITTLE bit between the buildings) and the Coit Tower in the distance. Nice-size bathroom with many toiletries -- but no hair dryer that I could find. Spotless housekeeping. The desk (chipped on the edges) could be a good work surface, and there is an internet connection (with an ethernet cord in the room) for $12 a day. We paid extra for this room with entitles the guest to the club lounge, breakfast, and evening snacks. While not bad, I'm not sure I'd upgrade again. The lounge itself is nice enough with an excellent view (same as our room, but on the 31st floor), tables and lounge chairs, nice continental-plus buffet breakfast of pastries, cereals, fruit, juices, etc. The evening has cocktails ($6 for wine) and hors d'oeuvres, which were not that impressive -- small assortment of hot hors d'oeuvres and really mundane cheese selection. There were a few complimentary newspapers around to be used in the lounge (I think, since there were so few.) Like any Club lounge I've seen, it can get a little crowded at some times in the morning. I could deal with these minor imperfections if not for the issues with the Club lounge management. When we first stopped in, the manager and assistant seemed more concerned with talking to each other than greeting guests. We would also find that guests often had a problem with their pass key-cards to enter, which often meant guests would knock (pound) on the locked door. Rather than assume that these were guests with key problems, the attitude seemed to be that these were Club-crashers. This could easily be verified since Club guests have a different color card. But no -- the Manager scolded anyone who might open the door, but he was VERY slow in trying to come to the door -- leaving the guest outside pounding the door, and those inside having to listen to it. Couldn't an assistant manage something? Further, I believe that the staff should be able to have their meal break, but this sometimes meant that NO ONE was minding the door -- again resulting in a guest, sooner or later, pounding the door. Also: the evening hors d'oeuvres were scheduled to go until 7:30. When we stopped in at 7:10 to grab something quickly, the food had all been cleaned up, and an evening dessert was not out yet. The slips continued. I met my sister at this hotel, where she would check in the following day. I reminded the staff about this at my check-in. Supposedly they entered her name. The following evening, I stopped by the desk to remind the desk staff to expect her later that evening. When they checked, there was no record of her name. They dutifully re-entered the information. When she checked in later, there was STILL no record of her name, which resulted in a late-night call to the room to give permission to send her up. To top it off: they gave her a room key-card that did NOT correspond to a Club level -- which resulted in problems at breakfast the next morning in the Club lounge until we got it corrected. (Also "funny:" the desk clerk mentioned, "You don't have the same last name as your sister," I think questioning her story. We are in our 50's, and I'm married. Are different names of married sisters so surprising???!!!???) The hotel has a nice, sunny second-floor public lounge, bar, and restaurant. We didn't eat here or have drinks, but it could have been a nice possibility. There are free newspapers for guests in this area -- stocked much better than on the Club lounge!!! The take-away: we'd be happy to stay here again since the room was like a good Marriott-quality place at a better price, and the location is excellent if you want to use the BART from the airport and be convenient to Union Square. I'd still check other options for price/value, but I could return here and be pretty happy if I could overlook the service slips. I understand the need for security at any hotel, but this place gets a bit undiplomatic ans slipshod in trying to manage it. Further, the Club lounge was not very impressive, and there are other good-to-much better alternatives for breakfast, drinks, etc. nearby. Do it only if you want a not bad continental breakfast without having to go far, if the additional price is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel , great access..”
Reviews.Author: N&GB6
Reviews.Content: Large hotel with gym, sports bar, chinese & a la carte restaurants, which were all reasonable priced & hotel bar. We had a room at the end or a corridor and the view of the city was fantastic, the windows were large and gave a panoramic view. The bed was wonderful, duvet & pillows. Room cleanliness was also good but you could hear some traffic noise even though we were on 8th floor. Easy walking access to shopping and cable car. Coffee shop right outside. It appeared to be in an area with a high volume of homeless people but as you travel round the city, there are homeless people everywhere. Trip to Alcatraz worth doing & spending day at Fisherman's wharf

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: nuramirez
Reviews.Content: We selected the hotel because of location and we had a good rate, $139.00 per night. We stayed from Jun 30 - Jul 5. Check in was terrible. Eventhough I booked the hotel 6 months in advance and I sent an e-mail re-confirming my late arrival and my requested room (no-smoking, 2 double beds), they didn't have it and I needed to change rooms the following day. New room was clean and had a great view of the city. Parking was pricey but convenient, too many homeless in the area. If IT WASN'T FOR THE HOMELESS, the location of this hotel is very good; a minute walk from BART, cable car turn-around, muni buses, many shops. The visitor center is a block away, very convenient. Express check out was easy and fast. I think I will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Parc 55!”
Reviews.Author: goRedSox1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 the week of 4th of July. We had one minor bump in our check in process - they had our last name spelled wrong (most likely an error in transferring the reservation from Expedia) so it took an extra minute to locate our reservation, otherwise this place was top notch! It couldn't be more convenient to public transportation around the city and to the airport. You are right in the heart of Union Square. We had breakfast each morning from the small coffee shop on the corner - it was cheap and easy. The only hotel restaurant we ate at was the pub - a little pricey, but what do you expect? We found the rooms to be very nice and the beds comfortable. The only thing was the bathroom didn't have a vent so it got quite steamy in there. I would definitely stay at the Parc 55 again - it is a great hotel for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55, awesome views & great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ileftmyheartinsf
Reviews.Content: Check in was great and front desk was extremely helpful. Stayed for 3 nights at a summer promotion of $99/night with my fiance. I would suggest confirming reservations a day or two before you arrive to avoid complications other people say they have. The view we had on the 26th floor was awesome. The bath amenities were lovely and housekeeping was great. We were very happy with the location of this hotel. Minute walk from BART, cable car turn-around, muni buses. Highly recommend getting a passport for 3 or 7-day from visitor center a block away that lets you have unnlimited rides. Yes there are LOTS of homeless people, but there are EVERYWHERE in union square so don't act surprised tourists. Our experience was that they were not too aggressive and some were actually nice. The only thing I wish was that internet access was free (in the room (as it should be in an area like that) and a refridgerator would have been nice and convienient. Another thing was that walls were surprisingly thin, we could hear regular conversations in the next room, but it was more personal enteratinment hearing the person singing in the shower next door. Other than that LOVED Parc 55 and will stay again for the aforementioned rate!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: savtrav22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in June for 2 nights for business, hotel is steps from the Powell St. BART and couldn't be more convenient for travel to and from the airport. The rooms were clean with comfortable beds. No WIFI, internet is available via broadband for additional charge. Breakfast at the 2nd floor restaurant is pricey, better to go to the great and inexpensive coffee shop adjacent to the hotel. The area is teeming with great shopping and restaurants. Concierge did a fantastic job of recommending places to eat, and arranged transportation for us at no cost to one of those restaurants one evening. Cable cars departed one block over. Check in and check out were very busy, the hotel seems to be home base for flight crews for both Delta Airlines and Singapore Air, so if you arrive/depart when those airlines are dumping flight crews in or out, then you are in for a wait. As many other reviewers have said, I was astounded by the homeless - I have traveled around the world in many major cities and have never seen so many homeless, and was startled by how aggressive they were (although not at all threatening, just aggressive in panhandling.) You are very near the tenderloin district so be cautious where you go when you leave the hotel. All in all great stay for the cost and location and I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Still suffering”
Reviews.Author: tim150978
Reviews.Content: Had to check in 3 times, staff were unable to competently check people in to rooms, heard at least 2 people complain that the valet had "lost" their car and then we were double charged for the room. When hotel was contacted they claimed I had not been charged even though I could show them it on my statement!! Then claimed I had said ok to a $20 fee for a room with a view even though I never had.This has been on going and they still have not resolved it. If you dont like your money, your car or good customer service, this is the place to go, otherwise stay in one of the nearby hotels. They are nicer, just as cheap and dont ruin your trip.

Reviews.Title: “For the money, Parc 55 couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: BostonVince
Reviews.Content: Check in around 1pm was quick and easy, and got a room right away. We did see long lines at the desk at times, and several large flight crews from Singapore Airlines checking in. It isn't possible to get any closer to BART or the MUNI, a godsend for travelers using public transit. As previously stated, proximity to shopping is superb. There were homeless people and some panhandlers around Powell Station, but they were totally harmless. Traveling frequently to NYC, we probably look more streetwise than some of the other reviewers not used to the city. No one ever approached us, even walking through the Tenderloin towards Civic Center. I do not recommend this area to anyone not used to being in major cities. Room on 29th floor was great. Nice and large and very clean. Good bathroom products by "Lather". Bed was extremely comfortable. Fresh air vents were great (but of course give you a little more noise). At times we turned off the AC and just opened those vents. Noise level really was minimal, even with the building going up next store. Besides, noise is intrinsic to cities. Anyone who can't stand noise should take a country vacation. Housekeeping does like to knock a lot, to check whether the room is ok. It seemed like overkill to us. Breakfast in club lounge was adequate. Fresh fruits, meats and cheeses, hot and cold cereal, bagels, breads and danish. Starbucks coffee was a real kickstart in the morning. The afternoon snack was ok, no where near what other hotels put out in their concierge lounge, but the Parc 55 also cost a fraction of what those other hotels charge. The evening dessert was a nice touch, and perfect since we usually don't have room for dessert at that evening's restaurant. Speaking of restaurants, we tried the Siam Thai Noodle both in the hotel (many restaurants were closed for the 4th of July) and across the street. Both were fantastic. Express check out could not have been easier. All in all I very highly recommend this hotel and will stay here next trip to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Staff, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FightOn
Reviews.Content: I frequently travel to SF on business and had struggled to find a hotel I would come back to on subsequent trips, but with the Parc 55 I finally found one (at least until it was no longer a Marriott property). Right away upon checking in I was recognized as a Marriott Elite member and given an upgrade to a room on the concierge level. The concierge lounge provided a decent selection of hot appetizers during dinner time and desserts later in the evening. It also had great 180 degree views of SF. The hotel itself was spotless, very classy and well maintained. The best part however was the service. I was in town for a convention and my fiancee was with me, she got very ill and we did not know what to do between check out time of 11am and 5pm (when my convention ended). The hotel arranged for her to see a local doctor and then allowed her to stay in the room until 4pm. Even though I'm a Marriott person, would consider staying here again because of the wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharon098
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 days at Parc 55. We had a club room on the 29th floor which was well worth the money. Large room and great bathroom, turn down service each evening .Our room had great view of the city and bay area we could also see the fireworks on the 4th July. Nice club room on the 31st floor great breakfast and tea time snacks also drinks available to club room guest. Location of hotel is excellant yes lots of homeless about but as other reviews have said not the hotels fault. Service at hotel and checkin was also hassle free. 1st vist to SF hotel and city were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WAFC
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel twice during a recent visit to San Francisco with my nephew. The hotel is in a very accessible part of town near to the major bus, street car, cable car and BART routes (you can get to Powell Street BART direct from SFO Airport in about 30 minutes + 5 minute walk to the hotel). Big indoor shopping centre just across the road. Rooms are a good size for a downtown hotel and clean. Hotel staff friendly too. If you like Icecream there is a great place just round the corner (Coldstone Creamery on Ellis Street). If you like Burgers try TAYLORS at the Ferry Building Only 2 downsides 1) Hotel obviously caters mainly for the business traveller as the internet access is not free and is expensive if all you want to do is send a quick email home 2) Hotel is on the edge of one of the bad areas of San Francisco. There were lots of odd characters hanging around outside the hotel and the nearby cash machine. However, if you keep your eyes open you should not get into any bother.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: PBNL
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, excellent location. Next to a BART station, so a direct and easy connection to the airport. The little pastry shop at the left side of the hotel has great coffee and sandwiches. Large room with a large, comfy bed. The rooms may be starting to get a bit worn down, but at least the are clean! Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “reservations needs work”
Reviews.Author: midliferDallas_Texas
Reviews.Content: Made our reservation online and took the precaution of printing out the entire reservation confirmation and taking it with me as a result of reading other travelers' experiences. Good thing I did because at check in, there was NO record of any reservation at all! When we got home, (reservations were on 28,29 June) we found that our mastercard had been charged for a "no-show" on the 22nd of June, the day I had made the reservations! Several calls on eternal hold with accounting, then a fax had to be sent, a call to my credit card company protesting the amount and just finally today we (think) resolved everything with a very nice lady in reservations. It seems a lot of hassle for something that should have been a no-brainer. That said, the hotel is in a prime location next to everything. The bedding is newer and the mattress comfortable, the bathroom clean and of adequate size.We had an upper level room (15th floor) and enjoyed the city view in the evenings For a hotel of that size, the elevators are surprisingly quick to arrive. Outside the hotel, there are an awful lot of homeless people and it is worse if you make a wrong turn and head to the Tenderloin area where the panhandling is even more aggressive. No fault of the hotel, but it can be uncomfortable when walking alone. Reservation problems aside, the hotel offers good value and a prime location--just keep a copy of your entire reservation with you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Italianissima73
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Parc 55. I was in San Francisco on business and we chose this hotel because of it's conveient location to the BART station - an easy and cheap way to get from SFO to the hotel. We were very pleased with our stay. Our room on the 15th floor had a nice view and was clean and comfortable. The hotel is in a bustling part of town - Union Square - close to AWESOME shopping, the cable cars, and great restaurants. My only concern, which had nothing to do with the hotel, was the large number of homeless people in the area. However I soon found that they were everywhere in San Francisco. I have lived in Washington DC and Philadelphia and have never seen so many homeless people - it really took me buy surprise. Back to the hotel. The fitness center was good - many machines to use - it was crowded in the morning but due to the size of the hotel I was not surprized. They provided towels and fruit for you to eat after your work out. Check-in and out was a breeze but again there are a lot of people at this hotel so be wary of the time of day you do these things - the potential for a line is good. We ate at the Pub in the hotel. The food was ok - moderately priced - but there are so many options outside the hotel we decided to try those other than the hotel restaurant. All in all is was a great stay and when I come back to San Francisco I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “$40+ tax parking”
Reviews.Author: nanasf
Reviews.Content: I had some issues with my reservation, and the person on the front desk was not helpful at all. He told me that I should call the reservation line from the hotel phone, when I was 30 minutes late for the banquet and the dinner party. I was furious. I asked for the manager and he whispered to his friend "call David" but the name on the sign-manager on duty, did not say David. I asked for the lady manager whos name was displayed, and finally got help from another employee.By this time we were at the hotel reservation desk for over 20 minutes. We ended up getting a beautiful room with the view. The breakfast was late and it seemed like it was made hours ago. When we finaly tried to check out, we were charged $40 for the parking and $65 for the breakfast (eggs and toast said to be arround $16 per person). The only good thing was the view!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience Here But SF Needs to Clean Up Area”
Reviews.Author: ManUtdinOK
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 6 nights at the Parc 55. Check in was relatively easy. I requested a top floor but got floor 15. Room was relatively large with views out two sides since it was on the end. Room was clean and staff was acceptably friendly. Be forewarned that they are constructing a large building next door so the noise starts pretty early. I use earplugs so it didn't bother me. Lots of homeless all around but it still seems safe as they were harmless. Just don't go very far to the immediate west from the hotel because that area is not safe. Very convenient to cable car and subway (BART). Major disappointment was not the hotel but the amount of homeless begging in a major tourist area. SF leadership really needs to clean up their act. Very little police presence noticed anywhere around the city and that was very disappointing. Saw more homeless begging on the 100 yard walk from the subway to the hotel than 2 days in NYC. Not the Parc 55's fault though. I think eventually this will come back to bite tourism there.

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55: nice, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: PGdenizen
Reviews.Content: I spent last night at the Parc 55. I was watching for certain problems that have come up in some of the recent reviews--most especially the issue of rude or incompetent staff at the front desk. I was greeted by a young women in a very friendly manner, and check-in was smooth. I had reserved via Hotwire and got a rate of $99. I'm always concerned that I might not get a nice room because of booking through a discount service, but my room was nice. It was fairly large by SF standards; the bed and pillows were very comfortable; the bathroom was spacious and well-stocked and the shower was great--good water pressure and plenty of hot water. Among the toiletries were some ear plugs--not a good sign. I was on the 5th floor and I did hear street noise, but no more than at any other SF hotel I've stayed at. My only complaint is that $12.95 for the Internet connection is too much. I saved money by parking at the Ellis-O'Farrell garage nearby ($30 for overnight) instead of using the hotel's valet parking ($40 plus 14% tax and a tip or two would have been about $48). I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: heb999
Reviews.Content: Great location for cable cars, shopping, dining. I had a lovely room with a great view (18th floor). Check-in very busy on the afternoon I arrived but quiet when I left at the same time two days later. Staff at reception very efficient and helpful. Had arranged a package to be waiting for me on arrival. It was waiting for me at the bell desk. Accommodation, clean, spacious and comfortable. Have stayed in many hotels in SF including the Westin St Francis, Hilton, Crowne Plaza and City Quarters. I would certainly recommend the Parc 55 above those mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LadyLong
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, ten days ago and found it to be a great hotel for the price ($135 incl tax). Our room and bathroom were a good size, clean and comfortable. Unfortunately the view was the building site down below but we didn't go to SF to look out my hotel window. Thankfully we were there on a Friday night so had it been a week day we may have suffered the noise of the workmen the next morning but this wasn't the case. The traffic noise wasn't a problem either. Location was great just a few steps away from main shops, and transport. Unfortunately there are a lot of homeless around SF but we didn't find them intimidating at all. As it seems with most other reviewers we also found checking in took too long. There were three people at the check in desk when we arrived and only two people in front of us. Two staff members disappeared and were gone for the remainder of our wait which ended up being twenty five minutes. When we were due to check out my partner felt unwell and needed to see a doctor so we asked whether we could leave checking out until we returned, this didn't go down very well and the lady on the front desk merely gestured to the bell desk and told us to leave our bags there and vacate the room. The man on the bell desk was equally as rude and put out when we couldn't tell him how long we were going to be. Anyway, as hotels go we don't think you can get a better hotel for your money (believe me I scoured the web for hours!). It's a shame the staff couldn't be more efficient and polite but you can't have everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, near the center of the city”
Reviews.Author: Ilia T
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, rooms on the top floors have a nice view Receptionists and concierge were very nice and helpful. The only minus I can state is that parking for guests is pretty expensive - 40 usd per 24h.

Reviews.Title: “no problem parc 55”
Reviews.Author: RL2
Reviews.Content: From the time you leave San Francisco Airport, It was a breeze getting there . Taking the Bart made it to simple, coming out of the station walking maybe 20 feet stood the Parc 55. Expect to see the homeless as you enter or leave the station. Parc 55 is accessible to all modes of transportation, union sq, mall, etc We picked up a 3 day passport , 18 $, to be used on , muni, cable cars , trolly cars for unlimited rides..good bargin. We stayed there 3 nights , no problems what so ever, staff was friendly, instead of the concerierge , ask the BellMen for directions, info, etc.. they were very accommodating . The so call sports bar on premises , wasn't lively, low key, unless super bowl or world series was being played you may get sound on the tv's...they had 6 flat screens in a small place . go somewhere else if you're looking for a sports bar. Other wise check out the Pac 55 .

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: verymerry
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a block from the cable cars and BART. There is also a mall across the street and a few blocks away is the Financial District and Union Square. Taking BART from Oakland Airport was a breeze - a $3 bus ride from the airport to the Coliseum train station and a $3.35 ride to Powell Street and the hotel is just a 1/2 block away. Compare this to an approx $45 taxi ride or $22/person airport shuttle! The room was a nice size with a comfy bed and crisp white linens. The view was good though there is construction opposite the hotel at the back so a crane and worksite is outside the window...but being on the 25th floor we could easily see above and could not hear any outside traffic noise. All in all, a good hotel. The only downside was no free internet which, from my past experiences, is unusual for this type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if discounted”
Reviews.Author: UNR91
Reviews.Content: We booked a king suite with club room access for 150-160/night during the week for a recent trip into the City. The hotel is located steps from BART, a short walk to ACT and many restaurants, all of which we visited, so this hotel was perfect for our itinerary. The room was well appointed, bed very comfortable, and view nice. The club room is located at the top of the hotel and has a beautiful view of the Union Square area of the City. The extra cost of club room access was worth having a nice quiet place to relax before and after the show as well as eat breakfast before our departure, all of which you would pay steeply for if going out. The breakfast was advertised as "continental" but went far beyond:a selection of baked goods, ham, cheese, cereals, juices, a nice selection of fresh fruit, coffees, teas, etc. A great place to stay if you can swing a discount.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate and location”
Reviews.Author: Wiserblond
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Parc 55 on Memorial Day weekend. We had stayed there the previous year and enjoyed it, but were somewhat nervous considering the recent reviews since the hotel changed ownership. We arrived using BART, and learned that we wouldn't be able to check in until after 3pm. We left our baggage and returned at 6pm to learn that the hotel was booked solid, operating at full capacity, and some customers were upset that their rooms weren't ready yet. We were ready for problems and attitudes (as we read about in the reviews here) and were pleasantly surprised that our room was ready, everything was in order, and check-in took only 5 minutes. We had a great view of southwest San Francisco (we were on the 17th floor), and the room was in excellent condition. No extra or hidden charges, pleasant hotel staff and the entire stay was stress free. We are staying there again next week for the Fillmore Jazz Festival and anticipate another great weekend. The convenience of the location and the quality of the hotel and the $99 rate featured on travel websites such as Hotwire, Orbitz and Expedia makes it a steal of a deal! Try it out!!

Reviews.Title: “At the Heart of San Francisco Shopping”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoLarry
Reviews.Content: Tremendous hotel! The service was excellent, very accommodating and helpful. Exquisitely clean and comfortable rooms. We didn’t request one but they offer hardwood floor rooms for allergy sufferers. Great location, in the heart of the shopping district. Not a long walk to Chinatown or Nob Hill. Less than a block to a cable-car turnaround that takes you to the Wharf/Ghirardelli Square without any transfers. Parking is expensive but what isn’t in San Francisco?!! I recommend the 5th and Mission parking garage, $30 for overnight versus $40+tax at the Parc Fifty Five, plus, you get a nice walk! This was one of our top 3 vacations(as of June 2007)!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LAStravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. It is located right between Union Square and the San Francisco Shopping Center. The Metreon, Mosconi Center, Crocker Gallery and more are very close by. The walk to union square was only about two minutes. We had a great view on the 20th floor. It was a typical nice upscale hotel. No character or charm if that is what you are looking for, but the beds were great, the lobby, the view, the room, and everything else was clean and nice. The pick up for the cable car is just steps away outside, but be prepared for a long line! I tagged along on my husband's business trip so this wasn't on our dollar, so warning- the parking fee is $45 a day and it is valet only, and there is a $12.95 fee per day for using the internet. The hotel restaurants looked very nice, but they were too expensive for us. If you are looking for a good breakfast or lunch, head to Sears Fine Foods. It is a small coffee shop across from the Sir Francis Drake. It is classic old SF! And simple good food. For quick food on the go it is fun to pick something out at the food market in Bristol Farms (on the bottom level of the San Francisco Shopping Center). They have a ton of prepared foods that you can take with you to a picnic in Golden gate park or just a snack to go. This hotel is perfect for a weekend of shopping or sight seeing in the Union square area.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: KGrrlRox
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Parc 55 and am now left with a less than favorable view of the hotel. I made a reservation through the hotel website, but they were unable to find my reservation in the system when I arrived to check-in. After standing at the front desk for 25-30 minutes, they were able to find my web reservation and put my details into the system. Now that I am home, I have reviewed my credit card statement and find that they have over charged me They have asked that I dispute this charge with my credit card company since they have no record of the charge. On a positive note, the location is great! The cable cars are one block away and great shopping is close by. The room was comfortable and clean too. I wouldn't recommend this hotel as a great place to stay and do not plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, big rooms”
Reviews.Author: edhodge
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Parc 55. Easy access to BART, cable cars and easy walking to the Embarcadero. The noise at night was disconcerting even on the 20th floor, even with a sound machine going. Lots of city noise but hey, we are in the heart of the city- what else would we expect? The concierge was very helpful. The staff at reception was funny and friendly. The room was very clean and a nice size, much larger than the boutique hotels where we have stayed before. The amenities were from Lather, all natural and from a local company. The hair dryer stopped working and they replaced it quickly. We were with friends. They had only one complaint- coffee in the room. Oh there was a coffee maker but evidently, the coffee was blech. We don't drink it so I couldn't say. No honor bar, no mini fridge but very soft, dreamy linens, comforters and pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Nice price, large rooms”
Reviews.Author: bebycik
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Parc 55 for 2 nights in June of 2007 (booked via priceline at $150 a night). First basics: 1. The hotel used to be a part of Renaissance chain-- expect standard decor and larger than usual rooms. 2. This is not a boutique hotel-- it's a high-rise with a large lobby and hundreds of rooms. 3. It is right by Union Square-- homeless people are a staple for that area and not a fault of the hotel. Now, to the experience-- hotel is very centrally located (right by Powell BART station-- take it right from the airport for a fraction of the taxi cost!). Restaurants, shops, museums, the cable cars, (and yes, even the homeless people)-- it's all there. The lobby is spacious and can look deserted at times. We had no problems with staff. Rooms are much larger than usual for Union Square-- we had a sitting area with a couch in ours and a king size bed. Spacious bathroom, fantastic linens and even complimentary ear plugs ( we were on the 10th floor and could not hear the street noise but appreciated the gesture anyway.) We did not use room service but stopped by at a hotel bar on the second floor-- a typical boring sports bar on a smaller side with an ambiance of a moth ball. In summary. Pros: great location, spacious, clean rooms, awesome beds for a very good price. Probably one of the best deals for your dollar in Union Square. Cons: a pretty generic experience (don't expect to be showered with attention like you get with boutique hotels), and you have to pay for your internet. The building is kinda ugly from the outside.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: leggsworth
Reviews.Content: The good: 1. Bed is quite comfortable with nice linens 2. We were on the 20th floor with a great view of the SF skyline 3. Rooms clean 4. Great deal on Expedia, including 3 last-minute round trip tickets from San Diego and 3 night's stay, for about $800. 5. Convenient locations, close to lots of good restaurants and shopping 6. Front desk service is professional and pleasant The bad: 1. Some staff need training in proper service etiquette. We had a housekeeper one morning that kept knocking on our door, trying to get into our room, even after we had asked to not be disturbed. One of the hostesses at the restaurant treated my 2 year old son like a thief when he went to take some fruit from a fruitbowl. He's only 2! 2. Rooms very small (oh well, what can you expect from San Francisco?).

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55 Is Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: croletter
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55 was perfect for us! We are a young couple who booked a 4 day getaway to San Fran, and were looking for the best value we could find in the Union Square area. We got a great deal on Hotwire at under $100 per night for the first week of June. Upon check-in, we asked the front desk for a king room with a view on an upper floor. The gentleman there named Daniel hooked us up with a room on the club level on the 31st floor (only 32 floors in hotel) with an awesome view of San Francisco. It also gave us access to the Club Lounge that offered a nice breakfast, hor deouvres in the afternoon and cocktails in the evening...it was a great bonus to our stay. The entire staff was great, and were really friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is in a great location, within blocks of lots of great restaurants, and the cable car turnaround is right around the corner. It is also nicely decorated throughout. The room was perfect! The bed was so comfortable, it was hard to get up most days. "Lather" brand toiletries were a great touch, and the rooms were nicely decorated. The Barley and Hops restaurant was a cool little sports bar, and again the service there was great. We didn't eat at Veranda, but it looked nice. All in all, the Parc 55 was perfect for us. If you are looking for a 4 star hotel with a good location and value, this is the perfect place. Only minor issue was the parking at $40/day was a little on the expensive side, but if you do your homework you can park elsewhere for less...but you really don't need a car in San Francisco anyway. P.S. There is a great little Italian place right across the street for happy hour called Puccini & Pinetti...they had $3 cocktails (Champagne, Anchor Steam on tap, etc.) and appetizers (Small pizza, fried ravioli, etc.)...we loaded up there for under $25

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but Bad enviorment!”
Reviews.Author: RACQUEENS
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. Convienent location, clean, nice staff and decent service. The only problem I ran into was, no one knew anything at the helpdesk. We asked how far a restaurant was from the hotel and if it was walking distance. They told us it was a 8 to 10 minute walk. As we were walking to the restaurant, we noticed that we had been walking for a good 20 minutes. On top of that it was extremely cold outside. We were very upset with the poor judgement of the hotel's help desk. There since of direction is VERY poor, so if you don't know where you are going, find out before you stay at this hotel. The area of the hotel is REALLY shady. Homeless people on every singel corner harrassing you at any second they get. I was surprised that a women at the front desk gave directions using the back door, then told me to ignore what ever is happening outside that door. Outside that door was serval homeless people sitting on the stairs bothering bypasser's. If you want to stay in a quiet, nice area, I suggest you stay in Nobb Hills!

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again and again”
Reviews.Author: ddetravel
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why I had such a different experience from the recent reviews, but I had a fantastic experience at the Parc 55. I took the BART from Oakland Airport. It was a breeze. And just right outside the stop at Powell Street was the Parc 55. It took about 45 mins from the airport to the hotel (door to door). Who needs a car? There was a line at check in, but the man who helped me knew I had been patiently waiting for about 10 mins and easily accommodated my request to be on a higher floor (I paid for the cheapest room in the place). He put me on the 27th floor with a view of the bay and Transamerica building. I had a fabulous room. Too bad I was just staying for one night for a seminar the next day. I was just steps away from the best shopping (including H&M)! The room was a good size (especially for San Francisco) and had clearly been remodelled. The bed was extremely comfortable. I'd go back in an instant. Also, I thought the bell desk was really helpful. I needed to leave a bag (being in a class all day) after checking out. They were nice enough to let me add things to my bag after I went shopping and before I needed to go to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: LovetotravelABQ
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Expedia.com. They gave us a great rate for 3 nights. Our hotel was ideally located just one block from the Powell Cable Car station near Market Street. There is a great coffee/breakfast place 50 feet from the hotel with great prices on their food and drinks. Upon check in we were taken to a wonderful corner room that was very spacious. The room had lovely bed linens and two lovely windows with views. The staff were really great, and they have a rent a car service right in the hotel, which came in handy when we wanted to rent a car for one day to travel to the Muir Woods. During my 6 nights in San Francisco, I stayed in 3 different hotels (different events). However, the Parc 55 was my absolute favorite! I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Help”
Reviews.Author: TheMightyTrev
Reviews.Content: While the location is very central and convenient, the hotel is very poorly managed and will make mistakes at every possible opportunity with no apology. We booked via their website, no middlemen, but were assigned a much cheaper room when we arrived. We had booked a Club level room, which was about $45 more than the room they were going to put us in. Worst part, he didn't say anything about not getting the right room type. Had I not mentioned anything- we would have been taken advantage of. Instead of an apology, he gave me attitude. We did end up getting the right room, but it took over 15 minutes when checking in. The rooms are small, but nicely appointed. Views are above average, but not the best in the city. No complaints about the room. Upon checking out, we had been tremendously overcharged. I pointed this out, and they said that this was the rate in the computer and I needed to prove that i had booked at a lower rate. Thank goodness I had my laptop to show them my confirmation. Again, no apology. We brought a car, and found the valet to be very useful. They were prompt and easy. The hotel was formely under the Renaissance chain, but they lost that affiliation in January of 2007. Hotel is a mess right now, both physically and in personality. The staff is Motel 6 level. There is quite a bit of renovation happening, in a desperate attempt to woo another franchise. Unless you get a great bargain (we paid about $180/night including parking for their club level rooms- too much in retrospect, when other nearby hotels such as Marriot and Hyatt were about $220) I would recommend paying more and going somewhere else. If you must stay here, don't expect luxury services at all. Bring copies of your confirmation and pay attention if they are trying to pull a fast one on you. If you are looking for a relaxing luxury place- go somewhere else, even if its a bit more money. If you need a nice room, conveniently located and you get a good deal, then maybe this place will work for you. Just come with low expectations. Let's hope they get their act together and get a new coroporate partner, because it is too nice a property to be run like this.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, shame about the front desk service”
Reviews.Author: sheree99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 as the first hotel out of ten on a round-the-world trip in April/May. After being very tired, but excited, after a 12 hour flight from Australia, we were greeted by one of the rudest front desk staff I've ever experienced. I requested a high floor, to which the response was a huff. She also tried telling us she only had twin rooms available (despite booking a double two months prior), but after some pressure she suddenly 'found' a double room for us. It was a shame the first impression was so bad, as the room was fine - much larger than expected, with a sofa area and nice view of the city. The coffee maker in the room was a welcome touch! The bed was huge and extremely comfortable, and we found the room to be very quiet, despite being right next to the lifts and the fact we stayed on both Friday and Saturday nights. The bathroom was a fair size and had some good amenities. The one thing that the room was missing was a fridge, and the room furnishings were also quite dated… but I’ve certainly stayed in worse 4 star places. We used the sports bar downstairs which again suffered from poor customer service – except for one particular man who was extremely friendly and helpful – he was the one person in the entire hotel that made it a pleasant stay for us! Also, it was in a great location near a big shopping centre and right next to the BART station, which made it so convenient from the airport. The only negative was having an 'early' flight out of San Fran (8.30am) on the Sunday, and discovering that the BART didn’t start running until 8am! We were a little shocked by this, so unfortunately had to fork out almost $40 for a cab instead. Overall, it was a fine hotel for what we paid - we got a deal at $100 a night (through a last-minute hotel website) – but I would probably stay somewhere else next time, mainly due to the service.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: dwe1978
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference and stayed at the Fairmont (which is absolutely wonderful). I stayed a few extra days on my own dime so needed a cheaper hotel. I got a great deal on Parc 55 from hotels.com. While it's not the greatest hotel I've ever stayed at, the pluses definitely outweigh the negatives. The best thing about it was the price. For less than $100 a night, I was able to stay in a great location. The hotel is in walking distance of restaurants and shops. It's VERY close to BART, muni subway, and cable cars. The negatives include the rooms had an older feel to them. In addition, I went to the concierge twice. The first time was to get a recommendation for lunch and he quickly gave me two names and didn't ask me what I wanted to eat or a budget. The second time the woman was a little nicer but didn't go out of her way to be friendly. But overall, if I go back to San Fran, I will likely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “EXTREMELY THE BEST.”
Reviews.Author: TARMOM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is IT. It is reasonably priced, very very clean, great hotel staff, and the best of all in a GREAT location. It is 1 block from the cable car or F line, a really nice shopping mall, 2 blocks from union square shopping, and tour buses picked you up rightoutside the hotel. You even can book these tours with the concierge at the hotel. One of the concierge's at this hotel was AWFUL but the other 3 were SUPER D DUPER. They went above and beyond to make our trip what we wanted. They gave great directions and good suggestions on local restaurants. The hotel staff was just as great, helpful and very friendly. Our room was extremely clean and plenty of linens each of our 5 day stay. This is the hotel to stay at when going to San Francisco. We will be back....

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Concierge and Desk Service”
Reviews.Author: MissSailorJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was adequate but I couldn't get passed the staff. When I asked questions they looked confused and asked me irrelevant questions in response. I can excuse people who are not completely fluent in English but not in a hotel front desk role. The Concierge was also disappointing. He responded in a quick hurried manner to my inquiry and wasn't genuinely interested in offering assistance. I may be too critical but these are important positions. These people are the face of the company and have the most impact on the clients impressions.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific. Parc 55 used to be great, not anymore...”
Reviews.Author: killbondnow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Parc55 because it *used* to be a good hotel, back when I lived in SF, and I had had good experiences there. Got a discounted rate through their web site, so I switched to there instead of at a host hotel for the convention I was attending. What a mistake! They nickel-and-dime you to DEATH, and by the time we were through paying dribs and drabs for things, it was more expensive than the other hotel anyway. Don't get me started on the $40 Valet charge -- better hotels in San Fran have $25 or 30 or so. We, also, parked at the 5th and Mission garage after check-in, which is a couple blocks away, a STEAL at $16/day maximum, and was more convenient to our convention anyhow. Complimentary breakfast for concierge-level rooms was NOT worth it. No hot food, and the lunch meats they did have, looked scary and gross. (A Hampton Inn breakfast is a Lucullan feast next to this place.) Wireless charge was ASTRONOMICAL. Again, why free at the Hampton Inns, properties that are a fraction of the cost? I *like* staying at luxury hotels, but this is senseless. The neighborhood of the hotel is dicey at best, loud, noisy, and full of bums. You have to run a large gauntlet of panhandlers, con artists and questionable vendors just to get to the BART station and cable cars on the next block. Worst of the Parc55 offenses by far however: We had returned the last night of our stay with a to-go box, but realized we didn't get utensils. We rang housekeeping and asked for knives and forks, they said fine. When they came up, they presented a BILL, for $4 for each utensil, AND tax (!!!) on the bill, AND the 18% room service delivery charge!!!! I am not kidding! Over $10 to get a knife and fork! THAT WAS IT! I had a lot to say the next morning at check out -- they removed the tax and the delivery charge, but NOT the charges for the utensils!!! CRAZY! We should have just gone to the Walgreen's down the street or even the 24-hour Carls Jr on the next block... Parc55, never again! I felt bad because I *cheated* on my mainstay Hotel Vitale, and that is a mistake which will not be repeated, I assure you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Okie37
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised and pleased with the quality of this hotel for the price. Parking is costly, but the need for using a car is limited because of location. Very nice lobby and rooms. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: OsideMom2three
Reviews.Content: Sayed here April 9, 2007. Great location for shopping. Room was very clean, though a little worn around the edges. The parking was $47 (for an SUV) for a 24 hour period but you do have in and out privileges and that is quite reasonable for SF. Valet staff were very courteous.
