Overall for what we paid, it was a great deal and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jaeger_10_08_05
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here two nights, but it was a great hotel for the great deal we got for it on Expedia. We booked a non-view room, but upon check-in, asked for a view, and was given one on the 21st floor. The room was spacious and the beds were very comfortable with many pillows. I would highly recommend this hotel and if you are looking for a deal, this is it! Also, as everyone has stated, the location is awesome. We took the BART from the airport and we stepped out of the station and the hotel was right there. Very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: auttapol
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, clean room, great location. The only problem with this hotel is their expensive parking $40/day. My recommedation is they shold provide free/inexpensive wireless access to customer

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: krissydorset
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms online, based really on position, and were delighted. Large clean rooms, helpful staff, would not hesitate to recommend. Central to all we wanted and handy for transport to airport (BART), trolley buses and trams. Aware of homeless but not intimidated by any.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but not an upscale hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelbunnorita
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Parc 55 over the weekend and found it to be a fair hotel in a central (but not nice) part of downtown SF. I would echo some of the other reviews in saying that while the rooms were clean and the staff were professional, DO NOT come here if you are expecting a 4 star (i.e. Westin, Sheraton, Hilton) type hotel. Having stayed at multiple large-scale business hotels in downtown SF, Parc 55 is on the very bottom of that range. Definitely doesn't deserve its AAA four diamond. Come here if you want a central location and if you can get a much lower rate than from other hotels, but given the choice, I'd definitely recommend going elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: UKKJ
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, a couple of minutes walk from Powell Street BART, which is very handy for the airport. It's also good for the downtown restaurants, and it's quite easy to get buses to other areas such as Little Italy to eat. The other main attractions e.g. Golden Gate Bridge (2 buses), Fisherman's Wharf (take a tram from Powell Street) the pier for Alcatraz (streetcar) are very accessible on public transport - get a MUNI card and public transport map from the info centre next to Powell Street station to make the most of this. The room was very comfortable and there's also a more than adequate gym. Try the coffee shop a couple of doors down for breakfast. It was excellent value with Expedia in the UK. As many reviewers will point out, there is a very visible homelessness problem in San Francisco, and this is evident downtown where the hotel, shops and restaurants are. However, we found that at night there are enough people around to feel reasonably safe walking around.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag at the Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: Ojaigal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc 55 for 4 nights in March, during a combination of business and weekend getaway travel. The hotel was very busy (lots of airline crews, tour groups, etc.); front desk personnel were perfunctory and distracted, but did honor our request for a view room, which was great! We booked through the hotel website, and got a good rate. Our room was spacious, but not well cleaned...poorly dusted and carpet had many "leftovers" from previous guests. Bathroom was not thoroughly cleaned. Cleaning staff were very nice, but VERY NOISY when coming and going in the early morning from their supply room, which was near our room...doors slamming, loud conversation, etc. at 7 a.m., including on the weekends. Calls to housekeeping and front desk did not change this. Concierge was marginally helpful when asked for referrals to basic things (health food store, wine shop, etc.) Room service was prompt and brought some nice little extras. Internet access is $12/day for cable. Refrigerator in the room is $25 one-time charge. Location is terrific; we took BART from the airport and were at the hotel less than an hour after our flight arrived (checked bags). We walked all over the city, and it was never a problem to get a cab right outside the hotel. All-in-all, might stay here again, but will first explore other options in the city. Prefer a cleaner room, and more personal service from concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: vonroad
Reviews.Content: We were in San Fran for a wedding and wanted to stay in the city. Thanks to Hotwire we got a good deal here. Overall it was perfectly fine; the room was nice, and the staff were friendly. My only complaint was parking. $40 a day! We had a car because we had to fly into San Jose (long story) and the wedding was just not accessible by public transportation. I saw other hotels nearby that were charging more like $25. I researched ahead and parked at the 5th and Mission garage just down the street; it saved us about 30%. Other than that, it was a nice place to stay, right in the heart of things near Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel in sfo”
Reviews.Author: ret777
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc Fifiy Five hotel on Market Street. Nordstroms was directly across the street. Once I realized which BART exit to take, I was within steps of the hotel. The hotel itself was kept very clean. Maid service was excellent. Every one on the hotel staff I spoke to were friendly and informative. Not many TV channels to choose from. The restaraunt on the second floor was great for breakfast. Never used room service. Since I used BART and my feet for transportation, I didn't have to pay the daily parking fee of $40. A small extra was a package of foam ear plugs in the room. Never did need them. All in all, a very pleasant and troublefree visit. I have no reservations in recommending this hotel. Howard Larson, Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: Muffy24
Reviews.Content: That's all the can be said. From the customer service to the fluffy beds, heavenly was our experience at Parc 55. The location alone makes visiting San Francisco so accessible, as the BART, the trollies are within one city block, with great restuarants and Union Square within easy walking distance. Everytime I am in San Fran, I will be staying at Parc 55. Note: ask for the highest floor available, the view will be better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: MauritsLondon
Reviews.Content: At first sight this hotel seems blandly mainstream and you wouldn't think it would leave a lasting impression. The location of this hotel could not be better and the quality is consistent and excellent value. We booked a Club Room and were on the 28th Floor with magnificent views of the city and the Bay area. The Club Lounge is a good place to have breakfast, although it is closed during weekends. The information sheet said it would be open on Sunday evening, but it wasn't. The room is comfortable, clean and tastefully designed and much better then the image of the Lobby and the public areas. The gym is very adequate and the laundry service impeccable. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Charged for no-show when I had cancelled”
Reviews.Author: Rea27
Reviews.Content: I should say right off that I have never stayed at this hotel. I did have a rather unpleasent experience with their staff, though. I booked a Feb 2007 reservation through the Mariott's web site in late 2006. I later received a notice that the Parc was discontinuing it's relationship with Marriott, so my stay at the Parc would not count for Marriott points or nights. So I cancelled my reservation on Mariott's web site, and recieved a cancellation email and number. Then I got my February credit card bill and found a charge for one night at the hotel. I dug up the cancellation email and called. My first call was after business hours, and I was told to call back during business hours. The next day I called during business hours and explained the situation to someone in the accounting department. That person told me that the problem was my cancelling on Marriott's site rather than calling them. I never understood why that was a problem, since I cancelled well before they dropped off the Mariott's system, but in any case I expected that they would credit me immediately. Instead I was told that it would take several days to research it and I should call back if I did not receive the credit. It would seem to me that if the Parc knew they were having a problem with cancellations on Mariott's system, that THEY would take the initiative to research no-shows. Instead, I find that it is taking a considerable amount of my time to avoid being charged, when the hotel seems to be at fault for losing the cancellation - and that is in spite of the fact that they are apparently well aware of the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: sfbness
Reviews.Content: Parc 55 had everything we needed, easy access, spacious room and bathroom. Concierge and staff were very helpful and informative.

Reviews.Title: “Very mediocre”
Reviews.Author: nreitter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 for 3 nights on business & left feeling that I won't stay again. The highlight was the room - they put me on the 19th floor with nice city views. The bed was comfy with lots of pillows & the linens & furniture were fairly up to date but that's about where the up-to-date-ness ended. The hotel itself is full of 1980s brass & chandeliers, clunky elevators & the bathrooms look & feel old. I would even go so far as to say it's a bit cheezy... The gym is AWFUL. Equipment is alright but it's too cluttered & they don't seem to have AC or a window open so you seriously are doing bikram workout & smelling everyone's funk! I was awoken several times each night by fire engines & police sirens screaming by. I was also dismayed at the very good entry price but then being nickeled & dimed -- $13/day for internet service (should be free!) & $40/day for parking. Great location for wandering to Union Square shopping. All in all, very mediocre hotel. OH, and also, when I went to leave the bellman had my luggage & was kind enough to place it in my car. He forgot to pack my laptop & so I had to turn around & drive 1 hour back to get it, causing me a 2 hour delay in getting home.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: someseesee
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I had ever stayed. It is 4 star hotel, customer services is excellent. I arrived with two kids and a lot of luggage, plus a double stroller. They helped me unload all my stuff and parked my mini van. The front desk gave my room number to the bell man, so he brought all my stuff to my room in 10 minutes. I called the valet parking and my mini van was ready in 15 minutes. Nice city view from my room (26 floors). Bed is very comfortable. Hotel is very clean. I only paid $119 for one night stay. All my friends in San Francisco thought I got good deal. Con: parking is $40 per day plus tax, but I think it is worth for the service I got.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad management”
Reviews.Author: travelmom2005
Reviews.Content: This hotel, recently liberated from the Marriot chain, heavily promoted itself on Expedia. For something special, my husband and I treated my mom to a 60th birthday trip in San Francisco. I wanted a special hotel, but could not afford the W. The price was right for this place, the location was EXCELLENT - around the corner from the cable car, across the street from the BART station and the big, new Westfield shopping center, and a few blocks from Union square. The room was clean, the beds were comfortable - soft pillows, feather comfortors. I even had room service bring tea - a charming Chinese gentleman delivered it with new years wishes and lots of giggles. BUT - and this is the big BUT - we were not given our room until 2AM!!!!!!! We checked in at 9 PM. Fortunately, my mom and I checked in the day before, so we were able to put our 2 young sons to bed in her room. My husband and I waited 5 hours in the lobby, mostly standing in line with about 25 other very hostile guests, waiting for our room. There was a couple who had spent 25 hours traveling from Caracas, VZ, a man with Parkinson's disease who desperately needed rest, and a long list of other stories. In addition to all of this, the hotel staff repeatedly double assigned rooms. They would send a relieved guest up to a room, only to have them return to say someone was already in it!!! Can you imagine how mortifyingly embarrassing that must have been for both parties???? This happened at least 4 times by my count. When we were given our room assignment, we made the staff call the room before we went up. The other part that was so awful was that we were told 3 times that our room would be ready in 30 minutes, and to come back. It took at least 1 hour to get through the line. My question is, why didn't the staff let people know what was going on? They knew the rooms wouldn't be ready, with only the small night cleaning staff and a number of very late check-outs (Singapore Air has a regular contract, I guess). Really unconscionable! My husband refused the offer of a free breakfast (hah!) and demanded the room for free - which is what we got. If you want to stay in this hotel, you are rolling the dice with your time and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “A Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: strathj
Reviews.Content: We had a convention/meeting rate based on my wife's employment. We live in the San Francisco Bay area. We were pleasantly surprised and would choose this property for a weekend getaway. Room was contemporary generic, with queen bed, writing desk, love seat and coffee table. Large bathroom with closing door. Good thermostat. Better than properties in the area that are rehabilitated older properties. Location is not Union Square, but very close--but if you go walking at night alone, be sure you are walking in the Union Square direction. Stay on a high floor to minimize urban noise. Prices for such things as room service are high, but lots of local options VERY close by--starting with Burger King and going up and up. If you get a decent price, this is a very good "play it safe" choice. Jeff

Reviews.Title: “Parc 55, excellent location, superb breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: JCambridge
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed in Parc 55 for 5 nights and were very impressed with the accomodation and service. Our room was a corner room on the 12th floor with a maginificant view, the room was spacious and well furnished with the only downside being the bathroom which could do with some updating and also lacked adquate ventilation so got quite steamy. We had breakfast a couple of times at the hotel and must say the all amercian buffett breakfast was excellent value at $18. I was in San Francisco on business and working at the Hilton, which is only 1 block away, my boyfriend visited numerous tourist spots throughout our stay and found Parc 55 was in the perfect location to visit the Information bureau and catch the cable car and buses. I would recommend Parc 55 and Union Square to both tourists and business travellers. If travelling a lot whilst in San Francisco I would defintly recommend getting a Muni pass.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It ”
Reviews.Author: kiwijoy
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel Feb 18 2007. Long line at checkit but it went very quickly. The front desk staff are very efficient. We book a club room and got upgraded to a king suite which was on floor 30. What a beautiful room(S) had a foyer with fridge, huge bedroom, bed was wonderful, bathroom was across the hall and was nice, living room was great, and the view.......WOW It evn has its own big deck. Tastefully furnished. Only drawback was outside our bedroom window was the hotel air con units...very noisy!!!!! 3007. I could not sleep, i called down at 1.30am to see if they could do anything about the noise, the maintence worker came up and was going to put some insulation strips on to help drown out the noise but i asked for earplugs instead...sort of helped. However it was such a fabulous room that i was happy even with an hour or two of sleep. The club room had a great view, good food and great staff. We had lunch from the Thai place in the hotel, very yummy! We took BART so didn't have to pay parking and everything is within walking distance. We had drinks at First Crush across the road, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Teyla
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a 3 day stay at the Parc 55! The location is the best because of the proximity to BART (across the street), and the cable cars (1 block away). Westfield Shopping Center is located directly across the street (Nordstroms, Bloomingdale, great food court too). The service and the rooms were excellent and we would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Francisco that would like to be close to the shopping and public transportation. It is right on Market Street, and is close to Chinatown. Parking is a little pricey at $40 for overnight; however, parking is at a premium at this location. We found great rates for this hotel on Expedia; however, I would recommend that you check out their website (Parc 55) first because they have several special package rates.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay, best location in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: EdRicarti
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, staff was very friendly and helpful. I arrived early and they gave me a room right away. The concierge was very knowledgeable and gave us an updated map, and also suggestions of places to go. Hotel was close to everything. I toke the train from the airport to the hotel, it toke about 25 min. and costs less than U$6.00 each way. Subway and cable cars are steps away from the hotel too. Tourist information centre is across the street from the hotel. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Weak”
Reviews.Author: RyanMarin
Reviews.Content: Hotel was just ok. Nice lobby but the rooms are dated. OK for business use. Great location if you want to be on union square.

Reviews.Title: “Your search is over!!!”
Reviews.Author: Radrat
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Parc 55 and had to write about our GREAT experience! We loved the hotel and the area. First of all, as we checked in, the service at the front desk was fantastic and the staff was very friendly. They assigned us a Club View Room on the 31st floor which has spectacular views of the downtown skyline and access to their private lounge for evening drinks and continental breakfast in the morning, also located on the 31st floor. The room was very clean and the beds were wonderful with plenty of pillows to choose from. If possible, leave your car at home. This place is located within 1 block from any type of transportation you could need. BART, MUNI, Trolleys, cable cars, busses and taxis are all a stones throw away. I would highly suggest the 3 day MUNI pass for $18. It can be purchased at the cable car ticket booth on Powell and Market St. There is a large mall just across the street and Union Square 1 block away. Last but not least, I would like to comment the concierge for his great knowledge of the area and his wonderful help in setting up our itinerary.

Reviews.Title: “so so”
Reviews.Author: yupric
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend who was attending a conference here. Picked the hotel based on that. The hotel is located well, not far from lots of shopping on Union Square and across the street from a main transit station. One thing I have to say is try to book on a higher floor. We where on Geary street on a lower floor and it was quite noisy most nights. If you wear earplugs it might suffice. Service was quick to the room.

Reviews.Title: “A Stroll in the Parc”
Reviews.Author: LadyRayRay
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had stayed at Renaissance Parc 55 after thoroughly reading the reviews on this site as well as others. We decided to give it a shot and were absolutely impressed and satisfied. LOCATION and TRANSPORTATION: Renaissance Parc is located in Union Square and I discovered that it was close to many forms of transportation including both the BART and the MUNI. And while cabs are scarce in San Francisco, I was pleased to see that there were usually at least 2 cabs waiting outside by the street. If there aren't any cabs there, I know that there were always a line of cabs outside of the Westin Hotel a few blocks away. Literally right outside Parc hotel is a shopaholic's dream. It's blocks away from Saks, Macy's, and other department stores as well as unique boutiques and stores along the way. There's also a new Westfield Mall right by there on Market Street which has a Nordstrom and Bloomindales. I also took a walk to Chinatown from there, and while it's not that far, make sure to wear comfy shoes. Somewhat southwest of the hotel further down Market Street, the area gets a little bit shadier and seems to crawl with even more homeless people (San Francisco as a whole has a huge homeless population), but it's nothing to be wary of. As for places to eat by there - we ate at a dim sum place called Tian Sing right outside which was great! The place was clean (cleaner than the ones I saw in Chinatown) and the service was very attentive. We also ate at this trendy spot across the street from Tian Sing called First Crush. The place was okay, but not exactly worth the pricey tag. I'd just go there again for drinks or a cocktail. SERVICE and CLEANLINESS: We checked in around 11am and found out from the hotel desk that official check-in time was not until later at 3pm; however, before even asking, the woman checked to see if there were any available rooms and checked us in to a 14th floor room. The man who brought up the luggage to our room was very helpful and pointed out what was what right from our window (whichwas a breathtaking view!). The room was clean. The bed was very comfy and cushy and had a plethora of pillows! The bathroom was big and absolutely not cramped like some hotel bathrooms I've seen. The only problem I seemed to have was with their shower curtain- no matter how much I tried to close the curtain, it seemed as if water would always be seeping onto the floor. BOTTOM LINE: The place was exactly what we wanted. A clean hotel with genuine and friendly service right in the heart of the city. As for price, it was mid-range, but well worth it. I'd definitely stay here again and try to get a room on a higher floor for an even more spectacular view.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: bluhouse1
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms through Priceline for an overnight stay in San Francisco. My goal was to have a comfortable, affordable place to stay that was close to the Westfield Shopping Mall. I traveled with my elderly mother and convenience was a priority. The Renaissance Parc 55 Hotel was just what we were looking for. I was able to secure the rooms at a very reasonable rate through Priceline. Both rooms were immaculate. The beds are extremely comfortable with lots and lots of pillows. The staff was courteous, and they never made us feel as though we should get "bargain" service just because we paid a "bargain" rate. We had drinks and appetizers at a small bar on-site. The food was adequate, but a bit pricey. If you walk two short blocks to the Westfield Mall on Market Street, you have dozens and dozens of eating establishments to chose from. The hotel is very convenient to Union Square and all the major attractions near the Civic Center. If you want to take a cable car to Fisherman's Wharf, you just have to walk one block. The BART station is also nearby, allowing you to travel to many Bay Area cities very easily. We did notice some transient people loitering in the general vicinity of the hotel, but the hotel security staff does seem to stay on top of this and moves these folks away from the main hotel entrance. I would discourage people from walking to Union Square if they want to avoid panhandlers. I would definetely stay at the Renaissance Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: JRGreen
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here after Thanksgiving for four nights. The hotel is clean and comfortable. The staff were all very nice - from the maids to the front desk. The Veranda lounge is nice in the evenings with live piano music and a great bar. The location here is excellent - close to the public transportation, Union Square, shopping, etc. There are some panhandlers in nearby Union Square but this comes with the territory in San Francisco, which has a large number of homeless. We had a room on the 16th floor which had a nice skyline view - I understand the views are even better higher up. Will definitely stay here again on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations, serious homless problem around hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ms. Christina
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, great location in proximity to things to do in the city, beautiful lobby, average to above average rooms, with a nice view. Excellent service that I would expect from an upscale hotel. Right away we were bombarded by the homeless. We we're just pulling into the parking garage (which costs $40 a night) and a homeless man came to the window, very agressively begging, would not leave our window no matter how many times we asked him to go away. In he morning, we walked to breakfast. Immediately outside the doors, two homeless people asking for money, one making sickly disturbing comments about my six year old daughter. Not far away, we were followed and harrassed by another homless person. They were everywhere you turned, literally, and very agressive. The Parc Renassaince tried their best to shoo them from in front of the hotel, but once you step a few feet away from the property, you are a target.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, awful telecommunications”
Reviews.Author: AThena53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Parc 55 for a business meeting. The hotel is conveniently situated very close to the Metro station - also very convenient to the multi-company car rental pickup/dropoff garage across from the Hilton on O'Farrell Street. While there were panhandlers in the area, as mentioned in other reviews, we didn't find them aggressive. The room was nice and well-maintained and the fitness center was well-equipped. Room service dinner was good and not overpriced. My main complaint was the telecommunications. First, there's the usual $10 per day charge for high-speed Internet access- a ridiculous nickel-and-dime charge when you know most of your guests will need it. I couldn't get connected after we arrived and spent 15 minutes on the phone with Tech Support. They said they needed to check some things and would call back- they never called back. I called again and they said the modem was bad and would be replaced. It was 8 PM Sunday. I went off to my meetings Monday morning (still no modem) and finally when my husband went to the front desk and requested a new modem they sent one up. The second problem was the phone lines. There was some kind of feedback on the line that made it hard to hear. I had to resort to my cell phone for the tech support calls. I tried participating in a teleconference on Tuesday morning on the hotel phone (800 call-in #) and the sound quality was so bad I had to disconnect and use my cell phone again. Usually a cell phone is worse than a land line. Not here. Summary- I'd recommend this hotel unless it's important for you to use their Internet/phone connections.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: RoccoF
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Priceline for a great rate and was not expecting to get a terrific room with a fantastic view of the city from top floor of the hotel (32). Upon check-in I explained to the front desk that a view was important to me as I was traveling with my 10 year old son who liked to look out the window the whole time. Of course, I would benefit too! They were very nice about accomodating my request and that one thing above all made my trip. The hotel is just steps away from Bart, which we took to and from SFO, as well as Union Square and the end of the Powell St. cable car line. It is a very crowded and active part of town but where all the action is. There is also a ton of shopping to be done across the street. The room was well appointed and the staff friendly. A maid offered turn-down service in the evening complete with several chocolates for my son. I could have used a refrigerator but used the ice bucket instead. Also, there are inexpensive restaurants and cafes located in the lobby area for coffee in the morning or a quick breakfast. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Right at the Centre of Things”
Reviews.Author: PumpDesigner
Reviews.Content: This hotel, like most in this chain, is well run with attentive service and clean comfortable rooms. The location is excellent and close to the cable car stop right in down town SF. Excellent shopping is all around. I prefer this downtown location to the overly touristy Fishermans Wharf area. One word of caution, SF was full of homeless people when I visited. Although I never felt threatened or in danger they can be intimidating if you are on your own.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad - Not Great”
Reviews.Author: traveltina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early August as a family of 4 w/ 15 & 12 year old kids on first trip to San Francisco. The hotel is a bit outdated; not rundown necessarily, just outdated. We had a gorgeous suite with wraparound views on one of the upper floors. The view was just stunning--we could see the Golden Gate Bridge out the bedroom window and the Coit Tower out the Living Room window. Service was fine; restaurant was ok. Nothing really outstanding; just average. This is probably a better business hotel than tourist place. But if you get a great rate or use points, it is just fine. The cable car was right there, there was lots of shopping. It was not the best part of town but convenient enough.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: Buds46
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Parc 55 in september during a business trip. 5minutes from union square and main shopping area. hotel room was spacious clean and gave us clear views of the city. Thai restaurant in the hotel served amazing thai food that was reasonably priced. the sports bar was also a great place to eat and drink. location of the hotel is really well placed - you're in the middle of everything. planning on coming back to SF next year for a vacation and will be sure to book my room at Parc 55 again. perfect place to relax after a hard days work (or shopping ;) )

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CJaxon23
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an excellent location. Just one block from all the shops at Union Square and steps away from the BART station and the Powell Street cable cars. The staff was very helpful and efficient. The room was huge (we stayed in room #1972). We had breakfast in the Veranda restaurant and the food was great. Overall, I would definitely stay here again. It was extremely clean and the location could not be beat. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SandyCA
Reviews.Content: Great location, next to union square, across the street from bart and cable car. Hotel very clean, nice room 1001 with 4 very large bay windows with a city view. Room large, clean, the bathroom tile is dated, shower pressure excellent. Bed comfortable. Excellent italian restaurant across the street, check out is 1pm which was great. Parking at hotel $39 a day, however if you walk 1 block down steet price $29 a day and if you park in off site garages after 5:30pm and out by 9:30 am only $15. Bid for room on priceline $75. I would stay here again and do feel it is a good deal if you can get the room for $150 or less. Staff very friendly and helpful. Street noise early in morning due to garbage trucks which is common in SF, bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “decent”
Reviews.Author: nola75
Reviews.Content: I booked this room after reading the reviews and getting a good rate through AAA. Two days before I was to arrive, I received an email from the hotel asking if I would need anything special for my stay; extra pillows, late check-in, etc. So I requested 2 foam pillows, which was one of the choices and a room away from the elevators. Fast Forward to check in: there was no one in line at the front desk however none of the agents even looked up. Two of them were having their own conversation. When she finally did look up she just asked us our name and for our credit card, handed us our keys and told us where the elevator was. She never once smiled or even said hello. I felt this was a bit off-putting as she was so not friendly. We get up to our floor and surpise surprise our room is 2 doors away from the elevator and no foam pillows. I didnt complain because in reality it wasnt going to hamper my stay but the fact that I asked for these things and was given the complete opposite unnerved me a bit. The positives: The room was quite large, especially for SF. The bed was super comfy. Location is great to catch any type of public transportation and right by union square. The bathroom could use some updating, specifically the floor. I did not eat at the hotel or use the fitness center. All in all, I would stay here again as the price was good and if youre visitng SF you shouldnt be in your room that much anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Boringly competent”
Reviews.Author: Riffmaster
Reviews.Content: Had 3 nights here in August. Very good location near Union Square, Macys etc and the Powell Street cable terminus. Appears grand on entering, but after forcing you to drag your bags down a long chandelier clad corridor to check in, thats it! Staff ok, but one chap next to me was not getting what he had booked, and although he was very polite and calm, staff member seemed pretty indifferent. Our room was of modest size, and the whole scenario (like the rest of the hotel) was bland,bland,bland. We were also just behind the lift which could be heard at night. $40.00 a night for parking? No thanks - cheaper garages abound around every corner! Very average, sure could do better for less.

Reviews.Title: “Great All Round”
Reviews.Author: TonyW
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel thru price-line for 125 us. Stayed Sat 5th Aug. Used the valet parking ($45) which is expensive but very handy. Checkin was a bit slow but I was given a great room (room 1301) this is the biggest room on each floor as its in the corner so I got 4 big bay windows. I think its the biggest room Ive ever stayed in. To get to the bathroom I had to walk through a walk in wardrobe type room - so cool. Great views (see pictures), if you get a higher floor then you can see union square. Everything in the room was fine, shower, aircon was really fast to cool the room etc. Didnt eat in the hotel so cant comment on that. There is a little coffee shop on the south corner of the hotel (not related to the hotel), breakfast coffee, juice, croissant there was $5. The only slight hiccup is that they would not let me leave a laptop in the left luggage as all the secure lockers were full but at least they were being honest and did not want the risk of it getting stolen (which I heard does happen in SFO hotels) and your insurance most likely will not pay up. From the 13th floor I could pickup free wireless internet from one called "Netgear". Also from reception you can pickup the "Kimpton" hotel wireless network which is also free. Did some Skype calls to the UK without problem (for free). The location of the hotel is fine. About 4 mins walk from Union square. It was fine at night as well. Overall, I'd be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Most disappointing hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: JenSmith
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the most disappointing hotels in San Francisco and an absolute embarassment to the Renaissance brand. I have traveled to San Francisco more than 100 times over the last five years and sampled just about every major upscale hotel in the area. I would stay anywhere but this place. The disappointment begins with the area that the hotel is located in, which, although centrally located, is the seediest part of the city and abounds in threatening looking characters. I felt at risk just stepping out of the hotel! The overall ambience within the hotel is gaudy early-eighties and an absolute assault to the eyes and senses. Rooms are small, even by San Francisco standards, and missing the nice balconies that hotels like Hilton and Meridien have. The overall feeling is of clutter and claustrophobia, exacerbated by windows that don't open adequately and leaflets touting all manner of hotel services. The beds are comfortable but nothing unique to the upgraded beds available at almost all major chains today. By the way, almost every pictures on the hotel website is highly unrepresentative of reality. Hotel infrastructure is in need of serious upgrading. Heating and air-conditioning system is ineffective and noisy. Water pressure is weak and hot and cold water mixing is problematic leading to uncomfortable showers and shaving. To cap it all, the hotel charges a usurious rate for internet service and only offer service from noon-to-noon regardless of when you check-in and check-out. Bathrooms have a dated feel and look. And there are marks on the wall of amenities that were once attached to walls and are now gone. Hotel staff service levels are nothing special and a little below average. The concierge lounge is absolutely below standards of typical hotel properties and closed on weekends unlike most other major upscale hotels in downtown SF. Overall, the quality and feel of this hotel is a better fit for Fairfield Inn than Marriott's top-of-the-line Renaissance brand. Only worth a stay if you can get it a Fairfield prices -- i.e. , below US$60.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: brv08
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night to attend a concert at the Bill Graham Civic Auditorium. It was a quick walk to the auditorium. The hotel is right across the street from the cable cars, close to all the major shopping and within walking distance to Union Square. In the times I have been to San Francisco, I have yet to find a GOOD neighborhood. The streets are overrun with homeless people begging for money. With this being said, I feared for my life on our walk to the concert. It is really bad! However, I was pleased with the hotel. The bedding was great! Very comfortable bed, and descent size room (remember you are in San Francisco). The pictures on the Marriott website are a bit misleading. the hotel lobby is a fraction of the size it appears in the pictures. I must say, everything was clean and in order. I would stay here again for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: max71
Reviews.Content: My son and I travelled to San Francisco at the end of June for a 16 night tour of the West Coast of America starting in SF. Following our arrival by the BART $5.30 each from SF airport we came out of the station and walked across the road to the Renainssance Parc 55. Checked in by Robert who was lovely, very nice room on the 10 floor good view of the city and bay in the distance. No complaints what so ever. Our only disapointment in SF was not pre-booking tickets to Alcatraz via the internet, and as our stay was only for 2 nights we missed out! It may cost a few more $ but not as much as another trip from the UK!!!! We would travel back to SF but only to see Alcatraz, everything else was very nice and just like on TV but we've seen it now! Oh.....do remember a coat YES IT IS COLD IN SUMMER!!!! about 62 degrees and very windy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: mooretw33
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 4 days in San Francisco. I had only been to SF one time before and had stayed at the Grand Hyatt, also a nice hotel. My wife had never been. We flew in from DC to Oakland and rented a car as we were planning on traveling to Napa/Sonoma, Muir Woods, Sausalito, etc. We arrived at the Renaissance at 10:30 am and were not only provided with an early check-in but were upgraded to a suite on the 32nd floor w/ club access. The view was spectacular. You can see the whole city and the mountains. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. Great shower too. We tipped our maid each day and were left with extra chocolates each night. On our last night we were surprised upon returning to our room to find a bucket with 2 ice cold Anchor Steam beers and a plate of fresh fruit. I had made sure to tip every staff member that helped me and I believe this was the result. Parking was $38 a day + tax which was comparable to other cities we have visited. Previous reviews have mentioned that the lobby was "cheesy" or "gaudy" and I would have to agree but I don't go on vacation to hang out in the lobby nor did I eat at the hotel. San Francisco has too many great restaurants! Places we had great meals: Stinson Beach Grill (Stinson Beach), The Girl and The Fig(Sonoma), E&O Trading Company (SF) - excellent Calamari, Plouf (SF) Our least favorite food was at Horizons in Sausalito, but the view on the deck is magnificent. Hotel Negatives: Concierge service was slow and did not provide accurate information at times. (we were told Stinson Beach was over 2 hours away...it's 30 - 40 min). The Club manager was not very personable but we can't complain since it was an upgrade for us. I would definitely stay at the Renaissance again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JasonBailey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Parc 55 for one night on Saturday, June 24. The lobby is beautiful and the service from the valet and front desk staff is very good. Overall, the property is very clean and appears to be well maintained. My room on the tenth floor was also clean, fairly large for a S.F. property, had a decent view and was well appointed. The bed was actually very comfortable. I did by the way ask for a complimentary upgrade at check in so its possible that my room was a little nicer than the regular rooms but you often don't know if you really are being upgraded unless you are a regular and/or are very familiar with the property. I did not dine at the hotel so I cannot comment about the quality of the food at the Parc however I had a drink in the sports bar which was quite small but like any other hotel sports bar. The Parc 55 is definitely one of the most "strategically" located hotels in S.F. in my opinion. Union Square, shopping and great restaurants are all very close and within easy walking distance. There is also an abundance of stores with wine, food, etc. all around the area if one wanted to get supplies or perhaps their own wine/beer. One disappointment however was the absence of an in room refrigerator and mini bar which made having any cold snacks or beverages on hand impossible. The Parc 55 is where the visiting baseball teams stay when they are in town to play the Giants (at least it used to be and I believe that this is still the case). All in all, I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect fit”
Reviews.Author: vallecitogirl
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I made a quick decision to travel to San Francisco to do a little sight seeing and shopping. Since we were so late in making our travel plans most hotels were sold out or were asking top $$ for their rooms. We tend to stay at either Marriotts, Hiltons or Hyatts so I was a little surprised when the Marriott Renaissance Parc 55 showed availability at a decent price. What was even a bigger surprise was that I was able to use my Marriott points which left us more money for shopping! We arrived at the hotel around noon and fully expected to leave our bags with the bellman and check in later in the day. To our surprise a room was ready and we immediately checked in. The front desk could not of been more helpful. Our room was non-smoking as requested with two very comfortable beds. We were given a room with a "bay view". We were on the 17th floor and the view was of the bay but not much of it. Too many other high rise buildings in the way blocking the view. The higher you go, the better view but this was not an issue to us. The room was comfortable and the bathroom was just fine. They could use more counter space for storage. The biggest drawback was the ability to hear people in the rooms on either side of us. I wonder if the guests in those rooms knew that we could hear their early morning conversations about getting ready for their flights or their late night giggles, etc. I was surprised that we did not have evening turn down service, this would have been a nice touch. The location of the hotel was perfect. Just around the corner from Union & Powell streets you were at the beginning of the cable car system or just steps from the BART station. You are also within walking distance of all the shopping around Union Square. The front desk and bell desk was very helpful with maps, where to go and where not to go (the tenderloin district) and dining options. We never did dine in the hotel so I cannot comment on that. Too many places around the hotel to eat so why bother with hotel dining. It was suggested that we buy a 1 day pass for the cable car which we did. It use is good for the cable cars and the bus system. It was also suggested that on our return trip to the airport we use the BART system. Since we had to pay a $42 (incl. tip) cab fare to the hotel from the airport on our return we used the BART system. $5.15 one-way. It was great! Only drawback to this is the ticket machines don't really have instructions on them and most people are either too busy to help you or are in the same boat as you. We did find a nice lady that was getting her own ticket to help us out only to have a very rude lady come up from behind and start yelling at us because we were holding up the line! Nobody else seemed to have a problem with us and there are many machines. I think she was just an unhappy person. Would we stay here again - yes.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: travelingfromTX
Reviews.Content: We stay at many Marriotts. The Renaissance Parc 55 was what I would classify as fine. The lobby was pretty, however the hallways and the rooms were just average size and were a little worn. The service was very good, however we had a major problem with the doorman and a limo company, which has yet to be resolved. The location was wonderful. You could walk virtually everywhere, or take the Powell Street Cable car 1.5 blocks away, the BART across the way, or an inexpensive taxi to most sights! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We Don't Need No Water Pressure”
Reviews.Author: S6blr
Reviews.Content: I was "upgraded" to the 32nd floor as the hotel was full despite booking my room several months in advance. Whilst I had a room when I arrived, they had messed up the booking even though I called from abroad to confirm my arrival. First note to self-this is a bad sign of mis-management. I was cheerfully checked in and then went to my room on the Club floor. I expected to have a magnificent rooom only to be disappointed by at best a decidedly average room. Not more room, but some tasky nicer appointments. The bed was pretty decent, but the distinct lack of water pressure, without scalding yourself or freezing cold shower does not justify the Club "experience" in my humble opinion. If you stay here you also get to deal with the hordes of tramps frequently around the outside of the hotel at night ddue to proximity to the "Tenderloin" district, so take cabs at night. Frankly I would probably not pay my personal money to stay here -- the company paid.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Renaissance standards”
Reviews.Author: horns1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 for 5 days in April and had three rooms for a family trip. I have stayed at Marriotts and Renaissance hotels often and am familiar with what standards to expect. I aslo have traveled to San Fran often and have stayed at other hotels in the Union Square area. Although the Renaissance line of hotels can be inconsistant about what to expect, this hotel is more like a Holiday Inn in their standards. It definately ranks far below comparable hotels in the area that I have stayed in, including the St. Francis, Hyatt and far below the Fairmont. The rooms are stripped of most upgrades that were once there and the overall appearance is not very memoriable. The restaurants do not operate fully at dinner and it seems that everything is done to save money. The lounge was closed on weekends and other services were reduced. For the same price as The Palace and Omni it is very overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Worked out very well”
Reviews.Author: psu0904
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights (4/7 - 4/9) at this hotel while in San Francisco for a conference. The hotel is very attractive, with clean rooms and beds to die for. I mean, this must be what laying on a cloud feels like. However, despite the wonderful bed, I was unable to sleep the first night because I had a room on the sixth floor overlooking the alley and the dumpsters that I became very well aquainted with. I was compensated by the hotel for this lack of sleep resulting from the dumster noise in the form of a new room on the thirteenth floor and a comped room (first night). I thought this was very stand-up and customer-oriented by the hotel - hence my high rating. I felt that I was treated very well and always with the utmost courtesy. The one final point is that the housekeeping staff need to ensure that the creamer in the little coffee packets are not stale. I had this experience but they quickly brought fresh replacements.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SeminarTrekker
Reviews.Content: I do like to stay at Marriott's and stayed at this Marriott Parc 55 Renaissance Hotel because it was convenient to a S.F. Amtrak Rail Pick Up Bus Stop,across from the San Francisco Shopping Center on Market. I had taken the train into the East Bay. I was in town for a Film Festival. The check in process was smooth and the front desk reception person was friendly and efficient. My room had a nice city view, and was clean and looked modern. Moderate size. This hotel is convenient to many San Francisco attractions, restaurants, trendy stores, as well as transportation lines (B.A.R.T., Muni buses, Trolley Cars, Cable Cars). There is only one enterance into the Hotel but multiple exists. This Marriott is part of their Renaissance line (typically older restored buildings). I stayed at one other Marriott Renaissance, The Chancery Court in London, which is one of the finest place's I stayed at. My only complaint, is one of the days, they messed up on cleaning my room, but later on in the day, someone checked about it. Other than that, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but spendy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty nice. We were there for a business trip, and the price was up there but competitive with other nice ones in the area. Doors are thin and noise easily comes both from the hall and the street below. Room service is prompt and super friendly, but a little on the expensive side and the taste is average at best (dined in 3 times, yeah it's lame). They really bend over backwards to make sure you are happy at the hotel in general. The gym is pretty good, plenty of machines if it is busy. The bed was quite comfortable, and the shower was nice/powerful. Good location within walking distance to a lot of attractions. Overall, if I had to stay in the city, I would stay there again (especially if it were on someone else's dime).

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: yc999
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed at this property for 6 days over new year of 2006. This is a great property in SF, best location of all, we think. We were warned that parking in SF is very expensive($40/day), we don't want to waste money on parking at all. So without a rental, this property is the one. You can take the bart train from Airport to the Bart station at Pawell st, which is located just accross the street from the hotel. And if you do want to get out of town to check out other sites, you can easily rent a car for the day, which is very convinient. In town, the powell st cable cart is just around the corner. We got a room on the higher flr, so the noise level could be lower, and plus you get nice city view.... they do have in-room high speed internet, but cost extral, I ordered it for a week, around $40, I think, which is worth it, since it is very good for finding out the stuff you want to do, restrauants you want to eat at, e.t.c.... Over all, we are very happy with it. This will be our spot for SF from now on...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bianca79
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Omni on December 2, 2005 for 1 night. The hotel is beautiful and service is excellent! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Holidays at the Parc”
Reviews.Author: smalltowngalReno
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Parc 55 for two nights, Dec 22-23, and couldn't have been happier with our accommodations. Prior to our arrival, I spoke to Donna (at the front desk) who was very helpful and made arrangements for two adjoining rooms with lovely views of the city. After reading many reviews about small rooms in the city, I found these rooms to be quite spacious with a sitting area where we could enjoy our coffee in the morning while enjoying the view. We found the beds very comfortable, the bathrooms good size, and the water pressure for showers was good. They had a great holiday room rate, $119/night, which was appreciated since parking is expensive $38/night. Everyone at the hotel, from the bellman to the room service waiter, was very courteous and friendly and we would definitely stay there again. We walked to Union Square and did some shopping and took in many San Francisco events. First, be prepared, everything in SF is EXPENSIVE. The first night we attended a concert at Davies Symphony Hall (excellent venue and fantastic musicians). Afterwards, we had dinner at the Italian restaurant across the street from the hotel(Panetti's)and it was very good. I recommend the eggplant parmesan. The second day we attended the 2pm performance of the San Francisco Ballet's Nutcracker at the War Memorial Opera House. This is an experience you don't want to miss. Beautiful scenery and dancing, it was truly breathtaking. I think we should have stopped with those two events, because the last one (Holiday Lights Tour) on the motorized cable car was a bummer. First, the only holiday lights you see are at Union Square (which is where we boarded). It's the standard (canned) tour of the city, nothing more, which we may have enjoyed more during the day, but at night, you miss a lot. Not recommended. After the tour, we couldn't find a place to eat that wasn't packed to the gills with shoppers, and it was 9pm. We finally got a table at Johnny's, where it was cramped and hot and the server had an attitude. Expensive and not very good, I wouldn't recommend Johnny's either. I think we would try and make dinner reservations next time we visit. All in all, we had a wondeful time in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at the Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: nitehawk
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at the Parc 55 over the Christmas weekend (Dec 22 - Dec 27). Great coice of hotel, full service, staff very attentive and professional. Hotel beautifully decorated for Christmas, had this trip planned for 6 months. Booked a Cub Level room through Marriot for $169 a nite, what a steal. Ended up with a beautiful bay view room on the 31st floor. Union square was extremely crowded for Christmas,but still a lot of fun. Had Christmas dinner at the Veranda at the hotel, Great restaurant. If you're looking for a quiet, clean, full service 4 star hotel in San Francisco, you can't go wrong with the Renaissance Parc 55.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal at the Parc 55!”
Reviews.Author: Doll3001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc 55 on December 30th with my fiance, at a discounted rate we got using priceline. It was my first time using priceline, and I think I should have started with an even lower rate, but at $100 a night we were very satisfied. We were accomidated in our request for a room on a high floor; the nice lady at the check in desk gave us a bay view room on the 26th floor. The hotel is very big, and a little corporate looking, the lobby decor is maybe a little less than cutting edge, but the rooms are very clean, with nice, expensive looking furniture, good quality amenities in the bathroom, and a comfortable bed with a lovely looking bedspread. It did have one of those weird foamy blankets under the bedspread, and I am afraid of actualy touching hotel bedspreads, but we were comfortable nonetheless. Everything looked extremely clean, I am just paranoid. The windows do not open, but you have your own thermostat. We were able to hear people walking above us and people in the hall occasionaly, but never in a ongoing way and not at night. We were in town just for the night to go to a concert, and to do a little shopping. The location was great for shopping at Union Square, we got everything done quickly and easily. We were so happy in our room that we ended up ordering room service, which was prompt and extremely good! We had a very nice stay, and if you get a good rate, I would say don't hesitate to stay at the Parc 55.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok - not topnotch Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: jessicak
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel room but small. Not much room to navigate around the bed, although there was a nice small sitting area by the window. Bathroom was not particularly large either (an issue for my traveling companion.) With all the hotels in SF, I didn't see anything about this one to entice me to stay there again, necessarily. I expect top-level accommodations at a Renaissance. I did appreciate that Parc 55 had a parking package rate because we drove to SF, where parking is notoriously expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - but stay on a higher floor”
Reviews.Author: Jct_9_M3
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights and really had no complaints with the hotel. Great location, very close to Union Square, shopping, convention centre, SFMOMA, etc. Room was fine; good service particularly from housekeeping. Breakfast in the restaurant is pricey, although the bar area immediately outside serves complimentary coffee and inexpensive pastries. Only downside was the noise from the surrounding streets: Thought I would be OK on the 9th floor, but it's a zoo around here late at night (it is the middle of San Francisco after all). Mostly, very loud police sirens going every half hour through the night. However, the hotel moved me up to the 22nd floor and all was well. Great view too. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in San Francisco - great choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: mazzyk
Reviews.Content: I'm so delighted that I opted for the Renaissance Parc 55 for my first ever visit to San Francisco. We arrived v early on a flight from Vegas as we needed to cram in a full day's sight-seeing in SF. Took a taxi to the hotel and expected to have to dump our bags and come back later to check-in. But to my pleasant surprise, we were able to check-in around 8.30am at no extra charge. Receptionist was lovely as were the porters - v helpful with recommendations. Dashed out for our trip to Alcatraz followed by a city bus tour. Finally crashed back at hotel later in day. Room was very comfortable and clean and quite high - 14th floor? Felt a bit dizzy at the window! Went to visit friends in the evening so didn't get a chance to use other facilities in the hotel. Picked up a hire car in the morning - didn't realise there was a Hertz desk in the hotel which would have been v handy - had arranged to pick up car at Westin St Francis. Brought car back to hotel where a bunch of porters attempted to load myself, 2 seniors and 8 pieces of luggage into a Ford Mustang convertible. They deserve an award for patience and for ability to re-configure the contents so we all fitted in!! They seemed very concerned about us leaving SF and driving to LA!! I'd booked through Octopus Travel on the web and got a great deal but I would pay more next time if necessary to stay there as the staff and hotel are worth it!

Reviews.Title: “It did it for me”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having travelled all that distance across the Atlantic for our annual holidays in California it was a pleasure to relax in the luxurious and spacious rooms of the Renaissance Park 55. The staff were extremely courteous and helpful, in addition to there prompt response to all our requests. The hotel location is second to none for sightseeing, shopping and dining out. To sum up the hotel, the surroundings, the staff and location made that special difference to our holidays. We will be back! Joe Taylor

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: Trev01
Reviews.Content: A well located hotel near all the action. Particularly good for Union Square, shopping and the cable car terminus. A medium quality hotel which does everthing correctly and efficiently. High level rooms are better than lower level which, as previous reviewers noted, are tired and in need of a makeover. The Club Lounge on 31st floor is unusually open 7 days a week and provides a good continental breakfast buffet, all day coffee and a small evening finger buffet and a limited selection of deserts. Good views from the lounge due it being several floors higher than neighbouring buildings. The only problem with the club lounge is the lack of tables for breakfast, as it is laid out as a lounge with sofas and low level glass topped coffee tables. It gets busy in the mornings as it caters for 3 executive floors as well as overspill from lower level rooms when the exec floors are overbooked. Check-in was a bit slow due to lack of staff at the front desk, (only one check-in attendant) but checking out was fast using the express checkout facility. 6 express lifts, ground to 31st floor in about 30 seconds and very little waiting in lobbies after calling for a lift. If you have booked a high level room with club access make sure you get it, don't be fobbed off with a lower level room with card access to the lounge as they try to get away with if you let them. The lower level rooms are not in very good condition and don't have the superb views that the high level rooms have.

Reviews.Title: “Good & Bad”
Reviews.Author: Dallastraveler74
Reviews.Content: I agree with the poster before me, this hotel is looking a little worn and is not all it's cracked up to be. I too stay at Marriot properties all year long and the staff here is by far the least helpful of any I've experienced with Marriot. The location is in a convenient area with access to shopping and restaurants, if you go in the right direction. Make a wrong turn and you will be surrounded by druggies and prostitutes, don't make a left out of the front entrance! The final day of my stay here there was a fire alarm that went off at 5:30 AM. Being on the 26th floor it wasn't a pleasant surprise to wake to. Can you say earthquake?!?! Anyhow, we stayed here for 3 days and it will be the last 3 we ever spend there. Do yourself a favor and go to Hotel Monaco right down the block, better restaurants, better bar & MUCH better service!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Parc 55 Hotel on 6th Street is a great place to stay. I spent seven days there from 22 to 29 September 2005 and enjoyed every minute from check-in to check-out. The hotel staff are friendly courteous and informed. The Rooms are first class, spacious and bright and well equipped. A lazy day away from the shops can be spent in the comfort of the room. The Rooms are serviced daily and housekeeping staff are friendly and efficent and respect your need not be be disturbed. The leisure/health club is superb and again the staff are friendly and helpful. The restaurant has an excellent menu and food comes just as you ordered. The hotel is so convenient for Union Square, Market Street and the public transport networks. I would recommend the Parc 55 to all of my friends and indeed to anyone visiting this exciting city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views From The 24th Floor”
Reviews.Author: maisany
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on Labor Day Saturday and was quite pleased. This is a downtown/Union Square area hotel, so the caveats re the nearby Market Street/Tenderloin areas do apply, but if you can deal with that, the hotel is quite lovely. We got there late in the afternoon and they had no single king bed non-smoking rooms available immediately, but when I persisted, the receptionist told me that there were a couple that were being made up as we spoke and that they would be ready in a short while. When I told them that I would wait, I think they did everything they could to get me the nicest room possible, and I wound up with a very high (24th fl) corner room, very close to the elevators (but not noisy at all), with a really terrific view of the city. The room was a good size, although the only shortcoming was the entry hall is extremely narrow so that you have to stand clear of the door as you open it on the way out. Not a big deal. The bed was wonderful and the sheets and pillows were quite good as well. The bathroom was huge and well laid out. I had limited interaction with the staff but starting with the accomodating receptionist, everyone was very polite, professional and knowledgeable. I asked the concierge to find me an address of a nearby shop and he wrote it down on a map, making it very easy to find. The only down side to this hotel is the immediate neighborhood, which can be a little off-putting and limits your dining options somewhat, but otherwise, this is a very nice place to stay downtown and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel/great location”
Reviews.Author: eric_pruitt
Reviews.Content: The Parc 55, as all have said, is in a great location. Very convenient to all modes of transportation. The rooms were good, not great. The service was solid, not outstanding. It was just an all-around good hotel. Which was fine for me and my wife for the price we paid. There are a lot nicer hotels in the area. But for the money and location this one is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, loved the Parc 55!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel808
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Parc 55 in San Francisco was the second hotel we stayed at while on our 16 day vacation. We arrived at the Parc 55, tired after driving 14 hours in from Seattle. Being so tired, it really helped that the service was superb! The valet and front desk employees were extremely courteous and friendly. We booked a standard room with the government discount and was pleasantly surprised to have been upgraded to a huge, beautiful corner room with windows all around. We had an amazing view fronting Union Square! The room was well appointed and clean. Perhaps the only flaw in this room was that we booked a room with a King sized bed and instead got a room with a full size bed. This of course was overlooked once we saw the size of the room and the view! The bathroom was clean and had a few nice touches like a heater which came in handy since it was cold at night, a phone and a movable vanity mirror. Directly outside of the bathroom in front of the closet was a seperate changing area, which I thought was a nice touch. For those of you who love to stay fit, this hotel offers a 24-hour fitness center free of charge. Also, there are restaurants on the property which offer a variety of genres. My favorite meal there was breakfast in the hotel restaurant, prices were reasonable for San Francisco and tasty and of course service was superb. Location wise, you couldn't find a better place. It is so centralized! It is right across the street from shopping and in walking distance from Union Square. If you go out late at night, past midnight or so, don't go to the left of the hotel towards Larkin st. Not exactly the safest feeling in the world with the number of homeless people and prostitutes but what else can you expect from any big city. Valet parking was $38.00 plus tax...pretty high, but the going rate for San Francisco. If you don't mind public transportation, don't get a car. You can see most things on foot patrol or via cable cars. It was pretty rough having to pay almost the same amount for parking after our three nights there as it was for one night's stay. Needless to say, our stay was very enjoyable and we will definitely stay at the Parc 55 the next time we visit San Francisco! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: DanielSE
Reviews.Content: I was in SF on business, it was my first stay on the Parc 55, and I enjoyed it very much. The most important thing to me when I am travelling is that the rooms are clean and nice. My room at the Parc 55 was very clean and well maintained. I've been to SF many times, and alot of the hotels in this perfect area are worn out. I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty good hotel right in the shopping district”
Reviews.Author: World-roamer
Reviews.Content: We got a fantastic deal through Priceline, and so we thought this hotel was good value. But if we'd been paying full price I'm not so sure. It's a large hotel and our non-smoking room was a reasonable size. But there is no fridge and not even any tea or coffee making facilities. The daily maid service keeps the room very clean. The checkout time is 12 noon, so I suppose I can't complain that our room wasn't ready when we arrived at 2pm, and had to wait an hour and a half. It's well located next to all the big stores, cinemas, restaurants, public transport and car rental locations. The cable car terminus to Fisherman's Wharf is nearby, but always crowded. You could wait up to an hour at busy times. Here's a tip - they don't always fill the car up at the terminus, so go to the next stop up the line and you'll probably get on the first car to come along. After you've done the calble car thing once, you'll probably find the Market Street tram or the #30 trolley bus the best way to get to Fishermans Wharf and the Ferries to Alcatraz. You definitely need to book the Alcatraz trip in advance (via internet), but another great day out is to hire a bike from Blazing Saddles and bike the bridge to Sausalito. If you start out at 10am or so you can have a nice lunch in this charming sea front town before getting the ferry back to Pier 39. We had a great time in San Francisco, and the Renaissance Parc was an OK place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the Parc 55”
Reviews.Author: JuicyCouture
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Fleet Week in October of 2004 and we've booked another stay for October 2005. The hotel room was extremely large for San Francisco and very clean. The bathroom was huge and had tons of space for my beauty products. The staff was friendly and they were always willing to help with any request we had. While we were there, there were protesters on the street below at one of the neighboring hotels. We were on a high floor but we could still hear them --regardless, it didn't bother us. Im originally from The City and Im used to some noise. You should know though, that if you stay at any downtown hotel, you should expect at least, a little bit of noise from outside. However, the hotel was quiet and we never even heard our neighbors. The hotel is located between the Union Square/Powell St. cable car line area and the Tenderloin Dist --stay on the Powell St. side! As far as getting to the cable car line, you can easily walk --it's about half a block away. However, if you walk down Market St, although the easiest, be prepared for the strong smell of urine and B.O. as the homeless sleep right in the area at night. I recommend going up to Ellis and walking down. It takes a few more minutes, but you don't have to deal with the horrid odor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller84
Reviews.Content: Polite, helpful staff, 24 hour gym facilities, clean room which was well maintained by housekeeping. The best aspect of this hotel is the location which is right in the centre of all the shops with tram stations, taxis, busses and a large shopping centre etc right outside the hotel. There is also a huge cinema within a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The central location meant there were always people around, which meant no problems when walking back to the hotel late at night. Would recommend and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal 4 Star in the Union Square area”
Reviews.Author: MomFromTheOC
Reviews.Content: In light of our steal of a deal via Priceline, I was not expecting much. I was extremely surprised that our room was not in the basement, not worn out or microscopic. In fact, we had a lovely spacious room on a high floor, two beds non-smoking as requested. Very clean and fresh -- a more than adequate 4 star hotel in a great location. Check-in was easy, friendly, efficient. Check out was the same. Absolutely a delight. The only negative is that the location is just on the fringe of a grungy part of town, but as long as you're not walking that direction (and I can't imagine why anyone *WOULD*), then it's not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Not amazing, but would still recommend”
Reviews.Author: stefiharr
Reviews.Content: Renaissance Hotels usually do a great job - but this hotel could use a little work. The location is GREAT! We were first-time S.F. visitors, so being so close to so much was a big plus. But, we had two problems when we checked in: (1) When we got to our room, ummm, it wasn't ready...thank goodness no one was actually IN the room. So, we went back downstairs to change rooms. (2) In our new room, we turned on the tv, and within 2 minutes, the tv shut off and started smoking. We had to then wait for a new tv to be put in. The hotel's asst. manager called to do the standard (but nice) apology. She asked if she could send something to us like a bottle of wine. She did (it was nothing too special and nothing accompanied it, like some fruit or cheese or something). We were paying only $142/night for our room, so you would have thought they would have comped a night, given a free breakfast or even moved us to a nicer room for the not 1, but 2, inconveniences. Oh well - the only reason it wasn't too big of a deal is b/c we didn't plan to be in the room much and we DID get such a great rate. So, the hotel is ok for a Renaissance (I've seen and stayed in much nicer, though). Would recommend it only b/c of the location and price...but the small, older rooms made us feel like we were in a NY hotel (which isn't a bad thing...just don't come expecting luxury or space). Also, for such a huge hotel, they only have one concierge on duty at a time...taking calls AND helping people in person. I felt rushed every time I had a question. I would highly recommend that they hire 2 at all times....but until they do...if you need help with restaurant or activity ideas, ask a friend who's been there.

Reviews.Title: “Simply excellent!”
Reviews.Author: SactownTraveler
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best hotels to stay in for business or pleasure in San Francisco. The location is good, the rooms are extremely nice and well maintained (comparable to Omni International rooms), the rooms are surprisingly quiet - I expected to be bothered by the nearby cable cars, but it was not a problem - and the shower is powerful. Even when nearly full, the atmosphere is quiet and adult. Oh, yes, the beds are nice and comfortable with both small and large pillows to choose from. The rate was extremely reasonable for the quality. I could only find two things to quibble about. First, my room was humid and warm on a cold day - due to all of the sound deadening insulation and the solid windows - but that was fixed by using the air conditioner. Second, there is no coffee maker in the room, but on check-in I was told about the free morning brew on the second floor. There were muffins and fruit rolls for sale for only $2.00, much less than you would pay at a nearby Starbucks. Finally, with big hotels like this, using the valet parking is often a problem. It tends to take a lot of time and it can be difficult dealing with the parking staff. That was not the case here, the staff were very professional and swift. All in all, this hotel reminded me of what large-city Hyatts and Hiltons were like in the 1960s and 1970s. Congratulations to Marriott for getting it right!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, and oh-so-convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Temporary
Reviews.Content: I had a short-notice business trip last we9ek and the conferen]ce hotel was full. I wanted a hotel within walking distance of the conference hotel, but expense was an issue as well. Luckily, Southwest Airlines (on which I traveled) allows one to book hotels on their web site as well, and this hotel came up with a reasonable price. It was a very nice room, everything in good shape. I was especially impressed with the temperature controls in the room, providing trouble-free adjustment from crisp cool to balmy heat within minutes. The city view out of one of my windows was very nice (although it would probably have been better if I were on a higher floor--I was on the eleventh) I had a couple of meals in the hotel bar, which has a good selection of beers as well as tasty, if a bit pricey, entrees (most start around $8-9). One night though they seemed a bit understaffed... The hotel is practically right on Market St and the Hallidie Plaza, steps away from just about any kind of transportation (taxis, BART, cable car, surface trolley, Muni Metro and buses) that one might want. Loads of shopping too, both on Market and a few blocks north to Union Square for the real high-end designer stuff. It does get a bit downmarket as you walk along Market toward 7th-8th Sts, though. Street life is the usual mix of suits, tourists, street merchants, panhandlers, performers and proselytizers, but its perfectly safe during the day, and just requires the usual big-city awareness after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable accomodations in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jlinder1
Reviews.Content: After making reservations many months ago for very specific room requirements (we needed three no-smoking rooms, two that adjoined, another for a "handicapped" room) -- and having confirmed these reservations the day before arriving -- the hotel had no knowledge of the arrangements. After a lengthy delay at the front desk at check in, we had could not get the adjoining room for my children.
